Z3MGWvC_TZ-Cc4JnRMU7-Q.text: Top Of The World Restaurant 5/11/12 WOW! A full 360 from the dinner we had last night. I am going to start with our elegant server, Jeanne. She only works lunch so she can be more personable. In Las Vegas lunch is just as important as breakfast or dinner. Jeanne know her menu and her surroundings. She has got to be the most perfect server I have ever had, and kudos to her assistant server.  Now as far as the food; way to go on thinking out of the box. Who would have thought of Smoked Salomon On a BLT and thick whole grain bread. And eating with the lobster bisque was divine. Dessert was absolutely sinful but we are in Las Vegas. Now the atmosphere is just incredible. You can see the old and the new. All the mountain regions. It takes a little over an hour to spin completely around., But they don't rush you plus you pass the dessert cart twice and the dessert anticipation is almost more than you can stand. The staff from the time we valet the car all thought the whole experience of the stratosphere and Lunch at the Top of the World was delightful and friendly. Have lunch at Top Of The World Restaurant  the best place to dine in Las Vegas.

_oS2JDRgRloW__5rOOPQ_g.text: The Top of the wold restaurant is a top spot in romantic Vegas dinning.  The food is fantastic, the service is very friendly and efficient, and the view is the BEST in town.  The restaurant is located at the very top of the Stratosphere hotel and casino and is without any doubt the best restaurant on that side of the strip.    Note.. the prices are expensive but they do offer a one person and two person pre-fix menu.

8-0fEAHiHFpC2b2vCa1tAA.text: Delightful restaurant with an amazing view.  Food was great, and you get to tour the rest of the Stratosphere with out having to pay the entrance fee.

MxAaMj8qb4m4_n1iFgFHXw.text: love love the view from the top of the Stratosphere Hotel and Casino. it made a great birthday lunch, it was delicious! Service was great!

7CAaERFGDuXNoWBMZUl4KQ.text: Walked out!   The first restaurant I walked out on. I had high expectations after reading the reviews here. It took us almost an hour to get up there, and then we were seated by a table as far away from the revolving window as possible. We were disappointed with being seated so far away from the window but besides that disappointed in the cleanliness of the place. It had a funky smell, moldy and possibly smokey? The carpet looked dirty and so did the bench that we were seated on. 5 star restaurant, so dirty? Well, I guess it is old so okay.. we stayed and waited (for a very long time for our waiter), we talked about asking to be seated closer to the window. How cool would it be to enjoy the view as the restaurant revolved! It was a week night and there were plenty of tables available right next to the windows, we figured it should be no problem. The waitress told us "no," and looked at us like we were problem customers. The restaurant is very expensive here and atmosphere is important to us. We asked if she could ask a manager because we were considering going elsewhere if we couldn't enjoy the view. The manager (or hostess, couldn't tell) told us "no," as well with the same disapproving look and we left (embarrassed and disappointed) to go to the Eiffel Tower Restaurant where we had one of the most amazing dining experiences we've ever had - seriously! I highly recommend Eiffel Tower.   We'll never come here again because of this experience. It's so sad that we were so dressed up and excited to be here and we felt we were treated so poorly. Boo!

7Qrbey5jG6ddkG6mChvcPA.text: Awesome view!! just llike what you can see at the Empire State Building and Sears Tower, worth to go upstairs.  Honestly, the food is not really good with that kind of price. I would pay more to go up have dinner at John Hankock but not his one. We ordered a sea bass, steak which were not good. The drink that I ordered Frosty Navel was kind of horrible. However, the soup was the best in there i thought. We also tried the dessert Cremen Brulee and Choco Tart. Well, the desert were totally bad.

M3EVXLqH0OWyXTScM8eOdg.text: First of all, the service here was excellent.  A server that can sit along side with me after our wine was served and before our appetizer was ready to share photos of our puppies is surely a moment of good interaction vs. scripted menu specials and courtesy calls like"how is that wine?" when they really don't give a damn...  Eventhough, this flamboyant waitor still gave good recommendations, after our moment, I trusted him fully.  We both started with our own lobster bisque.  It was spectacular.  No black pepper needed, just fyi if the server asks if you would like some black pepper with that, say no!   I had the black cod and my man had the filet.  His steak was cooked perfect.  It was so tender and flavorful. My fish on the other hand was only so so.  It was moist, and the fish was fresh, but somehow the fish loss its flavor.  I wouldn't order this again.  Their dessert menu was in very small portions, so even after our very satisfied meals, we were able to try the cheesecake trio and the chocolate creme brulee.  The bf loved the cheesecake, which was on a stick like a lollipop which you dip in different flavor sides, his favorite was the oreo.    The view was amazing, we sat there front early evening when the sun was still out until night and saw the restaurant just transform.  From full of light and open space and windows as walls that we face from the table where we were sat.  To dim lights insdie so that the las vegas city strip lights are still considered bright.  I have not stepped into the stratosphere for the hotel or casino, but will definitely come back to this restaurant again.  Next time, I want to have their steak and lobster combo!  Great wine selection.  Once in a while a bungee jumper will be in sight while he/she drops off the side of the building.    The restaurants rotates very slowly so you get a different view every minute.   Great staff, even the manager of the restaurant gets around to almost every table to chat a bit.  Excellent service from beginning to end.

Mh3X29uYdYzMw5GX-Fh3JA.text: Read a lot of negative reviews but I've only got good things to say about this place. Great food, great view, and very romantic. I had the best duck dish ever and my fiance had a great steak. The wine pairings were spot on and the service was excellent. Even had a great cocktail in the lounge while we waited for our table. The only complaint I have is the lame security line you have to go through to get up to the tower. I mean come on, when you're dressed to the nines and there for a fancy and expensive meal you shouldn't get patted down with the other riff raff. There should be a different entrance for dining only.

RPP389xRxzf-3oBQkZLg2Q.text: Lunch is a LOT cheaper than dinner.  I always love the view.  I've been here 4 times and it's a must go place for lunch every time I go to Vegas.  You can get 25% off entrees with a tix4tonight coupon.  You also get a free ride up to the top which, by itself, costs $16 to go to the top per person.  Service is always top notch as well as the food.  Lunch is very casual (shorts and a t-shirt are fine), dinner is dressy.

folbEj39JkGtVTLYsj0H-A.text: TREMENDOUS views and ambiance.  It's just that the food is awful.  Frozen vegetables and dry chicken.  Appetizing?  Not for $100 a head (with wine).  Better deals can be found in almost any other casino/hotel property.  I do though recommend heading up there for a drink and taking advantage of the views!

ohayTICIOuiZR1P1LrXg-A.text: This was a great resturant, great atmosphere great food, it was a great way to finish off a romantic night. People there are really nice and informative.

4zmxENAtynDVeCp8TIOBVg.text: Now forgive me for the tardiness of this review. I haven't actually been to the Stratosphere in years, but when I did, this was the place I wanted to go to. They've since figured out that they won't let you book reservations then skip 'em to get up the tower for free, but I imagine the food is still good, and there's still that business of a 1HP motor that keeps the view spinning about.   Or maybe it's that I've been there 4 times and never once had to pay a dime for it? Yeah. That's the one.  Several of my trips included the chef's summer special "Tornados and their sauces," which was, as it turned out, three delicious lumps of fillet mignon each with a very very good sauce.   Don't forget to ride the Big-Shot after your meal. It'll help it all settle.

mvPA6eBBHy6qo3DKq4Jh2g.text: Service was excellent. Food is over priced for what you are getting. It was really good but not worth the outrageous price. You are paying for the experience because we have had better "fancy food" at places with less "experience".  That being said, the view is unbelievable!! Go to the trouble to find out what time the sun sets and plan to be there for it. You don't automatically get a table by the windows/edge. Our table was on an upper level but we would have rather been closer to the windows.  Might help to ask.

psb9N0cl-NeL5zAIV0DIkw.text: It was a very romantic setting with the sun setting and the lights slowly flickering on. We also enjoyed watching the "sky jumpers" go past the windows. Service was great and the food was pretty good. You also get access to the observation decks after dinner.

G-W37sW604VpliLSm0DguQ.text: went here about a year ago, the food was amazing the waiter was not so much, the bus boy took better care of us hen the waiter. i talked to the manager and requested the busboy to be our waiter for the rest of the evening lucky us the manger agreed.  the best service ever at that point. if it wasn't for the bus boy this place would have only gotten three stars.

LvaM3fBn8G2zbh6j4LTQqg.text: I LOVE IT! Me and my bf went there and had a fabulous meal with a great view. It was really amazing and really memorable. I made my reservations online and everything was right on track. It is exciting going up because so many different people escort you.

WWbXmaFFqIWoeKN-_KNWhQ.text: A revolving restaurant in the sky, what could be better. Service was top notch and the food was excellent. A little pricey for the average person but worth it. It's the kind of a place to go to to say "yo, I bin ta dat joint". I'm giving it 4 stars because I got a little dizzy way up there.....hey, the views were great though.

73xqBFCNR0I9tYkmT1vs7A.text: I took my boyfriend here to celebrate his birthday and we were in love with the view! Absolutely beautiful and it kept getting better as the restaurant was rotating. The service was great and the waiting staff were very attentive. Prices are high frankly and only because of the view, but the food was definitely good. We're from New York and used to expensive restaurants but this was definitely up there. I went to restaurant.com and got a pretty nice coupon that I used, but compared to the overall price, it was still pricey... then again, it's not a restaurant that you'd go to everyday. Ohh and also, as it was for his b'day, everyone was wishing him from all the way downstairs, which was great! The best part was seeing people bungee jump from the top! Freaked some people out. Lol

fnuurxDqX5NenFKCJZW8pA.text: Lunch on a Saturday with my mom & dad.  Best: 1. Free bottomless mimosas! 2. THE VIEW!  Takes a little under an hour & a half for a full revolution, just the right amount of time for a meal. 3. French fries!!!!!  yum.  They were awesome. 4. Reservations were super easy to make (and then change), and the restaurant wasn't very crowded so we got a table right next to the windows (the ONLY way to dine here - if you can't get a table next to the windows it won't be nearly as fun)  Good: 1. Chicken pasta and lobster salad sandwich were both very good. 2. Lots of food options. 3. Pretty reasonably priced for lunch.  Okay: 1. Steak.  My dad said it was fine, not the best and not the worst. 2. None of our meals were super hot when they arrived - felt like maybe they had been sitting a while.  Bad: 1. COLD french fries when they first arrived.  BUT the waitress immediately took them back and brought a new fresh batch that was amazing!  So bad turns into great!

8GdwCBnOUDSfvqsa0tmJVw.text: Great view of the Las Vegas Strip! Another rotating view restaurant! Many of the things on the menu were kind of pricey, but the food was excellent. You have to have dessert too! I had the chocolate Stratosphere tower with fruits on it. YUM! I would also recommend doing the pre-set menus, since you practically spend just as much getting one item.  It was a great place for a date. We had a window seat. I had an appetizer platter that had duck, fish, and something else I don't remember...hehe My boyfriend had a filet mignon, which he really enjoyed. At any rate, it was great!  The view up there was worth the price of the place. We were able to go up and down the elevators to check out the view of the Vegas Strip as many times as we wanted.

SIkW21SGBtAnHAInHdawfg.text: I came here with 5 of my girlfriends and let me tell you! This is one place to definitely visit while your time in Vegas!! I really don't know where to start! Every one and everything was just so superb! The restaurant rotates around the strip giving you a 360 degree view of the whole Las Vegas! Of course the best time to go is at night to see all the beautiful lights!   The food they served was extravagant! It's pricey but well worth it! You pretty much pay for the view more than the food! Lol. The atmosphere was just so calming, lights were dim but not too dark. I had the lobster soup (it's called something else but basically speaks for itself!) and OMG! I'm telling you! If you've never had lobster soup before, you've got to try it here! I also had their potatoes and it was cooked just right. When it comes to extravagant places like these you really will enjoy all the types of dishes they serve you. Everything was just at the right temperature and right flavor. I didn't have to add salt or pepper to anything. My tastebuds were happy!!   I would love to come back here! I would most definitely recommend this place to everyone. When I'm Vegas....see the view! This is the place to do it! They also have rides on top of the Stratosphere!!

A8Hbnj_XggVTbw1zOOxo6w.text: My two visits here were great experiences. Top of the World is a great option for not only food and service, but the experience. The restaurant alone may be a four, but access to the observation deck and the views during dinner pushes the overall rating to a five.  My husband and I celebrated our anniversary here shortly after moving to town. We loved our meals and thought the service was top notch. I liked that the delicious bread came out with three different types of butter. My lobster bisque was pretty good and my husband liked his caesar salad as well. My steak was well prepared and flavorful. For dessert, we split a bananas foster dish that was both unique and delicious. It was nice to be able to check out the observation deck after we finished our meal too.  We visited a second time when my parents were in town. My parents were just as impressed with the experience as we were. It's a good option for out of town guests because the rotating view gives some entertainment while you enjoy the meal.   I'd recommend this restaurant/experience for locals and tourists alike.

Hootit-xbLePyXh2Dw4XEA.text: So I've been to a lot of restaurants all over the world and this is my top 3 I highly suggest coming here make reservation and you will have the best experience

p1cNH-OGGnEYc3mQoqkcMQ.text: This restaurant had been our #1 favorite for the past few years and was always our go to place for out of town guests and special occasions. As a local, we have tried the very best such as Hells Kitchen, SW Steakhouse, and Gordan Ramsey Steakhouse but never found anything that compared to the experience of Top of The World. Our recent visit was to celebrate my wifes birthday too which our experience unfolded.... I booked a reservation about 1 week ago and was given plenty options for time (had the impression the restaurant was not booked up). Upon arriving on time, we were seated at an inner table having to stare across at another party to glance at the view (how awkward). Looking around, there were plenty of empty window tables. I asked the waitress to be moved and was told those tables are not open. It was also relayed that if we wanted to move, it would be a 1.5 hour wait. 10 minutes later, two tables opened up and we were not offered to move. By the look on other guests in our situation, I could tell that they also were pretty upset that only a small portion of the restaurant seating was open. Everyone had been crammed into one area and am venturing a guess this was to make it appear that the restaurant was busy. In all of the times I have dined at this restaurant, it has never been full but was always offered to sit at a window table which far outweighs the impression of feeling "special" for dining in a busy restaurant.  As mentioned in other recent reviews, the menu has been trimmed down considerably. Our favourite chilean sea bass and succotash were missing. When talking with the waitress, it was mentioned that chilean sea bass is on the endangered list and succotash is just not offered anymore. As an alternative, we ordered the filet mignon, halibut, and creamed sweet corn which were both excellent!!! Upon finishing the meal, I had mentioned that it was my wifes birthday to the waitress and was told that if we ordered a desert they would put a candle in it... wow!! I am completely gobsmacked at the fact that the restaurant could not provide a complementary dessert to my wife for her birthday considering my bill was $170!!!  This restaurant continues to serve food that is of the highest standards but has forgotten about what makes it stand out against all other restaurants on the strip..... view and service!!!

PY07Tu9d9ZNkr0565gXFvQ.text: Omg if your really trying to get a great view with great service and great food this is the pace to go you can dress up or do casual it's really up to you but it's a very nice place the floor spends so you see the whole view I will be coming back!

j4NQA_kGKT9oqO9bKsANzQ.text: The rack of lamb is extremely delicious, it's one of the best racks I've had. By far the most unique factor this restaurant has is the fact that it rotates a full 360 degrees as you're eating, over the course of an hour and a half I believe, so take your time to enjoy the good company and good food. The seafood my table had was extremely good and very fresh tasting and the service really helped polish the night off perfectly with family.

ZKNKHo8i9cvfnXaKwvj_8w.text: Recommend lobster bisque Large portions - consider sharing or you will likely Waste meal We gave ours to homeless man on corner All good

mq1ZODREKLDNb0sUGbZTDg.text: Came here with a couple of friends on a night out, being that I'm local it's my first time at this lounge. Wow what an experience, our cocktail server Effie was really amazing! And the manager Jason came by to check on us more than once. I'll be returning soon! Such a great experience!

Go-yr5LvGeo4hOJXCh4hZQ.text: Excellent! Do not pay to go to the top.  Instead go have lunch.  The view is incredible and the food delicious.  A little warm inside but manageable.  Zachary M. was my waiter and he was "johnny on the spot".  I had a beer and a small Caesar salad.  They served three different breads and some handmade crackers.  the butter had lava salt and something else and it was very good.  Zachary was knowledgeable about the views.  I then got to go to the top and take more pictures.  I did not ride any of the rides.  the cost of lunch was $23.  I would have spent $20 or $25 just to go to the top and get a view.  Having lunch is the way to go.  I think if they offered going to the top at $10 they would get more people but they probably charge what they charge so you will stop in for lunch.  Great afternoon.  July 18, 2018

Wk-8lf6jamQheEa0UrIFNw.text: Didn't get to eat in the actual restaurant, only in the bar area. Nonetheless the view is perfect. Elegant atmosphere with half priced apps! & 2 for 1 drinks. The wings were so delicious and the sauce it was served with was so good. Drinks were a little strong, but I like that. I will come again to try a full course dinning experience

azEuI7cWnKdQtN2tz3pvHQ.text: Wow! I don't know which is better...the food, the service, the company or the view! This place is amazing!!

RmztiwlJEYFkq0ZAyCZk_g.text: Beyond beautiful, views and food were amazing. Pricey but worth it. Will definitely return. I had the surf and turf. 9oz filet and lobster tail with a side of veggies.

rm_j6v3EqhQfnYW2Zw7Vag.text: I had to check out this view and it sure didn't disappoint along with the cool revolving dining area!  I thought I'd be Blown away by the food but it was just ok.  I had the pork belly which was really tasty and the short rib egg Benedict off the brunch menu which was really good.   I loved the trio of flavored butter they serve with the great bread.   I may go back, I may not it's pretty pricey and once is enough for me!

GY5xdg3xojMwXV3lh7Yixw.text: I can't believe their attitude! Such poor service at the check in counter. We first was slowed by a security guy in the main floor, and don't even late to pass the 20 minutes limit, the girl in the counter started to blame us. We can tell the unequal treat between American and Asian. You are just a server, you need to serve everyone equally. I love this restaurant so much before, but they really let me down on Christmas Day!

Z-6_tGrUjTbl6ROivAhTaw.text: The view was unbelievable!!! We got there a few minutes late and they still had our table reserved, we didn't get a window table so we asked to changed, they said no problem and ask us to wait around 30 minutes which was no problem for us. We went one floor up to take a moment to appreciate the view and 15 minutes later we got notification that our table was ready. Server was very kind and fast. Food was delicious  the price we pay is worth for the service, the view and the experience! I recommend this place:)

qUddHuih9XS_0oaTx2y2AA.text: I made reservations 5 days prior. I asked about table close to windows. Manager on the phone told me that is good and I will have the table. When I arrived they said That they don't have available table close to windows and I have to wait about 40 minutes!!!!! If I know that I didn't go there!!!

QCAyZ7PXuqCaXHtuuPrGtA.text: This place is amazing! The view at night is breathtaking! I love that you can see the entire Las Vegas strip while you dine. The food is very delicious, we got the chefs sampler  and it was a good portion, plus we got wine pairing with our meal. Overall our experience was great and would definitely dine here again.

KmvOPOD81P9adUCO6CHRhg.text: I had come into the hotel for a show. The wife decided to come to this place since we were already here.  Booked dinner. Nice place.  Service decent. The problem is the food.  I ordered the $74 dollar Waygu steak.  I was expecting to be blown away. I was.. with how HORRIBLE it was.    First, when enjoying a steak at this price, I was expecting to taste the meat.  It was covered in sauteed onions like a cheap $6 dollar Salisbury steak.  It was cooked medium well when I asked for medium rare.  You can get a better steak at a coffee shop.  I didn't send the steak back because my wife set the reservation up and I didn't want her to think I wasn't appreciating the experience. So I had to sit back and choke down this horrible piece of meat knowing that I was going to be paying over $300 for the dinner, which made it all that much worse.  The desert is no better than a $20 Vegas strip buffet.    I wish I took a photo of the meal to share. Anyhow, the view is great and so is the atmosphere and that is what you are paying for. So bottom line. Go there for a few drinks and save yourself aggravation by having dinner elsewhere.  5 Stars for restaurant atmosphere, 1 star for food. 2 stars total.

ChWPVyWntooPpTZ6p_Vaqw.text: Top of the World is a MUST when you're in Vegas. We had the best night experience from start to finish. Our table was positioned at the windows for the incredible 360-degree view of the city, wow! The Top of the World is a high class restaurant that rotates around every 80 min or so and gives you the most spectacular views of the city.     It is very unfortunately that I forgot the name of my waiter but man hands down to world class service! Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu and was capable of thoroughly explaining any dish that we asked about. He also made recommendations based on our likes. He started us off with a complimentary starter that included different breads with 3 types of butter (ginger & orange, basil pesto & classic) and we ordered a few cocktails to start the night. I ordered my all-time favorite Sapphire Gin & Tonic.    For my main entree I ordered the Rack of Lamb and they were very tender and superb! The racks were seasoned with fresh condiments and spices to perfection. The sauce that was used was not overwhelming and it just was right. The fresh ingredients gave the rack of lamb a great flavor taste by diminishing the scent of the lamb. Lamb meat in general has a very strong smell and taste but if "cured" right with the proper seasoning then that natural taste will diminish and an enhanced taste will take place. I really recommend this dish to anyone that goes.   At the end of our dinner we decided to continue the night with more cocktails by moving to Sky Lounge Bar in the floor above the restaurant. Make sure you visit the Sky Lounge Bar on the 107th floor! It is definitely worth the breath-taking views!   The overall experience from start to finish lasted about 3 hours and all I can say is that it is worth every penny. This restaurant is pricey, so be prepared to spend a little over $150 per person if you decide to do dinner and cocktails all together.   Interesting note: The lobby elevator travels up at 21 miles per hour!

cTNlYhj_yowdj2kNfrDm9Q.text: Bad service. Restaurant is 1/3 full and waiting is too long. Food isn't that good either. Our servant was great though.

uJtjzHHG7YtltbmBAjMNAQ.text: Great view and food, fun restaurant and nice servers. Saw the Michael Jackson Show right after dinner. It was a score!!!

mPyEQGrXs-WFf57ko07fCA.text: I'm a local and I went for the first time last night. Honestly I was impressed with what I got.   The view is breathtaking and by far the best part of the restaurant. The only thing is that there is a lounge above the restaurant and you can hear all the obnoxiously loud drunk people during dinner.   Atmosphere: 4.5/5  The food was great and much larger portions than I expected. My boyfriend and I shared the pork belly starter which was delicious, and I had the salmon for my entree which was a huge piece of excellently cooked salmon. I didn't taste my boyfriends steak but he said it was pretty good even though there were many fatty pieces he was cutting off. Oh and the cheese rolls and flavored butters they bring you are fantastic.   Food: 4.5/5  Service was nice but for the price and fine dining I would expect a bit better. There was nothing really wrong with the service but my glass was empty a few times and I asked for a lemon for my water which I never ended up receiving.   Service: 4/5  Overall it was a very romantic lovely night and I would definitely enjoy going again in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view we saw while sitting in the lounge waiting for our reservation time. Breathtaking.

wG8wiF9VEA1BO6BQFwTQWg.text: Top Of The World always impresses. . .   Last night was my girls birthday, and I knew this would be the perfect setting. Made reservations for the perfect view of a sunset on Las Vegas. They were very accommodating, very accurate and sincere.   The food is always impressive, fresh and served with kindness and a smile.   The stakes are top of the line! Cooked to perfection, served at the perfect temperature. All there sides are unique and tasty. We decided on potato gratin, delicious!   Great drinks for the ladies, try the chocolate masterpiece!   Over all, we were both treated like the only two in the restaurant. They were courteous of taking our pictures at the right times (like Las Vegas blvd, and the downtown area shots)   I really recommend TOTW to any couple, party or family.   You will enjoy it!

x5kC2FCDVgFD4l98hpkuHA.text: Came here for my best friends boyfriends birthday it was awesome. You can see people jumping off the top it's freakin insane. The tower rotates it's cool at night. I got the pasta it wasn't that good but I'd definitely comeback and try something else.

q2i_5nIbsHdxbSK9R4rpqw.text: The view is definitely a five star view. The food is a 3 1/2! Service was about a 3 1/2 as well. A better deal is going to the lounge and having two-for-one drinks and appetizers. Two-for-one meaning normal price on the strip. But the view is spectacular. Much better places to eat in Las Vegas but you can't beat the view.

RcA5TjXYqBeiXxrg3cDtGA.text: Top of the World Restaurant, located on the top level of The Stratosphere Hotel and Casino, is a bit of old school fine dining that banks heavily on its rotating dining room that offers a wonderful view of Las Vegas and the surrounding area. The reviews seem to run hot and cold here, with the complaints primarily surrounding price and poor service. As for the former, yes it is pricy ... but the price does include access to the tower, which is $18/person. Factor that into the price of the meal and, depending on what you get, can be a pretty good deal. As for the service, I had no issues, except for the mechanical issue they were experiencing that prevented the restaurant from rotating until the very end of the meal.  I had planned a lunch with a business colleague during my Vegas vacation, I let him choose the location, and I picked this out of the options he suggested. He also suggested the lobster bisque and, as many other reviews have noted, it is heavenly. Possibly the best soup I have ever had. For my entree I went for ultra-decadence with their "Ultra Burger" topped with foie gras. The burger itself is made from braised short rib, topped with a choice of cheese and a healthy portion of foie gras. My colleague ordered the NY Steak served with a poached egg, and potato hash. It was something he had never ordered there before, but he had no complaints.  My only complaint is that there was no draft beer, and the bottled beer selection was weak. But their bread, served before the meal with three different types of spreads, was outstanding. That orange butter ... so so good. Before tax and tip, and factoring out the $18 each for Tower Admission, the two meals, lobster bisque, and drinks were about $50, before tax and tip. (And since they are factoring in the price of Tower Admission in their meals, that's why they charge a minimum and a fee for splitting plates)  Dinner may not be as great of a value, but if you are dying to go up in the tower and are willing to pay the $18 admission, then IMO you'd be crazy not to get lunch at Top of the World. Back out the $18 admission price and you are getting some REALLY great lunch options for $8-$14. The food, and the view, are both well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing lobster bisque ... maybe she didn&#39;t like it as much as I did
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger with foie gras ... mmmmm yummy. ;-)

9V25Gc4xk1cQ663eeyHEMA.text: 8-5-2017 Me and my husband celebrated our 1st yr wedding anniversary and we fell inlove with the place.. Food was exquisite with amazing view, I totally recommend this when you visit Las Vegas!

SINLQXG4ZzrU0L4ysVuvzA.text: Had the most amazing Birthday dinner here last night!!  E came with a party of 6 and everyone loved the food!!!    I personally had the surf and turf and the steak was the best I have ever had (I have had a lot!) literally melted in my mouth.   The lobster was amazingly tender also! No overly fishy taste which I run into a lot.  My boyfriend had the chicken and it was also very tender!! Boy was it delicious also? (Not as good as mine though ;)   Others had the wedge salad, lobster bisque, chefs tasting menu, pasta dish. All said it was amazing. We also got the cheese potatoes for the table and the crust was yummy!!!! The bread to hold you over is also great.   And the view wow the view was amazing!!!! Best part of my trip!!! I have already told people they have to go and experience  it. It was worth every cent.  The restaurant rotates so you have a amazing view the whole time it takes about an hour to completely rotate   We also had a few drinks our total was about 400 really not that bad for the quality of food and a group of 6. The waiter was also awesome!! I plan to go back here with just my boyfriend one of these days for a romantic evening.

wKPnISUCZEBiB2k4OB_8rQ.text: Love, Love, Love this place. The food is amazing and the service is outstanding. It was awesome having a waiter that was a little older, he knew all about the towns stories. That made the whole experience more than perfect. We had the surf and turf and the meat melted in my mouth, the best Lobster I had in this town. Keep going!

5DX2ZVqGYKY05XzkXGOz5w.text: We dined here again recently and it was even better than the first time around (which was also a 5-star experience). This time, we got a table right by the window - thus, giving us an even more amazing view. And a thunderstorm was happening in the distance, which added to the coolness of the view. It was a Sunday night, but it wasn't particularly busy. Our server was absolutely outstanding! We started with the oysters, which were seriously fabulous (some of the best in town). And, of course, we had to have steak. This time, though, we added a lobster tail to one and king crab legs to the other. Oh so delicious! Perfectly prepared and super fresh. Definitely splurge and create your own surf and turf. The steaks were perfectly cooked and quite tasty. And the bernaise sauce was amazing. You really must eat here! Excellent food paired with exceptional service and the best view in town. And they never rush you even slightly. Plus, after your meal, you can head up to the very top for free.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary bread with three different butters.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half dozen oysters.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary mini dessert.

4l7_FLv84LgiZNC4w68lYQ.text: It's an expensive restaurant, fancy and a great location. The food quality was fabulous, our waiter was brilliant and was at the table the times we needed him like he was reading mind, excellent suggestions. He would also come to explain the views as it's a rotating floor. It's been a nice experience. For drinks go to sky lounge before reservation for happy hour. Else it's gonna get too expensive.

NwyGsLdxjrvNj6SQzUVtaA.text: Party of 4, Sat night.  1 ordered surf and turf, 1 ordered Chilean seabass, 1 ordered ribeye steak (shared between party of 3&4).  Lobster in the surf and turf came very salty.  Salty to a point that you would want to spit it out (disgusting!).  Returned it and they brought out another SALTY lobster.  At this point, there is no reason to bring out another SALTY lobster, so we asked to have it be removed from the bill.  Surf and Turf $89, they removed $20 since that is all the Lobster is worth.  You've got to be kidding me.  I held back my rage and asked for them to remove 50% off the $89.  Not counting that this whole thing ruined our nice dinner, disrupted it bringing out another SALTY lobster and the audacity of insulting us with a $20 discount.  SHAME ON YOU TOP OF THE WORLD "MANAGER"  Please go back managing the buffet line and learn some decorum....my suggestion...within the "Fine Dining" arena.  RAISE HELL if you don't get what you PAY for.

JkOrPoUab35jODy-p2EQTg.text: Not impressed on the food! View was nice and that's it! Service was good, but food and price waaaay to high and I could cook the meal I had better at home!

QBt_r56nADdYeqV-UzWI3A.text: With my Meetup "So n City Single" @ the Top of the World. Amazing food & the best Ole Fashion I've ever had.

SMUK6ld44Pjpjm06A0rhfw.text: Omgggggg the view here and the food and drinks were amazing! Definitely a stunning down to earth place to visit at least once in your life...

Lq04Fnm8AFAL8TDl0VDtIg.text: Good food, steaks are flavorful and the view is like not other. You can eat at the other chic steakhouses, but dollar for dollar this is your best value.

u-raEQ8j-U67EhvcLmNB0w.text: Great staff. Friendly, knowledgeable and willing to take a photo for you. Food was also very good. Be prepared to spend a couple hours at dinner but worth it for the views you will see. My only complaint was that the room temperature felt very cold.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

18CTm6oeE0FWmYYfYCS23g.text: I used to come to this restaurant every time I came to Vegas, the first time I came here I was so amazed and food was unbelievably delicious . I don't know what happened, new chef perhaps? I don't see myself coming back. I am so disappointed with the food and service, My boyfriends pasta was cold but plate was hot and food was lacking taste. For the price any other restaurant would have been so much better. I had the chicken and it was so dry and tasteless I am just beyond disappointed.

CEJgg3x-jfjWDIp5KEup4Q.text: My husband and I decided to dine here to celebrate his birthday and our wedding anniversary. We have been living here in Las Vegas for a year, but have never been inside the Stratosphere. There are signs in the hotel that direct you to the restaurant, although it is quite a walk (well at least it seemed that way the first time). They make you walk through the Tower Shops, so you may run into the annoying sales people who work in the kiosks. After you check in, they will send you through a security checkpoint. So leave all your weapons and anything illegal at home, LOL. Dress code is business casual, although we did see a few people wearing jeans.  Well the best thing about this place is the view! We went at night and it was amazing! The restaurant revolves 360 degrees every 80 minutes and it goes slowly so you don't really feel like you are moving. I think the motor was underneath or near the booth that we sat in because every so often we felt our butts vibrate!  The food was alright, but honestly I was expecting much more from a restaurant like this. We ordered:  -Roasted Scottish Salmon with creamy Fennel Sauce: I know that salmon is salmon. But this one was very tasty. The Fennel sauce added a lot of flavor.  -16 oz. Rib Eye: my husband ordered this and said that it was one of the best tasting steaks ever!  -Yukon Gold Mashed Potatoes: nothing special, just regular mashed potatoes. But it turned cold very quickly :(  -Ricotta Gnocchi Mac and Cheese: the pasta was very overcooked and they went overboard with the truffle oil.  -Cookies and Cream Cheesecake Lollipops: You dip these in vanilla sauce and crushed Oreos. Each order comes with 2 lollipops. They were good but a little too sweet for me.   -Ice Cream: one huge scoop!  Customer Service was average. Our server was nice but it seemed like he was rarely around. The people who refilled our drinks were very attentive. Also, the woman who was taking pictures at every table passed by and ignored us a few times. Maybe she has something against Asians?   Honestly, I don't feel like I would want to come back again. The price and the quality of the food was just not equal. But I'm glad I got to experience this!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cookies &amp; Cream Cheesecake Lollipops
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Scottish Salmon

XqSZhv6PUERT0_ccIE22cg.text: Definitely a great experience, only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that while the food was good, I would rate it 9 out of 10 and the service an 8 out of 10. One visit was enough as we had a better dinner and service at Craftsteak.

RvRv0I2z9Lki9mnXaQAkIw.text: Go to impress your date with the view and nothing else. Everyone was nice enough but service was slow (took 20 minutes to seat us even with a res, for example), food good but not great (trying way to hard - everything has some kind of sauce when having your wagyu steak simply grilled is totally acceptable), and way over priced (I guess you're paying for the view - e.g., $50 for a piece of salmon).

HZjntLEVDWyyLclKFFqrcQ.text: AAAAmazing!!!!!  Took my husband for his birthday and he was in awe.  The food was absolutely wonderful and the view was spectacular.  Best steak either of us have ever had. Our server, Louis Papas was also amazing. He was always on top of everything. Never had an issue with anything.  The perfect dinner date.  Pricey, but so worth it.  When we return to Vegas, we will definitely go back again.

4whC_GUMvLGCKe2V6-REOA.text: The view was amazing.  With it for the view alone.  The food was really good.  The only reason why I gave it 4 stars was because I'm a cheap skate.

8Ls9475uaJwk-4nDYnL8TQ.text: Celebrated by 50th birthday October 9th with my husband. We went at 3pm and had the best filet and tail, lunch prices much cheaper than dinner and we just about had the whole place to ourselves. Server very attentive to all our needs.

Fr-J0azuds-yJkF67D3bag.text: The view was spectacular and the food was excellent! Our server was very nice and helpful. The only weird thing was the elevator attendant. My girl friend and I rode along side another couple, an older white couple. The attendant asked them where they where from and they said somewhere in the midwest. Then she asked us where we were from and I said "Los Angeles". Then she said by way of which counrty? I paused for a second because I did understand her question. She asked which country of orgin where we from. I guess people from L.A. aren't born in the USA! LOL!

li0ZHzJl9YwZWCplHe3mgg.text: As locals, it's a shame it took me over four years to finally visit this restaurant.  The occasion was my pending birthday and my girlfriend made the reservation.  From the cocktale waitress giving directions to the reservation verifyer to the security guard to the one of many elevator operators, they all made us feel welcome and it was so obvious they were engaged in making "an experience" instead of just another dinner reservation.  Our waiter, Bon, and his able helper, Alma, gave the best table service with fun, food and tales of the city and area that were new to us.  For an appetizer, we selected the grilled portobello and buffalo mozzarella that was an absolute wonderful way to start the evening.  Coupled with fresh bread and humongous sheet chips. our taste buds were woken up.  For an entree and as the birthday fella, I chose the surf & turf with 10 oz center cut and garlic Mexican prawns.  The presentation, aroma and flavor all melted into one with the first bite and stayed through the very last scooping of Yukon Gold mashed potatoes.  This is one of the best overall meals I've ever had the pleasure of.  Perfect seasoning, temperatures, textures and ease of navigating the feast.  I accepted the recommended pairing of Chateau Coutet, St. Emilion and there couldn't have been a better choice of wine.  Served early in the meal, the wine enhanced and brought out the deep beef and prawn flavors throughout the experience.  Going a bit overboard for the birthday, I selected the Chocolate Delight (?) that is almost indescribable.  As much as I didn't want to finish off with anything too heavy or rich, this was a perfect selection.  Enough chocolate in casing and cake to satisfy even the most demanding tastebuds, but light enough to leave a pleasantly full, but not overstuffed, feeling when it was time to go.  Not much said about the absollutely breathtaking views from 800+ feet above Las Vegas Blvd with bunjee jumpers taking off down the side of the building and the carnivall rides that go scarily over the edge of the building were enough to remain a memory for a lifetime.    I don't recall the Asst General Manager's name, but he stopped by several times during our experience to see how things were going and to share a thought about the venue and views.  Good stuff.  Will do again!

I8XJ49L5OcDy78uJIpp_fA.text: Great food and a fantastic experience.  I would recommend getting a reservation a little before sunset so you can see the city in the day, at dusk, and at night.  Fantastic views that matched the service and food.  I would highly recommend this once in a lifetime experience!

a1D3zAhLb3jDDcYqmGgBdg.text: If you're reading this...read no further! Just make a reservation, take your ass to the stratosphere, hop on that  elevator that's more like a rocket ship, eat,indulge and enjoy every second of it!!! (And thank me later with desert). K, bye!!!!

daEZxbyliJsh2kegt-uk5g.text: You cannot beat the view. Also, the fact that the entire joint is moving means you get several different views. Food is great and so is the wine.

QGc14IaVz9rXicrsIGe7_A.text: I didn't expect coming to this place and having a crazy, orgasmic, explosion of delight going in my mouth. I knew well that what I was paying for was the view (109th floor)and I feel coming in with this state of mind was helpful. See, the view really is SPECTACULAR and the fact that you're rotating the entire time is like nothing you'll probably ever do (while eating). The craziest thing, was just sitting there as people jumped off the building (no, Vegas didn't suddenly become suicide friendly, they have an attraction where you bungee off the very top of the building). It's an experience and I'm glad I can say I did it. The food was alright, I tasted some of my friends dishes and I had no complaints about their food, I had the churassco with au gratin potatoes. Their pork belly was tasty and their lobster bisque was alright but could have used a little less nutmeg. Like I said, at $101 dollars for a one person meal, you're paying mostly for the view.

GwP1nQUryem6rYWWnm4r6Q.text: I don't know what the hype is all about!!!! Services here suck! The foods was okay. Definitely is just one time thing! I will never be back!

4q3xJP_LTdwIcuMfj2sArw.text: The food and view was amazing. They were very professional and so nice I come back anytime I back to Vegas

pAxHvSBsBwFzi32SOTqApw.text: 5 stars for any restaurant that slowly spins, showing you the entire city, from 106 floors up. Strip steak was cooked delightfully, and the ambiance was mellow and exciting all at once. I highly recommend this place if you are ever on the Vegas scene!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My wife Mo&#39;s meal. Also deliciouso
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the restaurant

vAJJsEMNUVFUP4lH9b307w.text: On our wedding day we wanted a special meal.   We headed here.   Our experience was good, the views of the entire strip were fantastic, the restaurant was clean and the staff friendly and helpful.  As for the food, portions were enormous. It is kind of pricey but then if it is a special meal the prices are not such a big thing.

fcg8c-rHoCYYDlYJksfv0w.text: Visited this restaurant for a friends birthday. The restaurant itself was beautiful and unique. Not many other restaurants offer a view of skydivers and roller coaster rides. The staff was friendly and helpful with suggestions. The food and drinks itself were a bit pricey but everything was delicious.

hqbh7y6emWjKd5KkjfV6pg.text: This place should get less then one star... Too bad it is not an option!!! I am a chef here in Las Vegas and had a special guest come in from out of town and wanted to show him VEGAS! What a better way to start off showing Vegas to him by dinner at the top of the world restaurant at the stratosphere. With views of the strip and showing him where we're going to go each day that he was here. We got to the restaurant on time for our reservation, but still had to wait 30 minutes. We then were sat down with no attention to us at all. Finally somebody came by to take our drink order, but we had already had drinks before the restaurant. We then proceeded to order our food. We were waiting and waiting for our food and while waiting I noticed there was a little bread plate and a butter knife and it was empty. Empty for a very long time, and I was wondering if they were going to ever bring us bread. I'm just as we asked for it because I didn't want to wait any longer, our appetizer showed up and shortly after so did the bread. Our appetizer was the crab cake which was actually phenomenal. Or maybe it was because we were so hungry by the time it came.... We then had our delicious steak dinner which was Cooked to perfection! Unfortunately, my date started to not feel well. He proceeded to the restroom, which had only one stall and he was quite sick! He could not wait for the guest to leave the stall. Looking for a safe place to vomit, where it would not intrude on anybody too much, he found the door to the stairwell but it was locked. What happens if there was a fire and the stairwell is locked? Not knowing where to turn and it nature taking it's course on its own, my friend vomited by the reception desk. No one cared no one tried to help him no one tried to see if he was OK no one tried to see if he was there with anybody that could help him! He then took some time until he found our table since the restaurant spins and it's dark inside he had a hard time finding me. Once he found me he said I'm really sick, we have to go. I tried to find the waiter to get the bill, but he was nowhere to be found. Nobody came to our table to see if we needed anything or if we were OK or satisfied with the food or anything! A lot of time had passed I'm not sure how how much time but enough time for my date to throw up four times on top of the table with nobody coming around not a waiter not somebody filling water nobody! Finally the Waiter showed up, and asked us if we were ready for dessert! That's how oblivious and horrible the service was that they didn't even realize that their guest has been throwing up all over their table 4 times. Anyway finally he went to go get our bill which took a long time, then we gave him the credit card and he took a very long time to come back with that and we were able to safely get home. The next day, we called to speak to the manager of the restaurant to share with him this horrible service we had on the fact that my date was throwing up, and it could be a direct effect of the food that we ate we are not sure. He proceeded to say that we ruined the time and the ambience of the other patriots at the restaurant. And that it cost him a lot of money to have extra staff to come and clean up his mess. He offered us no compensation and when he said hold on to us on the phone, my date was telling me that the manager was being an asshole. Unfortunately or not unfortunately, the Manager heard this comment and hung up on us! This was the worst service I've ever had at any restaurant bar none ever!!!

rJI7Z8HPlU2y7P1kH_bRQw.text: The experience, the atmothsphere and the views are amzing! You can get some drinks at the bar upstairs but I definately recommend the revolving restaurant level for 360 views. Its expensive, steaks are $55, food is good and the service we got was average, Bob is not your top notch waiter. But I don't regret any penny, you go for the experience not for the food, make the most of it!

3vM65y293Jms1739_nzkdQ.text: My fiance took me here since we both lived in Vegas for a few years and haven't tried it out yet. Well, lemme tell you...for a like the Top of the World, their service was REALLLLLY crappy. It took us about an hour or a little longer than that to get our food so our whole dinner took us about 2 hours. The food was definitely not worth it. Their menu did not have much of a variety and I think I can make a better meal at home lol.  The POSITIVE about this place is the environment and the experience. It was really cool being able to sit by the window and having a whole 360 degree view of Vegas and being able to see people bungee jump off the Stratosphere.   THE END!

f0OL61A20DSOlh_msQ3jCw.text: I was pleasantly surprised with Top of the World.  I didn't have high expectations because it was located in the Stratosphere, which admittedly isn't my favorite. We decided to give it go after seeing an online deal come up for it and I'm glad we did.   The ambience is nice; the view of Las Vegas from the restaurant, as I'm sure goes without saying, is amazing. The service was also really great; our waiter was polite and attentive. We had a drink at the lounge upstairs while we waited for our table (the wait was much longer than they told us, but we were a no reservation walk-in, so no big deal).   The food: We started with the Lobster Bisque, which was really, really good. The bread they brought out was served with a very inters testing orange ginger butter that we both really enjoyed. My girlfriend had the rack of lamb and I had the New York steak; both were of great quality, were cooked perfectly and tasted delicious. I will say that the food feels a little dated here; that isn't to say that it wasn't executed amazingly, because it was, but it felt a little less current than I might have expected and I think that some other reviewers might be giving it less credit because of that.    It was well worth the price and I'm glad I finally made it there. The added bonus was that we were able to go to the observation deck (and to the rides) without paying the tower ticket ($12-$16 each).

bhw8jHtaOrSrLqKYHZGTkw.text: Amazing view keeps you excited to be in Vegas! The service was excellent! Huge portions so you could split the meal! I had the scallop lobster shrimp pasta in an amazing rich cream sauce! The scallops were huge! Great wine selection! Fun for couples or groups but expect your bill to be high!

CqPU_8EkVJ8ftmFw0Ye80Q.text: This place is amazing. One of the best meals of my life, hands down. The ambiance and the food are equally wonderful. The view is absolutely incredible. Also, the price of the food is not bad. We spent about 3 hours here eating with another couple, and watched the sunset. Make reservations a few months out form your trip. This meal will be one you will always remember.

njHjUjkdR8R3xuzWQ7m5Uw.text: This is not a place to come for food. Bagged lettuce and frozen patty's people arguing in the kitchen.. unfortunately the food is not good but the view is.

Y51HeBCYxBMMMBACtnC3NQ.text: I had dinner here with my girlfriend on 01/24/19.  The Top of the World restaurant is one you don't want to miss while you're visiting Vegas.  I made reservations in advance and arrived on time.  They were busy and we were advised to find a seat in the bar/lounge area, which we did.  We hardly got our drinks when we were summoned that our table was ready.  We were shown to the perfect table for two, right again the windows, so that we could observe all of Vegas and the restaurant revolves.  Wow, what a breathtaking adventure.    Our server was Dan D.  He was courteous, kind and easy to get along with.  He was also very attentive.  High marks for him!  This evening the restaurant had a 3 course special.  Soup or salad, meat or fish, and dessert.  We ordered the Lobster Bisque, which is always great.  I've had it here before.  It's one of the restaurant's specialties.  Next we had sort of a pasta appetizer presented.  They call it the four cheese Cavatelli.  It's part of the meal and no additional charge.  It was great, hot and fresh pasta in a meat sauce.  Next came the Filet.  WOW, was it great.  Tender as a mother's love!  Every bite was excellent and it was prepared just right.  Finally, we had ordered the Creme Brulee for dessert.  We were so stuffed we couldn't eat it.  Dan, our server, suggested we try at least one bite.  We did so and it was great.  Overall, I highly recommend you try Top of the World.  It's romantic and lots of fun.  The food is / was great!  Total bill: $129.90 without tip.

EWzb3C_U3aI5WfQpCaleZA.text: Food and service was very good and the scenery was breathtaking. Very pleased with our visit

NYZrA4LbSULW_D94hCEQ3A.text: Be prepared to spend a lot of money at this restaurant. It's at the top of the stratosphere overlooking the city with rotating views. My overall comment for my dining experience is this restaurant is missing out an opportunity to modernize!! The decor is very outdated and the menu has nothing that sets it apart from other well known steakhouse restaurants like Ruth's Chris or Capital Grille.  The service was decent, but the food was mediocre at best.  We ordered the Mary's Chicken which was a crab stuffed half chicken. The chicken tasted salty and I could barely taste or see the crab in the dish, but at least the chicken was cooked well. It was tender and juicy, not dry at all. Sides are separate and sharing sized so we also tried asparagus and decided to splurge on the lobster macaroni. The asparagus was cooked well and I liked how the outside was thinly peeled off to remove any tough parts - it was probably the best part of the dinner. The lobster macaroni was disappointing! The pasta was over cooked almost mushy, and had no flavor - it did not even taste like butter noodles.   Definitely an underwhelming dinner.   I'm giving this 2 stars because the view is amazing and at least the white cake that was a special order to the pastry chef for my friend's birthday was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 360 degree city views
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Macaroni

c6xcfTNzaRNhnBBMIe-O0w.text: Getting up to the restaurant is half the battle. The wait times for the elevators is long! They first make you go through a metal detector at the front, no big deal keeping everyone safe.   When you finally get up to the top you check in and get seated at your table. (You can ask to be seated  next to the Window if you can handle it.) We got lucky and got a window seat. Wow what a view of the city. It takes 1hr and 20minutes to go all the way around. The first thing our server tells us is that if you see people falling of the edge this is normal due to the sky jump platform right above us!!!!   We started with one app the Kurobuta pork belly..... Amazing so good. It didn't take long to order our food. I got the Wagyu Rib eye and my fellow diners opted for the Kansas City Bone-In and the Aspen Ridge Ribeye. Omg talk about steak over load, they did not disappoint.The Wagyu is a lean cut but it just melts in your mouth. The Kansas City has more fat but oh baby this is a True rib eye. The Aspen is just as good with a horseradish crust..... For our sides they included Mashed Yukon Gold Potatoes and Twice Baked Potato with Bacon, Cheddar, and Green Onion.....   At this point we are filled to our hearts content, but of course we could not pass on dessert we got the trio of ice cream, vanilla,strawberry and chocolate!   We had a great time here and got to see all of Las vegas oh id say about 3 times or so... Yah we were here awhile eating, drinking and laughing with amazing views! Our server was awesome taking the time to explain the menu and offer up lots of suggestions. I will definitely be returning here soon.... Be sure to give this place a try and Happy eating

w3qeOknJrSBamJmiFiHtCw.text: Came here for my birthday. Food was ok. The view was spectacular. Our reservation was for 5:30 and we got to see the sunset and night views of Las Vegas. I even had to pay for my own slice of cheesecake on my birthday.
