Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster soup  Only good dish
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strip view

M41cd3-Lf-pqUeHDzSotKw.text: My family brought me here for my birthday. My second time here as it is a wonderful experience. Staff is always friendly. The food has always been delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab stuffed chicken

WUeFU6QhOktQ8JraMkdaXA.text: This place was amazing. The views are spectacular! I took my friend for her birthday and we saw this trip before the sunset during the sunset and after sunset... oh my God it was just spectacular! The filet mignon and the creme brulee were to die for. The Caesar salad was yummy and the only negative I could say was my crab cake was too salty. Their ice cream was so good I can only dream about it now.  The customer service was beyond phenomenal. #madmax and his assistant were amazing!  They made sure our experience was unforgettable in a good way. It's definitely a place I'd go back.  I now have two very $$$$ favorite restaurants. I think this is a perfect place for special occasions. Birthdays, anniversaries, engagements, or just to take your date to an unforgettable night. You can also go up after dinner several floors up to view the entire city without paying extra which was great. We were so lucky to have had a clear not breezy night. Pictures were breathtaking.

ahKNfz_3AMw2FONcK4SBeg.text: We had dinner reservations last night, and the entire experience was disappointing. As a local I've eaten here a handful of times and have always held a positive impression of this restaurant. I had 3 out of town guests with me last night and was embarrassed that this is the restaurant I brought them too.   The service was the most cringe-worthy part of the entire evening. The hostess was the only employee we encountered with an ounce of professionalism. The server couldn't explain the daily special and lacked professionalism and menu knowledge. At one point in the might a tray fell next to our table and swearing was heard by all of us. While I understand that mistakes happen, the response to it was painfully unprofessional.   The food was lackluster and dated, just like the restaurant itself.   The only positive out of this experience is that I now know not to take any more out of town guests here when they come to visit. I hope this restaurant is able to return to its former glory, but until that happens there's no need to dine here.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken stuffed with crab. Terrible.

NHRDgzsWHC2HHDjYxvT0Sw.text: I got the Groupon deal for the husband and I. It was well worth it! The view itself made it worth the while. With each deal, you get four courses(1 appetizer, pretty much two entrees, and dessert). With the drinks and tip, we spent a little less than $200. Although it isn't mentioned on the Groupon policy, the waiter informed us we would each need to order a drink. It could be any drink such as soda or alcoholic. We were okay with that. The waiter gave us suggestions between the options we had. The both opted for the filet mignon. It was a huge piece and we were not expecting it to be so big. It was cooked perfectly, and so tender! We got lobster bisque which I liked but for my husband, he said was too "seafoody" taste. I got the pasta which noodles were cooked al dente and perfect. But I didn't care too much for the stew type beef. Husband got the crab cake which was a little sweet but he gobbled that down. The salted caramel creme brulee was so good, just a little sweeter than most creme brulee's I've had. The basket of bread comes with sour dough bread and this delicious sweet bread covered in butter. It reminded me of those Asian sweet breads we buy from like 85 degree bakery. They serve the bread with a salted butter. I'd definitely go back to this place when back in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu beef pasta!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge 10 oz filet mignon. So tender.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted caramel creme brulee topped with popcorn. Yum!

zvf45DsopvKB1SCmqIbD9A.text: Top of the World, I like the name but I didn't feel being on Top of the World with my food and service. I like the view that's pretty much and the sandwich I ordered no flavor at all the service was ehhh! Can't explain just dissatisfied costumer.. we left the restaurant with an expression of not coming back. I don't like to give 2 stars but food and service didn't make us happy:(

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ics2LeBq-BlqXVkGx6n03A.text: EXCELLANCE AT ITS FINEST!  Coming to Vegas for the 1st time and with hundreds of highly recommended restaurants to choose from, it's difficult to select just a few.  While reading review after review, I thought where else can you enjoy a highly praised meal while so high in the sky.  The adventure began as we ascended to the 106th floor and were seated at a plush table overlooking Vegas.  The views were absolutely gorgeous, which change as the restaurant slowly turns in a circle.  It turns so slowly that you dont actually feel it moving but if you turn away from the view for a minute and turn back, your view has changed.  Besides the breathtaking views, the food is mouthwatering delicious.  We had shrimp, scallops, king salmon and steak -- each of which does not have enough words to explain.  I recommend making a 4:30 - 5:00 reservation so you can observe a beautiful skyline turning to nightfall and sitting in the 2nd row (not right by the glass).  Truly the best restaurant I've ever been to.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RJnDCC-nm7mGgqALGnmRAQ.text: Great views and atmosphere. Excellent staff and service. The Wagyu Steak is perfectly cooked every time. The wine list is fantastic. The sommelier is awesome, though I wish they were busy enough at lunch to justify having one on staff for both lunch and dinner.  Corkage fee is $25 per bottle. If you intend to bring your own wine, you'll have to check your wine bottles with the check in desk at the bottom of the elevator before security. They will bring it up to the dining room to your table.

mZ9CdilrFc5kb9aGB4rQ5A.text: Half our party was there on time half was 15 minutes late. They gave away the table and told us too bad. They ruined a birthday party celebration. Straight trash service.

XdwzfpBwpNE4rovo3CpjMA.text: My boyfriend and I, came here to celebrate our two year anniversary and it was beautiful and the food was amazing ! Unfortunately the photographer sold us terrible pictures. She posed us and seemed to love her job but when she came to sell it to us, our mouths were open in some, and not smiling or the picture we thought was taken wasn't taken so that was super disappointing. We trusted she knew what she was doing by her attitude. Make sure you check those pictures don't trust them even though they get paid to do that.

cZbn-dYMnUp8yBmkiUZJUA.text: The perfect place to end a work trip to Vegas. The food was good though the portions were small and sides were scarce. The meal was certainly over priced

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A715bhF-jmp62iDdfwBq_w.text: This used to be my favorite restaurant but not any more.  I went there for my birthday and was extremely disappointed with the quality of the food, the presentation and the service.  The tables used to have white table clothes, the food used to be visually appealing and it used to be delicious but this has changed.  It is definitely not worth the amount of money they charge.

3_iijtQTuBXBPoSxnA2ebQ.text: Great views from the bar or the tables. Vibrant yet relaxing. Happy hour is 4-7 and the wings are good...1/2 price but still $8. They also have drink specials. Overall just a beautiful view of Vegas!

7xRsTDkJrnC7BRpTE-7kSQ.text: First thing to know about going to this restaurant is there is a security check heading to the top. Leave your pistols at home. You don't need it up there John McClane. Yippee Ki Yay MFers!   If you don't know about the 3 course lunch meal for $49, then you don't know.   **Pro tip- if you get motion sickness, this restaurant may not be for you. But the views are unbeatable. To mitigate the queasiness, sit facing the front of the aircraft.   The Caesar salad lettuce was perfectly cut, crisp and fresh. My filet mignon was perfectly cooked to medium rare. (Don't over-cook your steak, you heathens!) I chose the shrimp over lobster pairing. The 3 shrimp were also prepared perfectly and delicious.   The real highlight for me was the buttery mashed potatoes...with SRIRACHA.   Cleaned my plate spotless leaving the busboy baffled and confused.   The dessert (creme brulee & chocolate mousse) came after I was ready to tap out, but mama didn't raise a quitter.   This gem of a restaurant is hidden in plain sight. 844 feet in the air.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y8hRy7EjALqyFWt5Q_VU4A.text: The only reason this place gets one star is the view. The parking is difficult, then getting to the restaurant is confusing. The food was bland, tasteless and very expensive. My martini was mediocre at best and was $19. The service was slow. The dress code as mentioned on their website is not upheld. We went for a lovely anniversary dinner to find men in T-shirt's. We were not even given a piece of cake when we were celebrating our anniversary. There was a photographer taking pictures who  had no energy or enthusiasm. Don't go!

9sDdgmXhqOf3ypv53Eru7Q.text: Make sure and make reservations. It wasn't packed when we went, but reservations should be made. Also, they say they have a dress code, but apparently shorts and ball caps are acceptable. If you are thinking about coming here, make sure and leave the baseball cap and basketball jersey at home/your hotel room. Maybe try a nice shirt and pants for a change.   Aside from the lack-luster dress code, this place is pretty great. Obviously, the view is amazing. It's a revolving restaurant, so no matter where you sit, you will have a great view. I don't remember exactly what it was called, but we basically had the Surf and Turf lunch special (it's about half as expensive as the dinner portion). They have a full bar and fancy breads are served at your table. I had the lobster bisque (may have been called a chowder), and it was delicious.   For the main course, a beautiful lobster tail and an absolutely delicious medium rare steak appeared for me (see picture). My wife had the steak and shrimp version and it was just as good. The lobster came with butter (of course) and it was to die for. Every thing we had for lunch there was simply amazing.   The service was great, so make sure and tip accordingly. We each had a drink with the meal and the bill came to just under $200, so plan ahead. If we were there for dinner and drinks, I'm assuming it would be in the $300 range.   Overall....... outstanding!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SaSHBeoDMFOzrIPX104rdQ.text: One of the rudest waiters i have ever met, we ordered three plates, it took them more than an hour and 15 minutes to get the food. When i asked about the delay, the VERY professional chris ( the waiter) replied that usually people order starters and they would not feel the long wait; in other words, it is normal for you to wait more than an hour to get your meal, OR, just order a starter or a salad and you wont feel the long wait. I would like to thank Chris for making my dinner a pefect worthless one.

A0Urvmlasmv1zyYe_kI6pw.text: We took our daughter and her boyfriend as this was a dining experience we knew they would not forget. Steaks and sides were cooked to perfection. Steak was like butter and seasoned perfectly. We had mashed potatoes and glazed carrots as sides and they were both excellent. The view here is amazing. The restaurant rotates 360 degrees over the course of 80 minutes so that you can see the entire valley as you dine. This was my second time here and it was just as wonderful as the first!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the top.

9GflmOtYqSfoEkUqFQGm5A.text: Before coming here, I thought this restaurant may just be cool for the views, and maybe the food was just secondary. But BOTH were amazing - what an experience! The views were incredible for sure - I took so many photos. And the food was absolutely spectacular. Great service, great food, a beautiful spot for celebrating a milestone birthday!

9-ogqgaGXlZE_JxSM2-HOg.text: The food was amazing! Waitstaff and manager were amazing. View was amazing. Would definitely recommend the place....and get the bone in rib eye. You won't be disappointed.

ZldC9d4raVlIvZMV0mORDA.text: This place was amazing! The view is everything! Other than a great atmosphere the food was outstanding and the service was great (she took great pictures of us with the view behind us LOL - so nice of her). Only complaint is that it took us about 20 minutes to get our server, I'm not sure if it was because they were busy or if we were just getting past by hmmmm. but once she did arrive she was wonderful so I cannot complain. We ordered the pineapple lollipop chicken wings and just had Jack and Coke so I can't review the drink because I'm sure everyone knows what that tastes like but the chicken wings were awesome!!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view from our table
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple lollipop wings

MUI-4PXBuU4siotafDaBGw.text: As you can probably tell from my reviews, I rarely give lower than 4 stars, but with Top of the World, I just have to be honest. There is nothing negative that I can say about the service. Patrick was our server and he was great.   My family and I had dinner at Top of the World last Saturday. Since it was our last night in town, I thought it would be a unique experience to have dinner 106 stories above The Strip and it was a unique experience. Truth be told, that is what you are paying for here is the experience. A revolving restaurant above The Strip that you occasionally see people bungee jump off of.  There are a lot of great choices on the menu. My wife and I opted for Chef's Tasting Menu at $98 per person without wine pairings. After looking at what we wanted to have individually, it worked out to be about the same. I started with the Lobster Bisque, then the Kurobuta Pork Belly, and ended with the Filet Mignon and Shrimp Scampi. Unfortunately, I can't recall what my wife had. Which, for me, means the food was just ok, and it was. Based upon other yelp reviews, I was expecting better things from the food. The prices and the food are way off so expect to drop some serious cash.   For the two of us, our bill came to $283 without tip. That included our food and two drinks a piece. I feel, the for the quality of the food we had, the Chef's Tasting menu would have been more reasonably priced at $50 per person, and the drinks at about $10 to $12 a piece. Most of you can tell from my reviews that I am more than willing to drop some serious cash for a good meal, but this wasn't that kind of meal.   Getting to the restaurant is probably the most interesting part. I likened it to waiting to get on a ride at Disneyland, except there was a metal detector involved. You practically walk through the whole casino, then up stairs and escalators, through the metal detector and onto an elevator that takes 30 seconds to go 106 floors up.   If you want just a unique experience and don't care about price, then dine at Top of the World. I will probably go back at some point, but probably just to the lounge. I recommend taking Uber or Lyft to get to the Stratosphere. It will help you avoid the headache of parking. Also, book through Opentable. It is much easier than calling the restaurant.

vSjnJ4WBV3qXMPw6sNWUzw.text: We thoroughly enjoyed last nights dinner. The food and view were amazing and Chris' service was on point. His suggestions and attention to us kicked up the already great view and food to the next level.   Thanks again Chris.

P7L8eNJRMtQEIT08ULFdwg.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch. Lobster macaroni was amazing as was the service provided by Zach. Sandro, the AGM, even came by to say hello. I plan on coming back for dinner very soon. First class !

KDMHPMmMKIK5YQ-jQRgzTw.text: Had an amazing lunch there today. Absolutely beautiful day the weather was perfect in the views were simply amazing. My wife took me on a date here as we rarely have a chance to get out. I had their 3-course power lunch with field greens salad in a nice lite and tangy dressing first. The entree I picked was salmon and it was AMAZING. Melted in my mouth. Dessert was Creme Brulee made to perfection. My wife had Chop salad,an incredible version of French Onion Soup cheesecake for dessert. All incredibly delicious.I highly recommend top of the world restaurant.

_CT_WvPnXRE35dUWxNeBgQ.text: Beautiful restaurant and the food was good. Our waitress barely spoke English and wasn't very kind. We all had a dining credit with the restaurant and she had no clue what to do. She told me it had to be all on one bill. I said no, I spoke to someone and they told me to let our waitress know to charge it to my room etc.. it took over an hour for us to get our food. Our reservation was at 11:30 and didn't leave until 2p that's how bad the service was. And it wasn't even bz! She gave us our bill and didn't even mention on how to use our dining credit. She was a terribly waitress. And for a place to be a 5 star restaurant they should probably hire people who have a nice demeanor and attitude. And know how to do their job.

zt7iIQuxokFZwlWVs3daHA.text: Wow!! 2nd time here and once again we had some of the best steak and lobster, the mashed potato was so good! We have been coming to Vegas for 10+ years, at times twice a year and I cant believe I never came here!! Don't let the distance from the strip fool you, this is an amazing place!!

p4oACy2xp2gFUDGMKaBiVw.text: Not worth it!! The food isn't that great I paid $66+ for a burnt little steak. The service was SO slow. The views nice so Next time I'll just go upstairs to the bar and get a drink instead of paying over $200 for a dinner I could get at Applebee's or chilies.

27z5stRpThs9zRkKgZdkxw.text: If you are looking for a romantic dinner setting, this is highly recommended. The view at the top is spectacular and the food is great. If you don't have a big appetite, you and your partner can share one order of steak then you can order side dish, appetizer and/or salad. Best time to go there would be just before sunset so you can have a nice view of sunset and street lights at night. You may also request for a window seat to get the best view.

xv-6zWFC-MR1GsRRLsLl1A.text: I enjoyed our time at The Top of the World. I ordered the Truffle burger (medium) and the flavor is on point. The fries were crispy, just the way I like it! For dessert, we had the Bananas Foster. While it was lovely, I would have liked more bananas and perhaps a little more drama by lighting it up at the table. Service was ok, but they could have been more attentive, especially at that price point. All in all, a positive experience!

X5HFbZW7hzR6qiHtT9ol0Q.text: Fabulous view, great food and attentive and friendly service while watching people jump off the top of the building- what more can you ask for?

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PECIGpMPM2fgpwcBcT5bhg.text: We recently went to this restaurant.  The food was overall pretty good.  With so many exciting and gourmet restaurants in Las Vegas, it does not really keep up though.  The food is old fashioned but mostly done well.  I ordered salmon that was clearly previously frozen and so fishy that it made me gag.  Then a busser spilled a whole pitcher of heavy cream on us.  The manager was called and he was very apologetic and comped us nearly the whole meal.  The waiter was extremely personable and attentive and clearly felt terrible about the experience.  Now, for the view.  I don't get why everyone says it so great. I think it's best to go late so that you don't actually see all the economically depressed streets that are within view of the hotel.  It's unattractive and depressing to look at.  Once it gets dark, you can see the strip when the restaurant is rotated in that direction, and its fun to look at.  In addition, the Stratosphere hotel is one of the seediest, grossest hotels I have ever had the displeasure to walk through and it definitely takes the whole experience down a notch.    Sorry, I don't think this was nearly as much of a great experience as it was chalked up to be.

HxBnYqkg5OpCPEovsTKraA.text: Absolutely wonderful experience.  My friend and I arrived for our reservation as the sun was setting. It was such a beautiful sight to watch the sun set and all of Vegas to light up.    The staff here are all wonderful going above and beyond to help you enjoy your evening. The food was absolutely delicious with the filet being cooked to total perfection.   Amazing food with a birds eye view of Vegas is something I'll never forget  It's also quite wild to watch people plummet passed you from the sky jump located above the restaurant.

nMXUkUGZs8oMheVCYdqEXg.text: A place isn't 5 starts unless the customer service is good and the food. I'm sad to give this place  2 stars because the food was delicious. I had the Filet Mignon and the big potato and it was very very yummy. The service on the other hand wasn't too great! We arrived and got a rose and we were taken to our table. Once we arrived at the table the waiter handed our menus to us not explaining anything and asked if we wanted water. They have ice water or bottle we didn't get those options. Later learned about it because a different waiter offered it to the table next to us. Then when our waiter came back he asked what we wanted to drink. Since we don't drink we asked for a lemonade and he seemed annoyed. He then came and asked for a food order and again he was annoyed. Our food arrived and our lemonade was still missing. We asked the person who brought our food out. Not everyone's experience is going to be the same I did notice other waiters and their good customer service making me wish they were my waiters.   Great view of Las Vegas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak for dinner
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Z6GM61nr53THvYWjziLCnw.text: My husband and I planned on eloping in Las Vegas (see my review for the Little White Wedding Chapel) and in preparation I made a reservation at the Top of the World a few months in advance.  This was to be our big celebration dinner the night after we married.  I requested a window seat, of course, which I was nervous we may not get but hoped for the best.    The night of our dinner we dressed to the nines and barely ate all day so we could save our appetite.  When we arrived we did have to wait a little longer than I hoped considering we had an 8:45 p.m. reservation.  We went to the lounge which is on another floor, grabbed a drink, then headed out to the observation deck to see what all the fuss is about.  It really is a fantastic view.    The reason I can't give a five star review is because in addition to our wait, when our buzzer went off we simply couldn't find our way back to the restaurant!  the lounge is on a different floor and the bartender's directions were very obscure.  I don't know how we did it but we did.   i know it sounds silly but it honestly was not easy to navigate :o)    The food, service and wine, however, IS five star.  the prices were a little intimidating because we are by no means "fancy."  In fact, we were nervous that we would act too silly or that our manners may be sub par hahaha.  The server (I wish i could remember his name) was great.  We started with oysters and lobster bisque.  Very fresh and very, very tasty.  I'm from New England so I consider myself fairly educated on what is good seafood.    My husband got the filet and alaskan crab leg while i got the filet and lobster tail.  Perfectly cooked.  absolutely delicious.  the menu offers wine suggestions for each dish, which we went with because we are not experts on wine and food pairings.  They were spot on.  The meal was so savory, we were very happy.    With the food aside, the restaurant itself was incredible.  Oh, we DID get that window seat, by the way :o)   We were there for nearly two hours (not because of service, we wanted to take our time, which they didn't seem to mind at all) and because the restaurant floor rotates 360 degrees every hour or so, we got the most fantastic, romantic view of the strip.  The only thing (and they do warn you) that was a little odd was the jumpers dropping from the top of the Stratosphere outside of the window.  Honestly, we thought it was funny.    Overall I had a wonderful time.  the food was delicious and the staff was great.  One of the managers was adorable; he came over to thank my husband for bringing "such a beautiful young lady into the restaurant."  Maybe he was just buttering us up but it worked haha.  Very beautiful, very romantic and tasty.

oPQzeLttbh3Duhs-tpgVSw.text: Best meal while in Vegas! Save money by just going on top of the world and then the lounge upstairs (free to enter). In one hour you can see the view of Las Vegas. We went around 5 to beat any crowd or noisy people. All of the food we had was cooked perfectly and if you get a side of potato- yes its $10. but plenty to split for two. The dessert tray is on the non spinning part and you see it as you are moving by. Our meal for two was about $120 ( one alcoholic drink, two sodas, to entrees, a side of potato, and a dessert to share). But with out thinking twice I would go again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sun set!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lounge 107 entrance. Free above Top of world. Light live music played with lots of candle light- no pressure many drinks

SsMGjDlfqhBB32ZMw3AtKw.text: The food here was amazing I had the ny steak strip with lobster tail and mash potatoes and a lobster bisque well worth the wait the view is also amazing I can't imagine the view at night we had brunch here and everything was perfect

G5-rNhvBOV1yG6oeWe4-4w.text: Seriously? I cannot believe this has as many stars as it does. I have eaten at a lot of nice restaurants in Chicago, LA, San Diego, Chicago, and other major cities, and this place was not up to par on any level except the view.  First of all, the service was slow. I definitely understand if a restaurant is busy, but when your food comes out cold and the waiter doesn't check on you for long periods of time, that is an issue.  Secondly, the food was mediocre at best. If I am paying a lot of money per person, I expect at least a decent meal. Personally, I would have been more satisfied with a meal from a restaurant half the price.  The portion sizes were good, and the wine was delicious. The view was also amazing! However, it became very dark in the restaurant when the sun went down (this may be to make the view outside better).  I would not go back to this restaurant, but if you are looking for a great view, I would recommend going for wine and dessert. Do not waste your time on  the food.

fwfNa72vGHNflAf__dC0Vw.text: An overated experience indeed. My girlfriend and I spent Valentine's Day at TOW and we both were very excited initially. Reservations were made months in advance. However once we arrived everything went downhill from that point. There were several vacant tables that were close to the window and we saw parties of Twos being seating there. After being seated by the hostess we waiting quite some time for our food. We were able to talk to the manager on duty (Bald headed stocky guy) we asked to be relocated from where we sat. He stated, "We do not change tables because we have a full night of reservations and our policy is not change tables." Mind blown and pissed off I was annoyed as was my girlfriend. Not to mention our table candle holder was empty along with several other tables. (Way to set the mood TOW.) Apparently attention to detail is not a priority to you. Its either all tables have a lit candle or dont place a candle holder on the tables at all. Its looks tacky. We asked the server about this and she tells us, "oh they are charging them." Are you kidding me!!! Today is Valentine's Day!!!! Helloooo TOW Management you should have done this the night before!!!! Sigh, we ordered from the Valentine's Day Menu which was $199.00 with pre-arranged courses. Each course portion size was very small yet at times salty. It was a joke!!! I left hungry. Needless to say I was a little embarrassed for bringing my girlfriend here. TOW is a good atmosphere for the view but dont expect much more than that or else youll be just as disappointed as me and my date for the price.

MRQAf-4id2k5N8lUWPv1Mg.text: Where do I begin?  First of all I love Vegas,there is nothing like it anywhere.  I am lucky enough to visit fairly often for an East Coaster and every time I come to Vegas it is new and exciting.  The view from the Top of the World restaurant is stunning.  It is hard to describe how beautiful it is from the top of this tower.  We were seated in one of the booths facing the windows which was cozy and comfy.  I was in the mood for a good steak so I ordered the filet done medium rare.  The soup of the day was a tomato bisque which was flavorful and a nice way to start the meal.  Our server suggested a Merlot that did not disappoint(thank you Karen).  My steak was tender and delicious,but I do have one minor complaint, I love my food hot and the steak was a bit cool when I received it.  Our server Karen was terrific which made the dining experience even better.  The food was good not over the top fabulous but the view was something I will never forget.

unGDlkariX0phtDdjliJ-w.text: The special they had for 2 people is filing. The salad and lobster bisque was good as an appetizer.  The main course options were reasonable. The ambiance was of course one of a kind. Perfect for those romantic settings. The desert was good, just wish they still had the chocolate stratosphere again.  Overall the experience was good from the beginning to end.

TdoGIgLnWHRHlVz4l1O6xw.text: 5 Stars for the view alone.  Throw in a great selection of food and it solidifies the 5 Stars!  Our party of 4 had a variety of seafood and steak meals.  All were very, very good.  Romantic, sophisticated and relaxed atmosphere calls for a nicer attire than shorts or jeans.  Service was superb.  Go to the Top at least once when in Vegas.  The view of the entire valley is spectacular.

ZOHW1OlB5QLkAazJU_C_pA.text: "Beautiful views, romatic atmoshere and a moment of panic" We had dinner here at 8pm so we had fantastic night views! We requested a table by the window by Open Table which they happily provided. However, the booths look cozy and you can see the view right in front of you, especially if there's only two of you.  I agree with the reviews I have read on Yelp. The atmosphere and service are top notch and the food good, but not 5 stars. You are paying for the experience but it is not out of line with all the other nicer restaurants on the strip and those don't have the view! We started with the "complimentary" bread beakfast with 3 kinds of butter and I ordered the lobster bisque which was yummy! My martini was made perfectly.Then I ordered the lobster, shrimp, scallop combo and my date ordered the lamb. My seafood was cooked perfectly, not dry or rubbery, but I didn't care for the tomato sauce. It also had a white garlic type sauce that I preferred. Both sauces were  on the bottom and around the seafood so you could work around it if you didn't care for it. The lamb was a little chewy and we didn't care for the tomato sauce on that either. However, both dishes went well with our speical bottle of wine that we brought with us. (extra kuddos for letting us bring our own wine- with corkage fee, of course!) Service was great! Which leads me to the panic part of the evening... So, as we all know this restaurant slowly revolves to give you a 360 view in about an hour. Sitting next to the windows it can seem like you are sitting still as the outside moves around you. in reality the opposite is True. Well, when I first sat down, I put my purse next to my chair, on the floor, on the window side so it would be out of the way. About midway through my martini, I looked down and realized my purse was missing! Then I noticed that the floor was moving and I had put my purse on a section that was not! So, basically my purse was visiting all the other tables along the whole perimeter of the restaurant! Just taking a little ride around! LOL. I got up to go find it and the waiters all assured me this happens all the time, to sit down and enjoy my evening and they would locate it! And they did, everything was intact. They said they had never had a problem with a purse not being returned, only a shoe was never found! hahaha! Guess if you have a shoe fetish this could be your place! But, I couldn't help wonder why, if this happens all the time, why didn't the hostess warn me?  And, yes, I will go back!

Qy2WNgP7cUQqSCSYnbgbow.text: Went to the 100th something floor and got seated. Dining room rotates and see N S E and west of Las vegas. The waiter said it completely rotates in a full circle in about hour. I started with the Lobster Bisque soup, it was ok. I would rather have a bowl of pho. Then my entree was Surf and Turf crab cake.. it was good, nothing special.  You can also see people sky dive off the floor above us while eating. I got surprise when I seen a person falling. Did a guy just jump off? Pretty cool.  Also a lady keep coming over to try and take a picture but kindly told her to give us time. She came back and said let me know when your ready to take a picture we were like ok. So she came back. Kinda felt sorry for her she was an older lady.. very nice. She took our picture and said she will be right back after she prints and put it in one of those hard paper frames. The thing is it was like $20-25 bucks.

6jl1iXt5X_15m7rm1DP3yA.text: "Absolute Perfect Dining!"  Both my husband and I ate at this restaurant on the fourth of July and were amazed at the views and all the firework displays all over Las Vegas. What a spectacular view this restaurant provided. The food, ambiance and service were superb. If you want to try something fun for dessert, try the three scoops of sorbet (raspberry, mango and orange) with mint and crystalized sugar. What a treat! Make sure you share this dessert as it is very large. In fact, everything they serve is large so make sure you have an appetite. We enjoyed ourselves and will definitely return.   Visited July 2013

xYSLpEGgwpsE975nSMHyKA.text: This place is absolutely AMAZING. I booked a reservation here for my friend's 30th birthday. I requested a window seat and they definitely met my request. I walked in hoping we can get a good seat because in the back of my head I thought my request wouldn't have met since it was very busy. However, we got the best seats in the house! It was our first time there and it was absolutely breath taking. I didn't really read what the hype was about but when I walked in....we actually realized it was SPINNING . It was SO COOL. We started off by getting complimentary bread and butter. They provide 3 different types of butter and all 3 were so good. My favorite was the one with pineapples! The food is definitely on the pricey side but it was so worth it. I got the Wagyu steak with a side of potato puree and mushrooms. IT WAS MOUTH WATERING. Everything was super delicious and my friend had the best 30th birthday here. We will definitely be returning to celebrate more events here.

Yr0KTsGuDM9XtmEqAFAQ8Q.text: Went to dinner with the Better Half at the Top of the World Restaurant.  I've been there for lunch many times, but have never been for dinner.  We were seated at a table along the edge of the restaurant, which had a perfect, unobstructed view of the valley.  Since our reservations were for 6:30 pm in the 1st week of April, we knew we were going to get a great view of the sunset.  The waitress was very friendly and told us to take our time.  Here's a brief summary of our experience:  Wine - We ordered a bottle of 2006 Scott Harvey Zinfandel.  It had a nice bite to it....hints of blackberry and pepper made it robust....yum!  Appetizer - Portobello Mushroom, Red Pepper, and Buffalo Mozzarella in Olive Oil and Balsamic Vinegar......one of our favorites.  Very good.  Entree - Lobster Tail stuffed with Crab meat.  Prime New York Strip with peppercorn crust.  Very, very good.  The meat was cooked just right.  Side Dishes - Sides are ordered separately here.  We had Foie Gras, Risotto Gnocchi with Cheese, and Au Gratin Potatoes with Cheese.  The Au Gratin were a little overcooked, but the rest of them were fantastic!  Dessert - They offered small desserts, which is perfect because I really hate large dessert dishes.  I think they're a waste of money and food.  The Better Half had a chocolate something or other...can't remember right now (Thank you Scott Harvey!) ...I had the strawberry cheesecake lollipops and the cookies & cream lollipops....with dipping sauce and crumbled cookies....yes, they are as good as it sounds.  Check out the photos above to see them.  Service - We were treated well from start to finish.  We had to ask for water a few times but that was the only strike against a perfect evening.  I would have scored the restaurant 5 stars, but I felt that the menu was lacking more vegetarian options.  At the time of this visit I was trying to avoid eating meat....not go vegetarian, but just avoid it for a while.  There was only a grilled vegetable option, which sounded "blah" to me....so I broke my diet and went for the Prime NY Strip.  Would I visit this place again?  Absolutely!  Awesome place to take your significant other and spend a romantic evening overlooking the Vegas Valley.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can you see that little, tiny black square at the base of the tower? That&#39;s the landing pad for the Sky Jump.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake Lollipops &amp; dipping sauce for dessert....oh yeah!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoying a nice Tawny Port with dessert...yum!

3Rp0rNXk_lD39IS3QQ2f3A.text: Probably my favorite thing we did in Vegas (and we did a ton). Great experience!!  Want to get away from the sweaty/dirty masses for a while? Well they can't probably afford to follow you up here!! :)

w1ovbFSbZWV0_x_dYobt1Q.text: The view of Vegas is spectacular I don't think you can beat this restaurant as far as that goes however the service was sub-par and the lady taking overpriced souvenir photos had me so annoyed that she almost ruined our romantic evening she kept insisting on snapping photos and yelling at me to look at the camera I was looking at it and I didn't need you to retake the photo 10 times. Needless to say we didn't purchase those pics didn't particularly want to be reminded of that portion of our trip. The food was alright a decent filet mignon and the scallops were good but dessert was lackluster as was the lobster bisque and salads oh but definitely get the amazing twice backed potato is you come it's huge and is such gooey goodness. All in all it was a nice dinner but not on my top ten list

6bf4_ZU0HpSBOZt2eeoVBA.text: Been to this restaurant for 4 times.  The lamb is great.  We went to NyNY steakhouse, Mix in Mandayla Bay, Cut in Palzzo, Eiffel Tower in Paris,and the steakhouse in Palms before.  I personally think this place is the best I ate in Vegas.  If I ask for medium well, they don't bring some dried well done jerky on the table.  That's the most important in a steakhouse.

z7b_ivBEBBQIVAYZS74w7w.text: Great place for a romantic dinner. When my husband and I arrived they were having difficulties with the air conditioner they said due to the weather. We decided to stay and we're glad we did. The food, drinks, service was excellent. The view is incredible, you must go here at least once!

mqIPe_ShLCb_GnGCU9-2rg.text: My friend of 25 years and I had dinner here last night.  I've been here a couple of times before, but last night was better than all the rest.  We had the Cesar salad which was delicious (the croutons are better at Grimaldi's Pizza).  We shared the Surf and Turf.  The 10oz steak was amazing.  All the fat had been trimmed away and all that was left was the most tender and flavorful steak I've ever had.  The lobster was delicious as well.  The duo chocolate desert we had was decadent.  Yes, the view was spectacular.  Yes, the service was good.  We also had the pleasure of having our photo taken by Sherrie, the restaurant photographer.  She was amazing.  She took shots of us together and of us individually.  Yes, I know she's a professional photographer, but I didn't expect her to go to that much effort setting up our poses and the pictures turned out fantastic.  It's not often a reviewer spends this much time gushing over the photographer vs the meal, but Sherrie deserves high praise.  She made out wonderful night out immortal with her beautiful photos.  Thank you, Sherrie.  After dinner, we went up to the observation deck.  The view was incredible and it was loads of fun watching the people on the rides.  This is a great date night out for anyone who wants a wonderful environment, a delicious dinner, and memories of a life time.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My friend of 25 years and I.  We look fabulous!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top of the World

6XK-KtSmHWtZXiIdkRFP4A.text: Top of the World at the Stratosphere! Definitively of the most awesome places to dine in the whole city and one of my favorites. The experience, ambiance, the view, the service, the food, and anything else I might be leaving out, are all top notch! I love this place! : )

AWKVaLQP9BrSeM3c3gq_KA.text: Not sure what to expect exactly in terms of cuisine, we were happy to find it was a good ol' steak place.  Maybe not a steakhouse in it's True form, but steak place nonetheless.  We arrived a bit early for our reservation, considering we did a pit stop on the floors above (the guys went on the thrill rides), so we decided to wait for the rest of our dining party at the bar.  The bar itself does not revolve, so it was quite interesting to see the tables below you moving as well as feel some of the residual aftershocks of some of the rides.  My Long Island Iced Tea (or their variation) was quite nice though a bit warm and the guys' drinks, according to them, were actually a bit weak.  The waitress was kind enough to bring them back for an extra shot and didn't charge...though also kind enough to point out that normally they would.  For some reason, I did have to go back to the hostess' to remind them that our entire party was here, because it was well beyond 15 minutes past our reservation and it seemed like they had forgotten us.  Considering that upon making the reservation they were required to provide us with the dress code (dining attire - no jeans, t-shirts, hats, or sneakers), they were pretty rude and abrasive when I tried to inquire if there was a reason for the delay in our seating.  Not very courteous I tell ya.  But aside from that really, our waiter was extremely pleasant and even kind enough to take a group shot...which I am sure they get asked all the time.  Everyone seemed to enjoy their food, and although my steak was overcooked....it was still pretty tasty, alongside of the mashed potatoes and crab cake it came with (I got the surf and turf).  My salad was also pretty tasty, and the bread basket another thing to look forward too, as it was paired nicely with some flavored butter.  (Sorry for going a bit backwards there with the courses).  If there is anything to truly note about their entrees though, is that even though the menu says the steaks do not come with sides...they actually do.  Everyone had some kind of potato (mashed or au gratin) alongside of their steak...in addition to the sides we actually ordered.  And if your waiter tells you the sides can only feed 1, he's lying.  It's a good 2 person/portion serving.  I do recommend the mac & cheese or the gnocchi with truffle oil (just make sure you like truffle oil..it can be a bit rich).   **NOTE TO SELVES** If you are planning to eat at that Top of the World Restaurant, you get to go up the observatory FOR FREE!

NevAaycpuFM02igeBgG36g.text: Came here for our anniversary and it was a great pick. This place is amazing. The view from this place is spectacular. We went close to 6pm so that we could catch the sunset while dining. The food here was really good although the filet mignon was just slightly over cooked but the lobster tail and shrimp were perfect. The service was very good and they have a professional photographer there to take your picture and you can purchase the prints if you like them.

5VjrL9VI_IupgywxgiS-NA.text: Food is good, service is great, prices are high but for the environment very fair. View is spectacular and can't be beat. So romantic it's not even funny.

Q1Hd1ODNa99g7Nc_iXGc3Q.text: The view is nice.  Food was terrible.  When we called they made a point to tell us there was a dress code, so we dressed for the occasion.  The bar above us had locals in concert t-shirts and flip flops hanging over the railing above us.  $200 for dinner and the food was really bad.  Not worth the price or the effort getting dressed up.

fCmscegK0HvYSpGs8mhPYg.text: An amazing restaurant! The view is remarkable and romantic. Highly recommend going at night, so you can see Vegas in all its glory.  The dinner was a bit on the expensive side. There was a package for 2 for just over 200, and when you add a bottle of wine, you are looking close to 3 bills.  All Gourmet Food, All Fresh Tasting, I can say enough good things about it. It didn't get a 5th star because of the price. A tad bit cheaper and it would be a regular stop in  Vegas, not just a romantic retreat.

nvEHFD8uVhjvPrgSaW4pkg.text: What a perfect romantic way for my wife and I to spend a wedding anniversary.  Our reservation was for just  before sunset.   The waiters were polite and helpful.  The filet mignon was of generous proportion and cooked just the way we like.  All and all a memorable evening and well worth every penny.  With reservations you are escorted by private elevator to the restaurant.

xV34A0C8GCAKwXSC_lljlw.text: Very disappointed! We had a birthday bash reserved for a table by the window. Was told that due to the seating request, they would be able to get us the table until 9:15pm, which I agreed to do. We arrived 5 minutes early. Now the lady told us that they were 20 minutes behind. I said it was okay as long as we got the seating reserved. Was told that of we wanted the seating by the window, we had to wait another hour to an hour and half.  I told them that the reason why we had to opt for a later dinner was because that was the earliest time they could get us in for the seating requested. She was very rude and acted like she didn't care, that they had enough diners anyway. If there is a way to give a minus star, I would have given them 10 minus star for customer service. That simply ruined the special birthday celebration night. What an awful place. It's already expensive to start with. And being treated like that was really a huge disappointment. Will NEVER come back again, not even if the food is free. There's no need to treat your customers that way! If they could not meet the time they had guaranteed us, then they should have given us a free appetizer or a free drink or a discount to accommodate the wasted time!!!!

rYfMe_i2sWje8hgQrtAFXw.text: I have eaten there twice and was NEVER disappointed. While the prices are very, very high, I felt I got what I paid for through and through. I ordered the Filet Mignon with Lobster tail, and let me tell you, the lobster tail was the most tender I had ever experienced outside of Boston.  Their cocktails are so so, you really have to ask for Premium liquor to get a buzz on.  Service is fast and very, very professional. It will be a routine stop every single time I go back to Vegas.

6S2ZLLGKN0-rnATOh7_Ipw.text: I didn't realize that the restaurant was revolving at first- but when Dad pointed it out, I started feeling a sense of vertigo (although it went away pretty quickly). The view is INCREDIBLE (although you're up so high that the streets/cars below are reminiscent of a child's playmat). The waitress was extremely friendly. Mom ordered an apple martini; I ordered a white gummi bear cocktail. Most places will tell you they don't have the drink, and that's the end of that. But the bar was VERY accommodating and said they would put the drink together for me if I listed all the ingredients (slight miss, but the drink was still pretty strong).   Neither Mom nor I were really hungry (she just wanted soup, and I had JUST eaten somewhere else), so Dad ordered an appetizer and a five-course tasting menu to share.   Appetizer: Calamari (pretty good, but I was so busy chatting with Mom that I'm not sure there was anything particularly special about it) First course:  Mom picked the lobster bisque (she liked it) Second course: Beef Tenderloin Carpaccio (VERY moist and tender) Third course: Muscovy Duck with Hoisin Lime and Baby Lobster Tail (the plate was in front of Dad, so I don't remember duck, but I vaguely remember him asking me if I wanted any... and I probably said no. The baby lobster tail was also very moist, albeit a little on the salty side) Fourth course: There was supposed to be a chef's assortment of gourmet imported and domestic cheeses with seasonal fresh fruit (either Dad replaced this with an appetizer, or he inhaled everything with lightning speed while I was in the bathroom, because I did NOT see this at the table. And no, I was not drunk from my cocktail) Fifth course: Mini Desserts Trio. The dessert plate included banana bread (very good also... Dad usually doesn't care for banana bread), a chocolate/caramel torte (too sweet in my opinion, but it was Dad's favorite), and a raspberry mousse (my favorite of the three, because it wasn't overly sweet).  Overall, a pleasant experience for my first actual meal in Vegas. It's a little far from the main area of the strip, but I would definitely wander back here again.

vZ1kSGwaCXn6cQVuK8z6dQ.text: I took my bf here for his bday.  I thought the food was great!  You have GOT to try the Lobster Bisque!  The view is TO DIE FOR!  If anything, it is worth the bill just to eat and look over the city!  It's very romantic and worth every penny we spent!!!

DuueUBcGjFbEcWAxAO4qwg.text: Came here for lunch, so my review is base on lunch experience. First of all, I definitely recommend reservation, because it will cut out the wait time. Second, try to pick a sunny day to come because the view is awesome. DATE alert!!! If you wanna impress a girl on a first date, I definitely recommend this place. Now get back to the food and service. The food portion was decent and actually good. The service was very good also. The price is actually not bad when you think about the location and view.

RR6bWQEbbQNUTXDZjKHjew.text: Over hyped, over expensive food. I'm a True believer that good food should not cost an arm and a leg. But if its expensive it should taste better than Olive garden. I had the lobster bisque which tasted good during the first 5 spoon fulls but become too rich for a large bowl ($12). For entree, I ordered the seafood alfredo with lobster, prawns and scallops. Lobster was overcooked and I only found 2 chunks ($45). The pasta tasted like whole wheat pasta and I'm pretty sure the menu did not state whole wheat. I sampled my friend's salmon dish ($40) and it tasted overcooked and dried out. I also tried the foie gras tater tots ($11) which tasted more like mediocre hush puppies than anything like foie gras. The Mini desserts trio are not even worth mentioning. I was really looking forward to the meal and its sad that I prefer Olive Garden over this place. Yes, the view is pretty awesome and its rotating. But you can pay $16 to check out the view and walk around it slowly if you want to simulate the rotating view. There are so many better options on/off the strip!  If you like thrill rides, check out Big Shot, Insanity and X Scream. Price of tickets include admission to the top of the tower.  If you don't believe me that this place is overpriced compare the lunch menu to the dinner menu. The same entrees on the lunch menu are double in price on the dinner menu.   Don't fall for this tourist trap!

2o7US4ODFpVMdsMF4RRKKA.text: Their website is kind of misleading. The restaurant is not as extravagant as it appears. First of all, the location (Stratosphere) was not at the prettiest part in Vegas. Though the food we ordered (turf and quack, a salad with blue cheese and bacon) was acceptable, menu options are very limited. And don't worry about dressing up like I did because there were diners who were wearing jeans and a t shirt. And even though we were on the 108th floor, Vegas does not have much to view.

zz5LaDRRYbC6Nn2nipti0g.text: very romantic place food is expenisive but very good. we had a great server Max who handled everything we asked for.The View of the city is worth the price of dinner. We recommend the place if you want a romantic night

iKQrLrFXPtCME0rAs1EARQ.text: My husband surprised me for our first anniversary dinner here, and experienced best restaurant of my life. The view was breathtaking. At the time of booking my husband made a note of special occasion and they provided best service and table in the restaurant. We had all vegetarian food and to my surprise, the food was really amazing. the dessert we ordered came with a little candle and it made our day very special. Definitely recommend this place for any occasion.

oXkS4aHnNK1UHj55ZMX6OQ.text: The ONLY thing good about this place is the view. I researched this restaurant before making reservations. (I'm flying in from Hawaii mind you). There was a dress code, business casual. That means men wear a jacket, women wear a dress,  skirt or pants suit.     Upon arrival at the elevator to take you up to the restaurant, you are sent through a metal detector and if they are not satisfied with that you are asked to remove articles of clothing and or accessories. This was a huge embarrassment to the woman I was with. I should have left the establishment at that point. But she wanted to be a good sport about it and we continued to the elevator.     We got into the elevator with other hotel guests who were dressed in cargo shorts and t-shirts. I assumed they were going to ride the rides at the top of the tower. Our elevator operator Leroy, was dressed in a tuxedo and he is the only reason I didn't rate this restaurant  a 1 star. Leroy was very personable and it was quite an entertaining elevator ride.       We disembark at the restaurant level and are seated. We looked around and noticed most of the other dining guests are dressed in blue jeans, cut off jeans, shorts, t-shirts, baseball caps, mismatched clothes and the like. It looked like we were at a picnic for a Little League game.       I'm wearing a black suit and tie and my date is wearing a very smart  women's business suit. We looked so out of place. Our waiter looked better then most of the dining guests. We questioned the Hostess about the dress code and she said yes, there is a dress code but the restaurant figured since there was a Construction Equipment Convention in town, they wouldn't be so strict on the dress code.       We almost left then. I mean after all, we researched this restaurant and made plans around their advertisement. And now I have to sit across a guy in overalls, in a Green Bay Packer cap, who just kicked a bread stick under his table after he dropped it on the floor?       We looked at a menu. A rib-eye steak was $45. ONLY the steak! No potato, no vegetable, nothing, just the plain steak. We tried to make the best of it. My date ordered a plain salad... at $13. I got the steak. Thoroughly disappointed we left after we ate and went down the block to the IHOP were we had a great dessert. The Stratosphere Hotel is nice, it's this Top Of The World  restaurant that's iffy.

B7K9JiGH1my5BZijcUilXg.text: Well worth the money. I don't know why people give this one 4 stars based on price. You really don't go here unless you expect to pay. The service was great as well as the food! The filet was melt in your mouth as you can expect, cook exactly as I had ordered. The view at sunset is spectacular, I would recommend making a reservation at this time. The dress code says business attire, but you will be fine as long as your neatly dressed. You do have to go through security but its no big deal, just empty your pockets and move along. I would recommend this place to any one visiting Vegas.

mK2nNYIjGDqrG5CwOBj_RQ.text: this place has great food not only that but the most awesome view you can imagine!!!!! you can ride a roller coster  if you wanted to they even have bungie jumping! A+++++++ for the food.. great place for kids during the day time but once it hits dark its all for adults

irtLdfO3xSlFytf0VlSwYw.text: Just had  a delicious filet at the Top of the World! The service was impeccable, food delightful and the view from atop the Stratosphere is nothing short of spectacular. The slow rotation of the restaurant is barely noticeable. I've lived in Vegas for twenty years and this is my first visit. It certainly won't be the last. If you want to do something very special when you're in Vegas, this might just be for you. I can only describe our experience here as perfect.!

N0DpOd5YcC0N2vldMP3IlA.text: Ok I love the entrees here. The scenery is really amazing at night or during the day. However my head couldn't deal with going around in circles. Lol.. But really romantic! Can be used for a great pick up line "baby how would you like me to take you to the top of the world" haha

ixo4te1zC4OgADULrkAbVQ.text: My boss gave me a gift card to this place so I took my sister there for lunch. Before going to the restaurant you need to go through a security check point.  The restaurant was nice, the view is unbelievable.  It must be breathtaking at night. Call me a wuss, I got a little dizzy from the slow rotation of the restaurant.  Service was good and attentive but not overly friendly.   I had the sea bass and my sister had the lobster ravioli.  Both were very good.  Not bad for $50.   Can't wait to go there at night.

9nuO7uLwnIlecnbSexU6Aw.text: I ate here on Christmas 2015 with the wife. She had the holiday 4 course menu consisting of cauliflower soup, nut salad, prime rib, and bread pudding dessert. I had the pasta primevera.   The atmosphere and view are amazing! The food is about 3-5 stars depending on what you get. My pasta was 3 stars. It was under seasoned, and the pasta did not seem fresh, it seemed like the standard de hydrated pasta you get at the store. This was akin to something priced at $14 from the olive garden. My wife's salad was also a 3. The vinegrette was nothing special. The cauliflower soup was great and worthy of 4 stars, as was the prime rib. The desert was 5 stars! Amazing mentioned in your mouth delicious!

qe9Xigp7ILHI26tUiqOjWw.text: Great service. Food was great. Only thing is, price is outrageously expensive, but that was expected. Great once in a life time experience.

4gyZv1cztHE6HTfExbu2Ng.text: Lamb chops were delicious!!! Max is a divine server with wonderful recommendations Filet was great!!
