8Z4hr2CrWwg4VRYBjiI_UQ.text: Had lunch with my brother and sister here, we didn't have reservation but were seated shortly.  Service was 5 stars- Even when we didn't look much, we were still taken care of with 5 star treatment. The waitress was very nice and didn't hold it against us that we were not in our Sunday's best.  Food 4 1/2 stars- We ordered from the lunch menu, they had the 2 specials, my brother got the burger and sister went for the crab cakes. Both were great. I had the salad which was scrumptious too. We shared a petit four of desserts. Unbelievably moist chocolate cake, the other 3 were good too but I was too blown away by the chocolate cake that I can not imagine talking about them.    Ambiance 5 stars- Whilst you sit enjoying the food, the restaurant imperceptibly revolve, thus you are afforded a spectacular 360 view of Las Vegas. Every so often you witness some bad @$$ bungee jump off the side of the building. Talk about extreme!  One of a kind experience and only in Vegas!

Irc2qhG5NQUJNmT6ok9XDw.text: Came here to celebrate our 6th year anniversary and my bf's bday. The view was absolutely breathtaking. I had no idea that the restaurant spins while you're having dinner! Servers were really nice and polite. Another reason why I'm giving it 5 stars is because my boyfriend really loved it. Not only did we get a complimentary mini dessert for his birthday, we also got one for our 6th year anniversary--didn't have to share a mini dessert! I would definitely come back again for future celebrations. If you do decide to come here, come during dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nl0Ov06dVQ2bySUtUphQog.text: Amazing view and amazing food, great service . I recommend the Amazing lobster bisque. It was So creamy and yummy. Four courses meal is also a MUST!!!!!!!!! Make reservation ahead of time so you don't have to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LSmeiilg0wGJlx9q6xgYhA.text: Went here on the weekend of my 21st birthday- the view was absolutely spectacular! It was a week or two ago, so some of the details are a bit hazy. It was very very crowded, and fairly expensive- but the food was super yummy and the mixed drinks were decent. Our server was this blonde gal- wish I could remember her name! She was very nice, particularly given the stress she was under. Definitely worth a visit, even if just for a dessert.

-NP3I8qZ9S_DHstP58HSXA.text: If you've never been to Vegas and want a romantic view, this is the place.  If you're coming for the food, save your money.    For shelling out $50 a plate I expect a lot more when it comes to quality.  The steak was cooked to order but was sparingly seasoned to be nice.  The lobster gnocchi was delicious but had the texture of a tiny potato wrecking ball.  None of it was bad but the cost to awesome ratio just wasn't up to par.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L6qVVCZ5pE0s9l7-nFrkIw.text: did you ever have a wow moment?  when you walk into the restaurant and see the view i had one of them.  i didn't really expect it to be so cool but it was.  the food did not compare to the view but no matter, it was still yummy.  the restaurant is set up so you don't see anything until they seat you and for good reason.  they want you to be wow-ed.    the revolving aspect of the restaurant made me a bit nauseous but i think i'm just oversensitive when it comes to motion sickness.  it was really cool to see the people on the rides above the restaurants.  some were revolving over the top and some dropping down the side of the tower.  it's a bit pricy to ride the rides and i prefer food over that stuff anyway.    i had the Moroccan lamb chops and they were good and spicy.  lamb was tender and had nice spices.  it wasn't extraordinary but overall it was worth the view!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8tnhdEQn60b6nt-Vt-gahw.text: My husband and I came here for our 5year anniversary  First I'll say the view was Amazing.  The service was horrible! It took 20 minutes for us to be asked if we wanted drinks. And it took over an hour for us to get our food. I also had to go and get someone for our check and card back. We told him we have a show so we're in a hurry... 15 minutes still nothing. Also they took our food apparently they don't do to go boxes I asked and was told they didn't have them for my soup I was not asked for my plate she just took it and staked it with other food.  The food was not that good for the price not worth it. We are leaving the restaurant now and trying to reach the manager to complain. If you want the view it's beautiful but quality of food and service not worth it.

0m1fMTBHKy7Kgk8SN-2hjA.text: Sorry but no way this place is worth a ride to the Vegas ghetto. The view is decent yes and food is OKAY but not great.  Standard steakhouse pricing, menu and sides ect.  Service from start to finish terrible or at least we happened to have one of the worst waiters I've encountered. Yes,that's harsh and no, I'm not a crazy complaining person that over exaggerates.  I could care less if service is slow and orders get messed. This guy happened to be incredulously arrogant and obnoxious it was laughable.   The stratosphere hotel where the restaurant is located is in a really rough side of Vegas about 10 min or so from the main strip and the walk through the hotel and its "mall" to get to the restaurant would probably be hard for even a good restaurant to overcome.  If you are dead set on eating here I recommend coming during daylight. I wish I had taken pictures of the walk inside the hotel to get to this place, man o'man. I hope none of my friends see this as I was jolly that evening since I was in good company and I don't like complaining especially when someone else is treating me to a $100 meal but boy was I glad to get back to the good side of town and our hotel.  There are so many other really really good steakhouses in Vegas, would recommend skipping this place for certain.  I'm surprised that someplace with a coveted view and such high pricing can still have such a sleezy feel. There were several drinks and meal items on our table that missed the mark but won't get nitpicky as restaurant doesn't allege to be a 5 star or Michelin rated one.

xIeHS5KPzMl_hIWkEUBwTQ.text: Food was delicious. Though the seafood dishes are just a tad over seasoned. The views are spectacular especially for dinner when all the lights are on. I have a slight fear or heights and we were seated right at the edge, but after a little while you get used to it. Even the occasional roller coaster in the corner of the eye and sky jumpers dropping  added to the ambience. Very nice place, but for the price, I would save it for special occasions only.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot de creme
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso-Glazed Salmon and Gulf Prawns
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Scallop

O22NpvJMhQM2fcQ1jf4tUA.text: The food here is great. We came from New York which can be insanely over priced but we weren't shocked when the high end prices showed up on the bill. A lot of the reviews I've seen from unhappy guests are in regard to the pricing. Don't come here if you're on a budget and if you come with a negative attitude toward it it's never going to meet expectations. The restaurant revolves which is interesting and they have attractions such as the observation deck. The reason this restaurant didn't get 4 stars is how difficult it is to leave. We waited 20 minutes to get on an elevator with an insanely rude attendant that didn't want to take us for some reason. Honestly after a beautiful night the last thing we wanted was a difficult exit. Great food and drinks, excellent dirty martini and awesome views just don't beat anyone when you get to the elevators (and trust me it's hard not to).

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegas!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Martini and prime rib with mushrooms (which are amazing by the way)
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great drinks especially the martinis

_4PY8g5hn45BhlJpUImxoA.text: Wow! Wow! Wow! Spectacular experience! So my husband and I are celebrating our 1 year wedding anniversary, and he took me to dine at this wonderful restaurant! The food was absolutely incredible! The customer service was on point! The scenery was phenomenal! Take a look at my pictures they speak for themselves. AMAZING experience  ALL AROUND! This intimate dinner made my anniversary even more special than it already was!  hands down to the chefs, and the staff!!!! Shiela our waitress was very sweet and attentive!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Absolutely amazing!!!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cesar salad. Super fresh and yummy!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Husband ordered the rack of lamb  Omg the best tenderized juicy lamb ever!!!  hands down to the chef

lnY9-tcvhzjqeHrj9bR6MA.text: One word (WOW) top notch view top notch service top notch food it can't get better then this I feel like I'm dreaming, this Resturant made my 1 year wedding anniversary way way better and I'm glad I came here, oh boy

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My wife enjoying the view

EM1SVXAiJq-0AZDhRW7yHw.text: My after Wedding meal was excellent. I had the rack of lamb& a sweet red wine.My Husband had the chicken which I had a sample of.It was perfect.After dinner I had the Chocolate Lovers Dream which I highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4q52a2kxtScSW2yqHRXzyQ.text: The most horrible experience I would ever had at steakhouse restaurant. They confused our steaks. Me and friend realized that only in the middle of the meal.  When we ordered desert we asked to bring cream brulee. Our waiter Max wanted to sell us so bad Teramissu. Which we didnt want. He pushed us to order it. And when they brought it, we still didn't want to eat Terramisu, and he resisted to exchange it , even it was not touched. But the most disgusting moment was, that the waiter Max told me "to give it to my friend if I don't want to eat. But he wont change it..." Is this considered high class steak house??!!! Beside that the floor is moving and you have view on the city, it doesn't worth it even to eat there food, as you still WONT GET what ever you ordered... NEVER AGAIN!!!

qQKL38RDDls9sVtN-QB4Aw.text: This was the best dining experience I've ever had. The service was excellent and the food was superb! The restaurant is located at the top of the Stratosphere Hotel where it spins slowly, giving you a 360 view of the surrounding hotels and the Las Vegas Strip.  We got to see a few thrill seekers jump off the Stratosphere while we were dining.  I had the four course dinner and it was to die for. The Lobster Bisque soup was delicious and is a must have.  I had the Filet Mignon and it just melted in my mouth. It was so delicious! I celebrated my birthday there and was gifted a mini Melted Lava cake with a candle, that was nice of them.  The pricing is very expensive but well worth it. I Loved my entire experience!

zClf56TmTsuR5nPe1USk5w.text: I dined here for Valentine's Day a couple of years ago. I would love to go back again. The food is literally out of this world and not just on top of the world. Everything we ordered was ordered and delivered at the appropriate time. It was delicious. We ate the sampling of the desserts and it was great. I don't know what else to say other than this is a great place to go for a romantic dinner for two. Also a pretty cool place if you go with a group of people. The food service & view are extraordinary.

MRE0VB4-ME1_CDFaOfJT-A.text: The views from this restaurant, especially at sunset, cannot be beat.  The food was mediocre.   We did the tasting menu.  The lobster bisque was strange.  The "bisque" was heavily laden with all spice.  It really wasn't a good flavor for lobster.  I had the pork belly which was good.  My husband had the scallop which was really good.  The surf & turf was OK.  I do recommend upgrading to the lobster.  It was a full lobster tail.  The shrimp were overcooked and rubbery.    The dessert was tasty but we were too full from the meal to really enjoy it.  The service was excellent but it couldn't make up for the food.  I'd go for drinks and the view.

ldl2R26yP-4xq0BAGkKz6g.text: Top of the world is one of those places that would only be successful in a handful of cities around the world, and thanks to the tourists, Vegas is one of them. Set atop the stratosphere, a mid grade somewhat and outdated downtown hotel and casino, the property is kinda lost in a stretch of the las vegas strips no mans land. The back of the property is easily one of the citied worst and most dangerous neighborhoods.... As seen on COPS on fox. That being said, at the top of the towering hotel ( it easily is by far the tallest building in the vegas skyline ) lies a revolving restaurant topped off with an unrelated group of thrill rides and observation deck. The food at the restaurant is fair and executed competently, but in a town with such a plethora of great dining experiences, this place falls far short of being worthy a visit for fine dining. The experience of this place lies not in the food but in the location, as a high speed elevator will speed you to the top to seat you in its revolving dining room. Huge slanted windows gives a great view of the city as a whole and is a neat gimmick but does not compensate for the seemingly old and outdated furnishings accompanied by average food making this a tourist trap at its best.

JR4N7Xxrooi_7z7NHD43XQ.text: I was torn between 4 and 5 stars, but I Settled on 4  First off, this is an awesome place to take a date, as it really is one of a kind in regards to the design. The glass panels aren't exactly romantic, but the view definitely is.   I expected the food to be decent and to be paying for the view, but that wasn't exactly the case. I had the Steak and Crab Cake combination as my entree and it was fantastic. I go medium and the steak was just red enough to be flavorful, without the sinewy raw taste you get when its undercooked in the middle. The sauce was great and the portabello mushroom underneath was a great pairing. My GF had the Chicken which she thought was very good (not amazing, but good). We shared the ahi tuna salad which was very nice as well.   Our waiter (I forgot his name, but he had short dark hair). was awesome. The entire meal he was helpful and always there to check up on us. The sommelier was very helpful in helping us pick our half bottle of whine and understood we were on a budget of sorts.   Overall, the food was great if not fantastic, however, at nearly 200 bucks after tip, I can't give it 5 stars for great food, it would have to be some of the best I have had.   Again, great place to take a Date

Knrl1QsRM7bZXwi8zJOFZA.text: this place is awsome, the whole dining area rotates around the whole top of the tower, it does a full circle in 120 minutes. the food was awsome, be careful though when ordering appetizers. some of them are raw meat like the kobe beef and salmon starters. but other then that the rib eye I say that it was the best meat I ever had in my life and my GF had the Surf and Turf, she said "the meat just melts in your mouth"  the desert we had was called the berry blast I think and it was awsome. I rate this place 5 stars. our waiter he was awsome, he was very friendly.

5GZOwXHfUdeXhc2hkCBsdA.text: My husband the not so interested in food guy really wanted to come here. I figured ok it will be cheesy and expensive but he wants to go so ... I was so pleasantly surprised! I could almost pass on gambling in Vegas to just go to restaurants so you could understand how this wasn't at the top[ excuse the pun} of my list. The view was amazing, the food was perfectly cooked and really good and the service was excellent! Even the security guard before you get on the elevator was friendly. I had the escargot [ haven't had them in years} and a rack of domestic lamb that was delicious.  I think for the most part you want to get in the hotel, go up to the restaurant and get out.  The hotel is a little rough around the edges but I can't say enough about the restaurant.

fgHWyuMg0CujrH8wo2kFgg.text: On December 15th I ate a beet salad and got food poisoning.  This was my 2nd time eating here, and needless to say, it was a big dissappointment.  It has taken a week to recover.  My first experience here, last May, was a good one.  This time it was mediocre service and the food poisoning was awful.  They need to know and take care to not serve tainted food and make sure their food handlers are clean and observing proper procedure. Food is pricey for what you get.

6f8cX52wnTrsYbvz4NXMKw.text: If you are looking for an amazing dinner to celebration something special or treat yourself, this was it.  Amazing views, delicious food, and great ambiance.  It is definitely on the pricey side, but you get what you pay for.  I highly recommend making reservations, and it was worth the extra 20 minute wait to sit by the window.  We enjoyed watching those on the rides and especially the bungee jumpers flying by the windows!

18u3TLzRMy1_VW1LGgsV1A.text: You should get a reservation but they will except walk in's. The seafood stack is amazing and presented so classy. The crab legs were huge and juicy. We have been there a few times when visiting Las Vegas and will go back.

Y0g4g7tk4YUhmgfgTXfAxA.text: Amazing! My Hubby took me here for my 30th BDAY what a rememberance of my Birthday! The food was so yummy! Worth the price, try and spread your meal out so you get to rotate completely around the strip! fun times and romantic!

pXOzYMoVj1MF1Lgk4Z4x2g.text: one of the only places that I could eat at while in Vegas.  I am not a fan of Las Vegas at all, but this restaurant has excellent food.  nice wine, and fantastic views.

MGTT-aN8fvWMv1XsBlzKXg.text: I go to Top of the World every time I'm in Vegas.  It is a special outing for me and a way to treat friends or family who have gone out of their way for me or just to share the experience of good food, beautiful view, breath-taking fun of watching the bungee jumpers jump from the top and elegant atmosphere.  The tiny desserts are a perfect way to share in an indulgence and end the meal.  Love the place!

yqv__y7ptuYa8HlW4IyWwg.text: the view was amazing.... the food was really just okay...  the dessert.. HORRIBLE... it was really hard and yucky... i regret doing this but i admittedly ordered the uber touristy stratosphere shaped dessert... boy was that a bad decision. the outside tasted like a rock with bits of old hershey bar .. the inside was like a dried up truffle--which sounds like an oxymoron but isnt if you know what i mean..    but i was pretty happy.. i had champagne and blue skies.... i could've been eating the deformed left over crablegs at the bottom of the buffet tray and still been happy...

ARYoRe-I6YMlv0uSdg3F0A.text: airport-like security screening at base of tower is odd. service is cheerful and professional; yet nothing unique about the bland cafeteria like uniforms for such an expensive restaurant.  drinks are not memorable; lunch is best option for the value. one of the best hamburgers for lunch; great room for seeing the city from above.

GYkfDgFPT5ik6m2FAV3TZQ.text: We went to the Top of the World at sunset.  The view was incredible.  Nothing compares to it.  The restaurant rotates ever to slightly, so you dont really feel it moving, but get to see incredible views of the city over the course of about an hour.  There was nice music from the lounge above and dim mood lighting and candles...very romantic and elegant.  The service was outstanding as well.  Very attentive waitstaff!  The food was out of this world.  The BEST food my husband and I have ever eaten, hands down!  They start by bringing you a warm bread basket with fresh bread, rolls and crispy pita style bread.  It is paired with four or five different flavored butter spreads....melt in your mouth delicious.  We ordered salad before the main course (everything is a la cart making it very pricey- our tab for 2 dinners, 2 salads 2 beers, 1 soda and 1 dessert to share was $200, but well worth it).  I had the market greens salad, which came out looking like a work of art with cucumbers formed into a bowl holding fresh field greens and a really delicate tasting balsamic vinaigrette.  My husband had a lettuce wedge with this amazing bacon crumbled on it...tasted nothing like you can buy at the store.  For the main course I had seafood pasta...I expected lots of noodles, heavy sauce and little sea food.  I was mistaken.  Every bite was loaded with the freshest best lobster, scallops and prawns I have ever tasted.  The sauce was phenomenal as well.  The portion was so huge I could only finish about half of it.  My husband had filet and muskovey duck.  It came with a yam puree and he also ordered bok choy on the side.  His was sooo yummy as well.  The filet was so tender and cooked to perfection.  For dessert we had a lemon bar cheese cake. It was beautifully, artfully prepared and was far better than any cheesecake Ive ever had..anywhere!  Top of the World is a MUST when you are in Vegas.  I cant wait to go back, just so I can go here again!

OCQNiGs-8sWtAxLZxaw3IQ.text: This was a very nice dining experience.  I would have rated The Top of the World a '5', but we had to ask for things repeatedly a couple of times and at this level of dining, a '5' means 'perfect'.  We arrived about ten minutes prior to our reservation and were told that reservations were running about 15 minutes behind.  We took the opportunity to go up to the level 107 observation deck and watch some of the less faint-of-heart partake in the thrill rides there.  The time passed quickly and we were called for our table.  The maitre d' introduced himself to everyone in the party and gave a tour, providing the history of the restaurant, on the way to our table.  There are no bad seats in this restaurant.  Every table has an incredible view and the restaurant makes a 360 degree rotation in two hours.  The staff was very helpful, particularly the sommelier who gave us an interesting history on our favorite vineyard and associated wine labels.  The four course tasting menu was a hit for our party of four.  We enjoyed the accompanying wine flight in addition to our bottle of Joseph Phelps cabernet sauvignon.  The lobster bisque, crab cakes, sea bass and the fillets were incredible. The experience lasted over two hours allowing us a little more than one full rotation of the restaurant.  I highly recommend Top of the World.

Cjp8F6AZoLhScmoJOuLJEg.text: Hands down, the best view of Las Vegas. The restaurant boasts a spectacular revolving view of the city from the 107th floor of the Stratosphere Tower. As you might have guessed, it is very expensive but well worth it. The food and service was excellent as well as the view.  I had the Chilean Sea Bass which was breaded in something really good -- the fish was the moistest! (Shout out to my new friend Christian, heehee). Also ordered green beans on the side, excellent as it was all buttered up. Had a glass of Pinot Gris to accentuate the flavors. But the best thing I think I have ever tasted ever was the dessert - White Chocolate Macademia Nut Creme Brule... absolutely flawless. Enough said.

A3uaJc308JRTC-y3V3sMwQ.text: Truely the best view in Vegas, good food and nice service.  Not they even offer 50% off your entree if you reserve at tix4tongiht.

_PymUFYzKw9FZutKUbDnJQ.text: This restaurant has the most spectacular view but that is where spectacular stops.  We live in town and had family visiting from Canada last weekend and we went there for what we hoped would be a great dining experience.  The "arrival" experience was very strange - after checking in with a very unfriendly lady at a podium in the main casino, we went thru a metal detector and then squashed in an elevator with a ton of other people.  We then had to check in again and were told to wait as we were early - no offer of "would you like to go to our lounge" or anything.  The people were completely indifferent and at this stage had we not had guests I would have already left.  When we asked we were told yes we have a lounge it's upstairs and was given a pager to carry that would alert us when we had to return in a 4/5 star restaurant???  We walked upstairs and had to find a table - no one to greet you - the table was filthy and had a ton of trash underneath.  Two waitresses showed up and wiped the table with a very wet rag and left it wet!!!  We ordered drinks after which we were told it was happy hour but not for beer or wine - what???  Of course the pager went off before we got our drinks and had to settle the check there before we could go downstairs - why couldn't it be transferred???  We also had to carry our drinks downstairs ourselves - not very impressive.  We sat down and yes the view s superb BUT waiter was barely even interested that we sat down - menu was OK but extremely over priced for what we got.  I wanted the lamb but wanted it plain and not with the Moroccan spices and was told NO we can't do that - WHAT???  I am just not getting the NO can do attitude here.  All of our entrees came with NO vegetables at all, the lamb had a spoonful of rice and the salmon and spoonful of salad.  For a $300 check with no appetizers or dessert, two glasses of wine and a beer they will not get this local resident back.  Very disappointing and why as a local we just don't bother with these type of restaurants, they just assume you are a tourist, won't be back and treat you accordingly.  Very sad.

6WwnYAPvEtBeGaIm9lAfpQ.text: My boyfriend took me here on a Friday night for a romantic dinner.  At first I was a bit skeptical since the Northern end of the strip is outdated compared to the rest, but I was surprised when I saw the restaurant on the top of the stratosphere.  I'm from San Francisco, so I loved the idea of the rotating dining area, the one at the SF Hyatt closed down a couple years back, so I was nostalgic.  :)  The view was amazing, the food was great, but I deduct a star for the service.  The service was not bad, BUT the service was not 5-stars.  I don't know if it is the location of the restaurant, but the staff definitely did not look like the normal "VEGAS" staff personnels you see near the center of the strip.  However, the food was amazing and I loved my time here with my boyfriend.

zUJmNrtr1IRejNwV0MvDQw.text: Great food & great view.  Would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Vegas.  Something you wouldn't be able to do anywhere else.

rVMMyhbh3jTr170KMsd-qw.text: We went to Vegas for my daughters 21st Birthday and happen to be staying at the Stratosphere Hotel so i decided to make reservations at there fancy restaurant not knowing how very, very pricey they are. Did not realize that the dinner menu was a-la-cart. Every individual item had a separate price. Our bill for 4 people was $250.00. The view was nice but really not worth that kind of price. The food portions were good and the taste was just okay. I do not think they wait on you hand and foot though for as much as you pay.

_rifEjwUXgwbIAAxm45TjA.text: This restaurant has some pretty good food and the atmosphere was lovely. There is a nice view of the city and the restaurant revolves 360 degrees in about one hour. There is an higher area to sit if your are motion sensitive. The crab cakes were seared perfectly to give a nice crust and were moist on the inside. The lobster bisque flavor was somewhat off, however cumulatively everything was good. The presentation of the food combined with the atmosphere and service makes this place a winner!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Bisque
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loaded Twice Baked Potato
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Lump Crab Cake

GPPeza1HZHhRASo-KkrqEQ.text: Top of the World Restaurant has the BEST view in Vegas. Period. But now, the best view is complimented with gourmet dining experience thanks to executive Chef Pawan Pinisetti's fresh new menu.  We tried for lunch and dinner and both were amazing. For less than $50, their 3 course lunch menu is a great deal. This is a revolving restaurant and a full circle takes about 1 hr 20 mins. The restaurant is very accommodating to dietary choices. Being vegetarian, I had quite a few choices. The warm spinach salad was made without bacon vinaigrette and was substituted with balsamic which was excellent.  For main I had their spaghetti squash with seasonal vegetables which was delicious. The chef also made this amazing pasta (which he calls a vegetarian's take on steak) served with mushrooms and horseradish cream, it was fantastic! Hubby tried Maryland crab stuffed chicken served over red pepper romesco, beautifully presented, chicken was extremely tender. They do also serve kids size steak (not on the menu) which my boys devoured.  I am not a fan of mashed potatoes, but these are a MUST try, so simplistic and yet so flavorful.  Now the best part... DESSERT!!! Being a chocolate fan, I tried the 21 layer chocolate cake which was decadent.  I highly recommend their baked Alaska. It's a trio of strawberry, brownie and cookies&cream ice cream, streusel crumble, that is covered in meringue that's flambe at the table.. it's sooo good!!  If you dine at Top of the World, you also get complimentary access to the indoor and outdoor viewing lounge :)

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maryland crab stuffed chicken
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti squash with seasonal vegetables
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruschetta

gr-VyiPf-VM2P4axwwpkug.text: This place was INCREDIBLE. My boyfriend and I were visiting Las Vegas for my birthday weekend and we decided to go here for my birthday dinner. Our server was amazing and happy to serve us. Our orders came out in a very nice timely manner. The appetizers were perfect, the steaks were SO tender and mouth watering, our sides were wonderful and the drinks were awesome. To sum it up our food and drinks were EXCELLENT! The dining area is atop a very slowly moving platform that helps give everyone a BEAUTIFUL view of the city from above.  We loved it and would recommend it to anyone who visits Las Vegas for sure! If you come here get ready to spend some money lol.  Side note: Any "dress code" they have is not strictly enforced.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak + mashed potatoes
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilled Shrimp Cocktail + drinks

b_XZKeK0F3RhUrYonEipSw.text: We had dinner reservation last night at 8:15, didn't get seated till after 9pm  We had to ask 3 times for bread as we were very hungry and did not received our first course till after 10pm and main after 10:30. One person ordered caprese salad and had kale on it instead of basil and later the other person had the but ends only of tomatoe on hers. Anther person ordered ahi tuna and could not eat it because it was too salty. We were all disappointed and we were told they had 1000 reservations.  Well we will not be back

NTEzC9AYuc9XOcf6dEgaIQ.text: Delicious  wait staff were incredible! Highly recommend the steak and lobster! Perfect for our anniversary

CoNRMn_aAuFrkrfBzSyy9Q.text: Where do I start... We went to this restaurant back in July expecting the best of the best! Unfortunately, it was the opposite...  Obviously, when you are about to pay $300 dollars for two you would expect the best service out there especially for it being in Vegas. but it wasn't all there.   Prior to going to the Top of the World restaurant, we checked the Yelp photos of the menu and somewhat decided on what we wanted to have that evening. We wanted a cheese platter to start, unfortunately, they did not have that on their new menu. The server told us they were in a period of transition since they had switched chefs. He hyped up the new chef and said he has been on the food network multiple times. We definitely were excited to hear about this. When we told our server that we had seen a cheese platter being offered at this restaurant online, he tried to accommodate us as well as possible. He went to the cafe and was able to get us the cheese platter. Honestly, that was the best part of this whole dining experience!  We had a selection of three cheeses, fruits on the side, some good bread, and a real piece of honeycomb that we devoured! next we ordered a french onion soup, It was alright. It seemed cheaply made and not with the best ingredients. It was overly salted as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion soup, bread basket, and cheese platter

goQ1pK3a8TF2G8vsW5EbWA.text: To sum this up quickly, you're paying for the views not the food. I've been here for dinner before but today my review is mainly focused on my recent trip for lunch. Service is quick and pleasant, views are great. Ordered the lobster bisque and the chopped salad for starters, with lobster Mac and cheese and a burger for the main course. We also split a bottle of wine.  Lobster bisque was probably the worst cup I've ever had in my life and I honestly shouldn't have ate the thing and sent it back but I didn't want to get our meal off to a bad start. The chopped salad was some how too salty according to my friend. Truffle burger is literally just a regular burger. 3 people at the table all ordered the same burger, same medium-well. Each burger was cooked differently. The lobster Mac and cheese was made with some sort of shell pasta that clumped together and didn't absorb the sauce well. The sauce was also mediocre.   Service and table staff were great. My two star review solely reflects the quality of the food.   I don't usually go in that hard on places like this, but this is Vegas and whoever is running this place needs to update this establishment ASAP.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k9mO82M0c_LHNtLvbujhpw.text: I will say straight up, I have never thought highly of The Stratosphere and never come anywhere near it when I'm in Vegas. However, on a recent trip "The Strat" started upping their marketing game. Their ads were all over. Apparently there is a total rebrand going on that includes massive upgrades to everything - rooms, the restaurant, etc. Oh, okay... the view, let's try it.   Valet was easy. The Strat is striving to be better than the same old run down Stratosphere I remembered. Not saying I'm starting here, but the marketing did get us to try Top of the World for dinner. Easy ride up. Rotating view that takes about 40-45 minutes to see it all while you enjoy the meals. Simple classic menu with great steaks. Attentive but not intrusive service. Dinner was great! Also includes ability to check out the observation decks, that you otherwise pay for. I would come back for sure. Next time we may try the lounge upstairs but dinner is not out of the question.  Well done, Strat. Your marketing got me here when I otherwise never would have come. We enjoyed it and had a nice dinner. Not a bad night out in Vegas at all pre-gambling.

xwQ2cVa7hb6S8jiZ9kH_iw.text: Top of the World was a really fun experience! I was not aware of the fact that we would be moving while eating but it was really fun and barely noticed it. Our server Patrick was amazing and patient with us. I ordered the Australian skirt steak - medium rare with the potatoes, and one of my friends had salmon which was delicious! I like the place, my only qualms are with how very dark it is. However, my steak was delicious, the potatoes were amazing. I paired my steak with champagne and not red wine, which was a good decision for the garlic potatoes. Not sure I'd ever come back, but it was definitely a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aha tralian Wagyu Skirt Steak* Potato Purée
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YCMKYrOxPdfGDVh1QDI1lQ.text: My love and I went to Top of the World for Valentine's Day. I'm a Vegas local, but have never been to the top of the Stratosphere before. I loved the view and the fact that the restaurant rotates.   As for the food, I have mixed feelings. The bread could've been better for such an exoensive restaurant. We had been gifted groupons for the 4-course meal, so chose from the selective menu.   I had the following: lobster bisque (delicious), crab cake ('meh'...not a fan), the filet mignon and shrimp (the shrimp was average, the steak was absolutely fantastic--flavorful, insanely tender, and perfectly cooked at medium well), and, for dessert, the caramel creme brulee (pretty good, but I've had better). My boyfriend ordered the same, except he had the pasta in replacement of the crab cake (which I thought was better).   The staff was very friendly, and accommodated my boyfriend (who is in a wheelchair). Overall, the experience is lovely for tourists. The full rotation of the restaurant takes about an hour and a half. We were able to see SkyJumpers bungee off the side of the tower. After/before eating, you also get free access to the bar and outdoor/indoor viewing area for pictures or lounging.   For locals, I'd recommend a different restaurant for a pricey, fine-dining meal--such as a steak house or the like--where they pride themselves on the food alone. However, for tourists, this experience and view can't be beat.

46as9x9ROfeZT640mxiR0g.text: A view from the Top of the World restaurant.  Perfect place to have an elegant dinner date. The Helicopters are practically inches away. The restaurant rotates and you can see a 360 degrees view of Las Vegas. Their 4 course menu is perfect. The Salmon dish melts in your mouth. Food was excellent and service was great. It's a bit pricey but totally worth it.  There is a Groupon discount you can get if you dine on Sundays-Thursday.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nR0LB11EGJeDyuD5egkEow.text: EXCELLENT! What a wonderful venue. The best views of LV in my opinion, and you get to enjoy it while you eat! Afterwards, head up to the observation deck for some great pictures.  The food was great, although it's not the best in LV. My main complaint is that I feel that the filet mignon could have been a bit better. I would've liked something closer to a Ruth's Chris version, but that's just my preference and I'm not going to dock them for that. It was still a great steak, and the king salmon was perfect. Great cocktails and service as well. I was worried that this place will be all about the view and not food, but I was pleasantly surprised to find out that they pretty much nail both.   Easy to access, free parking and valet service. Overall a wonderful spot for a special night. I would recommend this as your first stop in Vegas. It really leaves you with a great experience to ride out the rest of the trip on.

rQ5jtrc8zxDwT4ewgClQpg.text: Well here's the thing. The food here was nothing to write home about. You come here for the view. The drinks weren't great either. I kind of suspected this is how it would be, but I made a reservation because I didn't actually know you could just come up the bar above instead (and you will need a reservation in order to be allowed up and into to the restaurant). Next time that's what I'll do and that's what I recommend. But it is nice to have a table close to the window. A unique experience.   I also somehow had no idea that the restaurant rotated! So now you're warned. THE RESTAURANT ROTATES.   You get a full 360-degree view of Vegas from up here in an hour and 20 minutes, I think. If you get queasy easily maybe it'll cause you some issues. It took us a while to get used to, that's for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aJUKzz6Q0ARohJAIGmQguA.text: Im adding 3 stars for the view experience because the service and the food it doesn't apply! We order a tuna tartare and it was ok but with a lot of grease, then we ordered 2 salads cause it's easy to do! When the Ceaser Salad came I couldn't stop laughing, the chicken was raw and it has skin, that was so gross! Who can not do a good salad?  The other salad the taste was awful!! We couldn't eat it! It was sooo disappointed!  The service was so slow! And the drinks so expensive if you wanna something more strong! Bad experience!

lpJqu3vzvMtDYM60CTUTAQ.text: I visited this restaurant with a few friends to celebrate a birthday. The ride up to the top floor was a little leery, the elevators move fast once they get going. The restaurant is on the 106th floor and has a revolving floor. The hostesses and waiters and staff are all very friendly.   All of the food we ordered ( in clueing the brown bread they bring to the table) was amazing! In all we ordered: crab cakes, brussel sprouts, asparagus, green beans, potatoes, mushrooms, and bananas foster. The highlights were : mushrooms (impeccably flavored), crab cake, and bananas foster.   Additionally, this restaurant has a great view of the city. I would definitely recommend this restaurant when visiting Vegas.

2nUmfI1JG0I80DHKFpcO7g.text: It was my sister's birthday and I went over and beyond to ensure she had a great weekend and she was great UNTIL we arrived at this place. From the indifferent staff at the 2nd check in to the 1 hour wait to get drinks(coke and water) to having to wait another 30 minutes just to speak with a manager. At that point I had enough. It's unfortunate that a restaurant I loved so much turned out this way this time.  Message to the top of the world: incentivize your staff because they all seem like they don't wanna be there. I get it was memorial weekend and it was a late dinner but I'd rather be told I can't be served than to take me in and make me wait hours for service.   Just terrible. The manager was completely empathetic and professional so the 2 stars are for him but everything else was less than ordinary tonight.

D0e9z7DphHPyMzbWsnRmTA.text: Spectacular!! Fine dining at its best! Oysters for appetizer yummmm! Give me more plz! Mango Maggie? Fruity but not overly sweet cocktail??? Sign me up! Yes plz! This drink is totally worth it! Harris Ranch Filet cooked medium was so p PERFECT! I repeat PERFECTO! Dessert NY Cheesecake was sooo creamy, smooth, yummm im so glad i had it. Being a native New Yorker, this Cheesecake is beyond words i can explain. Of course is more on the higher end on your spending criteria, but if you appreciate the view and watch the sunset its really amazing.  My waitress was sweet and kind, loved her service!

LZSIt2ClDzujMN9zfIujNw.text: A nice and wonderful fancy restaurant with a great view. I loved the atmosphere and the ambiance of the restaurant. The food was pretty good I ordered the salmon which was cooked very well the only issue I had was that it wasn't seasoned that well but was still enough to eat. The lobster Mac and cheese on the other hand was amazing and definitely a great side dish to compliment the salmon. I enjoyed the old school 90s R&B music they had playing in the background as well. Definitely worth going to if you are in the Strat Hotel in Vegas.

tZXF2qle51MCHAcnnfCfQA.text: Awesome Restaurant, Views, Food and Staff.  Everyone one that we encountered from the elevator to the restaurant staff all were gracious and professional.  We need to give a shout out to our waiter "Joseph"!!! He was so good, intelligent knowledge on all the food selections and so darn polite!!!  If he is there when you go, ask for him as your waiter, you will not be disappointed.  I attached a couple photos of our dinner.

Kkd7W3Xxx9C2A-lg8oKhpA.text: This is the only "tourist trap" restaurant that I can say was absolutely amazing. First of all, I don't understand why it's not busier. The place turns and you notice how the scenery changes. Most importantly, the food is amazing! The huge shrimp cocktail, the delicious and juicy steak, and my hubby rely enjoyed their salmon. I think that if you are ever in vegas, then you owe it to yourself to try this place. This place is not as expensive as it appears to be and is an line with all of the other spots on the strip.

QjBORaJ4f5UVI4XILvoN_w.text: Best views of the Las Vegas Strip!   Excellent all the way around! Top notch dining & drinks!

GjuUsEzs-FQEFIcE_wJcXA.text: Seeking to surprise my wife and son for Mother's Day , May 12, 2019, I took them to the Too Of the World for their Mothers Day Brunch. Usually a favorite place to go. However on this special day, my wife ordered a Cosmopolitan which she did not like. The only person in the immediate area was a bus boy named "GENE". My wife said excuse me, and GENE turned around and said, "Yeah? What do you want? While these words may sound innocent enough, his tone conveyed a level of disrespect that totally caught me off guard.  We played it off and she explained that she was not happy with her drink. (She is a bartender). We were not seeking free food or services, only a drink replacement. At that time, our server returned and GENE told her "She doesn't like her drink" in an equally annoyed tone. The waitress pleasantly took the drink and replaced it also removing it from our bill.  I don't like creating issues but GENE'S attitude towards my wife on this special day bothered me greatly. (Imagine if you took your wife out and this happened, what would you say or how would you feel?) I listened to the way Gene addresses other customers and he spoke to them in a manner that I expected my wife to be spoken to. I began to feel that the fact that my family is mixed race may have impacted his attitude toward us. I told our waitress about the situation and asked to speak to the manager. She told me that she did not know the bus-boys name and he was not on her team. I told her that I really didn't care whose team he was on. She got The manager and I explained the situation to him and he told me he would "talk to GENE". That was it, no apology for the situation, nothing else. This gave me the impression that the manager didn't care either. He did talk to Gene for about two minutes after which GENE returned to his duties as usual occasionally starring at me occasionally. The only reason I left a 15% tip which is half what I usually do is because the server was not the the offending person. Way to kill a special occasion.

pjglYYwxzsS0307y3zEwQw.text: Came here to celebrate a birthday and it was beautiful to see the day turn to night! The top slowly gives you a 360 pano view of Las Vegas - I had the filet mignon and it was perfection!   If you're lucky you'll see an occasional bungee jumper :)

FEXJmGJzCaiaZynKVz7tig.text: This review is for the experience of the restaurant. Out of most of the places I been to in Vegas this is thus far the best bang for the buck!  Everyone told me to check out the stratosphere for the views and the food was just ok. I beg to differ! The food was great, and so was the service! When you get to the stratosphere you get on an elevator which seems to take forever, which is understandable when you look up from the ground level from the outside LoL! When you reach the restaurant level, you are greeted by security, and then the front desk directs you to either the observation deck, or the restaurant. The restaurant overlooks all of Vegas! The restaurant actually rotates at a speed of 3 mph. Not that fast but you can soak in all the views from different angles!   As we enter the dining room we take our seat by the window. We were given a delectable bread basket with 3 different butters! Yumm-O! The great news is they have a three course pre-fix! You get soup, surf n turf, and dessert for $50 per person. To start off we had the lobster bisque. It was great, it had that nice sherry taste, and also some chunks of lobster. It was really good! For the surf n turf it was a filet & lobster tail. Both were cooked perfectly. Both were tender and delicious. The nice part, the lobster was served with REAL butter! Then, the best for last, dessert! For desert you get a mini creme brulee, and a mini flourless chocolate cake. Again, Yumm-O! So just when you thought your experience here couldn't be any more epic, when you dine in the restaurant you get to visit the observation deck for free!!! If you are in Vegas and walking the strip I highly suggest visiting here, it is so worth it! This place will not have your head spinning, that's what the restaurant is for!

0-6VcaDKvCjGGU_0NKNhGw.text: Visited this restaurant when we were in Vegas and the view was amazing. You really don't even realize you are moving until you look at the view and you are somewhere completely different. I give it a 4 star because I feel that for the price the food could be better. I had filet and lobster tail with potato puree with fontina cheese and everything was good, just not amazing. Definitely somewhere to visit for the experience.

YWwTqMw9lmmL0hOHT8ot3Q.text: We celebrated our Wedding dinner on the 4th of July and we were accommodated exactly where I had requested via Open table.  Our server Jeanine was incredible!!  Attention to detail.  She treated us with respect and dignity (same sex couple).  And so did the floor manager.   The views are beautiful as the restaurant rotates 360.  The food was delicious, tender and filling.  No complaints. Excellent place to have lunch or dinner for a special occasion. A la Carte menu.  ADVICE:  show up at least 30 minutes before your dinner time.  Reservations will be held for an additional 20 minutes only. The restaurant is on the 106th floor, so you have to wait in line then board the elevator.  Get to the restaurant on TIME don't be late for your meal appointment.    CONS:  Bring your ID card. My spouse and I were carded by the bartender at the bar on the 107th floor where we waited until we got our table.  We walked away instead.   Other than that, we enjoyed our stay. Well worth it!

8Ozo-NARfIcsJEm7KV8dRw.text: The atmosphere and experience was amazing. When calling for reservations, Christina was so pleasant and our window seating was beautiful. Our server Courtney was fabulous and despite being vegan was still able to find option to choose from. Would lightly recommend this restaurant!!

UcSJGJ46px4Wqhd44t3dkg.text: I went for New Years Eve and it was very cramped, music too loud where you couldn't hear the person next you, and a lot of ghetto and trashy people which I thought it was going to a professional and clean adult event!

2G_w3g2Nt-nDurV4bwi91Q.text: First of all I want to start of by saying that the food was good but everything else was not so great. We dined here with a party of 12 on Saturday, August 3, 2019. Our reservation was for 6:30pm. Per their instructions, we arrived 15 minutes early to find that they only had one elevator working. we waited approximately 30 minutes to finally get an elevator to the restaurant. Needless to say we couldn't all fit on the elevator so we were about 25 minutes behind on our reservation.   Upon arriving we were greeted by a less that enthusiastic host who was simply reciting a script and gong through the motions . once seated were greeted by our server and she became immediately annoyed that we were still getting settled. this attitude did not get any better throughout the night.  I will say however that the assistant server (Courtney) was such a delight and was far more attentive than our actual server. Kudos to the kitchen as the food was really good, however a bit overpriced but I guess you are paying for the view. I ordered a 2009 Bordeaux from their wine list and was greeted by one of their sommeiliers and told that they didn't have to 2009 and was offered the 2011. this was just fine. We ordered a bottle of 2014 Cabernet next and when another Sommelier came to us he informed us that they didn't have that either and offered the 2015. Please understand this doesn't fall on the sommeliers nut on the GM and Wine Director. you would think in a fine dining restaurant, that they would keep their lists up to date. The photographer also stopped by during dinner to take photos and her attitude was not much better than our servers. She did however do a great job with the photos which we did purchase. at the end of the evening we were presented with a check that included gratuity (we were aware of this ahead of time). I think this is the only time I have ever dined where I didn't feel the server earned that automatic gratuity. I think for what you are going to pay, there are better places to spend your money in Las Vegas. If you want the view go up to the bar or pay for the elevator ride to the observation deck and then go have a nice dinner. kudos to the chefs, Sommeliers and our assistant server for doing their best with what tools they were given.

laxqRVeoJfBHDWb5-BtULA.text: My boyfriend surprised me with dinner at The Top Of the World for our 3 year anniversary. We started our dinner off with amazing bread and 3 different butters. I got the filet for dinner an it literally melted in my mouth. We had a great server and the sommelier was so fun to talk to. We got the Chateau St Michelle cab and it was the best wine I have had in a long time.   I loved that the whole restaurant spun and we got a 360 view of Vegas. It was just like my favorite restaurant in Los Angeles. It was so fun watching everyone jump off the top. I got the chills just watching them jump!!  We are from San Diego and we both keep saying we cant wait to go back to vegas solely for that dinner we had.

3Dt02nL5e-GQI3ldx4nJQg.text: Unfortunately, we didn't get seated until 37 minutes past our reservation. We arrived on time and the hostess didn't bother to tell us of a delay. I asked 20 some mins past our reservation, 9:00, and was told they were still trying to seat 845's.  The hostess team managed the situation poorly. A bit of communication could have changed this all around.  The food was typical for these "top of the x" places - a pretty good steak place. You go for the view.  My steak came medium not med rare.

GBhOECFxVqIp9ENKzHLdxQ.text: La la looove this place! I am always looking for scenic places to dine at since there aren't THAT many options in Vegas... but this place has a spectacular view and amazing looking dishes as well! I love the chicken wing appetizer, ahi tuna cones, and mushroom appetizer from the lounge.

soCEQkq4r36NgZSq5IzZFw.text: Not sure what was my favorite.. the view or the food! We had a reservation at 6:30PM and the sun set around 7PM so it was actually perfect. I'd recommend checking when the sun is setting and reserving a time that fits what kind of a view you'd like during your meal. I feel I got to see the best of both worlds :) I got a seat next to the window and as you eat you get to see not only the strip but also people bungee-jumping off the building! Food is not cheap but its a rotating restaurant in Vegas. We ordered the seafood pasta and the duck. The seafood pasta actually had so much seafood that I couldn't finish all the shrimp!! That never happens.. With little chunks of crab meat hiding inside made every bite enjoyable. The duck was pretty good too! No room for dessert this time.   I would recommend this place for the experience or a special night out!

fKCJta1LBWQJEQkC5dG-UQ.text: We discussed dining here during our 5 day stay in Las Vegas, especially for a special birthday but never made it. On our last day, I was talked into going, I truly didn't want to spend the money at that point or drive to end of strip however we went and I'm truly pleased we did. The drive was nice, parking was easy, made reservation and was seated immediately, server was on point, friendly and pleasant, the view is like no other (be on alert for the sky jumpers on roof top while dining), we ordered the lunch prix fixe menu and it did not disappoint, other menu specials available too. By dining at Top of the World, we were permitted to the observation deck both indoor and outdoor, we saw all of Vegas and observed the folks on the extreme rides. I highly recommend this experience

8YqPhkb4l7yUgZ64BxJr1A.text: Fun experience, I recommend going for lunch not dinner. The food is pretty good and affordable for lunch but way overpriced for dinner. You'll have a great view wherever you sit.

WYipBM9wwFcGhK1T52QC8g.text: Favorite restaurant in Vegas! The 3 course lunch option is amazing! Salad, surf and turf and dessert. You also get free access to the observation deck on the top of the stratosphere.

lpeX3J3NhY7j8jxAbXxvYA.text: It was our favorite restaurant for Birthday's , anniversaries or any excuse for wonderful food.  I'm not sure what happened but the food is not the same .  The halibut was dry, the lobster bisque was too salty and the churrasco didn't have the  same sauce.   I miss the orange butter.  Currently trying other restaurants.

Jyhif-1NQHN2YlPlhujtFg.text: Amazing view!! It's best to go before sunset and stay to see day and night Las Vegas from 106 floor. It's our second time going for a celebration. Tasty food, prices as expected to be in a restaurant, good portion sizes, exceptional service. View and experience worth the money spend.

TLLzz7msRQHdr06U_jNCKw.text: My boyfriend was able to snag a 5:30pm Saturday dinner reservation on the same day. We arrived at 6pm, and they were still able to hook it up with a window table. It's True, place is expensive, and if not for the view- definitely overrated, but you're on the 67890th floor and you get a 360 view of Las Vegas. We scored seeing the city in the daytime, twilight time, sunset, and night time. The floor rotates and the whole rotation takes about 2 hours, which is how long dinner lasted- totes worth it! The service from check in to send off was great- professional, not pretentious, and actually funny.   The menu  is a la cart, but me and my boo did the tasting menu (4 courses). FYI- you can substitute the meat course with lamb chops- yum! The lobster bisque was OK, kinda salty, but Boo Thang loved it. As with any fancy restaurant the portions are small, but you do get full with the tasting menu. I don't know the final price, but Boo Thang said the damage wasn't that bad... for the unlimited time on the rooftop, 360 degree Las Vegas view, food, and drinks you would have spent the same monetary amount at a fancy steakhouse.   I rated this place a 4 because it's a restaurant with no party in my mouth, but the value and experience is definitely worth it!   The Good: 360 degree view of Vegas  Unlimited time on the rooftop   The Bad:  After a romantic dinner, we went up to look at the skyline, two words: Tourist Central.   PS: This place is everybody friendly. The attire is business casual, but it's not strict. We had dinner and we saw a family celebrating a birthday, couple anniversary, and even a wedding reception.

zQMrU4jNkS4XHDNRhOY24w.text: I usually don't write bad reviews, but I want you to be aware of this incident.We went to this restaurant to spend a good time with old friends, but it turned out to be a nightmare. We wasted over $600.00 on dinner, which was OK, but nothing special. After dinner we found out that the guys from valley lost my husband's car keys. We had guests who were late for their flight, so the restaurant provided a cab for them. We had no choice but to stay in Vegas and we couldn't return to LA for our work on Monday and lost our income for the day. However, they charged us the full price for the dinner. When I spoke with the manager Brandon about this matter and requested to get at least a discount for all the inconvenience they caused, he refused saying that he compensated more than enough. NEVER GOING BACK AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

znrxrTjXpjgZUhIJrhNEHQ.text: I went here for my one year anniversary, and overall it was an okay experience.   Pros: -Beautiful View  - If you tell them you don't want to be bothered by the Photographer she won't come near you.  -Decent portion size.  -Free trip up to the observatory  Cons: -The food is meh...  - The price - Atmosphere can be a bit loud due to Lounge 107 on the 2nd floor (balcony) - 25 min. wait for an elevator to the observatory - Super crowded elevators  All in all I would go there again, but only for lunch when the prices are cheaper and the crowds are less rowdy.

nzRVf8CS2XZe7hgGO63nwQ.text: Go for the view and the service, although try to pick a night when 1) the tower isn't swaying in the wind like a ship at sea, and 2) the observation deck isn't booked for a private party.

mZHYveKeOFkyPeDkhVQsqQ.text: I had a wonderful experience . My server was very attentive and friendly . The entree I ordered was delicious . The salmon was cooked to perfection . The view is breathtaking I enjoyed looking over the city .

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful dinner course

WMyD4p9yJvm_QEYuRhAXJw.text: WHAT A VIEW! The view and atmosphere are absolutely amazing and totally worth it :) Rotating restaurant, 106th floor up, top of the stratosphere hotel, definitely offers the best view and experience of vegas I've ever seen. It takes about 1h20m to fully rotate for a complete view; I did feel a little dizzy, I guess it's cause I was sitting anti-clockwise.   Food was alright. New york steak was a bit chewy. Salmon was fine. Lamb rack was exceptionally good.  Their bread, served with 3 different spreads, garlic/orange/ginger, was amazing! We did the wine pairing for an extra 40. It was sooooo good, perfectly goes with our lamb rack and steak :) We also had the grain with four cheese as side dish which was a very nice size and presentation.   Here comes the best part of the meal! Their desserts....omahgawdddd everything was beautifully presented and completly flavorful.   HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!   1.Bananas Foster in a Florentine Box Artisanal vanilla ice cream, foster sauce with myers rum and fresh banana, all served in a caramel almond box  2. Chocolate Duo Duo of mini chocolate pot de creme and mixed fresh berries in a white chocolate cup with vanilla mousseline cream  3. Chocolate Lover's Dream Dark chocolate teardrop shell wrapped around a moist chocolate cake, Grand Marnier and semi sweet chocolate mousse  Our waiter, David, was excellent and knowledgeable about the menu. Service is nice but somehow slow even with all their running around.   Price was reasonable, we spent about $350. Overall, I'd recommend it as a once in a lifetime experience. :)

iStPAW_p26mc7CdeFrZ-8w.text: Been here a lot of time for dinner but this was the first time for lunch. We brought our 3 year old daughter and they treated her so well. She loved it and as always we loved it. Food was excellent although I still miss the chocolate stratosphere dessert :,( Service was wonderful and it was perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian burger for lunch

bKJVov8wOeCxyRfFYeNyGQ.text: This was a great Dinner! The food was great and so was the service, Doug was our waiter and was a real class act! I sat in a booth and thought I was getting the raw deal as the the tables are at the Window. But I think the booths are a lot better because you get to face right outside the revolving restarunt. So I suggest ask for a booth.   I never expect good food at such a cool venue, over 800 feet in the air turning around to see the whole city in 80 minutes. But the food was great, one of the best caesar salads I have ever had and my steak was as good as any high priced steakhouse. The price is also like any high priced steakhouse but the view is priceless.  I only wish my experience below with the hotel customer service at the box office was as good as this restaurant!!! But that is for another time. I highly recommend this  This was a great Dinner! The food was great and so was the service, Doug was our waiter and was a real class act!
