photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Picture from booth looking out at the great view at the Top of the World Restaurant.

RUgV2FowemQK9qCK2svtHw.text: We have been eating at Top of the World for several years now.  I would give it 4.5 stars, but that's not an option.  So, 4 stars it is, because it's not a 5 star place.  As other yelpers note, the Stratosphere is off the beaten path if you are staying in the more crowded part of the strip.  And, it's not a very nice hotel/casino.  But, Top of the World is worth the cab ride.  The restaurant does spin, so if you get motion sickness I would not advise sitting on the outer circle.  I have never sat there because I didn't want to feel motion while I eat.  The lobster bisque is a dish we have ordered on more than one occasion.  It's a very solid representation of this fine dining staple.  Likewise, the crabcakes are large and have a good helping of crab meat, as opposed to some cakes that are mostly filler.  The horseradish crusted ribeye is a definite repeat order.  It's not as large as some of the dinosaur bones you get on the strip at 16 ounces, but it's more than enough and has an excellent kick due to the crust.  The wine list is not vastly extensive, but it's not short either.  Prices are expected given its location.  Service is very prompt, never had an issue in several visits.  After dinner, have a drink or 3 at the bar downstairs and get a great view of the valley.

PPxYW2OwCH4FGVpMQwU7Fg.text: This was such a treat! I was just here for the first time at Christmas time. It's such a spectacular view and the rotating feature gives you a 360 degree view right from your table while you dine. The food was very good. There was not a single thing I had that wasn't good. With the bread, they serve 3 different butters - all wonderful. The lobster bisque was the best I've ever had. If I'm remembering correctly, the friend I went with had been there several times before and had always ordered the duck but it was not on the menu this time. He was really looking forward to having it and was naturally disappointed to find it wasn't on the menu but he did very much enjoy what he ordered instead.  If you haven't been here before while visiting Vegas, it's worth the experience but know it's going to be an expensive night.

sqvDpqlKmyT_8OHJAk-Oig.text: The food is beyond exceptional! The steak & sea bass are what we ordered this time, both mouth watering/melt in your mouth awesome! My teenage son who typically just grunts his acceptance of food that is edible, actually rolled his eyes and said, "oh my god". I was scared at first and asked "what?!" Then he said with his mouth full "this is outstanding... So good..." I'm not sure if there are different staff on the days some of these bad reviews were written, but I'm shocked to read that some people actually feel the food is "inedible". The same thing with the service (which was also exceptional). They're probably the people who complain about everything and nothing is ever good enough for them - we all have one of those relatives. I will say that when compared to other higher quality restaurants, it is still priced about 25 to 30 percent higher than it needs to be, but then again so is everything else in Vegas. At least with food this good, you're not kicking yourself afterward. You pay $50 for a buffet of just regular food, you tend to be grumpy or even regretful. You pay $50 for a steak that is mind blowing, and suddenly it's not that bad. Especially when the staff are SOOOO friendly and totally go above and beyond. I never had to look for our server once! He was all over it, every step of the meal. He sensed my son was struggling with the menu and came over to explain what things were. My son was almost finished with his soda and our server was at the table with a refill before my son took his last sip. My son actually said "woah!" I've never seen a server anticipate every need of a diner before, quite impressive.  It was an excellent experience that I thoroughly enjoyed and will go again when back in town.

n6WbZO_S8WOwpWpeTuKa_g.text: The atmosphere alone is worth this experience. Our server was phenomenal at every moment. We started with a fabulous appetizer - it had amazing tuna and salmon poke, 4 freshly shucked oysters, amazing large chilled shrimp, lobster cocktail and a large king crab leg called the Mosaic of Chilled Seafood. The lobster bisque was next along with a Caesar Salad. The bisque was unique and one of the best we had ever tried with a unique blend of spices that seemed to end with a touch of nutmeg- delicious! The salad was not noteworthy but cold and fresh with a nice Parmesan crisp. I can't forget the bread selection including a Lavosh that was great served with a Orange Ginger, Herb and Regular whipped butters.   We ordered the Lobster Thermidor and I was sadly disappointed upon arrival. It seemed to be a regular lobster tail served alongside what was called a souffle. The souffle had a half inch of bread crumbs on top and my first bite was bland so I passed to Clarence. It was when I looked closely at the lobster that it seemed the Thermidor was missing- who doesn't love those creamy bites of lobster, crab and sherry richness but alas it was missing. We motioned our server who agreed and he whisked it back to be told the chef had incorporated the Thermidor into this souffle. Thankfully he agreed to switch our entree to the Cobia which was nice.   Since we were celebrating our anniversary our server brought a delicious mini chocolate flourless cake with berries. It was just decadent!   Make reservations as the wait for a table was 2.5 hours at 7:30 pm in a Friday. Definitely go and don't hesitate to ask questions as the service was phenomenal. Take advantage of the observation deck along with your meal rather than purchasing a separate ticket too.

fyPEQQU8PZmuzMy0zIT4cg.text: The concept is kinda cool. The restaurant would circle around 360 degrees while you enjoy your lunch/dinner,  giving you that panoramic view. We ordered a 3-course menu with an a la carte foie gras dish. The foie gras was okay but I liked that at Joel Robuchon better. The steak was moist. Of all, the lobster bisque was probably the best dish. The dessert chocolate mousse was quite satisfying. The bf didn't like sweet too much but he really enjoyed it. We also ordered the mango cocktail and it was pretty good also.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their desserts menu
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3vqhMSeAAcUAWV-id8glmw.text: Way overpriced. The "waygu" ribeye was worse than a regular steak I get anywhere. Smothered in sauce. Sea bass was pretty good. Horrible service; had one beverage the entire almost 2-hour experience. Food seemed like it came from a kitchen in another building.

OSwdbDmktirEEuA87nrDCA.text: If your planning to go to Vegas with your significant other and you really want to make an impression this is where you MUST go!!!! I brought my girlfriend here on  our 4 year anniversary witch also happened to be Fourth of July and she still talks about it to this day. What's better than seeing all of Vegas than eating a 5 star dinner while slowly revolving and fireworks cascading inches from you through the window? Service was old school standing waiting to service you at any given moment. Book an appt. though and be sure to ask for a window seat they do there very best to accommodate. Very low lighting and good live music playing on the higher deck so you won't find yourself screaming at each other from across the table. Man do I have my work cut out for me for our 5th anniversary it's going to be hard to top this!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best view of the strip!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. High deck where the on lookers wish they had a table
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table

8NDGHO_TpenX6gc9FuG1Ig.text: A great and amazing view, but lacking taste. The food was mediocre for such an amazing place. The staff was wonderful but the food was our only issue. The steak was not cooked as ordered and he said it wasn't the best steak. I ordered the salmon and it was also over cooked for my taste.  I would not return to the restaurant but will definitely return for the view at the bar.

K0zn8X9g98DGNTSdNIZTgw.text: One of the most expensive dinners we have eaten but SO worth the romantic and scenic experience. We had to have reservations and they treat it like an exclusive club with many "waiting areas" to get in the the dining area. There is plenty of signage guiding you to the restaurant elevator area, which you must check into before climbing aboard.  We went at sunset and were lucky enough to get a raised booth right in front of the kitchen, so our view of Vegas was phenomenal. A visit to the viewing deck was free with your meal as well.   The food was all very well done and the service great. There was a lot of diversity on the staff with workers from a cross the world, which we appreciated. Hubby loved his lobster bisque but was surprised that the lobster was served separately from the bisque. He loved his NY steak and lobster tail. I really enjoyed my salad and seafood fettuccine, although it was so rich and huge that I may order something else if we ever go back. The seafood was all very fresh and tasty. We had a wonderful experience here! At least at dinner, I wouldn't bring children and I would dress at least business casual.

UR7SZBy2fWKCaX9-xW328w.text: Good but overpriced!   Food:   Got the King estate Pinot noir which was very good but $65 and it's normally $30.  Husband got the prix fix menu which was $90.  Lobster bisque was good, scallop was literally 1 scallop.  He got the filet which was large and very good.  It had mushrooms and some sort of sauce on it but it didn't come with any sides.  I got the fettuccini with scallops, shrimp and crab.  It was very good and a large portion.  It was only $55, less than the wine.  Atmosphere and experience: Ok so we made a 7:30 reservation for Sunday night and show up about 15 minutes early to ask for a window seat.  They said there were none available and we would have to wait 45 min to an hour.  We decided to go ahead and take a table instead of wait which I deeply regret.  A couple who were only there for a drink were sat at a large window table 20 minutes after we sat down.  So there are 3 rows of tables in the circle.  The window tables which are 2-4 person tables obviously have the best view.  The second row is only 2 person tables.  The third row are large booths that are round and face the outer windows and there also a level above the first 2 rows.  So we were in the middle row which was the worst.  Service was good.  All in all the food was good but for $250 I want the view.

4DP2G5z6j06N2pol4OTOLw.text: Incredible food. Breathtaking views. One of the best in Vegas.  The experience at Top of the World starts when you board a guided elevator to the top of the Stratosphere tower. Then, you are seated in a slowly revolving tower with views of the entire city. The experience is accentuated by sky divers diving from the top of the tower.  Now the food. I had the chef's tasting menu with the lobster bisque, filet mignon, and chocolate dessert. The bisque tasted authentic and delicious. Filet mignon was amazing. Cooked to perfection with quality meat. Very pleasant and high. Thank you for a wonderful experience.

3q8tCxqwofPyO9Mq9C9WXw.text: This is the kind of  place that you pay premium prices are the setting.  You can't even visit the top of the Stratosphere without paying unless your eating at this restaurant.    Pro's: Location, Location, Location Good Service  Con's:  6/10 gourmet food at 10/10 prices  I had a simple baked fish dish and it was very bland and I could have gotten it anywhere.  We went out with 8 people and it cost over 1000 dollars with drinks.    I would have given this place 1-2 stars but the setting is so spectacular (500 feet high) I have to give it 3 stars.  Very expensive, but you have to go the top of this hotel once in your lifetime.  Even if you don't eat at Top of the World.  Thanks

SvjVevceDBWs_iiRU5984w.text: Awesome!!! Made reservations a week prior for my wife's birthday. As we got there they must of had it noted it was her birthday they took us in right away before other couples. They sat us at a table next to a window for good scenery, the food was amazing. We both ordered the Surf and Turf. Filet mignon and Lobster Tail, the filet mignon was so juicy it cut like butter and the lobster tail was so juicy and soft. Both tasted amazingly delicious, I guess its a True statement "you get what you pay for" for $200 for the both of us I can't say anything negative about our dinner. Great place to take your loved one out to eat for a special night.

bSiyj6htc8X09KK8KObnCg.text: The view is to die for. Total time for a revolution is 80 minutes. The food is what you would expect, very well presented. My only issue is that their New York steak is from Nebraska, I had happened to ask if they can see where it comes from out of curiosity.  The fish of the day was cod and it was mildly flavored with nice crust. Shared side ordered are enough for 2 people to share.

RBW7tFwthCzigGNFuM0e3A.text: Went here in a group of 10 on a Thursday night.  It's a little tricky to find, mostly because you have to walk through many hallways to get to the elevator that takes you up.  Greeted promptly and immediately seated.  Our server and helpers were professional though not really friendly.  Everything is overpriced because that's how everything is in Vegas.  That would be fine, but the food was just ok.  My steak was not that great, and everyone else said the same about their food.  The view is great, but I wouldn't spend the money, because you can have a better meal elsewhere.

35K2GxyY84wTU1l8RxWGlQ.text: This would be a 5 star if not for the manager who treats the customers rudely and does not appreciate locals who spend thousands of dollars there a month and send people in. You can have a reservation for a special day and it will not be honored. The customer is NEVER right. The view, the staff and the food would make it 5 stars....yes the view is magical...

BhVUPf5lOyuWKbfEoIWEZA.text: One of the best restaurant in Las Vegas. Food is great with nice a la carte menu. It has an amazing view from 106 floor, feels like dining on the sky. Great service as well.

do6sPuHLdkq6NlKCJhrhhg.text: Weekday night, loud birthday party upstairs, but the food and the view make you forget other distractions. Our waiter, John, was superb in every regard. Food was outstanding. All in all, experience was breathtaking! P.S.: the "skydivers" leaping from outside past your windows is startling at first.

78lVppz88JTfbcQoosJzHw.text: Decided to come here with the boyfriend since we were staying a night at the Stratosphere, and couldn't help but notice how fun this restaurant looked.  We were able to get a reservation for 8:45pm on a Sunday night, but beware, it's going to take you at least 15 minutes to get seated after you make the trek from the first reservation stand to your table via the elevator.  I felt like I was in a line at Disneyland's Tomorrowland, except I was hangry.  They only let ten people in the elevator at a time, and there was some large party going on at the top of the Stratosphere, thus... a long wait to get to the top.  Once you get the the 108th floor, you have to wait another several minutes in a line of guests waiting to be seated.  I will say, once you are seated, and you see the view, the mood gets better.  The restaurant slowly turns 360 degrees so that you get views of all of Vegas.  I started with the lobster bisque, which was quite a large portion.  Loved the fresh chunks of chilled lobster in the middle.  Boyfriend didn't get a starter.  We were too hooked on their bread with three different butters (regular, honey, and PESTO).  Then, more waiting ensued.  We weren't in a major rush, but we did have to make it back to our hotel room by 10:30pm to meet our group for the rest of the night's activities.  Something had to be going wrong in the kitchen, because we heard tables around us complaining about the wait for their food, even one guest completely cancelling everything and asking for the bill.  My boyfriend and I started getting antsy because we didn't want to have to rush through our entrees when paying that much for a meal.  Our server was literally no where to be found for a majority of the meal, not even when my boyfriend's wine glass was empty.  We would see him pop up now and then, but it was so clear that he was avoiding our table because he KNEW the wait for our next course was getting ridiculous.  It wasn't until my boyfriend got up to complain to one of the bussers and then flagging down the server, did he address the issue.  The entrees came out shortly after.  I ordered:  Pan Seared Foie Gras (cocoa nib fleur de sel, seasonal chutney, balsamic reduction, toasted bioche): Being a Californian, of course I order foie gras when I'm in Vegas!  This was delicious, though a smaller portion than I've received at other restaurants.  The chutney paired very well with the foie.  Organic Australian Wagyu Filet Carpaccio (parmesan reggiano, white truffle sea salt, potato gaufrettes): This dish was a bit of a let down.  The amount of wagyu served was minuscule, especially when compaired to the parmesan reggiano, and they went way overboard on the sea salt.  I could mainly taste cheese and salt.  My boyfriend ordered the Prime New York Steak with peppercorn sauce, cooked medium rare, and a side of Yukon Gold Mashed Potatoes.  No complaints there.  If steak and potatoes are involved, he's happy.  Getting back down to the lobby level was a bigger pain in the a$$.  Elevators kept stopping on the 108th floor, but then would say they are only going up.  It took us at least another 15 minutes to get back downstairs.  Take about a buzzkill to start the rest of the night off.  Overall, Top of the World gets an A++++ for the view and experience, but the service and mediocre food didn't really justify the cost.

AU2lXGlTmcbvoOHyJBhe8Q.text: View was nice. Food was just ok. Ribs on the burger (yes, actual ribs) were dry and hard to choke down. Good service.

bWTOg8UvCKbuVJ53AvFz4w.text: You can't eat atmosphere, but the TOTW wants to charge you for it.   The view is unbeatable, no question. The waitstaff was very good. Considering the price we paid, the food had all the panache of a suburban country club.

U7JOA0eMmTUT06evheIxLw.text: My boyfriend and I decided to eat here for dinner after seeing the stratosphere for a free local event. We made reservations through open table with no problems. We got there and were seated immediately by the window. The views were incredible. It takes about 80 minutes to go around the entire restaurant so enjoy the time while you're there. We both ordered the rack of lamb, which was incredible. After you place your order, they bring you a bread basket with freshly baked rolls and 3 types of butter for all the different rolls. For dessert, we had the bananas foster and it was to die for. Our server had a little bit of a stutter, but that didn't interfere with the incredible service she provided. I had read about some horrible service reviews and how the food was just alright but I had the most wonderful experience here, and I will definitely be back when my wallet can afford it!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bananas foster was incredible
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0dm2gaX4FpOxczvD76XTHQ.text: Breathtaking view, dinner was great! Great waiters and staff. Would definitely come again. Only downside is you have to wait an hour for a window seat and you can't reserve in advance.

RSBxElg2O0J1VVUth9zgDg.text: my lovely sisters arranged dinner here for my birthday while we were in Las Vegas last week. We arrived before dark and purposefully arrived early. This allowed us to enjoy the observation deck as the sun set and the lights came on all across the desert view. Incredible and a little eerie from up so high! 108 stories up above the strip. You can see forever! We went down to the restaurant, one floor below the deck. The restaurant turns continuously as you dine. You can barely tell it is moving so I promise it wont bother you at all! It takes a full 80 minutes to make one turn all the way around 360 degrees. The thrill rides are above you and you can occasionally see a sky jumper dive off the building!  Wow!   The service was impeccable and we were treated very well! We ordered the crab cake appetizer and split a Caesar salad three ways.  The crab was delish  as was the salad but we ordered our anchovies on the side. They were huge! lol.  We had the New England Prawns and  the Filet Mignon .   The butter was even a treat, arriving in three little bundles, regular, orange and Basil. It was a perfect compliment to the great bread basket.   We only managed to peek at the desserts as we had plenty to eat. I would come back here again! It was a fabulous evening!

J_IvUQb163iH1Q_6LQpstw.text: Had reservations on February 13th so a little busier than normal. Service was not great but the food was which is why it's getting 4 stars. After 25 minutes we had asked for them to bring bread as all of the table that had been seated after a sortie had it. We also had to request the wine list. However the views and the food or all amazing we will be going back

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-XzosKdkPN3LAU2ifetLqQ.text: Awesome views and descent happy hour. The service could gave been a little nicer, and made us feel as though she was rushed. We were also told several seats were reserved only to have them remain empty our whole visit time.

jtbqD7Mpb2V8KB3hjTXbpQ.text: First time in Vegas. Ambiance was great at this restaurant however there was much more to be desired. The foods was just below par, in comparison to the price. I don't mind paying $56 for a steak but I would have loved to taste a $56 steak too. Outback has presented me with much more quality and taste. Payment to satisfaction ratio was definitely not met...nice vibe but food could be better.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful presentation, lacking in flavor.

fJD0bJgJNs_iDgNPo_mWRw.text: My husband and I went back to celebrate our 10th year anniversary because that's where we had our wedding dinner.   So, this time I was very disappointed because the service was terrible.  We didn't get our drinks for 20 minutes, we served our own wine.  We didn't get our dinner for so long.  The service was very slow so we are so disappointed that we skip desert.  We are not going back and we will go to a different restaurant next time.

fCej8066-VdqOXtlOzO3og.text: We were 31 people last Saturday night 1/14/17. We booked the Renaissance Room for a small wedding. John the banquet manager was helpful and very professional.  The servers Michael and Herman were excellent the bartender too. We started with soup. The lobster bisque was delicious. Salad next then a delicious perfectly cooked filet mignon. Our guest were all impressed with the food and the spectacular view.

OHHp-uvVGrm46aRvtZn_2g.text: Let me start by saying if you never been its definitely a must. This restaurant is located inside of a casino, so whatever your reservation time is for you should leave at least 20 minutes before. It takes about 10 minutes just to get to the top of the restaurant once your inside. I when for Fourth of July weekend so the casino and lobby area were full more than usual. Once you get upstairs you will go through security and there is one elevator that takes you to the top so there is awaiting process depending on how busy they are. Me and my husband made reservations for 9:00 we weren't seated til about 10:15. We could've been seated at 9:15 but we asked for a window seat so it was a longer wait. I must say it was definitely worth the wait. The food was incredible and the staff was so sweet perfect place for date night.

1Mbl9XrhsxMPhuvOtWbBNA.text: My husband and I visited this restaurant last week while in Las Vegas. The food was good, and the view was amazing, but  service was not so great. We spent about 1 hour and 40 minutes waiting for our food to come out of the kitchen. There was a lady walking around taking pictures, she is good. If you go to this restaurant you need to buy a picture package, it almost redeemed the evening.

oFe8w0V4bHbp7eKsNtBrww.text: Let me start by saying this is the best view/seat in Vegas.  The view is outstanding.  5 stars for the view.  Now the food I would go 3 1/2 out of 5.  It was good but with prices that rival top steak houses you would expect top notch food.  I mean they charge $76 for a bone in ribeye.  It's good but nothing better than what you could get at Longhorn Steak house.  If the steak was $35-40 then yes it would be a great steak for the money but when you charge  $76 I expect a great 5 star meal.  The sides we got a ceasar salad and asparagus which again were good but nothing great.  I asked for a Window seat and was placed one level above.  I'm not one to complain to the staff so I didn't say anything.  Even where we were seated the view is outstanding.  Service was kinda on the slow side but only because 2 waiters were getting every table.  We waited forever to get drinks and food was on the slower side.  Now this is really nit picking and if I didn't spend $200 for 2 people I would have loved every second of it.  Everyone definitely needs to try this place just for the view alone but just realize you will be spending $150-200 for 2 people.

wae7Vq7A268_RwE0m5zKJw.text: Being on a company trip, everything was paid for.  Even so, I felt ripped off.  The food was bad to mediocre.  There was a lot of pomp, like the waiters would mix the Ceasar salad in front of you, but then it would taste like crap.  You are really only paying for the cool location at this place. And yes, we did go ride some rollercoasters in the middle of the night at over 1000 ft height, while slightly inebriated.  A good time was had by all (and hence the 2 stars and not 1).  However if I had to pay for any of it I would have been majorly disappointed.

JzWlUAeOh0aXE_dfu4tcFg.text: Views are amazing and the entire restaurant rotates slowly so you get a 360 view of the city.    Food was good, not great. Bit overpriced and the service was so so.

cYqSExe88rLyMFoN30bQyg.text: My husband and I went there for a date night. We got a seat right next to the window, and my husband who is scared of heights entertained me all night by holding on for dear life to the table the whole time as we ate. I informed the waitress he was scared and she was joking around walking right next to the window and teasing him which made me crack up. He was a good sport about it. The staff was extremely helpful and attentive. The food was amazing! The whole restaurant spins as you eat so you can see the whole strip during your meal. I would definitely go back!

ndhw5CF5eS-P6Dmch4oU6Q.text: Everything about this place was great, except for the food.  The view and the rotating restaurant were great fun.  The staff was super professional.  The food...  Not all that great.  Started out with several appetizers.  Crabcake was small and not very tasteful.  The pork belly was fatty and basically disgusting.  Shrimp cocktail was OK, but not worth the money.  All in our party had a steak.  I had a 16 oz ribeye.  It was fatty and very chewy.  The crusted horseradish was overwhelming and didn't add to the steak.    Overall, if the food lived up to its prices, this place would be 5 star for sure.

PGKELLYp4Xg2I6pIKRlDPg.text: My Husband and I were moving back to Kentucky from Las Vegas and for our last "fancy meal" while we lived there, we thought we'd try Top of the World at the Stratosphere....  The atmosphere was great! 100+ stories above the Las Vegas Strip at Sunset... it was stunning.... a very romantic setting! The view was constantly changing as the room spins (extremely slowly) took over an hour for the room to rotate 360o....not something you'll find just anywhere!   Service was excellent, staff didn't try to rush us out on a booked evening.  We took our time, ordered some aps & salads then enjoyed our meals followed by a desset. Food was good & yummy...However, not our best meal in vegas.... especially for the price.... I guess here though you aren't paying so much for the food-- as you are the experience and atmosphere of eating at the Top of The World.   Overall, no complaints! My husband and I had a wonderful evening and memoral experience... I would feel comfortable suggesting this restaurant for an anniversary, birthday, or other special occasion.... its a restaurnat experience you won't forget!

j4Yv5BRYm1AVehQbniK7VQ.text: If you want the most amazing view of Las Vegas this is the perfect restaurant to go to however, their prices are very high and their food is good but I've had better at much cheaper prices. I still recommend going there at least once so to experience the views.

RnRo1imlDe3KVkDK8-1blw.text: Most of what you are paying for is the view, but the food and service were excellent. Very attentive and kind staff. Food and drinks were really awesome - we had steaks and a variety of veggies. In my opinion, a steak shouldn't cost $56, but when you would ordinarily have to pay $20 just to ride the elevator for viewing, you may as well get a steak too! View is superb and a great experience, especially for someone who was new to vegas!

QNiFYQE2fJEKiQ5irva7zA.text: I just cannot say enough good things about the Top of the World Restaurant at the top of the Stratosphere Resort.   + Excellent view!  (of course)  + Fast lunch seating even if you don't have a reservation.  + Great food.  + An outstanding price given the venue.  + Perfect leisurely service.  + Place settings totally appropriate for a fine restaurant.  + A cordiality setting the standard for any restaurant to follow.  + 100% clean and neat bathrooms.  + Excellent Coca-Cola,,, to take with you!.  I half expected the Top of the World Restaurant to have a great view but only be a blah experience for everything else.   Boy was I wrong!  You can bank on every point listed above to provide you with and experience to be remembered!  A very nice point that is observed by all of the staff is the fact I never felt rushed to vacate our table.  Even when our meal was obviously finished and we were dawdling over our drinks while watching the skyline and the jumpers go by.   As I learned later a full rotation of the seating area around the tower takes about 120 minutes.  They allow everyone who comes in to enjoy at least a full rotation before even thinking about addressing your stay.  Couple the leisurely meal and view with the excellent food served and it all adds up to time an money well spent whether you come for lunch or dinner.  We started out with the Flash Fried Calamari Served with tomato sauce and wasabi sour cream.  A tender and tasty starter served in a visually appealing way. (I'll add photos later).   Also served to start was a selection of rolls with various flavors butters.   The one I really liked was an Orange flavored butter with a bit of orange in the center of the shell shaped pat as a surprise.  Super yummy on the warm rolls!   My meal was the Petit Filet Mignon With roasted portobellini mushroom and Yukon gold mashed potatoes.  Also comes with a selection of sauces but I stuck with the Brandy peppercorn sauce.  The Filet arrived perfectly rare.  The meat quality was top notch as was everything else about the plating.   My lunch was gone all to fast!  Even the  portobellini mushroom which am usually none too fond of.  My daughter's was the Fettuccine Seafood Alfredo Hand made pasta, sauteed prawns and scallops, cream, garlic and Parmesan, peas, teardrop tomato and asparagus.  Nothing says satisfaction from your child like the verbal silence that you hear while your daughter devours her meal.   Of special note were the scallops and prawns.  The prawns were actually prawn sized as opposed to the cocktail shrimp other places try to pass off as prawns.  The scallops were large pieces of goodness that disappeared even before the prawns did.  The paste and the rest of the composition was spot on. Yes, I had to sneak in a bite or two when she wasn't looking.  Both meals gave their money's worth in quality and amount.  Everything was served perfectly with attention during the meal at well timed intervals.   A special note of thanks to our server who addressed both my 10 year old and me with equal grace and attention.  You really made her feel well treated too!  The final topper was the Coca-Cola to go.  I am Coke snob but the Top of the World Restaurant  must be keeping on top of the coke machine like everything else they do.   It was an excellent coke with no fuss about a cup to go.  Another service offered by the Top of the World Restaurant  and Cashman are meal photos.  The person who took our did an excellent job.  Since in was lunch and perfectly clear outside, the backdrop of the surrounding city and hills was and pleasing counterpoint to the restaurant.  When a photo comes together, especially a photo with your girl, you act it without hesitation!  The whole set I opted for was $100 in addition to the meal and worth every cent for the way pictures came out.   I recommend the Top of the World Restaurant as a Las Vegas destination for any local or visitor to experience at least once.

3nRwDNTiuP9xFuHFg9g7gA.text: Go earlier than you need to be! There is a security crossing to get into the restaurant. This caused us to be a little bit late but the staff is so friendly they don't worry about it (and it probably happens all the time because people don't expect it). Service is good. The whole restaurant seems to move at it's own pace. It's a little slow - the time between people checking on your table, the wait for drinks, time between order and food arrival - but it's not terrible, it is what it is and it seems to fit the slow rotation of the restaurant. The food was great. Not incredible hence not 5 stars. My duck was meh... was better with the sauce intended for the beef. But the steak was amazing... melt in your mouth greatness.  The free-range chicken was delicious as well, a tad too much cheese inside but the taste more than made up for it. Totally recommend going.

VpnvQWcfEvyUqR3Zgr9MVg.text: I went here for lunch, and for what you get it's pretty worth the price.  Especially when you consider that going up for the view alone is about $18, a lunch where you pay $20 is a bargain.  I read the Yelp reviews and so lobster bisque was my pick for food.  It was very good, but not the best i've ever eaten.  Definitely worth the price, especially with the rolls it was a very filling lunch; but the bisque was bordering on too salty (and I love salty food).  My friends got burgers and loved them, and I snitched some french fries and they were excellent.  Some of our party also got dessert and raved about the bananas foster.  I tried a bite and it was pretty excellent from what I could taste.  Would I come here for dinner knowing how expensive it is and the quality of food?  Probably not.  Unless the view is really the priority (which, it is an amazing view) I don't know that the food is worth the price I saw on the dinner menus.

Btqv8UChdSqqfVxJjTN-Mg.text: Went there for lunch. Amazing view and yes it spins. Make sure you have time to enjoy.  It is pricey, but absolutely worth it.

KrY-rfhJOjvs1ZDago2EvA.text: For starters this place is very expensive, but you get a lot of value you for what you pay for. First you are at the top of the Stratosphere so you get an incredible view of Las Vegas. Not only that the restaurant does a complete 360 rotation about every hour I believe so you get a good view of all of Vegas.   I had a steak and it was fantastic. The servers here are excellent as well. They also warn you before not to get alarmed if you see people jumping from the building because the free fall ride they have jumps off from just above the restaurant, and sure enough a few minutes later we saw someone go off.   As a bonus too you get free admission to the observation deck.

ebCadsk9ZY8aSZ1n__mljw.text: Our Christmas Eve tradition is to try a new fine  restaurant.  This year was Top of the World.  While the view is spectacular, the food was 'meh' and the service well, to be told upon seating that the manager was pushing tables because the restaurant had over-booked just set the tone for the evening.  The carpaccio was drenched in some type of cream sauce, the foie gras was dry, the pork belly on a bed of rice was actually the highlight of the whole meal.  My husband  did enjoy his sea bass, my daughter's filet was overcooked (how to you go from rare to well done I have no idea) son-in-law had the horseradish encrusted ribeye bu encrusted they mean a blob of horseradish on top, and I had the filet.  Food was  just on the side of being cold, not ever room temperature.    I prefer the view from Binions.

bIdTiwC-wClJDpOAXxbp0A.text: Amazing atmosphere and ambiance. The restaurant is truly on top of the world. It was a revolving restaurant on the 106th floor. The service and food were top notch. There was 6 in our group.  Items ordered were: 2 Mexican prawns, scallops and lobster grilled on a panache with a couscous type tanouleh. Exquisite Seafood fettuccini  rib eye steak x 2 Rack of lamb. Very tender and just right  We shared sides of creamy polenta with creme fraiche And omg to die for gnocchi which had brown butter on top. Yummy. My mouth is drooling as I type. We also got a side of sauteed mushrooms with parsley and garlic.  This too was delish. The portions were surprisingly huge. We all had leftovers and had no room for desert.  We watched people dive from the insanity ride from the floor above us and enjoyed the breathtaking views of Las Vegas at night. Our waitress Karen was very sweet funny and kept on checking in on us every few minutes.  Highly recommended.  Will definitely go back when I visit Vegas in the near future.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from observation deck

X81bdQsKQCnHQOtUnHv-ZQ.text: This is my second time visiting the Top of the World restaurant and the first for other members of the party. This time I was disappointed and did not complain on site because I waited tables for 6 years and I always find it uncomfortable. However, a few things really did bother me.  They need to work on managing the guest's experience and work on training their employees to be more perceptive to their needs.   1.) Our drinks took about ten minutes to come out. It should take an average of five minutes.  2.) The bread did not come out until we requested it when the appetizer hit the table. 3.) The appetizer, the pork belly is a great dish, but was losing temperature and wasn't warm. I asked an employee if it should be cold and it was not offered to be replaced. 4.) My sister ordered her filet temperature as medium and it was medium well. In addition, another was medium rare and it was medium. I worked in a steak house and when this happen to my guests, I noticed and offered to have it recooked to order. It should have been noticed for the medium well, at least. That is terrible. 5.) It took an extremely long time to get our check. I am not sure of the policy for when they train their servers to drop it off.  6.) I wanted a cabernet, the server didn't even know which were offered by the glass.... which turns out it only three, no further comment necessary.  7.) Going down the elevator was a hassle because they continued to send employees down. It happen three times in a row. The poor elevator girl ask how dinner was, the other guests in the elevator really voiced their discontent. We weren't the only ones that evening.   The view gets an A+ and a B for food.  I just feel like you pay for the view. Unfortunately this time the service wasn't up to standards.  Try to look at other business models of fine dining for service tips, it may help.

K-1j7M2FLZV2NI6WOebWiQ.text: Yes go there for the view. It's great but you definitely pay for it. The drinks we had at the bar we average and little weak for the price. There was nothing to complain about regarding the food since it was above average. They do give you large portions which a big guy like me loves. If I go back to Vegas with someone who's never been here before I'd go back.

NQFf1-RIgkvtuz3J7TLQFg.text: After reading some reviews I was a little skeptical to come here but it was a great experience! We came for my wife's bday and had a reservation and were quickly seated. Service was superb! As expected the views are out of this world. Im not sure if its based on what you order but our food was really good. Portions are small just an fyi. Drinks are really good and the lobster bisque is a must. Of course its pricey but you're paying for the atmosphere. Have to come at least once.

OWuDDSBq6_w7442kR7KGQw.text: Can you get a better meal on the strip?  Sure. Is the food alone worth the trip to the Top of the World?  Absolutely.   Are you coming to Top of the World for the food alone?  Heck no!  Do the views make this one of the best overall dining experiences in Vegas?  You betcha they do!  Look, this place rocks and I'll be back again.  The restaurant, like the Stratosphere itself is showing some age, but its very good.  If you're staying in one of the megaresorts on the Strip, you're going to need to save a few bucks from the tables and spring for the cab ride to and from the Stratosphere to try the Top of the World.  This is not a short walk from the Wynn, Venetian, Mirage, etc.    While having to go through security and a metal detector, just to go to dinner may seem a bit disconcerting, here, its worth it.  We made our reservation several months in advance based on a recommendation from friends who had recently dined there.  We booked the reservation for about 20 minutes before sunset, in hopes we would be seated right around the time the strip lights up.  We were seated promptly and got to see Vegas transform from day to night.  While the strip lighting up was fun, the sun setting behind the mountains was beautiful.  The food is very good.  Yes, you can find some places on the strip where it is better for comparable prices, but remember the view!  You pay extra for a hotel with a view and you do the same here (albeit not that much extra given the high quality of the fare).  Service was top notch.  Our server was attentive, prompt and not rushed, even though we were occupying a prized window seat.    I had the wedge salad which had big chunks of bacon. The filet and pork tenderloin were both well portioned and cooked perfectly.  Both, along with the salad were enough to fill anyone up.  The desserts all looked very good, but we simply did not leave room.  As noted by other reviews, the restaurant moves.  I can get motion sick, but the motion here, is barely noticeable.  There were no issues.  One of the more exciting things is when you realize there are people riding the rides and bungee jumping from the top of the tower, above you.  It is kind of neat to see people plummeting past the windows as you eat.  After dinner you have access to the observation deck which is a blast.  You get to see people riding the insane rides and bungeeing from the building.  In addition, you get great unobstructed views of the strip, all lit up.    In the end, this was worth the trip, good food, very good service and amazing views.

P3aB-1YHg4KIxHYFiJ67yA.text: We got the carpaccio as appetizer and it was ok, little bit ruined by the sauce on it ... Our daugther got the meatballs (burgers) and fries and it was ok. My wife got the filet mignon with mashed potatoes and it was very very good, melt in your mouth. I got the ribey and it was very good and rightly juicy (that parmesan crust on it was interesting but i would not have put it there). The grilled beans on the side was below standard. As dessert our little one got the manho sorbet and it was good, and my wife and i shared the creme broule and it was very good. As wine, i got some pinot noir 2012 dry and good as i like it and brachetto d'aqui with dessert, very veru good! Our waiter Max was very kind, lovely and prepared. Location is the best part of this place, we got rim seats and we had great time also watching the sunset! Great experience. Food is overall heavy and hot 5 stars premium steak house but you dont go there necesserlly for that. You want the package and you'll get it. You feel like you are on a first class seat on a plane landing on Los Angeles! As they say there, great view! Check can be expensive, but at the end is more than fair and convennient, conisderimg also you get access to the deck at 109th. Floor (which it would cost i believe $20 per person, itself). Perfect spot to celebrate a good occasion! Also, stratosphere hotel was better than expected and valet service is free (kinda rare in vegas these days) quick! We have been to vegas many times, and we are happy we finally tried this place! Highly recommended!

3J-NEGMdSIVioB3sBJFBCA.text: I have been dining here almost since day 1 and can honestly say I have NEVER been disappointed  (However I do miss Debbie, my requested server for so many years). The girlfriend and I both had the Fillet Migon medium rare, hers was more medium but far from a deal breaker. The scallops, lobster, and lobster bisque were spot on.  A member of our party was a first timer. He is no stranger to steaks, both store bought and self cured as a hunter. He ordered the rib eye and quote "that is the best steak I have ever had".  Do I even need to mention the view?

9TRyiR2hAj4CMr-Jz3eEMQ.text: I've always felt the Top of the World restaurant that sits close to the top of the 1,149-foot Stratosphere hotel and casino was a bit of a gimmick and a tourist trap. It's 844 feet in the air so you're guaranteed a spectacular view of Las Vegas, and it rotates so your viewpoint is constantly changing, but what about the food?  As the missus and I didn't want to risk $20 a person on appetizers, and then spend another $40 to $50 each on entrees (should they just be passable because the view was certainly there to make up for them), we decided to take this restaurant around for a spin for a less expensive lunch and were, much to our surprise, quite impressed.  I settled on a salad for my meal: fresh heirloom tomatoes interlaced with chunks of bright red watermelon and squeaky mozzarella, supported by crunchy pistachio bits and a sweet balsamic and sherry vinaigrette drizzle. This was followed by a calamari and shrimp fritto misto appetizer that also included fried peppers and olives, and was presented in what I would call "Two-Face" style: half the plate was resting in a warm, somewhat chunky old-school tomato sauce, and the other half was basking in a delightful wasabi sour cream. Both of these plates had some thought put into them, as they were carefully designed to be tiny works of art on a plate, yet also flavorful and perfect for a light lunch.  This missus opted for the lobster grilled cheese sandwich that was served with a tomato bisque. The sandwich was prepared with huge chunks of scrumptious Canadian lobster trapped between layers of gooey cheddar and Brie, while the bisque was smooth and was presented with some playfulness -- the cup sat atop a raw slice of tomato that seemed to represent the "tomato base"  this dish used. She relished both items.  Some of the marketing this restaurant uses in its ads suggests eating here will "heighten your senses" and you can "taste the unexpected". Truth in advertising? Most definitely. The dishes we ate here exceeded our initial, jaded expectations, and I would come back to try their dinner or tasting menu, and experience Vegas at dusk.  That said, the view does seem to have an impact on the menu's prices. While I am definitely not shy when it comes to spending around $150 for a nice dinner out for two in Vegas, especially when what's offered is something unique, would I spend the same to eat at Top of World for dinner if it was 100 floors or so lower? Maybe? Maybe not?   Top of the World reminded me of a small restaurant I used to frequent very often in Montreal, Quebec that had an ever-changing, delectable seasonal menu, and always served consistently good comfort food, but an appetizer, main and dessert at dinner would never cost more than $35 per person, whereas lunch here was $45 each for what we ordered (plus two drinks).  When I focus on the quality of the food alone and the way it was presented, Top of the World was definitely on par with that spot, which still holds a special place in my heart, so maybe that's why I feel its pricing might get in the way of a repeat visit if you don't really care about the view.   I think this is a restaurant one must definitely experience if you've been to Vegas a couple times or it's your first trip there, and you'd never take a helicopter tour of the strip. You definitely won't be disappointed by the sensory experiences this restaurant offers -- from its crafty, tempting dishes to its breath-taking city views. When everything is factored together, the price is indeed right for the whole package, but if you're on a budget or just want to sample their menu, they are open for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fritto misto with squid and shrimp, served half in tomato sauce and half in a wasabi sour cream
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster grilled cheese and tomato bisque

98GO0cx_bWNNudyK4POQCw.text: We had an amazing meal for Thanksgiving! They had a special four course meal for the holiday - turkey, stuffing and so much more and it was well worth the price! My husband had ala cart food, steak and potatoes, and it  was amazing as well. The service was spectacular, and the view was off the charts! We had a helicopter fly by, and at least one skydiver fly past the windows. It was a great experience, and a checkmark on my bucket list. One note: be careful not to place your belongings on the revolving portion of the restaurant. My purse slipped off the back of my chair and was whisked away... Luckily our waiter found it and it was all good. But a bit scary until we found it.

ImtLL6a8jP4GSMKbmL_RrA.text: I've been here a couple times in my life and each time , I've had amazing food and great service! The view is spectacular as you can view the whole city in this restaurant as it slowly turns while you eat! Wonderful place!

LHAYROkIR_aEhEdV2AfF7g.text: The food is WHATEVS (steak AND the sides), and I remember my favorite dish was the mashed potatoes... I was quite disappointed because the restaurant is supposed to be a high end eatery and live up to its name, but the only thing they live up to is the high price. Nonetheless, the view is beautiful! The restaurant rotates very slowly so you can pretty much see the entire 360 view while you're eating. You can also see people bungee jumping from the building... eek! I don't remember if it was from an adjacent building or the same building as the restaurant, but all I remember is seeing people hooked to cables and jumping off while we were having dinner. I would say to come for the experience and view with your significant other while pretending to enjoy your meals.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. He got a ribeye and I got a filet.

DqWwaKfQ9qa6WcoHMLU80A.text: Most romantic dinner we have had so far. Great place, amazing view and really good service. Should try it once for sure.  Good for all options, vegan, vegetarian, meat eaters, all are welcome

n2xscKxYWVlEV7xWbJEeXA.text: We had some really great food here and the views of Las Vegas at night were amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1_m-WfAX6fslPJPXVijOhA.text: I have very conflicted opinions about Top of the World. On one hand, I proposed to my wife here, on the other hand, the service was just terrible.  I did a lot of research before choosing this restaurant to propose. I knew I'd be in Vegas with some of our closest friends and I needed a nice place that could accommodate all of us. In the end, I ended up choosing this restaurant.  Now the restaurant is very nice. The view at night was just marvelous, and I highly recommend coming here for a drink or two if you're in Vegas, just for the view itself. This is a rotating restaurant, meaning that you get a 360 degree view of Vegas.  We had a party of 12, so had to sit in 2 different tables, that were next to each other. We had 2 different waiters (I mention this for a reason, so read on...).  We ordered a few different appetizers, and I think most of us ordered steak for the entree, and we were all happy with the food (albeit the price).  Now I had popped the question after dinner, and we were all very happy because she had said "yes". There was a small band in the restaurant that even sang a song for us. Everything was nice, until the waiters for one of our table came by and told us we had to leave because another group was waiting for our table. We had just gotten dessert at our table, so we weren't even finished with our meal. The waitress was very rude and her supervisor also came by and said we had to leave.  I was a little surprised at their tone, and didn't expect this kind of behavior from this restaurant.  For 12 of us, our bill was over $1,200. You would think after spending that much, they would be a little nicer to you.  It's a shame that service was so bad here. We came here to celebrate such a memorable occasion, but in the end, the service left a bad taste in our mouth.

HSeK5eycJFewEhfIKzod_g.text: I had my birthday dinner here recently on October 27th. I turned 21 and wanted a special dinner!!! Our server was amazing. The manager was also amazing! My food did come out cold but they had no problem fixing my meal and talking about it with me! They so deserve 5 stars... they made my birthday so special. They also brought my cake out and served it to me and my family! Amazing view, amazing customer service and amazing food!!! I will be visiting again when I'm in Las Vegas!

7QaTegwdf6uXuxffomPNJg.text: Possibly the worst meal I have had in Vegas  Don't have the Lamb they have no clue how to cook it. Tough and cold  Service was average I hate places that add 18% to the bill for a table of 6 as the patron has no way of expressing his displeasure The view is simply not worth it go to the Rio instead

K_2BYRZuHVhdF5ZQapHnjw.text: This is my restaurant of choice in Las Vegas.  No, it is not as fancy as Michael's or Joel Robechon (sp.) or Guy Savoy.  But, I find the service excellent here.  I almost always get the Steak and Lobster and a bottle of Perriet Joet.   It is pricey, but the view is the best in the west and again great service (ask for Jeannie at night and Dee for lunch).  Dean (the sommelier) is the best.

u5A_BpKpiQ587i4iUZI5WQ.text: We had a party of 18 for a 50th birthday celebration.... so pretty important event.  This restaurant was beautiful!!!! The ambiance was amazing and we had an awesome view of Vegas.  However.... the food was horrible the steaks were all drizzled in mystery sauces and they had absolutely no flavor.  Our party ordered at least 10 bone in rib eyes 3 salmon dinners, 3 Surf and Turfs and each person complained about taste, done level and toughness.  The Lobster Bisque tasted sugary and the Cucumber cocktails were horrible.  Quite frankly the only thing we enjoyed was the bread and even that was a stretch and we purposely waited in hopes that this dining experience would be top notch.  We spent $2500 on a table of food not including tip.  The food reminded me of ponderosa.  My suggestion would be to collect feedback to help improve the dining experience.  It would be a shame to waste such a beautiful view and decor on crappy food.  I think you all have potential!!!!! But only if you take action  Look to hire a chef that is more forward thinking one that seeks feedback. In order to be a 5 star restaurant you all will need to send the chef out to interact with your customers or at least a manager.  After the first 15 minutes of Oooos and Ahhhs it was a horrible experience.  Thanks Eyenoticed!

2F-GknWXE1oeKZJ-Ndvxpw.text: Amazing view of the strip. Good food - nice fine dining place for a special occasion.

BtOxR1fGAJTdUis60m5pYA.text: A perfect 360 degrees view of Las Vegas and not to mention the sky jumpers which really makes it a wonderful experience. Came here for lunch and had the three course prix fixie lunch which was really worth the price because the portion was good and the food such as the lobster tail and filet mignon was excellent but the lobster bisque soup was a bit to heavy for me. The dessert were also just an okay because it had the looks but just tasted alright and was tad simple nothing that makes you have that you know satisfaction moment. but overall it was well worth it to come here and have lunch even though it's at the far end of the strip it was still worth the trip.

PijXD0Hap_LLOSh9pXq0og.text: My husband and I came to Vegas to celebrate his birthday and we came here for dinner one night. Everything from when we walked in until we left was nothing short of amazing! I give five stars very sparingly but this restaurant certainly deserves it. We went early because we wanted to see the whole city while we ate. Food is good, wine is good and atmosphere is top notch.

9bkDixS6WjK4_cxtTgir9g.text: We had booked reservations for our party of 15 last week. It was last minute but they were very accommodating. Not a single person complained over their meal. They had a nice selection of wines and beers. The steak was cooked perfectly, our starters were served in a timely fashion, the creme brulee was too good and the view was great. The elevator service was slow, but I guess that's to be expected with the foot traffic they get. I would recommend this to any business party.

8dQjKfeXDFBtTMYpAuiQgA.text: Service was amazing, although the food tasted mediocre, what made this restaurant was the view and service, I'd probably go back just for the view with a glass of wine lol

This is a "must do" Las Vegas stop!

qtaNkCzyWGWPhEkIPCcRfQ.text: Hands down this is the best food I have ever tasted! I couldnt believe how delicious the food was. For starters we had the crab cake and lobster bisque soup and it was to die for! Then me and my husband shared a steak and ordered the double baked potato! Sooooo soooo good! The server was incredible! He knew what came with every item on the menu with full description of the sauce and everything! Then when the food came out the runner described the food and the sauce on it. It was by far the fanciest restaurant I've eve been to! Then the 360 view was incredible. While you eat the restaurant rotates!

ZK4ktU8uliO7qOLrpDr49g.text: Food was a 3 star rating, but that gorgeous view bumped this up to 5 stars. I mean really now, you're paying for the ambiance and the views. There's nowhere else like this in the city. A restaurant that rotates all 360 degrees in an hour span? Yeah, it's real nice.  Came here for Valentine's Day dinner (not on the actual day but the weekend before) around 7pm. We valet because it'll be quite a hike if you park in their parking garage. If you valet, it's only a short walk to the tower entrance. And as of Feb 2017, self parking is still at no charge.  For appetizers, we each ordered a salad; Caesar and Wedge salads. They were big enough to share. For entrees, I ordered Miso-Glazed Chilean Sea Bass-with baby bok choy, tamari, ginger, garlic, and pickled carrot garnish. Portions were big enough for leftovers. My boyfriend got a steak filet. And we shared the twice baked potato topped with bacon, cheddar and green onions. Honestly, the food was alright. It was good....but nothing like "whoa!!!!" And my dish might have sat out for awhile because it wasn't pippin hot when it arrived to my table. That's one of my pet peeves....lukewarm food. Blehhhhh!!! I still would like to come back for lunch though...looking at some of the pictures of the lobster sandwich...yum!  Skipped on dessert because I'm not much of a sweets person plus we were too full already. But I have no doubt their dessert items must taste divine.  Like I mentioned before, you're really paying for the view. Especially during dinnertime. The restaurant rotates 360 degrees so don't worry if you don't have a view of The Las Vegas Strip when you first get seated. Eventually, you'll get to it. And for those that are sensitive to motion, it moves so slow, you really don't feel it. You're definitely NOT moving like a merry-go-round.  Tourist or local, I would recommend trying this restaurant. Lunch or dinner....you can't really go wrong. They have the menu on their website complete with pricing too. Enjoy!

Out of all the steak houses in Vegas this would not be in my top 5. I had a filet mignon that was bland even though it was covered in a sauce. We had potatoes two ways , corn, and mushrooms and those had zero flavor as well. qJ72akeNqa7RSkbwnAquqQ.text: UNBELIEVABLE!!!!! This place has such a breathtaking view of everything and rotated  so you can see different views. photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

peBgKbnGcCDHL4t5jvQfBw.text: Extremely disappointed by this restaurant. They enforce their fancy standards by not offering any type of plain eats. However, many of our neighbors in dining showed up in lackluster shorts and tee shirts. But dare you ask for accommodations on your meal such as extra butter or no lobster in the Mac n cheese. The servers are kind but not accommodating. Views are incredible but not worth the price tag of the disappointing dinner.

DdxHN8A-qQzE34YPbYjUVw.text: A rotating restaurant on the 106 th floor overlooking Las Vegas. Must have a reservation. Beautiful and constantly changing view. We went after dark for dinner and the city was all aglow.  Had a wonderful meal. We went with the four course meal. Lobster bisque was rich and creamy, Caesar salad was large and crisp. Then had Maryland lump crab cakes - excellent. There was also a choice of a pasta dish rather than the crab cake. Main course was a choice of filet mignon and jumbo shrimp, or a Wild salmon steak with large jumbo shrimp's in the citrus glaze. The portions were large and perfectly cooked. For dessert you have a choice of salted caramel creme brulee or spumoni ice cream. Both were delicious and portions very large. By the time our desserts came we were almost to full to eat them, mind you I said almost too full.  Both the beef, the shrimp and the salmon were cooked to perfection. Each of the four course meal's was of $105. A bottle of sparkling water is eight dollars. Our waiter was perfect attentive but did not rush us in anyway. Our waiter brought the food out with perfect timing between each course. He checked in once and a while  but not too often to make sure everything was fine and brought extra bread etc. when we needed it.We sat at nine and the restaurant was open till 11 and they never asked us to move or make us feel rushed as we needed to get out. Was very happy with our dinner and the view was amazing. If you're going to Vegas it's worth it to try the top of the world restaurant. Oh by the way, you can order straight off the menu you don't need to order a four course meal. But when I added together all the items I wanted to try the lobster bisque a Caesar salad etc. it was less expensive to just go with the four course meal

zawi_zrjP121bTLM3t_mvg.text: Been here a few times.   Last time I had a filet with the truffle butter ( very good) and foie gras (good)  The steak was very good, not mind blowing, but very good.  But the setting is what makes this place unforgettable .  Definitely a Vegas bucket list dinner.  Also. I found the prices to be fair.

ZjDB89O7odkYyKI4hzcG9Q.text: We went to the Top of the World to celebrate our 5th anniversary. I ordered the 4 course set dinner, and he ordered the Australian steak strip. Mine was altogether okay, yet heavily salted. His was chewy and distasteful. Our dinners cost about $300, which included 1 drink and nothing extra. The view was nice. It seems we paid heavily for a nice view, because the food was far from worth the cost. We will not return or recommend.

KKai_9w6yzVA9w39X_AfhA.text: Food: We went with a party of 10 and all agreed to this. The taste of the food was good but nothing special to brag about. It is very expensive. For example, you order a steak, depending on which one between $46-$79, and it doesn't even come with anything else! Then you'll have to order your side which would be another $15-$25. The portions were not that great and the food was over cooked in my opinion. The bread basket they bring before the meal, one type of bread and a giant Dorito with a cream dipping sauce, was not that great! I give the food 3 stars.  Venue: The scenery is amazing! Definitely cannot complain about it at all. The place is clean and set up nicely. The bathrooms were very clean as well. I couldn't hear the cooks yelling or playing their music which is annoying to me. If you don't like heights this place may not be for you and to top things off the place spins so it may make you a little sick. I give the venue 5 stars!  Service: It was good but not great. I had to ask my waiter twice to fill my glass. We asked him for a group photo and he made a face. When one person in my group asked for a $15 salad, he made a face and asked, "That's what you're gonna have for the dinner?"  I give the service a 3.  Location: I know there is nothing they can do to relocate the stratosphere so I'll be fair. By the time you get through traffic on the Strip, wait in line to get into the garage, go through a crowded tight garage and find a tight parking space, walk through their long crowded Smokey casino with their employees bugging you as to whether you want to purchase tickets for their show, walk through their mall with their employees bugging you as to whether you would like a butt massage, go through a metal detector, wait for an elevator in a long line, wait in a small crowded elevator with a lot of people and have your head feel like it's going to explode from the quick  altitude change, then arrive to wait in line again to get seated, then told you can't be seated until your entire party arrives, then finally get seated and have to wait another 30-45 mins for the food, then after you eat, reverse everything all over again, you can feel really exhausted, drained, or disappointed. I give the location a 2.  Final score: 3+5+3+2=13 13/4=3.25  Recommendation: If you want to see your house, the entire city, or trying to impress your date with a beautiful sunset or a selfie, then take her here to see the city on the Stratosphere observation floor, which is above the restaurant and free of charge. Then, after burning all them calories to get there, burn a little more and take her for another nice view, but better food, service and venue at the Paris restaurant. Also about the same price. Just make sure you make reservations ahead of time.   BUT, if you want really good food, a nice romantic night, nice venue, great service, for a 1/4 the price of the Stratosphere or the Paris, and save a ton load more money to get her a nice gift later, take her to Capos Italian restaurant! You won't regret it! Again, make reservations!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck Legs Confit with Orange Gastrique. Like over-cooked greasy chicken wings over giant broccoli &amp; carrots.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is Mary&#39;s Farm Free-Range Chicken with Lemon and Rosemary. It is the most reasonably cheap ($38) item on the menu that was good.

nhAdG9hAeh6rlsv0Db-MRA.text: Beautiful view !!! Came here for my husbands birthday he chose the place ! Very nice atmosphere you can see Las Vegas perfectly through this view, but .... If you get motion sickness this isn't for you! I totally got a little light headed and dizzy after watching the view for sure. Now ... let's talk about the food ! Very average nothing special but the prices are ridiculous! We had a party of 8 and out bill was about 1k. Totally sucks that the so called "Steak" is really similar to some damn carne asada from home ! From one of the guys that came in our group said the wine wasn't so pleasant at all. Only thing I can say was pretty good was the Mac and cheese with lobster! Maryland stuffed chicken weren't so great! If I would of known how much money we would of spent I would of gotten to another awesome place on the strip !

YIGF6MnBLy5odIFZUkANAw.text: Really disappointed. Made reservations and waited another half an hour on top of it for the tables by the window w the revolving floor. Ordered drinks and appetizers and the waiter asked for an entree. We told him we just booked a show so we didn't have time for a meal. He "talked to his manager" and kicked us out. I don't see why he couldn't serve us and then ask us to leave when we were done. It was really rude and left a bad taste in my mouth. I waited a long time for nothing.

Pj2W_um7GFqyISzQNgBpuQ.text: Had a reservation on Christmas day in the early afternoon. The restaurant was dead, maybe a quarter full and they still made us wait 15 mins for our reserved table. Once we sat no one came by for several minutes, again, it wasn't busy. We all got up and left after no one came by. Very, very bad service and very pricey. Won't try again and will not recommend.

cF_KgAFnfMFMOalLbU7wDw.text: 3.5, which I'm only rounding up because 1.) obviously the views are stunning, especially if you're there for sunset. I've been to a rotating restaurant before (shout-out to The View in NYC), so that didn't really phase or impress me, but yeah. It's very pretty. and 2.) going to the restaurant gives you free access to the Stratosphere observation deck afterwards.  The food was really lame, though. I got the rotini, which was overcooked with pasta sauce that tasted like nothing. I paid probably $30+ for something I could have made for myself way better at home. I got the lobster mac as well so I had something to eat later in the hotel; it also just wasn't that good. Way too rich.  The cocktails were weak but very tasty. I highly recommend the dessert cocktails. I got the Spark Plug & the Key Lime Pie.  Just recognize that you're coming here for the view and not an amazing culinary experience. If you arrive with that understanding, you won't be disappointed.

h7N9ADcz6tmpkqH28Q_V8g.text: Honestly it's a must go to. The view at night or during the day is spectacular and the food is great. The experience alone is worth it and you might be lucky enough to see someone sky jump past you during the meal. I only had one small issue and that was drink prices are pretty ridiculous here. This also seems to be a "Stratosphere hotel," kinda issue. I will say I went to other hotels and got a 12/13 dollar drink and that's kind of just a Vegas thing. At the top of the world they are charging 17 and up! Come on now if you are going to charge me 17 that better be a great cocktail and guess what it was mehhhh.   Long story short it's expensive, it's worth it. But maybe have the cocktails elsewhere not at this particular location.

It was a Monday night so they weren't that busy. They should've been more focused on us. Food was really good. The view was amazing. Dessert was the best part. It was a romantic night and super fun. ESXGFXWAu0F3wdUY7GRrBg.text: The atmosphere was amazing! However, the reason why I'm giving this 3 stars is mainly because of the service.   For food, I had the 4 course meals and my parties ordered steaks. The food were okay, just decent enough because the atmosphere made up for it. On the other hand, service was terrible. The lady that served us just seemed like she didn't care. Her face was nonchalant. I don't know if she just have no emotion but she seemed apathetic l(I feel like gratuity were already included so she didn't have any concerns). It took forever for food to come out. By the time our steaks came out, our appetite were ruined. Each time, I have to raised my hand and tracked the server down. If it's too busy for her, then they should hire more servers on the floor.   Also, drinks here are not great. How can you messed up on a martinis?? I asked the server about this cocktail drink, if it's really sweet? Because I don't like too sweet. She assure me, it's not too sweet. Honey, it was really sweet. I didn't even drink half of my drink.   Overall, the server killed it for us.

BO_meQzYRadLvkNK0DgBSA.text: To start the service is second to none. The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. The rotation is slow and the best time to come is around sunset.   I tried the tasting menu and found the price to be comfortable but the menu items themselves to be lackluster. The tasting menu wine pairing was fair.   This is a great space for excellent photo opportunities so come prepared and have fun with the dress code which is business casual.   Biggest Takeaway is to come around sunset for the best rotation.

cBnu5MFbFERTSu0gsS23Tg.text: Elegant and beautiful atmosphere. The wait staff was excellent and the service was impeccable. We enjoyed all the dishes that we ordered including appetizers, entrees and desserts. But, you definitely have to save your money to come to this restaurant... It is definitely not an every day meal! It is a perfect place to take out of town guests or a treat for a special occasion.

JdVz2-niZ-m2dtbxX0vwcw.text: we been here few times for birthdays and couple anniversary's . the only reason we came back for the excellent food and service even though its super pricey but when the food isn't as good and make us wait 30 mins when we have appointment and get others ahead of us when there were at least 25 tables available that is bad .

tmePwqlt_TYcT425sugE_A.text: This is an absolutely MUST-SEE if you are vacationing in Vegas. It's a bit off from The Strip, but worth the Taxi/Uber drive!  First off, the restaurant has the most amazing view. AND THERE ARE RIDES. LIKE, WUT?! It's unreal!  The entire restaurant spins around consistently (without you feeling dizzy lol), giving you a view of the entirety of Vegas. It's honestly breath-taking. So cool.   We ordered A L O T of food. We truly went all out. The beet salad, lobster bisque, shellfish tower, filet mignon, green beans, twice baked potato, bottle of wine. Everything was perfect.   The service was lacking, however. The waitress wasn't entire attentive and she was rather slow. It didn't take away from the overall experience and food though!  I recommend after dinner going up to the bar and then all the way up to the top to go watch people bungy jump and ride on the rides. I'm so happy we made our way here!! Would love to come back.

LRrevA_TEzbNT5oNMfca_Q.text: WORST SERVICE I HAVE EVER HAD!  I work in F&B. I know good service and this is horrible especially at such a "fine" dining experience. We waited 40 minutes for our reservation at a bar in the upper deck with a bartender that couldn't handle a party of six at her bar. (It was only ya at the bar)   After being seated a waiter poured water for us and spilt it everywhere. After a long wait another waiter came to take our order we were told that we must order and entree or order food that is similar priced. This stipulation was not mentioned anywhere in the restaurant or menu or during our reservation.  We asked to have a moment and were left for about 20 minutes while the restaurant was very slow.   My cup of ice I ordered did not come out until the entrees after asking three different people. The entries were bland and the sides were decent.   The waiting staff treated us poorly based on the money amount of food we were ordering and we only saw our waiter twice during our dining experience.   My wife found lobster shell in her lobster Mac and cheese and the staff argued with me about discounting that side from our check.   Over all I suggest you come here to enjoy the view and have a snack. Don't dine unless you're prepared for a long wait, poor service and over priced food.

QSWqVWWO6Txz2dSuzH1bAQ.text: Great place my son got the steak and I got fish.. good place for romantic date. Great place if you have people in town so they can see the whole strip.. The restaurant rotate while you're eating. The best view in Vegas..

ZImLzqLFMXKLhixhz0f9RQ.text: This WAS my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas and so much so that I booked a reservation a week ahead of time to enjoy dinner with my best friend. Requesting a window table as I always do and have always been accommodated.   Tonight it didn't happen with empty tables all around. Paul was very short and unable to help and hovering around being rude.   Absolutely disappointed. What happened TOTW..???  I guess my business will move to the strip.   VERY SAD

84uvj7peCiqZKxfY5oDbAA.text: Ventured here with some friends. We originally came to enjoy the rides and then found out we could visit the top level for free (there's a charge in addition to the rides) if we dined at Top of the World. The food was great but the service was superb largely in part of our busser, Letty. Why isn't he a server? He was professional yet relatable, funny, easygoing and attentive. The Spaghetti Squash was flavorful and delicious but the highlight of my meal was the warm bread that they brought to the table and the Bananas Foster that I had for dessert.   The views were breathtaking and we got to see a few people bungee jumping right off the rooftop directly outside the restaurant window. It took about an hour for the restaurant to spin back to it's starting point so we were able to see all of the sights...it was very beautiful. I'm looking forward to returning to dine at night to see the lights.
