k0AOKGWIvCIokZRw3VbPyw.text: Unsanitary food and terrible service by the waiter Waylon O.  Pros- bussers and food runners, view Cons- food sanitation, hair in our food, worst waiter I have ever had  As a Las Vegas local I have tried my share of fine dining in the valley, I have been to this restaurant multiple times throughout the years as we enjoy the view, and it's always a unique experience for guests staying with us. This time around I was pleasantly surprised to find a groupon at a great price, it doesn't matter how much money you have, saving money is always a bonus. With our second course there was a hair in our food, we let our waiter know and he just picked up the plate and said oh ok. No apology, no I'm sorry for the inconvenience, nothing. Later the manager came by with the remade plate, apologized and was very kind, however he's not the one working for tips. By the time we finished, we asked for our food to be put away to go, I asked him to include the sauces we paid for, but obviously he was in another world and did whatever he wanted. By the time we paid, he was acting extremely rude and just plopped the check with our change on the table, I was just waiting for him to throw it at us. Didn't even say thank you, or acknowledge our presence. Awful awful service, for the first time in my entire life I actually considered leaving no tip, but that wouldn't have been fair to the bussers and food runners who were actually kind and did their job.   If you want to see the view, just go to the sky deck for a drink, we still had a fabulous time despite the dreadful service. I would recommend taking your money somewhere else.

8LA6vTP13E_loE-4m11-iw.text: This was a great experience my fiance and I went to celebrate our anniversary and the view was beautiful and food was good overall had a great time

rikpr7FNcw9z3rETU4WD5g.text: Ordered the 12 oz. Lobster Tail while I sipped on lemon water. I honestly wasn't raving about the lobster tail... Gordon Ramsay Steak's @ The Paris is better.  Very fun how the ground is rotating while dining. You can see people bungee jumping off the roof and the roller coaster plunge throughout your meal (lol). Not to mention the literal 360* view of Las Vegas NV. There was a slight issue with the seating, but it was resolved. One of the staff offered us orders of comped dessert of our choice, I declined. My guest ordered a strawberry cheesecake which I had a bite of.   Server was very knowledgeable. Two thumbs up.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maine Lobster Tail

jm1XZDIqjsqtIOoZPICKqw.text: I love it here. Great place to go if you want to be fancy. Not the finest food in the world, but the view is unique to Vegas. The service is great, it should be, it's pricey enough for the okay food. Still gets 4 stars though. It's a great experience. Ride the rollercoaster at the top of the casino afterwards!

rk9MQ-EAdJPvsxCfq9KXdg.text: My bf and I went to this restaurant for our 3 year anniversary and I have to say that the hype about this place is a little over rated. I mean, the view is beautiful and it is kind of cool how the place rotates so you can see all of vegas, but besides that it wasn't as great as I thought I would be. First off, the food is very limited and everything is over priced. I ordered lobster ravioli for $38 and all I got was 6 raviolis and a lobster *tail* which was more like a very small piece of lobster meat. My bf ordered a filet mignon that barely had any flavor and cost $44. The only item I really enjoyed was my garlic mashed potatoes (($8). Other than that, the service was poor. The waiter didn't even come back with my change AND I waited 30 mins. for the change. I was gonna tip him more, but since he never came back, I just let him keep the change.

RKKvHASTpVlEhUKfG66L8A.text: the meal and the view was worth all the money i spent for the food and alcohol!! woot

sk4zdcQGnxLWuIluLeRDMw.text: My husband, son and I came here for lunch and I ordered some type of seafood (scallops and shrimp) pasta, something was not right with some of the shellfish, so I asked for them to take it back.  I do have to say, it was pretty damn tasty except those couple pieces of shellfish.  I then asked for the lobster bisque.  IT WAS TO DIE FOR!   They give you a beautiful large bowl with pieces of lobster and butter in the middle, they then serve you the bisque separately.  I really enjoyed this, the rest of the food that my husband and son ordered was really good.  I'd come here again just for that lobster bisque.  Don't miss out!!!  By the way, our waitress was great, she was really good with my son and was so nice!

ybHzz0Fd_Le3jV2_iLivrA.text: food is average for the money. cost is 100 pp and the service is well below average starting with the hostess. If you have a reservation plan on sitting down 45 minutes later as they force you to the lounge. MUCH better in vegas at this price!!!

vufqeikPuTRFxufDjpC04Q.text: The food was pretty great.  Too bad I couldn't enjoy it because of how the restaurant moves.  I asked the hostess beforehand.. if I get motion sickness very easily... is this a bad idea for me. She assured me no.  Trust me.. it was. Go to the Eiffel Tower instead. No need to go this far down the strip.

Bgv_uBMh6VB3xs4pP5UHqw.text: I couldn't pass up a rotating meal. The meal was amazing. I will never forget the lobster bisque. The view was "o.k." as i wasn't by a window. I was there during sunset which kept going in my eyes. Someone also proposed in front of us too. Aww. If you want to check this out I recommend just going to the lounge. Its the same feeling of the dinner just $100 less.

v_kvL7S9DUhsKRcwE4arLw.text: cool views up top, but food kinda sucks since it's not even considered fine dining. some food may look good, but don't taste very good, do not order seafood; think about it, why would you order seafood in a desert?

3aAVQNpRNJbGG_8B4uGw3Q.text: the view is spectacular, not so much about the food! i ordered sea food scallops lobster shrimps and the lobster was completely over salted! i've had like 3 glasses of water with that meal! very expensive and not worth it!

BFeHZpyPjtKlxsEFvQP8Ag.text: Only get 1 star for the view. The lobster ravioli was awful.I had to add lots of salt for taste.I should have told the waiter but i didnt want them to spit in my food so i just ate the bread.Dinner for 2 was like $180 (tax & tip) plus an $8 glass water container and no desserts.Not worth it at all.So i suggest going else where. Then again this was 3 years ago so i hope they improved but i will NEVER go back. Eiffel Tower Restaurant in Paris so much better plus we got 2 desserts and still less than what we paid for at Top of the World.

NaXmZmCcBHrJlPtst4PJMw.text: The view is worth going for. The Food was great, but I thought it was a little pricey. If you're going on the thrill rides, do those BEFORE you go eat. I had the Prime Rib sandwich and it was very good, juicy, and tender cuts of meat. The service seemed a bit slow, even though there were only a handful of patrons when we went for lunch around 3 pm. Would recommend for the view, the atmosphere is a bit blase, but the rotating seating area is something to see. Overall would recommend for nice romantic dinners.

vJ0DIu4d1jpViVDnHaNJGg.text: just a neat place! food was good and the view was even better. :)

Ydgtg_7xluTvbK_UCDOKCQ.text: First, let me say I and my wife have celebrated our anniversary at the TOW for 18 consecutive years. On 4 October we once again made reservations for 5:30 PM so we could enjoy the sunset and Las Vegas Lights. We arrived 20 minutes early, checked in and went to the lounge. We were called and were shown to our table, by the window, as requested. When the waiter arrived he began speaking very fast and in broken English that neither of us could understand. The only understandable word was "soup". I asked the maitre de if we could have another waiter. After a few minutes he returned and told us there were no tables available for at least another half hour and he indicated we could wait in the lounge. On the way to the lounge we noticed many tables were vacant. When we asked about them the maitre de replied: "We don't have any waiters for those areas yet." I and my wife were both flabbergasted by this strange occurrence of events and expressed our feelings. By now, both of us were discouraged and we decided to leave. It is very unfortunate that a good waiter will suffer since we normally tip between 25-40%, depending on the service. We were staying in our Motor Home at Sam's Town and we decided to return there and try the restaurant. We were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food and the service was excellent.  I am sure we will miss dining at the TOW but we can afford better service.

PU3rWgrh94X8pOArSBNQOQ.text: Getting into this restaurant is almost like going through airport security, just without the pat down.  I had called and asked about dress code, then asked about reservations on a Tuesday night. The woman I spoke with said it was necessary if I wanted to get in.  After finally getting in, there wasn't anyone else there. In fact, they just opened and were still setting up. Great views as the restaurant rotated.  Watched the sky jumpers fly by!  Got a great waiter, Kevin.  Being my second time here, I knew the prices were a little high, IMO. But forty bucks for chicken? My wife said it was good, but forty bucks?  I understand the ambience, which was nice and the overhead. My wife wanted to split a meal with a friend who joined us because she is a light eater. The waiter told us they would have to order an 80 dollar meal and there would also be an 8 dollar plate charge.  Huh? Is this customary at most high-end restaurants?  I ordered the salmon, which was excellent. The Yukon Gold mashed potatoes were absolutely delicious.  Bread and butter was very good also.  Overall, it was a good time.  I did expect to pay a pretty penny to eat here.   If you are talking about value for the cost, though, this did not meet or exceed my expectations. But I think the next time I want a great romantic meal, I will choose some place else.

4LkPmky4u399ziQFxZPxVA.text: On a trip to Vegas a few months ago  we decided to give the stratosphere a try for our last night in town. Paid les than 100.00 for the oasis suite on Sunday night. We were looking forward to dinning at the Top of the world restaurant mainly for the view. Getting to the restaurant was somewhat of a challenge from the time we entered the elevator loading area on the main floor to the restaurant.  Had to ask for directions a couple a times. Once seated we began with their very taste bread basket and wine.   My wife ordered the ribeye and was fairly satisfied with it, but not a memorable steak. ( I prefer a fire charred steak)  We shared a huge twice baked potato (very good) and field greens salad. I ordered the lobster bisque (not bad, I've eaten better) and the prawns, scallops and lobster plate. The roasted salad and the scallops were very good, that's where it stopped. The lobster and the shrimp had a little bit of foul fishy taste. I could not identify it at the time but the other day I was eating crab legs and took a bite of the shoulder meat, there's that the taste I remember. We will not be back for the food, but if we book a room we may have a drink at the bar for the view.(fantastic view)  There are much  better restaurants in town for the same prices. I give the view 5 stars.

U8o_3FQE9I5iSmBhQjxvdw.text: So, the Fella and I had a great spontaneous weekend in Vegas.  Business trip layover that turned into a little holiday for us, complete with show and gambling.  Yay!  The Fella had heard through the grapevine that lunch at the Stratosphere was delicious, and a bit of a better deal than the dinner, so we tried it out before I schlepped off to the airport.  Pretty much everything on the lunch menu was around $20, and that included the price of the ride up to the top.  After our meal we were also able to go to the indoor observation deck, and would have gone to the outdoor deck as well, but it had closed due to a lightning storm. Let me say, I was a little nervous... not about the height, but about the rotation.  I get seriously motion sick, and even just the swaying of the tower could make me ill.  Fortunately, it seems that the circumference of the rotating area must be larger than other rotating places I've eaten, because I was able to enjoy the sweeping mountain views, and the top notch prime rib!  The Fella isn't usually an atmosphere kind of guy, but he LOVED it (the steak helped, too).  We'll be back!

ErF5be2Drr7W5Nzb3v1ECA.text: Great restaurant with a spectacular view. The food was good, but you really pay for the view. Don't forget to walk outside to the observation deck and take lots of pictures!

E2nhuaWpn9tcR_O0eiZE3Q.text: I want to make this pretty short and sweet. The food was good, but not at the ridiculous prices that they charge. The view is gorgeous. It takes about an hour and a half to see the strip go around once, not 15-20 minutes.

5oeYPJVrUuSmZ1EYzQQA8A.text: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday Sunday evening.  I want to start with one note about Stratosphere employees- they ARE AWESOME.  Everyone from security to the janitors were so FRIENDLY.  I mean I have never had a janitor be so nice (she was working Sunday night around 8 or 9 cleaning the bathroom in Top of the World restaurant.)  This was my first time in the Stratosphere ever and I was very impressed how darn nice every employee was.  It makes a huge difference when even janitors and security are nice!  Anyways, I will start the night at security!  My first impression of a line going through a metal detector was "ghetto!"  I didn't realize to get to the top of the Stratosphere that we would be subject to a pat-down!  I never experienced this anywhere else on the strip.  There was a delay for my boyfriend and I so it took us longer to get through.  The security kid called the restaurant for us and told them we would be a bit late.  How nice is that that he did that for us???  The security director came and cleared us to go up after a brief wait.  So we go upstairs and of course the person operating the elevator was super friendly (as was a different person on the way back down.)  The Top of the World restaurant was kind of older looking- like the carpet was very thin and worn-out looking but it was still cute and of course the view is so neat!  Can't beat the view.  Our server was also very good although a bit pushy throughout our meal to upsell us on drinks, upgrades, etc.  A bit annoying because we don't drink alcohol much and I am trying to cut back on caffeine sine I am trying to get pregnant.  None of her business but it was annoying to be asked over and over again if we wanted drinks of coffee.  I digress.  I ended up ordering the tasting menu for $90.  Quite expensive considering the portions I received for the tasting menu.  I would have been better off just getting a meal and a dessert.  I swear it would have been the same price but I would have gotten full-sized items.  My tasting menu started out with lobster bisque.  It was excellent!  I could definitely taste the sherry and cream that was poured over fresh chives and lobster pieces.  Again, it was not a full bowl but enough.  Then came one scallop in a grain and sauce.  The scallop was pretty good but could have been seared more.  Next came a full-sized salmon portion with some kind of seed crust, two prawn and it was over some mayo-type cream and baby potato halves.  I was absolutely disgusted by whatever the mayo-cream was.  It was thick and literally was like mayonnaise.  So gross!!!!  The salmon was good but very oily- and I am not talking about natural omega-3 oils.  The prawn were overcooked.  My boyfriend's meal of fettucine pasta with lobster, scallops and shrimp arrived with my salmon entree.  He ate all the seafood but was sad the pasta was very buttery and not cheesy.  Major fail that a "nice" restaurant can't get an alfredo correct.  Both entrees were very disappointing.  I upgraded to the grand marnier cake which my boyfriend said ended up being a $15 upcharge.  I hope that I misheard that because I would not have upgraded had I known that.  Not worth it at all.  I love cake and this cake was lacking in taste.  It was a cake wrapped in a hard chocolate shell.  Very pretty but I prefer frosting to thin, hard chocolate.  I just wasn't terribly impressed with the food.  Honestly I would have been happier eating at Nora's or Honeysalt and just seeing the view from Mandalay Bay or the ferris wheel at the Linq.  Dinner was a total of just under $200.  Absolutely not worth it.  The view is cool but if you come here I recommend not being sat for a full dinner.  Just go get drinks and an appetizer.  Don't waste your money on the tasting menu either.  $90 is crazy when it wasn't that good of an entree and you don't get much in terms of starters.

Buht8i7kJfdkq7F6W154qw.text: the restaurant is very nice and the views are spectacular...def an ideal place to go if you want something special and romantic. they also had a live band that was really good. i really enjoyed the food as well. the crab cakes weren't the best i've ever had but it was really yummy. the ribeye steak was cooked to perfection: tender and juicy with a delicious horseradish crust on top. the sea bass was plain but the sauce it comes with has loads of flavor. the only complaint was that our food didn't come out piping hot...i think our waiter (an old man) took too long to give us our food so it wasn't as hot and fresh as i'd like...and for the price you pay there i would expect hot and fresh food! oh and they give you 3 different flavored butters for the bread and butter is good already but flavored butter is bomb.com!

js0-EXH5U1PdBj-PNL81ww.text: The food was so amazing, the meat was cooked perfect, veggies same. And the mashed potatoes by far the best. Our waiter was awesome and friendly, he made the experience so much better. I don't remember his name he had glasses and was a taller gentleman. Def going back

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AmaZing view and service!

pNgpTTsz0jA7p3bFl5L0tw.text: My husband and I went here for lunch, and it was...fine.  The interior is a bit dated, which is to be expected, but so is the menu.  What they do offer is nice food, but nothing particularly innovative or inspired.  That said, the restaurant offers a wonderful view of Vegas that you literally cannot find elsewhere.  That view, combined with well-prepared food, guarantees you a solidly good time.  Vegas has many highs and lows in its restaurant population.  Top of the World gives you a reliable middle ground that will not give you any unpleasant surprises.

lwYV_xRIKquHsD-Ov8vReg.text: The restaurant atmosphere was a little bit dated. But it was expected since stratosphere has been around longer than most fancy restaurants in Las Vegas. But the view was everything! Stratosphere is famous for their 360 rotating view of the city. There are some sections where you can see people bungee jump off thr building. Its scary to watch I guess because we had several people warn us about it. A photographer will  also go around and ask if you want your picture taken and sell them to you later for $25-$45 depending on what you purchase (very touristy). Our waiter was funny and often checked up on us. For service I would give it 5 stars. I would give the food 4 stars it was good but not the best. I ordered lobster bisque and the color was darker than normal and it was way too salty. They pour the soup from a container in front of you. I also ordered the surf and turf (lobster and filet mignon) that was pretty good. For drinks I got a Kentucky mule. It was not strong at all and there was not enough of the Ginger beer taste. They didn't make their drinks so good there. My bf got the Lamb chops. I actually preferred that over my steak since his had so much more flavor. Overall I would still give the place 4 stars because it was still a magicial experience mostly from the view and service. But the food and drinks could have been better for what we paid for.

3rOnl6JqRogH_IaDSks7Hg.text: Painful!!!!....just getting their was a hassle !! Food wasn't even great ..I wish I spend all the $$$$ somewhere else an fancier an more top notch where I can feel that nervousness like I don't belong here.. It was loud an busy not that quiet an intimate setting an staff was horrible!!

pRbwzlEyZld43efzPHlbKA.text: Food and service were great with a 360 view atmosphere is a plus!  Amazing spot if your celebrating a birthday, anniversary etc.

7Ga130EC5G0VKbArxyBSrQ.text: Amazing food and amazing view. Pricey obviously but it's such a special time and the food and service is so excellent that it's definitely worth it. I would highly recommend this place to all couples looking for a romantic Vegas dinner. Remember is rotates, so if your stomach get turned easily I wouldn't suggest it (or ask for a table at the part that doesn't rotate). I had an amazing time and the service was spot on. I could have cut the filet with a spoon because it was so tender. The rotation takes about an hour which is perfect for a nice dinner. I also suggest making reservations, especially on a weekend. For a filet/shrimp, filet/lobster tail, 2 Cokes and 2 caesar salads it cost $210 before a tip.. so have your wallet prepared! Totally worth it though, I'm telling you!

LW-nY7C1UNmEne5nvTMxCQ.text: Great for special occasions because it is a bit pricey. Went there for my B-day dinner AND got engaged the same night!! Food was great, service was pretty good but our particular server was a lil strange. Restaurant spins slowly so everyone gets a great view while they dine. We went to happy hour first and had some cocktails before dinner.

wX1xOlB7olQH_FXxlRwsqg.text: Gorgous view! Love that the floor moves so you can get a 360 view. Great food. Vegetarian options.

Jc2NHD7bR3WiuZFt4epmiA.text: Vegas is pricey these days...and every celeb chef and their uncle has opened a sooooooper-high-end restaurant in Sin City to capitalize on the wannabe-foodie trends.  Most of these places are in windowless casinos, or worse, underground in the bowels of echoey mega-malls along the strip.  If you're going to pay $50 for an entree, don't you at least want a view???  Yes, you do.  And this is precisely why you want to reserve a table at sunset at the Top of the World Restaurant.  Trust me, it's worth it.    The service is superb, the diningroom isn't uber-crowded or loud, and the waiters hop around the spectacular moving dining floor like ballet dancers!  Your water glass will never fall empty, your dinner won't take forever to exit the kitchen, and if you are a glutton (of COURSE you are, you came to Vegas, didn't you?!!), this is a great place to indulge!  Nothing on the menu is visionary.  If you're looking for molecular gastronomy, far-flung ingredients you've never heard of, or deconstructed dishes with fifty ingredients that all together amount to two whole bites of food, you've come to the wrong place.  You come here for the view, and a perfectly cooked steak.  And while you're at it, try the Lobster Bisque.  It's exquisite.  I promise!  I ordered the Turf and Quack:  A sublimely seared hunk of foie gras perching next to a like-buttah rare filet, complimented by a divinely tender duck breast.  There are sauces on each of these, and they are all tasty.  But even if you ordered this dish without sauce, it wouldn't matter:  the quality of ingredients plus the perfection with which they are cooked is enough to make a girl swoon!  Rumor has it there were some carbs on that plate, too, but for the life of me, I couldn't tell you what they were, because I was so busy moaning over each buttery bite of duck, foie, or filet!  Oh, yes, the floor moves......very.........sloooooooooooowwwwwly.  Don't worry, unless you are particularly sensitive, this won't make you queasy, and in fact, since it takes almost an hour to do a 365 degree rotation.  You will be warned by your server not to freak out if you see someone sky-diving by during dinner...this is Vegas, what would your vacation be without vicariously enjoying a flying Elvis or three?!  Next time I'm in Vegas, this is at the top of my dining to-do list...After all, I can't imagine a better way to spend a Sin City sunset than dining on a delicious dish and whiling away the hours at the Top of the World...!

Ht11bpUGYyqFGobbAvXrnQ.text: WOW! At the Top of the World  1st told we were not dressed formal enough to eat dinner and then they decided it was OK. What a view, food is excellent, service great.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My dinner, fettuccine with shrimp lobster scallops

DH1uo95n4fACM9ahsEKryw.text: Absolutely awful experience! Server was not attentive at all, food took an hour to come out and was completely disgusting! I got a salad and it was gross, ugh what a horrible waste of money. The scenery was beautiful but the restaurant is in desperate need of fixing up and so are the staff and  chef! Mind you this was on a Wednesday afternoon, not busy at all. Please don't waste the money you will be disappointed! They said they would call the manager and he never even came out.

vN3zwpltxquTAuBKw6tDng.text: I have been to Top of the World the last few times I been to Vegas and always had good experiences. You seriously can't beat the view of the city. The latest time, I came here with a few friends for their 2 for 1 drink happy hour. Service has always been friendly and prompt. I ordered their dirty martini which was well made and delicious. We also ordered some appetizers which were pretty tasty. Yes it is pricey, but that is what I expect for Vegas. If you haven't checked this place out, it is definitely worth the trip to the Stratosphere. Also, you get to see all the jumpers (bungee that is lol).

84MSvfcJw_oq3XJEfini8A.text: Thought this would be a nice different Vegas experience. First time in The Stratosphere. My wife had the roasted chicken which was ok, I had lobster thermidor which had a weird taste and has pieces of shell in it. The service was very good and the view is great, too bad the food wasn't

4N6cZ_UWnRNJIyxqe8Txug.text: What a fantastic dining experience! The restaurant is top notch and the food was some of the best you can get in Vegas. The staff beginning with the moment we stepped on the elevator until we got back down to earth treated us like royalty. Our party of four had four of the appetizers, which were all amazing. The Lobster Bisque is something out of this world. Our steaks were cooked to perfection and we ended our meal with a sampling of amazing deserts. I plan to take as many friends and family as I can back to experience a perfect meal with a phenomenal view and incredible service

SSKFQSg9Jzz7q7xLfvynZQ.text: I made a reservation 20 days before visiting the Las Vegas. We arrived on time but they made us wait more than 30 minutes. We noticed all people who arrived with us where already sited. We spoke to the hostess but with a very rude attitude was like we have a table for you next to the window you just need to wait 5 more minutes. They let another couple first and talking with them they had a reservation after us. We then went back to ask what was happening and same answer, they were cleaning the table and to wait (not apologetic at all). We then said No thanks and walk away. Really not the what we expected...

6MDViU41t6ZtTrGtZTSRqg.text: So I finally got to check this place out and i did have higher expectations than what it actually turned out to be. I was surprised to find only one vegetarian option and the service wasn't as good either for the price you pay. I ordered the salmon which was about $50 and even though I asked for it to be cooked well because I dislike super fishy flavors it still has a very strong fish flavor. the view of coarse was spectacular besides that I don't think I would go back but it was nice to have experienced it finally.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon with cauliflower puree.

lYIgvh8u0-FtghShJWdYoA.text: Bringing in the new year on Top of the World! We had reservations for dinner and were seated perfectly on schedule. The staff was great, and our waiter was awesome. When I opened the menu the first thing I saw was lobster bisque, and I was immediately sold on the four course prix fixe menu! What a great value, and omg the lobster bisque was to die for.  If you've never had lobster bisque do yourself a favor and order it! Oh yea, the filet was good too. (But that bisque baby!)

wJZet1z4W3buvx_ec_JOOg.text: Good eats. Good service. Great view. A little warm due to the sun. Filet was cooked to perfection. Tomato soup was spectacular. Dessert platter is pretty good. Overall, decent gourmet. Dress up or down. Either way, it's a good time.

YxNgDZWlaZ8dBKV0XZjwdg.text: Food orgasm literally! As if the food wasn't good enough the skyline at night is just beyond ridiculous with this view! Wow!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Alfredo and lamb!

ntmGRkkL48fvmcImb27N2g.text: The view here is excellent and would be worth eating McDonalds if that's what was served.  Surprisingly great food that stands on it's own, regardless of the view.  An ample steak-house like menu, but some great gourmet upgrades.  The Foie Gras appetizer leaves you wanting to order a second dish.  The lobster bisque is a meaty and hearty bowl, poured tableside.  The steak is grilled and a great marbled cut, while the chicken breast was moist with a crispy skin and an amazing sauce.  While you eat, the entire restaurant slowly rotates, taking about an hour to make a full rotation.  You'll be sure to see the skydivers jumping from the roof right past your window at some point of the tour.  A little bit pricey but considering it's vegas and you're floating up above the entire city, the meal is not a bad value.

3Uv2BWCMccY8jqOdp7rRDw.text: You are only paying for the view. The food was uninspired at best. This places tries to be a gourmet room, but in reality is a cheesy tourist trap. Trust me - you can skip this one.

AZCGUUI5eg7UU6bUYFxh4g.text: I love the Top of the World Restaurant.  I always have a great time and a good meal here.  One time I had to send back my Chilean Sea Bass, but then they brought out the BEST Chilean Sea Bass I've ever had to replace it.  I do admit that it''s the view that bumps this review up to 4 stars.  I will always love this place.

BzOkhID96c5Ra4KvP3LbUg.text: Superb food. A bit pricey but worth a visit. There are rides at the top, so it's better to go during day time!! Dessert was amazing!

NBQF2m4fyzHciwGiO-XLyA.text: Dined on 4/30/08, party of two.  Excellent steaks, and the best garlic mashed potatoes we've ever had.  Service was reasonably attentive.  My steak was overcooked, but replaced very quickly  with perfectly cooked one.  Great view ... we got there about 20 minutes before sunset, to get both day and night views.  At the bottom, you go through a metal detector security check .,.. a complete joke and waste of time, very poorly implemented.

xrgPBu8SQ-GHN1V8EYncqg.text: I guess I expected more.  Great view.  I watched Vegas from the day time to night, which was nice.  The food and decor was average, it could be better. The only thing about this restaurant that makes it so special is it's view, but I live here.

wWMH0eALPR4ht6n-rTVhwA.text: if you're going to enjoy a breathtaking view of las vegas, then this is the place! if your looking for a great place to eat, try somewhere else. i had the filet and it was chewy. my husband had the ribeye and didnt like it either. the waitress never came bck to the table to ask us how are meal was but im sure they found out with the half chewed meat in our napkins.

9z2aSkR7CQDBzbXEpe_FGw.text: A little on the expensive side if you are just considering paying for the food, but wake up and look out the window. My wife and I spent the entire time staring into each others ey... I mean spent the entire time looking out the window. It was worth the extra money.

bAnmtuz1g963Fcg91tTUAA.text: Amazing food, drinks, and view! Really no really you have to come here and experience it for yourself!! The best!!

dAkh9jibIq-aDWmuge8QAg.text: Top of the world restaurant is a place you must visit when your in Las Vegas .The food is great and the service was the best.

gvN96z4gdRf9FVxUbn45mg.text: The food here was good, but wasnt' over the top impressive.  Go to this restaurant for the view mainly, because even though the service was great, and  cant reallly complain about the food, the journey to get there was a hassle.  The location of this restaurant is sooo out of the way, cuz it is at the end of the strip, "old vegas", then once you're in the hotel,  you have to go upstairs, way ALLLL the way thru their mallll, then take 2 elevators before you are up there.   Too much work, and that would make me never go here again.

_Mte3DVjjMUvAjvn_8s1uA.text: the most amazing view ever! it was totally worth the wait, which wasnt very long. I had my birthday dinner here and it was really special! the steak was soooo delicious. i love this place and im so going back!

1MYecyk-sAoSsmv5kpGmHQ.text: Poor service and poor food.  If I payed 20 bucks I would have been disappointed.  Considering I paid over 100 dollars per person, I was highly disappointed.  They did not even have the air conditioning working until the later half of my meal.  I went here 5 years ago and was very impressed.  After this last visit I won't return.

9zspCWy0bYhGN5Et_iqq_A.text: We went for lunch on a Sunday, because it would be more casual and cheaper.  I didn't expect a lame metal detector when you get in.  The restaurant spins very slowly, and takes something like an hour and a half to fully rotate.  I can't imagine getting dizzy because of this, but with enough wine, I guess anyone could.  Obviously everything is pricey.  I don't think the food was amazing enough to be priced that way, but it was very good nonetheless.    The view was great, I imagine its really great at night as well.  There are crazy rides on top of the building, so occasionally you see a glimpse of people flying around above you.  Service was impeccable, and we ended up staying almost two hours.  Glad to have gone, but probably wouldn't go back.

fGz2pjSW48g_I3I_Z30Zqw.text: Atmosphere: 360 rotating glass view from the highest point of the tallest building overlooking America's city of lights... need I say more?  Food: Filet Mignon was great, roasted potatoes are crunchy and seasoned deliciously on the outside, with the consistency of mashed potatoes on the inside. Pearl onions marinated in a sweet sauce are amazing. Wine was good, dessert was a chocolate version of the Stratosphere itself.  Service: 5 star service from a 5 star restaurant, would you expect any less?  This is on my "must try before you die" list.

0d2IibKJhEMmuInl-_3tLA.text: Great view with mediocre food. The service is hit or miss. Not much more to say about this place.

_y65P6zGdThujMjoC4X5KQ.text: Excellent choice for a special dinner while visiting Las Vegas. Especially at night so you can view the amazing cityscape below as the hotel turns extra slow. Food was really great and the staff was so helpful. We have been there on a number of occasions but decided to take our 11 month old and were a bit worried of how it would work out since the restaurant does not seem to be "kid friendly" and more "romantic". Soon as we arrived, they were extremely great with us and even kept stopping by to say hello to our daughter. She loved the place and relaxed while mommy and daddy had a great dinner. Would highly recommend this place to anyone! :) Will definitely visit again soon.

JR6eIWpmuQFmg-LNX3vMKQ.text: First let me start off by saying the manager Buel stopped by the table and was so personable.  Meeting him really explained the amazeing service staff he has because positive attitude like his tends to have the trickle down effect.  This place is in the running for best view in vegas and let me say it is well deserved.  I brought a friend up with me and although the view wasn't wasted on us I couldn't help thinking how nice it would have been if I had brought my boyfriend up.  The food is amazeing all the way down to the side dishes.  I love my vegetables so I had 3 sides and each had the expected texture and flavor I was looking for.  Start out with the pork belly you will not be dissappointed.  The plan cha main was to die for.  I had the greatest service by Sheila (very attentive, sweet and knowledgeable)  but great service did not stop there.  Jen the photographer took the nicest pictures of us and was not pushy with the sale.  I would buy anything from someone like that.  I don't know who the chef is but he really knows what he is doing.  I wish I could get him to cater some parties for me.  I would be the envy of all my friends if I could serve food like that.  I just hope the staff here will take time to pay it forward and write nice reviews about others as well.  Let's spread the positive energy whenever we can.  I will be back.

4qTq-w5Z5L4sJq5Shvs-Ww.text: Similar to other folks, I give the view 5/5, and the food 3/5.    It's certainly not that the food is _bad_, just that it doesn't live up to the prices.    we ordered the four course tasting menu with wine.  The food was good, not great; the wines were uniformly tasty.  Some of the wine-food pairings were questionable - one dish was a roasted lamb chop served with a sauteed sea bass.  the served strong red wine tasted nice with the lamb dish, but wine accentuated the fishy flavor of the fish dish, which I don't think was the intended effect.  Desserts tasted good, and were very well presented.  Overall, I would definitely recommend it for a romantic or memorable dinner.   In my opinion, _don't_ order the tasting menus, as the extra cost in food isn't worth it here. Order an app, an entree, enjoy the wine menu and recommendations, and save room for desert.  The view, however, is worth the cost, especially around sunset.  I'd suggest coming ~30 min before sunset, so that you get some lighted view, and get to see most of the lights on.      last 2 tips:  every seat has a great view, and there is free valet parking at the hotel for anyone who has a reservation at the restaurant. turn right when you come in the parking lot.

fe_uhevtjA1jlWWn7NATvw.text: We have been to the Top of the World many times.  Spending tons of money and never had a situation like our 10th anniversary evening.  First off, the receptionists were not on their A game that night.  Sorry, but that is not my problem when I am going to spend $160 for dinner for 2.  Finally got to our table about 30 minutes late.  Dinner and the view is always incredible.  However once our dinner was over that was pretty much it.  When we were seated the greeter wished us a happy anniversary and that was that... not a complimentary NOTHING.  We were pretty bummed.   We have decided to chose a new fancy restaurant for our next trip to Vegas.

e29WNrwEmUOg1yrv-0lIBw.text: My husband took me to Top of the World for my birthday this weekend and we had a great experience. While we waited for our table we went up to the lounge above. Live band and attentive bartenders. Great place just to have a few drinks. Our server Lou was great. She was very honest about food options and she was attentive. We both ordered the pre-fixed four course meal. First course we had Caesar salad which was delicious. Second was crab cake for me and saw bass for my husband. Crab cakes were so delicious bursts of so many flavors cilantro and capers tasted great together. Sea bass had great flavor but it was on the small side, but great flavor. Third we ordered filet cooked medium. It was delicious with mushroom sauce and string beans. Fourth course were two measly mini desserts it was disappointing. Dessert is what we always look forward to. One bite was a bananas foster which was really good the second bite was a dry chocolate with some fruit jelly maybe raspberry it wasn't good. But it didn't ruin the experience. Ambience is nice and romantic. Even though I have lived here for 8 years I never tire of looking at the valley lit up at night. We had a great experience and will go back!

K2U-nIsP2eyFSDAH7PmH_w.text: This is by far one of the fanciest restaurants I have ever been to. The whole room slowly spins around so you never get a bad seat.   The food portions are just okay, not great.   The service was one of the best I have ever experienced. Our waiter, Jeff, was incredibly kind, very professional and constantly checked on us during our meal.  The reason I left off 1 star is for the portions, price and the main reason is that this restaurant and the Stratosphere is in a VERY bad part of town. Me and my Wife accidentally walked down the wrong street in a suit and dress and got harassed by some gang banger. Literally one block later, there is the Stratosphere. This isn't their fault, but it takes away from the overall experience.

aM8Os-wi0h7NSRRDCtVPWg.text: I made a reservation at Stratosphere Top of the World for 3/22/12 7:30pm.  When I made my reservation I was asked was there an occasion, I stated that it was to celebrate a Birthday.  I contemplated the Palms Alize(great service, great food, great scenery) or Anthony's in the M Resort.  I choose the Stratosphere.    The food was over priced.  The food tasted that of a $15-25 range.  The alcohol drinks were decent.  Scenery was nice but not worth the price.  Folks are better off ordering Apple Bee's to go and paying the $7-10 to go the top and eat while watching folks jump of the side for the added thrill.  Not worth the money.  Glenn is a horrible server.  If you are a party of two he will ignore you.  Eric the waiter & Tomas the buser were the only two that provided exemplary customer service.  Eric was not our server but he did such a wonderful job in providing good service for the party of two next to our table I asked for his name.  Tomas was courteous and very helpful.  Do not waste your money folks just visit the top & eat somewhere else to get the bang for your recessional buck or dine at a place where the staff are appreciative of your business and are grateful you'll spend over $200 to eat at their establishment.

0DpNFFtJCYkkZeQ3C1eIug.text: The space elevator already exists. Ride it.    When I took the Stratosphere Tower Tour five years ago, I knew that the next time we went to Vegas we had to have a meal in the Top of the World Restaurant.  So, with a month's advance booking, we enjoyed a Saturday lunch here.    Looking out over the desert, no wait, out over the city, no wait, out toward the mountains ... from this rotating restaurant we saw the expanse of The Meadows as never before.  We could see the runways at Nellis.  We could see the red rocks.  We could see an entire train, all 4 engines and 100 cars, in one sweeping view below us.  Oh, how about 8 helicopters flying below us?  Yes, from 1,000 feet up, everything looks different.    Daytime or nighttime, it's a spectacular view.    Yes, we ate.  Let's see ... iced tea ... no, you know it was fantastic!  Here:  an appetizer of salmon with salsa, cream, and homemade chips, you had to be there to believe it, but go ahead and look at the pictures.  A Caesar salad that was not so Caesar, but an interesting mix of things.  Surf & turf.  You bet.  More salmon, on a bed of asparagus, or some such thing.  House champagne, which is why my notes were less than perfect.   OK, I forgot to photograph the entrees, what am I, a columnist?  No, I'm a guy who was having a great time in the sky.    Oh, yeah.  Stratosphere chocolate for dessert.   A variety dish, with 3 desserts on it.  Hey, I got a shot of that one!   OK, so lunch for 2 was $109.18 + tip.  If you need to work up the nerve to go there, try the Stratosphere Tower Tour first.  Then, when you want to impress Your Lady, take her to this "romantic experience" restaurant.  You won't be sorry.

rjqgRXLSpDM0vxWRFdJOpA.text: At first thought you would think that your going to overpay for the location and the view with decent food, but I am happy to say that the food did stand up to the prices and did impress. The filet mignon which is the best seller was perfectly prepared, drinks were delicious, service was top notch with recommendations and wine pairings more then expected. Appetizers, entrees, and desserts were all delicious and complimented by our great waiter. I would highly recommend dining here and taking in the breath taking sights, the entire floor rotates a full 360 degrees within 80 minutes, makes for a truly magical and special dinner in SIN CITY ;) call ahead and make a reservation. Remember: what happens in vegas stays in vegas

QxYc4_Gnmo_zHvX84RJCFQ.text: My friends and I visited there one year ago. Their service was so bad. Our server refused to split bill for us. When we insist to pay separately, he asked us to do the math by ourself. How rude and unprofessional. I'm not sure whether that guy is still working there. But definitely the worst "top of the world" restaurant I have ever seen.

X7xK5QxvG6Nd0wqGDycVHQ.text: Top of the World was a treat. I have been to a rotating restaurant in Phoenix and it is pretty high up there. Top of the World was way up there, I mean way up there, with beautiful and exciting views. The sunset was amazing.  Our waitress was very good. She made sure our cocktails were just right. TOTW has a nice wine list. We ordered a bottle of Tat.  For dinner I had the Turf and Quack. Everything was perfectly cooked.  Creme brulee for dessert. Delicious.  The band was quite good.  TOTW was such a nice evening.  A must in Vegas.

CxKEG5GeVCXADH02A0Vz7Q.text: Amazing love the food and the most amazing view I've ever seen in my life! Would deff come back

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RxblqcK-63WCytl2sy1ZLw.text: Went to this restaurant Saturday night for a birthday celebration with our friends. Of course the view is awesome added to our visual pleasure was a double yes double rainbow. I had read the reviews prior to going and some reviews complained about high prices and mediocre food. Yes prices might be a tad high (I'm originally from Chicago now a Neveda local) but didn't find the prices that extreme for a fine dining restaurant with an awesome view. I read several reviews complaining about the steak(s) having no flavor so I was going to steer clear of steak. I informed our friends about the steak reviews but 2 of them went ahead and ordered steak anyways. Both steaks different cuts and preparations were delicious. My hubby ordered seafood fettuccine Alfredo, I'm not a big Alfredo fan but tried it and it was loaded with seafood (lobster, shrimp, crabmeat) and had great seasoning very yummy. My reason for 4 stars is because I ordered the Colorado lamb chops. I had heard that Colorado lamb is the best and have had it before. 2 nice sized chops cooked perfectly (medium rare) very tender.  Problem it came with a glace sauce over it (which I was aware of) but the sauce was beef flavored so much that I couldn't really taste the lamb. So if you like lamb like I do I would ask to skip the sauce all together or ask for it on the side. The best dessert of the night was the bananas foster and the presentation isn't bad either. So if your celebrating something special or just a splurge night out this is the place.

oNMrKeljS1_5B7fCL4dzjA.text: Best view in Vegas,best service form waiter , best seat , nice food, if they take picture for u, it should be charged $65.-

LM-P7NKstJObnH0X1gRamw.text: This place was amazing. The food and atmosphere was amazing. I took my girlfriend here for her birthday. We had a great time. We got to sit in a booth side by side and enjoy the a 360 view of Vegas.  With the occasional bungee jumper and helicopters flying around. The steak and scallops I ate were hands down the best I've ever had. I wouldn't order seafood there again though due too the hefty price and small amount of food given (tasted amazing though). I'm definitely ordering what my girlfriend had. She had the organic Australian skirt steak. The potatoes gratin 4 cheese was really good too and the lobster brisk was amazing. I definitely can't wait to come back again. The service and everybody that works there were very nice.

ILHkPuvimrZC8m_cTKqwMA.text: Excellent dinner.  We got there a half our before our reservation and they were able to seat us right away and still got a window seat.  We each had a steak, lobster bisque,  split a wedge salad, and twice baked potato.   Everything was very tasty and we'll cooked.  The service is very good as well.

CrcCR-eszQWemYRA5uocbA.text: Simply amazing. My partner and I got married in Vegas earlier that day, and we went to Top of the World for our wedding-night dinner. The view was breathtaking, and we were given a romantic booth facing out. The hostess told us, with a wink, "Now those tablecloths go ALL the way to the floor!" (!!) Hah! Sassy!   Let's see, my wife had the four-course tasting menu - caesar salad, the scallops, I'm forgetting the third course (salmon?), and a tiny dessert duo. I had the surf & turf, and the lobster tail was to DIE for. The bread assortment & butter varieties were all so delicious, as well. I ate pretty much all of her dessert, and the pot de creme - delish.  We left stuffed and oh so happy. Great service, great food, great view (we even saw sky jumpers leaping mid-meal!).

4519eEqA5jXfa3tuwQHirQ.text: Great place to eat, food is awesome. Price is high but for the food and the view it is a one time per trip stop for us. Steaks are some of the best ever eaten.

NsbyIf7Gpvrkr8fRdmmmSQ.text: The food is spectacular. Some reviews here rate the food poorly. That baffles me. The food rivals the Eiffel Tower or Gordon Ramsay Steak at Paris or the restaurants at the Bellagio. If you're into views, you'll love your dining experience as well. Service is consistently excellent. Not cheap, but highly recommended.

ojTAcE8-4j_y1eOLff8yew.text: My son took me for dinner here to celebrate Mother's Day! We arrived at dusk & let me tell you the atmosphere was beautiful as it slowly turns and you are able to see a view of the whole city, it was just lovely as the sunset Wow then all the jewels (lights) came on gorgeous, my son is a gem and loves to take me to fabulous restaurants in LV. Our dinner was delicious & our waiter was very friendly we were not rushed at all. All in all it was a spectacular Mother's Day dinner! After dinner we went to the bar one floor up and had a drink sitting by the window and enjoying our conversation in our beautiful city!

-KQBwJM130tHFTs7pBEBlQ.text: Great experience! We went because we never ate here when we visit Vegas so we didn't have high expectations on the food, but we were very surprised with how gourmet the food was. I had the fish cooked in pumpkin butter and served with a side of butternut squash risotto and was on if the best I have had in a long time! Highly recommend this restaurant as a Vegas experience.

3wxuw-nJzxoizMMKBl7uzQ.text: Are we revolving?  Are we not revolving?  Oh god please let us be revolving, because if we're not then I'll feel like such the dumbass suggesting we have dinner in a revolving restaurant that doesn't revolve.  Those where the thoughts revolving through my head as we waited in the lounge for our table.  Thank Allah my prayers were answered and we were indeed revolving.  Does food taste better while it revolves?  Is it worth the hella price markup?  I would say, mehpm *shrug*.  I'm a big believer in unity and coming together, so this whole "everything a la carte" thang rubs me the wrong way.  In spite of being seperated at delivery my steak was delectable and the asparagus spears were mutantally large (see pic for proof).  We had a bottle of wine, that was difficult for me to order well knowing that I could buy it for 30 dollars less at Costco.  Yep, that's the classy dame in me coming out.  After dinner, you're allowed access to the observation deck.  Make sure to take pictures in the cheesy "Stratesphere" photo booth.  They make great postcards and you get a couple wallet sized as well.  All in all, I would come here, if this is your first time dining like a record baby. (right round round round)

Ps4gk_i4FBaaD1sqJHvbCw.text: Beautiful restaurant, fantastic view in the revolving restaurant. Great menu selection and food presentation. Service was excellent, plus my favorite bused dishes immediately.

FM0-vqKoukAgYkZrjgwU_A.text: What's left to say about this amazing restaurant, that every yelper has not mentioned. All to a Tee.   The service was wonderful.   The views were breath taking.   And the food? Delicious.   Truly Romantic.

5yNtYP7K7UNlcvukxdCyQg.text: I walked away (well, actually Skyjumped away) from cocktails and appetizers at Top of the World very pleasantly surprised by the experience.  This lounge/restaurant at the top of The Stratosphere tower is obviously a Vegas tourist spot, and the primary draw will always be the views.  I was part of a group of 6 ladies who were sharing happy hour cocktails and snacks on a Tuesday evening when plenty of table were available.  We were greeted by a very friendly hostess who set us up at a sweet lounge table with 6 wingback chairs, and presented us with menus and an explanation of the 2-for-1 martini happy hour.  We ordered a round of blueberry martinis which were made with muddled fresh blueberries and a choice of premium vodkas.  We were entertained to learn that the "2-for-1" meant that we would each receive two giant cocktails at the same time.  Whee!  We shared an assortment of snacks including duck sliders, shrimp cocktail, calamari, tomato-cheese fondue, and tuna tataki.  All were very good, and the presentation of each was lovely.  I was pleasantly surprised by the diversity of the flavor profiles among the dishes, as they could get away with a much more generic menu.  The portions were appropriately appetizer sized and, if one wanted to make a tapas meal out of happy hour, 3-4 items per person would yield a generous amount of food.  I regret not looking over the dinner menu, as our appetizers here were some of the best tasting food I had while in Vegas.  If I found myself back in Vegas, I would definitely go back to Top of the World for cocktails and snacks, and would probably give it a go for dinner.

BNygPCXF57eHk1lzY1lFtg.text: The food was good; the view amazing.  Ordinarily, the meal I ate would have rated three stars; but the view entitles that to an upgrade. I had a fillet rare with a mushroom  wine sauce.  We got the yukon mashed potatoes, glazed carrots, twice baked potato and button mushrooms for the table. I had a nice glass of merlot with my steak.  The twice baked was rich and creamy.  You really can't go wrong with bacon, cheese and potatoes.  It was Christmas Day when we went.  I was slightly  annoyed I couldn't  get a burger for my daughter because lunch items were not available, I was able to get a grilled cheese and fries for my son.  (Just as background: my daughter is autistic and incredibly picky, I would have been fine being charged for a steak and getting a burger, although I did not share this with my server, they might have been more flexible if I had shared.  I just didn't  want to get into it).    The highlight of my meal was dessert.  I had the tres leches trifle.  It was amazing.  It included traditional tres leches cake and fresh berries layered with fresh whipped cream.  The teardrop chocolate cake and the cheesecake mouse were also hits.  Thank you Top of the world for some yummy Christmas food.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres leches trifle
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate teardrop
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rwQ3v_wZSnLaQ8OAvsaP5w.text: Of all the restaurants in Vegas, this one is the most unique and memorable for me.  I have been here around 15 to 20 times and nearly every time I go I bring someone new to experience it.    The top of the word is a high class restaurant that rotates around every 80 min or so and gives you the most spectacular views of the city.  You should make reservations and request a window table.    If you want the most spectacular views then plan a dinner there so you can see Vegas in its full luster with everything lite up but plan on spending about $100.00 a head which is well worth the experience.  Trust me.  The food quality, presentation and views are all 5 stars.    There is a secondary plan that I exercise often and that is a lunch date.  Again, make reservations and ask for a window table. I typically go around 11:30am and they have a killer cheeseburger as well as a large variety of lunch items like salads and sandwiches.  The pricing is more reasonable (like $20 for a meal) and you also get free admission to go up on top and ride the many rides or just continue your time taking in some additional views and pictures.    So, let me repeat.  If you only have time or money for one "special night" then book your lunch or dinner here.  This is a lifetime experience that you will not soon forget.    I have to update this only because the pricing for the lunches has escalated just a bit.  The burger is now $26 and most all of the meals are $25 to $40.  Even the grilled cheese is $25, albeit I'm sure it's huge. Even at that this is still the best view in Vegas and worth it.   Enjoy!

0qKUzUqvOMMnb_EJPQgFzQ.text: Wow! The view is amazing! The food... All food served cold on cold plates. Mediocre taste and overpriced for quality of food and portion served.  Service was horrible.  We had to ask for items several times before receiving them.  Skip dinner and hit the lounge for 4-7pm happy hour.  1/2 price cocktails help soften the $18 price of a mixed drink.

gjj_nZ_lxUkx7Ltw2_E8FQ.text: The service was really nice and the view and atmosphere was great.The good on the other hand was terrible especially  considering the cost.I had salmon and my fiance had steak both were tasteless and my long island tea was horrible. It was so bad when we were leaving one of the employees asked how was our meal. The employee went on to say they get 70% off the meals and still won't bother to eat there. We were totally ripped of for what we were charged. Don't waste your time going to eat there.

ufohEo5mOUoHr_1ZPpU1NQ.text: If I were to advise anyone on top 10 things to do in Vegas this would be one of them. The view alone is a must see. The restaurant is very modern and classy with great ambiance. I made a reservation on OpenTable and mentioned that the we were celebrating our 1 year wedding anniversary. The staff were kind enough to reserve a booth with an excellent view. I really thank you!  A really nice touch is that they provide a complimentary starter - different breads with 3 types of butter (ginger & orange, basil pesto & classic)  For the main dish I settled for the bone in fillet mignon & foie gras with a side of steamed asparagus & poached egg. I asked for the steak to be rare and they got it absolutely right. The steak also featured excellent caramelization like you would expect in such a high class restaurant. The poached egg had the perfect shape and consistency, it complemented both the steak and the asparagus. Another nice touch is that the sides are shareable. (they bring them in a separate plate)  For the desert I asked our server to recommend something and she mentioned their all chocolate cake. I accepted the recommendation and I don't regret it. The cake was really well balanced and the right portion size.  All in all, this restaurant was the best place to celebrate our anniversary. We will be back! Thank you for the experience!

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Fillet Mignon w/ Foiè Gras

quiCqmIILKoUdSgwQbPeOA.text: Hubby and I were celebrating our anniversary and enjoying our first evening taking advantage of a baby sitter! In other words, the world was ours, we were going crazy and we were being extra indulgent. So even though we had already eaten, it was early and we still had plenty of time. We both were in the mood for a place with a view where we could share a couple small things. I made a reservation through Open Table without a problem only an hour prior. Perfect!  We arrived just around sunset, which I would absolutely recommend! The sky was beautiful and eventually melted away to darkness illuminated by the lights of the city. So fun!!  The mixed bread basket was brought to the table after only a few minutes by our friendly waiter. My favorite was one that had a Cheese on top. But the large, seasoned crackers were good, too! There was also a trio of butter with the bread. One was some kind of garlic chive, another was a sweetened ginger and then there was plain. They were so flavorful and absolutely delicious!  We decided to the share the pork belly Appetizer. Pork belly is something I'm always interested in ordering, even though I've had very hot or miss experiences. Good news - this was a hit! The portion was decent, the meat was crispy/caramalized on the edges while the fat melted to butter and the sauce was great!  We were torn about dessert...thank goodness they have samples sitting out for you to see and your table eventually passes by them. I really like seeing the desserts before ordering because it really is important to me that I get something large. Also, the waiter made a good suggestion - he insisted the the berry Tres Leches was one of their bests. So we went with that and a creme brulee. Both were great, but the tres Leches was definitely my favorite! It was a pit sweeter than the brulee and I really enjoyed the different layers and textures.   This place was perfect for our romantic evening! I would definitely recommend checking it out!

ZlDphjyYZC-BlMoJHEGZSA.text: Had an amazing experience here. My husband and I went 15yrs ago for our first anniversary and here we are years later and I am just blown away by the culinary adventure this place took us on. We got the 4 course dinner meal and also 1/2 dozen oysters, the Lobster and Filet carpaccio... this was a flavor explosion on my pallet and the turkey. Our main entrees were just flavorful, mouthwatering, and cooked to perfection. The desert was was just the perfect ending to this wonderful meal and experience.

PUohpGBS8GCJjWOGYMOdMA.text: Want Dinner with an outstanding view ?!....this is perfect place on top of stratosphere not only so you get great view but it rotates around as you are dinning so you can see All of Las Vegas !!!! The service was quality and the tres leches dessert is to die for !

-WltIo_jYw7ffAQTJQ0eog.text: Was an amazing view but that's all that was amazing. The French onion soup had Whole bay leaves in it I kept crunching on and one I choked almost on bc who puts bay leaves in a customer bowl or in French onion soup at all. The steak I got was the bone in ribeye and I had a hard time finding the meat on that it was all fat and grizzle. I asked for a baked potato they brought me a old one previously cooked and completely still fridge cold. The cream corn was weird very crunchy so you could tell it was fresh but the milk bath they call cream was super watery n bland all in all its like a retirement home cafeteria w a view

DV_qizGwsn9aj-6zeEAjBA.text: What a fantastic dinner! The price point is right on the money for a four course tasting menu. The view is phenomenal. The only reason why I am not giving it five stars is because me and my wife are patiently waiting for the new executive Chef Pawan to debut his own menu. I see nothing but phenomenal things for this restaurant with this remarkable Chef at the help!

wiAUpwrL6Ufp4LkLB14jag.text: My wife and I come up here  for the last 12 years for our anniversary. I understand the restaurant is under new ownership. We had dinner like every other year, the food quality was very poor. There was a new menu. My wife had the lobster bisque soup which was good. I had the chopped salad and it was good also. After that it was all down hill. My wife's 12oz lobster tail was dry and over cooked, my steak was just mediocre. We both had the baked potato and shared the mushrooms, which were also mediocre. Service was good except waiter never returned to check on our meal. When waiter returned we told him about the lobster. He offered to buy us dessert, nice but the lobster was $119. Anyway I hope they go back to the old menu which was much better selection. We will look elsewhere next year to celebrate our anniversary.

fRwC1ab3Vt6tQqBghJafrg.text: Wow!!! This place is amazing!!!! It was my first time here on Oct 19th. My boyfriend and I decided to go to Las Vegas for a few days for our anniversary. We were trying to decide where to go eat on our special day.   After doing a little bit of research we decided to go here! Absolutely worth it!!!!   Beautiful building, with an amazing view!!! It is located in the 106th floor! The elevator takes 30'seconds to go all the way up! Staff are really nice, well educated, friendly, social, and excellent customer services.   As soon as we got there they sat us since we had a reservation! The only thing was we didn't get a table right in front of the view but our booth was pretty awesome!   Since it was our first time we did not know how the restaurant looked like or how everything works! I was astonished!!! The restaurant moves around 24/7. The table routes all night!!! Giving you an excellent beautiful unique awesome fenomenal view of the entire city of Las Vegas!!!!!! Not only that but you can expect people flying in front of you because the skydiving is in the other floor!   Our waitress was awesome! I don't rememb r her name but she was on point!!!!!   Food was terrific!!! Omg so yummy!!!!!! Delicious!!!! The complementary bread was yummy as well!   We decided to go with the chefs menu selection! I upgraded mine to the lobster!!!   We started of with the ceaser salad which was very tasty!!!!   Then we got the seared scallops!' Super tasty as well   My filet was right how I like it medium! Very juicy tender!!! And my lobster was one of the best lobster I had!!! My boyfriend steak was a little bit over cooked but he was okay with that so we didn't say anything!!   Our desert was the pumpkin crume bule!! At first I was like ewwww because I don't like pumpkin but I decided to give it a try and it was good!! I actually liked it! They also gave us a complementary dessert for our anniversary very sweet from them!!   Our check came up to 300 with drinks and everything a little bit expensive but worth it!!!   I also forgot!!!! They take pictures and omg very professional pictures! We couldn't resist so we ended up buying them!!!   This place is awesome!! If you go to Las Vegas you must go here!!!'n the atmosphere is very good!!!!

nOa0P46e3v6mO2mnNSeM8w.text: I opted for Chef's tasting... total price was $102 I had lobster bisque, pork belly and salmon with basil pesto crust and prawns. The taste/flavor was okay. The portion size was bigger than I expected so I ended up having to take my leftovers home. I guess you expect mainly to pay for the experience and view of Las Vegas.

QuRt1DMf44k-zuiAq1rhhQ.text: To be fair, the view, as well as the ability to see all 360 degrees of it was fantastic. The rest was, at best, kinda so so. Walking through the smoky, dingy casino to get to elevator was less than enjoyable.   They started by bringing a bread basket to the table. It consisted of flatbread, which was fine, and cold, dense orange flavored, elementary school style rolls, which were horrible. In an alleged fine dining establishment, that was a big turn off.   My husband had the lobster bisque to start, and I can't say it was great. Thin, and a bit fishy tasting, not the rich, robustly flavored concoction we have had at other places.   The menu is pretty pedestrian. When in doubt, I don't push it, go for something simple, like a steak. I ordered the ribeye. After telling the waiter how I liked my steak, he strongly suggested I order it medium rare. Unfortunately, it came out medium. To his credit, he saw that I was not pleased and insisted on bringing me another one, cooked rare, which was perfect.   On the plate with the steak were two carrots. I ordered the steamed broccolini with mushrooms as a side. It was bland and the mushrooms just tasted wet and soggy. My husband had the filet and a twice baked potato. The steak was ok, not fabulous, and the potato was pretty dry and awful. We had the tiramisu for dessert. It wasn't tiramisu by any definition that I would recognize, but wasn't terrible. With tip and half bottle of red wine we were out a little over $300. For that kind of money there are a thousand other way better places. Again, we enjoyed the experience and were glad we had done it, but do not feel the need to go again.

QotlSvoQPAQ0DL_150F5Cw.text: My boyfriend surprised me and took me here on a Monday for date night. We sat right by the window and we were rotating. It was a cool experience. One minute we can see the strip, the next we can see the Golden Nugget casino in downtown. I ordered the Mango Madness for my alcoholic drink and I loved it. I could drink this more often! My boyfriend ordered the tasting menu with the steak, salad, pork belly and we got cream brulee with dark chocolate for dessert. I also ordered the sea bass for myself but my boyfriend and I love to share so we did try every dish together. I loved the salad. It was refreshing and just enough salad dressing. The tomatoes were yummy in it. The pork belly was so tender and juicy. Loved it. I didn't care for the crispy part in the pork belly dish. It was added for texture I guess. My sea bass was absolutely delicious and cooked perfectly. Our server said the kitchen gave me an extra piece of fish and she didn't know why. I was like ok great lol. I let my boyfriend try my sea bass and he loved it! And he's not a fish guy but he finished that fish quick. I really enjoyed my dish. He got steak and shrimp with string beans. I tried his steak and it was tender and delicious as well.  He ordered a glass of Riesling for his alcoholic drink. Our dessert was amazing. I loved the cream brulee and the chocolate that came with it. So good! I also ordered another dessert which was white cake with cream and fruit. It was served in a glass and it was good but I prefer the cream brulee. We went to the Skyfall lounge after dinner for some drinks. It was right on top of the dinner place. Don't forget to go look at the observation deck. It is very pretty!

tlhSm2PPZY4yiP2Ewk8FBw.text: If i was rating on the food it would be 5 stars-it was delicious. However, the service was horrible! If I'm paying over $200 for my husband and I to eat dinner I should not have to hunt someone down to get more water, ask for my food, ask for a box and ask for my check. We literally had to ask for everything... super disappointing. And I know it a small thing but we also had to box up our own leftovers, after I finally got the box of course! But again the food was FANTASTIC! Service would get negative stars!

RgCkHI2geR1HrzV43WN3BQ.text: Went there for a birthday dinner and I have mix feelings about the restaurant. Pros, the view is unique. We order the lobster soup and a salad and both were good. The bad, we ordered the bone in ribeye and even though it was tasteful I've had better. The other bad thing is the selection on the menu is very limited. Service was not bad

Bj-cqbwSH72fFHVaH9Jouw.text: Oh my. This place has seen better days. Walking through the very run down casino to get to the restaurant was most depressing to say the least. The woman in front of us checked her very large pocket knife at the metal detector and asked if she should check her necklace which had a little silver colored gun on it as well. Our elevator guy was friendly and that helped. Had reservations but they sat us away from the view. When asked if we could get a table closer we were told no that people were waiting in the lounge for tables . They then sat a couple who rode the elevator with us and had no reservations at the table with the view. The steak was good but not remarkable. Vegetables were swimming in sauces and cheese and pretty gross. Our waiter though was absolutely delightful and between him and the elevator guy, alone earned this restaurant the only stars given in this review.  Hope they both get jobs at one of the high end restaurants in town

ovgoeAiGkR95LZDbiAOhtw.text: 20th Anniversary Dinner Review 4/24/16  WHY WE LOVED IT  ROMANTIC, Romantic, romantic! I did not want the night of our 20th anniversary dinner celebration to end! Fantastic million-dollar views, romantic atmosphere, great service, and delicious food. What more could you ask for? A MUST for a special one-of-a-kind experience in Las Vegas!   I'll start off my review by saying that OUR SERVER, DANA G., WAS FANTASTIC! With higher-end restaurants, your server can either help make or break your experience. It was our first time dining at the Top of the World on this Sunday night and Dana helped to ensure that our 20th anniversary dining experience was absolutely five stars!  SERVICE: THANK YOU, DANA! From the couple in California who flew out to to Vegas to celebrate their 20th anniversary. I dropped my cloth napkin a few times off my lap and lost them while the restaurant revolved. Dana always got me a new one. I took a hundred photos, not satisfied with any of them because the restaurant had dimmer lighting for some romantic atmosphere. You offered to take a couple of camera shots for us and the photos came out fantastic! (We also bought some professional pics). You made great menu suggestions. I also want to mention that you didn't automatically steer us to the most expensive items on the menu (like some servers do, to get a bigger tip on percentage), but gave a range of mid-price suggestions. You were always smiling. You were genuine, happy, positive, super helpful, and that made all the difference in our visit.   VIEWS: 360-views in the revolving restaurant. Our dinner was at 7:30 pm on a Sunday night. We saw the glittering lights of the strip, the city, bungee jumpers, and helicopters touring tourists everywhere. Spectacular!  RESERVATIONS: We were about 20 minutes late arriving for our reservation. We called ahead to let them know. It's a long walk from the front of the Stratosphere where our cab dropped us off, through the hotel, and all the way up to find the entrance of the restaurant. You'll also go through a security gate/metal detector. We were willing to wait about 15-20 minutes for a window table, which was very much well worth it!   LOUNGE AND OBSERVATION DECK: Make sure you visit the Sky Lounge Bar on the 107th floor. The restaurant is on the 106th floor. The Outdoor Observation Deck is on the 108th floor. Don't miss any of it - breathtaking!   Interesting note: The elevator travels up at 21 miles per hour!   DINNER: Our dinner was served with assorted artisan bread.  JUMBO PRAWNS SHRIMP COCKTAIL WITH GULF PRAWNS AND COCKTAIL SAUCE $17 - served in a bowl. Yum! I was very happy with my jumbo prawns (see pics of food).   LOBSTER BISQUE $13 - creamy and delicious. My husband's choice - I tried his lobster bisque and wanted to steal it away from him.   SURF AND TURF LOBSTER TAIL WITH FILET MIGNON $79  - I went all out for my anniversary and ordered exactly what I wanted. THE BIGGEST LOBSTER TAIL I'VE EVER HAD! A 9 0z. tender filet mignon, a lobster tail served on a bed of spaghetti squash, and roasted vegetables. If you are into lobster and steak, GET THIS.  ORGANIC FREE-RANGE HALF ROASTED CHICKEN $44 - organic free-range half roasted chicken with bacon, mushrooms, and creme fraiche demi glace. My husband's choice. I tried this and it was absolutely delicious.   Dessert - we were really full by dessert time. On the house, we were given a warm chocolate lava cake with fresh berries for our anniversary and it was very good.   COST: With tax and tip, our anniversary dinner was about $190. Well worth it for this special occasion.   FIRST TIMERS - WOULD WE GO BACK? - YES! It was a beautiful dinner experience. We're thinking about bringing our children with us next time because they would love the view and being up 106 stories in the air during dinner. Our server Dana mentioned that they do have kids meals there for $14. Since they are well behaved at restaurants, we just may take them with us next time. I would like to try the Seafood Platter on our next visit!  We look forward to the next time that we go to Top of the World!
