q-hYwQJKQl6t2c-yCsneZQ.text: The view is the only thing they've got going for them. Maybe it's great for tourists, but for locals, who know what good steak and seafood really is, we weren't impressed.  The prawn dish came out warm at best, wasn't hot like I expected. The prawns were gritty and dirty :( The NY steak was overly fatty.. We thought the chocolate dessert would redeem itself.. Not so much. We've had a better steak/seafood experience at chains or other restaurants on the strip like Joe's Stone Crab for example. Just not worth the price.. They should really update the decor as well :(

E0bD-qb1cJuXgEu7IIcnVA.text: Fail! The food here is gross. First they brought out the wrong dishes and then our actual dishes, which were gross. Dirty dishes on the desert display, which we kept passing as we revolved around the restaurant, come on. I guess try the bar if you want to see the view. Glad I didn't bring our family here, bc they would have sent the food back. We just suffered through it. Nice view, bad food and C minus service.

uegU-iFMphn3XDx3yhtowA.text: This was an amazing dinner and experience. The service was terrific.  The night views were spectacular. Great for family and romantic dinner.

LZy-U671I_Pek8Dk_VArng.text: I have been to Top of the World many times before but the treatment I received here last week from Roxanne at check-in was so abysmal it actually inspired me to start writing for Yelp again.  Roxanne should not be working in customer service. In fact it is my belief she should not be working at all, and should rather be locked up somewhere with no human contact whatsoever. It is a week later and I am still livid, seething even, in response to her incredible rudeness.  I complained to the manager about her of course, she seemed like a nice person, but insipid and impotent. I am sure she won't even talk to Roxanne about her attitude.  The food is nice at Stratosphere, the view is great, but they really need to sort out their check-in staff. I could not enjoy my meal there at all after the rudeness of Roxanne.

aAQcOaIniijnmunTplNgBQ.text: Came for lunch today, and I couldn't be more disappointed. Our server was terrible, because she spent more time chatting with another waitress than she did her job. We waited 10 minutes to place our order, we had to ask for a drink menu 3 times, and we waited another 10 minutes after lunch to just ask for the check...because she never came back to see if we wanted another drink or dessert. We spent $150 on lunch, and it wasn't worth $40. The cheeseburgers were very dry and overcooked, but the short ribs on the bottom of the burger was pretty good. Too bad it was a very tiny piece of short ribs. Overall, very disappointed and wouldn't recommend anyone waist their money there.

_t2-7fyfzxjlHkx1Q56r3g.text: Ok - so I have to admit I'm a sucker for ambiance.  So I love the whole "revolving restaurant" thing.  Dinner is very nice for this...seeing all the Vegas lights.  I loved it!  So 4.5 stars for this!  The food was fine.  Wedge salad, seafood, steak....nothing to write home about, but still solid quality.  I didn't come here for the food, so honestly I wasn't expecting much.  If you're expecting high end gourmet food then you may be disappointed.    The overall experience is good.  I'd definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Vegas.  Is this something I'd do every time?  No.  But ya gotta do this at least once!

FNlvYOJKMcIFPMyNpd_xHA.text: Great view.  If you've been to the observation deck at Stratosphere, then you pretty know what type of view to expect.    The food was mediocre for the price.  I ordered the 16 oz. rib-eye ($54) with a 1/2 lb lobster tail ($26) and an added foie gras ($10).   -Rib-eye: soft but a little too fatty (and I like the fat on my meat) -Foie gras: small (what can you expect for $10) and good but nothing special.  A little too much liver tang in the flavor -Lobster tail: NO NO NO.  It was just completely wrong -- the flavor and the texture were just off.  One of the driest lobsters I've had.  As for the service.....well, it took nearly 20 minutes for someone to come around.  Then another 40 minutes for the food to come out.  And another 15 minutes at the end of our meal to get the Snoot face.    A cool part of the experience to note, however, is that the restaurant rotates very slowly so diners can partake in the "360" view.  The sudden awareness that the room was spinning gave me a split second feeling of drunkenness..until I realized that the room was actually spinning.    Overall, romantic ambiance.  Next time, I'm just going to hang out at the lounge upstairs after dinner elsewhere.  Same view and ambiance but better service.

7TGVjOr3BzTeoAbSuGT6zg.text: I took my girlfriend to Vegas to celebrate her graduation and chose Top of the World for the celebration dinner. However, our waiter treated us very bizarre. First he forgot our wine, which can happen from time to time and frankly was not a big deal. But when we asked him about the soup of the day, he replied with "I do not know, I think it is some kind of vegetable." Again, forgetting something after a long evening is understandable so we politely asked him to confirm what exactly it was. To his credit, he did. My girlfriend and I are extremely lactose intolerant and when the bread and butter was brought, he politely offered us olive oil and vinegar, which we accepted. However, when we brought it back, he went to us and I quote "you guys know how to mix this right?" Of course we know how to mix olive oil and vinegar but just to have been asked that question, especially at a restaurant like Top of the World, I was speechless.   Also, the food took quite a long time and because of the disappointing service, we frankly were not confident that it was dairy free. We asked the person who brought the food, which confirmed it but after looking at the Brussels Sprouts, we did not feel confident they were dairy free and did not eat them. The food that we did eat was very good and I do want to point out that the bus boy, whose name I did not get was incredible and I wish I could of tipped him directly.   I did ask to speak to the manager, who I did not get his name but relayed our concerns. The waiter than came back to talk to us and said it was "misunderstanding," which clearly it was not. We ordered wine and did not receive it, we received horrible service and then we were offered free dessert. A very kind offer, except being lactose intolerant, neither of us can eat it.   So after all of this, we paid full price. Now the money is not the concern. I know the prices at Top of the World and was happily expecting to pay what I did, but I expected top-notch service, which I did not receive.   In closing, as someone who visits Vegas on a consistent basis, I am having real reservations about ever coming back to Top of the World and also having second thoughts about referring it as well.  I truly hope the service improves because at its best, Top of the World is one of the best restaurants in Vegas.

FKaPaV8zbKjqvEQF5SulBA.text: As a vacationer, this is one of the best views of Vegas that there is. The food and service was equal to the view. We had the the fresh seafood appetizer ( gulf shrimp, fresh oysters, tuna poke, Alaska king crab, and lobster in a cocktail sauce, and the porterhouse was tender, excellent choice. I came here under the suggestion of a friend and he was right. Only thing is you need to be taxied in, I wouldn't suggest walking around this area at night.

7wqauug6wDyXZ8gRj5qbtw.text: I have to admit the view is awesome, but you don't have to dine to get the view. Just go to floor 107, it's a lounge where you can see the view. Floor 106 is for dinning.  When enter, they check like it's airport security. surprised. Waiting for the elevator take a while, good 5-10min per elevator which hold 6-8 people. Elevator seems a bit old, but does the trick. When arrived we were told to wait on floor 107 until called upon.  The restaurant spin around the tower at a slow paste of 4ft/min. Occasionally we see bungee jumper hanging outside, since they jump from a higher floor.  We ask the waiter to take picture for us, since we have our own camera. He didn't seems too happy about it, the picture came out blurry. eh...  Food is good but expensive. Expect to pay $90/person.  Overall, do it for a one time experience.

52a8aWcVX1cd80lopcPLUQ.text: Second time going there was this past Saturday on the 20th. The food was fantastic, as usual. I had the lamb and i must say it was quite tender which was expected for the price. My only complaint is that nobody follows the dress code.  My first time,  i was almost turned away for a hat and went on to see gentlemen in polos and women in tight blue jeans. I would love to be comfortable as well,  don't set "strict" guidelines that are loosely followed.

DRoX89vzDLg2NYfR3nkdcg.text: Excellent!  Must have reservations...  One of the best dinner ambiances and experience ever!  Fettuccini Alfredo with seafood was delicious!

G1bDc9BazrIjzFxP8FZcqg.text: We had the tasting menu which had a decent portion. Really friendly waiter, who explained what everything was in detail. The view was amazing. Just keep in mind that the sun will be in your eye if you plan to be there before the sun sets. Not the best place for foodies but definitely a good place for dates.

gO-tkX475qaBx5Oziv1cPw.text: Valentine's evening 2013, my wonderful husband surprised me with dinner at this restaurant as we had never been to either the Stratosphere or the restaurant before. I was so looking forward to a wonderful evening with one of my bestest friends and my wonderful husband. Unfortunately the experience as a whole left a bad taste in my mouth. It was a combination of the Management of the facility as well as another diner in the restaurant that honestly I wish I was able to confront for ruining such a wonderful evening.  Without letting that situation put a bias on my review of their food, it was mediocre at best and seriously over-priced for what we had tried to consume before being rudely interupted by the manager. It seems that one of the other diners near us were offended by our laughter and enjoyment, enthusiasm for being together, and certain words that were spoken at my table. The manager then approached our table, looked at me directly and asked that we refrain from these activities immediately. Now please keep in mind I spent well over 200 dollars for dinner and had not even been served as yet. I promptly requested to know whom had made such a request of us, as I intended to embarass and humiliate them as they had done to me. Maybe not the best approach but honestly - who in their right mind is so narcassistic to believe that they are allowed to go out in Public then mandate that the Public behave in the way they deem they should? If you are so easily offended by others, stay at home and don't ever leave.  Back to dinner, I gathered my things, my 25 dollar valentine's day dinner picture, my BFF and left my husband to deal with getting our dinner to go. We had split some of the meal with my friend so he had 2 cards and some cash he wanted to give towards the dinner with the intent of giving cash to the waitress after the transaction as a tip (we prefer tipping in cash as we believe the servers are not taxed on this and get to keep more of it - if that makes sense). I am not real clear on what the cash portion my husband provided was for as I think he had wanted to get change from it but it seems the waitress took it upon herself not to return 20 dollars of that cash. Funny, she was going to receive a much larger tip than 20 dollars as she was excellent, it was her manager that was the jerk, but just taking the money and not returning it, allowed us to assume thats all she thought she deserved and we did not offer anything more.   All in all, as I indicated, the food really wasn't all that compared to other places we have been to with similar offerings. The price was not fitting of the quality of food, the service was excellent but that last little action was uncalled for. The manager needs a class in people skills and the only real redeeming quality this place has is that it sits at the top of the Stratosphere, spins and provides a nice view of the strip when your table finally gets there. If it was just an observation deck with a bar it could have been a much better place to go. Overall I was pretty bummed that this place seems to get a lot of hype but really is disappointing in the end.

SZTflCOIurOwXQM0-UdpXw.text: Beautiful views, amazing service and awesome food!  The four course tasting menu with lobster bisque soup, black cod, filet and two desserts is beyond awesome and large enough to share with another person!  This with bottle of wine was only $165 whereas some places in Vegas would charge you 500 - 600 and would not have the view nor quality of food and service!

A4QhbWHVfRpfad7mhoU1EA.text: We had an amazing dinner! Pricey but totally worth it with that view! Got a 4 course meal and left very full! Glenn our waiter was amazing! Best date night ever!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing view of the strip

vMLm1HQ10cilsNyHOHcUdw.text: Reading reviews of The Top of the World before I dined here, my biggest fear of this place was the price compared to the quality of the food as some people raved, some people boo'ed.  Yes, we all know the view is the selling point, but why pay quite a bit of money for crappy food?  Well, I'll get to the food, but I feel there's more to speak about to give a better picture of this place.     First off, by all means, I recommend getting there about 75 to 90 minutes or so before sunset to enjoy a bit for the 2 for 1 martinis and the cool, hip music during Happy Hour from 4pm - 7pm.  The hubby and I went to Las Vegas in late February (good time to go IMO), got to The Top at 4:15pm, enjoyed a couple of tasty Mango martinis at the lounge above the restaurant before our reservation at 4:45pm - sunset was at 5:30pm.  Come 4:57pm, our pager for our reservation had not buzzed yet, but that was okay...we figured let's try another 2 for 1 cocktail...this time, we went for the Chocolate martini and BOY was this good!!!!!  And right when we got the Chocolate martinis our pager rang...good timing!    So...we are led to our table by one of the hostesses, and our waiter, Bon, introduces himself.   Both the hostess and Bon were relaxed and unrushed.  We are stunned by the view.  Oh...and the restaurant moves, very slowly, about 80 minutes for one complete 360 degree revolution as mentioned in other reviews.  We found it difficult at times to review the menu and/or to concentrate on the conversation since the view is always changing.  You'll see helicopters flying around, the sunset behind the mountains, the cityscape below you light up as nighttime approaches, and most likely a few thrill seeking vacationers skydiving off the Top of the World (when you have the Las Vegas Blvd. in your view, that's when you see them).   There's also signs posted on the columns warning you when your table is in view of the jumpers...we were lucky enough to have one guy jumping off the plank just when we were under him...my heart beat faster for him, and the gasps of the other diners around you, even though they know it's going to happen, are quite fun.    So how's the food?  We went for the four course tasting menu (currently at this writing for $90).  For the first course, we both went for the lobster bisque.  It was a great choice (but an easy one...this vs. salad???  A no-brainer); very rich and creamy.  Be sure to stir a bit to get that blob of lobster meat mixed into the bisque before eating.  Stellar!  For course # 2, hubby went with the crab cakes which he liked, but I sure enjoyed that seared sea bream with Tamari Brown butter!  So tender, and a nice crunchy skin.  The butter really enhanced the dish.  Course # 3 and 4, there was no choice; the filet, which was perfectly cooked to our liking and melt in your mouth good.  The deserts?  A chocolate mousse and a lovely "flower" with blueberries and white chocolate in it (and the flower is edible, too).  Both were exquisite.    We were so impressed with the food!  A real nice treat considering it's pretty easy to assume one is paying for just the view in places like this.  Not to worry about that here.    Some other notes...Bon felt our courses were a bit rushed.   He originally told us that each course will come every 25 minutes.  This wasn't necessarily the case (but I honestly didn't mind all that much).  He told us to take our time and take in the view as much as we wanted before desert, and when we were ready for it, we could let him know.  Nice touch.   When you're done for dinner, do yourself a favor and go up to the inside and outside observation decks.   You will get a good view of the skydivers jumping off on the inside deck, and those other fun looking thrill rides on the outside one.  And one last gander at those great views.    Well worth going to!  Having one of those Amex gift cards to soften the blow of the bill helps.  We're really glad we went.  We don't dine at pricey places often, but sometimes, a little luxury is necessary...especially when one is on vacation, and more so in the life of excess Vegas.  Go ahead and treat yourself and feel like a superstar.  Not to be missed for a fun, novel and tasty dinner in Sin City!

-ZGLsxCQaTapZvbAbYnZXg.text: I was taken here for dinner on the Sunday prior to Valentine's day and it was fantastic. We ordered:  -oysters -fettucine -surf & turf -mashed yams -green beans -cheesecake lollipops -bread pudding  The food was delicious, I think my favorite was the cheesecake lollipops. They are small bite-sized balls of cheesecake and you can choose what type of dippings you want with it. We chose cookies and cream. So delish. Service was excellent. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because the decor/ambience is a bit dated. The carpet is older. And of course you have to walk through the Stratosphere to get there, which itself is quite dated. Luckily there were no funky smells, and the view really was quite nice. Considering the cost (in the ball park of $300 without alcohol) and occasion, he and I were both dressed up. Most other patrons were too, although I did see one guy wearing a Lands End sweatshirt and jeans. I'm not sure how enforced the dress code is here. Overall though, an excellent meal. I think it would be in the restaurant's best interest to update the flooring and decor.

YtbdyYReExjGkp0tzRvOPw.text: This restaurant had a beautiful view to say the least. It rotates very slowly so you can view the entire city and beyond from 360 degrees (just like the Sky restaurant in the Space Needle, Seattle). The food was good, I wouldn't say amazing considering the price but good. The Au Gratin Potatoes were stellar probably the most memorable item that I had. The cocktails were good as well. I still could not shake the fact that I was still in a Vegas Casino type environment though, maybe the carpeting in the restaurant lol.

_pRBJRsUYxCD5cTgNAZSRA.text: Ugh, I ate here on Sunday and I still feel ill just thinking about it.  To begin with, the dining experience is terrible, and I can give five good examples right here.   1. They served a strangely sweet lobster bisque, and then later dumped that same weird-tasting bisque over the Surf and Turf Gnocchi Pasta and attempted to pass it off as "sauce."  Same unappetizing color and flavor.  2. Cold "house fries." Mind you, it was 12:30 pm (lunch) and there weren't that many people. I reason that the fries, at the very least, should've been made fresh for the amount of time it took to get them.  3. The bread and butter were BOTH hard as a rock. The butter must have been right out of the fridge. The bread...probably the same.  4. Vietnamese Banh Mi Sandwich was soggy and mediocre (a word I don't typically use to describe things with pork belly).   5. They serve beverages in tall goblets with long straws, so there's no good way to drink your soda without looking/feeling awkward or having your damn straw fall out of the glass if you move it wrong. It sounds trivial, but this is just annoying to me.   If nothing else, they should at least ditch their "Voted best gourmet restaurant in Las Vegas" brag (no sources or dates listed on the website) and embrace the True novelty of the place.   I realize "you're paying for the view," as so many other reviewers have stated. This ought to just become the restaurant's motto. The carnies working the elevators and the skydiving tourists dropping outside the window and interrupting the otherwise beautiful view just don't bring to mind a "fancy" restaurant. There's a huge marketing clash here.  I've never written a review in my life, but I think a sub-mediocre experience at any Vegas restaurant with $$$$ as a price range indicator is ammo for heavy scrutiny.

oZR9OIj_rrVoOyoVD05uMA.text: I took my mom to Vegas for her 53rd birthday for her first time ever and wanted to make it special. Boy did this experience truly make it such a special evening!!!! I cannot wait to return. My mom mentioned earlier in the day that the trip was "over the top," and i told her to remember that statement when we go to dinner, she said "omg this is why you said remember over the top." What an amazing experience. I had NO idea the restaurant moved even after reviewing on yelp, so that was such a nice surprise. I will never forget the dinner i had with my mom at this restaurant. Viva Las Vegas! Oh yeah and when we saw people jumping! Lol. My mom couldn't believe it-- she at first was scared and couldn't believe her eyes since she didn't know they did that there.

fQhUHht0XTCaGMwdROdtBQ.text: Wow words can't express how amazed I was of this with both the experience of Top of the World As well as their amazing food. 3z3UJt62g3PJe9KJ_ubYHA.text: I really love this restaurant! This was my third time. Now, first off, the first thing that I didn't like was the absence of the three different butters that they used to have. Now, it's this maple butter that neither one of us liked. But, our waiter did bring us regular butter which helped the situation. The lavash and the other bread were both delicious. I started off with a Caramel apple martini which was pretty good. But, it was a little more bitter and less sweet. For my second martini, I got my usual lemon drop and it was perfection. Our entrees were delicious. I had gotten the lobster Thermidor the first two times so this time I got the filet mignon and the lobster Thermidor. I have to say, the lobster Thermidor was more like just Lobster on a tail then the actual Thermidor, but it was still rather good. And the fillet mignon was broiled to perfection. He got the filet mignon with the shrimp scampi. Both of our entrees came with mashed potatoes and vegetables that were also delicious. He got the chef's tasting menu. And, the lobster bisque he loved, but the scallop was just one tiny scallop. He shared it with me but it was just one. I thought there would be at least two or three. Also, for dessert, it was a creme brulee and I believe a chocolate mousse that came with his chef's tasting menu and it was tiny also. Barely enough to share, barely enough for one. All in all, I still give this restaurant a 4. The food was rather good and the views are breathtaking. Afterwords, we did go to the observation deck inside and out and took spectacular pictures! WThe restaurant slowly rotated all around & we saw breathtaking views of Vegas in all it's glory!

mx_f8_DFY96QIrQkaglt1A.text: The View is absolutely amazing!! I am a local and the view from the ground is beautiful but from up here, its amazing!!  The food was delicious. I started with the avocado salad, with pickled onions (OMG so GOOD!!), cucumber and the hot sauce!  My main course was the scallops. The sauce made the dish. It was so good. Such a beautiful night.   Not 5 star because of the old school decor. Carpet needs a little upgrade.

PjpMZLLFVWa2jUCYiSrjMQ.text: I'm a big foodie.  I love to eat and I love an experience and when I'm about to spend $250+ on a meal with my lady, I have some expectations about the quality of the food, the quality and selection of spirits, the ambiance and the service.  It is obvious that you pay for the view which, by the way, is amazing.  It really is spectacular....that's pretty much all about this restaurant that's worth the money.  The menu is limited and if you aren't in the mood for steak, well, good luck.  Yes there are non-steak options but it is limited.  The bread is even so-so.  When I'm paying $70+ for an a la carte entre and the bread is meh...it doesn't set the rest of the expectation up to be very high.  Got the 4 course meal because it seemed like the best potential deal.  The lobster bisque was decent but didn't have a ton of lobster flavor.  The pasta noodles were actually really good but the sauce and meat really just tasted like something you'd get at a chain restaurant.  The shrimp was over cooked and under seasoned and the salmon was bland and anti-climactic.  $300.  Never going back but am glad I did the touristy thing and saw the amazing view.  The view is awesome and was worth it....once.

EJdJKu7lzaIbzOo9-r-PkQ.text: HORRIBLE service and food. Granted the view is beautiful, but our experience at the bar and with out waiter was the one of the worst we've ever had. We're more than willing to pay the price for quality food but the food quality was less than mediocre. I would not consider this fine dining, just poorly cooked dinners that there trying to pass as fancy. My side was the lobster Mac and cheese and I found a huge piece of lobster shell in it. The waiter and manager did not even apologize when we brought it up. Again the view was amazing but don't expect anything from the food, and the service was not only slow but almost nonexistent.

7Qu1dfk9PFrMUx8APOM0gA.text: 5 Stars is for our Server Joey who did a great job and was very knowledgeable about the menu.  Also went above and beyond with our multiple requests to take our pictures of the group with the view behind us.   1 Star for the hostesses system, not particularly to any specific hostess, but to the system that the restaurant has.  We booked a party of 10 and paid the deposit.   We arrived 15-20 mins after our reservation (we also called saying we were late) and the hostess said they gave up our table.   The restaurant should take the initiative and make a phone call to the reservation and ask to see what the status is. Instead of marking us a no show and giving the table up.   Especially in a place like this, definitely need to call first.  Ive spent over a decade working in multiple restaurants of many styles and we also have hostesses call reservations before giving up the table.  It was a good that the manager Paolo who gave us a free first round because the night did not start off well.

Mcz2nD5bHLbMRqQk9Na15w.text: Fantastic restaurant, went there for lunch during a trip to Vegas. The lobster soup and the steak were exceptionally good

6a_I_dlxyVsfOVhjUWB9zA.text: We went for Easter Brunch - our family's first visit.  I'm not sure why but I didn't have very high expectations.  Wow! The food was excellent!  Great quality.  My son and I had the most perfect (and delicious) filet mignon.  I would definitely return.

j-SA-IKUrAOEx8zoJcqdTw.text: Came here for an anniversary celebration and my oh my, what an amazing view!   We tried the Chef's Tasting Menu:  - Lobster bisque: the lobster came in a bowl and the waiter pours the bisque of stock, brandy, and cream in front of you at the table. I enjoyed eating that chunk of lobster and slurping up every last drop of the bisque. It was even better dipping the complimentary bread into the bisque.  - Maine scallops a la Plancha: Perfectly cooked scallops with a delicious glaze and sweet potato puree. This may have been my favorite dish.   - Grilled portobello mushroom: Well-cooked and seasoned.   - Filet mignon and shrimp scampi: filet mignon was juicy, tender, and delicious and the mashed potatoes paired nicely with it.  - Salmon with basil pesto crust and prawns: Well-cooked salmon and juicy. The haricot verts was delicious, as well.   - Duet plate: ** Thank you, Top of the World, for adding on the candles and a "Happy Anniversary" chocolate sign to this plate. Such a considerate and thoughtful gift! It was the perfect finish for a very romantic and beautiful dinner.   Note: If you have motion sickness like me, you may have a difficult time looking at the 360 degree view. However, I found that you can buy SeaBands at any CVS/pharmacy and it works like a charm!  Tip: Go to the observation rooftop after dinner! I kid you not, it is one of the most beautiful city views I've ever seen! And, I'm saying that after having visited the famous city views at NYC, Seattle, Hong Kong, Chicago, Taiwan, Los Angeles, etc.

15VKiQUde4M1gwrkVkMOqQ.text: Here lies one of the perennial questions, does one give a notable establishment the five star review without being blinded by the view?  Let's defrag.   One or two stars can easily be dropped on the ambience/view itself, because who the hell wouldn't wanna dine over sin city in rotating fashion am I right?   Our server of the night was a gentleman by the name of Jeff. His impeccable service was seamless throughout our experience. You could take apart this man but he would only come back with an even more polished, professional answer to whatever your questions or needs may be.  The sommelier and servers were all kind and attentive to your needs. No question of professionalism displayed.   Food: We skipped on starters as we didn't feel too hungry. Otherwise I would've loved to try their lobster bisque.  Notes: The bread served on the side was not a favourite of mine personally, could have given more butter. Also a personal preference. Lol.   We both had the grass fed wagyu ribeye. My fiance had medium with the blue cheese and I had mine plain, medium rare. Usually when dining for the first time at any establishment I like to have mine sans sauce to really get into the flavour and texture of the meat.   The meat was done exactly the way we both wanted, seasoned well and the beef was of good, fresh quality. We both had the mushrooms as a side. Very generic side, nothing to shout about.   Dessert: We had their 21 layer chocolate cake. Am cut throat about chocolate cake so I have to say this was disappointing. Although I'm sure it pleases the masses aesthetically it was at best average in taste. Perhaps one should try the creme brulee instead.   All in all, bill came up to about 400 with a bottle of wine (we had the chateauneuf du pape, fantastic) and tips. Very worthy of a special occasion.   Summary: Will shave off one star for dessert. Otherwise it's a great way to spend a special occasion or spoil a loved one.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OzSIcWQcdPWYQU8l0F6uiQ.text: In town for our 13th wedding anniversary and the renewal of our vows, we decided to take a trip to the "Top of the World". We arrived about a half hour early for our reservation, so we stepped upstairs to the lounge of a pre-dinner drink. This was just the beginning of what would be a stellar evening for us.   Back downstairs to head to our table, the hostess was very personable as she led us to our table. She dropped us off at a lovely table for two right up against the window, and turned us over to our server, Eric. For the rest of the evening, we were in his very capable hands. His personal recommendations were compelling enough for us both to take his advice on the Ribeye. We shared a couple of sides as well as a beautifully complementary bottle of wine - all great choices!   The service, food, and views were all absolutely perfect! Our only gripe is that a number of our fellow patrons did not give this experience the respect it deserves. Gentlemen, when you come to a restaurant like this, please leave the shorts and tennis shoes at home (seriously, would a dinner jacket kill you?). Moms - teach your kids the value of dressing up once in awhile. Just because you're on vacation, doesn't mean you and your precious angels need to go to every meal dressed like you just got out of the pool. OK - enough of that - I'm off my soap box now.  All in all, we couldn't have been more pleased. Arrived before sunset, watched the sun disappear behind the mountains, then watched the lights of Las Vegas come up in full bloom. Food, wine, and service were truly impeccable. This was an unforgettable experience, and we wholeheartedly recommend you take a trip to the "Top of the World"!

yBReO9fqEHnvXV-w8xUhNQ.text: Loved this restaurant! Absolutely loved the beautiful view from our table, as well as the food and service. If you go for dinner, expect to see the occasional sky diver fall past you from the top of the building..  Overall it was a wonderful restaurant. One of my favorites in Vegas!

qTH_UTXEuCtSb3J0PXupww.text: My boyfriend and I recently came here for our anniversary.  We were able to make reservations the same day, when we arrived we were directed towards a separate entrance so that we didn't have to wait in the same line as everyone just going to the observation deck.  The elevator brought us to the top super quick, I think they said it's the worlds fastest double-decker elevator.  The restaurant itself is super cool, it looks a little dated but the best part is that the whole restaurant rotates, we were there about an hour and it did one full rotations, so we got to see the whole city.  The staff was very nice and accommodating.  My boyfriend went with the lunch chef's tasting menu and I got the dinner chef's tasting menu.  We both got the wine option as well, which included a different wine that paired with each course.  The first course, we had the option of soup or salad and we both got the lobster bisque.  It was the most amazing soup that either of us had ever had.  There was a bread basket that came with it and the bread was alright but the herb butter made it great.  The next course which was only included with my meal, was a roasted mushroom with pesto and some kind of cheese, which was so good!  The next course was the main, his included a petite fillet and lobster tail, mine was pesto salmon with shrimp (the shrimp were huge), the polenta that accompanied it was probably the most amazing thing I have ever eaten.  Next was desert, I wasn't crazy about the wine that came with it but the chocolate mousse and creme brule was so good!  Our bill was around 200, so if you are looking for a special occasion dinner, this would be a good choice, even for a local!

4IeKZaFGHHBRFOmOJCxL2A.text: I just don't understand how this restaurant has received so many good reviews. There are two components to a great meal. Good service and great food.  The steak that was suggested to me the "Kobe Ribeye Special" wasn't special at all.  Service was horrendous.  It took me 25 min after sitting down to get a gingerale. After our meal came and we had finished and our plates were cleared it took 30 min to get the check. Just unacceptable.  -As long as you realize this restaurant only exists because it's 800 feet in the air and your paying "fine dining" prices only because of the views you won't be disappointed.  If your looking for good food and good service don't come here.

Jdk5uurI1m-nFqmI004Q3Q.text: This restaurant spins probably just to keep you so dizzy that you cannot look at your egregious bill and bland food.   All in all, unimpressive. Food completely lacks any finesse. It's edible, but that's about it.  Finished the meal wishing that I spent the $160 bill gambling downstairs instead.  Here's the punchline: food was mediocre, service sub-par, wifi-bereft, bill atrocious, people rude, view sleep-inducing.   The view is very dull. Since the stratosphere is a bit removed from the Strip, all you can see is the suburbs. I was basically getting the same view from the restaurant as from my hotel room. I cannot believe people would actually pay to go up to the stratosphere.   Poor service, with overbearing servers. I was slowly eating my salad and with at least 1/4 of the salad left when the server came over and rushed me to finish as my entree was apparently ready.   Please, who do you think you are. In case it was not clear already, I am paying to eat here. I should feel comfortable eating at whatever pace I want, especially when I was only 10 minutes into my salad.   My server was also staring down on my bill the whole time I was trying to foot the bill.    Reservations said that dress was business casual but I definitely saw a bunch of people in sneakers and flipflops.   Must I say that the small details matter as well. I really disliked how the gave us pink Splendex packets for sugar instead of real sugar in a nice jar. This is not a college cafeteria.   Finally, the food. Bread was dry and disgusting, no thought given to it at all. Dessert was overly saccharine and creme brulee was limp. My entree of shrimp and lobster was alright, but the sriracha cream sauce was just really weird. The only highlight of the meal was the salad, so essentially we paid $160 for two salads.   Probably one of the worst decisions I made on this Vegas weekend trip, and being in Vegas that really says something.

p8lOhBozlgZdMNrw1TUQ7Q.text: Great view, great service, food wasn't good only ok. You paid for the view and service not the food.

UukxNIn0sDVNFL0IbOwQgg.text: Had a very nice time here with my gf over the past week. We had 830 pm reservations and this place was pretty amazing. The views were spectacular the food was good too. We each had the tasting menu started off with the lobster bisque which was ok. The had the seared scallop which I loved!! the main dish I had was a filet mignon and prawns overall it was a very good meal.

l798B3XA9qdbHrJANOoE5g.text: A great place to eat on special occasions with a breathtaking view from the top of the Stratosphere Tower in Vegas! Over 800 feet in the air.  Went there back in March 2012 for dinner for 5 people and it was great!  Meal was $88 for a 4-course dinner, not including drinks. I booked thru Open Table and had a coupon ... and when we showed up there, everything was in order and we were whisked away to our table.  Server was very pleasant and attentive.   After eating you can check out the rides on the top of the tower, and an observation area with telescopes.   Only drag (3-stars) is that the elevators are strategically placed at the end of a long walk thru the casino & shopping areas ... so if you have older folks who are not able to walk quickly or for long distances, might want to consider adding extra time (15-20 minutes) or even a wheel chair.  So 5-star for the service & ambience, 4-star for the food.

a1NJY9LIU8zVMdykStU7Ig.text: My husband and I were on this past Friday night for dinner and what an experience. It was a bummer at first we were advised the restaurant wasn't going to be turning because of maintenance but eh we continued with our plans anyways. We shared the Chefs Taste Menu and paired it with wine, we enjoyed the lobster bisque and the steak dish lastly the dessert, mmm creme brulee super good but the pork belly dish wasn't anything special. After about 30 mins into our dining the restaurant began to move, yes!!! so then we were even more happy that it started to work after all. The view is breathtaking, very romantic environment. The Sky Lounge is above you so its not super quiet in there you can hear the drinkers around you but it was all good again we are in Vegas and everyone is here to have a great time. A lady came around to take photos which we knew we would have to buy afterwards but eh we did it anyways. Of course when she came back around they were an arm and a leg. really $49 or so for 2 5x7 photos hahaha no thank you. One thing I would suggest is to make that price more reasonable and you will have everyone buying their photos! What were they going to do with my photos anyways after the fact? Throw them away :( The photos did come out very good and it was hard to resist but for that price no thanks we will use our iphones...  OVERALL:  Food-Excellent!!!  Experience - Excellent I will definitely recommend for any couples Service - Excellent, he explained the entire menu we requested window seats but didn't get window seats, another couple finished and because our server was so great he found a way to move us to the window seat... happy camper again at that point. :)  I am recommending this to all of my friends who love experiencing new restaurants and eateries with a little more class :) Get dresses up feel beautiful, enjoy the view and go with a significant other. Love is in the air here. At least its how it made my husband and I feel.

SHsJdyclh8GcknF73Ge7gg.text: This place is way over priced.  The cheapest thing on the menu is $37 for a piece of chicken with no sides.  Sides start at $12.  Kids meals start at $15 for just spaghetti.  The view is amazing if you look further away.  If you look straight down, it's surrounded by the projects.  I would suggest to just go up to the bar to get drinks and the view.  Dinner is not worth it.

OL8UJhe0JrCLmcvUAFiO8Q.text: First of all I want to say that the view is incredible, but that's about it. I am not really sure if the food tastes good or not, why am I saying this... our first experience at this place was a horrible one, especially being that my wife and I decided to have our 13th anniversary diner at this place. I don't know if  our server ANTHONY H. was having a bad night or what but when I am paying for a diner for two just under $300, I expect some great service and great food and I'm sorry to say that was just not the case. Such a horrible experience for my wife and I on our first time at this place. Your attitude and your bad energy Mr. H. Gave this place 1star, and the 1star is for the view only, the rest was sour and stunk just like ur attitude...

VokaAkaYjJA-kHvcWLmC9g.text: Nice views, expensive but average food, nice atmosphere. However, the ever-so-subtle rotating of the building had me so nauseous I could hardly stay there for my bday dinner. I deep sea fish, flip on boards, and other things that would throw my equilibrium off before a restaurant I'd assume, but this place had me feeling so so sick. Again, the food is WAY overpriced, but I guess you're paying to eat up high. Taste/quality was no better than we could do in our own kitchen, but still tasty.

PexBlixlDmGX0pPX6jB82A.text: The view here is amazing. I went to the lounge to get a drink. I kind of got dizzy from seeing the restaurant spin but other than that, it was a great experience. The building shakes every once in a while and make sure to get a table where you can see the strip! The lounge doesn't spin. The drink, mango sangria st. germain, was good: sweet and bubbly. It is quite romantic. Sometimes, you will be able to see sky divers.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lF6zvmTDWpe2goteMcrTzQ.text: Very unique experience. Highly recommend this place. The food is very good with large portion sizes. Plan a long dinner so you have time for the full experience.

evnRTgRjvBcaFwf4gfFtlQ.text: One of the better choices for dinner in Las Vegas. The views from the dining room, particularly in you are there at sunset, are excellent. Request a table near the windows when you make your reservation. The food is tasty - not spectacular.

G6qnIwoUmX_z9o7ioYp5zw.text: My boyfriend took me here for our birthday. I was a bit disappointed at first it was for brunch instead of dinner because of the city lights in Vegas at night. How can I complain he planned a special day for us. It was better tho because during the day u can see all of vegas from the top. The staff is very professional and knowledgeable about the menu which I liked. I think they time everything perfectly so u have enough time for the restraunt  to rotate around vegas. We came for brunch and my boyfriend ordered the seafood Omelet with scallop and lobster. To die for. Overall this place is amazing is definitely something to remember.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée. So good !
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese ciabatta is yummy
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flavored butter. Bomb

RzjReBX9iez41X4XND5IXw.text: I would of gave 5 stars, but...  My husband and I came to celebrate our Birthdays, we share the same Birthday 11/10. When we arrived I was very impressed by the beautiful view. It reminded us of a rotating lounge we went to in Dubai. I ordered the salmon, and he had the half chicken, a Caesar salad and mash potatoes. Was sooo good! A lady came around to take our pictures which we ended up loving and purchased. The atmosphere was romantic. The only thing I didn't like is they didn't even bring a Birthday desert. I've never been to a restaurant that doesn't at least bring a small desert with a candle for someone's Birthday. Even cheap restaurants do that. I was disappointed and so was my husband. We spent $200 and another $45 for pictures and they didn't even bring a small desert. Terrible

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon and lobster rice, half chicken, mash potatoes

hG7F2esmbyrso7CDGISeyQ.text: The food is good. Not great. Very overpriced, however it is absolutely worth it just for the view. The servers are nice and professional. And watching the sky jumpers is very cool. I'm a local and have been a few times and their signature cocktails are never very good so i recommend going with something you know. The staff however is always pleasant and very nice

S31WPu362ixT2OoRokiutA.text: Warning, you are going onto 106 stories of building!  We ordered of course of the day, food was alright. Nothing surprising. (Or I may have ordered the wrong dish.   However, five star for service and the amazing views!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Haha, yes! People are jumping off of the building while you are eating xD

_rC8wNwYYObyCDiGwA8D2w.text: Spectacular view (obviously). Go at night. No clarification needed. Just posting to share photos. Actually dined 2/5; posting late!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-9JDho1q1LxqrVSQj0U6Jw.text: Came for a drink because it's so expensive to eat!  Getting a table was difficult and the staff wasn't very helpful. But when in Rome... the coolest part was watching the people do the sky jump from the top of the building. It was also awesome that the bottom of the restaurant rotated, the top portion does not though.

B6VmlT5IrkpGTx1lY75Ahg.text: First time here and had a wonderful experience. My boyfriend brought me for Valentine's Day. The view is amazing, food is great,service was lovely and their lounge has a great vibe. Their menu has a lot of selection, I went with Seafood Alfredo, and it was delicious. Chris was our server and was very helpful with letting us know their specialties,and chefs favorites. The price was worth it. Very romantic and the view is just breath taking. Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great drinks.

l_fp4i7_Be97DCxqLadVJg.text: Took my brother here as a super special occasion after beating cancer. It was everything we expected and more. Of course the environment can not be beat but the food and service was also excellent. Wonderful experience and they wrap it up with complimentary access to the viewing deck which brings perfect closer to an amazing experience. Highly recommended!

TPHzIGrLQlrYfbjgOw07-A.text: The view was definitely 5 stars and where else could you see people bungee jumping by the windows, But the food was more like a 3. We both ordered filet mignon and shared a twice baked potato. We ordered medium-well hoping they'd be slightly pink in the middle, but they were more well done and completely grey. They had a smoky flavor but were very very dry. I was pretty disappointed because we've had much better steaks for a fraction of the price. The wine was good and sommelier was very knowledgeable.

fpqDKwhfM5nkOkUBuYxtCQ.text: Came here for a quiet dinner with an old friend.  This is his favorite place, and I can kinda see why.  It reminded me of the Equador, in SF.  The atmosphere is lovely, staff friendly, casual attire, beautiful scenery... on top of Las Vegas.   Food was presented beautifully, and in a timely manner, and the drinks were great.  It's hard to honestly give it a True "honest" review, because I hadn't seen my friend in over a year, so we had lots of catching up to do, so much of my focus wasn't primarily on the food, or scenery.  Although what I do recall about the experience was that it was delicious food, very attentive staff... and regardless of where we were seated, it was a good view.  Worthy of my friend calling this his favorite place in LV...  :)

XunEB12E8-VQF7dUlpUYNQ.text: The Sky Lounge in the Stratosphere Hotel is a few minutes down the strip and a little hard to navigate to. Great drink specials with spectacular views of Las Vegas! 2 for 1 drinks after 1 AM! We sat by the bar although I wish we could have sat by the windows to take in the view. Regardless the drinks were very strong and delicious! I will definitely try the food next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Views
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 for one drinks specials. Can&#39;t recall what this drink was called

C0aCBvhMs_LqsUN1edX44Q.text: They ruined our anniversary! I had made reservations three weeks ago for me and my wife as this was our third year anniversary. There was only one thing that my wife wanted, a table on the outside. The person making the reservation said that they put notes on our reservation so that they knew when the time came, there would be a seat for us. Come three weeks later, today, my wife and I show up as this is something we have never done and I wanted it to be special. They seat us furthest in the dining area, where the view was limited. I spoke with the waiter who was seating us about our  reservation and how I requested a window seat. She basically said just because you ask doesn't mean you will get it. So what is the point of even having us make that request if we have no say in it?! We noticed that there was another table that had the view we wanted that was not taken. We then asked another waiter about the seat and we were told that the seat was taken by another person waiting for a window seat in which there was a hour long line for. WHY THE HECK WERE WE NOT TOLD ABOUT THIS WHEN I REQUESTED THREE WEEKS AGO FOR THE WINDOW TABLE?! Having dinner ruined, they told us they could not give us a seat by the window and said we could go view their observation deck free of charge. Normally there is a cost to go up if you are not going to dinner. I would have never accepted that offer if I had known it would take over half an hour just to get back down! Because of that, the other restaurant I was considering had already closed. The only good thing I got out of this is knowing to never go back there again.

75wBgiSJ5H3taCd5tHUuNw.text: Save your money.  The food was cold, the restaurant can stand an upgrade - warn, dingy carpet, and the menu is very limited, no healthy vegetarian or vegan options.  It's 2018...  not everyone eat beef and chicken all the time.

GoilYeScgQkX0WxFCdTz_w.text: The food and drinks were just ok. Drinks were weak and food was bland. The view and the ambiance of the place are amazing. It was super cool to see 360 views of Las Vegas. My low rating is due to their customer service. With the exception of our waitress, the hostess and even the manager of the restaurant made us feel like we needed to leave once we were done. My friends and I went to walk around the restaurant once we were done with dinner and the manager told us we were not allowed to just walk around and asked us to leave. Horrible customer service! After spending a considerable amount of money on dinner, they just want you out. Other than the views, I don't recommend this restaurant for its food and customer service. It's not worth the money with their customer service!

Qz5S1c6UhszHLMaEgCtJ5w.text: Great food, AMAZING views and wonderfully attendant staff. Shrimp was over cooked, everything else was perfection.

ycxEEq5_sghNSVy5sOIapw.text: I came here last night for my one year anniversary with my boyfriend. The service was amazing! Our server (didn't get his name but he had glasses) was great. He was cracking jokes with us and explained the menu when we had questions. Our waters were always filled thanks to another guy working with our server.   As far as food goes, overall was okay. I ordered the 16 oz ribeye and got it medium well. I would have to say it was a little dry and not really worth the price. My boyfriend got the skirt steak and that had lots of oil and too much sauce, but if you're a sauce person then it would be great for you! We ordered a side of mashed potatoes and they were the BEST potatoes I've ever had in my life. It was fantastic. For dessert, we got the first two on the dessert menu (cannot recall what they were named) but it was mediocre. It was cute for them to put "Happy Anniversary" on our dessert!  The place has a great view. The restaurant does spin. My boyfriend got a little dizzy so we had to switch seats. He was sitting facing a certain way so he was turning backwards. When I sat where he sat, I was fine. I didn't feel dizzy. We also got to see the sky jumpers who jump from the top of the Stratosphere! It was so cool!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Display as you circle around the restaurant
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was a chocolate tiramisu cake
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert

qW_hwyaqyisu2uTPeqXOXQ.text: Great view! But restaurant very bad!!! I order pasta and lobster, pasta very bed quality I never try pasta looks like dollars tree((( lobster same situation... very very bad!!! No recommend this place

ZVSzVH56zXq0KcJfQmQtQw.text: I took my parents to this restaurant for their birthday. They said it was the best gift ever! You can enjoy a meal and see ALL of Vegas. The restaurant turns as you eat so it was a very interesting experience. I loved the view and the food was AMAZING. I would highly recommend!

79mHB-uGiaCw5Lr3mEhH_w.text: I'm from Mi and I chose to go to the Top of the World as part of our Las Vegas trip for my b-day. I read the reviews about it and how it rotates around at a slow pace so you can get a view of the Las Vegas strip. I loved the atmosphere and how classy it was. It does rotate at a very slow speed so you almost can't tell you're moving.  We ordered the Caesar salad for an appetizer as well as another dish which basically was raw beef. I like to explore my palate and although I can finally say I tried raw beef, I'm not a huge fan of it and won't be ordering again. For dinner, I had the seared orange miso glazed 56 Chilean sea bass ($56). For the sides we ordered the roasted baby carrot with lemon honey-glaze  ($12) and the twice baked potato, bacon, cheddar, green onion ($14). It was all delicious! They also have ppl that come around and will take pictures of you and your group. The pictures run from $60-$100. The tables are a bit tiny for my liking. Also we didn't get seat near the window which was disappointing. The seats where we sat didn't have much privacy. My overall experience here was good - from making the reservation, the time I walked in and saw the view, being greeted by the wait staff, the ambience, and the sight of the city.

bLbi3VTSar2iSwEY01CGfQ.text: The food was the best and the service as well. I started out with the ice burg salad with blue cuz crumbles. The taste was great even though am not a big fan of blue cuz. The bacon bits made it up for me. But if your a blue cuz lover it should hit the spot. My N. Y. Strip was cooked perfect. Now I had blue cuz crust and also perfect.  The mash potatoes were just as well. All and all great. Will be back.

BsfbDcQN-d_gIRgbOakouQ.text: OMG! The Stratosphere at night was amazing. Spectacular view of Las Vegas. A sea of lights that dazzled. The food was great and good service. I was very impressed with the whole experience.

-4epZtDxO0asmDYu3cfb7A.text: Just had a drink in the lounge as a way of getting the ride to the top for free. Was an excellent experience! The sweetest waitstaff, incredible views, great atmosphere. Would love to go back and try the restaurant. Looked fun!  The lady at the front desk downstairs said we had to buy two drinks each to get the ride up but I ordered one glass of wine (~$10) and my Mom has a soda (~$4). No one pushed us for more.

1lL5FtRyzw5Yis70uEmzFg.text: I think I had the best fettuccine Alfredo of my life here.  The sauce was buttery and creamy and just excellent.  Our first day in Vegas, staying at the Stratosphere, we decided to do lunch at this restaurant and get it out of our system.  We also opted to do lunch here over dinner figuring that we'd get a better price for lunch, and I believe we were right.  The view was incredible, however if you're not looking out over the strip, it is a bit boring and drab.  It's a desert, after all.  The most amusing part of the view was when the rides on the top hung over and we could see the people on the Insanity... which was humorous alone since I noted to my companion "you'd have to be INSANE to go on that" before I knew the ride was actually titled Insanity.    The food was very good.  As I said, the best Alfredo sauce ever.  And the chicken breasts on top were cooked to absolute perfection... I actually enjoyed the chicken more than the fettuccine.  I also ordered the Fromage du Jour from the drinks/dessert/appetizer menu, which I have to say I was a bit disappointed from.  The cheeses were Mozzarella, which was excellent, a Parmesan, which you can't really eat alone but worked great to crumble over my pasta, and a Reggiano which smelled like ASS and almost turned my stomach.  It tasted no better than it smelled either.  There was also some sort of compote on the plate that tainted some of the cheese and fruit.    I guess if I'd liked the compote it wouldn't have tainted anything, but I didn't care for it.  All in all the price wasn't too extravagant, but we did get one of the cheapest dishes on the menu at $14.  The staff was nice, the atmosphere incredible, so it's worth the 4 stars.

7jidsVHwgTmjS95mz6pIrA.text: loved their filet mignon with sauteed spinach!! OMG the spinach and meat combination was just heavenly!

mqp8_2ULlWirTeGPyUGYpg.text: Had lunch here, amazing view.  Menu was superb.  We had the braised beef dish, it was out of this world, great quality and flavor.  Also had the salmon appetizer.  Deserts very nice.  Our waitress "Skye" was very nice, professional and helped make our lunch experience wonderful.  The view, you can't beat the view.

SL4fL7ccgdDAta_noNa5Ew.text: Great view and food. Wheelchair accessible to boot. Definitely a must do romantic spot.

Bgsd-ZloqMhQx55uVzJfcA.text: I've had lunch at the restaurant, and spent the past 2 New Year's at the lounge, and I love it.  The first New Year's I spent here, there was an amazing buffet (the levels below the lounge, I believe). The tables were decorated with elegant ice sculptures, and there were tables of seafood, fondue, and other fine foods. The food was delicious.  The lounge is a great place to spend New Year's. Everyone gets all dressed up, and you're away from all the crazy party people down by the strip. You get the best view of the New Year's fireworks from up top.  It's a place to go at least once in your life...

kz59YF7yUnyB_VEbe8_0PA.text: I had dinner here for my birthday.  My entire experience with this restaurant was absolutely positive.  The host was very nice, informative, and accommodating.  We were able to sit next to a window, which had an amazing view of the city.  Do note that the view of the strip is limited, but you get a 360 degree view of the city of Las Vegas (the restaurant spins - slowly).  The waiter was very friendly, attentive, and prompt with bringing us our drinks.  I ordered grilled organic chicken, which was very tender and succulent.  My boyfriend ordered the steak, and he said it was the best steak he has ever had - very tender and juicy.  There was an item that I didn't personally like, and I was surprised that (what I think was) the manager came out to check on us.  That just shows they really care about the customer's experience.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant, and I would definitely come back again.

UfaDy8LW6OaC2uKJJnmP9g.text: The best view in all of Las Vegas.  Good food, service, presentation.  Not much more to say.

b3uUlEAEQk8mmjFaQ-Yt5w.text: Aw man, this place could get five stars for the view alone. Even though I've been to Vegas a number of times over the past ten years or so, I've never been up to the top of the Stratosphere. Having dinner at the "Top of the World" is an experience you have to try at least once if you go to Vegas, and could quite possibly be voted "Most Romantic Dining Spot" in Vegas if it hasn't already been voted that.  Having said all that, dinner comes second to the spectacular views of the city that you get from being that high. Yeah sure, you could go down the road and experience something similar with the Eiffel Tower Experience, but 1) the Eiffel Tower isn't that high and 2) you're still outdoors and subject to the elements. Whereas if you were to have dinner at Top of the World you have a better 360 degree view and you're indoors in climate controlled A/C.  My grandma actually took me out to dinner here so she knew the whole procedure for getting the most out of our experience. She made our reservations for just the right time, early evening, just before the sun started to set. That way as we ate the sun would set and we could see the city both in daylight (before we ate) and at night (by the end of our meal). She also said that when you make reservations and again when you show up, you have to specifically ask to be seated next to the window in order to get a window table (which are the tables with the best views). Otherwise if you don't say anything they seat you on the inside tables instead.  With pretty much everything set for perfect viewing we enjoyed a great natural show as the city came to life at night with all the lights as we enjoyed our dinner. Now I guess on to the food portion of my experience?  I got a New York Strip steak which was pretty good. I was also able to taste the fillet mignon with a really great sauce. However, probably what stood out from the whole dish was my side order of potato au gratin. Man it was so cheesy and creamy. Very tasty. The food didn't fail to disappoint. The prices are a little higher than what I'm used to, but then again and usually don't eat at high-end restaurants to often. I didn't think the prices were outrageous though. No shorts and t-shirts here either. You gotta dress it up at least a little bit.  Can't say enough about that view. Pretty surreal and amazing.

KdR1Y4PF8Cl5uc0rmtOg8g.text: All I have to say is KOBE BEEF!!!! Everything else is pretty much what you can expect from a high end joint. The whole rotating thing is pretty awesome too.

YE7T-vYzLR4IMESR4stRyA.text: A breathtaking restaurant to dine in.  My boyfriend & I celebrated  our 21st birthday in July with friends in Vegas! My boyfriend had made reservation with this restaurants months before our trip to Vegas. It was a surprise,  I did not know which restaurant he was going to take me out to. But when we got to the Stratosphere hotel, we had to find the entrance & elevator to get to the top of the tower (106th floor). oh my, was it amazing. The restaurant rotates in a complete circle in 2 hours (we were there for 3 hours). We got there at 6pm and ordered the Kobe beef for appetizer. it  was SO SO delicious! I have never tried thinly sliced raw beef that tasted as good as this place! Our entree came when the sun was setting and our dessert ( creme brulee, my favorite) came when it was already dark.  The view here is so pretty. I loved how it is all glass window so you get to view the entire Vegas, the strip, and the city lights as you are eating.I was speechless that my bf took me here. They also have a photographer who walks around & takes very nice pictures of you & your party. me & my  bf bought them for $60. it was worth it! Our dinner cost $200. reasonable price for such a romantic and beautiful dinner with wonderful food.

p2HuXiQXhDUIMZucrXnGPg.text: We came here for lunch & its pretty swanky! I feel like a revolving restaurant at the top of a really tall building is pretty much a must-do for everyone, so do it here!   The 3-course lunch was pretty cheap ($35). However, my prosciutto wrapped salmon dish was only mediocre. It was a little dry, the prosciutto was hard, but the pear + Beurre blanc sauce was a pretty good match w/ the salmon. I did try a little prime rib & I thought it was delicious -- I should have ordered that instead of the salmon! The meat connoisseur I was with said it was "just okay".   Overall, the restaurant isn't one of my favorites & I wouldn't choose it all the time even if I did live in Vegas, but for tourists & guests, I think its a great experience.

AuR4TV3U4s-bHb0VxnBnpA.text: WOW what a great place!!!!!  I went here during my only trip to Vegas, for my cousin's bachelor party.  While out there his dad treated all of us to dinner there, and boy were we all impressed.  We had a great table right against the glass, so we enjoyed our view the entire time.  Having never been to Vegas before this it was amazing for me to see the strip, and then what surrounded it.  The food was so good, and the dessert was great too.  I forget what it was called but it was an all chocolate mock up of the stratosphere, so that was pretty impressive by itself.  We decided to all go dressed up in suits, although it was not required.  We felt that since we were on vacation and going out to a nice dinner we might as well go all out.

18vkqjYQpT66M_0kxPMadw.text: I made reservations a month in advance, and I actually had to keep calling because I got tired of the wait!  So make sure you call in advance.  They also take your credit card info down at the time you make your reservation, because if you cancel and don't give them enough time, they charge your card like $50!  Friends of ours were also in town and decided that Saturday to go eat there.  The only time they got was a 5:30pm time.  They were still there when we arrived for our 6:30pm reservation.  To our dismay, they were seated right by the windows.  We were disapointed as we were seated at a booth as far away from the windows, and right by the walking area / preparation area of the servers.  But as the night went out, we realized we actually had a nice view and didn't have to turn our necks to enjoy it.  And it doesn't rotate as quickly as you'd think, we saw the strip maybe 2 or 3 times the entire time we were there.  We both got steaks, and they were good, nothing outstanding, but I wasn't expecting anything spectacular.  The dessert was amazing though - we got the chocolate Stratosphere with the fruit and it was SO GOOD.  It's worth it to go just for the dessert.  It's a bit of a hike, and you have to go through some sketchy parts of the strip if you walk here, but it's a Vegas "must go" if you have the $$$.

q5KBKwv0XpH6hUvpMbOoZA.text: Ate here years ago for lunch, it was a good time though. Talk about an amazing view!

5lMaFtMtk72FV7fvo-aq-g.text: First time here. Came for a friend's birthday brunch and had to say that the Two Pouched Leopold brunch was delicious. Great service and view, a bit overpriced though.

83bgUdHrTOdi4Q-Wq3l_rg.text: One of the best places I've eaten at. We came later than what we reserved and they still sat us. Very grateful for that.  I literally had a meal 2 hours before this, but when I saw the food, I got hungry all over again.  Our dinner started around sunset and the view outside was magnificent. It was so breathtaking.  I love love love love the bread and butter. The different types were a joy to try. My favorite was the orange ginger butter... and it was my group's favorite too!  The entrees were what was expected. I had the pork chops. They were delicious. It was a little dry, but the sauce and fruit made it all better. I tried a bit of the salmon and I suggest that a whole lot more.  We were all so full from the entree that we couldn't fit in dessert, even though they are every small.  Our waitress, Ellen, made the whole experience a lot more welcoming and memorable. She was super friendly and chatted with us from time to time, seeing how we are doing and such. So considerate. She has some interesting stories. hahaha Oh!! When outside looked perfect, she came by and asked us if we wanted a picture with the view. TALK ABOUT AWESOME TO THE MAX SERVICE!!  This place is pricey, but it was one hell of an experience. I'm so glad I tried this.

Phi7DnYWUg5SvUNNebJx1g.text: Very romantic & best rstnrt in town. From the views to the service to the food & to the stratosphere shaped chocolate ice cream for desert. All I can say is  5 stars.

2VyHgIRd-52XlE1FnIeytA.text: Went here for my 1 year anniversary and will be coming back for my 6 year anniversary.   The view is very nice, the platform does not move overly fast as well. The food, I got filet mignon, was excellent!

TVtlpf_GHqaeFBUvf2S7jQ.text: GREAT VIEWS ,GREAT SERVICE !! GREAT AMBIANCE !! NOT CHEAP !! GREAT FOOD ! $40 for their ONLY VEGETARIAN entree ....a plate of seasoned veges and cous cous, I asked for their rice insted of their cous cous. BUT IT WAS GOOOODDD !!!! A band was playing live on and off during dinner, SADE cover band, it was nice. Take a dramamine motion sickness pill before you go if you get motion sickeness of any kind. I did . This restaurant revoles 360 degress, very cool. You get to see the bungee jumpers fall right at your table when you hit that window....crazy cool. WORTH to budget a NICE ,PRICEY WONDERFUL dinner on your trip to Vegas. **I recommend having lunch instead if dining with family and or kids. The views would be much better than nighttime. As vegas is surrounded by mountains, the view is of the Strip ,street lights a a wall of darkness as there are no lights on the mountains. To see the snow capped mountains in the endless horizon would have been more magical. ***For a Great Photo, just purchase the one from the in house photographer. The lighting and view comes out great and they go mild retouching. ($25-45) ***I went 12/24 for dinner. I used a coupon from Restaurant.com and got $25 of the Bill......

xQV_pWUG4LTwfq-lx8kOQQ.text: We went here for our anniversary dinner and were not disappointed. Apart from the amazing views of the city, the place had a certain charm and warmth to it. Great experience.

jz2Mcx1_7SmtUd0DsLm9UA.text: Where should i start ? Walk into a hostile lobby with the elevator to your back . The front end Staff , no smiles no welcomes  Nothing. More like " What do you want ? Your bothering me!" Environment. This is how they made you feel. That put us off from the start the wait staff pleasant and professional . The meal ....cold , the meat over cooked and replace 2x still could not get it right. The management doesn't seem to care . Being in a landmark building and the view saves them. Not worth the money , we were warned from other locals .now we know terrible waste of money !!!!

Cd2HBwMJmoBM1dqAadLNTw.text: Great view and food was amazing. Took awhile to come out but no complaints here! Def worth a visit!

FlE0WG2Kl9SQ94ROd03Xzg.text: So, the hubby and I had dinner here about a month ago. We made reservations, as highly recommended, for 6:45pm and had a window seat. The view was spectacular and dinner was amazing! We did get to see a few bungee jumpers, which was cool! A photographer took pics of us that I absolutely loved and just had to have, so we purchased them. The wait staff was pleasant. Sunset was absolutely gorgeous! Seeing Vegas lit up at night was beautiful. Visited the observation deck after dinner, it was cool. Dinner was a bit expensive, as I had expected, but I would definitely recommend to others as well as visit again...maybe for lunch since I've experienced dinner.

OgI9HC-38zAnGm7Eb54Hgw.text: The food is not worth the money  The view is great if you want a free view from the top of vegas buy a appetizer and get some drinks then ask for the check i spent 300 bucks and it was not woth it.

MLg_EUUFOkN4G_MEcF9YiA.text: Ok this is one of the reviews I don't like to post but here it goes, when you go to a place expecting something and get something completely different and disappointing.   The food in this place taste horrible worst food I me or my family have tasted, super pricy for the worst food ever I guess the only thing worth it is the view so you must be paying for that.!!!   Don't waste your money here there are way better places to eat in vegas :-)

OiGnUFPlVqSnFFh0G13fRg.text: We went for dinner for a friends birthday. We got a table near the edge so the view was fantastic. The food is extremely pricey and is all a la cart. Unfortunately i did not find the food to be that great. My husband had chicken & he said it was just ok. I had gnocchi & found the sauce to be mediocre. I also had a salad, which was drowning in too much dressing at the bottom.  The service was great & our drinks were never empty. The view was amazing & we did a full rotation in the time we were there. I don't feel the bill was worth it though.

0OeI5ePQL7OzGB7B_kxoIw.text: You can do better for the money. The seafood alfredo was very bland. The sauce had little to no flavor.. butter and milk basically. I would not recommend that to anyone. 60$ for subpar pasta is disappointing. The only reason this has 3 stars is for the view. The floor rotates so you have the full view of Las Vegas. You should make a reservation if you plan on eating here but as I mentioned I wouldn't spend your money here.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Alfredo

WCn4UzEZja0o0ZLCBo5IEQ.text: This place was pretty good, but it wasn't fantastic. The view was great and the ambience was cool. But the food was very sub par.  I came here with my long time girlfriend for her birthday and it's not their fault but just days prior to making reservations I went cold turkey on becoming vegan. So needless to say they didn't have much of anything to cater to Vegans. That's not their fault though, just a victim of circumstance. Other than not being able to eat anything. It is a bit pricey but I expected that, however I will not personally be eating here again but I'd recommend those who aren't vegan to go check out the scenery.  Also, the customer service wasn't too shabby

AzdtFFM_QacAfAHttlFlvA.text: What a great experience for our 29th Anniversary! Our server, Dalia, was so friendly and made us feel so welcome! This was worth every dime!

oJEhR0TKaxIouOKSIavtIg.text: Went there for lunch and had the most amazing meal.  Honestly one of the best meals of my life.  We had the prefix menu, added a crab cake, and drinks.  My lemon drop was delicious.  Far better than I have had previously.  The crab cake was heavy on crab and flavor.  The filet and lobster were so tender!!! Caesar salad was delicious.  Then.... there was dessert.... my oh my... so good!!!  Will defiantly make a point of visiting there again when we are back in Vegas!!!

DTMmFJehVexV5PHwHO22KQ.text: Worst filet mignon and lobster I have ever had. Lobster was so dry I had to spit out in napkin. Waiter even commented that it looked dry. Steak omg horrible no char. Buffet line quality at best.  Don't waste your money.
