Oh yah they also skipped us and let other people go in.Our reservation was at 8 got in at 820 pm and when i asked how long do we havr to wait for a table the histess said "oh we somehow missed your name" No apologies or anything!!!!! never coming b

decBJUO_Woi9w14yipeKTw.text: The view alone is worth it. The food was exceptional. Happy hour at the bar runs half price drinks until 7:00 while you wait to be seated. We were seated right at sunset. A revolution takes an hour twenty which is about perfect for the meal  I highly recommend the Chef's four course sampler. Our waitress, Dana was incredible.

YBdKWIUMSVV99nwb0XGXPA.text: Garbage!! Your literally paying for the view not the food, took about 1 hour and a half to get our food. I ordered the New York streak And a bunch of appetizers i asked for it to be medium rare and it came out well done, told the waiter which was super cool and they brought me out another one, this time it was rare and cover in fat. HORRIBLE I didn't even eat It and they didn't offer to comp. the view is amazing but the food is no good and it's very expensive not worth it at all. Just go for the view and eat somewhere else. The waiter was very nice but this place is GARBAGE! Never again save tou

gO6kfdgbTT0W7IVm1YJ13g.text: My family went to the Stratosphere Hotel/Top Of The World for T'day dinner.  I didn't expect to have much to say about the food and I still don't although the wine list was pretty extensive. You pretty much go there for the view and the food is an extra.  I must say the view is spectacular. And we were lucky that it was a very clear night so we could see everything there was to see.  My 5.5 year old grand nephew, when he looked up from the iPad (which was rarely) was even impressed by it. The fact that every once in while he was able to see the bungee jumpers speed past was very exciting for him.  So in the end I'm very glad we went as it was a singular experience and added a really nice touch to the trip.

NrDN39hn58xUQj_PWwo1sg.text: Had made a reservation for 10 people for 730. They didn't get us seated until 45 minutes later because they were backed up so we asked if the manager could give us a free drink or a free desert for the two of us celebrating our birthday - Manager did neither. Food arrived late and cold. My wife's steak was medium well when it should have been medium rare so we talked to the GM who made it right.  The issue is mostly timing, I have a limo outside that I'm paying $125 an hour for. I can't be wasting time inside this restaurant, we need to get in and get out just like you need us in and out to flip our table. What should have been a 1.5 hour dinner (max) turned into a 3 hour dinner.  For a restaurant of this potential caliber you would think they would have their stuff together.  Waitress and GM were great.  Im just saying there's better options on the strip.

TOBrfAHmLtO-NQVLNc_8SQ.text: The view is what you are paying for here. While it is spectacular the food not so much. My steak came out overdone and my husbands lobster Mac was not cooked all the way. The apps were the best part of the meal.

HKolIOG9dkARh3maQnWkQw.text: I went there yesterday to celebrate a good friend birthday and the food was good . Our server erick an hispanic guy was awesome, the view spectacular!!! Prices for dinner a litle hight but it worth every penny,  we walk out happy!!

I never liked scallops AT ALL, nor have i liked polenta.. but after this experience with the view and service i fell love.. nice view of the city as well as not overbearing movement. You so into the food you can miss the view rotation and that says alot !!!

iyN7_JUM68vbSfOk6Y29sA.text: I was in Vegas and wanted to do something special for my special someone. I had read up on the Top of the World restaurant and thought between the time of year (winter), food and views, that this place would be ideal and romantic.  I had booked my reservation very easily through a website called Open Table via the Top of the World website link. However, I found a place in Vegas that sold discounted tickets and was so excited to take advantage of that. I was able to get 25% off of my entree's for the cost of only $3 per person. Basically I saved $34 for a $6 investment. Keep in mind that this offer is good but it's M-Th only and I did happen to go to the restaurant on a Monday night. The ticket place not only saved me money but also was abe to re-book my reservation for a more convenient time.   So the hotel itself is what I call...ghetto-fab, and it is not located in the best part of Vegas since it is in the Stratosphere. I would only take this experience down a notch because of the location.   We came dressed to impress (they do have a dress code), and we took a private elevator to the top of the Stratosphere to the restaurant entrance.  We got there a little earlier than our reservation time and took advantage of their lounge area.  The lounge had very ambient lighting and was surrounded by amazing night views of the city. The staff were friendly, and the drinks were well made.   When it came time for dinner, we decided on an appetizer and the Surf & Turf.  Everything was amazing. We received an assortment of breads and 3 different types of butter as our pre-appetizer. The butter didn't even taste like butter, it was very delicious!!! The steak cut like butter, the lobster was perfecty cooked, and our appetizer (thinly cut steak, capers, sauce), was so delicious.  We skipped dessert because I was very full from dinner and I hope to try some the next time we go.  We also had our pictures professionaly taken by a photographer who walks around. Prices were somewhat typical but she did a good job and I actually purchased some of the pictures.   The view was amazing and we found ourselves just staring at the city for periods of time.  It was very cold out (November) but we walked around on the inside and watched the crazy people do the Sky Jump off of that floor. Which is, by the way, something you get to see in the restaurant. People dropping off the top ads a different element to your dinner experience.   Overall, it was well worth it (especially after getting the discount coupon), and I highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a nice place to wine and dine.

cFoyycWVKVBWfg9f4qcc6g.text: My fiance and I grabbed some lunch here right before he proposed to me and I have to say it was an amazing experience. We arrived 30 mins earlier than our reservation and they accommodated for us. We both got the 3 course lunch meal and it was outstanding. The service was impeccable and the staff was very friendly and professional. One of the best meals I've had.

pzWv0aELm2FLcF2lLzjncA.text: Great food, great view. Very romantic.  Get a table right next to the window, definitely worth it for a special occasion. They even have weekly wines that are a special price and lower than normal. I would do it again!

6sbgaJ_RkfVcDlhBusYa-A.text: This place is amazing and I would've gladly given it five stars but here's why I didn't:  We went to Top of The World for my boyfriends birthday 2 weeks ago so I will try and remember everything I ordered. We planned to go here for many months and were really looked forward to it. We ordered the Pork Belly for an appetizer and it was AMAZING. Forgive me if I am wrong but If I remember correctly our servers name was Niki. She was cute as a button. Her service and recommendations were excellent (she should get a raise).   My main course was the Rack of Lamb and it was just exquisite. It was PERFECTLY cooked and melted in my mouth. By far, the best lamb I have EVER had. The lamb was accompanied by couscous with a wasabi style of kick to it and was out of this world. It complimented the lamb perfectly. I even had one of the managers stop at our table to tell me how excited he was that I ordered that because it is among their best dishes and his personal favorite.  My boyfriend ordered the Fillet Mignon and a side of bok choy. I had the privilege to get a taste of both and they were divine. The fillet was perfectly cooked and, again, melted in the mouth. The bok choy was still nicely firm and not overcooked.  The wine: We ordered a bottle of Forefront Cabernet Sauvignon which was the perfect pairing for the lamb and the fillet. Everything was perfect...until I decided to walk over to my boyfriend and wish him a happy birthday in his ear. I briefly sat, respectfully, legs closed on his lap to do this when GEORGE the "big boss" of the restaurant quickly comes out of nowhere to tell me to "get off of his lap because there is an 8 year old child sitting near by." REALLY??? What 8 year hasn't seen that! She wasn't even paying any attention to us! He just TOTALLY ruined a perfect night. Not only did he interrupt our sweet meaningful conversation but he embarrassed us without necessity!  Our whole dining experience was perfect until he did that. I feel sorry for the people who have to deal with him with any kind of regularity. This was completely uncalled for, rude, and inexplicable especially for a place of this caliber. Shame on you George, you should know better.

MezdWv1gnRv17E3CeYvCkA.text: This place is cool. It is very classy and the service is exceptional.  The food was excellent. My husband had the twin lobster tales and I had the duck...both large portions and awesome! the price is steap, for both of us it was about $200 with tip.   The view are amazing and there is a bungy jump ontop of the roof, so for about 20 minutes you can witness three or four jumpers from your table. Pretty cool I though, to some I can see lose their dinner!   The lobster bisque was to die for! (i think better than Texas de Brazil).  Great place for a special occasion!

7FyKaH7UY55DsTlHEZJYCA.text: Everything was great! The bread is amazing and so is the ribeye. Our waiter was very helpful. Perfect for a date night or bday dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great view!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best date night!

qupOmlb8agC0RRg6aj3nUg.text: Worst service I have ever had!! Long wait to get in once we were in had the worst experience ever. The waiter pushing us to leave for what ever reason he had. Found out later they were supposedly very busy and needed the table another waiter confessed. Over charged us for tower fee and later corrected that but since we had already payed, people be very careful

ZkXktsgKyLyGq9xQ6vI-_A.text: Went there last year to celebrate me and my boyfriend's 1st anniversary. We expected to spend around $200 over there. The view from there was really cool. I think the 360 degrees view of Las Vegas is the "most expensive" of this dinner. We had ordered a bowl of lobster bisque and we both thought it was soso. The one at Ventano (Henderson) is much better and cheaper. And then we had an appetizer plater. I remembered there were some kobe beef and duck on it. Kobe beef was okay and we both thought that the duck was really good. We didnt know which part of duck is it but it's like the fat of the duck (not quite sure) but it was good. And then for the entree, i had lamb and it was okay, im a big fan of lamb but it wont make me say "WOW".  My boyfriend had ribeye and the outside of the ribeye was kinda overcook, looked dark but he said the inside was okay. (he ordered medium rare). We were full after dinner so I just ordered a single creme burlee as dessert and nothing special about the dessert. I heard that there's something called chocolate tower and was really delicious but i didnt see it in the menu ( maybe i missed it or they didnt have it?? i dunno)  The restaurant will keep moving around so you will be able to see the view of Las Vegas and the view of the strip. Definitely go there at night since the night view is the best. We spent around $220 (include tax and tips) and we wont go back. I think they overprice everything since the food was not very delicious. Once again, the view is the selling point. Maybe you can consider to go to there lounge or just pay few bucks to go to the top.

YQImyIViKuiwUybDRr8QcA.text: Absolutely amazing.. impeccable food and view.. I love this place. One of my top three in vegas.

LCS1Ug1E7XVnKYG7MMLEAQ.text: The view alone from 106 floors up makes this spot worth a visit! I wasn't very hungry so I had a crab cake and salad and my friend enjoyed a burger. Service was attentive.

W3_dPh2VkfSGSzLVoh_kew.text: You won't find a better restaurant in Vegas at any price. Fresh, top quality ingredients prepared so skillfully that you can taste the quality of each separately. Exquisite sauces on perfect meats and vegetables. The view is just a bonus. The package with the Frankie Moreno show makes it the best night out I've had here in years. The reasonable price is just a bonus. No, I don't work for either place and live, though I visit often, thousands of miles away.

RuweTVqw_zTZbEo7cxoj-Q.text: Overrated.   The rotation gave me a little headache so I was already a little annoyed to begin with. And then that with crappy service. No thanks.   Our server was not attentive at all, half the time I would have forgotten what she had looked like if it wasnt for her horrific bleached blonde hair [with the roots showing]. We were a party of 4 and she went around assisting her other tables [larger parties] before us so we ended up constantly waiting for service the entire night, which was extremely annoying. She didnt bring out our food or drinks, nor did she refill them. I wanted to tip our her assistant because she was pretty much serving us.    The food was mediocre. I wasnt expecting too much, but to be payin $50-60 for just a steak with no side.. I wanted at least decent.   [+1]  My mood did get better so alrighttttttt.. the view was pretty cool. And we did get a booth facing out. Their butters were the shape of the stratosphere, which was kinda cool.. i guessss. We did end up tipping just 18%, knowing that her assistant would get tip share.

5x9MmUDr3vJ85EKlzKsx8g.text: Slightly above average food but expensive. Went there for a Birthday dinner for four. Everything was going excellent until they seated a family of four with two young children next to us. One child was an infant that kept crying. The second child was maybe two years old and started screaming as soon as he was placed in a high chair. The high chair was one foot directly behind me. The kid never stopped screaming and the parents made no effort to control him. We would have stayed for coffee or desert but I could not stand the constant screaming. I did not pay $200 per person, $800 total to sit 1 foot away from a constant screaming kid. There is supposed to be a dress code but it is not enforced. This family was wearing T-Shirts and shorts. If the dress code was enforced I would not have had my Birthday evening ruined by screaming kids.

0Zh1bsbPjXREXMpIjgovkQ.text: Food was good but the service was very very disappointing. We already had our dinner but we wanted to get the experience here. We wanted a seat by the window obviously. When we arrived, there were plenty of empty tables beside the window but they lied that all were reserved (did not see a single person coming and we were there till close). We ordered the appetizers as we were already full. The waiter was very rude. When we told him that we are not interested in main course his behavior changed and we felt unwelcome. He kept pressurizing us to order some main course though we made it very clear that we were not interested. At that point we felt really uncomfortable and we were in half a mind to leave. Finally the food came. I had lobster bisque and the husband had the pork belly. Both were pretty good. After dinner when the check came i signed and then the waiter took it while we were still sitting there. It seems he wanted us to leave as we did not go for the full course dinner. When we were leaving he even stopped me and verified the tip!!!!! At that point I really wanted to make it zero. Overall food was good but way too pricy and attitude of the servers are proportional to the amount of money you are spending!!!

0SblKRJ5SxKH2ZyYDOEwsw.text: My boyfriend & I went here for our V-Day lunch in Feb of this year.  During our stay my bf injured his ankle & so I had to wheel him in a wheel chair.  Instead of taking a cab to this restaurant I decided to take a walk, sight see and wheel him over.  Keep in mind that I was staying at the Aria in the new City Center.  Omg, it look me over an hr to get there and I was in a very BAD mood.    To my surprises this place was everything I expected.  The food was decent and so were the prices.  We ordered there $30 rita so we could take the souvenir glass home.  I loved every moment that I was there and it was such a romantic setting for us.  We enjoyed the view of Vegas, it was beautiful.  The staff was SUPER friendly.  I also enjoyed seeing people ride the rides at from the top.  We later look our drinks to the observation level.  We spent several hrs there and really did enjoy our self.    Thanks Top of the World for giving me a V-day to remember!!

NTYvxlKI_tWLPROxjsdsGg.text: Such a great place to celebrate. I had my  23rd anniversary here with friends and family. Such a beautiful view.

yG9pgxwJ0lN3_qtwyFnU0A.text: This dining experience had both good and bad elements.  First the good...the view!  We were seated at revolving window overlooking Las Vegas and the mountains.  What an awesome way to enjoy dinner.  We happened to be dining as the sun was setting, and it was simply gorgeous.  Our waiter was helpful and pleasant, and he made our experience enjoyable.  Another plus was the Baby Frisee Salad with Maytag Blue Cheese and Bacon Lardons.  Sooo fresh and delicious.  After beginning with this salad, I was really looking forward to dinner!  But alas, dinner was the bad part.  I ordered the Seared Organic Salmon with Lemon Grass Beurre Blanc.  Wow, was that salmon strong tasting, and also smelled strongly of fish (isn't that a sign that the fish isn't fresh??).  We also ordered some mashed potatoes to share, and they had developed a crust on top like they were sitting under a heat lamp for a couple of hours.  YUK.  So disappointing.  Also, I wasn't impressed with the cleanliness of the place.  It actually smelled kind of moldy.  Not something I like in a restaurant.

__VjanniJ4KAS9dbryDlaA.text: It was so difficult for me to find a good restaurant with great food in Vegas. So although it comes with a price, the view is amazing, the food is delicious, and the service was great. Even if you can't come here to eat you should come for at least a drink in their bar and also come right before night falls. Great views of the strip, mountains, and Vegas itself. I used a coupon bought on restaurants.com

O-CrjaYhN7ppi96TBczTfQ.text: I have been here twice, Its a very romantic dinner setting so I think its perfect for anniversary's, special occasions etc. The service is phenomenal and they aren't standing around asking you too many questions. I like the waiter/waitress to see that my drink is empty and refill it not ask me if I need a refill. I like less talk at a place like this and that is exactly what I get here. That way me and my hubby have a romantic dinner without being interrupted too much. I want to come here every year for my anniversary.  First trip I believe we ordered Filet and lobster bisque nothing out of the ordinary and it was soooo good. The second trip we went for the five course tasting menu, I really wasn't too pleased with a few things I had but next time I will order what I want :)

4n69yHWkuvFgUQKsacCMag.text: My favorite spot we went to for dinner on our trip out to Vegas. 1st time going to the Top of the World and it's impressive. The view was phenomenal and the food matched it. I got the 4 courses + wine pairing. My favorite side was the wagyu arancini!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sky&#39;s the limit ...

sXdezJGUXizmdto0kChTPg.text: Made reservations for my dads 70th Birthday and Arianna was the girl who helped me. She was very nice and easy to contact using email. I asked if they could make a specific cake for my dinner but they couldn't and referred me to Freed's bakery which did a great job! They were also nice and kind to waive the cake slice fee which they normally have if you don't order dessert from them.  The waiter was ok. He was nice and he was tying his best but he had 3 large parties including ours so he got a few of our orders wrong and we did have a wait a while for our food. But it's ok. Overall he wasn't rude, he came and checked on us as much as he could. So no complaints here, because he was very busy which I completely understand.  The view is gorgeous! It's a revolving restaurant and you can see the strip and downtown. It's an amazing view! It's on the 107th floor. The food was amazing too!! Of course the bill was expensive but you get your monies worth. You also get to go up to the observatory deck for free which normally you'd have to pay to go up.   Definitely will return, maybe I'll try the lunch to see the view during the day too..

sK33VhBfVvO32mlR4b3JKg.text: The place is nice. 106floor that rotates as you dine. Waiter was nice and friendly. I had purchased a groupon deal on this and the food was ok. I also added the wine pairing for an extra $49 but some of the wine in my opinion did not pair up good with the food. On the deal you get a four course meal and each course you get two options. I had the lobster soup.. good. Crab cakes-ok. Salmon and shrimp -ok. And the ice cream For dessert-good). The only thing was that I didn't t feel like the price was adequate for the order. It was ok food.

yIGtBE8nZSNWaVouWC5Q4A.text: Top of the World might just be one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. I went on Monday and it was definitely a memorable experience. The view was spectacular and you get a 360 view during dinner. The restaurant slowly moves as you enjoy your dinner. The service provided by the waiters were great and they were very attentive.   I ordered the rack of lamb and it was delicious. The lamb basically melts in your mouth and was cooked to perfection. My boyfriend ordered the filet mignon and it was great! They are "a la carte" so you would have to order the sides on your own. The lobster mac and cheese was delicious as well.   Overall, I definitely recommend anyone to try this restaurant. The food, service, and vibes are 10/10.

VNMVEcVSukMeXBm4W_zwTw.text: I like the way how they serviced us and the food great taste. Reception before we took elevator he is very nice and good remember because he said Happy Birthday to me when i leaved there. Small things can change to the big opportunity that can say here. Overview 360 degrees night view, food delicious, romantic so was perfect with the cost.   PS i really liked photoes service because like i pre-wedding lol

K6FIDr8CxwpotnWE4BYlKg.text: DONT GO HERE !!!! Where to begin. I made a reservation couple weeks in advance and explained then that my wife and I live in different countries, it's both our birthdays, and could we please have a window table. There are three categories of tables. Those at the window, those off the window lower level (with the most obstructed view) and those off the window elevated level, so at least you have a good view just further away. There are also two different table sizes. A table that fits 4 and a table that fits 2 - that is a joke. Smallest table I have ever seen   Despite that we requested a window, they sat us at the worst table possible; A small table lower level obstructed view. The table was a few inches bigger then the place mat.   There were however plenty of other tables available both at the window and on the elevated level. So I asked to be moved. The waiter told us that he would have to ask, but that other tables were for other people. I didn't understand this - why wasn't I allowed?  He said that they seat as people arrive. So when I arrived, I got the crappy table available. However, someone who comes later could get the better table, just luck. So I complained...and said "so you are telling me that people who arrive after me and who are not even in the building yet can have that table by the window, but I can't because I got here already?  Answer:  correct.   I asked him why would someone coming after us get a better table than me but never got any answer except "I'm sorry, it's all just the timing."  Right by us there was an empty table. I asked about moving to that specific table at the window. I was told that they were likely holding it for 4 people since it was bigger, so we couldn't have it. The table I asked to move to was empty for over 30 minutes. Then they seated a couple - 2 people - at the table. Incredible. When I complained how ridiculous this was, I was told that it wasn't his decision and management just gives the tables how they decide. Doesn't matter if it's fair.   My wife ordered lemonade.  It was undrinkable. Switched to a coke. I ordered a mixed drink. It took 20 minutes to get it. Appetizer and main course were ok. Definitely nothing great or sophisticated. This is not a place for the food. It was pedestrian food, not developed in flavors at all. They say they are a new restaurant and one of the best now , they absolutely are not. It's the same marginal food as always from years ago, but with new carpet.   Our waiter was hardly ever there to help. At the end of the night I wanted to leave a $10 tip on a $150 bill. My wife made me leave $15.   I have been here many times over the years. I'm absolutely never going back. Management doesn't care about you. You don't matter. The food is not anything special. You go for the view. If you get a crappy little table with people in front of you, you wasted all the effort of getting into the place (which itself took 30 minutes to clear security and go up the elevators) and get nothing. I'm never going back.   I told the waiter than I would tell the truth of this place in my review and to tell management. They didn't care. Despite my multiple complaints no one even bothered to come say one word to me.   If you want a great view at dinner of the whole strip you have plenty of options where people care and the food is great. Look toward the south end at the Mandalay Bay for instance. But whatever you do, don't come here.   I fully expect some type of management reply to the review. I really don't care what you folks have to say, or how sorry you are, or whatever bogus explanation you give. You couldn't bother to talk to me yesterday, save it now. There was no reason to seat people who arrive after me in better tables than me. You weren't at capacity. There were plenty of options, even if you pretend now there were not - I was there. You just didn't care. And I truly hope that this review discourages other from dining with you. My wife came from Mexico, me from Florida and we didn't ask for much. I gave you plenty of notice. But I didn't matter to you. And so you don't matter to me.

HlMypCFgFab3SC_P7l1mAQ.text: A little late giving this review but figured better late than never. We went for my husband's birthday and the service was great. There was an older lady who was just so friendly. I "secretly" told her it was my husband's birthday and she brought him a special dessert that had dry ice. My husband loved it. This made the night memorable.  I have been there since but figured I'd post about this.

UGENGBPRbHfpUf78wKQG2w.text: What a view ! Definitely worth reserving a table and the price.  The restaurant setting is intimate and comfortable, service is professional and personal. The food quality was amazing and beautifully presented. The experience and the view is so unique perfect for a special occasion.  The seafood tower was copious for the two of us, the ribeye was devine and perfectly cooked and seasoned. The creme brulee was delicious.

That is experience, being in the restaurant like that, having you 360 view and also having very tasty food. We had glass of wine (Napa Valley '14, red wine ), Brussels sprouts, beets and burrata, and after all  Australian steak (medium well) which was very satisfying. ( you get no sides for stake, only if you want to pay extra and order salad or fries)  Our server provided us great hospitality and we enjoyed or meal and sunset with most amazing view!   Everything costed around $190 w tip

echWpAjUYq2-p0slz7XQwQ.text: If your looking for amazing food with a breathtaking view, this is the place!   Boyfriend and I both got the Filet Mignon and it was absolutely delicious. The service was exceptional, our server was so quick and prompt. He checked on us every so often-we didn't have to flag anyone down for anything!   Everything was absolutely amazing!

jJpf-_JRV8CAlnOu3SVZHw.text: I ate here with my now husband to celebrate our engagement with my family. This is one of the best meals I have ever had. The only thing that was a small disappointment was the lobster bisque. It seemed a little bland. We were here 4th of July 2015 and we had a wonderful view of the fireworks display Vegas is so well known for. I had the bananas foster for dessert and was one of the best desserts I have ever had. I still have yet to find a bananas foster that even comes close to comparing to the one we had that evening.  This restaurant made for a wonderful evening and a most memorable celebration.

pxUNd6Vo75hfGKhhgU8iQQ.text: This was our first time going to the restaurant and before we came to Las Vegas I searched on Groupon to see if there were any deals and yes there was! Making a reservation was as easy as can be, just used Open Table and we were set. Made sure to call them before we left our home to make sure they had the reservation and they did! Since we were going to Las Vegas for our 24th Anniversary we decided that this would be our fancy Anniversary dinner.  This restaurant is at the top of the Stratosphere Hotel and Casino on the 106th floor. We self parked in the parking garage of the Stratosphere and it was FREE! We had to walk through to the casino to get to the escalator and elevators that go to the restaurant. We checked in at the desk before getting on the elevator and the girl at the desk wished us a Happy Anniversary...so nice! We got on the elevator and there was an attendant that escorted us to the 107th floor, checked in at another desk and the girl there wished us a Happy Anniversary also! A hostess came to escort us to our table, we walked down a flight of stairs to the 106th floor and was seated at our table near the window. This floor rotates 360o very slowly, you can't even tell it's moving, we got there just before sunset, so we got to see the city in the daylight, at dawn and at night with all the beautiful lights...just breathtaking!  Our server greeted us and as soon as we were seated we were brought water and bread. I told the waiter that we had a Groupon and he gave us a special Groupon menu. We choose between to starters, two appetizers, two entrees and two desserts. So I ordered what I wanted and my husband ordered the other choice so we could try everything. I thought because it was a special Groupon menu that it wouldn't be that great but I was wrong, everything was delicious!  So we tried the following:  Ceasar Salad: fresh, crisp lettuce, just the right amount of dressing and croutons.  Lobster Bisque: Lumps of lobster with a tomato cream soup, warm and delicious.  Crab Cake: Lightly breaded and fried with a creamy mustard sauce.  Cavatelli Pasta & Shortribs: YUM!  Filet Mignon & Shrimp: Medium temp., melt in your mouth, served on a bed of pureed potatoes.  Ora King Salmon & Shrimp: Served with lemon butter. It was moist and tasty.  Salted Carmel Creme Brulee: Mmmmmmm...!  Spumoni: Cherry, Pistachio & Chocolate coated in a chocolate candy shell!  We were so full!!!  Also got to watch the people bungee jumping off the top of the Stratosphere right in front of us!   We really enjoyed it and would definitely go back!!! After dinner we went to the 109th floor to the observation deck to check it out, there is usually a charge to go to the observation deck but if you dine at the restaurant it is complimentary.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view from Top Of World Restaurant at the Stratosphere, Las Vegas

S67EyaSFjmGTyBsbQGQNoA.text: The view was breathtaking! That alone was worth the trip, but the food was terrible. The lobster bisque tasted like they had cinnamon in it and the Lobster MAC and cheese was horrible. We are from the Texas Gulf Coast and we know what good seafood should taste like and this wasn't it! Very disappointed after reading other reviews! 09/17/2019  PM

LB2E_H2jfp-1JaI2dI_qLQ.text: This was my second visit here but  it was even better than before. I made reservation weeks in advance actually.We were going to be Vegas for  a family reunion so I had to make a visit here! Also we were staying at the Strat Hotel as well. It was a surprise dinner for my honey as hes almost done with his schooling and I'm so very proud of him.We go window seating just as I requested. He ordered a steak of course I had lobster and potatoes. We didn't have any drinks as we had a few of those already lol so just water was fine.The service was great i cant recall our servers name. Only hiccup we had was when came time to pay my card got DECLINED!!!! I WAS EXTREMELY UPSET I SAID NO WAY RUN IT AGAIN. MY GREAT BANK WELLS FARGO THOUGHT IT WAS FRAUD SO THEY DECLINED THE PAYMENT.My honey paid and I just zelled the money back to him because it was my treat. I CALLED AND GAVE THEM A PIECE OF MY MIND!! I understand they were only trying to protect my account but I had been spending money all weekend.It would have been nice to get a call or text to verify if it was me before doing so. It was Embarrassing to say the least. That was the only downfall of dinner but other than that it was excellent. We will be back again for sure.

rI3sF27mdkRjzaC6ujMVFg.text: Very Exquisite Restaurant!  My hubby and I ended our mini vacation at this restaurant on a Saturday evening.  The restaurant is located on the 106th floor of the Stratosphere tower.   Be aware of coming through a security checkpoint and metal detector before coming on the elevator.  My husband had to take off his belt and it felt almost like a TSA checkpoint.  One we passed that, we got off the elevator and we checked in at the booth. It took about 5 minutes to be called to be seated.  At first, we were looking around because 2 parties had come in after us, but seated before us.  But when we were escorted to our table, we realized it was because they saved a window seat for our reservation!  Our server was Max, whom was very professional and attentive.  He made excellent recommendations and my husband got the crabcake appetizer and salmon w/ shrimp entree.   I ordered the crab-stuffed chicken and we shared the lobster mac & cheese.  The chicken breast was seasoned well on the outside, and the crabmeat was filled inside the chicken.  Mac & Cheese was creamy based with jumbo peices of lobster meat through out (Definitely enough to share)  I sampled my husband's crabcake and it had a crispy coating and soft inside with sauces drizzled on the side for dipping.  Very tasty.  The view is what makes this restaurant one of a kind.  It slowly spins 360 degrees allowing you to catch every angle of the city.  Since we got dinner, we were invited to the observation deck (at no additional charge) to see the city a little higher up.  We had a amazing time!

CP8C49wZH8H9YKQVhE8DEw.text: By the time news had spread of Pawan Pinisetti's pending departure from Top of The World Restaurant reservations had already been made for Saturday, dinner for three originally intended to take a look at Spring's bounty quickly turning into a delicious "Bon Voyage" spanning three courses.  The fourth visit in seven months, all with the newly-crowned Chopped champion at the helm, it was ascending to the 107th Floor that guests checked in prior to occupying a window-side seats one level down, a young man this time providing professional service that was simultaneously friendly and genuine.  Tweaking everything from Appetizers to Desserts in early April, Pawan's penchant for sourcing and simplicity on display across ten new items, it was starting with seasonal Cocktails that setting sun was watched, both Honey Bumble Bee and Top of The World's twist on a Cable Car sweet but balanced while the Orange Cosmo is far more Spirit-forward.  Trying to show restraint with Bread, though the lightly-sugared Brioche and Baguette made for soaking-up Sauces were mostly gone by meal's end, it was utilizing top-grade Avocados that the first of two Salads shined thanks to Hot Sauce and Sunflower Seeds, a follow-up of Tomatoes and domestic Mozzarella also performing well without trying to reinvent the wheel.   Quickly growing more meaty, Winter's Tuna Tartare with picked Wasabi replaced by Fish brightened by Soy and Fresno Chilis, it was actually finely ground Beef that this time stole the spotlight, in one part due to the inclusion of classic accoutrements but additionally owing to fried Pita intended to be used as a delivery mechanism.     Overloading the table for round two, sixteen ounces of Grass-fed Beef from Tasmania prepared medium the centerpiece, it was with sides of Lobster Macaroni and Cheese and buttery Potatoes that each bite delivered big flavor, the addition of three Sauces gilding the proverbial lily and a toss-up between Bearnaise and Truffle Gouda Cheese as to which was better.  Neglecting to photograph Pea Pods with a hint of Mint, each bite the very definition of fresh, it was finding Brussels Sprouts a touch undercooked that focus switched back to Beef, previously-tasted Cavatelli and braised Wagyu standing up well to Horseradish-infused Cream just as Swordfish Steak did to Pepperonata that varied from sweet to spicy and back again with each bite.  Obligated to offer Scallops, the fan-favorites expertly seared atop creamy Cauliflower, it should come as no surprise to savvy diners that U3 Prawns packed far more bang for the buck with nothing more than Garlic Butter and Lemon while Lamb from New Zealand also took a "less is more" approach in allowing the Protein to shine.     Requesting Coffee with Dessert, its delivery timely despite the grand finale arriving fast, suffice it to say that Top of the World's 21-layer Chocolate Cake and Baked Alaska both remain formidable showstoppers, though the newly-launched Butter Cake is not far off thanks to what must be a whole stick dissolved in Sugar and Flour that retains a bit of tooth, thus contrasting nicely against slowly melting Ice Cream.

Vid3UgTU2OKdXnNBFGv_-A.text: OH MY GAH! I swear, if he would have gotten down on one knee and proposed right then and there, I would have screamed YESSS! I mean, yes to the view, not the proposal. HA!   The view of the City of Vegas during the sunset is breathtaking, need I say more?  During a lovely weekend in Vegas, Mr. and I were driving around trying to escape the rain. While he was trying to take me to Fremont Street for a night stroll, it began to rain and I refused to get out the car and mess up my hair. Welp, he got it after a while and drove around downtown Vegas when I had noticed the Stratosphere. In extreme excitement, I requested we go there to see what was in the building. He gave me a smirk and replied, "Oh, you're going to love me for this". Without hesitation, I sucked my lips and gave him a "yea, okay" type of look. Little did I know, it was in for a lovely ride to the 104th floor. Although we didn't have reservations, we had no problem getting access to be seated right away, it was perfect! Everything worked out so smoothly like it was meant to be.   This is absolutely perfect for a romantic dinner; pricey, but nice indeed! Our wonderful host, Damien, was able to seat us with a lovely view of the strip of Downtown Vegas as we began our 360 degrees (slow) revolving view of the city. We had a wonderful view from the window. The rotating restaurant offers a wonderful view of the strip and once you have had enough drinks and food, you get free access to the 108 and 109 floors (observation deck)! Make sure you ask your server because our server, Dana, wasn't the friendliest but it helped that we had a wonderful waiter that kept us entertained by talking to us about Vegas and the different things to do in the Stratosphere building. Our waiter was actually the one that informed us that we would have access to the observation deck. Alas, Dana must have disliked me and the boo because she previously informed us that if we get JUST drinks, then we wouldn't have access to the observation deck (totally left a bad taste in my mouth) UGH.   LET'S MOVE ON....   The drinks here are delicious and totally worth it! We heard so much about the bread so we had to order it. Little did we know, the bread was not complimentary and cost $5. Ugh, I sure wish they could have told us that before we ordered it! But, let's be honest--its Vegas what did I expect?! I love that you can see people bungee-jumping from the building. It was actually very cool to watch while dining.   Let's just say, the Top of the WORLD is OVER the TOP! One of the MOST romantic things that we both could have done, definitely something to remember.

I-D9rOb2D6Cr-fiZEw0R0g.text: We first dined at Top of the. World many years ago shortly after moving to Vegas, coming to celebrate an occasion with our adult daughter. We loved it. But it fell off our radar and we hadn't been back since. Mistake! Friends who have eaten here many times suggested it for dinner and conversation. Excellent idea.  Probably the only real negative to the evening was having to walk through the casino and then through security to get to the elevators to take you up to the restaurant. We came at a bad time because it took about 10 minutes just to get through the security line and on to the elevator (and the elevator was really packed for the ride up). Once we got into the restaurant, everything improved. We had hoped to get a table next to the window but ended up in a booth. Advantages to each. The tables are closer to the window but you sit facing your dinner companions, not the view. In the booth, you get to look out at the view while you dine. Because the booths are elevated there is no obstructed view in the house. The meal starts with a basket of breads - three different small rolls and a few boards of the very thin crisps. I opted to get the tasting menu (4 courses, $106). My wife ordered the ribeye ($59) with a side of sweet potato fries ($12). My first course was a lobster bisque soup. The server brings a bowl with a serving of lobster in the center and then adds the hot soup in at the table. The bisque was very thick and very tasty. Outstanding start to the meal. For my second course, I chose the cavatelli pasta. This is a small tube pasta with wagyu beef ragu, wild mushrooms with a horseradish cream on top. Wow! Delish. For my third course, I chose the filet mignon. This was a 10 oz piece of meat with a brown sauce cooked to perfection. One of the best filets I have had in years. It was served with three large grilled shrimp, potato puree and 3 asparagus spears. I'm not a fan of asparagus, but the potatoes and the shrimp were excellent. For dessert, I shared my salted caramel creme brulee with my wife. So much food, neither of us could finish it all.  Service was excellent throughout. Clint, our server, was informative and personable. The food runners and busboys all did a great job. Is it pricey? Yup. But is it worth it? Also yes.

lyeAFbKw04_4gLrTX3_uPw.text: This is the best view of LAS Vegas. The elevator ride took us up to the restaurant and lounge in a matter of seconds.  Elegant white linen dinning for the romantics or the company event.  The four course menu has two amazing sets to choose from.  The a la carte menu is abundant in steak cuts aged and even wagyu. I suggest the four course with filet minion to go with the 360 view of Las Vegas.  Make reservations at 7-730pm.  Which is taller the space needle in Seattle or the LAS Vegas Stratosphere?

gMr6ZeDmrQC1p2BZirnsHQ.text: This place is everything. For years I wanted to eat here and my bf finally took me here. It's a revolving restaurant with all of Vegas beautiful view! The surf and turf was amazing along with their complimentary bread. I believe the floor we were on was floor 106. But 107 is the lounge and 108 is the observation with bungee jumpers. And last but certainly not the least the Rooftop has a bar and rides to get on. All of them have the same spectacular view. Oh! And keep in mind the elevator to take you to these floors goes 1,800 feet per minute. Feels pretty scary lol but you'll get get over it. But anyway this is the place to be with your date or even family.  There is also a photographer that goes around and offers to take pictures for you. Our pictures came out so great!

9JgWZRqXtChtjMjSKuBaMg.text: 2 star for food 4 star for view.   Requested a table at the outer rim and went around 730, so we got to see both day n night breathtaking 360 view of Vegas. The restaurant slowly rotates. And it is fun seeing people jump off the top.   Foie Gras and lobster bisque appetizers were ok. Nothing too special.   Seafood alfredo: okay. Loved the shrimp n lobster, fresh and succulent. But the pasta itself was bland.   Truffle pasta: skip. Flavorless. And the pasta was too mushy for me. Cooked a bit too long.   Wagyu Ribeye added lobster tail: ok. Steak was a bit tough.   Note: need to go through a metal detector downstairs.

fApYwIKtqSpULidM2Vypcw.text: We made reservations for dinner after our wedding and I couldn't be any happier with our choice.  When we arrived, we were nicely greeted and we were seated very fast. We had an amazing view, my food was cook exactly like I requested. Our waitress was so nice, and polite. I am one happy customer...

gbNiwmakgsgTw5kawdLP0Q.text: Amazing experience and great place to dine! Made reservations to this place while planning our short Vegas trip here about a month ago.  We were seated immediately at 7:45pm on a Friday night.  Took an elevator to go all the way upstairs and its split between the restaurant and the viewing area.  Ordered the Australian lobster tail with the wagyu steak and it was delicious!!!!!!!! the dining area spins as you dine and you can get a 360 view of vegas and it was MINDBLOWING!!!! definitely would recommend this place, it is a bit pricey tho but that view just makes up for it !

aOjfD65_HoYcOaxkkJYQJA.text: Had high expectations, unfortunately it fell a little flat. Food was great quality but could have been seasoned better. Wine was disappointing and martini was just fair.   The kicker was the bill. Over $350 (incl tip) for 2 people. Ate at Hells Kitchen night before and bill was almost $100 less, for 2 rounds of drinks (instead of 1), plus 2 desserts and coffee.   The view *was* sensational though!   It was good, but didn't think it was worth the exorbitant price. We unfortunately won't be back.

WIz4F_Sl0wYIbK8FIvDqaQ.text: Absolutely fabulous!!!!!!! The breathtaking view on the 106th floor over seeing the entire Vegas strip, the ambience was dim and romantic, the music was fun with a mixture of old & new school. THE FOOD was delicious, we had the lobster bisque for starters, I had the swordfish which was remarkable full of flavor and seasoned to perfection, a side order of the lobster Mac & cheese & the Brussels sprouts. My partner whom we celebrated his birthday at Top of the World had the grilled salmon which was wonderful . We even brought our own bottle of champagne  and paid a small cork fee . The customer service was exceptional from start to finish. I will most definitely be visiting here again

HXAsofKBI7pWRpl2d_oJXw.text: 3 course lunch was DELICIOUS. I had Ceasar Salad, Salmon, and Cheesecake.  But the view was to die for.

wyCebacJbQu_2c9aRaTZxw.text: Top of the World restaurant in the Stratosphere Hotel/Casino was an amazing experience. The tower is the tallest structure in Vegas and the view is incredible.   The restaurant rotates in a circle while dining which takes about 45 minutes for a full revolution so you get a spectacular view of all sides of Vegas.   Make sure to go early before your reservation (make sure to make a reservation) as there is a wait for the elevator up the tower and the security checkpoint that consists of a metal detector and bag check (safety first). My only other tip is to make sure to request a seat by the window when making reservations. If you are taking the time and spending the money....make sure you have the maximum experience.   We went at sunset so we were able to view Vegas at daylight and during the evening with the lights.   Staff was very friendly and the food was delicious. Our waitress upgraded us to the window seat for my birthday. People all around us were there for special occasions and recommend to wear nice clothing. When it's 108 in Vegas it's easy to just wear shorts and a t-shirt without thinking twice about it.   Stratosphere is among the older hotels but the restaurant is still the best dining experience in Vegas.

fVGYxMaEMSt7R8B_PN04Kg.text: What can I say it's a moving restaurant!!! my sister bought it to my attention while we were in Vegas food was excellent. The portions were small but just enough!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HIKwAFboHzfAl17_Yx6cDA.text: This place is so great! We went for my husband's birthday while on vacation, and it was a great choice. The rotating part of the restaurant is so cool! In a little over an hour, you get to see the entire Vegas skyline from the top of the Stratosphere. We had really great service and the food was super great. I highly recommend the lobster bisque! That was probably the best bowl of lobster bisque I've ever had. That alone was worth it. My husband and I each got steak, and they were delicious. We shared the lobster mac & cheese and green beans, but honestly we were so full by the end of the meal, we should have shared just one side. If you are looking for a really nice meal in Vegas, this is it!

yYlnjvbQ50qpPJg1Wd9myQ.text: This place was eh. 5 stars for the view and 3 stars for the food. So I'm visiting Vegas to celebrate my sisters birthday and I told her to choose the place she would like no matter the cost for her b-day dinner. She chose "Top of the World" restaurant at the Stratosphere hotel. The place is easy to find. Once you check in, you're directed to go thru a metal detector then proceed to the elevator to be taken to the top.   Although I requested to be sat on the outer rim close to the window when I made reservations online two weeks in advance, it's not guaranteed and you must ask upon arrival. So this was a bummer when we couldn't get seated in our requested area for the better view and pictures. None the less where we were seated was ok. We had two waiters but I forget their names and they were nice explaining the menu items and their specials.   My sister and I for drinks ordered the mango madness and a glass of moscato and both were really good. For our main course we both went with their surf and turf which came with a 9 oz Filet mignon, lobster tail and mixed vegetables. We also order a shared side of mashed potatoes. They do give a complimentary basket of bread variety with different butters. The food was ok. Could have been a lot better for what I paid. If you're going for the view cool but the food is just mediocre in my opinion and I have dined at some of the best fine dining restaurants in DC and NY so I definitely know the difference.   Another thing as mentioned above...this was a birthday celebration and my sister was acknowledged however when it came down to her birthday desert they do not offer complimentary special occasion dessert you have to pay for it. Never been to a place that don't give a free dessert when celebrating a special event when we could have gone somewhere else. So this was new to me and maybe it's just how it's done is Vegas idk.   This was definitely a one time visit and I would not be back. Mainly because I think there are better options I can spend over $200 on.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Madness 3-11-17
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Driving to the Stratosphere Hotel. The top is the revolving restaurant. 3-11-17
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and Turf, mash potato shared side, basket of bread 3-11-17

uiu08lW8CchCA4ltItzUtw.text: This was only my second visit, and I already have to update my review. Very disappointed.  The seafood we ordered didn't look fresh, and worst of all, the oysters had a foul taste to them. Seriously, feeding people spoiled oysters for $50/dozen is disrespectful to say the least.

5EQMrgB8N3xloSiHCFM0Dw.text: We made a reservation for my niece bachelorette. It took 10 mins more then the reservation time. It's a very niece atmosphere. Food was great.

YwpYFK57xnGHE9CBsPwbag.text: You don't come here for the food. You come here for the view and experience. Food is fine but not the best. I would def. try it out again... maybe...

kQyS9AN-3kmyvJiIfxADTQ.text: Unfortunately traffic caused me to push back my arrival time so I changed my reservation on Opentable. Even still, I had to call in to let them know I might be arriving a little later and they did a great job accommodating my arrival time.  This was my first time at Stratosphere even though I've been to Vegas a mess of time. The whole experience from parking to going up to the restaurant was a nice journey. I liked that parking didn't cost. Each person in check in was very nice and well mannered.   Food: French Onion Soup - I prefer traditional mozzarella instead of the fondue. It was an interesting take  Tuna Tartare Tacos - amazing, best thing I had, The taro shells were a great compliment.   Filet Mignon 10oz - Very average. Dry, overcooked, and the plating on the big plate made the steak look very pathetic. I was extremely disappointed.  Sides - Lobster Mac - Great Mac, saucy style Mac but the amount of lobster was always disappointing. Any lobster Mac lacks the lobster so I guess you can't expect much.  Sauteed Broccolini - Very average. Waiter warned us it might be spicy cause of the chili flakes. Hot Cheetos has more kick than this.   The food itself was okay. I loved the Tuna Tartare tacos. Everything else wasn't all that impressive. I thought they would have the pre fixe menu but that ended the day before. The pre fixe menu had a better course than the items presented. I think it was a little more well thought out. The filet was the worst decision. I don't expect a filet to be overly juicy, but it was honestly poorly cooked. I like my steak medium rare and it was a solid medium. The dryness of the steak showed that it sat too long. If they had the sauce they described in the pre fixe, it would've made a lot of sense. Everything else I order was okay. The service itself was great. I don't mind that.  Luckily the view and the fact the sunset was priceless. I don't regret the experience and I am glad I got to share it with my date. I would just never come back there again. The revolving restaurant was a cool ploy but I don't think the food stands up to the atmosphere. Nevertheless, I don't discourage people to come here, there's a lot of value. I just think you shouldn't be caught up with everything and the price tag to not be able to see the quality in the food.

DTVABUPcgE0-5aw45LwfyA.text: I had read some mixed reviews but we decided to go for our anniversary. We knew our bill would be over $200 which it was.   I really don't have any complaints. We arrived early and they sent us up a level to the bar. The staff continued to wish us Happy Anniversary along the way.   Our waiter was really great, polite, and humorous. The restaurant was busy (it was the weekend before Valentine's so maybe people were celebrating early).   We even got to see the sky jumpers!  Super cool!  My filet mignon was cooked perfectly. Tender and delicious. My husband also had steak and he said it was really good (can't remember what he got but I remember it was $79)  I loved the view and it was romantic looking out over the city for our anniversary   This was something on our bucket list so I am glad we got a chance to do it.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2nH-1RZ_2YXs7e36wndcsw.text: Eating at this restaurant at The Stratosphere is an experience and bucket list item..... not for the food but for the view of Las Vegas as you eat on the circular section that rotates around the entire city over an hour and 20 min time frame.  The views while sipping on wine and having your dinner are amazing.  We had the 4-course dinner and it was quite good food!  Our filet was huge and well cooked.  The creme brulee's were also quite good.  The dish that impressed me was the beef and pasta appetizer in the second course.  A nice surprise that was tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view before nightfall....

_VfoXCFbomf2PwhM76FG4w.text: We ate here for our anniversary and enjoyed the best view in all of Las Vegas. The food was delicious, albeit pricey, and the entire restaurant rotates slowly clockwise while you eat. We came during the daylight but I imagine it would be even more spectacular at night.

awAbmzUe4LE421aSYR68iA.text: I visited on Saturday last week.  The food was good and the atmosphere was good.  However, I thought that I ordered the course, but the dessert did not come out and I got the receipt.  So I just left.  It would have been nice if the staff were kinder.

DuN1Jdpo0eutXrXX5TLqRg.text: A bit pricey but you can not put a price on the views and overall atmosphere.  Took a buddy there to celebrate his birthday.  We both had their four course combo meal and it was well worth the price.  Definitely is a place I will go back to. I highly recommend it!  The service was also 5 STAR

KqVvBAVhMqft0uPsAX7prg.text: We had lunch. It was nice. Good service, good food, nice atmosphere, as we were eating you can see people jumping off of building.  The restaurant rotates around one revolution in an hour. Great views.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Selfie!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Torta.

06LVe1dZxhwRMqNLEUKUhg.text: Pros- Amazing view! Very cool setting for a nice dinner. Cons- everything else. With high prices you expect at least flavorful food/drinks. And at the least SOME service. The waiters were MIA all night. Never got a refill on water even when asked.  Also if you like multiple cocktails order them all up front. Good luck getting more of anything from this restaurant.  Something to know. Getting out of this restaurant may take some time. A few people waiting to get on the elevator to leave threw temper tantrums due to the wait. What made everything worse was the staff who instead of being polite and attempting to ease the tension decided to also act like children and yell back with their own tantrum. Absolutely pathetic.. It was comedic

FnKVzqN_UnJj5wJPwEiBVQ.text: The views and food are amazing! Probably the only reason to make your way inside the Stratosphere.

-3yfhSy9k2_49OP2p4dDgg.text: Top of the world is incredible 360-degree view restaurant . We had nice birthday dinner and really enjoyed night city view and food was great .

hjBUbyRrdveM6RJkN2mBqw.text: The view can't be beat. The food is normally pretty close to being flawless. Decently price to be honest. Tonight, the service was a little slow. It was pretty packed but our waiter walked by our table 4 times before acknowledging that our plates had been cleared a while ago. Weird. Seemed distracted. I had the scallops, prawns, and lobster. Everything was great but I personally would wanted it to be seared a little longer. The sangria is amazing. Worth it. Bananas fosters. Pretty good.  Front desk, I dinging them because I told them I wanted a table where we can see the sunset. They told us 7:45pm. Well, we missed it. Kinda sucks if that's part of what you were looking forward to seeing. Would return. Worth the money. The view seriously can't be beat...

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome view!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon. Perfectly cooked!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio. Scallops, prawns, and lobster. Delicious!

Q0wpFAbK1TiWLk40VhcMvA.text: I am here now and could not wait to review this place.. Eating lunch, had the lunch Prix (surf and turf) with 3 white peach sangria's.. I had to rate this restaurant a 5 because everything was amazing food, drinks, the view, and most important the service. Our waitress Carolina was a 10 star server... I will definitely be back to Vegas and will be starting with this restaurant first!!!!

fdEYvA6lTwXuuyw8TQZcOw.text: The view a million dollar view The food not We reserved window seat three months ago They said it's first come first serve Waiter was incredible at explaining everything (Jeff ) Too bad he wasn't the chef Waited over 1.5 hr for food Even after Apps Had to order more bread, Dessert also not impressive The worst was service They introduce to waiters to assist you Took forever to get refills and they never cleaned up anything till we started stacking it up on table , second waitress ( Grace ) not amazeing.... Wife had the Veg plate just ok .... Son a Ny strip which was actually good but he's 10 and no kid menu 60.00 steak we took half home I had the very impressive steak oscar with crab, meat was very chewy like beaten to death special crab topping Not that special.... Go to Observation deck inpressive , eat at strip say Capital Griil awesome place .... food , service, and great location overlooking the wynn on the strip

Dj5XskUoDgw6GZWIrus32g.text: I cannot understand why this place has such good reviews. The view is fantastic and the experience itself was cool. The service was also good. But the food was just not very impressive for the hefty price tag. I would recommend going to the lounge or observation deck. Skip the dinner. It's my biggest regret of all of the money I spent in Vegas.

-k5Gg-90-SzjwCIWkR_Zow.text: Visiting the Top of the World was a surreal experience.  My husband and I celebrated his 30th Birthday, and each staff member that we encountered with told my husband happy birthday which made the experience personal.  Our waiter Ricky was amazing, the food was brought out in a timely fashion.  There was even a photographer there that came around to take our picture.  Top of the World is a must if you are in Vegas!

zazQzCoHh36Rd2DnTvVQZw.text: This was the biggest letdown of my life. After getting my food and tasting it I almost wanted to jump out of the building like the other people are doing outside of the window. The lobster bisque was not very good like other people have raved about. The pork belly was actually very flavorful and I did enjoy that. I got the 14 ounce ribeye cooked medium. It was probably the worst the steak I've ever had in my life. We got a glass of Merlot and it was also not good. The only good thing about this place is the view at night. It is very cool to see the city lit up. The service was good and everyone was very friendly. However expect to drop a pretty penny for your meal. If I were you reading this review I would skip the overrated overly expensive low quality food and opt for the half-price appetizers late night. Do yourself a favor and pay yourself $200 by not going here.

nSSnxu5Gkwzq_7dD_n445Q.text: Very Pricey, BUT NO REGRETS!!! My husband had the skirt steak and I had the filet. So amazing and I don't know that I could have steak anywhere else again. We also had mashed potatoes, drinks, and desert. Great for a date and a wonderful view of the city. Really makes you feel special.

QQezo0otU8maEi3U_wOWhA.text: My fiance and I had dinner here on a Wednesday night for Valentines Day week. It was not busy at all but I still made a reservation just in case. We got seated by the window and you get a 360 degree view of the entire city of Vegas because the center rotates. We were told that it takes about 1 hour & 20 minutes for it to go a complete circle.   The view is GORGEOUS. I believe you are about 108 floors up. And because the view is so amazing, they get 4 stars. The one missing star is for their food. It's really not the best. I'm sure a lot of people come here for the view, not the food.

FiMpL4u0QCya6EzM5CSg9w.text: When I booked a table for 4 at the Top of The World I was expecting a typical Vegas high end tourist trap (translation: bad service, so-so food, astronomical prices). Boy I was wrong. Let me go straight to the details:  1) Incredible view of Vegas, and the restaurant spins, thus you get a 360o view in about 1 hour. After dinner you have free access to the observation deck. Awesome.  2) Food was very good.... but expensive (thus the 4*'s). We ordered a lot of stuff, from salads to appetizers to entree and then the delicious banana flambee desert. OMG, and the wines, fairly priced, we had two bottles.  3) Service: attentive, polite, efficient. Really. Yes, I know, can this be Vegas? Yep. I wish most fancy Vegas restaurants had waiters like the one we had at TOTW.  4) Other goodies: valet parking is free, also enjoy the observation deck as much as you want, and watch the nut-freaks jumping of the platform (they charge $110 for you to crap in your pants). Take lots pictures. I took 7584 pictures that evening. I also believe a wheel chair is complimentary after you over-eat and over-drink and can't even walk to your car. Also lot's of hot babes with their boyfriends  note: if  he catches you staring at his girl friend's ultra-mini-skirt (is that a Victoria Secret price tag dangling of the thong's back part?) and cleavage (34dd), and he wants to beat the soul out off your skull, pretend you are a tourist from Estonia and staring at someones girlfriends boobs will bring great luck to the village and fertility to the cows. Don't forget the Russian accent, otherwise you are dead.  In summary: we had a great evening at TOTW restaurant. I was not expecting it, I was pleasantly surprised. Recommended!

qAgh0oh7xLxp0gsx-VEsdQ.text: Had the smoked Atlantic salmon which was ok however the lobster bisque was awesome! Also had the 16oz Aspen Ridge Prime ribeye which was cooked perfectly. Service was a little slow in the beginning but the waiter stepped it up in the end. 360 view of the city at sunset was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime ribeye cooked perfectly
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque was really good

GL2Bgfawb2bQjJx-GtHMIw.text: Nice restaurant to visit. Food was not as spectacular as I would have expected. For the prices they have I consider you are paying for location. The restaurant rotates and you get to see a nice view of the city.  It was surprising to see someone jump from the tower while I was having dinner.  Customer service is nice.  They fulfilled my request to have a table next to the window.  I showed up late for my reservation and was still able to have a table. My drink order from the lounge was lost but I received a complimentary drink, can't complain. Drinks were good. It's nice to visit this place when the sun sets.

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry Martini.

djqS1-ExUAVBGy3CGrqKPg.text: Had a beautiful evening here with my boyfriend. We had 8 o clock reservations and were sitted in a booth looking at the city lights of Las Vegas, I had the rack of Lamb which was superb btw.. My boyfriend had a seafood linguine pasta, I tried his but it was a little too salty for me, for a side we got the twice baked potato... Definitely a romantic evening and will probably be back to try out the brunch next time. Forgot out waiters name but he was very attentive and friendly.
