91X2wPIYh9yWl7l9wXGEzg.text: Price: higher than they should have been, but the view does help ease the pain.  Excellent service. Our waitress was very helpful.  Food: expensive, but portion sizes were decent. The lamb was perfectly cooked and the sauce was delicious.

CROsGZetCfZlsTjceH8Cmg.text: Joey made our night much better a total 180 degrees from the lounge area! We had a free mini toast. Wonderful service and thoroughly enjoyed the coconut Thai curry soup and the Thermidor dish with lobster, crab and potatoes. Our server was quick, polite, and didn't make us feel rushed one bit. Finished w complimentary birthday dessert and a stunning sunset of the entire Vegas city. Will be back on our next trip :D

tLtqgifNwCwwZMnT8SCs5A.text: First off, this is the nicest restaurant I've ever been to, so I went in with high expectations; and let me just say they were pretty much met.   I ordered the wagyu skirt steak medium well. I was blown away. The sauce it was cooked in was wonderful and the steak itself was cooked to perfection and was not tough or anything. I can't explain how good it was.  My bf ordered the new York strip medium and his also was made perfectly. It melted in your mouth.   The only part I would complain about is our waitress's service took a little nose dive with us after another table of hers blew something wrong with their order completely out of proportion. She became very short with us and didn't seem like she had the time of day for us.  Also, if you take the monorail over take a left once you cross the street. Don't go straight. It's kind of a sketchy neighborhood. So honestly I would just take a cab

6Rf_ZnE5Z4g_aAQ-QBCL1g.text: Such a beautiful view of the entirety of Vegas as you revolve.  We went at sundown, the perfect time for the panoramic view.  The food is also top class.  Based on the great expense, this is a celebratory event only for special occasions.  The noise level is surprisingly quiet.  We never heard another couple's conversation and heard each other perfectly.    Arriving early, we enjoyed cocktails while admiring the view of the strip.  The tasting menu was enjoyable, each dish beautifully presented and each wine presented with a detailed description.    An unique combination of dinner and ambiance that has to be experienced to comprehend.

ZUxFqphvEKKxYMHFkfN18A.text: This restaurant has a stunning view of Las Vegas, and makes a full rotation in about an hour, so every spot has an amazing view.  The sections are numbered, which is helpful to find your table if you leave to wash your hands or whatnot.  The rotation of the restaurant is slow so don't worry about getting sick or dizzy. I've been in rotating restaurants before that spun too fast, which isn't fun when you're trying to enjoy a good meal.  We started our meal with the market greens salad:  tomatoes, fennel, roasted beets, with balsamic vinaigrette on top.  The salad is held together with thick strips of fresh, crunchy cucumber.  Delicious.  For dinner I had the Large Mexican Prawns, New England Scallops & Lobster a la Plancha with roasted cauliflower salad with red bell pepper, golden raisins and capers, Moorish tomato sauce and chive oil.  I had never had Lobster a la plancha before, and this was simply amazing.  My husband ordered the Fettuccine Seafood Alfredo with Lobster, Prawns & Scallops with artisanal pasta, teardrop tomatoes, Parmesan Reggiano, garlic, parsley and basil.  The alfredo sauce wasn't too heavy which is nice and flavorful.  For dessert, everything looked amazing but we finally chose the lemon cheesecake with white chocolate shavings.  Tarty and thick, this cheesecake was amazing.  This restaurant is perfect for a romantic dinner to celebrate a special occasion.  Business casual attire is required, so don't try to come here in flip flops and shorts.  I would also recommend getting a reservation so you can guarantee you'll get a spot by the window.

HRCCgWlAkcjKYdWPAQ54uQ.text: The view is amazing! I was literally focused on my view rather than my dinner plate! The vibe is chill! The staff is friendly and I felt welcomed! My steak was not all that, I had better. But I would deff go back for the view!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

53SrooS5JvVLbFDLlj7leg.text: We decided to try this restaurant at the last minute.  We didn't have a reservation but they were able to fit us in anyways.  It did take a while to go up because of the long elevator line.  But when we finally made it to the top the view was amazing!! The food was delicious but the server was eh! You could tell he didn't care for his job.  We took pictures and they were offered to us at the end but they were $45. It was way too much for our blood lol. Fyi, it is an older place now so when it's turning there is a part where it makes the loudest noise!!!! The first time we heard it we got a little frighten.  But we were told it was normal,  but you would think with the prices they would be able to oil those wheels up or something.  Anyways,  after dinner we went to the Final floor and enjoyed the view.  It was an overall great experience!

Po_MUmPLA42re8AnM3NV8A.text: I came here on 2/13/11 with my boyfriend for our one year anniversary. I had researched a ton of romantic restaurants (thanks yelp!) and settle on The Top of the World. It was wonderful! Our reservation was for 4:45, perfect to see the sights in the daylight AND after sunset.   Our server, Dalia, was a total sweetheart. She even helped take some pictures using my camera, as I kept trying to get one of the sunset and they just weren't turning out right.  The food was phenomenal. Both my boyfriend and I went with the five course tasting menu. Everything was top notch but my favorites were the crab cake and the filet mignon. Both of those were the best I've ever had! The crab cake was so decadent, and the filet was melt-in-your-mouth and cooked perfectly.  The best part, however, was right before dessert. My boyfriend got up from the table, came around to my side, got down on one knee and proposed! He had even spoken to Dalia ealier in the evening and had arranged for the professional photographer to come around and snap photos while he proposed, how special is that?! Oh, and of course I said yes :)  We ended up getting two photo albums and two wallet size albums, which cost a pretty penny BUT since we were already spending a lot for the amazing dinner, springing for the photos was too good to pass up. Plus, how often do you get photo's of your proposal?! That, to me, made the whole night totally priceless.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the view at night
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. mmmmm delicious crab cake
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my man excited for dinner (and probably nervous about proposing lol)

cdmU_AL7s46B-4YW1cA6Qw.text: Poor service all around. We weren't greeted or welcomed and waited 20-30 minutes after being seated before we were even acknowledged. Our server asked immediately asked us if we were ready to order before we had even chosen our drinks. In addition the menu was very limited and overpriced for the selection. After waiting another 15 minutes or so before she returned we decided we did not want to eat there due to the poor service. Upon telling our server we had changed our mind about dining there, she promptly said "ok, you will need to move to the bar" instead of even asking why or what was wrong! Overall very disappointing experience. We ended up going to Morton's instead and they were wonderful!

X2PIBAhiojDrOWWF0ulu_g.text: The best lobster bisque in town. Most amazing view ever. An experience I will never forget. I need to go back there and just enjoy a fantastic meal and drinks again -- the cost is a little high but you're paying for the view, the great company of a server that cares, and the most incredible food (that you can tell the chef cares a great deal about). If you are unhappy with anything, they replace the item immediately and apologize profusely for the mistake. I spent probably more than I should have but this is definitely a spot worth spending serious cash on. If you go, the atmosphere is just amazing and order the lobster bisque and almost anything seafood related. You will not be disappointed.

zXOBuWsjVUqHRyE32hmDeQ.text: Special night - awesome view ! Good food and service. It was interesting how the Restuarant moves ad you barely feel it unless you are walking. Would recommend!

0RTRsmnITX_BTCIgOrznAw.text: Absolutely amazing restaurant. Went here in 2013 for our anniversary and will be back this year for our anniversary dinner as well. This was by far the BEST (although expensive) meal I have ever had. The view is absolutely incredible and I definitely have some amazing pictures of the sunset and the strip at night. We are very much looking forward to going again soon!    Food-5 stars  View-5 stars  Service-4 stars

_-idxCcDMnwY24y5cOwRsQ.text: Excellent service, food & panoramic view of Las Vegas!  After our dinner, we went up to the roof top for drinks & take in the city lights.  A must go to restaurant, when you're in Las Vegas!

mZ_HvYqVQ-NwEOZyEA8Q_w.text: Celebrated our anniversary there and we loved the view and the staff! However they need to get better quality food, the appetizers were good , but the steak and lobster wasn't at all. They have a awesome view but the food was over priced for what you get, maybe try the lunch menu if we go back with the family.

ef6SOr0-A0g_3jcO1n08LA.text: I think this place survives primarily because of the views.  The decor is definitely outdated and seems to match the rest of the Stratosphere Hotel.  We ordered the four course tasting menu and the skirt steak.  Everything (lobster bisque, crab cakes, filet and skirt steak) was very dry and lacked much flavor.  The food was definitely extremely disappointing and overpriced.  The positives for this restaurant were the views and the service; Rafael was our waiter and gave great service throughout the whole meal, especially selling food that he probably knew was subpar.  My recommendation, go to the observatory for the views and get your meal somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the table

Hal3GPJYc3BqDTsYZgKF9w.text: My hubby and I came to Vegas to celebrate our 10 year anniversary over Columbus Day weekend.  I chose Top of the World in large part because of the view.  It did not disappoint.  I made reservations for 6pm in the hopes of catching the sunset, which we did.  Big plus.  We were also able to see a sky jumper, another plus!  Our server, Bon, was great.  He was very pleasant, friendly, and helpful.     The food was just okay which is disappointing because the entrees are pretty pricey.  My husband had the halibut (bland) and I had the turf and quack (perfectly prepared but flavor was just eh).  It just wasn't anything to write home about really.  I was hoping for a fantastic meal but the flavor just wasn't there.  For the money, you can definitely find a better meal anywhere on The Strip!  I personally wouldn't come back for the food.  I do, however, highly recommend the view.  So I would suggest paying the $16 (or whatever it cost)  to access the viewing deck or go there for lunch and spend way less than what you would for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. view from our table + a sky jumper

htxDkKPc86RegyyFRjJZHw.text: I came here in 2014, my now husband wanted to do something romantic and this fit the bill. It is far better then anything else then anything I have seen in Vegas. Very good service, very good food and great views.

d2t9wHdT-9rUOtiLQAsKGA.text: We had a glass of Reisling was just ok, a Budweiser, typical.  We ordered the wedge salad, typical, the lobster bisque, extremely unbalanced in flavor, very sweet.  My husband had a steak that was impeccable, but I chose the seafood (lobster, shrimp, scallops grilled), I should have realized that grilled was a factor, as if you want good seafood, it should never be grilled.  Extremely chewy and rough, plus the tomato "chutney" was overwhelming.  If you go here, its a great atmosphere, excellent service, but don't order seafood,  its not seafood cuisine!

jPCfKeRPmWPouQXcm-ECSg.text: Food was good but was disappointed they don't recognize locals as this is something we look for. Also the lobster bisque was good but had paprika which we did not care for. The filet was amazing.

FRoBojl4gw1RhsGL5ksRHw.text: Put reservations in early for Valentines Day . Requested Window seat.  Reservations were at 5pm. Got there at 4:30. Was seated pretty quick..maybe 3 minute wait. However got seating next to the column that was actually nexr to the window so that waa disappointing. Bread basket was great. We ordered rack of lamb and rib eye and twice baked potato. Baked potato was amazing. But both of our main dishes werent good. Neither of us liked the food and it literally took an hour an a half to get our food. Wont be going here ever again. View was amazing and staff waa nice. Even got a rose with the check.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb

3gyIlxKbX-kbVyxnLo1u4A.text: The more sophisticated "roller coaster" of the Stratosphere Hotel. And I say this because the restaurant spins around the hotel at the top, giving you a 360 degree view of the city.  VENUE: We were escorted via elevator to the very top of the hotel. We stepped out, and were greeted and immediately sat at a table for two by the windows. As the circumference of the restaurant is ceiling-to-floor glass, and because it was 1PM in the afternoon, natural light just streamed in all around us. It was super bright yet, quiet and intimate. Not too many tables at 1PM (on the 4th of July, no less), which meant 2-3 people were coming by to check on us and make sure we were comfortable. Also as the restaurant spins around, you get a view of the people who are doing the bungee jump off the hotel. Fun to watch and it didn't take away from the air of sophistication at all.   FOOD/DRINK: Oh my heavens. If you decide to drink and enjoy sweet alcoholic beverages, please please please try the "Razz-jito." I ordered this per recommendation of our server, and it was FANTASTIC. Super delicious. My boyfriend ordered the "Mango Madness" and it was super strong (for me). I tasted more alcohol than anything and did not ask for a second sip. We ordered off the lunch menu. We started with the Lobster Bisque. It was solid you can't really go wrong with this soupd. I got the Mediterranean Salad with Lamb. The Lamb was huge and salad portions were huge as well. Pretty standard lamb choice but nothing to go through the roof about. Salad was fresh and came with fried onions on top (myfavorite). The bf ordered the Seafood Sandwich - a seemingly good choice. He stated that he liked everything IN the sandwich but to have it combined in that way was not favorable. However, the sandwich was pretty big and came with these really neat looking potato chips.  Food was okay, maybe we just weren't ordering the right stuff.  SERVICE: As stated in the first paragraph, service was awesome.  Overall the view and service compensated for our food.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood sandwich
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mediterranean salad with lamb
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Razz-jito

RAotng3cf2FqIp5Ux1mJCQ.text: Exceptional!!! Beautiful views of Las Vegas not necessarily the strip though  The staff is courteous and helpful It's very romantic and a crazy view of the city  I got the soup and froi gras - which were both excellent I would definitely recommend for a classy and romantic date in Vegas

1FyaSYQA4g0-MxZVeGHh2g.text: Yolanda was just the best! You want a good deal with the best taste see yolanda! Great view with a good meal couldnt get any better! Great job on the food!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tYJ_ZuzRbA29W8XfKky83g.text: I think about 50% of the bill is going towards the atmosphere. The food is not outstanding. We went with the 5 course tasting menu since I couldn't justify paying $60+ for an a la carte steak when I could just go to Carnevino down the street. We still had a fun time and the service was excellent. The jazz band was a nice touch and it was great watching people do the sky jump. Definitely a tourist trap though. Restaurant.com coupon helped the bill hurt less. But I'm pretty sure this will be the only/last time I eat here. Dinner some place else and then the bar here all the way next time.

feZOP41N2Zg4sv4MXkomxA.text: We went there for lunch and the view was what made the experience.   FOOD:   I had the Crabcakes.  It was spendy, but it was nice and lite.  Everything else on the menu looked heavy and more for a Winter meal.    DRINKS:   We didn't get drunk, because the drinks were so expensive.  But, they had a nice full selection to choose from.   SERVICE:   The service was okay.  We didn't have to pay to go up in the elevator, since we were eating at the restaurant.    ATMOSPHERE:   The view from the revolving restaurant is what made the experience fun.  After lunch, we went out on the terrace and enjoyed the view and watched the rides that were at the top.  We didn't go on the rides because they seemed so insane.    WOULD I GO THERE AGAIN?:   Sure, I would go there again, just for the view.  The food was adequate, but the view made our experience fun.

_UKPl8f6bpCiTQNwwRYkEQ.text: We went to the stratosphere for our one year wedding anniversary, it wasn't the best hotel and after going thru security and up the old elevator with the elevator attendant we arrived at the restaurant. we were seated at a great table by the window and as you know it takes about an hour an half to turn around the entire hotel. The views are specatacular.  Our Waiter, David, has been there forever and gave us all the history and recommendations. The manager for some reason wasn't thrilled that he would speak to us but he was definately doing his job. Our water was always full and we were even given extra bread and butter.  I started off with the lobster bisque and that was specatacular. My husband had a salad and the ribeye with mushrooms. I had a filet mignon and baked potatoe.  He said my filet was much better than his rib eye and the potatoe was nothing to write home about. The mushrooms were good. and our drinks were just average. We do have to say that the service and view were definately top quality. We would suggest for a special night and great memory afterwards you are able to go up to the tip top and see the view from outside and see all the crazys jump off the side of the building. Keep in mind: Although they tell you to dress up. most people go very casual.  we could hear the people up at the lounge upstairs. ANd the crowd of kids who go for the rides is not what you want for a special occasion.

ZH5hIpuEAOwt9pM30DOw1g.text: Come here for the view and not the food!  The view is breathtaking, yes.  The food, well, is just okay.  Since it was Sunday, we had complimentary champagne.  My friend and I had an excellent lobster bisque...downside...it was luke warm!  What a way to destroy a first impression.  The ceasar salad was a bit drenched in dressing, otherwise tasty.  The Kobe burger came out fully pink in the middle and we had to send it back.  Fortunately, our waiter was able to comp us for the burger.  The service was very good and the wait staff were all very attentive, promptly refilling our waters and checking in with us.   We went at around 3pm and the sun really hit us hard at one point.  This place is just beautiful around sunset.

JODWNncABycyl1i5f2x2mA.text: First I have to say I went here for my 30th birthday, and my bf had a dozen roses delivered to the table, this is probably what gave it an extra star that it would have lost due to the high prices which I knew was going to be an issue b/c my bf gave me a disclaimer and made me promise I'd order whatever I wanted and not look at prices.    Well that;s like asking me to sneeze with my eyes open. w/e. I ordered the salad w/ the maytag blue cheese dressing. The best freaking salad I've ever had. Main course i had the Jumbo prawns and scallops. Never  had either b4 and they were so freakin good. Sides: had 3 cheese au gratin potatoes and grilled asparagus. Delicious. SO much food I was so full. Did I mention the 3 types of butter w/ the bread? Delicious. I beleive one of them was orange flavored OMG so good. Too bad the meal averages about $80-100 a head b/c if it was just a tad cheaper I'd go back. Delicious! It was the fanciest night. And while normally I wouldnt had enjoyed the picture taking I was very happy she was there b/c I couldnt find my camera before we left for the strip that night. Thank goodness for $150 pictures. LOL.

6tvAsP_RWHd7-zDOR7wwRg.text: The view when we were escorted into the restaurant literally took my breath away. We requested a window seat and were very pleased to be seated at one. Our dinner was at 6:00, so we got to watch the sun set and see all the shimmery lights come on throughout the area. Incredible. The wait staff was extremely courteous, our waiter knew my name and addressed me directly the entire night. Also, a very nice woman came to our table as our view reached the strip and took some lovely photos of me and my friends. I got the baby kale salad to start which was delicious, and the bread basket was amazing, too; sourdough, Asiago crusted, everything crackers, and three different flavors of butter. For my main course I ordered the New York strip steak with a side of gnocchi and butternut squash. The steak was cooked to perfection, and the gnocchi was some of the best I have ever had.  I was too full to even think about desert, which is saying something considering some upscale restaurants leave you wanting to get another dinner afterwards with their small portions. Not the case here. I was actually upset about being so full because I had really wanted to try the mixed berries in a white chocolate cup. Oh well, there is always next time. And the next time I am in Vegas, I will DEFINITELY be returning. Everything about the dinner experience at Top of the World was divine.

RxgI36VhrYEmWTjuxdrufg.text: Top of the world felt just like that for me while I was there. My boyfriend purposed to me here and it was the most amazing purposal, view and restuarant. The view was just breathtaking!! Filet mignon was tender, juicy and delish!~ My whole family was so happy and impressed with the service, scenery and overall the restuarant.. The best part they had a photographer going around and taken pictures and captured the whole purposal. Priceless!~ Can't wait to go back and recap the whole night.. It truly was the most memorable and astonishing night of my life.. :-)

3KvGE7DbC__bbP_ppLyN0Q.text: Very nice!  It's like some grand-scale version of the Hyatt's Equinox in San Francisco, when they were open.  The restaurant is on the 106th floor, easily accessed by very fast elevators (I could hear my ears pop 3 times), revolves slowly (one revolution in about an hour) so you can enjoy the crazy panoramic view of Las Vegas sprawled around you, and the food & service can't be beat.  The prices are reasonable, and the selection is decent.    I had a few friends who didn't take too well to the motion (bring Dramamine if you're one of those), and my booze-snob friends thought the martinis were kind of low-brow. I only had a mild freaking out when I noticed flying humans in the air above the restaurant.  OMG there's a ride up there!  Not for me; there'd be pee, vomit and crap trailing my shoes.  Drama drama drama.  But besides that, I had a wonderful time.  If Trump builds anything higher than the Stratosphere, he ought to be ashamed of himself.

YuQo791XzIrWWeFmxHwwSg.text: Great view of Las Vegas and beyond. It's revolving, therefore just sit an hour or 2 for your meal, and you can absorb the entire Las Vegas skyline.

PMRYCraKf_SDog4C1QLe9g.text: This place was alright, but definately not worth the ridiculous amount of money it costs. $40 for chicken?! Are you joking? If i'm going to pay $40 for chicken it better blow my foodie mind. I can assure you, it did not. While it was above decent, It didn't seem like anything I couldn't get in any other less expensive steak house. The menu is pretty limited so make sure you either like steak or seafood (neither of which i like) before you decide to spend the $$$ to eat here. The view is gorgeous (you have to go at night), but I could have just seen that by going to the observation deck. They did have orange flavored butter for the bread that was the highlight of my meal! One redeeming quality!  Oh and the couple in front of us that was about the get it on at the table didn't really add to my experience. Please go back to your room....

z11H-Dqb1Mxizzoh1717Qw.text: I definitely recommend this place for lunch not dinner. Dinner can be very pricey, and the selection at dinner isn't exactly awe inspiring. For lunch you reap the same benefits as dinner, such as being able to go to the top of the Stratosphere without having to pay extra. To sum it up the lunch menu offers the dinner entrees worth getting at a fraction of the price. Lunch ranges ~$12-$17 for sandwiches, and the pre fixe menu for ~$30. Definitely worth a try. If you have your heart set on a view of the strip at night, restaurant.com offers a dinner only coupon(p.s. sign up for the email and buy when on sale.)

Miykbkd0ieYB6xzGLFKttg.text: Came here for our 9th anniversary and was not disappointed. We even made it out the door cheaper than we thought. As for a local comparison I would have to say it was comparable to Ruth's Chris Steak House with a romantic Il Forniao feel, especially with your spectacular view of the city changing constantly. Not a lot of people can boast about having the best food in town at 1000 feet.

DpyBal2Wxu17bl7cgVQp6g.text: I was expecting a great view and so-so food.  The view was beyond great.  We had a cool, clear, crisp night.  We arrived before dusk, and watch night fall over the city and mountains.  It was spectacular.  We also had skyjumpers jump past our window.  Wow.  The food?  Also spectacular!  What a nice surprise.  The staff took great care of us.I had the lobster bisque to start, and it was rich and full of lobster flavor.  I then had a special steak item.  My sister had a bacon wrapped pork tenderloin.  My Dad, a light eater, had soup to start and the crab cake appetizer as his entree.  The server didn't even blink at his request.  They have small desserts that you order in trios.  We ordered two raspberry mousses (I think) and (my choice) a mini bread pudding.  The two mouses were great, but (the only slightly less than wonderful moment of the evening) the bread pudding was dry and hard.    We were ready for a leisurely meal, and the staff moved the dinner along at our pace.  The entire experience was elegant, delicious, and wonderful.  It is very expensive, but the food and the view were worth it!

Gb0qBSP8Oj2vatiA2lZPCQ.text: The view was great!  But that is just about it.  We went there for my birthday a few year ago.  Food to us is just average.  The average kind that shouldn't be price like what they charge at this place.  We order fish, a few other thing, the stratosphere desert.  Nothing came close to outstanding or memorable.  Bottom line, we think for the price, food should be much better.  As for the view, it doesn't get any better.

GiAqugsPP4hBAm_i5gwIzA.text: Our dinner experience at the Top of the World was perfect.  Not one thing needed to be changed.  We had a reservation for a Saturday night and were seated right away.  Our table was in the second row and had a perfect face on view.  The view was amazing, breathtaking even.  Our waiter was very attentive and the service was perfect.  To start, I had the Grilled Portobello and Buffalo Mozzarella.  It was very delicious and everything on it tasted very fresh.  For my main meal, I had the filet mignon.  It was one of the best cuts of steak I have had in a really long time, if not ever.  It was perfectly cooked to medium and extremely flavorful.  It was in a red wine mushroom sauce, which was very yummy.  For my side, I had mashed potatoes.  These were fluffy and prepared wonderfully.  For dessert, we split the lemon bar cheesecake.  It was phenomenal.  The cheesecake was surprisingly light and the lemon bar was a nice addition.  This restaurant is pretty expensive, but for one of the best meals I have ever eaten in my entire life, it was worth every cent.  Definitely make it a point to make this your splurge meal while spending time in Las Vegas, you will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Bar Cheesecake

J--vG4dvnf_24YLfNfC9oQ.text: SUMMARY:  Make no mistake people, you'll definitely end up paying a hefty price for dining here so just plan for it.  Having said that, its (mostly) worth the price -- especially if you're seeking a romantic dining experience.  I still can't give it an absolute five stars. My general rating philosophy is to only give a place five stars if it's absolute perfection.  PROS: - Excellent breath-taking views. - Absolutely delicious food items. - Fast service. - Great ambiance (live music, mood lighting, etc)  NEUTRAL: - Slightly over-priced items. $215 for two people... - Slightly limited item selection (but to be fair, the BEST restaurants don't try to do everything... they specialize) - 98% of the staff were very polite.  CONS: - One staff-member was slightly kurt. Not a huge deal really. I try to give people the benefit of the doubt... maybe he was having a bad day. - There is an ever-so-slight arrogant aire of sophistication at the restaurant. I don't think it's anyone's fault... it just felt like people who dined there were expected to be fully aware of all dining etiquette. Maybe I'm just imagining things though.  ADVICE: - Always, always, ALWAYS get reservations. This place is popular even on weekdays. - If you're visiting Vegas with the family, consider dining somewhere else. The atmosphere at the Top of the World restaurant lends itself to business meetings and romantic dining. Not to mention that you'll get a much better value elsewhere.

_rFFg40TdzFCIsdfDER9TA.text: The view was wonderful especially since every time you look up it's a diferent view! The food was spectacular and the waiter was great!

bH6OeUax47sGsnqGFx5YKA.text: You pay for the view. I have been here three times and was never impressed with the food. The service is excellent. For the price, though, there is better food in the Vegas area.

vvtow4N_wKGGmcZB2Pcytw.text: I'm so sad to write this review.  My husband and I have regularly visited the Top of the World since 2002, when we got engaged.  The food and service was always superb.  Until last night.   We always order the same thing (we are a little stuck in our ways): filet mignon medium rare, garlic mashed potatoes, grilled asparagus and lobster bisque.  Every single visit up to last night provided for the most amazing filet either one of us had ever tasted... Like butter.  The sides were to die for as well...   And the lobster bisque-oh my God!!     When we visited last night we were disappointed to see that their menu had changed and the prices had been raised significantly.  But that still didn't deter us from ordering as their food and service has never let us down.  We both started with the lobster bisque and were very pleased.  Still delicious.    We then got our medium rare filets, Yukon gold potatoes and sauteed mushrooms (they no longer have asparagus-major letdown).   Neither one of us received a medium rare filet.  It was most definitely medium, which I know most people enjoy, but we are not those people.  The potatoes were dry and the mushrooms.....  I don't know even know what to say.  Generally we both love mushrooms, but these were far from  the quality and taste that we have come to expect over the decade we have been visiting.  They were just not good.  Compound our dissatisfaction with the meal with the fact that they had raised those prices, and you've got some unhappy customers.    Additionally, our waiter was one odd guy.  He was just not friendly and when he tried to serve us with a double order of mashed potatoes instead of our mushrooms, he seemed annoyed when we told him and even showed my husband his notes.... "oh mash and mush look very similar".   Okay, crazy- go get my shrooms! :)  The view is unbelievable and for us this place has a special memory, so we will probably come back, with the hope that Top of the World will return to it's original glory.   But if it weren't for that, this would probably have been our last visit.

TB3NOrpS-RDA8mPpbItEZA.text: Fantastic view, but you knew that already.  The food, however, was incredibly average and way overpriced.  I had my first taste of truffles shaved over Capon chicken.  I would have more enjoyed marinated pencil shavings over Shake n' Bake.    The appetizer sampler, including a foie de gras, and two, yes TWO raviolis was $25.00 per person. A $50 appetizer should be a-maaay-zing.  It wasn't.   On the upside, the sommelier was very knowledgeable about wine and turned us on to a great Chateau-nuf-du Pape (sp?).  The wine and the view were the best things about this place.  Save yourself $300. buy a good bottle, and head to the rooftop observation deck.   Then go eat elsewhere.

skU03euC_2fdNXu8GzCH-A.text: Absolutely breathtaking views!! The service was amazing. Our server was very attentive and extremely nice. The appetizers  (lobster bisque and blue cheese lettuce wedge) were very good! The peach martini was the best I've ever had. However, the rest of the meal was not impressive at all. I was pretty disappointed in main course and it was very expensive. If you go right before sunset, you get to watch the sunset over the mountains and the lights of the strip.

-X9fm3je1km5KihuIotAxA.text: My husband and I went here to celebrate our 15th anniversary. We had the steak & were not impressed. The view is amazing especially if you get to see the sunset. The wine  was my highlight! Service was good. Our picture was taken but we were never told where to obtain pictures and ended up forgetting about them. I was bummed because they must have been some amazing pics with that beautiful background. If you go here you are definitely paying for the amazing view.

6msfPat8-Ug58tmf09VZ0A.text: This place is amazing! The ambiance was so nice and romantic and a bit fun since you could see people hoping off the roof lol the views are beautiful and the food was delicious. My boyfriend and I both got different steaks and absolutely loved them. I was hesitant to come here since its located in a part of Vegas I don't go into nor would I have ever entered the stratosphere but i would definitely recommend making a trip to have dinner right before sunset here.

22JHwdnKdGCL3Z3RSCtP6A.text: Everything taste so good. Service was awesome, & knew how to describe the items on menu perfectly... Love this place

bdlpnD7G2myccio3j83EVQ.text: We LOVED the view! The food was decent, it's more priced upscale for the views. The wine was great and so was the service! We loved having photos taken professionally at the table as well.

MtvrPM2eYtPtMJiQ5vGhfw.text: Metal detector?!! I'm sorry but if you have to go through a metal detector there's no way I'm staying. The area is really really bad. Why are people jeopardizing their safety? At what other restaurant have you ever had to go through a metal detector? Hello!!!   This restaurant is also not 2nd Amendment friendly. Even with your CCW permit you cannot carry. Not even a pocket knife.  If you're not upset by this, you're not American.  The area is so bad that you have a metal detector, and you want me to leave my protection behind?! Oh hell no.

VAi4TwRDNZuxC5JVqAu-4Q.text: Great food and service. A must do in Las Vegas. Very pricey but worth the money.  Incredible views of the city.

cYnYqw-ThbvQ9buCqVk0_w.text: The food is quite mediocre. The view is fabulous, the service is great. We ordered 2 soups and two appetizers. The soups (lonster bisque and onion soup) were a normal size but both very salty and over seasoned. The meatball appetizer tastes like a meatloaf that has gone bad. The tuna tartar tacos were the only decent thing. Overall the ambiance and view (maybe the drinks) are the only thing you should go for but not the food.

6xe-44rjIkW_wJfOPtr1nw.text: Amazing !! The view is breathtaking and the food is flavorful. The service was awesome and the waiter was very attentive. I highly recommend this restaurant for all types of occasions.

IJas_ZUdqdfwAy2tbcI0tQ.text: This was my 4th visit to this place. Had good experiences previous times so decided to bring a dear friend who was visiting from the other end of the world.   Had booked 10-12 days before with a request for a window table. But did not get one, even when there were several window tables open. We were given the option to wait upstairs in the lounge for 45-60 mins for a window. That was Strike 1.   Food was very ordinary. Almost the class of a roadside diner. I have loved the foie gras in past.  This time it was tasteless unseasoned and even the balsamic reduction and brioche or whatever was tasteless. The miso sea bass was tough on outside and uncooked on inside and again tasteless. Even the bok choy on plate was boring. My friend's pasta was very ordinary. The mango cocktail was extremely sweet and undrinkable. The service was OK.  For a so called fine dining place, first there was no candle on table and when questioned, the waiter almost arrogantly said they didn't hv enough candles for the inside tables. Then one of the bus boys came and put a plastic battery operated tealight in the candle holder. Really? Fine dining ha?   Please save your money. There are lots of great restaurants in LV to choose from. The view may be great but the rest is unacceptable. I will not be coming back !

AIsA6aa-wosqzZy8ncaatA.text: The food ain't bad but what you're really paying for is the view. The highest tower in Las Vegas and a revolving restaurant at that. It's pretty neat, although the height and slow rotation might make you a bit nauseous if you're sensitive to that.  Came on a Saturday afternoon around 3pm-absolutely no line and the restaurant was quite empty. It's a fun experience, you get to watch people fly past the window from the SkyJump a couple stories above you and catch the tips of peoples' shoes as they spin around on the Stratosphere thrill rides. Also, someone came and took pictures of us during the meal to show us after (for purchase).   Food:  Bread basket Mixed greens salad Portobello mushrooms Rib eye Ultra burger ($26) Banana foster Creme brulee  Total for 4 came to about $120 if I remember correctly.   The good stuff: salad was good, bread was good (there was a variety and came with 3 different spreads instead of just butter), banana foster was tasty and came in an "almond box" which was like a light nutty brittle and ice cream, and we asked if they could make the fries that came with the burger into garlic fries, and they did and it was amazing.   The things that could've been better: portobello mushrooms were just alright, rib eye was cooked well when we asked for medium well (but still good just could've been better), the burger wasn't that special and probably didn't have to be $26 for what we got, and the creme brulee wasn't the best I've had (it was a little too much vanilla flavor and very creamy, would've liked it to be a little thinner or lighter)...   Now that I've tried it, I don't feel like I have to come back. But it was an overall positive experience.

xFuv1LhTLX44VK-8kDzveQ.text: Glenn was awesome, of course he recommended the most expensive dishes (I see you!) Best thing was the view Food was so so...Had to salt my wagyu skirt steak because it was really lacking. The chimichurri sauce helped out though. Potatoes were great.  Bread and the plethora of butters were good, too.  My boyfriend had basics that are hard to screw up - cocktail shrimp, portobello mushroom, smoked salmon... Fresh and delicious. I preferred his selections over mine.  What I couldn't stand was the antiquated feel of the place... has a slight 1980s hotel restaurant vibe to it, maybe the maitre d butter, carpet with starburst patterns. A bit too cheesy for me. But nonetheless excellent and attentive service. I know this was a happening spot back in the day, but now I think the best thing going for them is the 360 degree rotating view.

WUSak6oXFowC8pWjlaS9yw.text: My first time here...had to go thru security b4 u could take elevator up to restaurant...106th floor i think? It was very high lol...but omggg! The viewww!! AWESOME!!! I went for lunch and it was a nice clear sunny day...beautiful view...and i did not know the restaurant rotates! Lol that was great! My server was very nice n helpful with the menu..i ordered the lunch prixe fixe...lobster bisque, filet surf n turf which is a petite filet mignon n lobster tail, n a choco duo dessert..all delicious especially the surf n turf! That dish makes me want to come back again! Awesome food n service...definitely will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. From prixe fixe menu...lobster bisque
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. From prixe fixe menu...filet surf n turf..absolutely delicious!!!

4uf5cHcn31qsrfWXa1Al-w.text: I went there in a group of 4 to celebrate a birthday. The view is great. Our waitress was good, but I can get over the cold food and undercooked/cold veggies.  I love asparagus but somehow they messed it up! The steak sauce (gouda and truffle sauce) was served on the side and was like warm, served in the consistancy of butter rather than a sauce. And just be forewarned that there is a photographer that will bug you if you dont want to stand up and pose for a photo or 5. The food was good, but the ribeye was same as you can get at any Outback or Logans, and cold.  I'm not sure if they have to bring the food up the entire 120 floors by foot? But that would explain the temperature.   Also, you will have to go through a metal detector line before the elevator ride.  I would recommend going up there for the observation deck, but I wouldn't eat there again because the food was disappointing.

HUsFzfFdaJzsAUqksdNfPg.text: Tremendous Value on one of a kind experience: If taste of food depends on environment and company, then that is why at $180 for 5 people it was exquisite and an exceptional value too. In dining one becomes part of masterful architecture and engineering achievement. My guests and I loved the view, and dynamic show of Las Vegas from above. Truly "Awsome".

TPP_rJJLbTVeZ_vbAhqq5A.text: The view of course is amazing! Food was delicious. My husband had a steak and I had salmon.  Be prepared to bring $$$ !

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from Top of the World restaurant !

yROlTDptX1DiXOOFpaDP4A.text: When you walk in be prepared to get your breath taken away. Came here for lunch, had the Ultra Burger with cheddar cheese $26.00. It was good wish the cheddar cheese was melted more. Erick brought us bread, it was nice & hot, whipped butter was sweet and easily melted. They give you 3 varieties, I love butter. Our drinks were never empty. The server Dana was very nice & attentive, also on top of our drinks. I cannot wait to come back & have dinner here. I am sure it is spectacular at night! Thank you for a pleasant lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Glad we had lunch here, was craving a burger.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice presentation, beautiful crispy fries.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trying to finish my ultra burger.

fqzXR20xki08GMK5NVf_Dw.text: Came here with my wife for Valentine's Day. Been a local for 7 years, but my first time coming to the Stratosphere. The view was amazing, although fixating on the fact that you're constantly spinning can definitely lead to some nausea.  They had a tasting menu for Valentine's, but honestly there wasn't even a single thing on any of the courses that stood out to either of us. There were plenty of things on the menu that looked quite nice, so we created our own tasting menu that ended up at the same price ($200).  We started with the wedge salad, caesar salad with anchovies, shrimp cocktail and seared scallops. All were good, although certainly had better. Would happily have any of them again.  As for the main course, the waiter hyped up their "signature dish" of the wagyu ribeye. This is exactly what I would be looking to order just about anywhere and sounded fantastic. It was priced at $79, which sounded quite cheap for what it was supposed to be We complimented it with the seafood alfredo pasta dish and would continue to share.  The wagyu was served similar to what you would expect from Salisbury steak. It was smothered with onions on top and the entire plate was covered in sauce. This was certainly a bizarre presentation for what was supposed to be a high quality piece of meat.  That said, I don't think what they serve is actually wagyu. This is one of the lowest quality steaks I have ever eaten. If I were offered the same meal at any point in the future for $5, I would absolutely turn it down. There was no flavor. There was no marbling. There was tons of fat, but not in the way you would want in a high quality piece of meat. I don't fancy myself much of a grill master, but the choice steaks I get from Walmart are without a doubt far higher quality. And it wasn't like it just wasn't cooked well, it was legitimately a bad piece of meat. We couldn't even force it down and didn't box it up.  Whatever you do, please don't order this horrible dish. It is truly a steak that late night diners would be embarrassed to serve.   The pasta was pretty good, although certainly different from what you would expect from an alfredo pasta. The seafood in the dish was of decent quality and cooked well.  The service was also severely lacking. We waited for over 20 minutes to get water after our entrees arrived. This was not aided by the fact that one of our entrees was completely inedible.  The waiter and manager both acted shocked that we thought the steak was terrible, but after looking at yelp reviews while sitting at the table for an hour waiting to actually be able to pay our bill and leave, we found out that most people have thought this dish is horrible. Big mistake not yelping first! The manager offered to comp us a dessert, but we had already been there 2 hours and just wanted to leave so badly (it was after midnight at this point). We ended up getting it boxed to go, but the cheesecake mousse was still good the next day.  I feel like we were robbed of the $79 they charged for the inedible steak and the bad service made this an experience that will not have us ever returning to this restaurant (very surprised they didn't offer to take anything off the bill for serving trash). That said, if you do end up here, go with the seafood and dodge the steak and you should have a nice meal.

7ujHJ9oR3Pdv36kwTWB2mQ.text: GET THE LOBSTER BISQUE! Best thing on the menu! I had the skirt steak as well but it wasn't too great. They have a wonderful view and the restaurant slowly spins around so you can see a 360 view of the horizon. I would suggest getting a seating next to the window a as you have the desserts plates passing by you and you can pick one up conveniently! Waiters are very nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The butters and breads are so good I can&#39;t stop eating them haha and because of them I could barely finish my appetizer and main course!

dELyMsSVFvM3ThqupT6dqw.text: Whenever I read reviews of Las Vegas restaurants (especially those on the Strip) I'm intrigued by how many spend so little time discussing the food and, instead, concentrate on extraneous details like the friendliness of the wait staff or prices We're "locals" and as such have a lot of experience with these restaurants so here are a few thoughts on the Top of the World. First, after many visits we've found that the food here is almost always excellent. It's essentially a steak house and the menu (as well as the prices) reflect it. Don't come here for a burger or expect cheap menu options because there really aren't any. Tabs for two people can easily top $200. There are any number of other places within walking distance that can accommodate your taste for ground beef at much lower prices. Locals consider places like Top of the World to be "event" restaurants for things like anniversaries, birthdays and such. That's why the majority of diners always seem to be visitors, whose cell phone cameras seem to be permanently attached to their hands. Expect constant flashes. Most locals rarely venture to the strip outside of special occasions or to meet with friends visiting from out of town. Second, you can expect excellent service from a professional staff that understands the menu and will gladly help you with your selections as well as wine pairings if you so desire. Many have noted that orders seem to take a long time to arrive. I agree and have never been able to figure out why since the restaurant always seems adequately staffed. In any case, sit back and enjoy the spectacular view while you wait. Third, experiment a little with your food choices. Although it's a steak house, the menu includes a number of creative dishes that you probably won't find back home. You'll probably be surprised at how much enjoyment you can get out of being a little adventurous. Now a couple of gripes: Unfortunately, like almost all Vegas restaurants, there is no dress code. As such, you and your beautiful companion dressed for your anniversary can easily find yourself seated next to a table of guys who look (and sound) like they just arrived from a tailgate party. To my way of thinking, tee shirts, shorts and flip flops add nothing to what should be a fine dining experience. But hey, all money is green so Vegas accommodates. Tables full of beautiful young women dressed for the clubs likewise, can be just as distracting based on the amount of liquor already consumed and how many flash pictures they insist on taking, but that's a different story. Next, children. Why anyone would bring their kids to Vegas in the first place confuses me but there they are and the later it gets the more restless they become. Why not prohibit them after 8 pm?  Better yet, leave them at home. Finally, understand before coming to Vegas that (outside of cheap air fares and hotel rooms) this is an expensive town. Everything from food to booze and entertainment to gaming, is designed to separate you from your money. (How do you think Nevada gets by without a state income tax?) Enjoy your stay but be prepared to pay for it. TOTW is a memory you'll have long after returning home and forgetting how much you spent. I probably could pick a few more nits but the bottom line is that TOTW is an excellent Vegas experience and we'll be back.

H8xPIY5ZlaIwIlKNEpk5ZA.text: My daughter brought me here for Mother's Day and at was one of the most delicious food and can we talk about there food it was amazing the shrimp was so good and big ...it's super cool that you spin around to see the view of the Vegas strip while you eat, I even got a rose as I walked in so amazing definitely have it on your bucket list

dkJQguf_zagu4umAsMwx_w.text: This place was so awesome! My girlfriend surprised me with dinner here for my birthday and it was an amazing dinner. We started by being greeted by the friendly host that said Happy Birthday to me when we gave her our name and they made sure to make my night extra special for my night.   When we sat down we had water and the most delicious bread brought to us. This may be a little weird, but Im a fatty; The butter options were amazing. We were given a ginger orange butter, a pesto butter, and a regular butter for our bread. The bread was so good that we ate two baskets of bread.   We had the seafood platter as the appetizer which was a very nice size and presentation.   I had the steak and lobster for dinner with the side of twice baked potato, sauteed mushrooms, and gnocchi dish. The entire meal was delicious.   The only thing that I had a hard time with was that towards the end of our time at the top of the tower I started to feel a little bit of motion sickness. I was sitting backwards at the table and the rotation of the dining area was a little difficult for me, but it was totally worth it because the views were the best I have ever seen in Las Vegas.   I definitely would recommend this place to any of my friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful view of the strip

wSPpVPNLZy_hb5or5GpgiA.text: This place is fine dining at its best.  The view is phenomenal from the 106th floor and we got a little more than one spin around while at dinner.   My steak was perfect and our waiter's name was Jeff.   The service was top notch and I don't mind paying those prices when the food and service was as good as it gets.

4ELCsEb2RyhBtm43D3AE2g.text: From the minute we walked in and saw the view, I knew this was going to be a good experience.  106 floors up, at the top of the Stratosphere in Las Vegas, this rotating restaurant offers the most amazing panoramic views of Las Vegas that I have ever seen (and we visit here quite often from New York).  The restaurant is round in shape with a complete glass wall. It does rotate, taking an hour and 20 minutes to complete a 360 degree view. We were worried that my husband would get sick, but it moves so slowly that you can barely tell. If you make reservations, you can score one of the better seats in the house, a booth facing outwards looking head on at the windowed wall. So I definitely recommend reservations.  Food was AMAZING, service was impeccable. Staff acknowledged our anniversary, made it personal and special. Views are stunning. Would recommend 1000x over. I'm so sad we haven't visited this restaurant sooner and will be coming back EVERY time we are back in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YXtRgLXWhF4t7xlaF6COCg.text: A beautiful restaurant with the best view in Vegas. Loved Chef Juan who made fantastic food and was attentive to my gluten allergy. I'm really pleased with the experience!! The elevator ride up was also fun. You will see why when you get there.

V_xHdKJ1dHXD4gl_pGk5uQ.text: Incredible views Waitresses we had were incredible, friendly and fast tracked us through in 1 hour as we had to be at a show. Food was tasty and plentiful The atmosphere is quiet but it is more suited for small parties and couples as it is romantic.  Not the cheapest but the food is good  A once in a lifetime opportunity to eat so high up with incredible views... do it!

mT_aBDD2A4tL9wWIe-nPzA.text: We had dinner there last at 6:30 night just around sunset. The view from the widow seats are amazing. It's really cool to see the city change from day light to the Vegas lights at night. You can also see people sky jump off the stratosphere while you eat.  I picked a bottle of Sanctuary Pinot Noir from Santa Maria to start off. My wife had the Lobster Bisque for a first course and they do it table side for an awesome touch. For our main course she had the lamb chops and I had a filet with foie gras. Both dishes were amazing and also had great presentation. Afterward she had bananas foster and I had a glass of Pinot Noir from the wines by the glass. The glass of Pinot Noir was SO much different from the bottle that ordered it actually was the only negative of the night. I should went with a cab or merlot but that's my bad. After dessert we finished with coffee and expresso. Our waiter was great, everything went smooth. He was prefect, never missed a mark and was on point. Even talked to a manager on the way out and told him how smooth everything was. Top of the World ran like a well oil machine that night.

dvH34WGIYPZ8mlYfrrnXoA.text: This place is good but expensive.  It is nice to watch Vegas as you twirl around.  You are paying for ambiance here.  Make sure after your meal, you show the elevator operator your receipt so you can go to the very top.

6YVG8--J42iGc4NC7W2yXw.text: My husband and I chose to go Top of of the World after our 10 year vow renewal. I echo a lot of what has already been said. Great experience, meh food. We had the lobster bisque, Cesear salad, crab cake, NY strip, and twice baked potato. All of it was just okay. Honestly, the best part of the food was the dessert, we had the cheesecake mousse, Our server was very friendly, and we got some nice pictures. I'm glad we went, but we've had much better meals that cost almost $200.

Etd_YSFDJj_bqExO7jnaaA.text: Went for lunch. The ribeye steak sandwich was excellent.  Very huge so I was unable to finish it.  The mozzarella burger was humongous. Service was good. Definitely a pleasant experience.

adkRnNpnhYbcxn9R3ymliA.text: Made reservations a few weeks in advance before arriving in Vegas. Reservations were for 7:30 which was perfect because we made it in time to catch the sunset. I think this might have been the nicest restaurant I have ever been to in comparison to some of the more upscale restaurants in New York. However, this review doesn't do it justice. You need to experience this for yourself.  The views were 360 meaning the restaurant spun around the whole time you were dining and occasionally you would see people doing the sky jump which was pretty entertaining. For dinner, my friend and I ordered the prefix tasting menu which was great. It included an appetizer, entree, and a dessert of your choice. We also ordered a few glasses of wine. Everything was so delicious, but the views were just impeccable. The bill for 2 came out to be around $250 with tip. I think this experience was definitely worth every penny. Hopefully next time I'll be able to get a window seat!   PLEASE GO if you haven't yet!

QNgig_ZhYF2lPCPvtMAEMA.text: During my visit to Las Vegas I decided to have a late dinner here! It was amazing!!! The view was outstanding and food and desserts were very good and the service was perfect! One of my favorite restaurant in Vegas

ENBHYGpZajL9GQrPYsujxQ.text: While the whole view itself is amazing, as well as our server and food, about 5 minutes after getting up there I started feeling extremely motion sick. The restaurant itself rotates around at a very slow rate, but I'm also super sensitive with motion sickness. Just a warning to those who suffer from the same thing.  I was able to finish my lobster, but I had to give my husband my filet and drink. So upset I couldn't enjoy it, absolutely gorgeous views. Tip-book right before sunset:)

Q0iNZIcgHd6eMefs19cfvA.text: The food here is outstanding! It's on the expensive side but the views and the ambiance make it worth it. I was a bit worried that I had to pass through a metal detector to get in, but once inside I was seated with my party quickly and the service was fast and friendly. Try to go before sunset and watch the city below transform. Put this one on your bucket list.

D4uEbOT3jJOq7BSmL2A3FA.text: This restaurant has one of the most amazing views of Las Vegas for sure. It is definitely something everyone should do if you're visiting with your partner. Definitely a really romantic place!   The eating area slowly revolves, so you are sure to see all of Vegas in a 360 view at least once during your meal. I would recommend going at night because those Las Vegas lights are stunning.   I had the lobster bisque and seafood Alfredo and my boyfriend had the steak. The bisque was amazing, but my Alfredo left a little to be desired with flavor. The seafood used in my plate was really fresh though. My boyfriend's steak was a little over cooked but the side of twice baked potato he had was amazing!   It was pretty pricey and I really think you are paying for the view, not really the food. But I do think it's something you have to do at least once!

pP4oQ9RhWr0UyFATxaN7JQ.text: Let's start with the positives:   The ambiance and views were breath taking. Our server, Joel was beyond accommodating and extremely knowledgeable when it came to the menu. I wanted to purchase a cake for the birthday girl and the manager helped me with everything. My husband had the ribeye and we shared a twice baked potato, it was perfect!   Cons:    Don't order the Alfredo. I ordered the seafood Alfredo.... it was bland and had no flavor. The seafood was plentiful but the sauce was lacking flavor, cheese and consistency.

O-OcQN_7tiN-2gmlPx_RkQ.text: All I can say is " wow!"  I have always wanted to experience dining at a revolving restaurant and when I recently spent a few days in Las Vegas I finally had my chance. I made the reservation for myself and my husband about a week before and requested a window table . When the host came to seat us she said there was a 45 min wait for a window table and offered us a table that would still offer a great view . However, I decided  to wait the 45 min for the window since I knew I would likely never get to experience such a cool way to dine anytime soon . Luckily for us, a window table opened within 5 minutes !  The view of Vegas from that height with all the shimmering lights was spectacular. I loved how the scenery changed as we were served , I was actually mesmerized . The waiter was very knowledgeable and kind although did seem a bit rushed . I ordered a steak with twice baked potatoes and broccolini  and the wine suggested on the menu . The food was absolutely delicious !!!  If I ever return to Vegas I would certainly return to this place for the great food and the unique dining  experience . Give it a try, you will not be disappointed!

uR-5AB5wRoLeJavW4FGrYg.text: This is our first time here seems pretty lovely we asked to be seated facing the sunset via Internet request, and when we arrived they seated us on the opposite side away from the sunset. the lady seemed a little frustrated because of this and brought us to a manager. He was very understanding and got us a new table within in a minute. The lady asked me to remove my hat but there were people in there with bandanas on as well as sandals with socks. The steak tasted like propane. It was horrible. The waiter was very nice and helpful though and the view was beautiful. I'm hoping they will reach out and to make things right.

DXvYoIyCQDkSxEPFwK981A.text: Pretty damn good steak house / seafood selection. The view and atmosphere is amazing I must see and go. Me and my wife and some friends really enjoyed ourselves up here. 5 stars

wUqBfILFQqxhdNEDNs8SGQ.text: I would definitely recommend this restaurant if you want to have a romantic moment with your partner or love one  you can call ahead and order A dozen roses so when you get to your table you have a dozen roses waiting for you the food is excellent and the service is great..

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0c_6bMGmiPoeBVvCEjAlcg.text: We had a Restaurant.com certificate and love the view from here so went on Black Friday. A cab ride from the Monte Carlo cost us $50 so I walked in feeling like I had already spent too much money. We arrived in time for happy hour at the bar, but it was only for cocktails, not wine, which was disappointing. We had a table by the window which was great as the views are spectacular. We even were able to see people bungy jumping off the top. We both started with the lobster bisque soup which was wonderful. Loads of flavor and actually some ground up lobster. It was so filling, I could have stopped there. They had a pasta option which I had never heard of. Surf and Turf, which was lobster gnocchi and a braised beef. The lobster chunks were large and tasty. The gnocchi was way overcooked, but the sauce was very good. The beef was super tender and the sauce was very good. My husband had real surf and turf of filet mignon and crab legs. The crab legs were already split and he said they were some of the best he ever had. He could only finish half the filet. We were both stuffed. Our server was very helpful and knowledgeable of the menu. Yes, we had a great meal, and the views are awesome, but I think it's a bit overpriced. I could have had dinner (and enjoyed it just as well) for 3-4 nights, for what we paid here.

INgVtN1zyCvsmUGQiRx24g.text: This is a great place to come for dinner or lunch the view is amazing and it was such a fun experience.  Our server was Dee and she brought us a free dessert for our anniversary which was very unexpected.  The service is top notch and the view can not be beaten do yourself a favor and stop in for a meal and check out the excellent service and food.

pisZdSOkCVK3e8QSZmFeUA.text: I am giving this place 3 stars only because the service was pretty good. Hubby and I went last night for my birthday dinner. I was excited to see the view and have a nice romantic dinner. The view was beautiful but the movement of the restaurant almost made me sick. We both decided on the chef's special 4 course meal and I added the wine pairing. The lobster bisque was just okay. Weird sweet taste to it.  Next course for me was a scallop. It was just okay too. A little chewy. Hubs had the pork belly. He said it was just alright. Next for the main course we both got surf and turf. It was offered with shrimp but could upgrade to lobster for another $10 so we both did that. Glad we did because that was the best part of the meal. Hubs upgraded his steak and he liked it. Mine was not good at all. Had a nasty mushroom gravy on it and I only could eat a few bites. The dessert was good. The wine pairing was good. I really enjoyed all of the wines. But for $300 total bill go somewhere else. Totally not worth it.

liy0F_jhzjqYn1TSI9L6XQ.text: 5 stars all the way!  Food is terrific.  Food is out of the world! I love this view! Everything about this place rocks!!

OfnLhriog9qGLXzV1Oqvcg.text: Hi There,  Great food with fabulous service. Oh, and the view is unsurpassed. The food price has the admission to the observation deck etc.  Great deal if you look at in that way.  On thing I didn't see in other reviews was the fact you are on a rotating floor which ensures you see the strip at least once every hour and a bit. Have a great time :)  Cheers Ian

zN1-fMolUat6oRVlI6-Pkw.text: Selected the $90USA per person menu for two people. Cannot fault the service or the view. Although our seats were not by the window, we faced the view from one row back and was not disappointed. The lobster bisque was awesome, my favourite of the meal. Everything was great, including our cocktails. This was a more expensive meal than I usually pay, but was well worth it.

yNCnWp23d1BbjJnXiYnz1w.text: Overpriced. The food was not good.  Dry potatoes, bland salad.  The rotating dining area made me and some of my friends feel motion sick.  Cheesy atmosphere which is to be expected in that location, but they could have made up for it with excellent food, especially for the price.  Definitely wouldn't go back.

pxpGmIIlmpbsiXfZINrhkg.text: wat can i say... perfect. . the view was amazing and also the food.. cudnt ask for more..

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love love this restaurant...my boyfriend make a reservation and it was amazing the view is so breath taking!..

yqXbAo_udnYePtEthog6dQ.text: Excellent views, great food, attentive staff.  Top of the World is still the place to impress your significant other in Vegas. Only drawback is the elevator line to the top is a lengthy wait.

RWESDYZfRSAa3BGQWLxV7g.text: We went here for lunch because we wanted to go to the top but we didn't want to stand in line or pay for the observation deck (very cool that the elevator ride up is included in the restaurant price). Be prepared to take off all metal items before getting on the elevator [annoying!].  The view was lovely and rotated over our lunch experience. Watching the sky-jumpers was highly entertaining.  The pre-meal bread came with three lovely flavored butters, yay! (pesto, regular butter, and tangerine flavors)  I ordered the lobster bisque and sea bass. The bisque was acceptable tasting (not better than Target's lobster bisque) but the sea bass was NOT. It was a cheap cut of fish, not real sea bass, OUTRAGEOUS! Not what they showed in the pictures at the reservation desk. Fishy tasting in a bad way. :( !!!  I also tried the salmon and lobster mac and cheese from others at my table; those were nice and delicious. Burgers also a good choice here.  Service was average from the waitstaff.  Elevator attendant told us afterwards the restaurant experience came with observation deck time, above the restaurant - wish we had known. ----- In summary, DOT NOT GET THE SEA BASS but there are other palatable options. The view was great, and it is a better value to eat here and go up the private elevator than to just buy an observation deck pass.

Q7WQKtx9xS_lh7GORmUGiQ.text: This place is Amazing ! The service is great... Our meal was so yummy and good the vie is a PLUS

oZLn9gF82_TVBQ_vpN-5fw.text: At sunset, the experience is awesome.  It's very romantic for the ladies.  The prices are up high, so I wouldn't encourage going if you are on a budget or trying to hold out.  My motto is if you are going to go out, go all out and don't hold back.  The food is awesome, the wine selection is really good, and the atmosphere is cool.  Also like the gradual rotation.  The only sad thing for me is that the last time I went they had removed the tower of chocolate from the dessert menu.  It was one of the high points for us when we went the first time because it's a need little model of the stratosphere made of different types of chocolate.  That was the only dissapointment.  I recommend the lobster bisque, potatos au gratin, lamb chops, and ravioli (I think lobster or shrimp filled).

bCJQGzNulLp5T4XYmizniw.text: The service was really good until we received our main entrees, after that we did not see our waiter until the end of the meal. The seafood tower was very good and set a good standard for dinner however that was one of the highlights of the evening.  .My lamb chops were over cooked and the steak that was ordered was VERY fatty. For the prices it should have been a better experience. The views were amazing and it was a nice touch since we didn't order dessert and there was a birthday they brought out some whipped cream and raspberries with a candle. I would not be back, I would recommend for a drink or dessert since the views are amazing!

cZdBWjsLaHVbTC3_ra33HQ.text: 2 stars for the view and different flavored creme brulee.  I came here about a year ago with my boyfriend. The view is great, as the restaurant spins while you eat an you get a 360 view of Vegas. don't worry, you won't get motion sickness, you can't even tell its spinning.  The food was not up to par though. We had wine, appetizer, entree, and dessert. The bill was close to $300 and not worth it. I don't remember what we had for appetizer (see, that's how unmemorable it was) but my entree was duck. Bland. My boyfriend ordered a steak and he did not enjoy it either.   They also take a picture for you at your table and it costs $60 to buy it. I'm a sucker for that kind of stuff, so I went ahead and purchased it. It came with a frame and 2 more wallet sized photos. Shouldn't have costed $60, but ah well, it's Vegas.

5WqI9sYQJ8Q0KCXf5HrXPA.text: Went here on our anniversary and was super impressed. We both did the 4 course meal.   First, the view was amazing. We planned it so we would be able to watch the sun come down, which was just gorgeous! There was people doing the bungee jumping, and it was really fun to watch them fly by the windows.    For my meal, I started off with lobster bisque soup, which was delicious. The waiter brought me a bowl full of lobster meat, and pouring in the cream in front of me. The second course was a sea bass on bok choy, very fresh. My main course I chose the was a steak, which was amazing. The dessert was almost too much. They brought each of us a plate of 4 different mini desserts. I couldn't even eat it all, despite how tasty it was.   Our waiter was very friendly, on top of his job. My only complaint is I kept getting lost finding the bathroom lol. But other then that, amazing food and experience!

zsEj7qoCf3bvifknJxiy2A.text: We arrived to the restaurant at 5:00pm, which was perfect because it wasn't too busy. The greeters at the front were very nice and friendly. The fellow in the elevator was quite comical as was the man that was the busser for the table. Our waitress was okay, nothing out of the ordinary unfortunately. I like to think I am particular about my food and being that I'm Indian I am not willing to spend large amounts of money (or even allow someone to spend such money on me) on mediocre food. However, the food here was amazing! I started with a salad and had a vegetarian dish for my main course. The food had so much flavor! I was so surprised, it was so tasty!. My boyfriend also started with a salad and had a seafood alfredo dish for his main course. He loved it and devoured it within minutes. Who can forget the amazing view?! We watched the sunset over the city/valley. The restaurant was quite and intimate, the booth was spacious and I spent the evening with my lovely boyfriend and had a fantastic experience. I would definitely frequent this restaurant again in the future.  I am taking a star off because the waitress was lacking personality. If you make a substantial tip regardless, I expect a little bit of happiness out of you. The manager or owner was greeting all of the tables, which I thought was a wise business tactic. He complimented my boyfriend and myself. Although this was lovely, he used the same line on the next table; which was fine, but at least use mix it up bro. Maybe I'm being too picky, but I used to work in the restaurant/hospitality industry; so I might as well be picky (:  All in all, I would recommend this restaurant for the grandeur food, breathtaking view, and lovely experience!

Bay85NysSFIZaUy8QH7a4w.text: I came here with my boyfriend for his birthday. We had a blast enjoying the food and the view of the entire city. One of the best venues in Vegas.   ENTREE: I ordered SALMON for entree and it was very fresh and tasty. About $40 with some side veggies and mushroom. My boyfriend ordered the RIB-EYE : the sauce was amazing and the quality of the beef was very good as well.  DESSERT: they have the special DESSERT TRIO for only $8. i would recommend the banana bread pudding the raspberry chocolate creme brulee.   FUN: 1.go up to the observation deck at the stratosphere (Which alone costs $16) to see people do sky jumping.  2.Photographers will take photos of you at the restaurant. The quality is great and we got our picture for about $22 (not too bad! ) wear something nice if you want to have a picture with your significant other on a romantic date! :D

6jrN69g5AlhzDO9YNGC1GQ.text: Good steak, expensive, but good. Awesome view and a top 3 lobster bisque for all landlocked states

2yJxm0eXs0zsHg7Ska3d9A.text: If it wasn't for the view, the experience was pretty bland. Food wasn't that good. Serving staff was blah se. I'm wondering what all these good reviews were about, I had a better experience at the  sky city in Seattle.   :c(

GAuI2cuAgvIftZKTnTWPeA.text: Beautiful view but food is just OK. I We expected it to be expensive but didn't expect to be disappointed in food. Bread was not warm and was tough and tasted old. Lobster bisque tasted nothing like the bisque I ate before. It tasted like pumpkin pie filling. When asked waiter he said the chef adds allspice in it. I sent it back and got potato soup instead, which was OK. We did get charged for the bisque though.  My husband got ribeye and it was greasy and tough. My skirt steak was good, when we were ordering the waiter didn't tell us that the ribeye came with caramelized carrots and the skirt steak came with green beans. He offered us baked potato and mushrooms. We knew nothing about the size of the portions. There was too much food. If I knew my steak was going to include green beans I wouldn't have ordered the mushrooms. Our daughter ordered lobster Thermidor and it was good.  The view was breathtaking and we paid for it. We've dined at fancy restaurants before with the views and paid a lot of money for dinners but at least the food was worth the money. This restaurant's food was not. I would not recommend this restaurant.

vG_GwsFUgCpnvNgcv-9Fuw.text: This a definitely a special occasion restaurant, because of the price, top notch service and the view.  All the food was very good and the view was spectacular.  I wouldn't say this is the best food ever.  The service is top notch if not a little snooty.  You definitely should dress business casual, but not over the top.  There is a photographer that goes around and takes pics.  Kinda like prom night.  The photos are not that great quality so we only bought a few from our Anniversary dinner we had there.

RKLoVqph3Lim-gaVNHQUbw.text: I finally made it to Top of the World for Christmas dinner. This review is a little late, but it's definitely worth it. So here we go... Yes, this is a revolving restaurant. Every 30-45 mins you will have gone 360 degrees full circle while sitting at your dining table. The food quality is amazing and deserving of the solid 4 star reputation. The Christmas menu was really exciting and included a classic Waldorf Salad which reminded me of something you would see at your favorite high end NYC restaurant. The Kale salad and gnocchi were two of my favorite things and the overall experience was really fantastic!
