zgrFPRRlEiGXFSm2M90XHA.text: Looking for a romantic spot?  Well look no further this is the spot you have a 360 view of Las Vegas and for food I recommend if taking a date order two filet mignon and just one order of baked potato with everything on it and trust me it will be a night to remember. Also go on the Internet and find out what time the sun will set that day and make reservations for half an hour before that way when your up there you guys can have a view like no other.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good food with an awesome view

X0gYQvqQ2OJTygrUiLUBwQ.text: I absolutely love the Stratosphere for so many reasons.  But here are just 3 1. I got married here 5 1/2 years ago 2. the view 3. The Top of The World Restaurant  We went here to celebrate our 5 year wedding anniversary at sunset. The same time we got married. This was one of the very best dining experiences we have had in Vegas. Of course you can't beat the view....that's a given. The food, however, is to die for! I've never had a baked potato as huge as the one that came as a side with our dinner! I ordered the Fettuccine Seafood Alfredo with Lobster, Prawns & Scallops. My husband ordered the New York Steak with Brandy Peppercorn sauce. We both could not believe how great this meal was. I mean, it's Vegas.....and everything is so over priced! But, here we found a pricey meal that was worth every single penny! So yummy!  We will be back to visit the Top of the World very soon! We love good food, great views & of course the memory of our beautiful wedding.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New york steak with brandy peppercorn.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum! Fettuccine seafood Alfredo with lobster, prawns &amp; scallops. Loaded baked potato side.

9Q7tqKhSvLbiT375fohM3A.text: We went to dinner at the Stratosphere with our two teenagers. As you can see from any photo on the place, the views are unbelieveable and the rotating experience, especially at sunset, are unparalleled. So, it would be easy for the Strat to rely on its iconic views of Las Vegas and neglect the food and service. Surprisingly, both the food and the service are superb.  Our waiter, Max, was a True dining professional and guided us seamlessly through the experience in ways we didn't even realize we needing guiding. For example, he told us when to expect the "sky jumpers" to appear before us, how to prepare our camera for the best photo and more. He seemed to be working with an experienced serving team that anticipated our every need.  I got the tasting menu with filet mignon and it was devine. Daughter got the seafood pasta and is still talking about it. Max even got my 15 year old French fries that were not on the menu and allowed him to share my filet with me.  The reason that this isn't 5 stars is not the Stratosphere's fault. I hadn't realized how much I am afraid of heights until dining at the top of 106 floors. Being this high up was actually very stressful and watching the sky fallers jump past our window every few minutes for the entire meal was kind of terrifying. When Max told us we could go upstairs to the open air viewing platform as part of our meal, my husband and daughter eagerly went up to take in the views outdoors, while my son and I waited inside. So while the dinner and service were impeccable, I realize that sky top dining is probably not for me.

e46gHx7ySTTK_WS2Tj3vCQ.text: Service was excellent,  food was so delicious!! And you can't beat that view of Las Vegas. It's such a good place to go to if you want to eat somewhere romantic!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy dessert!!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free bread and 3 different kinds of butter!! SO delicious! :)

vgAPAHxe587AzWMpog5b_g.text: Date of dinner: March 24, 2014  We celebrated our 5th Anniversary and the Top of The World made it a special occasion for us. From our greeting by the host staff to our server, everyone was awesome, acknowledging our special night.   We were slightly disappointed that our table was not right along the window, however we had a more spacious booth seat, and the window seating is a bit chilly in March.  The meal was equally as awesome, we both indulged in the Lobster Bisque, it was creamy and wonderful. In hindsight, we could have split a bowl, as we both were so full half way through our entree we determined that we could not possibly order a dessert. Fortunately, the Top of The World took care of us with a celebratory little chocolate cake which was perfect. Delicate, yet rich and perfectly sweet to end the dinner.   We went up to the outdoor observation floor and marveled at the view. Watching the people on the various thrill rides was fun as well.

piTYVvM18EqzcTMLsgg7nA.text: What a colossal let down this place was. From beginning to end. My boyfriend proposed just prior to dinner here, so it really wasn't going to take a lot to impress me. I was so far on cloud 9 that literally everything would have to go wrong for me to hate this place.    Short version: don't waste your time or money.    I did my research before choosing eat here, so I knew what to expect. A great view with mediocre food. I knew we were paying for the view.    My fiance (that's weird!) booked a reservation through Open Table and followed up with emails to Top of the World staff to confirm a window seat for dinner. All was set... Except when we got there we did not have a window seat. Not a huge deal, but when I have already accepted I might be sacrificing food quality for ambiance, I want the unobstructed view!   They quoted us 20 minutes to get a window seat, so we killed time in the bar upstairs where we were promptly ignored. 20 minutes turned into 50 minutes. I get that's not their fault. But, had they not messed up in the first place this wouldn't have happened. We had reservations after dinner so their mess up put up back one hour and we had  to rush through dinner.  If they had been more honest with their quote time, we wouldn't have waited.  Who wants to spend over $250 on dinner and rush through it?  We finally sit down for dinner and both order the $70 steaks, medium well. For $70...it should come out as requested. Mine was rare. So obviously rare to anyone who even looked at it. I sent it back and knew it would come back like leather, which it did. So disappointing.   At that point not even a view of the strip could salvage the meal.   Definitely not going back, and would only recommend this place if you actually enjoy throwing your money away.

rYLYbba9cTJ9F80RRy49Tw.text: View is by far amazing.  I felt the food was overpriced for the quality. There's a ton of good places to eat in Vegas for the same price.    My client got the duck and steak, steak was great, duck was meh.  I got shrimp and scallops, was very good...not sure if it was over $25 good.    ALSO, they search you before you go up into the elevator to get to the restaurant.  Like go through a metal detector search. And look in your purse search---frist time for everything!  They also require you to be DRESSED nice, group of 8 before us, the men were in t-shirts, no dice, wouldn't sit them. So keep that in mind

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1Ay0dmYCj1DedZCSYFAUXw.text: I absolutely love Top of the World. Each time I am in Vegas, I have to eat there. The food is wonderful, the view is fabulous and the staff is very friendly. Reservations are easy to make as well. The prices are fair for the amount of food received and the quality is second to none.

rmZb4EVPEK8YwFqVvkVABw.text: This is a must do when in Vegas ! I don't see a bad seat in the place....with the rotating dinning area your view of the city constantly changes making for great conversation and cool photo ops.   The menu is not cheap and the food quality is in line with prices. One person in my party ordered gnocchi which was way too creamy and rich. Steaks are a good "bet" as well as the salads.   Food aside the view is why you want to expire nice this place.

_TrszsEqOB-sPJ-UiYRyoQ.text: I have to admit, I came here for the view. The restaurant is on the 109th floor with a slowly rotating floor that shows the entire 360 degrees view of Vegas in all it's glory. There is also a bar one floor above. Plus you get free entrance to the observation deck afterwards. I didn't have high expectations of the food and figured it would be overpriced for the quality. It turned out as I expected but the food tasted slightly better than expectations. I came here twice so far, once for brunch and tonight, I came for dinner.   With the view, I give this restaurant 4 stars. If without the view, I'd give it 2.5 stars.   Let's start with the decor:  I'm not sure how I should comment. The walls are painted a navy blue color with stars. It looks much more elegant at night time than day time since everything becomes dimly light. I remember coming here for lunch and thought I walked in to a casual diner called Saturn. Night time, it looks a bit more elegant. I still wouldn't consider it very sophisticated but it looks much better. Does it matter what the decor looks like? Not really. Who's looking if you have such a nice view of VEGAS.   Let's get to the juicy stuff. The food (dinner):   Bread- thought it deserves a comment. This bread basket is pretty good. Comes with three flavors of butter cream. You get an assortment of breads. Great start to the meal.   Lobster Bisque- The lobster bisque has a nice and creamy texture with fairly decent bits of lobster. Flavors are there, except too much salt. I personally did find it a bit too salty for my liking so I thought it was just fair.   Seared Jumbo Lump Crab Cake- A decent sized crab cake with lumps of crab and shreds of radish. The crab cake was a bit mushy. Not much of flavor.   Organic Aspen Ridge Ribeye with Horseradish Crust and Demi Glace (medium rare)- This ribeye turned out to be pretty good. Glad we decided on medium rare because I suspect it would become too chewy if ordered medium or they might overcook it. They do put the horseradish on top and cook it into a crust. I'm personally not a fan of horseradish as I think it masks the flavor of the ribeye. I asked it to be a thin and light layer of horseradish. Turned out to be pretty good. Came with tiny carrots.   Large Mexican Prawns, New England Scallops & Lobster a la Plancha- This dish came with successes and fails. The scallops were nice and tender. I am a big fan of scallops and eat it a lot so I was happy taking a bite into this. It was cooked thoroughly but not overcooked. The prawns were plain under cooked and slightly blue at the bottom. It was pretty gross. The lobster was decent. Some bits were juicy and succulent and other parts were a bit dry. I suspect uneven cooking.   Did not order desserts this time. I did have the banana foster last time. I thought it was decent but nothing amazing. It looked pretty cool, like some crazy tower of deliciousness. However, it failed in terms of taste.   Service was a hit or miss. Last time, I came for lunch and the lady serving us was amazing. I give her two thumbs up. Tonight, my server was a man who barely paid attention to us. I was not too happy with that. He kept on kissing up to the table with party of 6 next to us. Barely came by even if we needed something. I give him 4 thumbs DOWN.  Go up to the observation deck after dinner. Walk around and burn off some of the calories you consumed. Watch some of the bungee jumpers scream like little girls. Go outside. It's nice and breezy. You get the entire view of Vegas and won't have to take photos through a glass window.  Would I come here again? Yeah, probably once in a while. I enjoy the view. This place is only worth it if you go up to the observation deck. The food is overpriced but you do get free entrance to the observation deck.

_1yCCTGo09D9DJkcw3VLxA.text: While waiting my turn to do the Sky Jump I decided to pop by the restaurant with the best view in Vegas for lunch. Looking through the menu, I glanced at their lunch specials and chose the Grilled Cheese Frenchie. Now my feeling was that $25? Really? How good can it be? Well judging by the picture you can see that this restaurant doesn't mess around. A delicious blend of decadent cheese and tomatoes, it tastes a bit like Alfredo pasta with bacon for good. If you don't mind paying a little because it is Vegas after all with a killer view even in the afternoon. You can't go wrong with this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Cheese Frenchie

pmQt-N1MtjCev0l9bJOeVg.text: I'd been wanting to dine at this restaurant for several years, so a buddy & I made reservations (June 2007). Funny enough, it was really just your basic, run-of-the-mill dinner not much different than most of us regular folks have when at home...  Miles & miles of views care of the 1,000 feet elevation Foie gras w/rabbit Filet mignon Creme brule w/berries  Add martinis & a glass of red wine and you'll end up with the reasonable, family-friendly cost of $200 including tip.   Bring your sunglasses if dining during daylight hours. As the restaurant spins uncontrollably around in circles at ever-increasing speeds, the sun can be very difficult on your bloodshot Las Vegas eyes.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The restaurant is WAY up there.

M5kGMO_9Wq5Zgu9jxB5lFA.text: My boyfriend and had dinner there at 7:30pm the view was incredible the service was great and the food was wonderful..I highly recommend this restaurant and would most definitely go again if we go back to vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My boyfriend and myself at top of the world .June 11 2015

d6rrwBBZNnYJMj0HotZ5Nw.text: I made the mistake of thinking that this place was a walkable distance from our hotel (Mirage). Man was I wrong! We were walking, more like running (me in heels) for a good 15mns. When we got to our appointment, more than an hour late, all sweaty, we were greeted with all smiles and great service. Still seated right away. For that we were thankful.   View is stunning. For someone with a fear of heights, I was afraid of feeling ill from the tower rotations every 20mns. Totally wasn't the case. In reality, you could barely feel them. Food was delicious. Steak and lobster combo is a real winner. It's definitely one of those restaurant worth visiting in your lifetime.

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k6srP5egjdxEb5r86p8ckQ.text: *This has been a draft since October.. delayed. My apologies.  The group is us made reservations, they gave us an early time because they said they were booked later on in the evening.  We got there for 530 and spent just about an hour an a half there.  They were not booked through that time however we did appreciate that it was revolving through at sunset so it worked out just fine and realized if we were given a later time we would not have got to see the sights as we rotated.  You check in and head toward a small security station where you either get patted down or bag searched and walk through a metal detector.  This to me was a little strange, if I'm going up to this $60+ a head meal not including drinks and sides mind you, I really don't feel like I should have to be body searched to do so.  That, was disheartening.  They told us on the phone that they can turn people away about what people wear, we got really dressed up and we were very well expecting the rest of the restaurant to also be fancy.  The people that were ahead of us were certainly far from dressed up and they still allowed them to get in the place.  Classin' up the joint, eyy.   We got in the elevator and shot up while the attendant spat his speech, he was great except too scripted but perfectly timed.  We were seated and had a wonderful view.  The actual views alone are great, everything else isn't.  The menu was fine but the price was ridiculous and none of us left raving about our meals. I got the pasta with shrimp, scallops and lobster.  I got that because it was really the only dish with a variety.  All the other dishes were expensive but didn't come with sides, those had to be purchased separately, and the pasta and fish was a good combo.  Our waiter was a hoot, he was really nice and helpful.  He had some funny one liners and was knowledgeable about Vegas history.  He also reminded me of a theatrical voice where I just wanted him to keep talking, he reminded me of a narrator of a play or story.  The way this place rotates is really cool.  I feel like the food was just mediocre for the price but the atmosphere is really what we paid for, I wouldn't go again though the next time I go to Vegas, once was enough.

_ixfYxnf6Auwlnm6ws9vfQ.text: the best place i've ever been. had the five course meal for a hefty price, but it was worth every penny. request a window seat as you arrive, sometimes there's a wait but every seat is just as magical. i loved this place so much that the next time in my vegas it will be the first place i'll go!!!

MHwDdqVt8vNveGIFeHzzxw.text: Great food, great view, expensive price. The price is worth the experience and the quality of food however there are other restaurants that have a great view with a better price tag. I recommend the Voodoo lounge for a less expensive alternative. The stratosphere rotates as you eat. We completed one full rotation while we dinned and was there approximately 2 hours.

eDRuDyDtH_Vhv6wGHlql9A.text: I have to say over the years we have eaten here for lunch and for dinner. This place is so amazing just to think it turns as you eat. You can see the whole city in a complete turn. The night is the best with the lights, It is really beautiful, Your up so high like your in a plane!!! Before you come I recommend making reservations so you can be sure to get in because this place does get busy. This is truly a dining experience. From the moment you arrive, till you leave. The food is amazing no matter what we have ordered here it is always so good.  I always have the lobster bisque soup. It is really delicious! Has to be one of the best in town. Anyone who does not have a wonderful dining experience here is crazy. They are always consistent.  This is a place to go for a dining experience or special occasion.  Make sure what the dress code is because I think lunch is a little more casual. Once your done with lunch or dinner you can go to check out the view in the observatory. You can take pictures there and visit some of the shops. Taking the elevator back down seems to go pretty fast for being up so high. All I can say is try this place for yourself. It is not cheap by no means. Your paying for the wonderful dining experience you will have as well as the amazing food you will get,

1SBDx-GBH_RHm-EYv1r-MA.text: We flew to Vegas and landed on the Top of the World!   My boyfriend and I had a double date here with my best and her bf and all four of us were excited to see what this place was about, neither of us tried it, so we were ready to eat and enjoy the amazing views.  Located at the very top of the stratosphere, which is also a hotel with shops and tons of restaurants, it's off the strip but in no way does it keep you from seeing the lights and beauty of the strip.    You can easily make reservations here online which is very convenient. We were seated promptly and the hostess was sweet and friendly.  Our waiter came by and seemed like he was in a grumpy mood.  Now, out of all the good things I wish to share with you about this restaurant, our waiter was a major downer, he was sarcastic, seemed irritated when asked if he could take our picture, and couldn't answer my friend nicely when asked where the salmon was from. He didn't even know where it was from.  He made us want to leave and skip dessert.  =( skip dessert?!?! -----something I ALWAYS make room for.    Anyways, like all the other reviews the revolving restaurant feature is pretty darn cool.  What's even cooler, is the fact that you can see people bungee jumping off of one sides of the top building.  Now, that's definitely something I'd like to do in the future.    The food was delish!  The only exception was the truffle mac & cheese.  It had a weird texture and I found it to be heavy and reminded me of lima beans, strange.  I ordered the salmon which came with mushrooms and mashed potatoes.  This was DIVINE.  I loved every bite and wished i could have chowed down the whole thing, unfortunately my stomach told me to stop putting food in my mouth, before getting sick.  The bf ordered the lobster pasta which he enjoyed so much he ate almost everything.  My best and her boyfriend enjoyed their meals as well.    Basically the food here is absolutely worth a try, the views will set the mood for a romantic date night or double date night, and watching the bungee jumpers will be a great conversation starter.  Just hope you have a different waiter from us.  ENJOY!   #Yelp 365 - 01/365

UQTv_UH-Fv0sXnEJ-4oXZw.text: An amazing place to eat are found at this restaurant.  The views are spectacular as the place turns 360 degrees as you eat.  Sometimes you would even see a bungee jumper flying over the side and down.  The food was not bad, but not as good as it could have been.  My scallops were raw in the middle, and my creme brulee was cold, and not fresh.  I like my flaming when it comes out, not taken out of the fridge.  The breads and butter spreads are very tasty, my salad was perfect.  The poor waiter struggled to help my poor wife who has several allergies.  In stead of the chef coming out, or the manager, the waiter would make a mistake and we would have to wait for a new dish to come out.  This happened all night, and in the end, she became sick due to contamination.  If I had to do it again I should have asked for the chef to come out.  I heard several staff members behind us complain about working here, and one of the managers reprimand a staff member, which was very unprofessional.  And finally they have employees whose only job it is, is to take pictures of the customers, and try to sale you a photography package.  Who wants a photograph of them at the dinner table?  Strange.

LOaBZ_FM0srnRkWckQsIiA.text: I brought my wife for valentines day dinner, she really likes the food and view.  Made reservations a month ahead so didn't have to wait more than 5 min for our table. We will be coming back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UVnSSIWwmweMI6D-LaBuQA.text: The food is just ok.  We tried the lobster bisque that everyone seemed to rave about was disappointing.  Just a weird mix of flavors.  The tuna tataki and calamari were ok.  The faltiron steak sandwich was also just ok.    Of course the rotating view is very nice but there are so many other fantastic places to dine in vegas and get way more bang for your buck.

4P7HqpJnI_XV7_dMQfc9Cg.text: We visited here in April 2013. View is great, watching morons jump off side of building was fun, but the food was blah.  We had crab cakes for appetizer. They were just ok. I had filet which was just like ordering filet from chilis. My daughter did the seafood Alfredo and worried the whole time she had just got food poisoning. Son in law had surf and turf, turf was bad as mine and surf was dry and chewy. We also had lobster bisque and it was weird tasting too much sherry or something going on wrong in that recipe.  Service was fine.

WZxEG6gpwfjI7oap4mMlkQ.text: The husband and I had dinner here the first night we were in town. He told me the ambiance would be amazing with the Vegas skyline and subtle rotation. Usually restaurants that have a gimmicky atmosphere have subpar food. Oh boy did the food here blow other restaurants out of the water! We ordered the rack of lamb and one 4 course meal to share.  The staff was friendly and attentive. They gave us recommendations on what to order and advised perfectly.   We started with bread, which was AMAZING! It was fresh and came with 3 flavored butters. The orange one was my favorite!   Lobster Bisque - oh so tasty and filled with lobster. Waiter served it table side to show how much lobster is actually in the bisque.  Branzino - perfectly seared and delicious!  Steak - perfectly cooked as we asked and tasty, but the rack of lamb seriously outshined this.  Rack of Lamb - absolutely orgasmic!!!! I started with this while the hubs ate the steak so we could switch off and I told him I needed to finish with this. The mint sauce was great and we each had 2 pieces. A very generous portion.  Dessert that came with the 4 course meal was good, but seriously that rack of lamb. Mmmmmm!  At one point during dinner you rotate to where bungee jumpers are falling from above (keep in mind we are on the 107th(?) floor). It's pretty entertaining.  We went out to the observation deck after dinner and it was a great way to end the night. Worth every penny. Wonderful service, atmosphere and food!

HquwsslXhsejbE51y4erDA.text: The view was amazing. Loved watching people bungee jump. Unfortunately the food was subpar. There was 9 of us and we all agreed it was not worth the price. I ordered the seafood Alfredo ($59) and Caesar salad ($15) and it wasn't good at all. It had a weird taste I can't even explain. My friend ordered the same and agreed with me. We also ordered a side of mushrooms to share but they were burnt and returned them. Food took long enough we didn't want to wait for just mushrooms. Everyone else didn't like their food either. You'd think if you're putting out $100 on food it would be phenomenal. I understand you're paying for the view also butttt yeah no. The only thing we all did enjoy was the different infused butters that was complementary with bread. ALSO the walk to get there is RIDICULOUS. You have to walk thro the casino then around a extremely long mall just to get to the elevator for the restaurant. LADIES I REPEAT DONT WEAR HEELS ON THIS VENTURE. The walk was about 10 mins which is absurd.   Also you go thro a metal detector before the elevator. Which is very weird but it became the norm while in Vegas. Everything was metal detectors, pat downs or purse searches.   So the view and butter were the only positives.

UvaFbVXbU_9q4O8bVlpx7Q.text: Food was marginal for the price. The service was terrible. It took forever to be served, and get the check. When I gave the server my card, he said it was declined even though I knew there was money on it. He also made another server come and tell me the card was declined, and take another form of payment. The server was rude, and took his time waiting on us, even though there were only a few other tables occupied.   On a more positive note, the view is terrific! I would recommend going to the lounge or the observation deck rather than paying for dinner.

FAo4HMor0VzcWRg9xMm_5w.text: My husband and I went in August 2013...the service was really good and the manager is a great guy.  Food was terrible, but I guess you go for the views.

8tS50E3zFylDk_DIvClhtg.text: This was truly the best view of Vegas. However the food left a lot to be desired. It was below average. We ordered filet mignon and rack of lamb...both were blah.   The service was excellent!!!  I would skip the restaurant in the future and go to the observation deck then bar for happy hour.

Z83-iJcn3SEbKnkREhHu5A.text: Food is middle-of-the-road, but don't despair, you're paying for the view.  Get there just before sunset for the best views.  Interior could use some updating: the dog kennel carpets are 10 years past replacement and it wouldn't hurt to update the light fixtures.  Interior's not as nice as the website reflects, just keep that in mind so that you aren't too disappointed.  It's best to focus on the beautiful view outside of your window and the occasional sudden bungee jumper, as you sip on your unspectacular lobster bisque.

oDH5LCIjvoa4DC3phQZiRw.text: We celebrated our one year anniversary here. First be prepared to come early. It took 20 minutes to get to the restaurant. Waiting for the elevator took awhile plus when you finally arrive, you have to wait in a long line before reaching the hostess. After ordering our meal...it took another 20-25 minutes before we got our food. The view was beautiful!!!! We enjoyed it more than the food. The food was good, but a bit pricey for the quality. We've had better at other steakhouse restaurants. Your pretty much paying for the view...not the food. Although our waiter was very pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Alfredo...the alfredo was too heavy.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak with pepper sauce.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twice baked potato.

nKQHvuh22j4C1Q14yMc0Mg.text: Every single thing about this meal was perfect. Mother's Day is often a difficult day to eat out, the staff never appeared stress even though we were 15 mins late bc of traffic. We did the chefs tasting w the wine pairing. We also had a couple bottles of wine between the group. We were supposed to have 7 and only 5 showed. All of these things can ruin a servers night, but our server was fantastic! Celebrated a bachelor party in a fun, fancy way! Recommend this to anyone looking for an amazing dinner!

21jFrOrbC1H8iAVzXWGLXw.text: Went here like 6 years ago and been meaning to write a review. This was the BEST restaurant we have ever been to. From the view, to the service to the food. Everything was excellent. And we have been to dozens of 5 star restaurants. It is worth the money for a special occasion. Loved it!

Ikr6ijk5sFSx_EnliMNE_Q.text: We came here as our splurge meal on a Christmas visit to the Strip.  The view is as incredible as you would expect and the service is excellent.  We started with the lobster bisque which I am still drooling over a month later.  We ordered from their limited menu and the food was well prepared, though not the best I've ever had.  The restaurant itself wasn't very lively and dimly lit making for a romantic setting. The staff was willing to take our picture and there was a professional photographer about to sell you quality prints at a not very modest price.  If you're looking for an elegant quiet dinner with a great view of the strip, this is the place you are looking for.

Zl_X_1ECNDfos_4OBF39jQ.text: Phenomenal view with one of the best seatings in Las Vegas. I wish I could have had the whole experience but the rotator which spins the restaurant giving you a 360 panoramic view was broken. My view was still beautiful nonetheless wherever you are in the restaurant.  I ordered the shrimp scampi with a glass of Brachetto d'Acqui which was a fantastic sweet & bubbly red wine. The shrimp scampi was a big portion, big enough for two or to take home for left overs. I wish I could have saved room for dessert but I was stuffed with more than half my plate leftover at the end of my dinner.  Our server(tall bulky Asian male) was pleasant and well informative.  The food was fresh and cooked to perfection. I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the table.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi &amp; Brachetta d&#39;Acqui.  The bread butters has three options: Regular, Orange(sweet), and Garlic Pesto

OJAVPEOIFRs85N0DFsyDZg.text: This is the perfect place for gentlemen to take ladies whom they truly wish to impress, or for those business folks who desire to take a potential client to a venue where they can be persuaded to "sign on the line."  Either way, you'll have a great time, albeit an expensive one.  It's not at all unusual for a dinner for two costing around $200, so save your pennies.  The TOTW was chosen one year, when the governors of all 50 states were meeting here in Las Vegas.  Can you imagine the entire states' leadership in one location, 800 feet above the ground?  The view is spectacular (see the attached photos), the food is sensational, and the service is terrific.  What more do you need?  The restaurant "spins" at a speed where one complete revolution takes approximately one hour, and my social engagements there averaged "two complete spins."  There is also a unique kind of "optical illusion" that is experienced while you're dining there, but it isn't mentioned all that much.  As you're seated and eating, watching your scenery constantly changing before you, you come to believe that you are in some kind of "flying saucer," HOVERING over the city.  You don't think of yourself as being in a building; you feel that you might be aboard some sort of an aircraft, which actually adds to your enjoyment.  (Another way to truly enjoy your visit, is to pay for it with your company's expense account.)  Just one bit of advice or "admonishment" from me, if you please...  If you are one of those folks who will probably go there only ONCE during your lifetime, let me suggest that you go only at night (to get the most from your visit), and that afterwards, you go up to the next level to have your after-dinner drinks in their "stationary" cocktail lounge.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NwdxR0Eo_iVTQj2Wkf0MKw.text: We came here last Monday night to celebrate my birthday we originally made reservations for 715 but we had difficulties with Uber trying to get here and this restaurant is way way way in the back of the hotel so we ended up getting there around eight but we only waited for about 15 minutes or so before we were seated! You have to go through a metal detector before entering the elevators which is strange for a restaurant but we waited longer for the elevator to come get us and we did to be seated they have a person in each elevator because they are confusing I guess anyhow we were seated not directly next to the window but one table over so we still were able to get an excellent view.. I know this is a place for the great experience and I was kind of hesitant to eat dinner here because of all the negative reviews but I can honestly say we had a pleasant experience I had a margarita  and started off with a Caesar salad my husband had the soup of the night which was cream of chicken and he said it was great I'm not much of a meat eater but I did have a few bites of my husbands 9 ounce filet that was absolutely perfect!!  We also split the mashed Yukon Gold potatoes and sauteed mushrooms which were also good.  Our waiter was excellent I feel bad I can't remember his name but he was very attentive and checked on us Sevral times. We did not have dessert because we were way too full although I've never been to a restaurant that doesn't offer a free birthday dessert but I did not make a big deal of it because like I said we were too full to eat dessert anyway after our dinner he told us we could go up one floor to the observation deck which was gorgeous it was such an amazing view we had a good experience here overall!

RQQ9ArpeymYS11yvzWMdWQ.text: So, we planned my wife's birthday dinner at Top of the World restaurant at the Stratosphere. Even after reading mixed reviews I hoped for the best, but sadly was disappointed.  We walked through the (and I'm being nice) dated stratosphere hotel and casino (think late 80's Vegas), up to the area where the elevator was. We had to go through a metal detector to get to the elevator, and were asked repeatedly if we were going to the club or the restaurant.  We got to the top to be seated by a nice hostess. The initial view of the strip is impressive, and then you start seeing the sad parts of Las Vegas :-(.  Our server introduced himself and that was the last we saw of him. After seeing the prices the restaurant was charging then looking around at the dated atmosphere, the poorly maintained inside of the restaurant and the lack of service, we left.  I write this review as I sit eating my salad at Lawry's and celebrating my (much happier) wife's birthday dinner.  Long story short, view is neat, but definitely not worth dinner.  . . Go to Lowry's Prime Rib instead :-)

uNdyc8GgB8uBV9nYJVrSyA.text: Most horrible dinner! Food was cold, steak disappointing! Service  has went down hill! Save your money and try out back!

ngb9VAQcNoamWDujH_i8ug.text: Went to top of the world with some friends and it was ok! We all had steaks and they were cooked perfectly but it didn't really blow me away. What did blow me away was that view! We got there right as the sun was setting and it was really great. The view made up for having to go to the stratosphere (which is kind of a dump). We had the creme brulee and it was hands down the best one I've ever had. If this was a restaurant in another city I would probably give 4 or 5 stars, but since vegas has SO many amazing places to eat this falls a little short in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View

wXB7dtCzVWrpwIH_Oo_zJA.text: Beautiful Place, great views of the city. Impecialbe service.  Friendly staff.. Steak was vrey good. Ordered a dish with potatoes amd veggies. The vegatable garden seemed very bare. Disappointing to say the least. Got a childs portion of pasta, that was OK.  The birthday dessert was areal treat.

Hg9DaGiWZfoD4fn_lZyBbA.text: A special dinner tonight planned for my boyfriend's birthday not only meet our expectations but, soared higher than anything I could have dreamed of.    Our waiter Bon was super helpful, friendly and entertaining.  The entire staff was engaged with us and the others from the security screener to the elevator operators.   We shared the tomato, buffalo mozzarella, grilled pepper and Portabello appetizer with herb oil and balsamic redux dressing along with an assortment of freshly baked bread.  My boyfriend enjoyed the Surf and turf done perfectly while I experienced the well balanced and seasoned Vegetarian plate.  The big finish after watching the desert tray from our first full 360 degree location was the Chocolate lovers delight.     The food, wine and service was not only outstanding but, the best I've ever experienced.  As a local, I now wonder what took us so long to come see for ourselves what all the talk was about.  I'm breathless from the view and watching the sun set was an added bonus.  We will return and I highly recommend, and I don't use that word lightly, others see for themselves.

IOseLi_weRSxPCYOhqJv9g.text: This is possibly the worst meal I've ever had given the price.  It is incomprehensible that this place manages to stay open given all of the great restaurants in Las Vegas.  $44 for a piece of uninspired chicken topped with a sweet sauce that you'd expect to find in a coffee shop.  Same for the wedge salad.  And fois gras paired with white chocolate?!  Friendly but inept service.  But, hey, a nice view.

fkSSURNqrU7IbLGads-ifw.text: For the most part my vegas eating occurs around what we're planning to do... so when skyjump became a "must do" we found this place.   We have a 360 restaurant at home so the novelty of the concept didn't speak to us.  I knew the view in the day is alright and, although vegas has a nice night view,  it's not really taking advantage of the revolving dining experience even to the extent of the one back home.   So we decided we'd like a 360 dinner at sunset followed by a night jump as I love my sunsets.   We carefully planned out the sunset timing and set the reservation so we'd see the best of it while we ate and still had darkness for the jump.  We made a few calls to the restaurant to confirm a window seat and I was looking forward to the vegan menu item they have that sounded yummy.  This was near the tail end of our trip so we'd been looking forward to it for a while and   i'm sad to say we actually left without eating because I got so upset before we got that far.   I tend to expect that when I make a reservation,  I can show up 10 minutes before and be seated by the time I booked.  Especially in a place such as this.   Well...   we waited for some time at the bottom hostess as she talked to non-dinners and left us waiting there.   We have heard that when skyjump first opened people were terrified of the jumpers out the window resulting in upset, broken plates and wine down the wrong pipe for many dinners so The Top of World started to tell dinners about the jumpers long before they sat at tables.  In this case the lovely elevator man informed us that jumps had been all canceled due to wind so we WOULDN'T see jumpers over our meal.    Wow,  bummer considering we had a jump reservation and hadn't been told this yet...  So we  arrived at the top a little bummed and was met and subsequently ignored by a cold hostess that made us feel like an inconvenience.   Other than greeting people at the elevator,  I'm not sure what else she was suppose to be so busy doing that set our priority way down... Eventually we're addressed and at the end of the interaction she set our menus aside with no further conversation and we piece together we were waiting for someone to come seat us.   Well... we wait.. and wait... and the hostess is just sanding there in an empty foyer with just the 3 of us not talking to us or explaining away the hold up.  Eventually someone who I don't believe normally seats people noticed us and rushed to seat us - alas a turn around to the evening?  No... we've been placed at a non-window seat despite 3 requests!   We said we asked for a window and could see 3 such empty window tables sitting there and was told they were for other people but we could wait for one to be available or just eat now away from the window.  We opt to wait for the window.   We're lead back to the cold hostess and we're told 20 -30 minutes for a window seat  (interestingly enough we're still the only party waiting for a table)  so we waited a bit and could eventually see the sunset disappear from sight via an obstructed view across the building.    I'm pretty upset the sunset is gone, the service was dismal,  the jump was canceled AND no one has even called to notify us of the jump cancelation even 30 minutes after we found out from the restaurant.  Frankly by that point I lacked the motivation to shell out $100+ p/p for a diner I felt too grumpy to enjoy... and so we left.  Honestly I'm unsure I'll ever be back... maybe next trip we'll try again with both elements but the upset is too fresh in my mind to say.   This place is REALLY far away from everything and the area it's situated in very seedy...  I'm glad we didn't walk it in the dark to say the least.

j8Bou0t8YwGjopGPd0rPeQ.text: Been to the stratosphere a few times and love it. They are accommodating and friendly and the food is wonderful as well as the view!

JY2eyNZpMNUct-MzYlsRvg.text: I wound up here completely by chance.  It all began with a last minute Hotwire reservation that put me at the Stratosphere hotel for a night (I was extending my stay in town for a day, and rooms were hard to come by).  Checking in mid afternoon, a very nice Guatemalan girl at reception gave me a voucher for my choice of a free drink (champagne or bloody mary) or a free ceviche at the Top of the World Restaurant located at the very top of the hotel.  The voucher even had a detailed recipe for the ceviche on the back, and it looked delicious.  I was famished and even though it was mid-afternoon I could still make it for lunch.  So off I went.  I should probably begin by describing the view.  That is obviously the clear draw of this restaurant.  The main floor is encircled by windows that extend down to the floor and allow, collectively, a 360 degree, panoramic view of the desert floor below.  While the view was very impressive, I thought initially, that where I was seated would determine how good my view actually was.  The designers of the restaurant, of course, thought about this.  Their creative solution?  Make the restaurant revolve!  That's right, in the course of an hour, you will make a full spin, so everyone will be guaranteed a private minute with the best vantage point of the Strip lying below.  Genius.  It was probably the only time I used my camera in a restaurant for taking pictures of something other than the food.  If that were not enough, you will occasionally witness bodies dropping past your window, hurtling downward to a most certain death only to be granted a reprieve at the very last moment.  Some sort of macabre activity called a SkyJump.  I was pretty pleased with all of this.  I was able to see Las Vegas in a way that I never saw it before, so it really transcended the level of being a gimmick.  I was happy I went here for lunch.    So, what about that lunch?  Well, I opted for the free ceviche and additionally ordered a po boy.  The ceviche, for all of the hype and glossy advertisement, was singularly disappointing.  A lone jumbo shrimp in a shot glass of spicy sauce.  There were no implements to assist in eating this, so one could only dip the shrimp in the sauce and eat it directly -- not exactly a ceviche.  More like a step up from shrimp cocktail, but the flavor profile of the dipping sauce was not particularly memorable.  The sandwich was considerably better though.  The portion size was especially large, and the flavor was clear and consistent throughout.  The ingredients were of good quality, and I was pleased with the texture.  Even the shoestring fries were good.  So they redeemed themselves.     Between my comfort food, my glass of white wine, and the extraordinary views, I had a grand time making my way through a lazy afternoon.  Highly recommend going at least once for the view.  A more economical option is to go for lunch rather than dinner, since the view is the same.  The food seems to be generally good, but it's not the biggest draw as one can certainly eat better elsewhere on the Strip.  Overall, 4 stars. (slightly less if there was no view)

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XEoIK8D86je35bHvK3Mekg.text: Beautiful view, delicious food but bad service!  Our waiter was so slow and not very helpful!  We had the bone in ribeye (amazing), the petite filet (ehh), the asparagus (wouldn't order again), the mushrooms (yummy), the twice baked potato (heavenly), a caesar salad (big enough for two and okay) and the banana's foster (OMG!!!).  Our total with drinks (lot's of drinks, lol) was around $300.  Fun place to visit!

NRhpm1LCGMbRGFyXhUEcKQ.text: Terrible service, went here past weekend and the table was shaky, asked the waiter if they could fix it or let us sit at another table, and he said no.  It was pretty empty when I went so I didn't understand why not.    Food was alright, portions are huge but tasted average.   Won't be coming back with the rude service. I personally prefer Eiffel Tower over this, better price and service IMO.

NDDr6qJaYiKgsRopByOdIA.text: We were here to try the holiday menu on Christmas Eve, the view is amazing; the food was bad, some plates were undercooked, others were overcooked, the soup was cold and the service was the worst ever. Too long between courses, more than 40 minutes between the salad and the soup. The manager didn't care. He never came to check on the table and, when we talked to him about the service, he was even rude. Very disappointed! Don't come unless you want to spend more than a 100 USD for food that does not wort it.

OxG0JIYP4NfLRWFtNGs0EQ.text: Food was mediocre, but the view was breathtaking. Occasionally you will see people doing bungee jumping. The restaurant rotates, so some might feel the motion sickness. I ordered the lobster bisque and it was really salty, but the foie gras and crab cake was pretty tasty. The entrees are really filling, and nothing much special. But for the price, $200 for 2. There are better restaurants out there. The waiter are also not attentive. It took them forever to come to place our order and they hardly check up on you after ordering. I recommend this restaurant for people who wants to bring their family, but not on a date because although the view is breathtaking, the service and food us mediocre. They also offer photo taking, and it is charged pretty expensive. Oh yeah, 1 more thing, since the restaurant rotates, the lighting of the restaurant also changes. So sometimes you'll be eating under bright light and sometimes it's pretty dim.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster, big prawns, and scallops!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras!

HqBM9UF2qxgH5YEuPUkGEQ.text: This restaurant doesn't have the best food but it definitely has an awesome view of the whole entire Las Vegas when dining.  The setting is a little dark, intimate, and romantic.  If you want a great atmosphere for a date, this is a place to go to.  For the most part, most of your money will probably end up from buying wine, and other liquors.  The service was great from most of the servers.  Our main server had a hard time looking at us when talking to us.  I think that's probably the worst part of the whole thing for me.  Everyone was at our beck and call when we needed them.  If we wanted something, they were ready to get it for us.  I'd go again, and again.

trkvJY1Iq1TF4SJUapqEkg.text: I give it four stars bc they held my reservation even after I was over an hour and a half late, and they did not rush us out, look at us with disdain, or act nasty to us, which I totally expected.   Me and the mrs ordered the price fixe dinner for two which was around $200, which was pretty much on par with mostof our nonbuffet vegas meals. I think it was some type of surf and turf dish. Our waitress was wonderful in bringing it allout to us. The meal was topped off with a chocolate stratosphere tower.   And of course there's the view, absolutely exquisite, and after about 20 mins I stopped noticing the tower rotations.  Anyways, the whole point of this review was to praise how they held our reservation for so long, even after the people ahead of us just showed up reservationless and had an hour wait on their hands. To that, I was very impressed.

RWr2KUpON1hNdE2MdiQxow.text: The BF took me here for a romantic dinner.  I must say, the view is amazing.  I was in absolute awe the entire time.  It's enough to make you fall in love all over again.  A photographer even came to take photo's of us (for a fee of course) and they came out fantastic.  They were True quality.    I agree that the food was just okay, but the fact that they wait on you hand and foot makes the vist worth while.    Overall, I truly enjoyed my experience and would consider doing it again after visiting other establishments such as the Eiffel Towel Restaurant.

aJgqw1zVMX84Xvdj181Bog.text: A great experience. We had thought before going the pricing may have been driven by the view alone but the food was excellent and the service impeccable and whilst not fine dining perfectly tailored to a group of 11 guys out to celebrate. Definitely try and eat during the sunset transition. Hadthe surf and turf with king crab legs.

1kGq8kqiLfNU-WWDds7_AQ.text: Excellent experience.  Food, Service and the view.  It was just what I hoped it would be.  This is not a cheap meal, but it was worth it.  I had a 5:30 reservation, and wanted a slow meal so my wife and I could enjoy the sunset.  The staff had no problem with us sitting at the table for close to 3 hours.     I would go back for a great meal, in a relaxed atmosphere.

KphOeujABbuytAw1_Era8w.text: Absolutely amazing views and food for the most part was fantastic. However, the accompaniments to the main crab dish were lukewarm and very clearly reheated... Pretty disappointing for such a pricey restaurant. Great service.

sWaTlY5NzuucmVfkpZbScQ.text: My wife and I enjoyed a lunch at this restaurant while visiting Las Vegas.  We arrived to the restaurant at 12:30 PM on a Tuesday and it was nearly empty.  I'm not sure how they can survive being that empty; but, perhaps they thrive on the dinner crowd.  What's unique about this restaurant is the fact it sits high above the strip and offers views of all directions because the restaurant continuously rotates (very slowly) while you are enjoying your meal.  I will warn that if you don't like motion, you may have a problem with the motion despite the fact it turns very slowly.  I was initially sitting backwards; but, had to switch places with my wife as I was becoming slightly nauseated.  My wife and I both ordered sandwiches which came promptly and were good.  The portions were average and overall the prices was much higher than what you expect to pay for the same meal at another restaurant.  The two sandwiches and sodas came to $60 after tip.  Honestly, if you're looking for a good similar quality lunch, you can find it priced about 1/2 of what the Stratosphere charges.  It's clear they are charging a premium price for the food due to the view.   That said, we were not disappointed.  The service and ambiance was excellent so were willing to pay a premium for the meal.

4neJ9UntcsPtnCg5my8qsg.text: Went there for my holiday in Vegas. The restaurant is cool with the 360c moving floor as I got to see the Vegas strip and the whole city at night. The food is okay-good. The service is okay-good as well. Good for the view and foie gras dish there is great!

jjGdlTB_3eDT3X5zN8Ntyg.text: So this place is simply amazing...I loved it why the 4 stars our waiter sucked...just plain rude.   Went here for 4th of july right before sunset...the view is amazing...and just when it got dark we saw all of the fireworks going off all over...you get to see the people jumping off from the rooftop as well....  I ordered the Surf and Turf with 10 oz steak with mexican prawns...MMMMm it was sooooo good!!! My girlfried ordered the California Free Range Chicken Breast filled with Three Cheese Fondue....Sooooo 'Not Good" it tasted gross...the fondue inside tasted like burnt rubber...  the chocolate martinis where to die for...  Its a very nice romantic restaurant...I mean if your going out to a fancy restaurant expect to pay more than $100 dollars for your meal...if you dont want to spend alot dont go to a fancy restaurant..  It's worth it...:)

yPcaSbjG6MDflHk2Nhfmxg.text: Had a reservation for my family (group of 9) for Thanksgiving.   Had to wait 45 minutes for our table, and our group left after waiting 2 hours for our food to arrive...which it never did.   The waitstaff was terrible, and I was embarrassed that my family had to end up eating dinner in a greasy diner instead, since the service was so shitty.  Fuck this place.  I'm just glad we left before being charged $100 a person for such an awful experience.  Seriously, fuck this place.

EP1eSJDy2iawejXLm5yw8Q.text: My girlfriend and I went here for our 2nd year celebration and it went fantastic. Our server was superb, with our first time visit, I wish I would of remember his name but I forgot so bummer. Anyway it was such a fantastic view especially for me I enoyed it because I'm usually scared of height, but didn't stop me. We ordered our food and we ordered one thing off the menu because we wanted to share. We didn't say anything to our server that if they could split the food for us because we were just going to split it ourself but he did the most incredible thing and told the chef if could split the food into two plates. How generous he was serving it to me and my girlfriend. It made us feel special as a customer to the resturant. At the end he gave us a free little chocolate brownie as a little celebration with two candles for both of us to blow on. Our server went above and beyond our experience, hopefully everyone else does too because we sure will come back here again.   While we waited there was this women going around taking picture of people and when she got to our table she took pictures of us. At the end she made you take a look of the picture if you wanted any of it  Ofcouse the picture werent free so it made you have a choice if you wanted it or not. Surely we did buy the picture because they look amazing and keep them for memories. They werent cheap but werent expensive as well. So buy them as for memories.  Next time we go here we want to go during the night time because you could see all the light around Vegas. Takes 1 hour and a half I think for the whole thing to go around so you could see everything. Great experience, couldnt have spend it more!  05-14-16

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free desert because of our 2 year anniversary

LKQP9cROPJiIvivKkIlJmw.text: The view is spectacular! The fact that you're rotating the entire time just adds a wonderful experience. The food was fantastic, the ambience was great, the service however was on the slow side, but I think it was a matter of being understaffed. I dream about dining there often and now whenever I visit other restaurants I find myself comparing the food to Top of the World. I cant wait to return.

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HzFh4JO5aZ-HmH7e--eZPQ.text: All I have to say is "WOW"!.  The views - WOW!  The food - WOW!  The servers - WOW!    Our company had a conference at the nearby SLS Hotel and booked a private dinner here.  We had a private room that was decorated very elegantly and had our own private server and bartender.  The views were outstanding, especially at night as you can see practically all of Las Vegas lit up and also people bungee jumping.    Anyways, on to the food.    Appetizer: Lobster bisque and garden salad.  The bisque was thick and tasty.  The salad was okay, but had very nice dressing.  Entree: Filet mignon with some greens.  I asked for it medium rare and it was cooked perfectly. It was like 12 to 14 oz.  I loved it!  I usually can finish all my meals, but I definitely struggled with this one and if it wasn't a corporate dinner, I probably would have taken it home.  Dessert: Dessert trio.  I can't really say, because I'm not a sweets person, but they looked pretty.  Overall, this place has a great view and a great food and the positive reviews speak for itself.

IEasyIHkkDJEnLgtbfOItQ.text: Very nice place to eat if you are celebrating a special occasion or are looking for a "nice" place to eat.  Lunch ran us about $50 each (not including drinks).  The view is amazing as it sits high on the Stratosphere casino hotel.  The restaurant slowly spins giving the diners a full 360 of Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing view of Vegas!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing place!

3TF71YwslZjiBnij794KcA.text: SKYE  was amazing I would go back if I had the chance. Went to tix4tonight to get discounted price on food but it doesn't include 3 or 4 course meals. The view was amazing went around lunch time on a Monday not busy at all and was able to get a window seat. Took about 80 minutes to see the wonderful view of Las Vegas.  Afterwards, went to the observation deck and didn't have to pay to get in.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert

SPiew5qiCS54SFLDhTdvMw.text: It's a great place... Nice views, good food... Steak was perfectly cooked and was tender... Sides were good too... But a bit pricey unless you want to impress someone... I can come back for more....

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme Brûlée for dessert.... Good....
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom side... Good stuff...
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye.... Perfectly cooked....

A-H7Zbbqynu6TrdBZeCP8g.text: Top of the world deserves more than 5 stars. Made a reservation for window seating in late August because they get booked fast. Before going up to the restaurant they do require full search of body & belongings for safety measures. They accommodated us for the best seat we could have asked for. We were pleased by the experience especially the view of Vegas skyline. The food was delicious and as well as dessert.  Steak was prime to taste but could use sharper knives at least. Ordered wife the wagyu steak and lobster tail and cooked to perfection and her favorite twice big baked potatoe and it was big alright. I ordered the Kansas New York boned in steak and scampi with side button mushrooms. There's complimentary breads and butters pesto, original and citrus we loved the pesto and citrus flavors. We also added a bottle of their monthly white wine as glasses weren't worth it don't finish tale it back with you. As you eat you spin 360 with out even noticing. You get photo shoots as well seperate packaging pay but reasonable to some degree. Overall, we loved the experience and coming back next time as we celebrated our anniversary this time. Remember to dress nicely for date night casual works just fine but for the price go dressy for the occasion. We'd loved it and enjoyed every moment of it can't wait for next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buttons mushroom
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twice baked potatoes
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kansas New York boned in steak and scampi

w5sUdzG6uyEkFp-gLHM5Mw.text: We made a reservation for 9, and made the mistake of not requesting window seating not knowing if the view would be obstructed by sitting elsewhere. We checked in and were pleasantly surprised that they sat us at a wonderful table by the window anyways, but it wouldn't have mattered. The entire place is set up so you have a spectacular view of Las Vegas, so never fear where your table is.  We both went with the tasting menu. Joey provided  excellent service, and his knowledge of the wine menu was impressively helpful. I had the lobster bisque that was very nice, and hearty at the same time. The scallop was amazing with the sauce. The filet melted away as I savored every bite.   Bottom line- amazing experience, amazing food, amazing service. It's easy to see why they've earned as many awards as they have.  P.S.- you can take as many pictures as you wish so long as you aren't disturbing other diners (like the Germans next to us who turned our table area into a studio).

l_l4PwAds8AhAEf_lr4QIQ.text: When you first walk into the dining room you are blown away by the 360 degree view of Vegas. It was a clear day and I could see all the way to the mountains. The place looked somewhat modern and very upscale. Wait staff was tremendous and knowledgeable about the menu. I had the Prime Ribeye Steak sandwich which consists of Caramelized onion, Peppadew aioli, cheddar, arugula, ciabatta bread. Amazing. All the flavors worked real nice together. The onions gave it a moist sweet taste which was nice against the dry cheddar. 10/10 would recommend again. It is pricey but you're paying for the view honestly which is more than worth it. Fellas take your girl here and guarantee you'll get a little more than a kiss goodnight. Only negative and it's not a huge deal but the dinning room rotates so you can see the whole view in the hour you spend there. It made me dizzy after a while. Other than that enjoy yourself! You're on Top of the World!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oyYw0wlDvjWU7jNtyFa8yQ.text: Food: Good food. We had crab cakes for Appetizer, Duck Confit, Sea food Alfredo. Fantastic View of the Strip. When you reserve, request for the view.  Great Service.

-IZgqPz2ZA8_I8oJucJ0KQ.text: Four stars for the view, one star for the food. I give The service 3 stars. I got the chefs 4 corse. The pork belly was decent. The salad was just ok. The steak and lobster wasn't anything to write home to mom about. And the desert was just ok

YNdOdrh8kVszwWIGRPR7oA.text: Sing along with me, "I'm on the top of the world, looking down at creation, and the only explanation I can find..." is that this is the ultimate must do dining experience in vegas.  The food and service are top notch. Wine list not as good as last visit, but we found something decent to pair with our meal. Incredible views, rotating restaurant, building jumpers flying past the windows, what is there not to love about this place?

MIhTeH9O2cnMbY38Am1P_g.text: Nice view and delicious foods. You can see all of Vegas. But I feel like throw up whenever they moves little by little after I had alcohol. I know all the foods looked more delicious with dark lights but this restaurant is way tooo dark  I thought I was invisible

zaoatogW-c9CawLYn48DIA.text: The atmosphere is absolutely amazing! The food on the other hand not so much.. We try the four course tasting menu for 90 bucks and we did the wine pairing for an extra 30. 1.Salad was ok 2. Scallops favored really well. 3. Salmon I did not care for it. The pea guacamole was a little lumpy I like it a little smoother. 4. Mini dessert duo (DE creme and mixed berries) ok..... He had the  1. Lobster Bisque 2. Scallops 3. Center cut steak (loved it) 4. Mini dessert duo.  Not sure if it was just us but he felt a little woozy once the room stopped rotating (after midnight i think) so we didn't go to the lounge. Went downstairs to play a little.  And once we got in the cab both of us felt very dizzy. Really weird because I never get motion sickness.  If they change the menu/ chef I would love to try it again but if not I'll pass.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uZTMRMpeCxbdkKJztgeKIQ.text: A must visit when in Vegas. Not just because of the views or the rotating restaurant that gives you the panoramic views of the valley, but the food is actually magnificent. The Chef and his team have done a remarkable job delivering quality and flavor for great value. You won't be disappointed.

8-BOwClVSMg6o3-MxvU8Sg.text: I love this place. We connected with the chef de cuisine and he made our visit the most memorable dining experience ever. 3 courses and dessert. Plus with the view you can't complain and you'll randomly see bungee jumpers heading down.  For starters they brought out some bread with these awesome infused butters. First plate I had sea scallops omg they were to die for. Then the chef brought out pork belly with Chimchurri. Perfect combinations of flavor with every dish. On to my main course I had skirt steak and it was bombbbbbb af!   Lastly for dessert we had the triple chocolate cake. It was so rich and moist!  I will definitely be coming back here again because everything was so good and the chef was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12oz. Grass Fed Australian Wagyu Skirt Steak with Asian Chimichurri #vscocam
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chefs tasting menu | scallops| Farro butternut squash | béarnaise sauce |
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Kurobuta Pork Belly | Chimichurri &amp; Orange Gastrique |

r2V4ivklpG3HNSfEwm1CKg.text: Yes, the metal detector before the ride up was a little weird, but whatever, they do it as a precautionary measure since 9/11 because the stratosphere is one of the tallest buildings in Vegas (I asked).   ***the floor rotates 360 degrees in an hour, VERY slowly, if you're complaining about sea sickness and dizziness you've got a lot more issues than you think, I'd start with visiting a psychiatrist first. The view is spectacular and the jumpers really don't detract from dinner like all these other people have said, it's actually kinda cool to watch then fly by and the place rotates so it's not like they're in your way during dinner the ENTIRE time.  Moving on...  Our reservation was for 6:15, we checked in at 6:09 and they gave us a pager, they directed is to the 107 lounge upstairs where we ordered two most delicious dirty martinis, we waited maybe 10 minutes before our pager went off. Nothing ridiculous, it's a nice restaurant you might have to wait a moment, no big deal.  We were seated in the booth, which honestly  wasn't right next to the window but instead of having to turn our heads to enjoy the view we got to sit and look straight out; personally I think that was the best seat in the house.   Karen was our waitress; she was awesome, her recommendations were spot on! She was cheerful and checked on us frequently but not overly frequently, I hate when servers come back every 2 mins when you've got a mouthful. Haha.  What was ordered; Crab cakes, $19 for one  we ordered two and I think it was one of the best crab cakes I've ever had, if not the best!  Ordered lobster bisque soup, Karen kindly offered to split the soup for us, which was really nice, and honestly with a 4-course meal the portion was perfect, not too much, not too little and it tasted PHENOMENAL! It wasn't too salty had a slight almond flavor to it, it was just magnificent. By far the best lobster bisque I've had! Better than Ruth's Chris that's for certain.  My bf ordered the horseradish crusted ribeye...it was yummy, he ordered it MR and it came out a little more on the rare dude (Karen had suggested it cooked Medium before hand, but he didn't complain and still ate it, it was really yummy)  I ordered the filet, it was very tender and at first it was just okay, they had some mushroom sauce over it which personally I think it probably would've tastes better just plain with pepper and butter seasoning like most restaurants do, but as I got more toward the middle it got a lot better. I also had the paired cab with it, and that opened up really nicely.  Our sides: Potatoes au gratin - HEAVENLY! Button Mushrooms - Wow!  Dessert: Strawberries Romanoff- never had anything like it before but it was light and refreshing, perfect for after a heavy meal, absolutely delectable! It was my Bf's birthday so they brought him out a cute tiny flourless cake and that was orgasmic!  Coffee, a bit strong tasting to my liking, but my bf said it wasn't too bad, I had the espresso which was yummy and came with a rock candy to stir and sweeten the espresso, very cute.   They also had a photographer there that takes pictures...they're like $45 for two big photos. They came out very nice.   For such a fantastic meal and my BF ordering two beers through dinner as well, the bill only came to $250, and with tip $300 which I would gladly go back and pay again the next time I'm in Vegas. :)

fe2gZ8_M1O90cbJmJ30Lkg.text: wesome chef would run if you wouldn't believe in well with our server he was the best name with mom and let me tell you Tom was the absolute and if you could put an! On the stratosphere in the top of the world restaurant !! The people next to me paid for my meal !!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Went to Top of the World for the fist time visit to Vegas it was my birthday !!

9isNF-Fh1MQawYzSHA7e_Q.text: Came here to celebrate our 4 year anniversary, as I was proposed here 4 years ago on this day at this restaurant. Unfortunately we sit here disappointed. Steak has changed. Less flavor and dry. The carrots that embellished our food were more flavorful then the steak itself. For a $70 22 oz steak I expected so much more. I've had better steak at Outback Steakhouse than what I had here tonight. Unfortunately I think this will be the last time we come here.

mQuLNYedU_itqzYXrG0vtQ.text: Have been here serval to times with different friends. I prefer lunch than dinner since you can see the entire vegas better. Also, lunch price is more reasonable than dinner and less crowed. I like their burger and prefix three courses. Food taste good and service is always good! I will come back here every time with my new friend in town.

4UV0gJqVqs2ElMXowJMNHg.text: What can I say the view was mesmerizing and unforgettable ! I did not expect it to be that incredible. The best part was being able to dine and go 360 all the way around the restaurant at the same time. The food presentation was awesome!! But it wasn't tasteful. We had the seafood alfredo and crab cake and we weren't a big fan. The appetizer raw bar seafood platter was out of this world! Our service was attentive.

eEblXfkeiv39WXcbBwG3XA.text: My wife and I came here for her birthday dinner. I put in the reservation about a week before we had dinner and requested a seat near the window. When we arrived they had us sitting at a table that was not near the window. I asked if we could move and they did accompany us but we had to wait an extra half hour. Fair enough. The view was amazing and our waiter was very nice and attentive, however, the lady helping him was kind of stern and not as friendly. We requested bread with our meal. The salad was brought...but no bread. So we sat and stared at our salad, waiting for bread. Finally they brought bread and apologized for it taking so long. When it was time to bring the dinner plate, we asked for more bread. And we waited...and waited...and waited...and finally ate without bread. Just as we were taking our last few bites, the bread was brought - so we sent it back because dinner was finished by that point. What was kind of crazy is our waiter told us he asked his server (the stern lady) to bring us bread three times, but when she finally brought it, she said she didn't know we wanted bread - so one of them was lying. Anyhow, our server did compensate us by not charging us for our split meal (would have been $15) and gave us an extra dessert. So for that, and the stunning view, we give three stars.

Fn3mgU9TkTn_HkpoqV_bAA.text: Mexican food  Not suitable for Asian who doesn't found Mexican food tasty  The deserts are too sweet

h6T2l0SnZGcl3EiEVj9UAw.text: Lovely staff and restaurant. I accidentally went into the wrong area of the restaurant, we were looking for the bar area and ended up in the main dining section, the staff was not rude about it. I apologized left a small gratuity and they had the decency to bad mouth me behind my back, lol. Finally made it up to the lounge area we were looking for and enjoyed 2 for 1 cocktails and half price appetizers. The service was ok, the food was good, the view is AMAZING. Plus you get to watch people jump of the side of the building so that's cool too. Happy hour is between 4 and 7; if you dine in the restaurant bring some serious $$$ the menu is definitely fine dining.

J2dxmjaWyRc7lM1S4WW6_A.text: We loved our dinner here, we love ambiance and views, so this was the place to go. Love how it rotates so you basically see all of Vegas. The service and food was excellent. We asked an associate to take our picture, told him it was our anniversary and how much we enjoyed it there. At the end of our dinner the waiter stated that the manager would like to buy us two drinks! (the drinks are $17.00), we found out it was Marty, whom we asked to take our picture. Thank you Marty! You made our night extra special and he took the best picture of us! We also loved the observation deck, we were higher than the helicopters! We also visited the lounge 107, which we thought was a club, it was nice, but not a club as advertised. A great place to get a drink and admire the views though.

JluOexM0ORH_X567zUEODQ.text: Probably one the best views if not THE best view of Vegas. What is unfortunate is that the food and drinks are extremely sub-par to what places on  and off the strip have to offer. We went here for mother's day and we enjoyed the staff and our present company more than the food.    We ordered a couple of steak dishes and some seafood. The Steak was tough and the seafood was overcooked. Desert was decent and better than the main courses we had.  I do hope that this changes. It's a shame that the view doesn't meet the standard that the rest of the strip emphasizes.   Should anyone go, go for drinks and the view. You will enjoy the hospitality that everyone that works there exudes. Just plan on going elsewhere to eat.

9BEiy9qCfo0jLTACTvczEw.text: service 10/10 views are the best in Vegas especially at night with all the lights the mango sangria is the best! I got the rack of lamb and Caesar salad and potato to share big portions for the price plus free dessert for going in on our 10 yr anniversary. Perfect place for a dinner date. Only thing I will complain about is it's far too warm they should fix the air conditioning. But will definitely go ago and I recommend to everyone to check this place out

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rack of lamb
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I got the rack of lamb and free dessert for our 10 yr anniversary

ggVVOiQAH87BNOow0KQT-A.text: This was the best dinner we've ever had with the most beautiful breathtaking view!!! I am afraid of heights but was 100% fine with enjoying dinner as high in the sky as the helicopters while rotating at an extremely slow almost not noticeable speed (takes an hour and 20 minutes to make a complete turn). It was truly an amazing experience, one we will always do when we visit Las Vegas!!! Be sure you make reservations! The food was superb we had the filet mignon and the twice baked potato and I had the mozzarella tomato watermelon salad which was delicious and for dessert we had the chocolate teardrop cake which was out of this world!!! I can't wait to go back. For the two of us it was $202 plus tip ($252) Well worth every penny!! Dress code is business casual but we did see a few very casual customers.
