Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of Las Vegas

zYWe4QTm4XX7hdmmwWepRA.text: I can't lie, I was very skeptical about dinner at the top of the Stratosphere because I felt it was surely a tourist trap with large prices but food that was so-so. Boy was I wrong!  We made reservations online through Open Table and my husband called earlier the day of our reservation to request a table by the window. It is a good idea to call as we were told that we got the last open window view table.   Our waitress was very friendly and did not rush us at all when ordering. The food did come out fast, which is great, but take your time ordering if you plan to enjoy the sunset like we did.   I ordered the salmon and it was great, my husband ordered the shellfish meal and most of the meal was great but the scallops were a little chewy.  Overall I'd definitely suggest the restaurant if you are looking for a nice, classy meal with amazing views!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9eZIE0CO6j2Nx9TV9Hcr6Q.text: Rotating restaurant on top of the Tower at the Stratosphere offers diners a nice view of Vegas on a clear day. Because it's located a bit off from the main part of the Strip, not many people seem to drive here for a meal, but this restaurant is well deserving of it's stellar reviews.   Highly recommend the 3 courses prix fixe menu for $45, available at lunch until around 3:30pm. The lobster bisque is tasty, as well as the soup of the day, which was a vegetable corn soup with fennel. For my entree of surf and turf, I chose the Canadian lobster for the seafood. I absolutely loved the succulent lobster. The steak was tender too. The dessert duo was not as impressive. I think you might be able to upgrade to a different dessert for a small upgrade fee.   Overall, it was a memorable lunch, and you get to go to the observation level both indoor and outdoor before or after your meal. So you save around $20 on the observation fee on the Tower. It was also enjoyable to watch people go on the adventurous rides they have. Highly recommended! We will be coming back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roaring restaurant provides panoramic views
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prix fixe dessert duo is alright.

zVZKll_zt_-VacFvYZlF0Q.text: Views are amazing, food is overpriced, service was slow even though restaurant was half-empty when we got there. Quality of food was good, but not superb. I would maybe visit again because of the views and experience, but considering how amazing culinary options are in Vegas, Top of the World should think about raising the bar (or lowering their prices!) - good views are not everything.

ERMTqcRTZJR8yFuCOKgbsw.text: Let's start by saying that you indeed do feel at the top of the world when dining here. To start off, we made a reservation a day before at 8pm and the lady insisted on arriving 30 minutes earlier. That was a great tip because we made it just in time for our reservation. Not to mention, our window seating request was satisfied with no complications. The elevator staff are very welcoming. Our server was from Mexico City; very pleasant to be able to speak in both languages and have some connection with him. The service we received from him was extremely friendly. He always made sure our drinks were never empty and always checked up on us in a timely manner.   The food was phenomenal. They start you off with different types of breads with a side of 3 different types of butters. The bread was warm and it was great having different butter options. I'm a big steak fan so I ordered the 9oz filet mignon medium-well along with a side of their mashed potatoes. My dad ordered the 22oz. Kansas City Bone-In Strip. My sister had the chef special, Organic Half Chicken. VERY juicy meat and cooked to its best.   The view is breath taking. A full 360 view of Las Vegas while enjoying your dinner. The rotation isn't as bad as I thought; I thought I would've been dizzy while eating. After dinner, you can always walk upstairs and experience the view behind a mini fence. Overall a great experience and I'm glad I chose this place for my Dad's birthday.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The 22oz Kansas City Bone-In Strip!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 9oz Filet Mignon with the mashed potatoes.

g5IMLH8G4MydGROcXTEseg.text: You are paying for the experience, and everyone should experience it once. The 360 degree views sold us on this restaurant. The views are unparalleled and truly a sight to behold. The bungee jumpers from atop the building are a surprising and fun addition. The service was good. The food was mediocre and not worth the price. The dessert was the best part of the meal. Everyone should experience it once, if you go back for a second trip then you must really love the view. The restaurant moves so slowly that you will not get dizzy or sick. The top floor observation deck where the amusement rides are located is included for dining guests. Visit the top on your way out.

SUiKSK53g4w0vapfcMyYiw.text: My first time here was with my bf 8 years ago, whom is now my fiance as he proposed to me on Top of the World after dinner!  We went here 8 years ago when we first went to Vegas together. We had dinner when the sun was about to set and it was so romantic. The upstairs of the restaurants spins at a 360 degree angle, but you could barely tell. So at night is the best view you can get, especially if you're by the window. You can see the whole strip. So pretty, especially with all of the lights   Our most recent trip was a couple years ago and I couldn't get over how great our meal was. He had scallops and I had steak and we shared the seafood tower as an appetizer. Everything was amazingly prepared.  The only thing I brought up was that the butter they provided was in the shape of the stratosphere and now they don't offer it like that??  It's also a pretty cool view to see people jumping off of the top of the stratosphere when they're bungee jumping while enjoying your dinner lol.  I'm sure we will be back here as it is a special place in our hearts since it was our first romantic dinner in Vegas and where we decided to spend forever together when he proposed. It's definitely a place for a romantic date night with your significant other and if you wanna impress them with that view!

Qu46J5uPIAA2ut-VnwtxOA.text: I've been here twice for dinner, but that was at least eight years ago. I'm happy to say that during my most recent visit last month, I was still wow-ed by the food!  We came with family for a weekend lunch and I was pleased with the lunch and brunch selections. Also, the full menu was available all day!  Their bread basket was delicious and we loved the flavored butters, especially the herb one.   Short Rib Benedict ($28): Poached eggs, short rib, crab, hollandaise, potato cake, and seasonal vegetables. Everything about this benedict was amazing! The potato cakes were creamy and delicious, the short rib was insanely tender, great crab, tasty hollandaise with the right consistency, and the soft poached eggs were absolute perfection. The roasted vegetables were pretty great, too.  East Coast Lobster Tail BLT ($30): Lobster, applewood smoked bacon, yellow tomato, lemon aioli, avocado, and arugula on multigrain toast. An awesome sandwich with a generous serving of lobster tail. I loved the additional twist of yellow tomato and arugula, plus, avocado is great everywhere. The BLT was accompanied by a delicious simply-dressed salad and lattice potato chips.  Seafood Platter ($56): Prawns with Top of the World cocktail sauce, ahi poke cones, yellowtail crudo, lobster cocktail, and crab salad. This platter is insane and so awesome!! It is loaded with seafood goodies. As is no surprise, EVERYTHING was delicious. It doesn't matter what else you order, but you need this platter in your life.  Bananas Foster in a Florentine Box ($10): Artisanal vanilla ice cream, foster sauce with Myers' rum and fresh banana, served in a caramel almond box. Um, yes. I love Bananas Foster and this is a great version of it. The box makes it even better. The box is delicious.  Great food, great service, and amazing views of the whole valley (if you didn't already know, the restaurant rotates 360 degrees in 80 minutes). What else do you need?

yE_dsslGm1TPgh6zf63vWg.text: I am kinda sad to give this place 3 stars, but I have to be honest with myself. The food was average, at best. Granted, I did not get steak and lobster (maybe that is where I went wrong), but I still had high expectations for my dish.   As many have said prior, it is a great experience. The view of Vegas, the night lights, and the sky jumpers is a delight. But, you may be better off just paying to either go the sky lounge/bar or the observation deck to get the views but save some money.   My cousin made reservations here for her birthday, and despite taking a look at the menu and seeing the prices, I was intrigued. I was for sure certain that for the prices I saw on the menu, the food was going to be great. But, somewhere, the food fell flat. For starters, I ordered the lobster bisque. My indifference of the soup was more a preference. It was a bit more tangy and tomato based than I prefer, but it was decent. For my entree, I ordered the salmon dish, which is one of my favorite dishes to eat when I am out. The salmon was served on top of a lobster rice. The lobster rice was very good! My cousin complained that she did not get any lobster in her rice, but I had several pieces in my dish. Honestly, the rice saved the salmon. At first bite, the salmon tasted good, but as I got closer to the center I realized it wasn't seasoned well and something was missing. I also prefer a little crisp on the surface of my salmon and this piece was very soft. Though I didn't hate my food, I was not excited about it either. And, though I started to regret getting another dish I was eyeing, I am slightly glad I chose the salmon because I don't exactly feel like I wasted money. Had I chosen a $70 dish, I may have been more disappointed.   The service overall was great. I appreciated the attentiveness of our server. There is also a photographer that comes around and takes your picture, of course there is fee, but it's typical for any major attraction. By the way, what do they do with those pictures that people do not buy? I always wondered that.   This is a nice place for a special night or celebration, but honestly, there are a ton of high-quality restaurants in Vegas that I think will be enjoyed much more. But, if you are solely concerned about the experience, go for it. But, please expect average/slightly above average food for well above average prices.

MrZyF90_HjXjGANorDp8Iw.text: DISAPPOINTING!   There are 3 different components here: The view/experience The food The service.  Remember, you are paying for the view/experience. The food, alas, is not the draw. It's okay. It is not worth the price. When you're paying $100 or more for dinner it should be really good. It is not.  This is a once-a-year excursion for my friend and I, and we go for the sunset. That's the view/experience part. Always excellent.   Once we were seated, it took the waiter about 5 minutes to come to our table to greet us and hand us menus. He told us the night's specials which were numerous and varied. Too much to remember. Another 5 minutes passed when I caught his eye and pointed to the empty water glasses -- he came right over and filled them. A very nice man, but let me just say the service is leisurely. Of course, you are not in a rush since it makes one revolution every hour (it does not spin!) and you want to see it all. But still ...  The menu had changed since our last visit, so it took us a few minutes to decide. Our waiter told us the rack of lamb was only two small chops. Really? Not worth the price. Oh, did I mention then have a new chef. He's made changes. And not for the better.  So, after we had ordered, the assistant brought us the bread basket. It had been sitting in view for the entire time and usually in a restaurant they bring the bread so you have something to munch while perusing the menu. Anyway, it arrived with two dinner rolls right out of a package from the market, two pretzel bread somethings and the now obligatory parmesan seeded cracker bread. All cold. And a little teeny-tiny pat of butter.   I ordered the Caesar salad with anchovies. "No anchovies," the waiter told us. That's disappointing! If I were at Denney's I would not expect anchovies, but this is a "gourmet" restaurant. No excuse. When the salad arrived, there was no ground pepper offered (there were little salt and pepper grinders on the table). I know it's an affectation when the waiter carries a two foot long pepper grinder, but that's part of the fun of going out somewhere swank, isn't it? So I ground my own pepper. First bite. What?? This isn't Caesar dressing. It looked like it, but it tasted more like oil and vinegar. When the waiter came by to see how everything was, I asked about the dressing. He assured me it was a real Caesar dressing with anchovy paste, etc. I KNOW what a Caesar dressing should taste like. For years it was my specialty when we entertained. I made it from scratch. This was not it. He offered to remove it and take it off the bill. I said, "yes, please do that." Again, disappointing.  Both of us had steak and I have to say my grass fed ribeye was tender and delicious. No quarrel there. EXCEPT. It was simply a hunk of meat plunked in the middle of a large white plate. On a presentation scale of 1-10, I give it a Zero. I mean, how much time and money would it take to pipe a bit of mashed potatoes around the meat, or put a pretty little garnish at one edge? Nope. Nothing. This chef is out to save money any way he can. But you're there for the experience, right?  My friend had the filet mignon and enjoyed it. We shared the asparagus and green beans, which were very well prepared. We also shared the 21 layer chocolate cake which was very good and way too much for two people, but of course we brought it home. The coffee, when it came, was warm, not hot, but refills were generously offered and we were invited to linger and enjoy the evening.   In summary, I am very disappointed in this new "chef." I hope the Strat finds someone with a little more savvy who can actually put out a meal worthy of a gourmet restaurant with attention to detail.   So, go for the view and the experience, be prepared to shell out the big bucks and don't sweat the small stuff.

D7XuAvcafxRMSyI7wGakaQ.text: My husband and I went for our 10th anniversary I made reservations in early October and I was told that I had to prepay $126.52 per person prior to getting there and to keep the reservation.  Once we were seated we asked the server, Joel to verify that we were getting a prepaid menu and let him know that we had paid already.  He explained that anything over and above what we had paid we would need to pay for we understood we ordered two glasses of Pinot Noir and when we received our bill it was $70!!!! Our waiter Joel explain to us that the price had gone up since we had prepaid for our meal and therefore that is the reason why it was $119 per person plus tax and gratuity and not $126 per person plus tax tip and gratuity. If we did not say anything we would have been charged the extra $40 per person and would have paid $70 more over and above what we had expected to pay. I'm not sure what most people call this but this is purely an ethical to have someone prepay for a meal and then the meal go up and then not let them know ahead of time that the meal price has changed and that they would pay a different price ahead of time. However they tried to get away with it and it wasn't until I had become almost belligerent that they changed the price to what I agreed to pay for two and months ago. If you're reading this please do not make reservations with Stratosphere, they are predators and you should not patronize them.

Z8QwuyKhD1m4fin0RD62zg.text: The view in Vegas is absolutely second to none. The dining room slowly rotates the guests view of the fabulous Las Vegas Strip. The lights from the whole valley with a vibe hats both electric yet calming, making it ideal for romantic engagements or business dinners. The staff is both knowledgeable of the menu as well as food and beverage trends and hospitality. However, the food here is UNBELIEVABLE. Truly an experience that is so mouth watering it makes the view and the staff together just worthy enough to prepare and serve. I have enjoyed a large portion of the menu and I must say the menu is evocative of exotic flavors without taking away from the quality and natural flavors of menu item in question. Bravo. I will be back again and again. Chef Johnny Church is the real deal and his latest menu is just another example of his genius. It was truly an unforgettable experience and birthday.

SrbDZ1W9wc83Ic1EMoWt_A.text: I came here on a Friday night for dinner for 2. I made our reservation based on the location and ambiance, obviously, and the raving food reviews. Honestly, I was a little disappointed. Boyfriend and I started with a wedge salad and lobster bisque and something about both of them was... Off. The wedge salad dressing wasn't bleu cheese so it just wasn't what we are used to. It wasn't terrible. Neither was the lobster bisque. I wish there were actually some meat in it! It was extremely rich and tasted more like cream than anything. I had the New York strip steak cooked medium and Scott had the lobster Thermidor. Both pretty good but just not THAT impressive. However the side of potato puree with Gruyere was sinfully delicious, along with the bread basket and different butters at the beginning. Those were almost worth the whole thing! The wine list was impressive.   The service was amazing! Fast, personable, and professional. I enjoyed overall but would not return. Take a trip to the observation deck after dinner for an awesome view and rides.

oqUtioTCfHWvpQ7RfVqNoA.text: The space needle in Seattle and equinox in San Francisco have nothing on this place . The best of the best view . Travel tip - Go to the top for free after you eat .The food is very good here.

ifWuklq7n7trcJzeOVS1nw.text: I had high hopes for this place... But believe me when I tell you that the only thing you are paying for is the view and some half ass made food.

zNwm-L4BRyBRISHIswRXUw.text: The view is breathtaking, and will cloak your experience in awe.  Come at night and the place is dimly lit to highlight the miles and miles of lights below.  Service is well done and unobtrusive.  When we were there we enjoyed the Prix Fixe meal for $150/2 ppl which included appetizer, salad/soup, entree, and a kitchy chocolate dessert that modeled the tower itself.  We also shared a half bottle of wine so the bill came to slightly over $220.  Food is secondary to the rest of the experience, but it was pretty well done and sufficient for me not to complain.  We had a kobe beef and lentil leek appetizer, lobster bisque or the house salad, sole burre blanc with haricot verts, and the chocolate dessert mentioned above.  All of it was tasty, but a little heavy (in terms of portions and butter) and didn't suit me well for the prolonged evening after.    Two thumbs up, overall.

7tBbx4LGWNjOv-RaMXlRuw.text: The food is here is good but not excellent but still worth the price, assuming you remember that you're in Vegas and that everything is at least somewhat overpriced.  The view is amazing of course and it just makes for a real fun experience.  For starters we sampled the cheese / fruit plate and I had a shrimp cocktail.  Both were pretty good.  For entrees, my date had the lobster ravioli and I had the surf and turf, a 10z fillet with a 8oz lobster tail.  Everything was delicious and we were both very satisfied.  The service was good and attentive.  The only real detractor in the evening was a manifestation of the "compelled photography" experience that is becoming increasingly prevalent in Vegas.  Any time you do something even remotely touristy in Vegas, they want to force you to stand or sit somewhere and get your picture taken, so that later on someone in your group will see the picture up on a screen, have a very emotional reaction to it and insist that you buy it, usually for no less than 15 dollars.  Well, this has found its way unfortunately even into this restaurant.  The photographer was an older lady who bordered on being crass.  We agreed to let her take the photographs and she does shots of each of us individually - including some very contrived poses - and then a couple of shots together.  Then she comes back a while later and gives you the sales pitch, like trying to convince you to pick five (!!!) different photos and get them all in some fancy book.  Lady, this isn't my high school or college graduation and it's not my wedding.  I'm not going to pass this down as a fairly heirloom, so relax.  One of the photos did come out VERY nice and so I bought it, but the whole experience took way too long, felt too forced and in general broke up the last part of the meal too much.  They need someone who can get in there, take just a couple of photos nice and fast and be charming enough to not make it feel like an ordeal.  And maybe do the sales pitch after I've left the dinner table.  The idea isn't terrible, it just needs better execution.  It didn't even really detract from the evening that much, you just kind of get out of it and go, "Wow, really?"  This place was an enjoyable experience but to be honest, once is enough.  There are enough other places on The Strip with great food that I won't be compelled to return here.  But if you've never done it before, it's fun and worth checking out.

usbUJihekfoOm0D6rAqHFg.text: Two words: The view!  And it spins!  Came here for dinner and was seated at a table towards the center of the restaurant, so not too close to the window, which I guess didn't really matter because you can see the view from just about anywhere in the restaurant.  Food was great and dessert presentation was beautiful.

JdMqB97fKgtuXqdaHkyL3Q.text: This restaurant is located at the top of the Stratosphere tower, which is about 1,150 feet high (almost four football fields).  It's worth coming here for the view alone - seeing the Strip at night from such a height is a breathtaking experience.  The base of the restaurant gently rotates so your view is constantly changing.  It's not noticeable and is a really nice touch to get a view of the entire valley.    The food is very good as well, and the service was attentive and courteous.  It's quite an expensive meal, especially at dinner, but you're paying for the overall experience.  The restaurant also has a photographer that goes around and offers to take pictures, which makes for a nice keepsake.

mUFd5qWiD9vFSBA8CHkDhg.text: This is a restaurant everyone has to visit when they come to Vegas. The views (rotating restaurant) are incredible and you often find yourself just staring outside mesmerized. The service goes way beyond what i was expecting. The food is amazing as are the portions.   The whole experience from the elevator ride up til when you leave and have the option to go out on the deck for a better view is superb!  I recommend it to everyone.

olrazhmA_PML-g0foI8oJw.text: Bleh....came here for lunch based on the recommendation of bf's mom. Yes, it's nice to see all of Vegas, and it's a cool idea if you've never been to a revolving restaurant before. BUT...if you're only gonna be in vegas for a few days, eating here can be a very time consuming experience, considering that it takes a while to get there if you're staying on the strip and you then have to get to the top of the stratosphere. the day we went, the elevator either wasn't working or was just being hella slow, bc there was def. about 40 mins between arriving at the stratosphere and finally being seated!   We had a 1:30 reservation, and were suprised at how few people there were eating there. It's a huge dining room, but I would say there were only about 30 others. Considering that, our service should have been awesome, right? Well, actually, it SUCKED. big time. Our server was a complete snobby beezatch, after we placed our order and had been awkwardly awaiting our food for about 45 mins she came by and casually noted that "your dishes will be out soon." Maybe they ran out of ingredients and had to leave the Stratosphere, go to the grocery store, then come back and fix our meal? That's really the only reason it should have taken that long to get our food, esp. considering it wasn't even crowded!  That being said, our food was actually delicious and well worth the price. I had some sort of veal medallions with a big hunk of mozzarella stuffed w/ greens on top; BF had the perfectly velvety lobster bisque and a humongous ribeye, absolutely divine, but the accompanying potatoes sucked. Also, the menu was a lot smaller than I expected, and there seemed to be things on the website that weren't even on the lunch menu when we got there. Overall, I might go back if I had nothing else to do and was w/ somebody who'd never been that before, but other than that, it's just not worth the trouble.

qYhEY1W2LWq_DF68ntq4-Q.text: Quite honestly some of the worst food I've ever had. The service was poor and the entire menu is over-priced. The view is worth checking out, but don't bother with the menu.

33uPJGBg-KiNLphlMEL1iQ.text: This place was amazing!  Great food, great service, great view, and a great atmosphere with a fantastic ambience.  The staff was friendly, our waiter was super kind, and my New York Strip steak was grilled to perfection and my mashed potatoes were quite delectable.  This place is top notch and for a high end restaurant the prices are very competitive, especially for Las Vegas.  I'd recommend this place to anyone and can't wait to eat there again myself!  Bon Appetite!

aToBcwuW739cGUwsofzlqA.text: Grossly overpriced, small portions of terribly prepared food.  I've had better fast food.  The only reason it gets 2 stars instead of one is for the view.  Let me give you a hint as a local... if you want to see the view without the pricey elevator ride and long wait, book a reservation here, take the private elevator up for free, and just don't go to the restaurant.  Take the stairs up top or another elevator up one floor and VOILA free view at the top of the stratosphere!

kjUB6TOzK_Qn9Z9rOELXXw.text: What a painful experience.  Someone else chose the restaurant.  I knew it was going to be a bad idea with the $$$$ prices, gimmicky location of the restaurant.  Place sets itself up to be all snazzy.  Fancy view, dimmed lights, elegance and all that jazz.  Prices seem to match.  Short version of the review:  Save your money, find a restaurant for a few notches down you won't notice the difference.  If you don't mind the costs, try a Buffet on the trip, it'll cost you less, give you more variety and the quality will be on par or perhaps better.  So please be aware, I'm more harsh in this review, because if I'm gonna pay more, I'm going to expect everything to be proportional to the prices.  Food:  It wasn't bad.  But nothing special.  Got a Mediterranean seabass filet.  Tasted fine.  Not great, just fine.  I'd happily pay 10 for it.  Grudgingly 15 for it.  Unfortunately it cost me 44.  Found a bone in my first bite.   Flavor was fine, but nothing amazing.  Serving size was good.  Unless you get the 88 dollar 4 course meal, you have to order everything a la carte.  10 dollar sides.  Seeing as my group was made up of 3 chinese people, we opted out of trying their 10 dollar Baby Bok Choy or the Shitake and white mushroom with garlic sides (same price).  Tried the cream spinach and potatoes gratin.  They weren't bad, but we didn't bother finishing either side.  Someone else got the first, and the last person got the Pork tenderloin (wrapped in bacon).  Not bad.  My friend liked his fish more, pork was a bit dry for him.  I liked the heartiness, hit the spot better than the fish.  Food:  3/5 (Taste 4/5)  (Price 2/5)  The experience:  This one is hard... people at the front desk seemed nice enough.  The waitress that help refill our drinks and clean up was very friendly.  Unfortunately the waiter left a bad taste in my mouth.  He seemed like he was having a bad day.  Not sure if it was because of our party --- seems we weren't high class enough for his fancy restaurant with a 50 dollar minimum per person.  Didn't know upstanding high end restaurants had to twist people's arms to buy their food.  He began by recommending the 4 course menu, because it was a better deal -- everything else was a la carte aka overpriced and not worth it.  Unfortunately we weren't too keen on spending 88 dollars per person.  So we opted to have one person try it and share some of the extra, since 4 courses was quite a bit of food and gave a good general glimpse of the restaurant's food.  Of course when we went to order, the waiter decided to tell us now that the 4 course menu is only recommended when everyone orders 4 courses.  Because I guess my frugal group's decision to not pay 15 dollars for soup/appetizers, would mean that as I receive my first 2 courses they would have to sit by and watch me eat because the chef would not be happy serving their food till I was on my main course as well.  He seems pretty bothered by this as he was explaining it to me.  I assume he was hoping we'd spend more, cause his tip on the minimum 50 dollars per person, was not worth his time to talk to us.  So on that new information I changed my order, got the fish and 2 sides for my party.  As I ordered the side of spinach, pointing to it on the menu, a very strange dialogue came up.  He started explaining to me that the spinach that came with my fish was not the creamed spinach but just some sauteed spinach.  He was obviously annoyed that I could not process the complexity of his simple a la carte menu.  I didn't even know that the fish came with anything else.  I assumed a la carte meant... by itself... without anything else.  Guess I was wrong, maybe i shouldn't have ordered the extra spinach.  But since I wanted to make sure i hit that 50 dollar minimum, and had wanted to try it.  I kindly pointed to the bottom of the menu again... under the part that read SIDES.  Next to the nice $10 price.  And repeated that I wanted a side of creamed spinach and the potato gratin to share with my party.  I guess that annoyed me more than i remember it being, bad taste in my mouth.  On a side note, my waiter reminded me of Hugo Weaving  (Agent Smith from Matrix or Elrond from LOTR).  He had that frown down cold!  Yeah, service: 3.5/5  Nothing was especially great, in general it'd be a 4.  That waiter dropped it to a 3.5  I'd drop it more cause of him, but he may have been a random lemon.  The view?  Eh.  The only reason you'd come to the restaurant is if you stay at Strat.  If you stay at strat, you get free tickets to the observation deck.  You get a better view there.  Food: 3/5 Service 3.5/5 Price: Not worth it. View: Nothing you can't find elsewhere in vegas.  Sorry this was long.  Just know what you're getting into.

9OytoZ76RAuMNLCsZkL_6w.text: No other place takes the cake other than TOP OF THE WORLD  This is what makes Sin City what it is all about.  Good thing our reservations were for dinner time, because the city isn't much of a sight to see without all the neon lights of the night.  The view is spectacular.  And the floor revolves.  You don't feel it, but if you look closely enough, you can see it.  Nothing like the "mood" lighting and the white tablecloth on the table.  It was well-worth it.    They have a number next to each item on the menu.  Common sense would say that it is the price.  Everything is a la carte.  The food is cuisine-like.  Don't expect to get full...unless you're prepared to pay.  But for my honey and I, it really was so well-worth it.    I would definately come back here for special occassions and with my other half, but not too often.  This place is so special and visually-stunning, that I'd hate to keep coming back only to evetually feel just like any mediocre place.  But to Top of the World Restaurant....I definately give my hats off to you.

eHwbUCibV0Hl20mfLGK0cg.text: I do believe this is one of the tallest buildings in the United States, if it qualifies as a building.   I guess it does as there is a restaurant at the top.    Met a friend in Las Vegas and we had lunch here.   What was funny was that when walking in my friend asked "Are you supposed to be wearing a jacket to go in here"?   Answer to that is "Oh course not, this is Las Vegas".  I think we were wearing shorts and T-Shirts.    The food wasn't anything outstanding to justify the price.  They say (a commercial says) "What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas."   What happened here is my $50 for a lunch for two stayed in Vegas.    The view is great, you can see all of Las Vegas and a lotta lotta desert and mountains off in the distance.   And I am not surprised that some people get dizzy even as slow as the restaurant rotates.   We didn't get dizzy but it was nice to get back to the ground, even $50 lighter.  If anything, eating here made me totally miss what was one of my favorite restaurants ever, Windows on the World that was at the top of the World Trade Center.  Now that was a nice one and totally worth the price.

QRLDd8XD6X7fAmAYdHQ1LQ.text: One of the best places I've ever gone to share a memory with the person I love, while having some of the best food I've had to enjoy. The view, the staff, the service and the food are always amazing

zUYAxyG4-w54uvUAOrGeiQ.text: I have been coming to this restaurant for over 6 years every time I come to Vegas which is quite often and the food USED TO BE amazing but not anymore. After they changed the chef about a year and a half ago the quality of food and presentation has been going down the drain. This last visit has done it for me and I wish I took pictures of the dishes because the words just won't describe it. We started with the lobster bisque which was too brown and had caramelized sugar taste to it. It used to be by far my favorite soup but this time I could not finish it because of the strange tart aftertaste after each spoon...it tasted overcooked and too sweet. I had the scallops and shrimp and my husband had the lamb chops. The scallops came with the couscous that had raisins in it giving it a sweet taste and the scallops came grilled or fried with butter sauce and oversalted. The scallops and couscous did not go together well at all and the way it was presented was underwhelming as well. The scallops were laid out around the what seemed to have been just a pile of couscous. I did not finish it either ..weird combination of sweet raisins in the couscous and salty buttery shrimp did nothing for me. I would expect this in the restaurant by the road at a $15 dollar price not $44 in a supposedly world class restaurant. My husband's lamb chops came with the same couscous and a pile of green beans (and I mean a pile) ...the presentation was non-existent. He ordered them medium rare and they came out dry, with too much paprika and too much salt, usually the signs of disguising the low quality meat.   We have paid over $150 for what we felt was worth $50 tops. The service was good no complaints there but whole experience ruined by mediocre food.  We will not be going back for the food. The view  is amazing but save your money on the food and go have an amazing dinner at Paris - Eiffel Tower   or La Cirque at Bellagio both have amazing views and amazing food and service.

AmcS_sqnP-RE9a-YPxhDjQ.text: Love, love, love.  The views are breathtaking and the 360 rotation let's you see the whole Las Vegas Valley.  We went before sunset so we could see the colors change.  Absolutely spectacular!  Our server and waitstaff were impeccable, offering suggestions, refilling drinks quickly and without having to be asked, and making sure we thoroughly enjoyed our experience.  The food was delicious (I actually was able to cut my steak with my fork) and the portions were generous.  Wonderful spot for a romantic dinner, special occasion or impressive business meal.  Can't wait to go back.

n9JJtpuP9jgKBAXL3sLCpA.text: For the price of the food your paying for, it could have been better.  We felt that everything we ordered was very salty.  I ordered a steak, and at a price like this it should have came out with the plate almost on fire along with the steak, but it was barely hot.  I guess you pay for the view tho, amazing view at night, rotating floor 360 degrees.

mDEf2_fkVRC7dPtxSHv5Fw.text: celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary there-BIG mistake-the view was really the only good part.  Food was fair, prices outrageous, and overall, a very uneventful experience.  Told the manager, who offered to buy us a drink at the lounge-no thanks-couldn't wait to leave.

JsUqK2VHG0XlqpAsIQd0MQ.text: Beautiful view, excellent service, delicious food. This is one of the best restaurants that we went to while in Las Vegas.

-u09daKZBM9GrT471YbhNA.text: The view is of course amazing and that's what you more than likely came for. The food (that we had) was not the best but not bad. The lobster bisque though, was literally the best I've have ever had! Love love love the cognac flavor in it!

V1idg54L9IpuO1MYS8cojQ.text: If you are looking to make memories with a special person in your life while in Vegas, go here. Going here with my boyfriend for our anniversary, not only was it romantic, but one of the best experiences we have had at a restaurant ever - and when everything, from the ambiance, to the food, to the service, rings wonderful - then you are guaranteed a beautiful, euphoric feeling inside. It ended up being one of our most favorite memories on any trip thus far. We came by around 4:30 to catch the sunset, so we could get the best of both views - very good idea, if you are going for dinner. The manager greeted us and came by several times throughout our dinner, and our waitress was a complete darling. She was very helpful since I am vegetarian and she is vegan, so we clicked quickly. Despite the menu having only one vegetarian entree, it was great to just see a nice plate of veggies when all the other well-to-do places try to do pasta/gnochhi as vegetarian fare. I also got the market greens salad which was so delicious. My boyfriend had the tomato/mushroom/buffalo mozzarella dish which he loved to death, along with his pork dish that had some buttery yams on it. We got a side of potatoes au gratin but I do not recommend this because the side vegetables are at least $10 and the portion is *small*. For dessert, we did the trio. I actually think this is my only slight regret because for 8 dollars, you get very tiny desserts. It's nice if you want a light touch at the end, but for two people I don't think the portions were enough - especially for someone like me who loves dessert above all other courses! However, what we did get was very delicious. It was fun to dip the cheesecake lollipop into the different toppings, and I adored the banana bread pudding! During the meal, a woman comes around and takes several souvenir pictures. We had two taken together, and then of just us, separately. These pictures were stunning, with the strip in the background/distance, and despite being overpriced, my boyfriend and I got a few. Two big pictures came in a nice album which on front says "Top of the World" with a Stratosphere, and you can also get tiny wallet-sized versions which are slightly cheaper. We ate leisurely and enjoyed ourselves, and finally left, happy and full. You are able to go up to the observation deck or the lounge afterwards to extend your time, which we did. What really solidified TOTW as a wonderful place for us was that after hitting ground again, I had suddenly remembered a Restaurant.com giftcard for $25 that we had meant to use, but forgot! My boyfriend called and explained this to the manager, who invited us to come right back up so he could apply the discount. As soon as we were back up there, he immediately helped us, completely friendly and understanding. I cannot tell you how happy this made us, and just made our experience that much better. It's the best to find a place that makes you feel good, that gives you happiness and good service, and all of that can be found here. Do yourself a favor and splurge - that money would've just found itself in a slot machine anyhow, right? It was really worth it, to sit up in the sky, high above such a beautiful, usually busy city, and see it from a calm perspective. After coming back down from this heavenly view, I definitely felt different, more relaxed, now full of great memories.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert Trio!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Market Greens Salad &amp; Tomato/Buffalo Mozzarella/Mushroom
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the cover of the &#34;photo album&#34; book, for those interested

xLy7F5mW9b4WfpsNbctWbg.text: We returned here on or 7 year anniversary. Food was okay. Not as good as it was 7 years ago. Tastes more commercial than homemade. They are pretty pricey. We had the Salmon and the Steak. The view is still breathtaking. However If you can avoid going through the ghetto hotel do so!

roHfmTQjAMZGosE6_q1rNQ.text: Love the view. Lobster bisque and lobster grilled cheese were both good as was the steak. The dessert trio was the high light very nice presentation. The view and service is what earned top of the world a 4 star rating. Over all a nice lunch, but there are so many better restaurants in Vegas and it's only a few times a year I visit so I'm glad I was able to experience this place, but probably will not be back.

LKR66AESsJINP-ZJB9laog.text: Last Spring, The Lover and I decided to head to Las Vegas in hopes to win millions and retire early. Well, that didn't happen. BUT we did try Top of the World since we were staying at the Stratosphere.   Five Stars - The ambiance, view, and the food we had was excellent. Service was phenomenal. Just what we've expected and we were really glad it measured to our expectations and more.  Location - Staying at The Stratosphere, the restaurant is located above us - exactly 844 feet in the air. And also, according to the review preceding ours, she mentioned that "ghetto-fab, and it is not located in the best part of Vegas." News alert: the whole Vegas strip IS ghetto-fab. Did you happen to look around? I mean, unless you're staying at the Bellagio's Presidential Suite... And, if you do not find the Mexican card clickers on the MAIN strip "ghetto-fab" then I really do not understand your definition of "ghetto-fab." Moving on...   First Impressions - Business casual dress code is always a plus. There is velvet rope and a podium at the bottom of the Stratosphere, where a formally dressed staff member checks reservations, and directs diners into the foyer.  Toward the left, the staff guides the uninitiated to the elevator that delivers them to the upper eschelon that is Top of the World.  A helpful elevator operator warmly greets diners, and tosses out Stratosphere facts, such as that the elevator is traveling at a crisp 20 miles per hour.  In less than 30 seconds and more than 105 floors. You can definitely hear and feel your ears popping. I think the elevator added excitement and mystery to what lied ahead. Definitely well-received.  Food - For starters, we had the Ahi Tuna Tataki and Asian Salad, which was Ahi tuna, seared rare, Wasabi vinaigrette and potato gaufrette drizzled with soy reduction. This was altogether enjoyed by The Lover and I with a basket of warm artisan bread and butter that's exceptionally good. And to cleanse our palettes, I decided to go with a glass of their Pascual Toso Malbec and The Lover had Stella Artois.   Entrees: I put their Turf and Quack with Duo of Sauces to the test. The dish consisted of a Petit filet, seared duck foie gras and Muscovy duck breast, red wine mushroom and brandy peppercorn sauces, and yam puree. The filet melted in your mouth like butter with an explosion of flavors accompanying it at every bite. The foie gras tasted fresh and was cooked to perfection. Each ingredient in that dish complemented each other. On the other hand, The Lover went with the 10oz. USDA Choice Filet with red wine mushroom sauce, served with roasted portobello mushroom. I could tell that the dish was to die for because he did not speak to me until after everything on his plate was finished. It looked great. It smelled fabulous. Chef Giffen did well.  Dessert: The Lover never had creme brulee before this experience, so it was a must. We ordered an assortment of decadent desserts, such as Cheesecake Lollipops served with cookies & cream with vanilla sauce and crushed Oreo, Pistachio Creme Brulee, and the Mini Raspberry Mousse Cup, a handmade chocolate cup filled with raspberry mousse. The Lover doesn't have much of a sweet tooth but he devoured everything along with me. I felt that it was a dessert heaven success.   Final Verdict - The view alone is a must-see; revolving at 360 degrees every 80 minutes, a perfect dinner getaway while you're in Vegas. The food, along with the service, is on-point. Worth every penny.

fIXkz7TrBJr1EiXsgmonAA.text: Amazing and a top of must do list in Vegas! Reserve for a half our before sunset and enjoy the ride... Much better than the High Roller.  The staff accommodated our group of 8 with special birthday requests and beyond. We ordered the tasting menu and it was superb! Seared scallops and Fillet   2 inches thick, medium rare and perfect. Service was spot on and the exterior entertainment was steady.  We will eat here on our next visit.

qu382HTvh7ROq6UkTe1lsg.text: The food is very good and the view is spectacular. The "hospitality" is grossly lacking and because of this I cannot recommend this restaurant. When you pay a certain amount for a meal (there is a "$50/person minimum, $15 split plate charge" for example) you should be able to expect a certain level of service. Not so for "Top of the World" - I was very disappointed. People were ridiculously rude at the security checkpoint, as if we were burdening them for being there (seriously?! This guy's ONE job is to lead people through a metal detector and show them the elevator. It's hardly taxing, dude. Get another job if you don't like this one.) Our waiter was outrageously rude about the restaurant.com gift certificate we had. We sat down and he was fine. We tell him about the GC and his demeanor changed (to attitude and rudeness) IMMEDIATELY. No joke. He actually didn't even want to let us use it because we didn't have it printed out, even though the website specifically stated we didn't need a printout, just the code (we even showed him a screenshot of this exact wording on the site, since we were concerned about not having a printout either, but wanted to take the site's word). He made a loud scene and called his manager over while telling us "he's not going to accept it" either - unbelievable! The manager graciously just took the code down and said it was fine, slipped away, and then unfortunately left us again with our charming server. I got the feeling he was used to dealing with our guy's "personality". After this debacle, the meal went on. But instead of splurging as we had intended though (this was supposed to be a nice family dinner with my husband, mom, and brother), we basically stuck to the order minimum, since we really did not feel like patronizing this place. No overpriced champagne for us! As I said, the view is gorgeous, and the food was good. All tall rotating restaurants are overpriced for the food and drink, but you're paying for that view, of course. If we hadn't had such atrocious "service" I'd maybe recommend this place (as long as you remember what kind of restaurant it is and how that affects the prices); but the Stratosphere is getting run down (walking through the casino and shopping area was pretty deserted and almost creepy feeling), and the whole experience being as it was, I'll have to say you can spend your money at many, many other fine establishments and have a MUCH nicer experience while in Vegas.

7CxrawZ5_McLSiAZX5PhTA.text: The food was amazing! Our waitress Jennifer L was awesome. She was so sweet and she was always checking up on us. I would go back again. The view off the charts. BEST VIEW IN THE CITY!

pkOA1CkXFF_bRpnjrp5PYg.text: This dining experience was amazing.  I had the best ribeye steak ever!  We were celebrating a birthday and it was unforgettable.  Service was top notch and our waiter was very attentive.  The blended flavored butters were delicious that were served with the bread basket.  This place is a bit pricey although the food is excellent and you cannot beat the view.  If you have a special occasion and want it to be memorable, Top of the World is the place to be!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of Vegas from Top of the World Resturant!

oLkCCS-eVIrkDUwggfnVEA.text: What else can you say about this place? It has been years since my first visit  here   ( Not Vegas) It never fails to surprise me by the quality of the food as well as the great service and and BTW the view is not bad either.Kidding it was amazing on a nice cool evening.  Had the surf and turf and being a rather big eater myself at times I was more then letting a notch out on the belt and  had great take home snack for after hours of a night of walking the strip(and no I don't work there, the strip it is)lol. Oh and if you must have appetizer Grilled Portobello & Buffalo Mozzarella. And the Mrs had the Fettuccine Seafood Alfredo with Lobster, Prawns & Scallops.. Amazing.

kLmr3fgwk6DGT3GX7DZO2A.text: Hubby and I went to dinner at Top of the World for our anniversary. Like many of the other reviewers say, go for the view, go for the atmosphere, but don't go for the food. Every other time I have gone to an upscale restaurant, the chef has always been able to accommodate my dietary needs, but TOTW failed miserably in this area. I was given a plate of under-cooked lukewarm to cool veggies for my vegetarian gluten free meal, and left still hungry after a $50 (total bill $100 + tip) meal. All in all.. I am sure this is a fine place to eat if you don't have dietary restrictions, but avoid it if you do.

JspPbUDCf5QPpsTKt4fh5g.text: More like 3 1/2 stars  We made reservations and were seated right on time.  We sat in a booth. We were celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary. When our waitress arrived she was very cold and rehearsed. She did not even try to talk to us.  This might not sound unusual but we saw her with a few other tables and she was chatty.  She took our drink order and said she would be back. Someone else brought our drinks. We waited and waited and finally she came back. She took our order and left right away. About 45 minutes went by and she never checked on us. Finally our food came.  For the price we expected a little more. Expect to spend $50+ per person just for your main meal.  Appetizers, desert and drinks expect to spend $200 plus for 2 people. Don't get me wrong the food is great and the view is spectacular but the service is why they are only getting 3 1/2 stars.

OYYnJOzfikcTnSsbJOoiRg.text: great service, great view, with great food.  I had the rack of lamb, which was tender, juicy, and filling.    we sat near the window, which provided great views of LV, rotating a full circle every 60 minutes.  the move is very subtle, so shouldn't cause any dizziness.  the price includes access to the top floors (which usually is $18/person).  you can bungee jump, ride rides, and the balcony has fantastic views.    The only problem was the prices were on the high side, upwards of 50-60/dish.  They certainly factor in the $18 fee to the top into your meal.    overall, great experience, and one definitely must try it once, especially for a special occasion.

lXkkABk5sz7AP5ij4t-TcA.text: I rated this restaurant with 4 stars given the overall dining experience. It is, indeed, a breathtaking view of the entire city and is very romantic by day or night. I went with my wife for a late lunch and we were both delighted.  Having said this, as many others have stated, the food is over-priced and unremarkable. I ordered a medium steak and got it almost well-done, whilst my wife got the vegan plate, which was $40 for a big plate of mostly steamed veggies and quinoa. House wines are also sub-par; you'll get the equivalent of a 10-dollar wine.  I never thought I'd say this, but I highly recommend this restaurant in spite of the food!

xIDdx1iumJK8gxlRMMVZjg.text: SCAM ALERT-CHECK BIG PARTY SERVICE CHARGE CLOSELY.  I am late with this but this is my first post ever but wanted to alert people.  We spent Easter Sunday with 6 people, stated with a couple bottles of champagne, then wine with food, spent above average for sure.  Bill comes and we throw 3 credit cards in - fortunately one for us looked at the bill - the service charge was about 50% of the food and drink total!!!  He asked for the manager, who looked puzzled and said it was a mistake and they would re-run the ticket and I think he comped our deserts.  This cannot be an accident - its a computer!!   I am guilty of trusting restaurant checks at higher end places and not scrutinizing them - never again.

I1MwlpUK-eosXaPhwe3-Sw.text: Love this place my wife and  I always look for places to  go for our anniversary and this is always on the top of the list we love it. We always do the tasting menu and have not been let down yet love how they pair the food and the wine.  Can't go wrong

Z9-nFpzB_RJEmAwD3sbMZw.text: While Stratosphere may be far from the cream of the crop as LV hotels go, the Top of the World is certainly an exception to the rest of the hotel.  Beautiful atmosphere, wonderful meal and great service.  We all had the 4 course tasting menu, which for $90, and all things considering, I thought was a very nice price.  Especially since the third course, the filet, I would guess at 10 to 12 oz.  A far larger portion than I have seen on any tasting menu.  While the food was not spectacular, it was certainly very good, and we all enjoyed.  The wine pairing for $30 was fabulous, and for me perhaps the best part of the meal.  It would have been a bargain for even more.  I also highly recommend the bananas foster in a a almond brittlle bowl.  The service was excellent, but not rushed at all.  Servers were always in the area, but we had a rather slow pace to meal, to enjoy the view.  We were there 2+ hours, and since the restaurant slowly rotates, we enjoyed 2 complete rotations, and spectacular views.  The atmosphere is quiet on the inside, and the views cannot be beat.  I would recommend this experience to anyone.

PFJQKmlFYaiaVa1mtTuJEA.text: Salads are very good. Lobster bisque soup had a weird gross taste. Crab Cake is very good. Service was just OK Server not very friendly. Not even sure if she spoke good English.

yqTmEYdBVlgpeZX3-cnGgA.text: My wife and I went here for her birthday and it was by far the best dinner experience we've had in Vegas. The food is great and the staff was second to none. Would highly recommend it to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from top of the world restaurant at sunset
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fCNKN4J0Mb72XOwWmYsSbg.text: I go to Vegas once or twice a year. When I do, a stop for dinner at the Top of the World is a must. Some of the best dining you'll ever have.  Throw in the first class service and amazing views and you've got yourself a home run.

cQHN2r4xbHazI656U1CRpg.text: Just like the other reviews states, you're paying for the view. Service was slow for us, at least. We dined there with another couple (separate tables because of our Restaurant.com gift certificate) and they ate and left at least 30 minutes before us. Don't get me wrong, our waiter was extremely nice and informative, he just had a lot going on. The pesto-pineapple butter was delicious! We ordered soup and salad because we figured, "how can you go wrong with soup and salad?" I ordered an iceberg wedge with Canadian Bacon and Blue cheese crumbles and a honey Dijon vinaigrette. My salad was overpowered with blue cheese and the "bacon" seemed to be pieces of fat thrown into my salad. If the review was for the food only, it would be 1 star. I'm giving the extra 2 stars for the friendliness of our server and for the amazing view. It was definitely romantic, relaxing, and enjoyable - however, next time we are just coming for the drinks.

Pbw_b0um5WRr1Lj6Fp3Kcg.text: Had the filet and lobster tail and the rack of lamb. Both meals were absolutely delicious and the sides that came with each meal were full of flavor.  All of our meat was cooked to perfection as well. The overall atmosphere of this place was great. The service was fantastic as well. Definitely a great date night spot in Vegas if you don't mind spending a decent about of money.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

56O058G4NJSnaICv8OHvBQ.text: Amazing meal.   1) We ordered the crab cake appetizer. I was honestly a little surprised that it wasn't hotter, but it was sooo tasty. We also both ordered cocktails recommended by our server, which were absolutely delicious and light   2) lobster bisque. They serve it as a bowl with lobster in the middle and pour the bisque over. It was very succulent. We were thinking each thinking about getting our own but decided to share, which I'm very glad we did. The portion was very generous and the perfect precursor to our meal  3) Rack of Lamb. Oh, my, goodness. This was incredible. I ordered it medium and it literally melted in my mouth. It came with a side of chutney which was the perfect accompaniment. I was full half way but couldn't help but eat the whole plate. That is NOT the kind of meal you waste.   4) Bone-in rib-eye. Ridiculous. There are no words for how delectable this was. Hubby made a good choice. Im his words, "even the fat is good,"..that's saying something   We also did the wine pairings suggested with each part of the meal which I highly recommend.  And honestly, the view is everything they say it is..incredible.  But the best part, my guy proposed to me during dessert!  I wouldn't have changed a thing!

5S2X5Bw7CJZrkpGF_XTw3Q.text: The food was amazing and the view was wow. I liked the service, and the steak was perfectly cooked. I recommend the lobster bisque it was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lFLP55ylo_2m7zBxItTSWw.text: Incredible view! Seriously, that is the reason to come here. The food was good- well portioned, seasoned. We did the tasting menu and it was definitely the way to go. It was definitely traditional from a preparation standpoint- not inventive or unique. Service was also just fine - not amazing, but solid. The observation deck at the top was a fun experience after our meal and all of the elevator attendants were really fun and entertaining. I would definitely recommend as a "must do" for Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from table

U3Ks9iMz8ibEzZGVVYNB4Q.text: Make sure to make reservations! My boyfriend and I came for the view. We were a bit disappointed when we were seated closest to the center (away from the view). Our total bill came out to ~$130 for 2 entrees including tax n tip. The food was mediocre. I felt the price was a bit steep given that we were seated in an area without a view (which was the whole point in eating at a revolving restaurant). However, I was very happy with the level of service provided. Probably won't be returning, but is something to cross off my Vegas To-Do list.

vvgdCwA0UWAUEFp1qBrhTA.text: Amazing I had my wedding reception dinner here! Chateau Briand is what I remember and thier space needle dessert was very nice It's the kind of place you go once But definitely better than the real Space Needle in Seattle

BUE5sP1o6dvzqKLN7eFfTA.text: The views alone are 5 star. I had to take 2 stars away for the service. With the prices they have, service should be a lot better than it was. We had a group of 7, so the gratuity was added, and I feel like our waiter knew his tip was guaranteed and didn't give us great service. Everything started great, some of our group were late, so we were able to wait in the lounge. I think that has the best view. We ordered some beers at $8 each. Once all of party arrived we were seated immediately by the window. Service was ok, we were getting settled in and checking out the view, so it took us a minute to decide what we wanted. Originally I planned on seafood Alfredo but chose the chefs tasting menu at $98. Course 1 was lobster bisque, I didn't like it. I ended up fishing all the lobster out and didn't finish my soup. Course 2 was the pork belly, so good and crispy in a delicious sauce. Hubby got scallop and it was also yummy. Upgraded the main entree to lobster tail for $10, and glad I did, well worth it! I ordered my filet mignon well done, instead of medium well. My fault, it was not good. My husband loved his and said it melted in his mouth. We upgraded the dessert for $5 to whatever we wanted. I ordered creme brulee and it was food. I should've ordered tiramisu. But I was stuffed already anyway. Our waiter kept avoiding us, and it took 20 mins to get our dessert order and 30 minutes to get our check. We were there for over 2 hours! And most of it was waiting! I did enjoy the company and the views. The food and service should be a lot better for the price though. I would still recommend, but not highly.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I did not like the mango spread and I love mango. The green one was good. The cracker was delish
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big serving, it was ok
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster was perfect. Filet mignon tasted like liver

7Z55D6kODYUYFtaQ1qcP6Q.text: If you're looking for a fantastic view while you dine, this is the restaurant for you.  It's very romantic.  We arrived with no reservation and were seated fairly quickly.  The whole place rotates, so you get fantastic views of the whole city.  The food was fairly expensive, between $35 & $50 a plate.  For four of us, including drinks, it was about $250 with tip.  The food was not spectacular, but it was good, you're paying more for the view.  If you're looking for the view, without the high cost to eat, I suggest the twice baked potato.  It was $12, but it was huge, tasty and filling.  The bread they brought was very good as well.

qyPTBJeqkDaIOgSYBnjk2w.text: Our dinner was 5 star with a bullet.   I had Chilean see bass and it was delicious and cooked perfectly.   Cheesecake for dessert was decadent and wonderful.   Cocktails mixed perfectly.   View....stunning.   Then why only 4 stars?   Price.   I get it.   You pay for the view and executive chef but a dinner for two was over 250 without wine though we did each have a cocktail and we had dessert.   With tip I spent 300 bucks and sorry Top of the World.   You were great but that is too much.   Significantly too much.   For 225 with a tip it is a slam dunk 5 star experience.   For 250 it is getting testy but I still likely would have given 5 stars and grumbled about it.   But 300.   You're nuts.   Would love to eat there again one day but not likely at that price.

OReDJsOlinBrU43hqIUM1A.text: Food is very good, a little overpriced (I guess you're paying for the view). This is a crab cake app & a mango madness drink (not bad at all). My date had issue with the unclean bathroom, at an establishment like this, there should always be someone maintaining it, especially on a weekday eve when it wasn't extremely busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab appetizer

sqQik-moa50YO4ICBN7tdA.text: This place is a must go when visiting Vegas. I've been to Vegas several time (8) and this is one of my favorites. The view is gorgeous and romantic. The wait was 30 minutes when we arrived without reservations and we didnt mind the wait. We went to the view deck and had drinks.  I ordered the 14oz. Prime New York Steak with Peppercorn Sauce and my husband ordered the Duo of 8oz. Canadian Lobster Tails with White Wine Butter Sauce. The food was delicious. Service was impeccable.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The duo
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine with a great view.

fM-pufBiO6phjX0XsSW8IA.text: Actually I was surprised. Didn't expect smth special, but evening turned out to be very nice. We came right on time, about 7 p.m. and were given perfect table near window. Waiter was excellent, food was rather expensive, but nice and not French fries and stake! Thank you for "different" menu and nice cocktails! The view was nice, Vegas has what it has, sundown was beautiful and Strip in night lights too. Pretty romantic place. What I liked the most is quiet atmosphere, no smoke smell, very good service!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fua Gra and Crab Cake.

fdjc0YB3hs_q586zc150jg.text: Excellent service, excellent food, excellent view and did I mention "Tim" the manager? Good too. Not many places truly know how to cook a steak anymore but this place sure does. Bizarre diabolical chefs work here. Will surely return.

tXEuROgwW4ymT68mTaKX6Q.text: My husband and I came here for lunch and ordered the crab cake (good), the fillet mignon and skirt steak. The skirt steak was close to medium-rare, my fillet was undercooked significantly. While the staff was personable, the only person who really seemed to be on top of their job was the busser. He is majority of the reason we tipped 20%. This was last Friday around noon. Besides the disappointing steaks and waiting 15 minutes for a mimosa, the view is lovely.

COnSBkAVfqkQf4cwLxaFDQ.text: You're paying for the view, basically. The food took a long time to come out, it was warm, not hot, and soooo overpriced (50 bucks for a rack of lamb that was good, not amazing). The waiter was a nice guy, which was one of the few positives. When my boyfriend for his Surf & Turf Gnocchi, he realizes there was no lobster in it. John (the waiter) was very apologetic, and had the waiter make another plate. Again, you're paying for the view and not much else. If you want great meat, go to Fogo De Chao, at least the sides are included.  If you want the view, go to the lounge that's above the Top of the World, and save some money.  We were disappointed, to say the least.

qBkQJgWhByHzc0OZEiex0g.text: Beyond the amazing views and the fact that your eating dinner 800' in the air,  the food was AMAZING!!   The bread and the appetizer came first.   Bread was fresh and warm with a selection of butters.   The orange butter stood out on top!!!WOW!!!    We both ordered Wedge salads, which I believe had some of the best bacon on it that I have ever eaten,  huge portion which could be a meal in itself.   I ordered a 9oz Filet Mignon, rare, and they substituted seared scallops for me instead of lobster or shrimp.  The scallops were on the tasting menu and sounded really good!  Mine came out perfect!!   5 Stars plus!!!!!   The fillet was perfect,  I could cut it with my fork and the scallops melted in my mouth!!   My partner in crime ordered Tagliatelle Primavera, the plate came out and it looked like it could feed a village of 50 people!!  The pasta was cooked perfectly,  the vegetables were on point, outstanding dish!!   I think I might order it next time I'm there and see if they could put the seared scallops on top!!  We finished up with a shared dessert called Chocolate Lovers Dream,  which has a moist chocolate cake, Grand Marnier and chocolate mouse wrapped in a dark chocolate teardrop shell!!!    Amazing!!   When in Vegas,  go to this restraurant!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ultimate dessert!!!   Chocolate Lovers Dream!!!   Do it!!!!

LIYUi0nqyh8EIgg8_aBd3A.text: I had been here 10+ years ago and I couldn't stop raving about this place. This was a must do meal for my new wife. (We got married in the Chapel in the Clouds at the hotel).  Anyways, we made a reservation and requested a window seat. They had no problems accommodating us.  When seated, our waiter was pretty slow getting our drink order. He served the wine my wife ordered right away. My non-alcoholic, non $13 glass of wine took another 8 minutes.  Food came out pretty quick. The lobster bisque was very good but also extremely rich. The waiter, when serving it (they pour the soup over a small mound of lobster meat right at the table) splattered a few droplets on my wife's blouse. We didn't notice (because the restaurant is very dark) until right after the waiter left. We asked for some club soda to clean the droplets off which the manager brought but there was no apology whatsoever. They acted as if she spilled it on herself.  The crab cake I ordered was pretty good but not even remotely close to the best I've ever had. $18 for a single crab cake seemed more than just regular steep. It was exceptionally steep.  Our entrees were very good. She had the surf and turf gnocchi and I had the duo of lobster tails. Like everything in a revolving restaurant, they were overpriced.  During the meal, I asked the waiter for a refill on my Coke. He forgot about it and only remembered it 5 minutes later when I was about to point it out again. He gave some bs excuse that a few years ago, he only had to wait 4 tables at a time, instead of the 9 he does now. ARE YOU KIDDING ME? 9 tables is nothing. If you hustle and do your damn job, you can do twice that number and still provide exceptional service.  The bill took forever to come and they refused to give the 10% discount as an Ace Play Club member. It explicitly states, in the Guest Services Directory, that you get a 10% discount. I complained at the front desk and they adjusted our bill to compensate.  I love how, with the bill, there's a little insert that explains how to tip. "Exceptional service gets 15-20%". If the service was exceptional, he would have gotten 25-30%, but it was garbage. I felt like I was cheating myself by even giving him 8%. The last time I was here 10 years ago, I gave a $100 tip on a $400 bill.  The views are fantastic, the food was good (although not worth the prices). Waiters are hit and miss. With a different waiter, I might have given this place 4 or 5 stars.  Since waiters are random, I cannot recommend this place as it's a pretty expensive dice roll.

lVPdVqaGI2yDPkFQ5S4MBQ.text: What a disappointment.  Our reservation was early and yet the wait staff attitude and attentiveness was lackluster.  The windows were dirty from storm a few day prior which is understandable.  For was ok.  Really nothing special.  The experience could have more than made up for that by receiving good service.  Probably won't go back, for the cost I'd rather get better service.

C5s7kf1KtKaw7U2xn9ut0A.text: The view was nice but I would rather pay the $12 to just go to the view, 60$ for pasta is kinda harsh.

xV9bkHPAx_733A-5zw3EZw.text: If you're looking for a classy, romantic, upscale dinner... you're looking for the Top of the World! Wow. The food, the drinks, the VIEW! It was truly a magical experience. I love that you get to see all of Vegas while enjoying your meal! Definitely go at night to see all the lights!

4Qk0rZzkW3ZqConhl9Mikw.text: The Ora King Salmon is DELICIOUS!! Best piece of Salmon I've ever had. If I could it every day I most definitely would

6oPjxpFz75OpYbPzByJWoA.text: I decided to take the wife here for a memorable anniversary dinner. She loves beautiful views and the the restaurant revolves, giving everyone a different awe  -inspiring view during their time there.  The whole experience was amazing.  From being greeted with "Happy Anniversary" at the hostess stand to  having a great server like Christian. These things made our experience special.  My wife has a very restrictive diet (no gluten, no nightshades, no eggs, pescatarian) and she was able to order normally from the menu. The carpaccio was delicious. So tender with lobster in the middle. She had the shrimp cocktail. The shrimp were huge and tender. The Waygu skirt steak was amazing. I opted for no sauce because it is that good. The Ora King salmon was perfectly cooked and soubise was so flavorful.   For dessert, I had the baked Alaska. It was so amazing, I ate the whole thing. All of the layers of deliciousness were too irresistible.  She had a drink called the spark plug which was a delicious coffee based martini for dessert. Giving you the option of a dessert cocktail was a nice touch too.   Hats off to Executive Chef Pawan Pinisetti and his staff for his spectacular menu and quality of preparation.  It was honestly the best dining experience I've ever had out here.

0LN3kG0nuilaEnkfzyMYNg.text: Amazing experience. Prices are significantly less during lunch and the views were beautiful! The service was first class and the food was delicious. I got a great deal using Groupon and wasn't treated any differently. Don't forget to go to the top after your meal which is included. Definitely recommended and a must do at least once. Would like to go at night next time. Very romantic as well. Worth every penny. Oh, and valet parking free as well. Enjoy!

h8YnO3zZT7svFeJZK3IWQQ.text: Ohhhhhh I am in love again!!! This was so special my Hunny took me here for my bday dinner surprise and I loved it!! The view was awesome and our waiter was funny as hell, he said he finds a table to pick on every night and guess who he chose US . He made the night extra special with his sense of humor and ya know I love a great waiter/waitress. We chose the pre selected menu lobster bisque md crab cake filet mignon and shrimp and creme broulee. This food was soooooo good and filling by the time dinner was over we had the itis.   I really can't say enough about this view it was too beautiful. Now I had a couple moon and stars drink which was very different but tasty, but drinking and going to the restroom doesn't always go hand in hand. The restaraunt rotates so you gotta remember which way you came in meaning head back to your table and not the lobby like a couple of us did playing follow the leader  but before we sat down the beautiful hostess explained to us why she told us our number section Thank you to her . Overall I had a blast and I will be back thank you to our waiter for making the night awesome!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hfn6qPRX-xmJSKexXWfQgw.text: Top of the World restaurant is located on the 106th floor of the Statosphere Hotel. Reservations are recommended as the food and view from the rotating restaurant are the attractions. Plan to spend a minimum of 80 minutes to enjoy a full rotation. Booths and tables are the choices. I recommend a booth because both people sit side by side and look directly out the window. Tables are closer to the window but you must turn your head  to look out the window. Service is slowly paced. Plenty of time to enjoy the view. Our server Jeanne was friendly and pointed our various places around the valley. She also provided an in depth explanation of the menu with a la carte and chef tasting selections. Our choices were a la carte. Summer &  Butternut Squash Soup Filet Mignon 9 oz portion Twice Baked Potato Seafood Alfredo  Lobster Bisque soup was on the menu but the special of the day was the Squash soup. The Squash soup was creamy with a hint of cinnamon and onion. An excellent choice, simply delicious. The Filet Mignon was cooked perfectly as requested and served with a brown gravy on the side. The twice baked potato was large, enough for two. The outside had a nice crisp texture and the inside soft and creamy. The potato was topped with bacon and onion.  Seafood Alfredo was offered with 3 choices of sauces. I chose the marinara. A large portion of tagtiatelle pasta was surrounded by jumbo shrimp, large chunks of lobster and crap meat. The bowl was covered with the marinara sauce. The entree was perfectly cooked. As with most pasta entrees, it was more then could be consumed. The dessert menu had several interesting choices but we passed. There's always next time.  Reservations at the restaurant includes complementary admission to the indoor and outdoor observation decks on the 107th and 108th floors. The indoor space is nothing special but the outdoor deck is more interesting, a wind in your face experience. Save the visit until after dinner when the strip is all lit up. Top of the World is a great choice for a special occasion or introducing visitors to Las Vegas.
