ZDr48g9IsCq11k5rqPt8qw.text: The staff was friendly and my husband made reservations and told them it was my birthday. It almost doesn't matter where you sit except that you don't want to end up in the in between seatings...those are kinda awkward seatings. There's the row of booths that are intimate and give you a good view above the head of the diners that are dining a row below you, then there's the row of seats that are directly in front of the windows and those are amazing as well...and then there's the awkward in between seatings. Yes, I was unfortunate to be stuck in between. You wanna look out at the view...but instead your view is obstructed by the other wonderful couple that are awkwardly having an awesome time not talking to each other and are directly in front of the gorgeous view and they know my husband and I are both staring past them to the view...also staring at the man's failed attempts to make his lady smile (but that's none of my business). I didn't like that I had to tell the lady that I wasn't staring at her husband ...just the view.  On an amazing note...the steak i ordered medium rare was medium rare and ah-maze-ing!!! It melts in your mouth not your hands. My husband and I got the four course meal. I took a shitty pic of the lobster bisque because I already started eating it like a thirsty dog on a hot day. We ordered lobster bisque, crab cakes, filet mignon &shrimp and creme brulee.   The service was to be expected. Waitress was nice enough and she told us the groupon voucher we had was only valid on the weekdays not the weekend (my bad) but I knew it'd be expensive so I planned for it. Lol.   We had a great time. Would go there again.

cA1fUElKSpCuyMfNQOqklA.text: I love good food with a view... and this is probably the best view you'll get while dining in Vegas.   During the day, it's not so busy and the sun fills the place with natural light so you can look out onto the desert. Don't be startled as people casually fly by your window as they bungee jump off the tower.   The server was very professional and nice. She brought out complimentary fresh baked rolls with butter and cheese crackers shaped like giant Doritos.   I ordered the lobster BLT and a chocolate martini. Both were amazing- as they should've been for the price. Although it was a little pricy, the experience of eating in a beautiful rotating restaurant with a sweeping view of Vegas was worth it.  I can't wait to go back to experience it at night.   Check out the 3 course prix fixe lunch menu for $49, which includes a petite filet mignon, and the 4 course chef's tasting menu for $98, which includes a lobster tail!

EpTILgrP8lBPdZbOw3OQqQ.text: Amazing views!! We had the Power Lunch and cocktails. Power Lunch came with Lobster Bisque, Pan Seared King Salmon, and caramel creme brulee. It was all good!

rNsbsfD5QxPs4W0EXyBHFg.text: Food:  1 star (regrettable)  Service:  3 stars View:  5 stars This is a hands-down great place to get a panoramic view of LV.  I only wish there is a way to see it without suffering through the food.  With the price you pay, you get to grind your own pepper...  Now here comes the real bad part.  First, the bread basket had four types of bread that were all cold.  Can't they serve at least at room temp?  Mixed green salad was weltered in marination probably due to sitting too long in the kitchen.  Grass fed rib-eye was so tough, I was getting tired just to slice them not to mention chewing it.  Do the feed the cow with artificial-turf?.  Ahi tuna was simply overcooked.  The correct way (I hope the cooks are reading this) is to slightly brown the surface while inside is stays raw and then slice thinner to plate them.  The tuna was like sponge where moisture was sucked out from freezing/defrosting.  Sweet potato was cold.  We ended up leaving behind more than half of the food.  Just could not bare it.  But the view was phenomenal and relaxing being inside the rotating room.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sad looking ahi tuna dish.

Ws6mOoSIaJ_pCfNPN6wTiA.text: My husband made reservations for party of 3 (including our toddler) to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary.. This place was great.. Lived up to my expectations.. I was greeted by the waiter with a "Happy Anniversary " and through out the whole time, they all made me feel special.. following each of my husbands requests.. Food was delicious and the atmosphere was great! You can view the whole city as you enjoy a delicious meal.. the prices are up there.. but worth the big $$ !! A must try!!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fPCj6cwdx3HwXzpIIpnGJQ.text: Maybe they don't care about people visiting for lunch? Two stars for great views and a clean restaurant/bathroom. I order the cheeseburger which was cooked well (not medium as I requested) and flavorless. The lettuce on the burger was the cheap think iceberg chunks and warm flavorless pickles(very odd). The fries was pretty good. I left more than half of my burger on my plate. The waitresses commented on the fact I barley ate anything. I said, "yeah wasn't very good".  She smiled and said we could have split it. Ummmm Ok?   I always made sure I stopped by this restaurant when I'm in Vegas but I'll skip it from now on.

tLcIkM5rA3X4imxZ7xXWqg.text: Celebrate my Christmas here at Top of the World with good friends.  From the start to end.  Everything is perfect, from the virw to the food.  What else can I ask for... The food was really good.  Soup - butternut squash soup. Very creamy and delicious. Main Course - Wagyu Ribeyes.   very tender and is perfect medium.  Dessert - Chocolate ganache log cake.  Cake is very moist.  I would recommend this place and I will definitely going come back again...

a1vSnZnELOx_5yAASVJItg.text: Food was so bad. I can't even give a better review for the view because I was so dizzy from the spinning that I would have enjoyed simply visiting the observation deck for the view. The server was great, the staff was very professional...the food was sooo bad. I wouldn't have expected it to be so mediocre or bland, but it was. Steak was boring and fatty, Brussel sprouts were soggy, twice baked potato was dry and cheese was hard. If you go here, you pay for the view. That's all.

3DpV3eul4s0_Io-yUh08kQ.text: Nice concept and definitely a great view. The server is a little short tempered. The food is a little better than average. Ok pricing for the type of place it is. Overall not a bad place to experience. I would recommend people visit this place at least once. Once is probably enough.

-M_DE4RlRzFJyeF83AYlRg.text: Amazing experience! I had a party of 8 and every single person loved it! The food was awesome and the staffs are very professional. I would have to say that getting up to the restaurant was a little rough due to the fact that the stratosphere staff they had working for the elevators weren't organize or professional. But other than that this place is a must for once in a lifetime.

mnBrOwYBuY6h9BGd-g8PlQ.text: I so badly wanted to rate this place based on my entire experience, but the 2 stars comes strictly from the initial experience. I made reservations to take my husband here for his birthday. Reservations were for 9:15pm & unfortunately mother nature wasn't on our side & the big Ridgecrest earthquake hit about 8:30pm. Understandably so the servers freaked out & pretty much all left. When we went to check in at the "hostess stand" the man behind the counter was super rude & told us our reservation was cancelled due to the earthquake. He told us to come back tomorrow in which I explained tonight was out last night in town so that wasn't an option. Then he told us we could go to the lounge so we agreed to that. Then we get to the next guy who tells us we can't go to the lounge. Frustrated & hungry we decide to leave in which another guy comes & tells us we can go. Confused but excited we can go we make the journey up the elevator. We get there & a lady tells us we can be seated at the restaurant but it'll take about an hour or we can just eat at the lounge. We put our name down for them to call when a table is ready but go to the lou he in the hopes to order an app & some drinks. As soon as we sit down head chef comes & tells wait staff kitchen is closed. Good god man can this place please provide better communication amongst the employees. We ended up at Yardbird at the Venetian & hot damn that food was well worth the hell we went through!

WJvBofeKPUBFpE3HNY_Hiw.text: This place has an amazing view! It is so cool how you rotate around the city. As for the food I thought that it was just ok, it was expensive but not as worth it as at Eiffel Tower. The lobster Mac and cheese was strange noodles and dry. The dessert was extremely tasty (specifically the butter cake!). I'm giving it lower stars for the food but still a 4 for the ambiance and views.

gYdlnICZv9nEbwuyAij8QQ.text: Absolute disgusting don't do it. If your looking to celebrate a anniversary, birthday or any special event do not come to this establishment under any circumstances. Don't be fooled by the pictures the food and service is the worst! They make you feel like crap on your special day. They won't accommodate your request to sit by the window , for a birthday desert or anything forget it. The manager is the absolute worst ( Hispanic looking guy that was working on a Thursday night) should be fired he has no knowledge on how to assist or treat paying customers. They ruined my best friends birthday night completely .SANDRO the manager does not deserve to work here.

0Co1EUlR_aWFRlmwO0KCbg.text: I dined here on Easter 04/16/2017 with my boyfriend and I must say it was an average experience. The view itself gets 5 stars and the fact that this restaurant rotates and you get to see the beautiful dusty views of Vegas.   I was disappointed with the menu selections, since this is a high end restaurant I did expect them to have more options for non-beef eaters but this place is known for their steaks.   I did ask for a special accommodation and I was informed that if anything is not on the menu they cannot serve it, which was a bummer. I really was not happy with my meal at all and was not worth the $200 my boyfriend spent but he enjoyed his juicy steak.  However, the drinks were delicious and it was yummy...so the drinks were worth it. If you have certain dietary restrictions I highly recommend do not dine here unless you love steak.  However, our server was lovely and even took our picture for us. He did not recommend any specials. I do hope they change their menu, then I'll probably be back. After dinner we did go up on top of the Stratosphere and enjoyed the view, if you dine in the restaurant you get to go up for free and see the view, so many memories you can create there! Definitely a must see!

NZi2Ad_7EVQzqGvI1_ZeoQ.text: Beautiful restaurant! The food was great and good service. I would recommend going at night the view is awesome!!

fRwBy5lyFbqDWGc3Zy5jrQ.text: Love it!! My boyfriend took me to dinner here for my birthday. Our reservation was at 7:30 pm so we got to enjoy the terrific 360 scenic view of Vegas during the day, sundown, and at night w/ all the bright lights. Also, watching people sky jump off the tower was amusing!  I ordered the 5 course tasting menu and my bf ordered the rack of lamb and a bottle of wine. Portions were big and there was more than enough for the two of us. The lamb was cooked and seasoned well. The tasting menu I got included the following:  Lobster bisque - Lots of lobster, good texture, my bf liked it but I found it to be too salty. Crab cakes - This was yummy! Crispy and golden outside, and soft inside. The papaya salad added a nice balance. Miso black cod - Also yummy. Cooked well, not over seasoned, melts in your mouth. Filet w/ Red Wine Mushroom Sauce - Yum! No A1 here =P Dessert Trio - banana something was my favorite, chocolate cake, and a raspberry mousse.  Service was excellent. Waitress was so sweet and attentive and the staff helps you find your way to the restroom ( a little confusing when you're rotating and had a couple drinks). Not at all disappointed, despite the $200+ bill. Great place for a special occasion, I definitely enjoyed it and will be back.

DWzi7M-jSuNM-eGreKKSNw.text: We had another great dinner at Top of the World at the Stratosphere. They make some of the best lobster bisque we've ever had. We spit a wedge salad and had the lobster Thermidor. Of course the view alone makes it worthwhile but the food is excellent. Nice selection of wine for those who are experienced and novices like us. We come here most times that we visit Las Vegas.

VB3rdbTFDFhcJPeGaKjZmQ.text: I would give this place five stars if it weren't for our waitress. Everything was superb except for our table service.  Our server, Elizabeth, was cold and unprofessional. She mumbled her words making it very difficult to understand her. When taking our dinner orders she neglected one person, and only came back when we protested. She didn't ask if we wanted appetizers or any side items... she just got the main course orders and turned around and left. Again we protested and got her back to order our salads. The food and the view were outstanding. We had a very nice time. It's too bad they have someone like Elizabeth there trying to spoil it for the guests!  Our bill was about $600; we expected service to match. There are hundreds of great servers in Las Vegas who would love to have the job she seems not to care about.

CEtIBf7kN63jDA8JXmVgqA.text: The best view of Las Vegas. That said, the food and service were exceptional as well. I took a group of business colleagues for a celebratory dinner and all were pleased. Drinks, appetizers and entrees were all well received. Go for the view, stay for the food.

YbJsrfQ0-SEuuEsZRum1kw.text: My wife and I went for our 20th wedding anniversary. This was our first time going. AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We will go again!

_N5KpGGHaH4xurrte0EgKw.text: My husband and I went for our one year anniversary to Las Vegas and we wanted to live large even if it was only for the weekend. I picked Top of the World to eat for our celebration. We had the 4 course dinner with wine and it was AMAZING! They give you a different type of wine with every course. The food was also AMAZING! The lobster bisque was by far the best Ive ever had and the filet mignon  was perfect. We were so full by desert we barely tasted had any but it was delicious! The room is always moving so you get a full view of all of Las Vegas. The moon was full and the night was impeccable. I had such an amazing experience. I hope to return to Las Vegas one day and I will surely return to this restaurant.

pm4Gi3vmEyqrt1STJmH44g.text: Hmm, we have something similar here in Honolulu, but no where as high. Our first time eating here with our 50 dollar restaurant.com certificate. The waitresses and waiters here are so professional and friendly. I was given a dodo color orange collard shirt to wear over my Tshirt because we didn't know they had a dress code lol. I can't complain though, most high class restaurants will tell you "sorry come back later" but they were cool about it. Hands down the best complimentary bread and butter assortment I've ever had. 3 different breads/crackers and butters. Shit, I couldv'e ate just that and be happy :) I had the NY steak I think? I forget because we ate so damn much on our trip to Vegas lol. Anyways it was some beef, but was mmm mmm good. Gfs pasta was good too with huge pieces of shrimp and lobster. Thanks for the great service and friendly attitudes Top of The World Staff. :) Would return to eat here on my next trip to Vegas again! Visited Aug 2011

drJn_6VOkltvxYEtZJsQNw.text: Extremely Slow service, food was only so-so, especially considering the prices. We had a group of 9 and only two of us enjoyed the food, both of whom had the grilled cheese. I'm confident that none of us will be coming back. 7/26/2015

_HSo4-jFrX-vbzvpPbC5Aw.text: On top of Stratosphere tower. Had a reservation was seat quick. Staff was friendly. Our Waitress was kind, friendly, and check frequently to see how we doing. Beverage was cold. Food was good, tasty n good portion size. During the diner in the seat area was slowly spin for a 360 degree view of the strip it was nice touch. Price was little expense but worth the experiences. Would recommend to diner in here romantic with partner or with family.

gWSUznDjsTTZWhLikoIeEw.text: Had our wedding dinner here. The view is amazing. The food was also very good. Very expensive tho.

_-lhbd1k0oR9Ug1k1upEmg.text: I spent Thanksgiving day with my family here, and while the food was absolutely spectacular, I feel compelled to comment on the service, which was, to be honest, terrible.   When we arrived, everything seemed fine, it wasn't until we started looking at the prix-fixe menu that things started to go awry--the waiter assured us that it was a three course meal, despite it being Thanksgiving and despite my having experienced every single other prix-fixe menu being written in such a way that the choices for each course are inbetween thick black lines, indicating the differences in each course. (This menu indicated that this was a FOUR course menu). The waiter told me I was incorrect when I asked, confused, why the two choices for the second course (a lamb chop and scallops) were in a different section on the menu than the main course, Thanksgiving dinner. I was incredibly polite about the whole affair, and he maintained that I was incorrect.  He disappeared for about 15 minutes and finally came back with our drinks. The table next to us that was seated after our arrival had already been given drinks and bread by their server. I had to ASK for bread from our server, and he seemed slightly annoyed that I would ask for such a thing. By the time the bread arrived, we'd been waiting 20 plus minutes for our first course and were absolutely starving. (Our reservation was for 2:15, so by 2:45 and no lunch, we were ravenous.) After he FINALLY brings the first course, he's gotten wind that he was indeed incorrect about the menu, and makes us reorder our food. Cut to about 30 minutes later, I have to ask him exactly what is going on, as the people next to us, (who were, again, seated after us) had already gotten their main course and we'd only been given our appetizer. Also,  the restaurant was absolutely not busy at all. We were among 3-4 tables in our section, two of which were staffed by other servers. The surrounding area was completely empty otherwise.  When I finally grabbed our server again. (After trying to politely get his attention and being ignored, I had to actually WALK to him) I explained that we needed to leave as soon as possible, because we had a 4 pm show at the MGM. I had never DREAMED it would take an hour and a half to get our food from a prix-fixe menu, since everything should be ready to go. Again, the food was lovely, but it really put a damper on Thanksgiving because we had to eat so quickly and were unable to enjoy our food because it took so incredibly long for the server to bring our meal and also because I was so freaking STARVING that I gorged on cheap bread instead of the awesome Thanksgiving dinner!  Finally, I had to actually get up and search for over server because he had been absent for so long, and I've NEVER had to do this, even in a dump like Denny's.   I'm usually pretty easy going about servers being slow--I understand that they can get swamped when things get busy, but the restaurant wasn't busy at all, and the servers taking care of the surrounding tables seemed to have no trouble at all and had a much more friendly demeanor.  Our server was the older gentleman from Oaxaca, and I don't know if he was having an off day or what, but when my family spends several hundred dollars at a restaurant, I expect better service that what one would get at  Olive Garden. I live in Los Angeles, home of terrible waiters, and this guy takes the cake.

91mmKUyxPJ5GHspzpCOkVg.text: Nice place. European cuisine (with American serving sizes) and breathtaking views. Lobster bisque is perfect. But do not expect any surprises for special dates (as birthdays, anniversaries, etc.). Anyway - cuisine 5, service 4.5, location 5+

2LuMM5JQtCVSox9v2OAF0A.text: What a great experience.  The food is amazing the service is attentive and the view is spectacular.  The price, $90, for the pre-fixe menu is worth every bit the money you pay.  The steak is probably the best I have ever had.  Will certainly come back for the great food and atmosphere.  I do have 1 small gripe though, the place smells like lobster bisque as this is the house soup and you have to go through a metal detector to get there, other than that, this place is top notch.

pAil5mhal5AIR4rAiUEQLQ.text: Amazing view and delicious food.  We visited "Top of the World" on a Monday at opening time (11am).  At that time, very few of the tables were taken, so there was no wait and the restaurant was nice and quiet.  At the end of a fun trip to Vegas, it was great to be able to look down on the whole area and see all the places we'd been.  The tables are located on a ring that rotates, completing a full rotation about once every 90 minutes or so.  Your table is about 800 feet above the ground, so it is easy to see the Strip, downtown, and all the surround area.  It's also fun to see the skydivers jump off the roof above you.  The food was good.  Lunch prices were reasonable.  I had a deliciously tender filet mignon.

dZdF80sXH9WgvapAvSvibA.text: Food is delicious, atmosphere is "pure Vegas" having a 360 degree view of the strip. Nice place to go for special occasions, business and on vacation. Worth every penny

Rh4mEJEK0V_Y-atqEqR3ng.text: My GF and I decided to try ToW for dinner while in Vegas and were not disappointed.  Prices are definitely a little on the high side, however, the food is great and the view is spectacular.  Make sure you go slightly before sunset so you can see Vegas in the sunlight, then the sunset on the mountains, and then the Strip lit up at night.   On to the food: The kobe beef carpaccio was excellent.  The truffle oil and capers were perfect with the thinly sliced meat.  I had the New York Strip, which was perfectly cooked to medium-rare and extremely tasty.  The Cabernet that I had with my steak was definitely too expensive and very average.  The desserts were also great, we shared the strawberry cheesecake lollipops, the chocolate raspberry creme brulee and the mousse cup and all 3 were delicious.  All in all, ToW is slightly overpriced but definitely a spot to hit up for the experience alone.  The service was excellent as well, we were seated promptly, our waiter was attentive and the food came out fairly quickly.

isjK_VnzDph0QdhETdwpRQ.text: To celebrate Valentine's Day, my fiance and I went to dinner here. It was AWESOME!  When we got there, we went up to the bar area for a little bit while we were waiting for our table. It was really nice with an awesome view of the strip. There was great live music. Then we got seated and our table was right by the window. We enjoyed an awesome panoramic view of Las Vegas as the restaurant rotated around. The food was mouth-wateringly amazing. We enjoyed some wine and a portobello mushroom and red pepper appetizer. My fiance ordered the Turf & Quack for his entree, and I ordered Miso Black Cod. For sides we ordered ricotta stuffed gnocchi and bok choy. Everything was incredibly yummy! Our server was super nice and we had great service the whole night.   On the ride all the way to the top, we shared the elevator with a few people who were going to jump off the top of the Stratosphere! So, along with the beautiful view of Las Vegas, we got to enjoy watching people JUMP off of the Stratosphere. Over and over there were people just flying by our window! I could see the bottom of the platform where they were standing before they jumped, and then they just hopped right off and down 107 stories (or something like that!).  We had such a great time, the restaurant was perfect for enjoying a romantic evening. I loved it.  :-D If you want to enjoy a memorable and romantic experience with your significant other, this place is a great choice!

gWpzQ7JpsFWOjowgaTi5ZQ.text: OK food but the view is why to go. And you get to see the bungee jumpers plummet every couple minutes. Food is just OK. I got the chicken and it was good. Dessert was delicious. View was as promised and the service was excellent. Hate that hotel though--it's dirty--wish they could move this one to a nicer spot. Overall 2.5 stars.

WVD_dpyYO_C83iGqthXstA.text: VIEW VIEW VIEW! The rotating dining floor offers exceptional views of Vegas. The food is the only reason for the 4 instead of 5 stars as the menu items are very heavy and the portions very large. The food was tasty but slightly old school for my taste buds. The wait staff takes their job very seriously, which is refreshing;) We would go again but only when we have company in town, as it is a "MUST SEE" in Vegas!  Pros: VIEW! staff  Cons: Food is too heavy

DEQQrw4RC5v-2JkHCqYHZA.text: This was the best restaurant we went to in Vegas! First all it just wasn't the Greta food it was the whole experience. We were so excited to go have dinner at the top. We dine at the Effie tower thinking the restaurant was at the top but it wasn't, it still had a nice view of the water show, but wasn't the experience we had at top of the world.  The restaurant rotates so you get a 360 view during your dinner! That was very cool. The server even came over to point out a few landmarks to us as we rotated. Everything from the salad to the dessert was fantastic. The avocado salad was excellent and not your normal salad. It had avocados,cucumbers,onions and a spicy sauce that made it so delicious. We ordered the porterhouse and that was fantastic. It came with potatoes and Broccoli Rabe which most steakhouses don't include sides. We also ordered the lobster Mac n cheese that was tasty too. The warm butter cake dessert was so good!   Then we got to go to the outside deck since we dine at the top of the world. The dinner was expensive so it was nice that it included that. We walked around the observatory inside and then went outside. They also had a bar lounge and gift shop.  I would definitely recommend this and come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View outside
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ac ocado Salad

ljUBvn_FNCimHNi94hu4BQ.text: Great view, great service! Armida was our server, very attentive, great atmosphere, food, not so good, ordered the steak and lobster, steak was undercooked, I like medium rare and rare, ordered medium rare and came super rare, creeme brulee was a bit too dark and seemed over cooked, also the pop corn on top of it, a no go! Will only come back for the view,

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Créeme brûlée?
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Médium rare? Um not

HNAO4TV78VvRGqwuF29qDQ.text: This was an amazing experience that I was able to enjoy with my family on our first visit to Las Vegas. Top of the World is located at the Stratosphere and I highly recommend you make reservations before sunset so you can watch the sunset from your window seat of the restaurant.   This restaurant is an experience. You are essentially paying for the view and the meal which reflects on the menu. They will have complimentary dinner rolls and butter offered. We ordered the Australian Wagyu skirt steak and the Maryland Crab Stuffed Chicken and a side of grilled asparagus. Everything was delicious and savory. The asparagus was the best I've ever had, it had the perfect amount of garlic and parmesan and complimented the different meats well. The steak was so tender and juicy.   If you are coming to Vegas for the first time and are staying for a short time, COME HERE! The restaurant revolves and that could be a motion sickness thing, but I did not notice it at all. We even got to enjoy some folks bungee jumping off the top!   If you would like to see all of Vegas without visiting all of Vegas, come here. The view is breathtaking and you are guaranteed to have a great time due to the great service of the employees.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Australian Wagyu Skirt Steak
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maryland Crab Stuffed Chicken

6OYBbLYFzU9Lr1FvRgPS2A.text: If you have not been to the Strat lately I suggest you go. The property overall looks better with a refresh...   Top of the World.... it has amazing views, has a  really nice atmosphere and has also been remodeled.  The service was really good and  our server Eric took great care of us. We had Tuna tartar and salad for apps... both were excellent.   Rib eye for main course along with Brussel sprouts and asparagus.  The views alone are worth the trip up there... I will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussel Sprouts
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

51dIGTcMtaiSwbW5IAdd-Q.text: Let me make it clear that this is a very conflicting review.  I am not one to give low stars.  Typically I try to find positive things to counter the negative experiences.   I called and made my Valentine's dinner reservation 3 months earlier.   I called twice to make sure we got a window seat as this was a very special Anniversary for my husband and I.   Upon showing up, I checked in and confirmed that I was going to get a window seat.   Young lady that checked us in, confirmed and asked me to wait few minutes to be seated.  Then another person came to seat us.  She proceeded to seat us on the interior portion.   When I asked her to seat us at a window seat as requested,  she very rudely said that those free tables are for VIPs.  I took a picture of those tables as they sat for over 30 minutes without any patrons.  I was super irritated at that!  Our waiter Dennis was pleasant.   The best personality and professionalism came from Sergio (from Mexico).  Sergio was very welcoming and attentive.   In all honesty, Sergio needs to teach a little class and customer service to the rest of the staff at Top of the World.  We ordered... Moon & Star  Mango Maggie Tuna tartare  Crab cake  Mixed green salad  Rib eye with blue cheese  Vegetarian entree (zucchini spaghetti) Asparagus   The drinks were good.  Tartare and Crab cake were good.  The Vegetarian spaghetti was okay.  My husband asked for some hot sauce or flakes and finally got them when he almost finished his plate.  The rib eye was good but that had to be the most plastic baked cheese over it that imitated blue cheese.  It was awful!  I scraped it off and still couldn't finish it as the taste of that baked on plastic tasting cheese was unbearable.   Although in the end, we were given coupons for free Champagne up at the bar,  we couldn't wait to leave.  After making reservations in advance and calling couple of times few times within the week to reconfirm,  we weren't seated where we requested.     Customer service in the front 0 stars Waiter service 3 stars  Drinks 3 stars Food 3 stars  Sergio from Mexico=5stars!  So in conclusion,  this was the biggest disappointment and waste of my money on a very special Anniversary.   Giving 2 stars is me being generous,  considering how upset I was.  Too many options with better food and customer service in Vegas to waste time here.  If you want to go up there, just go have a drink at the bar.  The restaurant is absolutely not worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of asparagus

pujNIU8ZWNDnwtC4F4e7QA.text: Had dinner reservations here for about two months ahead of time for our wedding anniversary. On the day of our reservation we showed up a little bit early to go to the lounge for drinks. We were told they were in the middle of a water and power outage. they told us everything was on track to be back on for a reservation at 7 PM and when we showed up they still were beating around the bush about when exactly everything would be OK to go up. Instead of being truthful about their situation they kept leading us to believe that everything will be OK momentarily and we ended up wasting a whole bunch of time bunch of time. Now we are left to find a last-minute reservation for our anniversary on a Saturday night. So thanks a lot! I probably won't but again just based on the bad taste in my mouth from this experience.

veObYhTTD4cBRghPXWgm-w.text: This review is for Top of the World, as a part of my quest to eat at all of the steakhouses in Las Vegas. The overall score is an average of all other categories with steak being counted twice, since it is a review of a steakhouse.    Overall: 4.1 Decor: 5 Bread: 4 Appetizer: 4 Filet: 4 Side: 4 Dessert: 4   Top of the World is a steakhouse located at the top of the Stratosphere tower in the north area of Las Vegas.   The decor is very nice with excellent views of the entire Las Vegas Valley. It actually reminded me of the scene in Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade when they were in the restaurant of the zeppelin.    The bread was very good.   I ordered the shrimp cocktail as an appetizer and it was very good.   The filet mignon was also very good.   As a side I ordered a twice baked potato and it was very good.    For dessert I ordered Chocolate cake and it was also very good.   Overall, Top of the World was a pleasant surprise. I expected the food to be mediocre at best, but it was actually very good across the board. The service was absolutely excellent.

XailVOCGAN8tI3KI5QC56Q.text: Was not pleased with this experience. Unfortunately the breathtaking view was not enough to make up for the terrible service. Our party of 8 was there for a bachelorette trip and only came to this restaurant because it was recommended to us.   We were introduced to THREE servers and none of them were attentive. NONE. The wait times were so  ridiculously long that our dinner took an unnecessary three hours. When we finally received our food, it didn't all come out on time - and we only ordered appetizers and two entrees for our meals. You would think the food would have come out in a timely manner. Nope. I've been a server so I thought "maybe the kitchen is backed up" but when I got my chicken it was dry and cold. But I was too hungry to even think about sending it back.    When we were done with our meal, we sat with empty plates and glasses in front of us, for no joke, AN HOUR. We had to ask a buss boy for our server but didn't even catch his name so we couldn't tell this buss boy who our server actually was. We requested our checks and that took another 30 minutes. When we finally got our checks, we were all nervous to even hand over our cards because we weren't sure if we would even get them back.   We requested to talk to a manager who took his sweet time coming to our table. He was a total prick and said "Sorry about the service. There was a larger party that was more demanding." So because we were easy going and polite, we got pushed to the side and ignored.  We told the manager we didn't feel comfortable leaving a tip that was so low or a tip at all without expressing our concerns and, no joke, this manager just shrugged his shoulders!!! So we left without leaving any tip for our three servers. It was the worst experience and a terrible way to start our trip to Vegas. This place consumed our entire evening and I do not feel confident to suggest this place to anyone.

xhCxNofCasneovXuY_kPJQ.text: We came here for Mom's 70th Birthday. Beautiful restaurant on the 106th floor. We went for lunch so I'm sure the evening views would be much nicer with the lights.  Our server Jeruscha was pleasant.  The food was very good. I had the Power lunch for $50 which consists of a starter, protein and a dessert. I had caesar  salad, salmon and the desert was a salted caramel creme brulee. Surprisingly, the Caesar salad was larger than I expected. The salmon was tasty and was a nice portion size. The salmon sat on a tasty puree and had a small amount of orange segments. I've had similar menus but typically a side is included so that was a slight disappointment but again does not take away from the delicious taste of the food. Sides ordered were asparagus, brussels sprouts, lobster mac & cheese and fries. The asparagus was really good as well as the brussels sprouts however in my opinion the brussels sprouts could have been a little softer. I did not care for the lobster mac & cheese but that's more preference, I have not found a restaurant to make a good mac & cheese. It honestly is the side I typically never order due to their various disappointments.  On to the desert, I literally had to push the creme brulee away for me. The flavor was divine I am not a huge fan of creme brulee although I've had it several times in the past but I must say this was the best creme brulee I've tasted. I wanted to keep eating this treat as it was very delicious and the serving size exceeding my expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scottish Salmon - yummy
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner Menu
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad

KljPs0zyWLZ0MS6BlBnYpA.text: They don't care.  Had a 6:00 open table reservation.  Took a Lyft to the restaurant.  arrived early to sit in the lounge.  Except, they had a power outage at 8AM and the restaurant was closed and wouldn't reopen until around 7PM....maybe.  Did anyone call me?  or text me?  They certainly send me emails to remind me of my reservations, but not to tell me it was cancelled.  Saturday night in Vegas with no reservation....really.

Q0h9ktzz9YfaP7JbaVbecg.text: I had higher expectations for this restaurant as it's been in Vegas for a very long time, the views are amazing, and the price is high.   The views are absolutely stunning at night and the restaurant rotates slowly so you can see the entire city lit up! All of the tables have a view no matter where you sit, so don't worry. You do have to take an elevator to the top and check in with a hostess then you are sat. Our server, Dalia was very sweet. She even moved our table mid dinner so we could sit at the window.   I was disappointed with the quality of the food here. I was expecting much more considering it's on average $100 per person. The food was meek, and all of it came out at room temperature and not warm. The bread was dry as well. I will shoutout the Cavatelli pasta, however because of the flavor. We did the 4 course tasting menu, ordered 8 different dishes and all of them at room temperature and nothing special. It also took 2 hours for service for 4 courses.   I think you should enjoy this restaurant at least once, but you are definitely paying for the view more so than the cuisine.

yR1bzsekmG2zZzZn9hPurg.text: An absolute MUST SEE!   Breathtaking views hovering 800 feet over Las Vegas. If you're afraid of heights, no worries there's special seating for you!   The service was phenomenal and the food was DELISH! Four course meal with enough options to please everyone.  This unique experience doesn't come cheap, so take advantage of the Groupon deal (while it lasts.)

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skyline views
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top of the world

xz-jlFxlRMO-8vh8ZwpVlg.text: Great Experience. I purchased the Groupon which was such a great deal. I literally received so much food for the price of a normal dinner. The four course experience is $106 per person but with Groupon deal it's $80 some dollars. The lobster bisque was creamy but had somewhat of a smoke taste which I would have preferred less of. The crab cake was exceptional covered in panko bread crumbs and a good portion. The filet mignon phenomenal.  Now for the experience. The level we were on was literally rotating g the entire time and took a little over an hour for a complete 360 of the Vegas skyline. Which at first was a little scary as I felt myself getting dizzy but once I relaxed I was fine. Great service and such a magical experience. Don't forget to stop by top creamery after dinner two more floors up.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our view at dinner!

6aS7hGKi7fgDTtIh_a9dag.text: One thing is certain, Top of the World delivers some spectacular views of Vegas. The restaurant slowly rotates so you can enjoy all of Vegas as you eat, without getting motion sickness. A full rotation is 80 minutes so plan accordingly.   This is the third restaurant of this kind that I've been to (the others in Seattle and NYC) and they all seem to have the same decor. I think because of this the decor seems a bit dated to me, especially since my visits to the other two were years ago. Also the Stratosphere, recently renamed Strat, is old and dumpy inside. After walking through the rest of the hotel to get here you don't feel like you should be entering a restaurant that is this pricey. The metal detector at the bottom also doesn't lend itself to a classy restaurant but hey I get it, security trumps ambiance.   Now let me get to the food. I decided to share a filet mignon with my friend, since their smallest steak was 10 oz. We also shared a side of fries. Both were more than enough for the two of us and our steak was cooked perfectly (med/well). Our other friend ordered the wagyu steak.  At $30/oz. minimum 4 oz. you would expect this steak to be cooked to perfection. She ordered it medium rare but it came out like medium well. When she brought this to the attention of our waiter he actually argued with her and told her it was the lighting and reluctantly took it back. It came out the second time still cold in the middle. After this she didn't bother waiting for a third one.   Our waiter did apologize for questioning her the first time and offered to comp the lobster mac n' cheese she ordered. He also gave us vouchers to get free champagne at the bar upstairs.   Overall not a bad meal but with all the options in the area I wouldn't return. You can also enjoy the view from the bar upstairs but it does not rotate.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Views
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped salad
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 10 oz filet mignon

R7jIeC9U-Xh8E0jKAhGEMA.text: I had to make a new review after my most recent visit. Previously I visited for dinner and I was very impressed, not just with the view but with the food and the service. This time, I was there at lunchtime during the week.  The menu is different for lunch and it was really quite good except for my kids. The chicken sandwich was not suitable for kids (spicy sauce, not "hot" spicy, but not kid appropriate either). As a foodie adult, yes, it was great. But the wait staff should know to advise against it for kids. Thankfully one of my kids ordered the burger and between it and two orders of fries, they were full. My wife and I split the chicken sandwich.  Service was rather slow this time, especially considering weekday lunch and that the restaurant wasn't even half full. I remember wondering a couple of times if our server had gone on a break or something.  The main thing that degraded this visit though was the cheesy photographer that was getting everyone to get up from the table and stand for pictures by the windows and in weird, uncomfortable poses. Maybe this is a lunchtime thing only, but at a restaurant of this level, I don't want such things at all. Yes, I came partly for the view, but I don't want pictures like I'm getting on a cruise ship or entering Disney World.

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich and fries
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti squash and carrot pasta (lunch)

V8VU5YPypVSRV0SE_UTbag.text: Nice view of the Vegas strip from here and you can sit and watch people jump as this is the top of the building.  I intended to go back at night to enjoy the view even more, especially with the lights but I didn't make it.  I also didn't make it to the level with the rides.  I got some ice cream and cookies from the little place by the elevators and managed to spill it all over myself.  It was melting in the cone faster than I was eating it so I went back to my hotel to change and just forgot to go back.  The ice cream was delicious and the cookies were just ok. Overpriced of course but it's Vegas..

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mQOgIK2ayHF4SRfIrrv6jA.text: Top of the World may seem a bit gimmicky but it's actually a very nice spot for a special occasion dinner. It's pricey so I don't suggest it for anything other than a treat yo self meal! My bf brought me here for our anniversary and it was the perfect choice. It's located in the Stratosphere and you take an elevator all the way to the top where upon being seated every table is met with a gorgeous view of downtown LV.   The restaurant rotates slowly throughout the meal although unfortunately they were filming a commercial while we were there so we didn't get to experience that. Even so, the view was gorgeous. A professional photographer will come take your photo and sell it to you after the meal. Of course my bf gave in and spent the $30 or $35 for the photo which is a lot! But it's a nice keepsake.  We checked in for our 10pm reservation and waited about 10 minutes to be seated even though the restaurant wasn't full and no one else was checking in. I hate when restaurants do that. But our server was professional and we both really enjoyed the food. The bread basket alone was phenomenal. You can never go wrong with a classic fresh Sourdough loaf, and they also had a chocolate bread which I thought would be nasty but was actually very tasty and unique.  We ordered 2 entrees and 1 side to share, which was a nice amount of food without leaving us stuffed. The USDA Prime Center Cut Ribeye had so much flavor and was exquisitely juicy, without too much fat. I know a ribeye isn't considered as nice a cut as others, but I really recommend it here. The Ora King Salmon over a fennel sauce with lemon butter and citrus segments was high-quality fish and we both enjoyed it, although I think there are other items on the menu that are more exciting. The Lobster Mac n Cheese made with orichette pasta, mascarpone, and bechamel sauce was packed with lobster so we had some in every bite.  Although it might not be the newest and hippest, Top of the World is a special place and definitely has the Vegas vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ora King Salmon, Lobster Mac N Cheese, and Shrimp Scampi
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Downtown View

5qjglm1JoErSV40Rtznlvg.text: Hubbs made reservations for dinner but bcuz we had a lil emergency w one of our fur babies on day 1 we changed to lunch.  You first have to check in at a main desk for restaurant dining and Yu must have reservations or cannot dine. The wait for the elevator was 3 minutes but not too bad as there are double elevators which can fit about 10 at one time.  *DISCLOSURE: You have to pass thru a metal detector so hubbs had to valet his weapon before getting onto the elevator.  The restaurant revolves and take 80 minutes to complete one revolution. Because we had reservations they seated us prior to the couples/groups ahead of us. Made us feel like VIP guests.  We ordered the Power lunch consisting of three courses. We both selected the 5-oz filet mignon w lobster tail, hubbs started w lobster bisque and I picked greens salad, and ended w creme brulee topped w caramel corn.     Even the table breads were delectable-one pair of sweet glazed rolls and glazed French baguette served w pad of room temp butter.   Lobster was topped w rich sauce that we forgot the mini ladles of melted butter set close by our plates. The filets were drizzled w a thin au ju and cooked to perfection mine medium hubbs' med rare both served on a bed of light mashed potatoes.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5oz Filet Mignon and Lobster Tail*
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top of the World

M4NyrEkUhoJVvC5E48Y5hA.text: I came here with two co-workers for dinner on March 21, 2019.  I haven't been to the Strat casino since it was called Bob Stupak's Vegas World, and the surrounding area and casino has gotten worse over time and is very seedy.  After going through security and waiting a long time as there was only one functioning elevator, we made it to the top and walked downstairs to the restaurant area (not sure what people do if they are handicapped).  The view is really nice, and our waiter did a great job.  Two of us ordered ribeyes and the other ordered a filet, with a total of three sides.  After starting with salads, three sides should have been two.  The sides (brussel sprouts, mushrooms, and sweet potatoes) were very good as was the filet, but the ribeyes were very disappointing as they were way too thin.  They do have an excellent wine list, and the bottle of Caymus complimented the meal.  Dessert was the bomb - a huge 20+ layer of chocolate cake that we split yet could not finish.  I wish I could find that one here in Houston it was that good.  If you go to the Strat I wouldn't call it as fine of a dining experience as other places I have enjoyed in Vegas.  The view, uniqueness, and good service made it a memorable time that I will remember more than I would at a high-end steakhouse somewhere on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table

DiDpjZBR4T6BtBalwmSTfw.text: I truly don't know how to begin. I thought I was a Mastro's girl but this view is so incredible, and add in the place spinning thingy-sheeshhhhhhhh. Honestly this place deserves a 10 star review because not only is the view amazing, the staff tentative, and the waiting and dining area well decorated, comfortable, and inviting but the food is truly incredible. I went for a bachelorette weekend and was treated like the queen I am! We had Jason as our waiter who was so well spoken, quick to help, and served us with a smile. I had an old fashioned for my drink and I as strong and decadent- just like I like it! Vegas style lol. When we went they had a three course meal for 106$. I mean come on- if that's not a steal I don't know what is. I got a wonderful salad for my first course, a perfectly season steak, with PLUMP AND BUTTERY shrimp (literally the best!!!), with mashed potatoes and asparagus for my second course, and a trio of ice cream for my third which I didn't have room to finish. If you are trying to choose between this restaurant and another for a wonderful dinner- PICK HERE! Also you should call ahead for big groups.
