Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak USDA Prime Center Cut Ribeye* Grilled Asparagus Potato Purée (idk if these are the right collection of items but it was delicious)
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view

1AIiClsuuT2aUi8iYAr-nQ.text: An exceptional experience, the food was excellent, the waiters attentive and personal, the view spectacular!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

psdPVEau3zzWSFH9vYao5g.text: The view is amazing day or night. The food was just as great! The service was also great.   I ordered the lunch pre fixed menu for $50. This came with a lobster bisque, filet mignon, large lobster tail, and chocolate fruit muse. They also serve complimentary bread with flavored butter.   Everything was just right. The lobster and steak was tender and very flavorful. The dessert was sweet and addictive. I will definitely be back and I would definitely recommend this place.   The only complaint that I have keeping it from reaching 5 stars is the building itself. The atmosphere is just run down and old looking.   The Stratosphere's campaign is to "take back Vegas" but they don't seem up to date with the new and upcoming resorts just down the street.   However, the view is definitely worth visiting! Very beautiful. They will charge you $20 just to visit the observation deck. But if you eat at the restaurant or visit the lounge, you can visit the observation deck for free.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the restaurant as it rotates past the strip.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch pre fix menu main course. Lobster tail and filet mignon.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert included in the lunch pre fix menu.

pW7q0CcyocDYtaGWfU1e4w.text: Like everyone else I must say the view is fantastic. I love being on the rotating platform looking at all parts of the city. We even saw a few of the sky jump people passing by the window. The service was also very good. The problem was the food for the price wasn't that great. I had the Caesar Salad with blackened salmon. I've had much better elsewhere. My daughter and wife didn't really think the Wagyu skirt steak sandwich was that good.  I wish I could rate it higher for the view.

5ABOhYEVEGzHhj-Xvwypqw.text: This restaurant was everything and more. Great valet service. Then the view from the restaurant was amazing. The floor moves while you're eating. The service was great and the food was amazing! For my first time in Vegas- I was in awe!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12oz . Wagyu Skirt Steak w. Twice Baked Potato , Bacon , Cheddar , Green Onion

f9EHaP3w7xeN8_R-2ACKBA.text: It's a good thing the food was good. My wife and I wanted a nice view for lunch. We are empty nesters and were out casually exploring the stratosphere. We decided springing for an expensive lunch was worth it for the view. And that's where it went bad.   We sat for 15 minutes before a waitress came over, and then told my wife to relax (it was not busy and 12:30 pm on a Sunday). We were immediately under the impression that we were not a high caliber guest. Translate: the "I don't think you can afford to eat here" look. I can't remember the last time I was made to feel unwelcome in a restaurant by superficial wait staff. On the other hand, the sweetheart taking care of our water and bread was attentive and respectful.   The food was very good but ridiculously overpriced. My wife and I eat out regularly and travel quite a bit, so we are not misplaced. For $40-80 a person I expect outstanding good and impeccable service. We got really good food and very poor service. The view: phenomenal.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tAnKjIK6VAitfWa4nlNCSw.text: First off, hands down best view in Vegas! You pay for the ambience. The seats are oriented for you to enjoy the view.   The pricing was on the expensive side for what you receive, but hey, you're paying for the venue as well.   The wait staff was absolutely wonderful. Very attentive and didn't rush you to eat and leave. Or drinks were always refilled without us asking. Five stars to the staff.   We started with an appetizer of foia gras. It was very well cooked on a bed of bread and caramelized apples. May not be worth the price but it was somewhat enjoyable. I would suggest trying something else if you want bang for your buck.   We also ordered the duck confit and the rack of lamb. The duck was a bit salty and dry, so maybe try something else as well.   The lamb on the other hand was amazing. Cooked to perfection, tender, and well seasoned. Definitely would get this again.   Also had an Arnold Palmer. Do not get this! Water down and nasty. I generally judge a place by how much time they put into the ingredients. Attention to detail is a must. This was lemon water with a splash of tea in ice.   My one True complaint is that I requested a window seat a day in advance for a Thursday which isn't very busy. And there were open tables at the window and they still didn't seat us. This made me drop the rating one star.   This place would have gotten three stars for the lesser table option and the duck I had, but the wait staff definitely raised it another star. I will give it another try and maybe change my review next time. So yes, I will be coming back.

ESnXiVFUyuzYdR83uHM2gQ.text: Had dinner with the fam (5 of us) on a Friday night. Amazing views!!!  Food was okay.  3 of us had the rib eye (smaller one), also ordered was the skirt steak and a pasta dish.  Sides were Brussel sprouts, mashed potatoes, green beans (these were tasty) and another potato dish.  For dessert I had the caramelized cheesecake...best thing I had!!  I feel like the food could have been more flavorful for the prices. Total bill was around $450.  Views were great though!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramelized cheesecake was bomb!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye

laBMOm_ffqAEWvEWHmhSDw.text: I love this place. It had a nice view and of course you can see Vegas by night. We enjoyed our BDay dinner with good foods and drink here. If you're looking for a romantic place then this is the one!!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rtyAhAAcSS-IQyTwO48qpA.text: In my opinion, 60% of the bill goes to the atmosphere and service we received. The quality of the meat was just okay. We paid $79 for the wagyu ribeye and ill be quite honest, i dont think that would be something ill ever order again... even if it was cheaper. The $72 grass New york steak was just okay as well. I had to drench the steak into a1 sauce and salt to get any flavor out of it. However, the meat was very tender which made up for it. Personally, i think eating at texas de brazil is a LOT better. They have a wider selection of meat that is very delicious. However, the best thing i have to say about top of the world is their baked potato. Oh my lordddd that is the most amazingly tasty baked potato ive ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Christmas menu/receipt
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decent grass ny steak
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meh wagyu steak

R7au7_7_aSf1p3pAaej04w.text: We visited the restaurant based on a lot of people's recommendations. And yes, it was worth it. We went for lunch in Saturday and the place was not too packed. The view is pure amazing. Reminds me of restaurants in the Shard/London and Paris. Different views but same idea of lunch with a view. On top of the view comes the rotation, which is really really interesting. It takes 1 hour and 20 minutes for a full rotation, which is the effect time for a lunch.  Their food is as good as their view. The lobster bisque and their ultra burger are memorable. In addition to their crab cake and steaks.  Skye was our waitress, and she was a funny and accommodating host.  Thanks !

fIu29Mi_Ab9Dmya4-t6IbQ.text: What an amazing experience  The food was to die for  The service was outstanding  Just the outlook of the entire city of Vegas Was worth every Pennie   The service was a little slow  Probably because it was Mother's Day  But I was so excited to be there  That I didn't care   One what an amazing experience

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top of the world and sweets
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top of the world

Poji68JPakcAdx7qw9s1Qg.text: Our aniversary, 22years! Food is a big part of our lives, so trying this was a must! First, the table was perfect right next to the window, unobstructed view as we twirled, our service also excellent, and the food was so good!  We got the four course tasting menu but got two extra apps. The big seafood trio with crab, colossal shrimps, and tuna tartar. Very good, we also got pork belly very tender.   Our tasting menu, we got the lobster bisque, fish, filet and desert trio.   Overall, very romatic, good food and great views!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PzhobC8rt-jG4UJfItNAVw.text: Amazing view of Vegas! Great service! Food was delicious, ordered the four course tasting menu! Thank you Todd for the wonderful experience!!! Had a great anniversary dinner!!!

SKGq2d3Qnn25_Mvb7757qA.text: Came here for my birthday dinner and requested a table along side the window. They didn't honor our request & had open tables. The food was aight.

GD8VRewRnT39cnhRsCTh3g.text: Micah was the best server in Vegas. He waited on our party of eight tonight and was so helpful and fun. Request him if you have a large party. Thanks Micah!

52HdLoDEEa47KU-gugHKrg.text: Excelent view, customer service and food. Big thanks to out waiters David and Jeff. They made our dinner extra special with their knowledge to all details on food and drinks! Highly recommend this place and will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oASkW3WxBxKvguSE49po5g.text: Ok if I could give stars for just the view  I would give 5 stars but the I expected waaaaaay more from the food being "on top of the world". Do not expect much. You are paying strictly for the view as it is breathtaking and we still cant stop talking about it. Now I made my reservation over the phone which she required a $50 deposit apparently because it was new years weekend. To get to this place is a journey in it self. You go on an elevator that goes 21 mph how cool. It's very tight security up there so be prepared. We immediately sat down to a window seat and were blown away. It was 1030pm and vegas lit up. So we started off with bread that was hard as a rock and almost broke my tooth. It is cool they bring you different flavor butters but damn why is the bread so hard? I could not even enjoy the butters because my tooth hurt from the bread. We ordered the pasta and chicken. Absolutely no flavor so bland I was appalled that this nice restaurant had this flavorless food. But we ate it anyway. Note to management: you need to change up your menus and head chefs because if this food was good this place would be the most amazing restaurant out there.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View  amazing
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hard as a rock breed that almost broke my tooth. I couldn&#39;t even enjoy the butters
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flavorless pasta but huge shrimp

FOjvBqu21d7PKG5Yd60nAQ.text: Do yourself a favor and take the $250+ you will spend on dinner for 2, elsewhere.   A little about myself: I worked in the restaurant industry for ten years. I've dined in restaurants at the same price point as Top of the World. I know a good steak when I taste one. You could call me a steak aficionado. I also know good service when I see it.   Trust me when I say, this restaurant was a COMPLETE waste of time AND money.  Let me start with the waitstaff: Lack of formality. Lack of menu knowledge. There were no recommendations made for us, no suggested appetizers, and no complementing glass of wine offered. I was indecisive about which glass of wine I wanted to pair with my $75 steak and the waitress said okay and stared at me before telling me she'd be back.  Water came right away. Then another waiter came and asked if we wanted water. Our glasses had just been filled. The bread basket was brought out quite timely. It contained five pieces of all different bread with four different types of butter, which were described nicely, but not by our waitress but the other waiter who failed to realize we already had water in front of us.   The food was horrible. The cocktail sauce for the Shrimp Cocktail was marinara.  The lobster tail didn't look right, nor taste right.  The steaks were huge but the flavor and texture were off. I let an 8 oz filet and 6 oz lobster tail go right to the garbage. The manager stopped over as soon as the food was dropped, before we had a chance to taste it, and we never saw him again.   The only thing that was decent was my glass of Shiraz and the view. Complete disappointment. Complete waste of money.

HvtizqEalMNdvPn8mAm-zw.text: Located near the end of the strip, the monorail only gets you so close.  You still have a good bit of walking to do to get there.  The hotel that you pass through it VERY old and dingy.  And for the record, they require business casual, but they don't enforce that rule during the summer due to the heat.  I found this out by sweating my ass off while walking in business casual attire only to see someone walking out of the restaurant in a t-shirt and cargo shorts.    Don't pay to ride to the top of the Eiffel Tower.  Don't pay to ride the Ferris wheel.  Have dinner here to get, without question, the best view of Vegas.  It doesn't even matter where you sit because the Stratosphere slowly rotates so you get to see a 360 degrees view.  They bring out various types of bread and various types of butters which I found all to be good.  My wife got the salmon.  The plating didn't look that nice to me but she said it tasted great.  I started off with the lobster bisque which was excellent.  The soup was followed up by the roasted chicken.  It was very tasty.  Could've used less salt, but the presentation was good and it tasted equally as good.  Stay away from the alcoholic beverages.  I wanted to try a couple of their martini's.  Didn't find out they were $15 a pop until afterwards.  And don't get sticker shock when you see your bill.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Loch Etive Salmon with Ginger Lemongrass Fleur De Sel.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Boneless Free-Range Half Chicken with Fresh Herbs, Pee wee potatoes, mushrooms.

g2w5tinjFJDetcAC1_sOvA.text: We were a party of four lingtime friends enjoying a great night in Vegas. We had an excellent experience beginning to end. The service was excellent, lead by our amazing server Judy.  All of our dinners were delicious and well prepared!

5Dh00ara1RGy_k3xb0o4KQ.text: If you want a fine dining experience in beautiful Las Vegas, this is the place to go.  I always wanted to dine on top of  the world and watch the city lights from below.  We came here around 4 pm, planning to make a reservation for 6 pm, while we spent time doing the crazy rides.  The lady at the booth helped us make our reservation and allowed us to bypass the security lines for the rides since we were their guest.  Upon checking in and requesting a window seat, the hostess said she would send us a text when our table was ready while we waited at the Observation Deck bar.    The hostess did hook us up as we got a nice table overlooking the strip.  Our waiter was friendly and came often to refill our drinks.  We shared a lobster bisque as our appetizer and the waiter even offered to give us two bowls.  The bisque was amazing and creamy.  We also got delicious bread with 3 types of butter.  I think it was normal butter, basil butter and mango butter.  For my entree, I ordered a seafood dish that had shrimp, scallop and lobster with a side of vegetables. I can't quite remember, but it was delicious, just a tad bit salty.  It was definitely portioned a lot better than the Lobster Tail I ordered at Alexander's that left me feeling unfulfilled.  The restaurant rotated slowly so that you could see the view of the strip.  It was romantic and refreshing.  My boyfriend joked that if he had a ring, it would have been the perfect place to propose.  We were full by the end of the night, so did not opt for any expensive dessert (especially since they no longer carried the delicious tiramisu that I read about).  When we inquired about any birthday dessert, they did bring out a little lava brownie, which was cute.  It was the perfect dinner to have before watching Le Reve.

cGZufigWATIAAWJq4HZESQ.text: This place was cute. It wasn't scary at all being up so high either. We got to see the bungee jumpers while we had dinner and that was cool. The service was impeccable. Super nice and super professional staff. The food was delicious no disappointment there at all. I just wish they had more seafood options lol I came here thinking they had king crab legs because of the photos and was disappointed when they didn't lol it's not their fault though. Menus change and I understand that. I had the filet mignon and it was perfect. The lobster bisque was rich and I had to stop myself from eating it all because I wanted to finish my main dish. Bread and butter was blah. All in all amazing :)

Yx240l1Bymye9fN9TJZT1w.text: The pros: The view. you save about 20$ just for going up.  the food was very very good, the service was excellent  The cons: Very overpriced.

FI4aubbU26ahZ4oOy6406A.text: The waiter is very cold, may be too tired? they charge you a split fee $15 without telling you in advance, when you find out, they will then show you on the menu with very tiny small words. They recommended you the best selection is the Surf & Turf, but the lobster is very dry and tough, fillet mignon is dry too!  It's very strange, because I went there few years ago, the Rib-eye is very tender juicy before, may be they change the chef, or the famous chef didn't cook anymore....it was a big disappointment for us. surf & turf $79 didn't worth it. the revolving tower provides good view.

JVpvd0KPyfYMjgCX5JP5TQ.text: The service was spot on. The view is outstanding. Sadly the food fell a bit short of great for the price paid. Lobster was tough and the bread was very soggy making it impossible to eat without a fork. I will probably not return but it was worth a one time experience.

vqoLOC0dYRnXJWaq_TNWYA.text: I made a reservation online for our 10 year anniversary. So very pleased! We anticipated paying more at a nicer restaurant and it was worth it! The service was spectacular from the moment we walked up to the security area. The hostesses were personable and our waiter was fantastic!   Please note: if you wish for a window seat, you may have to wait. Even online, when making the reservation it states it's based on how busy they are. All seats appear to have a good view, but obviously, the window view is preferred by many. We had a group sit next to us where a grown woman, quite literally, pouted for the duration of our meal. Luckily, for us... I requested a window and they weren't too busy when we arrived. I also noted it was our anniversary and each person (hostess, the lady who took us to our table, and the waiter) congratulated us on 10 years. A very nice touch!  I got the 14 oz. New York Strip, which comes with two small carrots. I also ordered the wine recommended for that dish - a great choice! The steak was flavorful and cooked perfectly. My husband got the rack of lamb and said it was the best he had ever had. I even tried it for the first time - and it was wonderful. We both got the caesar salad (the best salad I've had) and shared the potatoe puree side (comes with fontina cheese/breadcrumbs.) Everything, down to the bread with flavored butters, was incredible. While the dessert tray was enticing, we were too stuffed to think about trying anything.  As someone else mentioned, it might be nicer if folks stuck to a "fancier" dress code. The pouter mentioned above was in cutoffs and a tank, while folks surrounding her were in sports jackets. I'd definitely return and recommend to anyone. Thanks, Top of the World, for a great meal and experience.

yH49PD5X5S8KGfxddMnsUw.text: I can't believe we have never been up here!We have visited Vegas at least once a year since getting married 13 years ago. This was our first time and it was a wonderful experience. It takes 80 mins for a full rotation and we went around twice! Time flys when you're having a good time! The food was delicious. I started with the caprese, it was so fresh! I had the ribeye, and got the horseradish on the side. My husband ordered the filet. They were both well prepared. Not dry at all. Dessert was bananas foster. To see and taste is to believe! Our servers Sheila and Jaynar were so attentive and made this the BEST date night ever!

EolsaAJHp4aVxEyOuJ0USQ.text: My boo and I went here while in Vegas. We had a fantastic view sitting at the booth. I recommend requesting it when making a reservation. The other seats are great as well but the booth gives you a view a little higher up outward facing vs the tables that you'd have to turn your head to see things. We each had the tasting menu with the wine pairing. The food was excellent, and cooked perfectly.  The portions surprisingly generous, considering it's a tasting menu. The wine pairing was a great ad on I wish they were slightly more generous with the portions.  Service was excellent and courteous. Lastly there is a photographer who will take your pic if you'd like. There is a cost associated so be sure to ask first, we didn't and I felt bad when we only purchased 1 pic because I imagined it takes time and at least some cost to print and assemble the pics on the spot.

8wVvl8ve4zqiklCOSZzuow.text: Wow this was the best food I've had in Vegas by far. Came here with girlfriends and we came in rather late. The waitress was wonderful I wish I could remember her name but I know she was from long island- so sweet and truly accommodating and took her time with us especially with all of our questions. The best mashed potatoes with fontina and brussel sprouts I have ever had. The other girls had steak and fish and they loved it. I had a tagliatelle primavera and it was out of this world. The view is also beautiful and we got to watch people bungee jump off the top of the building during dinner. It was amazing! This is a must go to if you are in Vegas.

lkNnDoBeZ2KEz0kJdl08Xg.text: View was great, food was okay. We spent 30 minutes trying to get back down the elevator with a handicapped person because the elevators kept being full-- when we explained we're with a handicapped person who cannot stand for long periods of time they were not understanding. The frustration really ruined what was otherwise a nice evening celebrating a birthday.

q47OhKIieQyXMuc-dZpwDQ.text: Go for the view,  stay for thence meal and good service.  Once you're done your meal,  go up to the level with the rides.   Even if you don't ride them,  feeling the wind up there in warm weather is pretty great.

KaucPrkLAVOPgKmRf_K8Dw.text: WONDERFUL :D  Beautiful view of Las Vegas from way up high. Watching people on rides & dropping down from the SkyJump. So crazy! Haha I'm not enough of a daredevil to do those rides.   So we had an AMAZiNG dinner here for my parent's 25th anniversary. We got a champagne that our server recommended which was delicious. Then we had the trio appetizer of the foie gras, crab cakes, & scallops. That was my favorite thing there! Soooo freaking YUMMM. Then we had the Surf & Turf which was also good.   Service was very attentive & superb.   I would definitely come back again for a special occasion :)

CAKPFIzC5U9A-La7OHuzXg.text: If you want to have a sexy evening with that someone special, by all means make your reservation now at the Top of the World Restaurant. The food quality and presentation is nothing short of fantabulous!  Go there before sunset and you will enjoy an amazing sunset from the top of the Stratosphere. The restaurant itself rotates 360 degrees each and every hour. You will see the Las Vegas city lights come alive! The wine selection is outstanding and the staff is simply the best. By the way, order their world famous Chocolate Tower. It is absolutely perfect with a great wine!!  Bon Appetit!!

n_PJ4Pq2gKHtua6wlYhpnQ.text: HORRIBLE!!! The only thing great is the view of Las Vegas!!! For starters, when my drink arrived to my table, it was in a dirty glass. It still had red lipstick from the previous customer. GROUSE!! When the meal arrived, it was not cooked as we had ordered. We specifically ordered Medium Rare and it was sent out done. Soooo done, like a boot. The steak was horrible and for what you pay ( $60 plus ), it's not worth it. This is the worst experience I've ever had!! Save your $$$ and go elsewhere. Such a waste of time and a HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!!!!! They don't even deserve one star, that's how bad it was.

Q1wbd63e-SKOjT9gViUCTQ.text: Returned to ToW for lunch after a few years' absence. We love the view and as always, had great service.  The food never disappoints.  Husband had a wonderful burger (cheese, beef and shredded short rib meat!!! - yummo).  Not being that hungry, I ordered a small green salad - (hold the beets): about $12.  I asked that they add some grilled shrimp, just to make it more interesting.  Four (4) large shrimp surrounded my salad greens -- very tasty and just the right amount for me.  Then the bill arrived.  Salad:  $35.00.  Are you kidding me???? $22.00 for four shrimp???    Where did they have to go to get them?   I can overlook overcharging for wine at $12 - $16 a glass - but come on: $ 5.50 for one shrimp????

kOJCyN_WTslviztfZUo-Tw.text: Happy hour (of course) is half off certain appitizers and 2 for 1 drinks (needs to be the same drink). We ordered the hummus, cheese plate, and carpaccio. All delicious! The carpaccio melts in your mouth, the hummus was smooth, and cheese plate speaks for itself. The bartenders were all super nice and attentive. If I had one negative, the elevator girl was not friendly or nice but I don't care about her.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Part of the bar
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view

x7u8kTlISvaJzNySNC013w.text: The view was definitely the best part of the meal.  Which is not to say the food is terrible, but it definitely isn't great.  I got the NY strip and my friend got the Ribeye.  We both ordered them medium rare but they came out more medium than medium rare.  Which wasn't terrible, but not what we ordered either and for 50 bucks a steak you should get it as you want it.  My Fiance got the Prawns, scallops and lobster and thought it was good but not great.  And my friend's wife got the center cut filet which she enjoyed.    All in all it wasn't a bad dining experience, just for the price I feel there are better restaurants on the strip.  But the view is amazing.

AAKDZ00Gy-MhCmOw50gvYQ.text: Five stars! Great service (Joseph was our server that night) and one of the best fine dining restaurant (rotating restaurant) with a breathtaking view at Sin City. I would recommend it.

8zmxU6LYCbLwsM39-SfZqg.text: Great view entertainment & food. My portobello sandwich was so good I want to replicate it. But not so good on my family's choice. New York steak sandwich was little too tough. Pricy though. Holy smoke! I have to get a second job to eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roller coaster on top of the building &amp; I&#39;m having lunch inside
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gn3DGGxZYS-p4czcISbBQg.text: I came here with a group of 6 friends & I was amazed at how great the service, food, and atmosphere is! 1st, the view is amazing and the ambiance is beautiful. 2nd, the wait staff is great and very attentive. 3rd, the food was fabulous. I ordered the salmon & it melted in my mouth. The lobster bisque is great too. Had the best time 10/10 would recommend!

wSgnhSLbZLuTfVHoBxW8lg.text: The whole experience gets 5 stars with 4.5 on the food. While good, the cheapest steak if $47, but remember that it would cost you to go up to the observatory anyway, so we tried to mentally subtract the cost of just that ticket from the meal price. We spent about $250 for the 3 of us. The service was great - Glenn - our server, was phenomenal. Loved the view. We ended up going around 2 revolutions (and we had wanted a leisurely meal so we could see both day and night views (our reservation was at 6:45 to facilitate this in mid-August). After dinner, we walked up to the next two decks, the top deck being open air observation deck. There, you could catch a glimpse of the people doing the "attractions." It was our son's 10th birthday and we made a reservation on OpenTable and noted it was his birthday. Everyone who helped us from hostess to Glenn made a point to wish him Happy Birthday, which made him feel special. While we didn't order desert because were were full from a delicious lobster bisque (with lobster in the center of the bowl and the soup poured around it at table), and the skirt steak, Glenn surprised our son with a s'more dessert with a candle. It made his night very special. They also called you by name and gave you that extra special attention. All our needs were met - from a request for more garlic pesto butter, to making a special virgin drink for our son. It is definitely something we were glad we did once while in Vegas. There is a photographer who comes around to take your picture (like on a cruise ship) but there wasn't any real pressure to (a) take the photo or (b) buy them (approximately $65).

F9BzUqrg76Yf1DPVvRaSiA.text: The view is spectacular when the strip is visible but not so much on the dark side while dining late at night. You can feel the vibrations from the thrill rides above you. The food is excellent and quality but portions are small. If you plan on leaving full, expect to spend near $100 per person. This place is a must for us if we are in Vegas with somebody who has never eaten there before. I enjoy sharing the experience with them!

vhv5jbRj9lqbz5YCJ9Gocg.text: I made a reservation two months in advanced and my boyfriend and I couldn't wait to check out the most beautiful view in Vegas. Our server was more than happy to walk us through the menu and offer his opinion, and he recommended this 4 course tasting menu for $90. As he was explaining what the offer entailed it is my opinion that he purposely mislead us to believe that it was $90 for two people when in reality it was $90/ per person. As he was explaining what we got for our money he used phrases like "You each get to pick from one of the following options" and "this deal is perfect for couples". I remarked that it seemed like a deal too good to be True and he confirmed that it was the "Best value on the menu for parties of 2" needless to say we were more than a little shocked when we received our bill and saw that it was double what we had expected it to be.   Instead of confronting the waiter we paid the bill (tip included) and left right away, feeling tricked and a little stupid.   Pros: Easily the most delicious steak either of us have ever had. Cons: Felt mislead and tricked by our server.

r-lI0MzPibM_xmm5ucnSSw.text: I had dinner last week at Top of the World, and I was not impressed at all. I ordered the $56 New York Steak, au gratin potatoes, and crab cake appetizer. For the price I paid I was expecting so much more. My steak barely had any flavor and it was tough/gristly. Seriously I've had better steaks cooked at home or at Outback Steakhouse. The crab cakes tasted alright, nothing special, but it was such a small portion. The appetizer was for two people and only came with one crab cake ($18). However, the au gratin potatoes were good. That was the only thing I felt was worth paying for.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No flavor steak... Not worth $56.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake for two...

RAP0MZbFM0dDllystD_6OA.text: My wife brought me here for a birthday lunch. The views were beyond amazing. We have eaten at restaurants just like this in New York Hawaii and Canada , after being at this location we realized this place has the best views. Our waiter was fantastic and on point. The place is expensive however it is worth it. The only part that bothered me as to why this place is getting a 4-star and not a 5-star review is our plates and silverware we're not clean. Asked for a new set and they gave us a new set right away. However they were not clean either. For a place so beautiful and definitely not on the cheap side I would expect the basics to be a no-brainer.

dLHY4YDrovVB9pSQ35YrZg.text: I wasn't all that thrilled about going to an overpriced lounge with a spectacular view, but what sold me was the Hamburger sliders.  Yes, hamburger sliders.  We went during lunch time since it's cheaper and we didn't want to roll in with our tourist clothes and awkwardly try to get a table while the fancy people scoffed at us under their drinks. It was quiet when we go there and ordered drinks (which were ok).   But damn, those sliders have been haunting my mind so much that I would fly back to Las Vegas, eat them, and go right back home if I wanted to. I don't know what special sauce they put it them, but the sliders are delicious! I still think I can taste them right now.   So do yourself a favor, go during lunch on an off day, grab a drink, eat some sliders, and watch the crazies bungy jump off the building.

4rFyWthTOVT4Qnf6QEMC6w.text: Top of the world! It was my mom's birthday  So I took her to this place to experience the view of las vegas. When I first arrived, I was amazed by the view Yes, that's why I came here for. I kinda expected that the food is not gonna be that great. I said that we're paying for the view to my mom But it was totally dispointing. Filet mignon steak... it was steak. Nothing special  Seafood alfredo . I could have made better than this Half duck... my step dad tasted a piece and he never put his folks back to that dishes  I'm giving 3 star for the view only

qDOkkww9KTgi3R3p01KMzA.text: The whole experience did not disappoint! From the hostess to the waiter, everyone was so friendly! Food was amazing, and the ambience was awesome. Every one and a half hrs, he restaurant does all full rotation so you get to see all of Las Vegas from the top. I felt a little sick when I looked out the window, and again when we saw people bungi jumping right Above us...but the overall experience is something you won't find elsewhere. The wagu steak and fontina mashed potatoes were off the hook....and the wine pairings that we added to the prefixed dinner course were on point. Lobster bisque is poured right in front of you....so the experience was a 10 too! Definitely will be coming back. Oh, don't forget to make a reservation, I don't think they take walk ins?!?!!

3vZjQp18TzzMMsji2DtGLg.text: The Top Of the World located in the Stratosphere is one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas. it offers the best view of the city. its pricey but well worth it. If you want to impress a date or if you want to have a romantic dinner with the wife this is it. Make a reservation and wear your best suit.

QRxC7XKAInhcGTrIHbezWQ.text: This was a breath taking experience for my boyfriend and I. His custom cake was beautiful, the service was amazing, and the view is one to remember for a lifetime!! One of my most beautiful memories of Las Vegas!

oUtijEGt7HjAw5Zqp7rA1g.text: Decided to come here for my hun and my 5th anniversary!   I was so impressed by everything. The view is so amazing and it was purely a lot of fun. We saw a bunch of bride in their pretty dresses and of course the rides that hung off around the restaurant.   I ended up getting the 5-course tasting menu and my hun got an N.Y. steak. The N.Y. steak was pretty good and the waiter was so nice that we were able to switch the sauce for a different sauce.   5-course meal  Caesar salad-average  crab cake-so good, loaded with tons of crab meat fish-it was okay  filet Mignon-so tender and yum-e-yum dessert (would have ordered a different one)   Service was the best. Love that they changed our plate every time a new dish came out. Always on time with the water and food. Our waiter was the best too. He helped us take a nice picture and even helped us change the setting to our camera.   This place is so amazing that we end up making it an every 5-year anniversary spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uJi0vtrq_4WD4pd4TMQyMw.text: I was very excited to dine here with my fiance for our anniversary today. We made a reservation weeks ago for lunch at 3, because the lunch menu is reasonably priced. $50 per person as opposed to $102 per person. We arrived on time and it took about a half hour to seat us and right before we were seated we were told it's ONLY dinner menu, for today? I asked why and that when I made my reservation no one told us that. The chef and establishment is trying to con us out of our money just to make more money for New Years. Needless to say we left and ate elsewhere! Top of the world ruined our anniversary because they are money hungry and also didn't have the common sense to say it's only dinner all day UNTIL we were basically seated. When I called I made sure it was going to be lunch at 3 pm and I was told it would be. Never ever ever eating nor coming here again in my entire life! They ruined what was suppose to be a special day for my fiance and I. Selfish and money hungry.

REVDTauN8l2FysoZQcZ5Vg.text: Enjoy the best meal in town with the best views. Fine dining at its best with spectacular views of the city and the mountains. We planned out reservation to watch the sunset. The pork belly appetizer was phenomenal. The rack of lamb was absolutely velvety and delicious, and prepared to perfection. The Colorado ribeye was garnished with a horseradish garlic spread that added so much to the presentation and flavors. This experience is definitely one for the books. If you are visiting Las Vegas or a local this has to be a place to dine.

8CnAymudTnu17DNmayTENQ.text: I love Vegas and I loved my sandwich.  The only reason it's missing a star is because I didn't get entirely "settled in".  Tall places give me the heebie jeebies and when I saw the jumpers (from the ride) for the first time I got kinda spooked. I felt better when the restaurant 'revolved' to the other side where I couldn't see them.  But regardless, the food was excellent, I highly recommend going in a group/birthday setting because it's more fun. I would definately go again.

kZopAH5zCJgXP1Bn7XAV6Q.text: Excellent restaurant. Perfect combination of view, service and food.  I ordered the lobster thermidor, and my bf got the ribeye steak. Our friends ordered the duck Confit and the Chilean sea bass.  All the meals were superb.

hn96pvhkkG57oDmsu49rvA.text: Top of the World or Vegas world at least.  At the last moment, my eating companions decided to eat here versus somewhere else.  It was off the strip but was told well worth the cab ride and the view is spectacular.  Yep, despite the location away from the strip, I would have to agree that this place is great for the breathtaking views and their food.  Located in The Stratosphere tower, you have to make your way up to the 106 floor to this lounge/restaurant.  I am told that it takes approximately 120 min to go around the valley of Vegas.  The views are great during your dining experience with no obstructing view for your enjoyment.  Though the menu is a little pricey, you get good food and view.    We bought our own bottle of wine so it saved us a bit for the food.  For our appetizers, I got the tuna tartare. That was ok. Kinda fishy.  The oysters were good along with the foie gras.  Better eat them while you can before California's law goes into effect in July. No foie grae. Ugh!!!!  Again, I decided to order the Muscovy duck with a light glazed with asian bok choy and lightly seasoned salad on the side.  It was asian fusion-like that was quite good, surprisingly.  While my other companion decided to go with steak, lamb chops and more foie gras.  The food was quite good.  I would come here for the food more so than the view.  I can't take the view home but I certainly can take the food home.  In my belly. Lol  The service was attentive and I have to give it to our waitress who did an excellent job to accomodate our palates. Again, it was an expensive dining experience, but for the view along witht the food, you can  not put a pricetag on such.

Z3_QuDLeCYET3clKLRMgCg.text: I loved it here. The food was really good and filling. Surprised because restaurants like these never fill me up. We ate here during the sunset so we got to see all of Vegas through the sunset and then with all the lights! Loved that you are rotating while eating so it doesn't matter where you sit. also in a perfect pace so you dont get lightheaded or dizzy.

f2SrPXuuMR37NCJkrzaTPQ.text: Celebrated my birthday here! Awesome view, good food. Sure it's expensive as all hell but hey, it's Vegas! I requested a table and not a booth in my reservation and they gave me just that! I'll admit, going thru the metal detectors was a bit weird but I didn't remember it until after I left and saw the detectors again. Had the steak and double baked potato. Good choices, the chocolate cake was banging!!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pics of the view, our food, and the bill... Basically as much as my monthly cable lol

pM9RyR1-z9iBXWJo9h6asQ.text: Service: 5 stars.  Dan and Rocky were fantastic, personable, attentive.. you name it. Food: 3 stars.  Gnocchi with lobster/short rib was good, not great.  (Gnocchi was a little grainy/too soft and squishy.)  Kids' filet, while a neat idea, was $30 for a 5 oz cut.  Wife liked her cobia and crab cake (a little too much garnish on crab cake for her taste.)  Pork belly appetizer was pretty good.  Views are great (go about an hour before sunset and watch the day turn to night), our kids were well-behaved (and complimented, always cool) and the drinks are good (wife loved the blueberry martini and the sangria is good.)  It's pretty fucking pricey but you are paying for the experience.

2EZVKBEwCbkZdElBvTpWkg.text: We celebrated my husband's birthday by having dinner here. The food was amazing. It was pricey but you got excellent meal, amazing view and friendly service. The restaurant revolves 360 degrees. We had chicken alfredo pasta, lobster and scallops (I dont remember the name of this dish), lentil soup and salmon sandwich. All were delish!

paLnS3RpbOkfdXkq1iZlGQ.text: - Decor' 3 stars - Service 2 stars ( Dennis ) if in not mistaken on the name was our waiter needs improvement, couple other guys,food runner was good. Looked around and other waiter takes good care of their customers. - Food overall presentation 3 stars, could be better. Food taste: - Lobster Bisque 3 stars - Crab cakes 4 stars - Foie grass 1 star, really needs improvements. - Lobster tail 2 stars - Sauteed mushrooms 2 stars - Potato puree 4 stars - Bone in Prime Rib eye 3.5 stars  And of course The view 5 stars.!

8Rih7QUc0SFvumwu_VjzZg.text: Food was excellent. Servers, excellent. Getting us to our table on time, fail. We arrived 30 minutes early. We had a party of 6, it was a birthday celebration and we had a limousine scheduled to pick us up after dinner. At our appointed scheduled dinner time, they refused to seat us because two of our party had not arrived. 20'minutes...  refused! Almost 30 minutes...Still refused. Finally, I told them, we're on a schedule and if the last two don't show up, they simply won't eat. We're not going to destroy this birthday celebration and lose our limo ride because of two people. I could not believe this treatment. I'm sure if Wayne Newton said he was ready now, they would not experience this kind of service. They finally seated us. When our limo arrived, I had to pay for the driver to sit outside while we finished dinner.  If you're entire party is not on time, don't expect to eat until they show up.

aGE41JDHtQVjd_tQleNn7w.text: In general I feel like this place is really nice and such a cool experience to be so high up and getting an amazing view of Las Vegas but for the price they definitely need to put more effort into their hiring process. I didn't really feel like the servers were as courteous and definitely did not give what I would consider five star service. Just being honest  \_()_/

69q2zIZcoNUG0CT5vu-OFA.text: Started off the night with a considerable wait despite having a reservation. Service was slow--tables sat after we ordered recieved their appetizers and entrees before we got any food. We got wagyu ribeyes, and I've had better non-wagyu ribeyes, so that was extremely disappointing. Overall it's a cool view and I'd grab a cocktail here, but the food and experience were not worth the money, especially when there are so many outstanding restaurants in Vegas.

NI8BKZY1D8zTuBjJ2R-RrQ.text: Definitely a great view of Las Vegas. The creme brulee was to die for. Caesar salad and steak were also delicious. The floors move so that each table does a full rotation around the restaurant and a complete view of Las Vegas. An all-around great place to dine for a nice night out.

M6Mi2GoeuECHbvFl_-bYSw.text: Came here because of a group deal that actually wasn't much savings. However, the three course lunch meal was fantastic.  Filet Mignon and lobster tail...delightful. Great view even on a rainy day. My server was very sweet. The revolving view is an hour and twenty minutes. I think the service is based on that amount of time so if you're in a rush you should let them know. I'll definitely be back.

CuSpdtIBhK7z3v5_q_c-EA.text: It was outstanding. The view and move is so subtle and.  The wait and reservations are worth it. I almost recommend having a drink at the bar becuase you will have to wait even with reservations. But its okay.  The view is stunning. The food was great. I recommend try something different.  Lobster mac and cheese. Phenomenal  chicken and crab and salmon.. worth the drive.

6RXHYagkCdBBZtWUeUtqIA.text: Honestly - the food wasn't that great. Extremely expensive and was just sort of bland. The service was very very slow and it didn't even seem that busy.  They charged my credit card twice. (121 dollars x 2)  and blamed my bank. Now they're telling me it's going to take 2 weeks to get my money back. And on top of that they added 20 dollars onto the 20 dollar tip I gave!!! They also had a photographer who was rude when you didn't want to buy her overpriced photos at the end of the meal. The 2 stars is for the view.

oc6mSMvC1KsvxdjyNnHYBA.text: The best anniversary dinner  and considering we live here and we have been to a lot of places! All of the items from the pictures were amazing! Starting with the appetizers to the desserts !  Highly recommend for people that want to enjoy a nice view through their dinner

Snng73olRbltqDbfmv3rig.text: The view and the atmosphere was amazing. The host and the waitress were extremely helpful and had great customer service.   We just stopped in before catching our party bus, but the food came out in a really decent time and was cooked great and tasted amazing.  The elevator line takes a little while depending on what events they have going on, but the crew is really efficient.   We're definitely going back.

cMoOJs_FTToKaYaNDFzu6A.text: Very nice experience and good food,service is excellent! Will be back next time in Vegas

kjeXGR7ed8Kf4Kgpu8dvOw.text: My wife wanted to go here for her birthday, biggest problem for me is that I do not like heights. First of all the elevator ride to the restaurant takes only 32 seconds which is really moving. The staff from the elevator operator to the reception area at the top were all polite and professional. The view is amazing and the rotating platform you are on gives you great views of the city.  We were brought to our table and our server came over quickly. He was knowlegable and had a very good personality. The food quality was very good. My wife had the prix fix dinner which included king salmon and prawns. I had the lobster thermador which consisted of a two and a half pound Maine lobster. Both meals were prepared well and I know my wife would like to go back. The only thing is the cost of the food was quite pricey but I guess that includes the view. For the two of us with one drink each and tip it came to just under $400.  If you are looking for the total experience it is worth it, but if you are looking for a restaurant in that price range there are better options.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k432tjRKx4RZNNsu0bELNA.text: I have lived in Vegas since the 80's. I have been coming to the Strat since it was Bob Stupak. I been dining at the Top of the world since it opened. THIS WAS  THE WORST EXPERIENCE I ever had. I can understand changes happening when the company changes ownership. That's Vegas but these changes were all terrible.    Let's start with my family's and friends favorite appetizer the Pork Belly.  It's no longer on the menu. WTF? The menu has been cut down with very limited options.  I ordered the ribeye med rare. It came out dripping blood. WOW!  My mom order the filet mignon med rare and it came out cooked perfectly.  I wanted to try something different for the Top of the World so my side item was the macaroni lobster.  It came out looking like and tasking like  it came from the box  called Suddenly Salad. Yuck.   Time for dessert! Why would you take away the dessert cart?  Bad Move!  Sight is 100% up sale on its own. The cart would pass the table and you would pick out what you were going to have for dessert before you ordered the main entree.  I will not be coming back unless I hear of some original menu items coming back.

yr1YGM5b6ZhHvfmryHqwwA.text: Great place to have a relaxing lunch while getting the entire view of Vegas. The food was marvelous. We only had a light lunch since our breakfast haven't settled yet. The warm spinach salad was light enough for me. We also had the lobster macaroni. We didn't expect that much lobster meat in it. Quite a great deal! My mom had the crab cake and she enjoyed it very much. Unfortunately, I forgot to take any pictures of the food. Was mostly absorbing the view. I must say the service was incredible. They really made you feel very welcomed and attentive, but not in the annoying kind. They just appear when you need them. Once again, I think I will definitely come again next time when I visit.

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WtoVB4ZbaWfWD-dfvhqbtg.text: We had dinner at Top of the World in the Stratosphere and it was a fun experience.  The restaurant revolves 360 degrees so you get a great view of all of the strip, downtown and the outskirts of Las Vegas.  The menu is minimal - focusing on classic like Wagyu, Chilean Sea Bass and Lobster Thermidor.  I had the salmon - it was served with green beans, polenta and a small side of lobster.  I chose the Riesling, which the menu said paired well with the fish dish.   I wasn't disappointed.  The salmon was delicious!  It was beautifully presented on the bed of polenta with the lobster and green beans on top.  The salmon was perfect; buttery and flaky and it was absolutely delicious with the polenta.  We also had the cheesecake for dessert and, of course, it was absolutely decadent!  A perfect way to finish off our dinner.  The only downside was the long wait for the elevator (there's only two elevators to the top) and when the restaurant rotated around towards the sun, it was IN YOUR FACE.  They had shades for the windows but only for the bottom panes, not the top.  So the sun was shining in my face for a bit until we rotated away from it.  I'd definitely recommend having dinner here later in the evening when the strip is lit up.  I'm sure it's an absolutely amazing view.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon with lobster, polenta and green beans.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramelized cheesecake mousse

Rv_HiJp3PRd4_8WSz1dJkw.text: What an experience!! I have been wanting to check this place out since I moved to Vegas and finally had the chance. I'm scared of heights so I was very relieved when we were escorted to a booth a good distance from the windows but you faced the windows, you also face the table directly informant of you so it can kinda seem like your staring at them eat.  The view was absolutely breathtaking, being able to look out into the city to the mountains simply beautiful. Be warned you might see a jumper lol half of the restaurant gasped when someone was on the free fall thing.  We were seated and the waiter was right with us, he gave us a rundown of the menu and he's recommendations.  The wait staff was absolutely amazing they make you feel very important while your there. I went with the taster menu that gave me 4 courses price was $103.  It came with my choice of two different salads and lobster bisque, I went with the lobster bisque because I had never had it before and I figured if I'm going to try it a upgrade restaurant would be the place to try it. I enjoyed it, there were a few pieces of lobster and it was extremely rich in flavor. Second choice was out of scallops, pork belly or portobello mushrooms, I already had my eye on the pork belly. It was paired with corn black beans green onion and a salsa. The flavors were so good together I could have eaten more. Main course I went with the Fillet mignon and shrimp scampi that also had green beans and mashed potatoes. The steak melted in my mouth, the shrimp were nice size and delicious.  My husband ordered steak and lobster. The first thing my husband said when he cut into the steak was "just like cutting butter, I can tell this is going to be good" he agrees with my five stars. I definitely recommend giving this place a try if your looking for a romantic place to eat and for a special occasion. You will be paying about $150-200 minimum per person.

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A6PWpe93rxhgU_WXi_jpRg.text: Went to celebrate a friends birthday it such a nice atmosphere and scenery upstairs although downstairs looks so old n out dated, but this is located in "old Vegas " urs not just paying for food but also the view

f9r4FuURkTX0gFgnp_jEeg.text: I visited this place when I went to Vegas for my birthday around late February/ early March and the food was amazing! I got a steak (forgot what cut) medium rare and it was juicy and buttery it literally melted in my mouth! I got it with a side of fries (mediocre tbh) and a side of lobster mac & cheese that I had to order two of because it was so good my sister took it from me! The waitress seemed to be in a rush taking our order-- but she was kind overall. I asked for a wine pairing recommendation and I didn't like the wine that was recommended but I don't really like reds anyway so it was my fault. My sister ordered the chicken breast (not pictured) and it was equally delicious. Some of the best cooked chicken I've ever had. Also the restaurant spins in circles as you dine but it's very subtle so you don't get nauseous. I sat further back (pictured) but maybe sitting right next to the window might have been a different experience in terms of nausea. Only down side was the lighting-- very dark, but that's to be expected in steak houses. Also VERY pricey but since the food and the experience was good, I did not mind! Besides this is a place you go to treat yourself, not your local steakhouse you visit a couple times a month. If you're not willing to splurge on great steak, and a great view, don't bother. BUT if you're down, eat here ONCE and you won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table set up
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My dinner -- steak, lobster mac &amp; cheese, garlic fries

EyP9cDcBXalqvg0kZjOx6A.text: Fine dining restaurant located on the 106th floor of the Stratosphere tower.  You access the restaurant from the main casino floor. You check in at the front desk of the lower floor then you go through security. Security will search your bag and you have to go through a metal detector.  The elevator will take you up to the 106th floor where a hostess will bring you to your seat. TIP: reserve a window table for the best view in Las Vegas. You get 360 degree views of the city because the restaurant rotates.  The menu is on the pricier side. Be prepared to spend about $100 a person before drinks. We got the chef's tasting menu which was about $100 a person. We added the wine tasting which was an additional $30 a person. The wines were pre selected but you have two or three options for the food items.  I had the lobster bisque to start which was excellent. My next course was the scallop, yes singular because it was one. It was average. For my main course I had the filet mignon. It was a generous size and came with mashed potatoes and green beans. It was very delicious and filling. The last course, dessert, was creme brulee and chocolate mousse. The creme brulee was good but the chocolate mousse was outstanding. All the wine pairings were tasty and complimented the courses.  The waitstaff was very friendly.  TIP: Dining in the restaurant gets you complimentary access to the 107 bar and the observation deck. Rides are an additional fee.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drinks in the 107 lounge
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasting menu

ueDhWbcR2BCm2f8a9R17Aw.text: First time coming here for date night. Arrived around sunset and watched the city light up as the evening went on. The restaurant takes 80 minutes to complete a revolution--we had enough food and drink to make three laps:) There were four Sommeliers to assist with your favorite wine. The seafood tower was excellent and was more than enough for two people. Also had the fillet and stuffed chicken-both fantastic but brought most if it home as we were stuffed from all the chilled seafood. Wine was great, cocktails were great. Assorted bread basket was a nice addition too. We didn't make it to the observation deck that night due to rain and lightning that kicked up at the end of dinner. We came back a couple nights later, explained what happened and of course they let us back up top for some outdoor viewing. Just prior to making it to the top, we stopped in the lounge one floor below for some drinks, comfortable seating, and great views. Go and enjoy. Cheers!

-QVcT1OQNpdt13eWl_svrg.text: Amazing view!!! Had their course meal, amazing food! Did their wine pairing, hated that! Lol But I don't not like wine, so don't let that stop you. Also, ask the sit on outside near glass!! Bought the pictures from someone who walks around taking pictures, girlfriend was skeptical about them. But we ended up loving one of the pictures. Take your time eating, so it can go all the way around at least one. Tipped the waiter real nice, and he came running out while I was leaving and thanked me so much. Made me feel good.

obs-eGiDYdJvNNyrxT5Q-A.text: If you'd like checking out spectacular views of Las Vegas then top of the world is where you want to be! We decided to go to Celestia which was playing at the Strat and had some time before hand and decided to pop up for the happy hour at Top of the World bar.  The views are absolutely stunning! The bar is located above the restaurant and has many sitting areas around the bar along with seating at the bar. The happy hour was offering half off drinks specials and appetizers. We decided to just grab a drink before the show and check out the gorgeous views of Las Vegas.  The bartending staff was very friendly and attentive. The environment was very clean. And the views are what make it all so amazing! I definitely recommend going to this bar and checking out the amazing views 360!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spectacular views!!!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The restaurant below the bar area!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area!

9xAeiAbPCbx37D9A4IfhXQ.text: A visit to the Top of the Stratosphere was on our to do list while in Vegas. Doing research, the Top of the World restaurant got great reviews so we decided to make a lunch experience. At $60 pp for lunch , it is not cheap for a family of four but it was well worth it. If you buy lunch, it includes the otherwise $25 fee for a ticket to the rotating top of the space needle which I believe is or used to be the tallest structure in Vegas.  The Stratosphere hotel itself is unremarkable....somewhat old, outdated and it smells of your aunts basement who chain smokes. However, once we got to the top for lunch, it is a different world,... refined, sophisticated and the views were stunning. What's more, the food was even better! I ordered the steak and lobster, with a Caprese salad as my appetizer. Wifey has Crab cakes and lobster bisque. We all had creme brulee for dessert.  All I can say is...$&;@!  Best meal we had in Vegas. I'll spare you the details but every single item was sheer perfection. Add to that the rotating view of the strip and surrounding mountains and it was a truly memorable experience!  At the top are also several death defying rides (see YouTube). While my family did not have the stomach to get on the rides, we spent quite a bit of time watching others take the challenge. We took lots of pics as well.   Highly recommend putting this experience on your Vegas list.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crime Brûlée with caramel popcorn. Outstanding!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stratosphere tower
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table

pvQoGXZY_H3czTCEAg4GeA.text: This was a GREAT dining experience!  Luckily I was able to score a really good deal with a Groupon where I had 4 courses for $88.  I had the Caesar Salad, Crab Cake, Salmon & Salted Caramel Creme Brulee.  Everything was amazing...paired with an amazing view of Las Vegas as the sun was setting.  A bonus was watching 2 people jump from the top of the building.  The customer service was great and the wait staff was very attentive.  This was my first trip to Vegas, and I can't say I'm a fan but dining at Top of the World made my trip memorable enough that if by chance I visit Vegas again I would be sure to dine here.

A3gDt96rZalVCSQsS8JYsA.text: Came here on a Monday night the day I was supposed to leave. I had such a profound experience that I stayed longer and didn't end up going home on Monday. Service was prompt, attentive and the ambience humbling. The first drink didn't have the bold flavors of an old fashioned but the second did, it was definitely perfected. Sherene was a pleasure to interact with and definetely enhanced the role et of my night and early morning. Thank you!

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Family
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. From the bottom to the top

vD4zP9lbkH_G-VlAuBCJVQ.text: My fiance and I ate here to celebrate our anniversary. I love scenic views and the view up there was amazing. It is a revolving restaurant so you are able to see EVERYTHING. You can even see airplanes waiting to deplane, which was awesome. This restaurant is located inside the STRAT hotel.   Tip/ I would make reservations in advance. We did not have to wait for our table to be ready. We were able to be seated right away and our seat was next to the huge glass windows. We were able to see the view of everything pretty up close.   Ambiance/ Romantic for sure. Candlelit and pretty dim lighting so you are able to see the nice view outside.   Food/ So good. I ordered the lobster bisque as an appetizer and it was delicious. I also ordered the scallops and they were made perfectly. My fiance ordered the 16oz ribeye steak, and it was juicy. Some restaurants when we order steak, they end up being really dry and chewy, with no flavor at all. The steak at Top of the World, was flavorful. We also ordered the 21 layered chocolate cake for dessert. SO GOOD. But since it was a big slice, we ended up taking it home as well. Portions are great.   Service/ Waitress and Waiters were awesome and on top of everything. Checking in every once in a while to see how we were doing. Offering to top off our waters. She even offered to take our picture! We never had to waive down a server to help us out. They beat us to it always, which is by far the best service we have ever received.   Photographer/ There are photographers going around asking if you'd like to take photos. I RECOMMEND THIS. Especially if you are out on a date with your loved one. The pictures came out perfect. It is something we will treasure for the rest of our lives.   Would I come back? That is a definite yes.  If you have not tried this place out, I suggest you do! Perfect for date night!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wey1d_ILxS_FPF3iWmo6DA.text: Top of Vegas means you gotta be up on the Stratosphere for an epic meal. We came here for my friend's birthday dinner and it was a spectacular event with a rotating dining area and bungee jumpers taking the plunge. Don't come to eat here if you don't like seeing people falling.  Since you're paying for the view, expect to pay some high end prices for your meal. Their menu consists of mostly new American options such as cuts of meat, seafood, and more. On the night we went, they offered a tasting menu for $106 where you can sample a lot of their specialties. Given my budget, I opted for their RIbeye ($59) and split some table sides of asparagus and Brussels sprouts.  First came the bread basket which was utterly disappointing. Our bread was incredibly stale so for the first time ever, I decided to not touch it beyond the first few bites. One of their bread options was so stale that you can use it as an edged weapon.  My ribeye cooked medium-rare was actually very good. Juicy inner portions of red meat with a seared outside made it very chewy and tender. For a 16oz portion, this was actually a lot of meat that took a while to get through. I was very happy with this plate even if it took us over an hour to get the food.  Service was okay as it took a very long time for them to finally get our order. On a personal level, I also was a bit taken back at how the servers near groveled at your every whim. Our server was exceptionally nice but almost to a point where he would apologize and excuse himself for every small thing. I understand it's a high end restaurant but it felt uncomfortable having him act this way... it's like I wonder what he says behind the scene in the kitchen when not around customers. You can't stay perky that long lol.  So while the food was pretty good, the high prices and extremely up and down service/wait time made this probably a once-in-a-lifetime experience for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l9ix6_vUlhRM_dV36kqS0w.text: A friend suggested we have dinner at the Top of the World since we both never been there before.   In order to find the elevator to the restaurant you have to go through the casino and up a flight of escalators to where the showroom is located. They have a reception desk just to the left of that. From there you go through a security metal detector to take the elevator up.  Another reception desk is located as you exit the elevator to check-in. It was a little crowded and could have been organized better as diners are trying to get in/out of the elevator while others are waiting to be seated.  Once we were seated it was no problem. Our server was Jeruscha and she made sure everything was taken care of. The view from the restaurant is second to none in Las Vegas. The restaurant revolves so you have a 360 view of the city.  Our meal consisted of Caesar's salad, Lobster Bisque, Shellfish Tower and the 40oz Dry Aged Porterhouse Steak. Both the salad and bisque was good. The seafood tower was HUGE! It could have been a meal in itself with jumbo shrimp, snow crab pinchers, lobster and king crab legs. The Porterhouse steak was was good as well. For dessert we ordered the Baked Alaska and Creme Brulee which were both excellent.  The ambiance, view, service and food makes Top of the World a must visit.!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shellfish Tower
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 40oz dry aged Porterhouse Steak

LSdSGC11VSqyT_E-ADKttw.text: Great views and good service.  Our waiter was a hoot.   The portion sizes were more than we anticipated.  My guy and I went on Groupon for the meal deal.  We ended up ordering:  Lobster bisque:  3 stars- a tad salty, but still good flavor.  Had chunks of lobster in it and was plated well.  Fillet mignon:  3 stars- a large portion, but a bit salty for my guy's liking  Salmon:  5 stars-  similar to how a moist Seabass would be lightly glazed and seared to perfection.  Mmm.  There were 2 pieces of shrimp that were plated along with this, and they were just as good and buttery.  Crab cakes:  3 stars-  lightly salted with a good crust.  Unsure but the texture wasn't sitting well with me.  Dessert:  5 stars- neopolitan ice cream (strawberry, chocolate, vanilla) covered in a thin chocolate shell  Creme brulee- 4 stars- a tad sweet, but oh so decadent.  Tip:  give yourself a good amount of time to take pictures at the top, unfortunately we rushed on over to see "O" so we couldn't do this.  Otherwise, have your phones ready to record the jumps from the side windows.  They're definitely a spectacle.

WV8KwcadY4RHYkRNBjFbmA.text: Outstanding views and wonderful service!   Our reservation was at 6:00, and we watched the sun set which was amazing.  The food was superb, well worth the money.  Also nice that parking at the Stratosphere was free, which is rare in Vegas I found out.  The staff in the hotel and the restaurant were all great.   I would recommend this to anyone wanting a True 5 Star dinning experience in Vegas.

du5iGWU25GRH5nzjodXpxQ.text: Let me start with this, the view from this restaurant is absolutely breathtaking. Upon booking the reservation, we knew this but had no idea how amazing it would really be, wow. From the view to the service to the food, this was a top dining experience. Our server Isaac was so sweet and helpful.   I ordered the Australian Wagyu strip steak with sweet potato fries and burssel sprouts. The steak was cooked perfectly to my order, literally melted in my mouth. The fries were also yummy. The brussel sprouts were unfortunately disappointing. The aioli tasted like mayo which completely turned my taste buds off. But our server was great and didn't include it in the bill which was a great gesture. The view, while eating the perfectly cooked steak, and sweet po -teets was one I will always remember.   This is a location you must go to of you're in Vegas. FYI it is reservation ONLY and they pack up fast enough so don't make it the same day of (a couple days before is best). I would also recommend going at night versus during the day because the city lights are just one of a kind.  A trip to the observation deck is included with your dining experience so also make sure to take advantage of that!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Australian Wagyu Skirt Steak*, Sweet Potato Fries, Brussels Sprouts
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from observation deck

qgWJ3z-gkOzxKK8KvhHsOQ.text: I was having a girl's weekend with a few of my closest friends and we wanted to have a fancy dinner out. We decided to look at Groupon to see if there was anything worth trying. I noticed the Groupon for Top  of the World at The Strastasphere had four stars. I read through some of the reviews and it sounded like the majority of the people had a great experience.   The Groupon was for their 4 course dinner for $87. It's normally a $106 meal. That's a great deal, so we went ahead and purchased it and made reservations. I am SO glad I did!  We made reservations for 7:00 and requested window seating. This was the perfect time as we got to witness the sunset during our meal and see the glittery lights of the strip as the evening went on. The dining room rotates at very slow speed so you get a 360 degree view!   Not only was the food delicious but the view, service, and ambiance of the restaurant was spectacular. Our server's name was Frank and he was very helpful and patient with us. He helped us make decisions on our dishes and was very personable.   The meal begins with a beautiful basket of artisan bread and butter. The presentation of the bread was better than the bread in my opinion. This was the only setback of the meal. The bread was more baguette style and very hard. The best tasting bread was what our server called the fig bread. It was sweet and much softer than the rest of the breads in the basket.   Because we went in a party of 4, we opted to order different items on the first 2 courses, so we could try a bit of each.   Lobster Bisque: I was highly impressed with the presentation of this soup! They place the bowl of soup in front of you with the lobster in the center and pour the bisque over it. This soup was as I imagined it to be! The bisque was savory, smooth, and sweet. It complemented the sweetness of the lobster very well. Absolutely delicious!   Ceaser Salad: this was your basic ceaser salad with crispy romaine, Parmesan cheese, and croutons. It was tasty and the serving was big, but I much prefer the bisque!   Crab Cakes: the crab cake was very good. There was plenty of crab which complimented the flavor of the saffron aoli and arugula beautifully.   Cavatelli Pasta: this pasta dish had a lot of flavor profiles, but they all worked so well and it was my favorite of the second course. The wagyu Beef was melt in your mouth delicious. Frank recommended that we mix the dish up, but I opted to just take a bite of each item together. I was hesitant about the horseradish cream, but the spiciness and coolness melded so well with the beef.   Filet Mignon and Shrimp Duo: Melt in your mouth delicious and the huge juicy shrimps cooked to perfection!   Salted Caramel Creme Brulee: This was a big serving and very good. It was smooth and had the perfect crunchy top a creme brulee should have! The addition of the popcorn was also fun.   If you're ever in Vegas and looking for a fun dinner experience, I highly recommend coming here. Keep in mind though, it will be a longer dinner since it's 4 courses. You will also want to stay and enjoy the views throughout the rotation. We were there for about 2 hours total.

8m_d3chojKIpLvuhIdlfeA.text: My hubby picked this place and I'm glad he did!!  We had to wait about 15 mins at the bar even though we had a reservation so that sucked but atleast we could look at the lights of Vegas! We ordered the crabcake which was delicious! Be warned though, you only get one! Oh did I mention the delicious warm bread?! It was so good, 4 different types! I got the lobster bisque and absolutely loved it! It's rich and delicious and has chunks of lobster in it! We weren't too hungry so shared the cut rib eye with pepper sauce and a side of brussel sprouts! The steak was delicious and tender and quite big even though it was the 10oz one! The pepper sauce was a good accompaniment but the brussel sprouts were so darned good!!!  For dessert we couldn't pass on the warm butter cake! So delicious!!! When we were seated I was excited because we got the booths so could face the lights but then I realized that I couldn't set up my phone to do a hyperlapse of the skyline because I would get all the people sitting in front of me! I know where I'm going to sit next time!

GK6ZyxBd5n4Ljln9k3pEdg.text: Visited the "Top of the World" on Saturday August 31, 2019. When we first arrived there was a line to check into the reservation. Then another line to wait for the elevator. Please note you will also have to go through security. Seemed more like going to an attraction than dinner. Once in the dinning room, the view is spectacular. It's breathtaking! The room rotates 360 degrees in 1 hour. At some point in the rotation you see the people above bungee jumping. That's pretty cool to watch! The wait staff were nice however the service was slow. Don't plan on going unless you got 3 hrs of time to give them.   As for the food..it was ok. Our table had mixed reviews depending on the dish compared to the price. You definitely did not get what you paid for. For the price the taste of the food should have least started at the quality of "Ruth Chris Steakhouse" if you know what I mean. I ordered the Salmon dish and Brussels Sprouts and my husband ate the stuff crab chicken with lobster Mac and cheese. We sort of ate each other's. The salmon was good and the lobster Mac and cheese was awesome. The other 2 dishes just average.   If I had to do it again, I'd definitely go again. But I'll pass on a 2nd visit. This is a solid 3.5 review.
