QSC-N4hsuPo3oPZqt9dikA.text: Here is the skinny if you haven't been before.  Leave at least 1 hour from your hotel or residence.  It will take about that long until you're seated.   Our group was very frustrated with process.  Once you find the check in location you will go through "security." Now this is an utter joke. I watched as the lone security officer let people through *beep* after *beep*.  People would simply chuckle and make their excuse.  The guard never had them go back through the metal detector or question what they actually had.  So what's the point!?   Then I try to pass through "security" with a wine bottle and you would think I'm Michael Corleone.  The guard said I couldn't bring it up and told me I'd have to stow the bottle somewhere. Which is strange because the restaurant has a corkage fee.  So I ask if they could call the restaurant.  Instead they call their supervisor.  Yup.  Still a no go.    So then we walk back to where we checked in.  They explained that the wine bottle can't go up with me and that they must take up 107 floors.  Apparently 9/11 triggered this rigorous security process. So back through the metal beepy thing and then you wait for an elevator. The elevator only holds about 10-12 bodies so we had to wait 2 cycles.    So now that is out of the way the restaurant and food is great.  I didn't even know the restaurant rotates!  About 1 rotation an hour so you can see everything.   We ordered the dry aged  28 day porterhouse which is probably the best steak I've had in Vegas.  Better then Joes, Echo & Rig and Mastros.  Yeah, I was shocked too. It can feed about 3 people and comes with two sides.  Retail price: $159.00 and worth it.   We also tried the lobster mac & cheese that was worth the $19.00.  We finished with the warm butter cake which was delicious.  I was pretty  impressed by Top of the World.  The view really was incredible and the food was just as good.  Just getting their sucked.

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge porterhouse that can feed three.

x5f5VVk6MQu8sdXqSmLzmQ.text: No complaints at all about Top of the World restaurant, located on the 106th floor of the Stratosphere tower; This restaurant gets a solid 4.5 stars from me.  Food and service were both excellent, the views of Vegas and the Strip unrivaled, and for fine dining, the price wasn't out of line.  We decided to try this place for late dinner on a Tuesday, and found that they had a 9 p.m. reservation available.  We were greeted on the ground floor at a welcome desk by a host who took our names, verified our reservation and invited us to go through the metal detector and take the elevator up to the 107th floor.  Once there, the elevator opened to a hostess stand where they again verified our names and after a brief 5 minute wait, took us down a staircase to the main restaurant on the 106th floor and showed us to our table.  The restaurant really wasn't full on this night, so we were lucky enough to snag one of the larger tables for 4 just in front of the windows.  According to at least one website, this rotating restaurant makes one trip around every 80 minutes, but to me, it seemed to move a bit faster.  One can definitely tell you're moving, and it seemed that, before we were even served our dessert courses, we were back looking at the same view we could see when we first arrived.  For starters we had the shrimp cocktail.  We then ordered the skirt steak and the ribeye and planned to share both, and had the lobster mac and cheese as our shared side.  We enjoyed a bottle of Jordan Cabernet Sauvignon with our meals, and finished off with the creme brulee.    Everything we had was exceptional, both steaks cut like butter and everything was very flavorful, including the breads and butter we were given upon our arrival.  As previously mentioned, pricing wasn't terribly out of line for a better restaurant in a larger city: The shrimp cocktail was $19, the ribeye $59 and the skirt steak $47.  The lobster mac was also $19 and the creme brulee dessert $12.  The bottle of Jordan, however, was a bit pricey at $105.  For everything we ate and drank, our bill came to $282.53 before gratuity.  Again, not bad for fine dining in a larger city and the quality of the steaks and other foods really was superb.  The only possible critique is that it seems they overly hype the height of this building and restaurant.  They claim, for instance that it's on the 106th floor, with the bar above on the 107th.  The elevator attendant made a big deal about how long it takes for the double deck elevator to get from the bottom floor all the way to the top, etc. That said, the Sears tower is 110 floors tall and is much, MUCH taller than the Strat, so it seems that their floor count is a bit exaggerated, or mostly hype.   That said, it's an interesting dining experience to have a meal while rotating and overlooking Vegas, but also to see amusement rides spin out over the windows above you, see people jumping off the top of this tower and falling in front of you as you dine, etc.

Aftu737u8MlATR-uqpYFBQ.text: This establishment is beautiful and the food is great. Such a beautiful atmosphere. The staff is amazing and work very well together to make sure we had a wonderful experience. The view is to die for..literally lol ppl were jumping off the building. I really enjoyed my time here. Thank you.

RVkWjBz9jrK7hPBxO3aYFA.text: I made a 9 PM  reservation  for last night,  18 days before coming to Vegas from Miami to celebrate our Wedding  Anniversary ( a surprise for my hubby) which btw I made them aware . I requested a window seat  but  so disappointed that after that long minutes  of wait to pass and  get up to the restaurant,  we were seated in a corner in a little table . I understand there was no guarantee but a little consideration  could have been nice . We can see little portions of the view in between  the 4 guests beside us.  I addressed the issue to the waiter, we were told if we want that seat we have to wait for minutes to an hour... ( isn't that's the reason you make reservations  for ? So you won't have to wait for an hour for a table) Too upset and disappointed, we just cancelled it and went back to Bellagio where we are staying  and went to  LAGO (  an Italian restaurant)who took us eventhough it was late (1015 pm) gave us a nice table with view of the fountain. ..  Excellent dinner, a bottle of fine  prosecco, couple of cocktails  and 4 waiters attending to us. They TRULY made us feel  ON TOP OF THE WORLD ***just a little advice when making a reservation on this Stratosphere TOTW... especially if you have a special occasion to celebrate, be prepared to be disappointed and and better yet have a plan B*** Anyways  if you just want " the view" just have a window seat next time you fly to and from vegas.

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lago in Bellagio, magnificent fountain view

iHsH4gStT3Pw-hG9cSzTww.text: The last time I was in Vegas I decided to check this place out. Please make your reservation ahead of time through open tables or with the restaurant directly because they do get busy, especially on the weekends .   This restaurant is located on the 72nd floor at stratosphere hotel overlooking Las Vegas strip. The ambience is lovely and the view is phenomenal. The restaurant have a beautiful revolving view of the strip.   The service was wonderful. I order the filet mignon. The taste was a little bit more than average . I'm giving it a four stars because I felt that the  food was just above average but it wasn't exceptional or left a unique impression .   Other than that it was overall a good experience. They also have an open bar right above the restaurant level with the same view .

XMXa1j4rORzDy_1pEpkJUg.text: My husband and I went to Top of the World last weekend for our anniversary. We made reservations ahead of time and put in the special requests that we wanted a table by the windows. The reservation form also asked if we were celebrating a special occasion and we put that we were coming for our 5th anniversary. When we arrived we were greeted and told "Happy Anniversary".  My husband asked the hostess about a table by the window and she assured us it was all taken care of.   We waited a few minutes in the lobby then were taken to our table by the windows. We decided to do the pre fixed menu with the wine pairing. Our first course came out quickly. We were left to enjoy our food and wine. The waiters were very attentive yet did not rush us. They waited until we were done with each course to come and take our plates then bring the next. The food was amazing and the wine pairings were spot on. Bring a big appetite because it's a good amount of food!  Our dessert even came with a little Happy Anniversary sign.   We almost didn't come here because of not so great reviews, but I'm so glad we did. We had a wonderful time. Our waiter even offered to take our picture and it came out so much nicer than the one the professional photographer took.   We capped the the night off with old fashioneds at the 107 sky lounge after.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert

uoCC3HhwyvCz0zhBmpA_zg.text: We went here for a birthday and it was the perfect place to celebrate a special occasion!  We choose this restaurant for the views and it didn't disappoint.  I loved the rotating concept and the beautiful night time lights.  Our food was delicious and service was excellent, but it wouldn't matter anyway.  Also we expected these prices for a 360 view of Vegas 100+ floors high while enjoying a meal.

8jQ_XB0XH1wdhs29HtLnyA.text: Service was better than the food. I was a bit disappointed by the limited menu selections, especially the seafoods. Because there really wasn't too much to choose from we opted for the tasting menu for $90 per person. This was a lot more than we wanted to spend but all the other entrees were $45 and over already plus cost of sides we decided this was a better deal to at least have selection. The tasting menu came with soup or Caesar salad. We got soup which was a Thai chicken soup (best item we had all night). Next was Branzino or crab cake, we had 1 of each so we could taste each others and hands down the crab cake was better....Branzino was horrible! Next was the filet with green beans and pearl onions 1 decent and cooked well, the beans were fresh and had a crisp crunch. Finally dessert but this was the most disappointing. You know those mini desserts you can get in any cheap buffet....well that's what we got. It was a mini cup or a dark chocolate mouse and a berry whip cream in a white chocolate cup. I wish we could have had a real choice of a decent sized dessert that didn't taste like it was from a buffet....I mean you sure pay for it at $90 a person! The view was nice, and maybe of we decide to go back we'd go later at night for a night view since we went for early dinner at 6.  Overall I would return...but I wish they'd add better seafood selections.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our view! 9-9-13 double rainbows!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake - part of the tasting menu for $90 per person

BvlgYLcdZXs8JsC7gLydOQ.text: Happy hour 4-7 two for one, make reservation at sunset and go a little early 1 floor above is the lounge. Go to happy hour enjoy view then go to dinner 1 floor below..... Great time loved it!

WqzCu8UBTREr5tpyn2cgEQ.text: Made reservations from Washington DC before going there with my friend.  We had three drinks and made the mistake of singing "its hammer time" while waiting to get seated.  As soon as we sat down the manager (who is a female) sent over waiter  who then told us we can eat but we need to chill on our drinks. Because according to the manager we were way too hammer to drink.  She stated you guys need some food first and funny thing was, we just had appetizers at the lounge.  Maybe she just didn't like MC Hammer!  I was talking straight, walking straight but still too drunk for them.  I think it was more like we looked too young for that old crowd. Left without eating and went to Wolfgang Puck's restaurant at Cesar's and got the best service and food ever.  So if you are young or look young,  save your self from this OLD ass place that's been at Vegas forever.

Wl7m4aTIEGejn2MgFGs4vQ.text: If you are coming to Las Vegas this fine dining restaurant is a must with a great breath taking view. Go the extra mile and get the 7 course meal all paired with a different wine. It's spectacular and the pairings are fantastic with the sauces and seasonings. Service was great and on top of everything. Also go so you can watch the sunset!!!

mvrdK_S75jeeD5tIicdhEA.text: So I visited this place tonight... and after everything was done I was only somewhat unimpressed.... first off, I did not have a reservation and was told by locals that because of the high $$$$ as long as its not on the weekend you can do a walk in due to the fact that the restaurant is mainly used by tourist. Upon getting there I had to endure a 20-30 minute wait. Although when we were seated, I saw many empty tables which made me believe that the "wait time" was done on purpose to give the illusion that its full. On to the food, the only thing I would highly recommend is their lobster bisque soup, which was delicious! I ordered the pork sirloin ($50) and my girlfriend ordered the steak (10 oz) and lobster tail ($79). To me the food portions were small and did not come with any sides. To me the price doesn't justify the quantity. By the way the mixed drinks were very "light" on liquor... but your paying a premium price of about $13-$15 bucks for a mixed drink. Overall my total bill was $214... and while the view is remarkable I probably wont be back again unless its a really important occasion... and even that is something i'd have to give serious thought about doing.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the top

AxnlaXHoP2647bdwcNiezA.text: I had a great time at Top of the World in Las  Vegas tonight.  The view is spectacular and my husband is always good company for me.  You truly do get a 360 degree view of the city.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  Not all are as bubbly as they could or maybe should be (first greeter at the desk take note!).  So I gave them 1 star for first impressions (my star rating is cumulative...so you can earn up to 5 stars but you also lose stars as the meal progresses)  The decor is old and needs refreshing but the view is all that matters.  They earn a star for the 360 degree view. (If you tend to be at all queasy with motion sickness this is not the spot for you!)  The food is pricy but what you would expect at a highly rated restaurant (Zagat 23 out of 30 for food; voted LV best restaurant consistently, average 4.5 rating on TripAdvisor, Yelp, UrbanSpoon). Yes, I do my homework before I commit to a dinner that potentially could cost over $200.  The ala carte side dish offerings are adequate, but the chicken (1 option) and seafood choices (4 options) were limited in my opinion. Still they earned a star for having enough variety that we both found something easily.  We started off with soup.  While we waited the waiter brought a basket of warm bread that was very good.  We enjoyed the view and took some pictures, but after quite some time my husband asked whether they had to go out to get the lobster for my soup, it was taking so long.  About that time the waiter realized our soup had not come out and immediately brought it to our tables with appropriate apologies.  Oops lost a star for that one.  OMG the Lobster Bisque is wonderful.  Some of the best I have ever had.  My husband had the SOTD which was a Vegetable Soup (can't remember the ingredients but it was made with pesto and a grain). Very good also. Add another star.  I ordered: Roasted "Loch Etive" Scottish Salmon with Thai Jungle Curry Foam* for $42 (description says "from the deep Scottish water sea inlet named "Etive," high in Omega 3. Kelp noodle salad with Asian vinaigrette, peas and wild blueberries).  The Salmon was grilled perfectly, flakey, moist and seasoned just enough.  I couldn't really discern the spices in the Thai Jungle Curry Foam, but the kelp noodle salad and dressing was tasty.  BUT the ENGLISH PEAS were RAW.  Yes, RAW.  Read that hard, dry and not cooked at all.I tried to mash one with my fork and could not.  I commented to my waiter and he brought a plate to ask me to send a couple to the kitchen for the Chef.  He also tried to squeeze one and it did not give.  A young man from the kitchen came out and apologized and said he would check with the Chef about the intent of the peas. I hoped that he did not INTEND for them to be raw.  When the young man returned he informed me that the Chef prepared the peas this way to give them crunch.  I don't like mushy peas and I do like them crispy and I know my peas and these were not "crispy" they were hard and inedible.  I don't know why but that's the truth.   My husband had the "California Mary's Farm Free Range Chicken Breast with Lemon Herb" for $44 (included Gnocchi with arugula pesto, English peas, roasted tomato and chicken jus) and the chicken was just DELICIOUS, but guess what! The peas in his dish were also RAW. Minus a star for the peas, but you get it back for the rest of the meal so its a wash.  The manager took off the cost of our Haricot Verts with Roasted Tomatoes (also very good) and so they won a star back .  Overall my rating is 4 stars.  I will go back but won't make it a "must" on my next visit.

MK5G_QcoKdGP8PuxPxXmiw.text: This restaurant is lovely, the food is really good and it is one of the only pricy restaurants I've been to in Las Vegas that is kid-friendly.  Expensive to take the kids?  Absolutely.  But if you're looking for a special occasion place where you can take the whole family, I wouldn't hesitate to suggest Top of the World.  The waiters we've had never spoke down to the kids, treating them w/great respect.  Case in point:  our 6 y/o spilled his virgin strawberry daquiri (very accommodating w/the virgin drinks, btw), and the staff couldn't have been more understanding and helpful about it.  They even replaced his drink for no extra charge.  I've been in much lower-priced restaurants that haven't done something like that.  If you can get everyone's attention off the tremendous view (try to time your dinner to encompass sunset), and you have kids in your party, be sure and order the chocolate souffle at the beginning of your meal.  And start off the meal w/one of the aforementioned virgin drinks - the strawberry daquiri was like a fantastic strawberry smoothie and the whipped cream on top really made the kids feel special.  And for the adults?  The food has been fantastic each time we've visited.  And if you want the experience but don't want to spend big money on dinner, having a drink in the attached lounge is an incredible way to savor the view that's unlike any other in Las Vegas!

PE2n7eTcgWvHuj6ZAcivTA.text: This place has always been a must do for me when in Vegas, but the food this visit was off the charts wonderful. My friend had the lamb chops with a wonderful light curry sauce that really made the flavor wonderful. I had delicious salmon perfectly prepared. It wasn't almost RAW as is the new style, but was moist and almost fluffy! There was the best subtle green sauce with it that made it the best salmon I've ever put in my mouth. We had early 5pm reservations and saw the sunset over Vegas, then the lights come on . WOW. The waitress remarked the chef was new and from The Paris Hotel. Best meal I've had in years.

KmiD0E7IaY334ABOjkiUlA.text: Lunch today was a big disappointment!  I have been bringing Las Vegas guests here almost monthly and loved it!  Recently, their lunch menu changed which more than halved the selections and doubled their prices!  Ugh! Supposedly because of their "extensive" remodeling.  Didn't see evidence of any changes except on the bill!!  I won't be going back. Too bad because this was once one of our favorites.

7JeKgNEQFb0zzw-wahZzAQ.text: All I can say is "WOW!"   Top of the World is expensive - and worth every penny.  My wife and I had a dinner reservation for sunset and are still talking about how wonderful the experience was.  The staff were extraordinarily professional and attentive.  The food was awesome - including the desserts.  I highly recommend this restaurant for a classy romantic and memorable dinner.

-FRbRwZxEjNCGkdHuoRDVA.text: Took a special lady at the time here for her birthday awhile back. This is one of those restaurants worth at least experiencing at least once in your visits to Las Vegas.   The view up here was pretty cool with a different perspective. 800 feet high with a 360 degree view of Las Vegas and the surrounding desert and mountains from a revolving tower restaurant. We had dinner reservations in the evening so we were able to see Las Vegas during the day and then watch the night come to life with the crazy lights the city is known for.  I thought the food was okay. Not too small, but not hearty either. I'm an I-can-eat-anything-and-everything type of guy (except for fruits and vegetables) and prefer buffets when I'm in Vegas, but since this was a special occasion I wanted to take my date out to someplace different and nice. In all I spent around $160 for dinner and then another $40 for 2 drinks in the upstairs level lounge area; debit card ouch!..but it was worth it at the time. Like everyone here comments, you're really paying for the view and experience to be on Top Of The World.  I would give this place 5 stars if they maybe offered a buffet option without breaking the bank. Yup, I wants me my Las Vegas buffets! LoL

C2I05er5iSM6e9TofvuGxw.text: No needs words!  Romantic. I used a coupon, that made it into good deal.

buhlcaNBuLBS4b6rxx4fAg.text: I've lived in Las Vegas for five years and this was my first time in the Stratosphere and at the Top of the World Restaurant!  I made reservations for 5pm, knowing that the sun will set around 5:20pm.  I had heard going up there when the sun is setting is the perfect time.  We were sat in a both.  My husband and I looked at each other and we really wanted a table right at the glass.  Luckily, we saw a table of two moving to a both and we were able to move to their table.  At first, you feel a little iffy, because you are actually moving.  And you think "hopefully this feeling goes away" and it does!  FYI: It is a $40/pp minimum. (which is not hard to do!)  We started off with drinks.  I ordered a glass of Riesling (delicious!) and the husband ordered a whiskey sour.   Our waitress was great and once we placed our order she said that it will be about 35 minutes.  Normally, that would suck, but since it takes 120 minutes for you to rotate the entire city, that was perfect.  The husband and I just chilled and enjoyed our drinks and the view.  It was VERY relaxing up there.  I loved it!  Going up at sunset was PERFECT!  You get to see everything with the normal light and see the sun setting and the entire city's lights coming on was gorgeous!  So glad we got the best of both worlds at that time!  They brought out bread that was really good.  A sourdough and a bread that had like cheese & bacon baked into it!  Two butters- a chili butter and a sea salt butter.  Yum!  The food: I had ordered two apps as my main course: - Grilled Portobello Mushroom & Buffalo Mozzarella w/ Roasted Red Pepper, herb oil & balsamic reduction. This was delicious!  Just a fancy version of a Caprese- minus the basil, + adding portobello mushroom. - Seared Jumbo Lump Crab Cake W/ Green papaya salad, pink grapefruit, lemon grass beurre blanc. This was good.  Not the best crab cake ever, but good.  The husband ordered:  - 16oz. USDA Prime Rib-Eye with Horseradish Crust and Demi-Glace - Twice Baked Potato He said that the steak was good.  To me, it looked like it was cooked a little more than medium, but had decent flavor.  He also said that the twice baked potato was "money!"  They had a live jazzy-type band playing that was nice.    We just really enjoyed how calm it was up there.  We got to see some people jumping off the side of the Stratosphere, which was fun!  You usually pay just go up in the Stratosphere (like $30 pp or something) and if you eat there, you can go up even higher for free and check it out.  It was super windy at the top, but pretty cool.  You can check out the rides (no thanks!) and just see the interesting people that are there.  You think when you go to a place like this, that you are paying for the view and the food is going to be gross.  The food was decent and you get an awesome view.  However, I would definitely go back for more drinks and less food!

wbgEXUvaAgQZVr3Ov2eguw.text: I made a reservation for a Wednesday here to celebrate my wife and I first anniversary. Going through those not so obvious passageways and blistering fast elevators to get to the restaurant felt very special indeed. I'm gonna repeat what mostly everyone's been saying and that is the view is spectacular. A great view of Las Vegas rotating at about an hour for one full rotation (per my wife's observation). The food was great. We got the Prie Fixed Menu ($90 per person for 4 courses) bc everything else seemed to be around 30-50 bucks a plate. For our first course my wife and I got a salad and the lobster bisque. The salad was salad but the lobster bisque was delicious . That was probably the best soup I've tasted here in Vegas. It was creamy yet light and I like that they put some lobster meat in the middle of the bowl. Our second course was a single sauteed scallop with a corn and butter sauce. The scallop was perfectly cooked and you can't go wrong with butter and seafood. Our main courses were salmon with prawns and a filet mignon with haricovert (pronounced ha-ri-co-vare), roasted cipollini onion, and some kind of red wine/butter sauce. Again, everything tasted great and my wife ate everything. Our dessert was some kind of chocolate pudding with a small floral bowl made of white chocolate that carried some fruit and whipped cream. I would say the only misses about this place is that for dinner time it is pretty dark inside so looking at the menu can be a little hard and the dessert wasn't that special. Everything else though was superb and I would recommended this place for any anniversary or special occasion. My wife told me she would come back here for lunch and I agreed as prices are little bit lower. Overall, I think this restaurant is "close to the top" on my top resto list bc of the ambience and the attentive service.

rNvX8R7O4mO3hfesVZcoFg.text: Wife had a shrimp scallops, lobster plate. I had a New York steak. Her plate and drinks were excellent. Her side of gnocchi was a little under cooked. My steak was unevenly cooked, med ish on one end and well on the other. I asked for med/well so I guess technically I got what I wanted. The vegetarian soup appetizer was awesome. Truth be told that and the bread and I would have been good to go. Service was good but overall not worth the price $190 with two drinks. (W/o tip)

prWhXTlka0E5rGPvRkhCSw.text: Best place in Vegas, hands-down! food is amazing. service is upscale, as is the place. high up in the stratosphere with amazing views! rotates throughout your meal so you get 360 degree view. great for dates you want to impress, or groups. pricey, so have your funds up if you plan on going. Dress to impress, as there is a bar one floor beneath that plays music in the evening. Can't hear it while you eat, it's actually a very quiet place. Amazing time and worth the money imo. Been there a few times and plan on going back a few more. Did I mention the food is amazing?

a8q8Kd7KubA-qHpPAAH81g.text: The views give this place a five-star rating by itself. You get a full 360 degree view of Las Vegas from the best place to view the strip, so why wouldn't it be amazing?  The food was pretty darn good. I had the free range chicken (minus the three cheese fondue) and my boyfriend had the large mexican prawns and new england scallops. Since I'm lactose intolerant, I had to send the chicken back when it came out with the cheese still inside. But the waiter was extremely apologetic and made sure that I got what I ordered. I loved the chicken - it was so moist and well seasoned. My boyfriend said that for the quality of the restaurant the seafood was a bit chewy and disappointing. (So minus a star for that.)  Also, I know that this isn't any fault of the restaurant, but the Stratosphere itself (which the restaurant sits on top of) is Ghetto with a capital "G."  The service by Anthony was great! He was extremely knowledgeable about the Strip and we had a lengthy conversation on what happened to the Sahara hotel, who owns certain hotels & buildings, etc.  Overall, a wonderful experience for a romantic anniversary dinner and we'll definitely return.

XkfIyhsgjKoBmzP3qoshdw.text: To go up to the observation deck at the Stratosphere is $16 each so we decided to go up and have lunch instead. My husband had the salmon caeser salad and a bowl of lobster bisque and I had the 3 course lunch tasting and our bill came in $50-ish. Seeing as we would have spent $32 just for the view I felt this was a good value and we spent over an hour there. We were wearing jeans and I didn't feel under dressed for lunch there at all.   The food was great and the restaurant was not too busy at all so we had a great time. If you are a fan of lobster bisque you HAVE to try their version of it--it's amazing! We all had it and loved it. It was the best thing I ate in Vegas period. I chose salmon as my entree and there was a trio of desserts. One of them was the banana bread pudding and I would say it also makes the list of one of the other best things I ate.   My mom did the $37 trio and had steak and lobster tail as her entree. It was a pretty small amount of lobster but it was lunch and she said the steak was really good. She also ordered a sangria and I had a sip it was pretty tasty but not worth $13 in my opinion.   Bottom line: go for a nice lunch and you won't be sorry!

H4eMcav5qPsW5LIOFtuCfQ.text: I absolutely love the ambiance and the food! I always go for the multiple course meal with wine pairings. My only stumbling block was the fois gras. It showed up twice and I don't care for liver even when it's fancy! I started out with the best lobster bisque soup I've ever tasted. Right up to desert the service and presentation is top notch!

JsMz9vZEY7_kQQMBlYflDQ.text: It's all about the views! Rather you are a local or just visiting Vegas I would recommend this place. Food is worth the price, good drink menu. I was there on a Father Daughter date night and was a little disappointed they did nothing for her as they were told before we arrived. Overall worth the cost.

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedge salad...

QkIWYBrxuMQitkfyNcp30w.text: Pricey but goooood, I got the chicken and man that was juicy and amazing, and my girlfriend got the duck that was goood nothing too strong and weird tasting good stuff.

FS03b80Z6AmGliwYVUJR7A.text: My sister with her family came to visit me first time for 3 years! They had to fly 13 hours over continents and ocean, and then we were driving 5 hours to Las Vegas to celebrate  my nephew`s birthday. I booked in advance a table in this restaurant via Open Table, hoping that it will be an unforgettable experience for me, my family and my birthday boy nephew. It was unforgettable. But definitely in the negative meaning.   In addition to the Open table booking request, yesterday,  June 12, I specifically called the restaurant in the afternoon  to confirm this booking and the greatest desire of my nephew to seat near with the window.  My biggest mistake was that I did not remember the receptionist's name and I did not record this conversation.... Very friendly receptionist confirmed our reservations for this evening, and assured me that we are going to seat by the window as it had to be the birthday party.   When we arrived at the restaurant, we were provided the table in the second row from the window with no city view. We were given any comments. We had to ask twice and it takes 15 minutes to call the manager to our table.   In the brazen manner we have been given very unprofessional response - I do not know with whom you spoke, we have no tables for you by the window. Moreover to my question: "If you are not responsible for the confirmations, which is given by your restaurant representatives by the phone, did I had to make a record to have opportunity to prove that my request was confirmed?" The manager said - yes, you have to!!  Furthermore the manager make it clear that he does not care at all of the negative feedbacks.... WTF? Seriously?! It was the most  unprofessional behavior that we`ve ever met!   How others said, the food at this restaurant is not worth the money that they ask for. And all you are paying for is the city view.  When we went around the restaurant, we found out a number of available tables for party of 5 from which the view was really good, exactly what we were expected and CONFIRMED to get at this place!  We had to wait our order about an hour. During this time, several tables by the window became vacant, but the waiter denied our 4th request to change the table.   Finalizing: not professional, boorish service, very intrusive waiters, not tasty food. If you are going to celebrate here a really important event, be ready to make a record of telephone conversation with the restaurant representative to be able to set-down an unprofessional manager.   Don't have respect for promise, poor standards = no tips, no positive feedback. Honestly.

03Qinei1zYk_RdR4hrr1Qw.text: Felt like I was having dinner on a cruise ship, except the cost of dinner could have paid for an entire cruise!  The experience was fun, but I don't think I will be back. I will start with the positives. The staff was extremely friendly and the experience was unique. If you do decide to go, request a seat on the lower level, preferably at the window because the entire restaurant rotates. However, if you sit at the second level, you don't rotate and will have the same view your entire dining experience. The food was tasty for the most par. I had the lobster bisque which was very good and rich and my husband had the cesar salad which was pretty large and yummy. The bread basket was also good (but they never came by to refill or even offer to refill it). For dinner, I had the filet which was good, although there really wasn't much to it. I added the Foie gras for $20. (see below for my comments on the foie gras). We ordered the fontina cheese potatoes which was the best menu item we had all night. We did not order dessert because the lemon tart cheesecake which I went into dinner wanting to order, was not on the menu that night. The view was also amazing. It takes an hour and 20 minutes to do one complete loop. They time the dining perfectly because we were in and out in the hour and 20. We also came 30 minutes before sunset which was perfect because it was fun to see the valley during the daylight and the lights of the strip once the sun set.  Negatives: I literally felt like I was on a cruise ship. From the cheesy stratosphere olive pick in my martini to the waiter's name pins that had their country of origin to the menus and to the bathrooms- I could have sworn I was on a boat. The problem is for the cost of our dinner, we literally could have booked a four day cruise to Mexico! My other issue was the attentiveness of the service. Everyone was very friendly, but no one ever asked if I wanted another martini until I was halfway done with my entree (my drink was empty since the appetizer portion) nor did they refill our bread basket. Also, my husband and I were there to celebrate our wedding anniversary and indicated as much on our reservation. Now, I am not looking for freebies as I would have ordered the lemon tart cheesecake if it were on the menu, but they did not offer us a celebratory complimentary dessert, which I thought was in bad form. The foie gras was literally the worst I have ever had. There was something wrong with it for sure or it was just prepared terribly. The taste wasn't the only problem. I paid for it as an add-on to my filet for an additional $20. However, the foie gras was also an appetizer on the menu. The appetizer consisted of the foie gras, some sort of jam, and brioche. The cost of the appetizer was also $20! I literally got two bites of foie gras on my steak for the same price.  There are so many better steak houses on the strip. The only reason to choose Top of the World over SW steakhouse, Joes, Capital Grille, etc. is because of the view. However, if you want to experience the view, pay $20 to go up to the observation deck or Sky Lounge for a drink and save your money and go out to a nice dinner on the strip after.

1aUbZCPUgi1YTrKXZVfiNw.text: absolut great location and fantastic four course menu  The restaurant is 800 feet above the Las Vegas Strip. The Restaurant turn around 360 degrees in 80 Minutes. you can the complete Las Vegas in this time. Best time for a reservation is the Sunset time. The menu was very good. Main course was: Grilled Center Cut Filet Mignon with Red Wine Sauce. See my picture.

kwTHaeFmP8-Th14ZMDIaCQ.text: Come here for the view, not so much the food! If you stay at the Stratosphere, why not give it a try. If not, nah~~~ NOTE: If you have the ace|PLAY red, green and orange memberships, you can get 10% discount for dinner.  Location (4.5): The restaurant locates on the 106th floor of Stratosphere hotel. This is the second tallest tower in the west! This tower unfortunately is not near the Vegas strip. You can see the whole city in the restaurant since it spins 360 degree.   Service (3): If you have a reservation, you can check in with the host downstairs before getting inside the elevator. If not, you may have to pay for tickets to visit the tower. Before going inside the elevator, they would check your phones, purses and coats to prevent you from carrying harmful things up the tower. Our waitor for the night was nice. He did what he had to do, but I wish he could be more lively! While dinning, there will be a photographer walking around to take photos for you. I appreciated the fact that she was being direct on what we should pose for the photos. That saved a lot of our thinking times! Later, she would come back and bring copies of the photos of you - $20/photo wallet with two small photos of your choices and $45/ picture frame with two large photos of your choices. If you want the digital version, $25 more!   Food (2.5): They have the tasting menu $90/person if you are interested. It also comes with the optional $30 wine pairings. We went with the regular menu. We ordered the pork belly appetizer, their so-called well known lobster bisque, ribeye, a lack of lamp and a side of french fries. No worries if the french fries doesn't appear on the menu. Just ask for it if you want it :) Overall, the food was salty for our taste. If I was to be the chef, I would make the pork belly skin extra crispy to make the whole dish less fatty. I would also make the lobster bisque and the rest of the entrees less salty... OMG it was THAT salty!!!!! I mean throughout dinner, we saw a stand of dessert display and we were so excited! After trying the entrees, our hunger for the beautiful looking desserts vanished...  Satisfaction factor (2.5): As much as trying food thousands feet up high and seeing people doing sky jumping outside the windows, the view itself was the only reason why we stayed... As for the food, no more thank you very much! If I was to come back, I would rather to go the 107th floor for coffee or tea while enjoying the beautiful view!  So think twice before you dine here. With the price that they charge, you will find much more quality food down the middle of the strip!

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye steak
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb chops

Xd_a8GD_cK_G1NTrsJoQNg.text: Let's start with their view, it's awesome. You get the 360 from pretty much top of the strip! It's a nice view especially if you've never seen it. But one time is good enough for me. Depending on how sensitive you are to motion sickness, you're going to get motion sickness....yup I did! So there's a fair warning to that lol  The service was top notch and no one at our table had an empty glass for too long. They were definitely on top of their game on that!   The fresh bread and butter they had was pretty delicious. They serve it with three different butters, whipped butter, pesto, and a fruity one I believe. All of which were delicious!   For my entree I had asked for a rare filet mignon which was slightly overcooked but still delicious. The entrees don't come with any sides so you have to add anything you want. The sides are portioned to serve maybe two people at most but we're all fatties so really one person.   My friend ordered the bone-in filet but black and blue and it came out overcooked. Sadly, for a restaurant of this caliber, they should be capable of cooking a rare black and blue steak.   Everything else was good and they even gave us an extra birthday dessert for free because one of the kids wanted that specific dessert.   Overall it was a good time, our party had fun and the service was good. Just for that, I'm willing to come back again.

9rms251HsO-DDseONY0eew.text: After clowning around in Circus, Circus for a While I decided to walk to the Stratosphere from there to work up an appetite. When I first Entered the Stratosphere, taking a couple turns and going through Security (They do the Same there like they do at the Airport) and taking the elevator to the top floor, I made it.   My reaction when I first walked in was (OMFG) this place is amazing, 3 Decks of Tables and I was immediately sat down by the Window, such a spectacular view of the Las Vegas Strip, the Outskirts of the Strip, The Mountains (I wasn't sure if I saw Old Vegas or not). The Restaurant also rotates at 360 Degrees and you can see all of Las Vegas within 80 Minutes, also you'll notice that divers from the Sky Jump pass us on their way down (so remember to wave).   I started off with some bread and 3 different compound Butters to spread on (1. Lime, 2. Orange and 3. Garlic, They were all so good a nice little something to start off with). For my Appetizer I got the Roasted Kurobuta Pork Belly topped with Chimichurri and an Orange Gastrique over an Arborio Rice Cake with Cilantro, Aji Amirillo (Peruvian Yellow Chile Pepper) and Lime Powder (I loved it Juicy, Succulent, Cubes of Pork with those Crispy Rice Cakes on the Bottom, Perfect Contrast).   For my Entree I got the Seared Branzino topped with a Citrus Brown Butter Emulsion over a Mushroom Fricasee with Huitlacoche (Mexican Corn Truffle), Corn and Asparagus and finished with a Hibiscus Gastrique (Fish was perfectly cooked, flaky, good color on the Skin, Acidity from the Butter Sauce, Earthiness from the Fricassee and the Huitlacoche and a little of Tartness from the Gastrique).  The only negative thing about that dish was the Asparagus (it looked like it was steamed or Blanched, they were very bland and they had no part of being on that Plate, they were just leaning against the fish, it was unnecessary in my opinion. they should've just left it off the plate).   For my Dessert I got the Chocolate Duo: on the left was a Mini Chocolate Pot de Creme (French for Pot of Custard) and on the right were Fresh Mixed Berries in a White Chocolate Cup with a Vanilla Mousseline Cream (Such a nice ending to Lunch, The Pot de Creme with its smooth, creamy decadence and the White Chocolate Cup acting like a vessel to hold these fresh and tart berries). Lunch came out to almost $75 (Most Expensive lunch I've ever had) but I enjoyed it. Everything was marvelous The Food, the service, the people and especially The View (I loved having Lunch with a View). Such an awesome place for Dinner or a Date or to bring some friends (I'll be sure of that next time). After lunch I was all set to ride The X-Scream and The Big Shot, but I'll be sure to return again pretty soon

_qk3-lr_gdWybRkyOITkjQ.text: The food was amazing and the service was top notch at Top of the World. 6 starts all the way and a definitely a must do when in Las Vegas.

6PlUgwZmeWMniIgTVgHkpA.text: I love this place,one of my fevorite in vegas Highly recommended. Go when the sun goes down to enjoy both the day and the night of the beautiful las vegas. After hanging out at the top of the world go up to enjoy the brizz of thw high Stratosphere tower

lxWFxIyqaJeOVrv3iYnIHQ.text: Whoa if you stay in Las Vegas you must try this place out at least once. From the first interaction going up to the restaurant you felt special . The wait staff was amazing . I ordered the surf and turf and this was by far the most tender and juicest steak I have ever had. The lobster was very large and cooked to perfection. The view from here was amazing and seeing those who were doing the sky jump added a little more fun to the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and Turf

TjaxjYaeJZMA1lTX6emx5g.text: We had a lovely dinner on Christmas Night. I was disappointed in the dessert, we ordered Taramasu, It tasted like it had been in the refrigerator for a week or two, should have been fresh for this 5 star restaurant. Make sure you have reservations early!

mNtdiTMzw6yUDYJ0oXd8bA.text: Amazing views and food. Sensitive to dietary restrictions too. Patrick was our waiter and he was phenomenal. He made our experience exceptional in many ways!

JbJJvpprDY_4wDPTg52BfQ.text: I'll try not to repeat everyone else's comments, and add a couple of things that stood out:  - Out of our party of 10, the steak of one surf and turf was overdone. When brought to the attention of the server, the steak was replaced with one done just right very quickly, without anything but attention to rectifying the situation. A second lobster tail accompanied as well, which was very nice of them.  - You get admission to the viewing deck included with your meal (normally about $20, plus sometimes a wait in line). The view from there and from the restaurant is amazing, of course. Helicopters making close passes and diving bungee cord danglers provide entertainment.  - The lamb is a delicious alternative to a steak, especially for those who enjoy a bit of spice.  - This is not specific to this place, but if you've never had the dessert wine known as Pedro Ximenez, then this is as good a place as any for an introduction. A crowd-pleaser, to say the least.  This turned out to be an ideal location for a classy bachelor party dinner. Well done, ladies and gents.

Mtdz6nXWz0gvSQJHS-VKyA.text: Amazing view, friendly service and delicious food. Still have a photobook to remind of that day.

wDxa-3yKp0JH4qrIC8meNg.text: Looooved this place! My steak was incredible and I loved my lobster. Best view of Las Vegas hands down!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G0nxG_tpzsKwmjnLcN8gxA.text: This place has the best steak I've ever had!! Yes it is pricey but it's so worth the view and the food! The New York strip was very good as well as the pina colada!!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BD7Ao8W3F4HuwE2N9tvH0w.text: Such a beautiful fine dining experience. Whenever my parents visit we always go here and the waitresses and walkers are so welcoming, very attentive, and make you feel very special. The food is also quite amazing. I personally like the lobster bisque and their lamb. And they have  an amazing spinning view of the whole city! You literally dine on top of the world.

SJ9LdwIGOE4AHCY9R13pPw.text: What can I say wow!!! the view the food and the service all 5 stars., this place is a must for sunset dinner you are really on top of the world

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our table right next to the window.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7fFS8euCcIAiHmgxGx28_g.text: I was there for our anniversary. Love the ambience, service, & food. Memorable  Given the fineries, the price is nothing compared to their equivalence around the world.

vL8rry655p3gM_-ECr8I3g.text: The view is stunning but the food is extremely disappointing... The bread was hard and stale, what a bad start! I ordered the lobster bisque and I sent it back. I also got the eggs Benedict and i would rate it a 4 from 1-10. My friend got the lobster tail BLT sandwich and she sent that back. My mom ordered a steak sandwich and it was greasy and spicy. I was expecting much better food but this restaurant did not deliver. The server really didn't pay much attention to us and this place was relatively empty.. They have a lot of stuff to work on!  Come here for drinks and the view !! Not the food

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict

ZpADyA182ZvRkdH3msc-8w.text: I have been to the lounge many times, and love it. This time, we had a 10yro so the lounge was not an option.  We went in to have dessert, because the desserts here are amazing, and the view one of the best in the city!  Even though they prefer you go to Lounge 107 for dessert, appetizers and drinks, we asked if an exception could be made on a Saturday night?  After a quick check  in with the manager, we were told to come in. We were seated right away, and had an awesome server. Even after we told him we were only there for dessert. We felt completely taken care of start to finish! For dessert we had Banana Foster. A delicious cookie box filled with vanilla ice cream and caramelized bananas that they pour at the table. YUM! The individual lemon cheese cake is also amazing, easily enough to split as it is a small 4" cheesecake. The youngster, not a fan of trying anything to adventurous, had 2 scoops of vanilla ice cream and chocolate sauce. Simple enough, and he seemed happy.  After our awesome desserts, we headed up to the observatory for a few minutes to take in the lights of Las Vegas. Overall an amazing finish to a great night playing tourist with my visiting family!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas Foster for desert!! YUM!

yJSfTrRvqvmffSR9DwZkug.text: Wonderful place! The meal was great, view awesome and waitstaff very attentive. Pricey, yes, but worth it once in awhile. Did not do steak, but all fish eaten by the three of us was delicious. Lobster bisque was enjoyed by the two who ordered it. Scallops, sea bass and salmon were also consumed and all were excellent choices. Tres leches cake was enjoyed by the 3 of us as well. Save your money and treat yourself to the Top of the World restaurant.

rhsOZlMeurNZMyu-AmPhhA.text: I'm so incredibly disappointed in this place. I was so excited to come here for my birthday. We made reservations months ago.   I'll admit, the view is breathtaking. You get panoramic views of Las Vegas, and at night the lights make it even more gorgeous. If you get motion sickness like me, you had better come prepared. The restaurant rotates and even though they say you hardly notice, I'll have to say that you really do notice.   I came here with a group of six. My sister joined us, even though she's on an extremely strict diet and would only be ordering a plain salad. That's when it all went downhill. Our server treated us like we were poor folk venturing out to a fancy city meal. We hardly saw her. She didn't explain the menu, and I was so sad because all the servers around us were being so friendly.  She, was not friendly. And honestly, if I'm paying they much money for food, I expect a certain level of service. The bill for 6 people was just under $400. We however left unhappy.  The food wasn't spectacular, and I think it was really overpriced for that it was.  I got the ribeye, and it didn't have any flavor. My boyfriend got the salmon, and it was decent. I won't be going back here, I was so upset. If you want the view, they have a lounge. Check that out instead.

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf pasta with braised short rib and lobster
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye

Ap9i9NzENCLChq_XP-mpVw.text: The lunch prices are ridiculous, but so be it...you are really paying for the view and that alone is worth the money invested in a good, but not spectacular lunch.  The food is good, not spectacular (for the price) and we were able to fit 8 at our table and everyone still had a nice view...

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NzSY8uU3ZI_LSJdWsdGDIw.text: The service was amazing. I felt very welcomed and had a great time! Yum!! I had the soup of the day and shrimp scampi!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. :)
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great view!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster!

JZguOdjLO1wiBGIT_FclgQ.text: My husband and I just spent a small fortune to celebrate New Year's Eve overlooking Las Vegas. While the view was spectacular, the food and service was not. It took forever for the food to be served. My soup was cold, the steak was over cooked, and the lobster was raw. By the time we were served our food and paid for our beverages, we had 10 minutes to celebrate in the lounge. This meal definitely was not worth the cost.

BHTUh3JmBrnPiPqsFgGQZQ.text: I had no problem with the food, however the service seemed as if it was rushing us to order and seemed as if they did not want to serve us.

rSxX3tibkOkGOohs9jj72Q.text: Food was great and the view was amazing. Food is pretty pricey but worth it. The restaurant rotates so you are able to see the whole srip and everything around. After Dinner you are able to go higher for an outside view.

UUFSzP9J9uWKjXz5mY_gIQ.text: I do not like leaving negative reviews, but if the plate fits...sometimes you have to do it.  I was so looking forward to having dinner here because as often we are in Vegas we just never seem to have time.  So it was with great excitement that we booked our reservation for dinner at Top of The World.  First I want to say that the view IS amazing and a great way to see Vegas.  The atmosphere was extremely romantic which is exactly what we were looking for.  We were seated right away but here is where it went wrong.  I am not sure if our server was down an assistant but he was slow to get to us the whole evening.  While he was friendly, he seemed to rushed to really serve us and at the price, we expect excellent service.  We waited about 10 minutes before our server greeted us...and another 10 minutes before he came back for our drink order.  We were okay with that because hey you are there for the ambience so we sat back and relaxed taking in the view.  I just cannot eat a lot so hubby and I split a Caprese Salad with Heirloom tomatoes.  I have to say it was delicious and the only good part of my meal.  I ordered the Organic Half Chicken and hubby had the duck and we shared a potato dish.  My chicken was horrible.  I took two bites into it and could not eat anymore, it was over-cooked and dry.  My hubby's duck was overcooked as well but he was able to eat his.  While he did not think it was horrible he rated it about a 5 out of 10....but back to my chicken.  I kept waiting for our server to return so I could tell him about the chicken but by the time he checked back my husband was finished with his meal.  Here is what really peeved me.  Our server finally came back to check on us and when I told him about the chicken he looked at me in disbelief.  All you had to do was look at my barely touched plate and you could see it was extremely overcooked (I am not sure how it wasn't caught in the plating process).  He kept saying "really?"  YES REALLY! He then asks me if I want them to bring something else and I said no my husband was finished with his meal so I did not want to wait for another meal and eat alone.  He then tells me he has to check with his manager.  He then comes back and says they are going to comp our drinks BUT not the chicken!! The chicken I couldn't even eat!  So let's do the math....my husband had a drink 13.00 I had a drink 13.00 so they comped us 26.00 instead of the 37.00 (price of the chicken) that I couldn't eat! Look I realize it's only a 10.00 difference BUT I could drink my drink I couldn't eat the chicken.  We eat at a lot of nice restaurants and have no problem spending the money for great food but this was over the top bad service.  I didn't expect them to comp the meal BUT  I did expect them to not charge me for a meal that was so bad I couldn't eat it.  So sad it was not a good experience because I would have loved to put it on our must do's in Vegas  but bad food, bad service at this price makes it a no go.

hliyl4TsBJm4tqiGcZtQAw.text: For a romantic dinner, this is definitely the place! I took my then girlfriend here during our Vegas Valentine's Day excursion. She loved it as much as I did. This place is located within the Stratosphere, and reservations are strongly recommended. Getting to this revolving restaurant involves taking the elevator to the top, and checking in at the desk. Once your table is ready, you will be taken to the revolving restaurant and you will be amazed by the great views. The restaurant rotates at a slow rate, so you will get a change to enjoy the 360 degree view of Las Vegas. The view is especially great at night. The food itself is phenomenal. It is well worth the price, as it is made with the right balance of ingredients. Thus far, I've had the filet mignon and the salmon. To drink, I opt for the pinot noir. I have a glass to take in the view, and another one to accompany my meal.  The service is efficient, and the meal comes with many trimmings. I have not yet tried their desserts, but I will update when I do. Chances are, I will come back here on my next Vegas trip, so stay tuned.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2nfvuniDaOn0W6jYRMe0kg.text: The atmosphere and view was great.  The dining definitely was elegant and had a great ambiance.  I honestly think food is over priced and did not have any flavor.  If food would have had flavor it still was over priced.  It's definitely not a place for kids, my two kids didn't touch there "pizza" which was a flat bread & sprinkled cheese for $17 each.  I've been to better restaurants and don't mind paying a good dollar for a great bite.  Also the $25 to share a plate, I feel is extremely ridiculous and slap in face.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yy6gxCRwo_Q12EQ0nHA7vg.text: This place is MUST if you're in Vegas. The view is breathtaking. The staff is beyond nice, and the food and drinks were incredible. I've been to Vegas many times, and this was hands-down the best dining experience I've had there. The lobster bisque and lobster thermidor are heavenly. You won't be able to pass on dessert, as the rotating floor brings you by the dessert stand a few times, so go for the lemon bar cheesecake.   There were also people bungee jumping off of the top of the Stratosphere, and would swing by our window from time to time. Ha! This place is the quintessential Las Vegas experience. I won't be able to come back to town without going to The Top of the World!!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster Thermidor and crab cake
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. haha!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lemon bar cheesecake ... the sauce on the side is YUMMY!!

mx_4IjCmiV682qgj36_9_A.text: This is literally one of the most amazing restaurants you HAVE TO TRY BEFORE YOU DIE. I have NEVER experienced ANYTHING like this. It's so awesome to be able to see the entire view of Las Vegas while eating some amazing food!   I had the chefs tasting menu with the wine pairing and it was perfect! The champagne was a little heavy for the scallops but it was still amazing!!!!   Thanks for a great experience!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mn2245NOIC7dZrGZ92DiUg.text: Very very disappointed, as we had been there before had a good experience. This time we went for a birthday and we did inform them.  At the end of the meal they handed the birthday person a tiny unlit candle and said this is for when you have a birthday cake. No other acknowledgment.  The bread was cold and soggy. My steak was well cooked and the waitress was attentive. If I go back it will be for the view and a cocktail and appetizer.

6JORmmXcIUvPS7ar-C9v5A.text: Top of the World is for sure a tourist destination - but one of the better ones I experienced.   Just so everyone knows - yes the restaurant spins! We went at 8:30 PM and it was dark outside - I feel this would be the best time to sit high above the strip and take in all the lights of the city that never sleeps.   To begin, you have to go through quite a bit of pre-screening before arriving to the restaurant. (After walking through the casino and up an escalator to get to the elevators to go up) so keep that in mind when you're giving yourself time to get to the restaurant.   To begin - YOU MUST if you like chocolate martini's get one. It was delicious. My coworker and I both got a few. Secondly - the bread is "hard" per their direction so don't bite into it expecting fluffy flakes. (This was odd but the butters were delicious so I went with it).  We did the al la carte menu, but there is a chef's tasting menu option as well. I had the 9 oz fiet that was cooked to perfection and we shared the green beans and potato puree sides. And the sides were heavenly. Also we got salads to start - they were much larger than anticipated. Two could easily share one as an appetizer.   Additionally - they have a photographer that goes around and takes photos while you're at dinner. We got suckered into buying one for each of us because we were there for a special occasion (it was my birthday) but normally we wouldn't buy one. The also gave a "free dessert" because of my birthday. It was rather small and one person even called it a "Chocolate fart"....which was funny. But alas, it was small but mighty of a dessert.   Lastly, since we ate at the restaurant they allowed us free entranced to the observation deck. I'm not sure what the cost of that is but it was nice.   Overall, fun experience. Not something super awesome that I would do again - but still fun

eKWlwP19U4PGWQVcU-ucxA.text: I really love this place. For tourist trap it certainly does have excellent food.  I've been twice - first time, four years ago.  Next year I plan to go back and do the bungee jump, then celebrate in this fabulous restaurant.   Smiles

4UvmD8HnbySvoK8t8JfHtg.text: So how I ended up at this restaurant is I wanted to see the view of Vegas from the Stratosphere Hotel (note this is not a good area of town. One wrong turn and you'd be somewhere you don't want to be). Unbeknownst to me there was a $20 fee to go to up to the observation floor. Hmm no and thank you but since it was lunch time I rationalized that it would make sense to eat and see the view at the same time. My waiter's name was Zachary. He was nice and checked on me a lot... in the beginning lol. The restaurant is fancy but low key during lunch. I wanted the cheapest dish on the menu but ordering a sandwich seemed too casual. Then I reminded myself that I was on vacation alone and I deserved to treat myself. So I went for the gusto and ordered the Chef's tasting menu! First course I ordered the lobster bisque. The flavor was decent but another tablespoon of lobster was needed. For my Second course I ordered the seared scallop with cauliflower salad because I love both. This was insteresting not sure in a good way. The scallop was cooked perfectly but the cauliflower was cut uneven. There were big pieces and little pieces so it altered the eating experience. There were also raisins in the salad. The sweet element was different but I could have done without it. For my Third course I ordered filet mignon and shrimp scampi. The steak was bland and over cooked. I asked for medium. It came out medium well. I didn't send it back like I normally would have. The string beans were bland. The shrimp scampi was ok but I wasn't really  interested since the star of the show was ruined. Dessert was pretty but again wasn't enthused by this point. Service between the courses was slow. Not sure why because it wasn't busy. Good thing I had a bottle of wine to occupy me which a time or two I had to pour myself a glass and when the waiter did pour it he'd leave the cap off smh. This visit $180 and 2 hours later. In conclusion the view is AMAZING and and distracted me from the sub par food. This was a been there done that place for me. I wouldn't come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon and shrimp scampi
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared scallop with cauliflower salad
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bisque - lobster

Bnd32naF41Y8JK1J3coiYg.text: 5 stars for sure for the view and ambiance.  It is just a fantastic place to see Las Vegas and can't be beat! The food was 4 stars - maybe 3 stars at comparable high quality restaurants - very good, but not fantastic.  It was well worth the time and money however with the view and service.  The price fix menu was great with the filet darn good, but again not the absolute best.  All in all it was worth it to go and have this unique experience.  I would say a must do at least once while in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great view of Vegas

rw4JMajsFEogwH4C5uR9gg.text: I took my husband, for his birthday , here...just this week.  We have been to a Top Of the world restaurant in NY and Hawaii and i have to say the view is much better here...no obstruction of view at all.  Hawaii was amazing of course, but there were still buildings in the way but since this particular restaurant is higher ...the view was amazing.   we went during lunch time on a Wednesday...which was perfect bc there weren't too many people..so we were seated right next to the window.  this is a rotating restaurant and by the time we finished our lunch , which was a 3 course meal we opted for, we had made a full rotation.    Our waiter was informative, gave us the right suggestions and gave us information about visiting the observation deck after lunch , so we thank him for that.   the food...AMAZING. we have been to 5 star restaurants where the views is amazing..the ambiance is amazing...but the food is blah...not this place...it was amazing.  we had the lobster bisque , the filet (JR) , with a side of potatoes and the dessert was yummy.   I highly recommend this place..especially for lunch when you can get a beautiful view ...and go for their lunch 3 course meal..worth it.   we will return !

RYIr78IWtA7QXh_pY3l2vA.text: Jennifer, Grace and Glenn were spectacular! Wonderful food, but the staff really made it worth it.  We had the four course meal and the filet was cooked to perfection.  The view is really astounding... the mountains, the Strip, Fremont St. are all really neat to see from up high.  But, once again, it was the staff who really made the place shine for me!

xDqT3TGqK3UNN2VNH59mRQ.text: Worth every penny. The food may not look like it would be filling but the portions are perfect. I make an excuse to dine there as often as possible! If you don't want to splurge on dinner lunch is a great lower priced alternative!

O0Hx2WMOyW24xpIm2_IrMA.text: My first time on Top of the World was my husband's birthday. Everything was just as good as it had to be. Of course, the view is amazing and there is no way to exaggerate that. And you can never get enough of it!  Yes, they search your bags and make you go through the metal detector. Yes, the dress-code is business casual. But what did u expect? Sweaty T-shirts and shorts with hairy legs all around?! We had to wait some 15 mins before taken to our table, so we spent the time on the outside terrace, enjoying the breath-taking view.  All of our requests were kindly met, the waiters were polite, funny, professional and not at all annoying. It was an extremely comfortable pass-time.  We even had a birthday candle to make a wish on the desert :) As for the food, well, I'm not much of a high-class restaurant goer, but I felt it could be improved. Let me be clear, evthing we ordered was tasty, well-done, nothing wrong. BUT! I can cook that very same New York steak myself... Guess, I expected food to be as impressive as the view outside. However, this was an evening to remember, and I strongly recommend  everyone to share the pleasure. By the way, the cost is quite reasonable.

7DcUtLCEf4KD7pu7ZLomYA.text: Ok.  I will make it simple an honest for my visit.  View, outstanding especially at sunset.  I requested a table with a view for a special occassion for my daughters 21st B-day, my wife and I's anniversary and my daughter was also on leave from the Navy.  The service was very good and we got a visit from the GM who saw our request and came over.  He is also former Navy and wanted to meet my daughter.  Excellent touch.  The food is good, but I will say if you are a foodie type or you really like deep flavor, this is really not the place.  There are more top chefs around on the strip or go to Smith and Wollensky.  Not saying it is bad, but for the price you pay you can do better.  If you are having a special occassion and want it to be memorable, then by all means go to the Top of the World.,

bMi6py1Bw74lWhjYEyAlNg.text: This was my first time here and indeed the view of the city was amazing!  However, that was all I can really say was great about this restaurant.  Even though we had reservation, the hosting at the door was quite unorganized.  We checked in, and was told to stand to the side to wait for our table.  We waited for a while, and finally had to flag down another hostess to take us to our table.  She didn't seem very happy, and didn't even greet us until we arrived at our table.  My boyfriend had the five course tasting menu which came with the soup of the day, crab cake with green papaya salad, roasted miso black cod with ponzu butter sauce, grilled petit filet mignon, and mini desserts trio.  I had the large prawns and scallops with Morrocan couscous, and we ordered half a dozen oysters to share.  The food overall was mediocre for such a nice restaurant, and not flavorful at all.  My favorite out of all those dishes were the oysters, but I've tasted so much better in Vegas.  Our waiter was nice and had our glasses of water refilled constantly.  Other than the ambiance, I wouldn't recommend this place if you wanted something yummy for your palate.  Also, the restaurant slowly revolves so you get to see all angles of the city.  I am sensitive to motion, so it was a little uneasy at first, but after a while, I got use to it.

j7d7af3B7qnBCUEOvSMpKA.text: I came here with a couple friends Mid July 2010! Tremendous view, you honestly cannot beat it.   Now, it was quiet and friendly and entertaining with the jumpers from the higher floor, very cool to see.. Thought about doing it, but i am a chicken haha  I got the Lobster and Steak Combination dinner  for only $40, which came with Lobster Bisque, roasted Potatoes, seared vegetables AND DESSERT!  Presentation was fabulous, all of the staff were friendly nice and hapy...  LOBSTER... I have had lobster A LOT... and 90% of the time at restaurants its Overcooked and tuff and flavorless.. and 1 time it was so bad i had to ask them to make it again... the Chef told me that was the way its supposed to be cooked... uh huh..  Top of the world restaurant Chef, I Love You... You made the most perfect succulent and sweet lobster i have ever had the pleasure of eating... Lobster wow.. :)  Steak, flavorful perfectly cooked to my liking, if only they had better cuts..   The Lobster Bisque was smoky rustic and authentic tasting, it may have been slightly smoky for me but i still ate every drop.. and sopped it up with my bread  DESSERT... There were three different kinds one with raspberry creme which was delicious a chocolate morsel and something else i cannot remember.. i ate them too fast... lovely presentation  The Chef is amazing, i found out at the end of the meal he is French no wonder!!   GO HERE!! You will NOT regret it!! mmm delicioso!!

ItdgaSUdLFEiKeidz22BDg.text: "What a big steaming pile of pony loaf."  That's the first thought that pops into my mind when I think of Top of the World Restaurant @ Stratosphere.  This is the single worst of the supposed "mid/high class restaurants" that I've been to in Vegas.  PURE CLASSLESS PANDERING: The second thing that pops into my mind is, "What an incredibly classless sham."  But if you've ever been to the Stratosphere Tower, you already knew that didn't you?  What, with the endless parade of Disneyland-esque shops that they just happen to force you to wander past just to get to the restaurant's very entrance, it should be obvious after realizing that the restaurant was just another revenue generator around the one-trick-pony that is the Stratosphere, that this was all going to lead to nothing but utter disappointment for the evening.  How do I loathe this place?  Let me start with the view.  WAIT... YOU HATE IT BECAUSE OF THE 108 STORY VIEW? Not exactly.  I have a problem with this restaurant because the view is absolutely the only thing they have going for it.  The view is gorgeous whether you're near the windows or "above" in the loge dining area.  The rotating restaurant is a great concept and I'm sure all year long, the patrons flock to Top of the World to "dine in the sky", only to discover that they may have a view from heaven, but a they also get a dining experience from hell.  this Restaurant is about as well-tended to as a Denny's - and the Vegas Strip Denny's has much better prices, and piping hot food to boot.    To be 100% clear, if this restaurant wasn't on the bazillionth floor of the Stratasphere, I absolutely believe that it would have gone out of business years ago.  WOW... WHAT'S SO BAD THAT THEY'D GO OUT OF BUSINESS? First of all, I've been there 3 times, (Stratosphere's got some good casino coupons) and 2 out of 3 of these times I was there my main course was served cold. In one case, part of my Kobe medallions course tasted like death barely warmed over, prompting me to send it back.  I even talked to a couple next to me and they mentioned that their food could have been warmer too.  But this isn't that surprising because the service is so atrociously slow.  I used to think that the problem lay entirely with the wait staff not delivering the food in a timely fashion when my order is up but since my lukewarm Kobe, I've come to the conclusion that everyone there from the host to the chefs to the waiters just... don't... really care.  It frankly goes beyond service though:  I had Filet Mignon here, and it had a wine & mushroom sauce on it.  Filet's usually not the most flavorful cut but I certainly expected the softest steak they had available, and instead I got something like a tasteless cube of what I suppose was beef but considering the difficulty I had with it and a steak knife, I can't really be certain.  And then suddenly, I understood why they put a mushroom wine sauce on it:  To cover up the fact that it was a weak tasteless steak to begin with.    SAUCES, HUH?  OVERUSED MAYBE? Well, as I went from dish to dish (asparagus, lobster ravioli, etc.) I realized that that was what the common thread was:  It felt like it was a warmed over cafeteria meal served 108 floors up.  None of the dishes would ever stand on their own so every course was constantly covered up in some sort of thick sauce or glaze.  Hollandaise sauce, Wine sauce, Apricot sauce, Ginger sauce... over and over again with the sauces.  Additionally, I think the cheesy & cheap nature of the Stratosphere lends itself to getting a rather crass group of customers.  I saw people in the restaurant with very questionable attire and I was trying to figure out if I was the one being and old codger or were these kids wearing just completely inappropriate clothes.  Tennis shoes & jeans appear to be the norm with lots of douchebag-ish Ed Hardy garb.  One girl looked like she was wearing lingerie and just grabbing a bite to eat on her way to Poly Esthers... or maybe the Rhino.  One never can tell with this bunch.  On a humorous note, I once saw one of those cheesy photographers going around taking couple's pictures as this "momentous occasion" of eating at Top of the World, the later showing them the photo and charging them something like $20 on their restaurant bill for the photo.  The price springs to mind because a couple I sat next to was muttering something about the price they paid while they were perusing the check.  CONCLUSION: I'll say that this establishment barely escaped from having  the "1-Star of Doom"(TM) stamped on their forehead and  I will pull no punches when an organization deserves serious criticism: - The horrendous service - The unforgivably cold food - The poor quality of the steak - The crass environment ...and +1 star for being in the damned Stratosphere and having a view.  2-Stars.  Terrible, borderline awful.

Vc7JbYQrljcHa7aCID21Mg.text: View: BEAUTIFUL (go at night) the room doesn't spin fast or anything so no worries of being nauseated or dizzy.  Food: DELICIOUS. Great portion. The portion was bigger than I thought (2 thumbs up especially for the fine dining price.) I ordered the quail (WOW) and my bf ordered the filet mignon (another WOW). Both dishes were AWESOME!! As for dessert, we ordered the trio where u get to choose any 3 from their dessert menu. I think we ordered chocolate lava cake, banana bread pudding, and creme brulee. OMG the creme brulee was my FAVORITE of all 3 and my bf said that the bread pudding was the best he's ever tasted (and he's tasted ALOT.)  Service: what more can I say. 5 star service.

u0_o-uQxNquEgrEDJ2G7jw.text: A spinning restaurant sounds a bit like a disaster of nausea waiting to happen, but it's really not like that.   This restaurant looks out over all of Las Vegas and, yes it spins, but so slowly you don't really notice it. Well, not until you get up to go to the bathroom and lose your table for a few seconds.   Overall, it's a bit overpriced for the quality of the food, but our waiter was fantastic, we were in a great mood, the view was fantastic, and my friends and I looked fantastic (it's all about me, me, me).   I ordered the Filet Mignon and it was cooked to my specifications, the wine that accompanied it was a good choice, and the sides did the job. I wouldn't say this is anywhere close to the best steak I've ever had, but it was pretty darn good. Plus, the joy of looking out over the bright Vegas lights gives it an extra star.   I would suggest checking it out if you're a Vegas regular and haven't had the chance yet.
