oDTf5NUylnNCPbjRVh_oPg.text: Okay, I was in Vegas a couple of weeks ago for the biggest gathering of nerds, techies, rocket scientists and geeks on the planet.  And yes, I admit, I'm one of them, and yes, we are HOT.  Anyways, it was time to make a decision for dinner. The choice was to either have dinner with my fellow co-workers from out-of-town at this place or eat by myself at another hotel buffet (ugh, not another...).  So, simple enough, join the group.  The view is indeed spectacular and the service, attentive.    But, and a BIG BUT, the menu was predictable and boring consisting of your typical red-meat Black Angus Schmangus shit, salmon, and sea bass (woohoo) and pairing it with sides like garlic mashed potatoes (good gawd),  asparagus (yippee), plus salads (Caesar's, told you they're predictable), and soup (lobster bisque, oh come on), desserts (creme brulee....lord almighty)  I got the lamb chops which was, ehh, okay but cooked a bit too rare.  It's a revolving restaurant, so please, do yourself a favor and mind how much you drink  because I don't want to pick you 1,000 feet down, your pea brain splattered all over the sidewalk, nor smell your fucking puke in the elevator 104 floors up!  And don't get lost going around in circles trying to find the restroom. It's always been on the same spot, it's the table where you're seated that's moving, dumbass.  Good thing it's on company expense because I'm not going to spend this much money on this place.   Minus 1 more star for the looong ass way getting to this restaurant. And stop frisking me already, I'm not going to bomb Stratosphere, you TSA wannabe!

XtbNbPMkPR7V2ukbBEogJQ.text: Undoubtably, the view at Top of the World is breathtakingly gorgeous. Five stars if all we are yelping on is views alone.  But I can't eat a view, so Top of the World ranks considerably more south of the equator in my book.  Food: Entrees are priced from $45 - $65. Sides are a la carte, which means if you want more than just a slab of meat on your plate, you will probably dish out another $20. I find this kind of pricing a little deceitful and offensive. Even so, it would have been fine with me if the food was good. Unfortunately......  (prices are approximate. I don't have that kind of memory.) Chilean Sea Bass: $45 - boring and bland. Not so much moist as it was soggy. No distinct flavor at all. It was encrusted with porcini mushroom dust but it could have been pixie dust for all I could discern. It was also served on wilted romaine lettuce, which I think romaine lettuce should never be served as. Better choices would have been wilted baby spinach, kale, or even beet greens. I'm a big huge fan of sea bass and found this dish quite disappointing.  Asparagus: $10 - Christ. These were the soggiest, blandest asparagus I've ever had. Were they boiled in unfiltered tap water for an hour?! Cooked for just a second longer and you could have scooped these up in a jar and stuck a Gerber label on it. Asparagus tastes amazing broiled or grilled, with maybe a slight glaze of olive oil and a pinch of sea salt -- none of which will compete with the natural flavor and sweetness of this green-stalked pee-smell-changer. To have such a simply delicious vegetable stripped of any nutrients or flavor is downright  veggie blasphemy. I was tempted to throw a stalk at the revolving window just to see what the staff would do.   Lobster Mashed Potatoes: $14 ooooooh, how I wanted to love this dish! Two of my favorite foods mating in one big bowl, what could possibly go wrong? Alas, the potatoes were so dry, I could have used them to plaster that crack in my bedroom ceiling. There was some kind of bbq-flavored "gravy" and little chunks of lobster...it wasn't horrible, but I wasn't impressed.   Garlic Mashed Potatoes: $10 Technically my bf's dish, but of course I noshed too. Dry. Uninspired. And I couldn't discern any real garlic. Roast those suckers and blend them in, folks.   Ribeye: $50 bf's meal since I don't eat cow. He actually liked his meal; it was cooked perfectly and had great texture. However, he said he had better. On many occasions.  Overall, my impression is that Top of the World caters to a very base culinary crowd. Those whom are so distracted and awestruck by the view that they actually think the mediocre food they are shoveling into their mouth tastes good.   We ended up spending almost $200 for a dinner for two (I'm including the $40+ it cost us to get from MGM to Stratosphere and back, because I'm a bit bitter about it. I would have been so much happier eating at any of the restaurants within our own hotel). We didn't even order any wine, alchohol, or dessert.  After dinner, we took the elevator up to the Observatory Deck (outdoor), which was **incredible**!  You can see all of Vegas, including the main strip. I tried to convince my pusssy bf to ride the roller-coaster with me, but he wasn't having it.   Bottom Line: eat at a REAL restaurant, then go up to the Observatory Deck for the astounding view, without the huge markup on sub-par, "Black Angus" type food.

wR-CClQ2aPiyNiBYQLRAtA.text: My review is for the LOUNGE part of the restaurant.   My boyfriend and I were staying at the Stratosphere and looking for somewhere to hang out and have a drink. He mentioned the lounge at the top of the tower and I reluctantly agreed. I'm scared of heights but I was curious to check it out. It's normally $6 for hotel guests to gain access to the top of the tower, but since we were going to the lounge, it was free and we were able to go through a private entrance with a separate elevator. It was pretty cool.. it felt a little VIP even though it wasn't ;) You do have to go through a small security check before you can ride to the top.  Once we got to the top (the trip up took about 2 minutes), we exited the elevator and saw the view. Immediate vertigo.. it's such a weird feeling. The lounge is very dark and lit by little blue lights.. it's nice and intimate. You can sit wherever you want for the most part. They have a nice selection of martinis. Drinks are reasonable.. we expected them to be pricey but my martini was $10. It's a one drink per person minimum which isn't bad at all.   The view is breathtaking. I think it would be so cool to watch the sun set up there. The kind of scary thing is that the place shakes a bit every few minutes. You get used to it while seated, but I walked around and freaked out a bit when it shook. We stayed for almost two hours. It would be really fun with a small group.  I think it would be nice to eat in the restaurant, but I had a look at the menu and none of the offerings suit my tastes. Duck and whatnot, and pretty pricey. I like that the restaurant slowly rotates.. unfortunately the lounge doesn't.

cn2nqXmkV-2GAmNeJUxdVA.text: I came here to enjoy the ambiance and left feeling more than satisfied.  I had ordered the lobster bisque, which was the best lobster soup I have ever had to date.  My next dish was the Californian Chicken with a side of mash potatoes and green beans.  The chicken was cooked well and can taste every bit of it.  It took me back to thanksgiving.  The service was superb.  They refilled our wine glasses and water.  Did I mention that the views were spectacular.  I started off looking at the strip and after 1 hour or so, I came back around, which was an excellent way to end the evening.

ltnaWvMH5FrhMPaYmm-E1Q.text: We went here on Valentine's day on a last minute romantic night. I believe there is only 1 other restaurant like this up on the space needle in Seattle. The whole dining room moves in a complete 360 every hr. So you get diff parts of vegas as you go through dinner. Great date night or romantic night. Not so much if you don't like heights. Great food great service great place to go.

PGvAAnoSXLScWUkj8zPwkw.text: Overall my expierience at the Top of the World Restaurant was ok and worth the visit but I do not think I would go back. Do not get me wrong but it is a great place to take a date, especially for a special occasion such as a birthday, anniversary, divorce... etc... The service is impeccable, view's astonishing and food..... Ok..... I may have set my hopes to high on the menu and what I ordered but it was nothing to exciting flavor wise nor did it have me asking for seconds. Unfortunately my girlfriend thought the same way about her meal but did agree that it was worth doing once since I have lived here for so long.   Please do not let this review stop you from going. If you have never been before, I highly recommend you go and try it out. Bring a date or two and maybe you will find this place as the second-coming or something in terms of food, service and view.

Ow-GdH0ipAbXI2JSnV-57w.text: While the Vegas strip view was absolutely gorgeous, the spinning 360 view gets a little dizzy if you try too hard focusing on it. Like most Vegas tourists, we were tricked here thinking it would be the dining and visual experience of our lives....err...NOT !!  Upon entrace,  you have to pass through this ghetto casino on your way to this restaurant. I define ghetto by the old, moldy smell of the carpets, slot machines that looked like it was from the 80's and the classless crowd.  I define classy as something like the Wynn. The restaurant itself anything but modern  and the dishes were average at most but had a above average price tag.  I did get a little annoyed too when the picture taking lady were pressuring us to buy the portrait she took of us. She didn't even take the time to wait till we were all ready. she jus snapped away and I swore my eyes were looking elsewhere in the photo. when we rejected her ridiculous offer of 20 dollars per portrait she gave us the biggest attitude and walked away. Way to blow your customers away, woman !  Never again.

X088E6Fe_aECwsSOw0cccw.text: We had lunch there while staying at the stratosphere hotel. Obviously the attraction of the restaurant is the view. We were surprised by the quality of the food, I ordered a Cod and my friend ordered a seafood pasta. The fish was moist and tender, and the seafood was actually very fresh, as a New Englander, that's a great compliment. : ) Food was not cheap, but not as expensive compare to the Vegas - strip prices. I took a video of the rotating view, check it out at youtube.com/watch?v=h5qI...

0D3KsxBmjcSZ_GIz0uLWlQ.text: This place is EXPENSIVE... but its good food with gigantic portions.  Our dinner for 4 (without alcohol or dessert), was $350.  I had a 10 oz Filet Mignon ($48).  Then you order your side separately.  Another $10 for garlic mashed potatoes... and another $12 for a Cesar salad!  It was an enormous amount of food.... with an enormous price tag to match!  Our service was incredible and the food was delicious, but if I didn't win big at the casinos that day... I probably wouldn't have gone.

PvNIXGvHcNMym6m-D4hmpQ.text: Despite the fact that this restaurant is located in the somewhat churlish Stratosphere Hotel.....it's an absolute find. Don't mind the walk through the low stakes gambling tables and Midwestern flip flops because this restaurant is definitely a special place for a special occasion. The views are mouth dropping and you'll gasp as sky-diving derelicts jump past your window. The city lights are ever changing as the restaurant completes a 360 degree spin at 1200 feet. And all of this while eating the best filets ever (literally melts in your mouth). The servers were very attentive and the staff was professional and pleasant. But make sure you bring your Platinum AMEX because between a few drinks, two filets and a couple of side dishes, the bar and table bill came in at $350 with tip. But as far as I am concerned...it was well worth it. Definitely a night to remember

Dp8tswcGtNMV8azwgJeniQ.text: My husband got food poisoning after eating the most expensive steak on the menu...but the view was great.

ed9TKAnRDFA_qNayyeIcLQ.text: BF: so they were thinking of going to Stratosphere for dinner tomorrow, the revolving one. Me: oh OK. Me thinking:  that's kinda corny isn't it?  But oh well, we're going with people visiting from NJ, and I've never been there myself.  1st, the valet is in the back of the building as opposed the front. Then, you have to go the long way to get to the bottom of the tower since there's no short cut, for some odd reason.  When you get to the bottom of the tower, you have to "check-in" for the restaurant.  Then they asked you to wait in some kind of green room, until you're escorted to the  ..  metal detector?  I didn't realize I'm having dinner at the airport.  After the brief puzzle, we waited for the elevator.    So we're in front of the elevator, waiting, and noticed the button wasn't lit. What would *you* normally do? Exactly!  As soon as we started walking forward to reach for the button, we were notified rather startlingly  that we're not allowed to press the button.  Should have told us sooner, no? or put a sign by the button "not" to touch it.  We finally got up to the 107th floor, were told to go to the door on the left and had to check-in again before someone finally escorted to our table. I've never experienced such lengthy process just to have dinner.  Our waiter did make a good suggestion, so I liked him.  I normally make it a point to ask what the more popular dishes are at the restaurant (or what's the chef's favorite is), and most of the time it has not disappoint me.   Between the 4 of us, we had 1/2lb king crab legs for appetizer which was good.  As for entree: fillet mignon -- which I heard was pretty good; sea bass which in my opinion didn't look too appetizing; my bf had pork chop which was over cooked; and I had veal which I thought was very good.  Mine was probably the best out of the 4, w/o trying the fillet and the sea bass.  Although the view was awesome, and  I enjoyed my meal, this isn't a place where I'd go back to unless I'm showing people around LV.  And when I do, I will either have the recommended Veal or rack of Lamb.  We capped the night at the jazz lounge upstairs with some cocktails. It was an enjoyable evening for our last night in Vegas.   BTW.. can someone explain the Purell anti-bacterial dispenser by the entrance to the restaurant?

M89snFs1XoElYpA-42xnZA.text: Awesome place. Went here with a small group of friends and had a great time. The food was delicious and the view was amazing. Its in the stratosphere and literally at the top of the hotel. It slowly spins while eating. I definitely say its a must place to dine while visiting Vegas, or those that frequent Vegas quite a bit its worth a stop and deserve a spot in your itinerary.  It does get a bit pricey but thats Vegas for you. Any fine dining your expected to drop a couple hundred. I believe a meal for us 4 with two bottles of wine came out around $400.   I would definitely dine here again. Though don't get too full, u want to save room for all that alcohol and raging at the Vegas night clubs.

PdM2MNJhw1l18Vd8Iv_eJQ.text: Beautiful view of the Las Vegas Strip = overpriced food. I know we are in Vegas but come on if you are spending $$$$ on dinner you expect the kitchen to cook a proper steak. Service was great... the waiter was patient with us asking all these questions about the food and drinks. Our table ordered the Seafood Appetizer which included jumbo shrimp, lobster, ahi poke, ceviche. The lobster and shrimp were yummy but the ahi poke didn't look fresh at all. I ordered the filet mignon and the bf ordered the rib eye we also split the creamed spinach with blue cheese and potatoes gratin. We both got our steaks medium rare but they were sort of overcooked I don't know if it was a bad night but it's no excuse for a steakhouse to serve overcooked steaks to their customers. The creamed spinach and potatoes were yummy of course! Not a place to go back to or recommend. If you really want to see the view of the strip pay the $20 and take the elevator up.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Appetizers

5taSd0yc5D8QLCtGj64OVw.text: Rachel Ray move the hell over!   The food was pretty damn good. I was pretty surprised. Most places that have a great location or great view usually have mediocre food. But they were on point this time.   Had the quack and turf, duck, steak and fois grois (yes i spelled that wrong) damn tasty. The service was great. Friendly staff, always filling your water, asking if you need something, bringing you more bread, or clearing crumbs and plates away. The staff is pretty funny and happy.  yes this place rotates. I didn't realize it till we sat down. And it was night time too. It was terrible. it went really slow. Towards the end of dinner we finally saw the kitchen, and how busy it was. Just try not to stare out the window to keep from throwing up.  I have a fear of heights, but if you don't stare intensely out the window it'll be ok. Food was good, and then afterward you can go upstairs to the observation deck.

0X1JKIJqS_6HUn2_ut04Wg.text: First, you should know the food was delicious so this poor review is not for the food.  This review is for the service.  Absolutely horrendous.  I made a reservation a month before maybe even two months before and when my party arrived we had to wait for 1/2 an hour.  Yes a whole 30 minutes to be seated.  When I asked what the problem was I got excuse after excuse.  That is unacceptable.  I want a table not a reason why you do not have one of which is not even valid considering I have a reservation for 20 minutes ago.    After being seated the waiter took forever to take our order.  We did get our drink order in but unfortunately (and maybe this was because no alcohol was ordered.. hey people I know I know.. it's Vegas and all but we had a bottle service waiting for us and well...  two bottles and six girls...  no drinking at dinner...) only the ones who ordered soda were given refills.  The rest of us were never asked if we wanted another drink... another strike against.  The bread... what bread... they don't serve bread.  Actually they do but it came just before our meal which was about 45 minutes into the dinner.  Also, finally....  The waiter was chewing GUM!!!  So gross.. I am sorry but this type of restaurant should not even allow gum on the premises.  yuck.    Needless to say after the meal I spoke with the manager.  of course my little professional side came out and I was very straightforward and as polite as one can be when explaining about how unacceptable the service was for the evening from beginning to end.  He asked what he could do for me.. I responded, "we have already paid the check, what can you do for me"?  So, he bought a round of drinks for me and my girls as well as made sure to not only sit us at the best spot in the bar but also escort us up to the bar.  That was very professional and gave him points but all in all this restaurant was a bust.  Food... very good... service... not worth the food...  make of it what you will

yDvvx6As6M5fstY5hD5WGw.text: The top of the world restaurant is nice, it does revolve and the view of the city is ok, (I am just spoiled living so close to the ocean has made this desert town view seem somewhat bland). The food is nice but not really worth The price at $100 to about $300 per person. the wine pairings are for the most part near perfect and perhaps the only reason worth braving the wait, (post reservation) and the feeling of being gouged for seemingly overpriced yet very superb cuisine. I would say that if you live in the area and you need somewhere nice to go for an anniversary this might be it, but other than that, the top of the world restaurant doesn't really have much purpose, other than taking in the big time tourist bucks.    CHAD

YcU83L7LhRylfLD6GIIDkw.text: Food is great!  Must get the filet mignon with red wine mushroom sauce. Pretty much everything is good and prices are reasonable. +Plus the 360 sceanic view.

W0QN1Y1zNjjWgoC7xkOV4Q.text: Fantastic view!  Food is good except the lobster bisque was only lukewarm. Enjoyed the rest of the dinner; the banana foster was yummy. Staff was attentive.  Add watching sky divers jumping from the observatory, all in all a memorable evening.

qNsmTwv-FkBnv8OQeicgAg.text: Brilliant evening, great food great service stunning view! Well worth it. An evening we will remember for the right reasons for a long time.

yitVL3n1ljeDlzaUkJSeIw.text: i see everything.   i see the strip... i see mt Charleston... i see Green Valley and Henderson... i see Summerlin... i see the crazy horse 2 (what what)... i see the sun in my eyes...  i see dudes falling to their deaths (or not, sky jump people... relax)... i see tasty vittles brought to my table... i see the peeps above me enjoying happy hour... i see a guy proposing to his girl... i see it all.  the GRUB: - Lobster Bisque - bowl is presented with a healthy amount of pulled lobster... then the server pours the bisque over... enjoy - Jumbo Lump Crab Cake - see pictures, visually stimulating with plenty of sauces and micro greens as the bed for the crab cake - and a generously sized and flavorful crab cake set on top - Turf and Quack - 10 oz fillet Mignon, crispy fois gras, and grilled duck breast served with whipped yams - fillet was a perfect medium rare... the duck was sliced thin and juicy... the fois gras was a bit on the oily side, but its fois gras, its supposed to be a little fatty. - Wife had the Mediterranean Lamb Chops with green beans and cous cous... i had a bite, and the the spices on the lamb were phenomenal. i was a tad bit jealous. the cous cous was fluffy and the green beans on point. - single scoop of Mango Sorbet with micro gelatin balls filled with citrus... delicious cap to the meal.  the JOINT: - one word says it all - VIEW. you just cant beat it. - rotating floor lets you see all of it. - high class, white table clothes, and great romantic ambiance. - take the elevator up. - plenty of light at the top.  the SQUEEZE: - You have to know this is a bit on the 3 to 4 $ scale, so the expected dinner bill was unexpectedly affordable... $200 for 2 is not bad considering we got 2 apps, 2 bottled iced teas, 2 entrees and 2 desserts - plus table for 2 on a rotating platform, ticket for 2 to the top of the Strat including observation deck, and the VIEW. not bad at all. - Service was top notch - Cash and Cards accepted, maybe even table chips... i dont know.  FINAL SAY: if celebrating a special event, or in the mood of eating at the highest point in the Las Vegas Valley... Top of the World is where its at.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb chops - Mediterranean spiced rubbed lamb, cous cous and green beans
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turf and Quack - 10 oz Filet, Crispy Fois Gras, and grilled Duck breast with whipped yams

k0uDMkduTfMO9Lbv_s9-kg.text: We ate here May 4, 2011 for my daughter's birthday. Before you even go up the elevator, a word of warning. There is a metal detector and weapons are prohibited, so if you have a concealed carry permit and you carry in Vegas (you should), you have to leave it in your car as they have no storage lockers available. Luckily the valet hadn't moved my car yet, so I was able to leave my Glock hidden in there. Not the most satisfactory solution, but there were no problems.  Food was excellent, service was great, prices were expensive. I would certainly return for one of those "special occasion" dinners.

2l8GisIf0DFsfXr31shcGQ.text: We almost didn't go here, it was on our last day in Vegas we decided to check it out.  Instead of paying to go to the observation deck (which is $17 per person!), we decided to have lunch at the restaurant instead.  What a treat!  They have a decent menu with good lunch options, but they also had a chef's fixed price option (3 courses).  We decided to go with the chef's menu, which was wonderful.  We both had lobster bisque as an appetizer, which was good.  Then the entrees were ricotta gnocci and miso glazed salmon, both of which were delectible.  The gnocci was very tender and the salmon just melted in your mouth.  For dessert, it was a tasting tray of mini desserts, which looked like they came out of a cooking magazine.  One of them actually had a little bit of gold leaf on it!  The drinks were fabulous, we tried the Bloody Mary (nice and peppery/spicy) and the Mango Madness (it was lightand refreshing).  What a great place, I would definitely go back there!

pymcoUcStPf7LgZ27NIlMg.text: PLEASE don't listen to Kurt S's review.  This place is WONDERFUL.   He is completely wrong wrong on the service.  I have never had a more PERFECT waiter and dining experience.  I am very sorry he either had a rare bad one or he was in a less rare bad mood when he went.   The waiter smiled the whole time, he answered our questions, he was smooth, efficient and considerate, there when he needed to be and out of the way the rest of the time.    My friend had the same meal Kurt had, said it was the best filet mignon around.  Cooked to perfection.    This place is everything you expect from four star dining, and yes, the prices reflect it, so please just go ready to spend $170-200 for two.  This is the dining event you dress up and save up for.   Oh and that's one more thing.  I am really aghast at permanent low-class cheap ass tourists who want to walk into a classy place like this in halter tops and ripped off jeans shorts and sandals and 70s hair they never comb.  You people can go dumpster dive for medium rare squirrel filet.  Stop ruining the atmosphere for the rest of us that have some decency and respect for ourselves and other people.  This place is definitely worth a 3 piece suit or tux for dinner, but business casual is the dress code.

ETdM0gv-rsNykuCcVvrS-w.text: My husband and I dined here with another couple, and had a decent visit. Before I get into the review of the food, it should be known that what really makes this an experience is, of course, the amazing view and ambiance. The Stratosphere offers a second to none view of the entire valley from the slowly rotating platform upon which the restaurant is positioned. This is definitely a place that will impress out-of-towners and locals alike. But why did I give it only 3 stars? Here's why:  The food was underwhelming. The prices weren't outrageous, but the dishes were all unremarkable. We had the pork belly appetizer, which is usually great anywhere (hello, bacon). This one wasn't seared to give it the nice crunchy texture, and left something to be desired. The lobster bisque had a strong curry flavor, which overpowered the lobster completely. Tasty it was, but not what I was expecting or like any seafood bisque I've ever had. I ordered the pork tenderloin wrapped in bacon (warning: huge portion), and it was overcooked. I specifically asked for it to be cooked to a medium, and the waitress initially said the chef wouldn't do it. I asked her to check, but that I would order something else if he really wouldn't, but she came back and said he would. He didn't. I ate maybe half of one pork medallion and decided I wasn't into it enough to keep eating. We finished with the cheese plate, which was good - not spectacular.  The service was very good, and the Sommelier was really helpful in choosing a wine to suit all of us. Again, I really didn't dislike the food...it was just not as delicious as I would've hoped for.  Bottom Line: Come here for the view, experience, and drinks, not for excellent food.

zfs1TlmpnCgd5KxuzP6Ulg.text: Went here for an intimate dinner with my wife while in Vegas for our daughter's wedding (it was our anniversary week as well).  The view is fantastic - the food, while okay, was not worth the price.  You are definitely paying for the view. Would go their for a drink but there are far better restaurants in Las Vegas as far as food and price.

vZz_7Cf2ot8DSjq4k37B0Q.text: Top of the World, you took my breath away when were getting seated to our table.    I took my bf here the other night to celebrate his birthday and we both had a great time.  The service and view was AMAZING!!!  We both ordered the four course meal which consist of salad, appetizer, meal and dessert.  It also came with 3 types of bread and three types of butter to go with it.  I highly recommend spreading the pesto butter....YUMMY!!!    I was surprised that they read my reservations in detail.  I booked our reservations through open table and asked them to sing happy birthday to my bf towards the end of the night and they did.    Defintely a good date night place :-)

6gcUy9Z5cuUesxQuf2l65w.text: The view of the city from this restaurant was gorgeous! I loved it, it was very romantic...   The food was okay, a little over priced but the view made it worth it. The lobster mashed potatoes were delish!  Our server on the other hand was why I didn't rate this place with five stars. Ion or whatever his name was the worst server. But otherwise it was such a beautiful experience.

ioStFtZ0uIllxTSVvqBQ5A.text: This is a rotating restaurant on top of the Stratosphere.  It's about on the same level as that place on top of the Space Needle in Seattle.  You're coming for the joy of rotating round and round while you look down at the view.  The food is OK but nobody comes for the food, except possibly to eat the Chocolate Stratosphere dessert (a molded chocolate replica of the tower where you're eating) which was kitschy cool.    As others have noted, the Stratosphere is old and looks kinda "ghetto" compared to the newer places in Vegas; it's also at the far far end of the strip away from most of the newer and fancier places.  The restaurant itself is nice but the downstairs you have to walk through to get to the restaurant is old and dorky.      Also, the Stratosphere has thrill rides operating on top of it and as the restaurant rotates you will probably see people flying past your window on the sky ride a hundred stories up.   If you are planning to have some drinks you probably want to be aware of this in advance.  I myself was not  aware and when I saw human bodies flying past the window after a couple of glasses of something, I about freaked out.  If the sight of these folks inspires you to go on the rides yourself, you need to go all the way downstairs again and get tickets, which is a hassle.    Overall it's more of a retro-silly Las Vegas dining experience than an elegant or fancy dining experience.   If you want a really nice dinner, pay more and go to a nicer place.  If you just want a fun sit-down restaurant lunch or dinner, the Stratosphere restaurant is fine for that.

zvc9ETnBwlxVc0WyudQD3w.text: My boyfriend and I ate here for our anniversary and the view, food, and service were great! And might I add, very romantical.  The lobster bisque, filet mignon, and alaskan king crab legs were all melt in your mouth delicious. It is a bit pricey but you basically get what you pay far.  Great place for a date or even a fancy night out with friends.

xoQMroFRJ4h60IDAZGunMg.text: Second visit here. It was even better than the first which I thought would be hard to beat. This place is amazing. The prices are high but definitely worth it. The service is amazing. Ask for a booth also. They are very dim and private. My second visit I had to get the pork belly for a starter again because it's delicious and melts in your mouth. For dinner I got the surf and turf with a 1/2 pound lobster tail. Easily the best tasting and quality lobster and steak I've ever had. I recommend this place if you are from out of town or even local for a fancy dinner.

3Hz0CheWNKfltIqUpqXf3A.text: So we have a party of 13 and a reservation, we were seated w/i 15 minutes so that's 1 star. The view was amazing, so I'll give another star for that. I chose the Seafood Alfredo for my meal, it was bland to me. But the prawns and lobster were really good. I just expect more a $75 meal for one... The service was great; we had 2 servers for our party. All in all, the experience was good but I don't I'll be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The check for a party of 13.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view.

SmPyS9lSxw-RVHbLf5mqwg.text: Great, attentive service. I was surprised by my bf for my birthday. The view is great. It takes about an hour and twenty minutes to fully rotate for a complete experience of the view. I was disappointed that they no longer serve bread pudding. I had the twin lobster tails and my bf had the surf and turf. He admits that my lobster was "fresher" than his crab legs but he still enjoyed everything. Oh, the sangria is AMAZING!   You may even catch a skydiver or two.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty cool view...and I caught a sky diver
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twin lobster tails.

anfTrY7xB71pGhihxVNGoQ.text: My boyfriend and I ate at Top of the World recently while on vacation in Las Vegas. Of course, the view was amazing and the concept of the rotating room was awesome. The food was AMAZING. My boyfriend got the Cesar salad to start and it was really good. I got the shrimp cocktail. It was really good as well--the shrimp were huge. For the main course, my boyfriend got the center cut New York strip steak and I got the Wagyu ribeye. The New York strip steak was amazing. It was tender and cooked to perfection. My ribeye was, hands down, the best steak I have ever had in my life. It was buttery, flavorful and tender. We also got some asparagus to share and it was really good. For dessert, we got the baked Alaska. It was really amazing as well. We actually weren't expecting to get dessert, but it was so good that we cleaned the plate. This place is definitely in my top 3 favorite restaurants. I hope to be back soon!

78CkSUBbMQoRrZ44M1vLCA.text: Pricey and old school... but the service and view. I really like the fact they serve Maytag blue cheese as well. It's about the closest blue cheese to Parmesan.

CVk-w3MDZBYXtgRk1Rg44Q.text: Stratosphere Tower definitely a must visit spot in Las Vegas. The "Top of the World" is a amazing restaurant. A group of 6 visited for lunch and we had an awesome time. Beautiful views and great food. We had the lunch 3course special, house salad and rib burger. It was just totally awesome. Well worth the money and trip!!! And too top it off we had shots of vodka.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome dessert. Tiramisu, Sponge cake, and Whipped Tower
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon and Lobster with pill of mashed potatoes
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon and Shrimp

GU2An3Lh55vVbxzJl3CzGw.text: Very pricey but the view is incredible and the service is also top notch. The food was also outstanding. Our steaks were cooked to perfection and sides and apps were very tasty. A must see and do in Vegas but be ready to spend $$$

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K_r7m6TDJDYDgTlGNP6bcg.text: Love this place a client of mine recommended this place and sure enough was just an amazing experience. The view is just wow especially if you go during sunset time. Food is just so good. The shrimps are huge and the food is delicious and don't forget about there fun desserts.

DZQP31mwwNAx6YWPkGyILA.text: Service is terrible and the NY Strip steak tasted like a microwavable dinner with a gross sauce on it. The view is the ONLY reason to go. It's a unique experience rotating to see the city and the views are beautiful.

C8QyK3nhVXkk2XWdsq0mkQ.text: We had dinner at the restaurant and I am so glad that we did. From the service, to the food, to the scenic view, everything was just perfect!!! My husband and I loved everything. I do recommend going at night, so that you can enjoy the beautiful view of Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu Skirt Steak

F4CoP6nEV9gXI0nm1ufhTw.text: I don't usually give five stars - when I do, you know it's worth it. Lamb chops were up to par with standards in heaven. View was amazing during sunset and dessert was light and sweet.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Do yourself a favor &amp; order the lamb-chops medium well.

kXyFDPh5NXya-RFrB2bHBQ.text: So are in town for spring break and this was a last-minute lunch reservation! And it was amazing the service was awesome my husband and daughter had the steak and lobster and it was so tender you could cut it with your spoon and the lobster was just amazing I ordered the chicken Caesar salad which was huge and was so good I would recommend this restaurant over Gordon Ramsay's Hell's Kitchen a hundred percent the food at the Stratosphere Top of the World restaurant was the best we had in Vegas and then we got to check out the very top of the stratosphere at the end of our lunch it was great

TXpSf0fo6g338ukBlSW40A.text: We came at night (pretty late, I think our reservation was at 10 or 10:30pm)... We wanted the nighttime view of the lights! Not many people there which was nice.  Like other reviewers have stated, you do have to go through security check prior to taking the elevator up to the restaurant.   After dinner take advantage of going to the observation deck to take more pictures and look at the views!  Reservations: Made ours through open table which was so easy and convenient. When you make your reservation, ask for a table next to the window so you have a good view. We saw jumpers while we were eating! I knew to watch out for this from other Yelp reviews.   Environment:  Dim lighting perfect for a romantic dinner. Somewhat loud upbeat music for a romantic feeling place. It was fine though, I mean it was Vegas. Views were beautiful. Don't look outside for too long, you get kind of dizzy!  Food: I had the tasting menu with wine pairing. I chose: lobster bisque (SO good- watch out if your lactose intolerant though), seared scallop (my favorite part of the entire meal), filet with shrimp, and the chocolate duo (only desert option on tasting menu) - all very tasty. Shrimp was a tad overcooked for my liking, but I'm picky with food. Filet cooked perfectly and the red wine mushroom reduction was delicious. Portions small, BUT filling! Wine selections paired with each course we're perfectly paired! Keep in mind the wine portions are very small. (See pictures) My husband had the wagyu chef special (NOT the wagyu skirt steak on the menu, I bet it would have been better) and he did not like it at all. In fact he did not even finish it, which is not like him at all. He said it tasted like maple syrup was poured on top of the meat. I didn't even want to try it after he described it that way. He ended up helping me eat some of my food - which he really liked!  Service: very nice and professional. Super quick with serving drinks and food... So take your time ordering so you can enjoy the atmosphere!  I took off 1 star because of my husband's meal. You would think for a super expensive plate it would have at least tasted good. Oh well, it's Vegas and most nice restaurants are very pricy... So to be expected. Just wish he enjoyed his meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice display of desserts that we passed during dinner.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desert paired with port wine.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3rd course. Filet mignon &amp; shrimp scampi with mashed potatoes and red wine mushroom reduction. Paired with Cabernet sauvingnon.

oRFY9UJ8R_9VoR1inP46oQ.text: My girlfriend took me for my birthday. Its definitely very romantic with a beautiful view of entire Vegas while the restaurant rotates. Staff are really friendly with very good service. This is hands down the best birthday dinner I've had. Definitely recommend to get some drinks at the lounge after a delicious dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Uo5HV1F2lYfz6ClZ1bbc6w.text: First off, the view is amazing, that was what initially attracted me to this restaurant. Service was ok. Food took about 30minutes to come out after ordering. My food was served to me COLD... I had to wait about 15-20 after being served AND had to tell another waiter to go and ask for my waiter to even check on us to see if my food was served up to par. After letting my waiter know that my food was cold, it took an additional 20 minutes just reheat my food. By this time, my guest was finished eating her food COMPLETELY and she had to eat alone on her birthday. Managers came by to apologize and basically still gave me the ticket for the food that I did not eat at full price. Oh..they sent one glass of moscato to compensate for a $159.00 meal to reconcile. The view was nice but I won't be returning because of the service experience.

mUNkm9tGi7ViZ_kSBDIqXg.text: This is a long overdue review.  Amazing.  Started with the service getting into the restrauant, the wait staff, bartenders, Chef and then the food.  We enjoyed the full expierence of a revolving restrauant and getting in the sunset with the spectacular night views of Las Vegas.  Dinner choices were perfectly prefpared and delicous.  We sat for 2 hours enjoying all.

V9b_1P1H7ey6kENP3Gd1WA.text: Beautiful view of the strip in a restaurant that rotates 360. The server was professional, the food was delicious, and the atmosphere was business casual.  Normally you are required to pay per person to go up to the top of the tower for the view but it is included with your meal purchase.  We ordered surf and turf which included steak and lobster for a hefty price of around $100 per person plus tip. I've eaten off the strip for around $20 Per person plus tip with comparable food.  I love the experience but cannot justify going to this restaurant unless I am celebrating a special occasion and want to spend quite a bit of money.  I had family from out of town visiting and decided to give an extravagant experience. For my normal days, my steak and lobster experience will be off the strip at one of the locals' casinos with a View from an elevated location to overview the city.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread and flavored butter
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert display
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf meal

q6LDWP9Adg6EB7Hjnq9Tdg.text: The food is just OK, considering the high price. The view is good. But there is a new high rise under construction, next to the SLS hotel, that blocks quite a big chunk of the view towards the strip, such as the Wynn Resort. So at night you see a big black space next to the west side of strip.   Unfortunately because of that building one won't be able to see the entire strip as one could before. Rest of Vegas is quite interesting, but not unique, since it is just a regular city one sees when flying out of an airport at night.

OWA-4PkYyj-bjhTTHlEOoQ.text: Marvelous setting, as our table does a 360 degree tour of Las Vegas and its spectacular environs. The servers, sommeliers and chefs do a magnificent job of letting you take all this in with elegant comfort and service. Kodos to all!  There is, however, one small, but not unimportant shortcoming at the start: the bread rolls brought to our table are soft, tasteless and unappetizing. There are few more special joys with a cocktail or a glass of aperitif glass of wine than a warm, crunchy bread roll with butter and olive oil. But, Alas, this has been replaced with the aforementioned mushy cottonwad-like replacement. So, please do think this change through, because you had these treats in many of our past visits to this world-class venue over the years.  The one advantage of this situation, of course, is that we do have a little more room to enjoy more of the magnificent entrees from the classy menu's selections. But still, we would welcome back the crispy rolls and baguette slices from the recent past as we peruse the wonderful menu with our aperitifs.  Thank you --  A recent very pleased diner.

im4Mwe089UtuAMbn2D-kzg.text: Food is really good, view is awesome. Very romantic place for dinner. I would have done 5 stars but our service was kinda bad. Took a really long time to just get a Pepsi, really big gap between courses. The Filet was incredible, it was perfect.

Hnt1Cj8yEsdvwV_F-LsfHg.text: The bread selection was really good, it was a good start to the meal. There were three different types of butter, regular, garlic, and orange. The garlic one was really good but the orange one was disgusting. The lobster bisque was too sweet and there was barely any lobster, maybe like a tiny little piece cut into little tiny pieces. The duck was not flavored good at all. It was too sweet as well, weird taste to it. The stratosphere white chocolate mousse tower was the reason I have to give this restaurant a 3 because it was really good. The baked potato was really good too. The view was romantic and amazing, you could see most of Las Vegas. The  concept of the restaurant moving was also pretty cool, it took an hour and 20 to spin around completely. Our waiter was really friendly and welcoming, he spoke to us for about 15 minutes and checked up on us a couple times. The price was definitely overpriced and wasn't worth it. Maybe we should've tried the steak but we were tired from having steak in other places.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stratosphere tower
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twice Baked Potato , Bacon , Cheddar , Green Onion

xPfpiCRpFQxUgrw5dPv2XA.text: Came here alone for a late lunch on a beautiful Sunday, April 26, at around 2:15 PM.  I've been here on several occasions before, but never alone...  Checked in with the hostess at the front desk on the 2nd floor of the Stratosphere.  Made my way through security line and waited for the elevator for a little over 5 minutes before I was able to get to the 106th floor.  The ride up was about a minute or so...  Upon exiting the elevator, you have to check in again, which was a little overwhelming, considering you've already made so many stops.  The wait for a table for one was about 10 good minutes...considering the lunch crowd has pretty much died down by this time.  I was seated at a table behind 3 gentlemen facing away from them.  My waiter, Andrew, came by to see what I wanted to drink & I ordered my usual boring virgin pina colada.  After he brought my drink, he took my order and I was ready to get down to business.  The view was magnificent and the weather was just perfect.  I couldn't have picked a better day to sit atop this beautiful restaurant, while taking in all that Vegas has to offer.  When my wagyu carpaccio arrived, Andrew also had another table show up waiting to be seated.  He had to go and tend to them so I didn't want to be rude and bother him to take a picture of me with my food.  So, I decided to bother the 3 gentlemen behind me instead.  Yes, I literally turned around just to interrupt their meals.  But they were so sweet about it...  The wagyu carpaccio was excellent.  Beautiful presentation as well.  It had just the perfect blend of flavor, oil, and the consistency was just to die for.  It literally melts in your mouth and the cheese adds just the right amount of salt to give it that extra flavor.  I basically finished the whole thing in under 3 minutes.  Lol  A few minutes later, my short rib and crabmeat Benedict shows up.  It was delicious!  The hollandaise sauce was perfect with every bite.  The short rib was moist and tender.  I couldn't finish it because I had already finished my appetizer, plus I'm not a potato fan...but even then the potatoes tasted great.  Andrew came back to check on me several times to ensure that I was enjoying my meal and indeed I was in heaven.  Great food, beautiful view and excellent service!!  What else can a girl ask for?  Andrew suggested that dessert would make it even better, but unfortunately I didn't have any room.  It would've definitely been great to have my friend, Joe, with me again...but I forgave him for not meeting me due to his being so busy prepping for the big fight at the MGM next week.  I still had a wonderful time nonetheless.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ry7RGP9INh78zW9D95hdfg.text: If you're looking for a good deal, look elsewhere. But if you're willing to splurge a bit, you'll be rewarded with more than just a dinner, but an entire experience. The Top of the World is located around the 106th floor of the Stratosphere hotel and has a rotating dining room giving you fantastic views of all of Las Vegas. The menu gives you a few different choices but is largely overpriced. However, the $90 tasting option is the best way to go. You start off with soup or salad and then proceed through three other courses, including a peppered salmon and delicious desserts. Although I don't usually like to spend big on dinners in Vegas, I recommend giving this place a try just once. And definitely get the wine pairings for only a little bit more!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nccsXzd-NbF0nfqqJfIJHQ.text: Me and my wife decided on this place for date night over our usual Ruth's Chris. From the beginning, parking is FREE. We went to the happy hour at 107 sky lounge first and enjoyed the BOGO cocktails. They were awesome and what a great deal. After walking down to the restaurant, we were greeted and seated promptly. We came for the steak and ordered the filet cooked rare. OMG, me and my wife both agreed it was better than Ruth's Chris. We had potatoes on potatoes for sides. The potato puree, and the twice baked potato. The puree was better tasting if you were only going to side on one or the other. Only negative comment I have was I had a non-expiring $25 restaurant.com gift certificate and they did not except it. They told me I could call restaurant.com and try to figure out. I figured spending over $200 that the manger would just credit me $25. He did ask if we wanted a cocktail as we were leaving but my wife was ready to go. I wasn't sure if he was going to comp that or not but we kindly declined. Other than that, the service and quality of food was a+ and we will more than likely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eNIgtxQa9FElOG0VpBBR7g.text: I can only rate this place on the Caesar salad and the view. Both were absolute 5 stars.  We ate in the lounge above the rotating restaurant.   What a spectacular view, if you have never been to the top... check it out!   Awesome!

dfVy-cAb6ORT8E2q6LJ0cw.text: This place has some of the best views in Vegas! I would definitely recommend this place to both residents and non-residents. The service was amazing and the food was delicious. We didn't do the Chef Tasting Menu, which I regret, as that is the best value on the menu. Between the four of us we ordered the lobster bisque, caprese, and scallops for appetizers. We then had the chicken, filet, salmon and ribeye for entrees. Everything was cooked perfectly. Another awesome part about this restaurant are the crazy people who do the Sky Jump at the top of the Stratosphere. Depending on where you are in your rotation (the restaurant rotates), you may even get to see a few during your meal!

FbnFeKcjG0-ZQnCD10wf6A.text: I loved having dinner here with my husband!!! The food was delicious and the service was wonderful!!! The view outstanding!!! I will be back and I highly recommend this place!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was so wonderful, we absolutely loved it !!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was an awesome way to see the strip at night .

GnOosrjsH4Vqay6-4WAxYQ.text: We called and made a reservation for 830, and showed up at 8 because we weren't sure if it was going to take a long time to get on the elevator. If you have reservations you can go right up, no problems.    We were very early so we decided to hang out in the lounge, we were greeted by the waitress very quickly and offered a menu. We ordered the last tango cocktail and it was good but not something I would ever try again.   We were seated at 825, and given great service from our waitress, she offered us drinks and let us know what some of the favored items on the menu were. my fiance got the wagyu skirt steak, I ordered the rack of lamb. Both were very tasteful and very well prepaired.   The wagyu was very good but I didn't feel it was worth as much as they charge.  The lamb was cooked perfectly, the only thing I didn't care for was the risotto it was dry. We also ordered a side of broccolini that was no more than steamed with no flavor.  We got desert after, we ordered the lemon bar cheesecake, it was outstanding, had to be the best cheese cake I had ever tried. I also ordered coffee which was fresh and delicious.   For the 2 of us it was about 165$ after tip, and we also had the 10% discount from using the players card. I would recommend that this place should be tried at least once if you have the money to spend.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon bar cheesecake
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rack of lamb
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu

DuQDYJbJwxpscWr2m1DmIg.text: Three stars for the spectacular view 800+ feet above the entire Las Vegas valley. But there are more things to point that weren't great, than things that were.  Here's what you need to know about this restaurant on the 106th floor: You must make a reservation; make it for just prior to sunset and ask for a window table. After you're seated, you'll definitely hear people plead for those tables instead of their own booths set back from the windows ("Please....? We are from Ecuador.") What?? That family, by the way, was told they could sit where they were seated, or wait about 30 minutes for the next window table to possibly open up. They stayed put, and complained about everything from their drinks to the temperature of their meat.  This place is very expensive, but worth it for special occasions, or that once-in-a-lifetime romantic dinner. What will irk you, though: They make a point of saying there is a dress code - business casual. That's a little subjective, sure -- but the woman on the phone specifically said no shorts, no jeans, and men must wear shoes and a collared shirt of some kind. Not a problem for most folks, foreign tourists and Americans from all corners, alike. The problem is, it's not enforced, which really, really takes away from the experience. We walked in dressed very nicely (casual, but proper dining attire) behind a whole family of four wearing T-shirts, shorts and sneakers. And some hick had a sleeveless shirt with sandals, and his teenage bride's ass was hanging out of her Daisy-Dukes. It soured everything from the start. We tried to ignore that and focus on us, and the view. Because the 360-degree rotation takes about 80 minutes, the service is deliberately slow-paced, which is fine. You're paying for the view and ambiance (if you can avoid looking at the white-trash family two tables over).  We chose the chef's 4-course tasting menu, at $98/per person. My Caesar salad was fantastic. Fresh and flavorful. My wife's lobster bisque was garbage. Watery (not creamy), overly salty, with a tiny chunk of lobster meat at the bottom. Her next course was a SINGLE scallop, which tasted good, but was sitting in an unnecessary bed of roasted corn and red peppers. My pork belly was a solitary piece of pork fat with a hint of swine. We both got the same entree, and our filet mignons were ridiculously good, cooked perfectly. String beans and mashed potatoes were equally good. The 2 accompanying shrimps were NOT good in the least. Tasted old and squishy, no flavor, smelled like fish. I once heard chef Emeril Lagasse (not affiliated with this place) say: "If the fish smells like fish, go with the chicken." The dessert -- a small helping each of chocolate mousse and crime brulee --was definitely good, but nothing to rave about.  The waitstaff was on-point: polite, refilled water constantly, checked on us when appropriate. As the room rotated, however, you'd move past the open kitchen, where you could hear the cooks yelling out orders and ringing their little bell to signify plates were ready to serve -- that, again, takes you out of the experience and makes you wonder why you're paying about $250 for diner grub and service. All in all, glad we went for the experience, but there's no need to ever go back. And they're doing themselves a huge disservice by pretending they're a sophisticated, exclusive restaurant -- and then allowing in anyone with a working credit card. Final, side point: Eating here allows you to go up one level to the 107th-floor observatory. Views are the same as dinner. Don't waste your time. There's a bar, inexplicably loud-ass club music, a juice/smoothie/candy place, and a gift shop. It was a tremendously tacky waste of space, and most people were just hanging out and looking at their smartphones anyway. One floor above that are the outdoor rides, which were closed due to high winds.

zxPr_rw4UUb1lLaLf_A3Fw.text: This is the place to go if you are looking to splurge. I came here for my birthday dinner and I would definitely come back! I had the Chilean sea bass and it was so delicious, soft and just cooked to perfection. Upon learning it was my birthday, our waiter brought out a delicious creme brulee dessert with a candle. It's the little details that count!  I constantly felt catered to and waited on, as you have a person to bring you bread/water and then your server. We showed up 30 min earlier than our reservation time but they were still able to sit us down quickly.  The view is beautiful, as well. Within an hour you get a full 360 view of Vegas.

GUqUJAuHbIPtyd61HDwf_A.text: Face it, when in Vegas you will shell out the big bucks to eat a steakhouse, so why not go to the one with the best view!  I do have to warn, you might get a bit lightheaded but it's definitely worth the food.  I had a steak and it was amazing, I set the whole thing, probably shouldn't have, but in Vegas that's the only time I am allotted to do the shouldn't haves in life.  Great service, great food, and great ambience!  BONUS TIP:  At the end of your meal you are granted free access to go to the viewing deck, DO IT!

tDrNV9PwFAx0-QVx2OKGiA.text: Very nice, and elegant place...in my opinion.   Celebrated my sweetheart's birthday there recently and had a wonderful time.   It was well worth the money.  The ability to see the entire Las Vegas city through the windows was great.   The atmosphere was relaxing and inviting.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Las Vegas.

jpNh429RGgPAhqxkZ6PMLA.text: Everything that could be wrong with the food was wrong. We ordered the chefs pre fixe, which is $98 per person. The free bread was stale and bland, the butter was cheap and one was very sweet tasting, like in a bad way. The lobster bisque was a pathetic joke, they poured a dark orange looking thin broth over the tiniest lump of creamed lobster in the center of the plate. The soup tasted like vinegar and was so unpleasant I couldn't finish it. Of course the waiter said nothing when he picked up my totally full bowl of soup but I had hopes for the next courses. The one scallop was covered in a cloyingly sweet sauce it took over the delicate flavor but then the scallop itself was so undercooked that it was slimy.  The filet was covered in some type of A1 steak sauce and it tasted like it came out of a microwave and yet was not hot. It also tasted like not a filet mignon. It tasted like it was hammered to death.  I'm very saddened because I was with a special guest that night and could not say anything to my waiter in the moment. $100 I spent on my meal and I still had nothing I could eat. The dessert was also sad. The creme brulee didn't have a sugar coating that was hard!! That's like.. what creme brulee is. Also it was thin consistency and bland. The chocolate just tasted like chocolate with an oily white chocolate stick in it. Just sad.  In addition I think they should slow down the spinning of the room, I timed it from one point full circle to the same point and it took under 38 minutes!! I believe it should be at least an hour. It's slow, but it's the type of speed that you're never able to not notice you're moving... and if you're the one seated with your back to the movement it makes you feel like you're moving backwards the whole time which is a confusing feeling when trying to eat. But seriously if that poor "filet" had been edible I wouldn't really have had such issue with everything else. I've paid well over $100 for a good steak and will continue to do so. I'm from Texas and I know steaks. NO filet mignon should have a gravy covering it. No decent steak should be hidden under any sauce. It had fake grill marks on it for gods sake!! I think the sauce was indeed to hide a very cheap and microwaved cut of beef.

z3E7jRnJB_3vVFvuyEKU0Q.text: If you would like the view of the entire Vegas light, this is your place.  However, I will not recommend this place for dinner. Go to the lounge instead for a drink.  It will save you some heartache and pocket sore.  Food is definitely average at best.  We had one Chef's tasting menu for $98, a soup dish and one pasta.  1/2 bottle of VC champagne.   Lobster Bisque, come luke warm and with a bitter taste.  Secondi, Kurobuta Pork Belly, absolutely disastrous.  The taste was all right, Thai favor with subtle hint of lemon grass. But the presentation of pork belly was bad, the meat pieces were with a pale color, worst is the temperature.  It is not even warm.  You would think it was pickled pieces of bacon.  Ugh.  Then it is the Filet mignon  and Shrimp scampi.  Pretty good portion, again food temperature like it had been sitting there forever.  The desert was acceptable - chocolate duo.  A chocolate mouse in ramkin and white choco cup with cream and berries.  From the service part; the girls who greeted in the front were just plain bored with their job.  No reception and call by a single word of your last name.  Made me feel like I was going to a dental office.  The champagne half bottle came after our first course.  It wasn't even cold when poured.  The waiter came and pour a full glass.  The waiter tried hard but he was so busy.  I told him that it was my mom's 92 birthday, he came with a candle on the ordered desert. No songs no complimentary cake.  It seemed that they were overworked and under paid.  The bus boy came with very nice bread.  He presented 3 types of butter, rattling out some mumbles. I had him repeated 3 times before I could catch the words.  Everyone was on the rush for something else except attending to the patron.    The bill came at $244.  The price didn't surprised.  It was the cattle call behavior and airplane catering food quality that really disappointing.

3lYkd5AFFnv-W0dx6w0ggQ.text: First time here and was happy with the results! Came for our anniversary!  Fair warning, this place is expensive! Make sure you are prepared to spend over $200 for a couple. That's not including a tip.   We went to the observation tower while waiting. The view is breath taking! Literally taking your breath away! Received a text letting me know that our table is ready. Was greeted by the hostess and asked how our night was going. They warned us that the dining area rotates, please be careful. Takes 1 hour, 20 mins to make full rotation.   My husband ordered 16 oz steak with fried horseradish - amazing! I ordered the seafood alfredo with extra alfredo sauce, grape tomatoes, shrimp and lobster - awesome! Needed more parmesan cheese as I love cheese! The bread was warm and yummy. Ordered broccoli with mushrooms and creamy spinach sides. All food was excellent! I must say I really enjoyed my husband's steak more than my dinner. That steak was so amazingly awesome! Melt in your mouth tasty! We ordered drinks from the lounge.  Our waitress was helpful and attentive. I asked her to take our picture and was so happy to do so. Our table was in front of the windows, which made viewing better as there was no one in front of our view.   This is a great place to go, experience something new! Don't come here with expectations. Come here with an open mind and enjoy yourselves! You will thank yourself later! Enjoy!

o_dZcr_Q_DFlK2mqAL2f-Q.text: VIEW Was awesome ! the food was great the waiter was very nice and accommodating but the HOST ANGELA was awful!   She was very inconsiderate and unkind.  It was my birthday and she didn't do anything to acomandate to make the day more special for someone's birthday!  She didn't assign us a seat by the window even though there were tables that were empty by the view...  It would've been better if she gave me a reason to why we couldn't have the window seating but she made no effort what so ever ...   For $300 dinner for 2 you would expect much better service from the host she didn't even smile one bit! Obviously customer service was not one of her traits.   Besides the negatives. Our dinner was excellent.  Must have the Chocolate Godiva cocktail  The foie gras and the porkbelly appetizer was mouth watering!  Our entree was ribeye steak amazing ..!  The lamb was just okay ..

DwlHtGSBn1RdVhEJCNS37A.text: Wonderful Dining experience!  Our hostess Jeanne was fantastic...ask for her if you can.    Very much worth the price of admission. Had dinner and enjoyed MJ Live.  Leave yourself time for the observation deck and the elevator wait.

owrzKJIFD3RqBUf4OKTJ4g.text: Absolutely the best lunch value in all of Las Vegas in my opinion!  I try to visit every time I'm in town and have never been disappointed in any aspect of the service and food in all the years I've been going there.  Most recently was last week, taking my 24yo daughter to Vegas for the first time.  We planned our nice lunch for last Friday.  And for the first time, I actually bought the discount tickets from Tix4Tonight - they have kiosks all about town.  For only a few bucks a coupon we got a 25% discount off each lunch!  And of course, if you have lunch at the Stratosphere, your "ride to the top" is included - normally $20 a person.  We were greeted and promptly seated - the staff here are consistently pretty amazing.  And of course being a later lunch on a weekday, we got a window table so my daughter could take in the 80-minute, 2-mile long ride in a circle - just about the time it takes for a leisurely lunch and you get to see the entire skyline go by.  For starters we ordered the Smoked Atlantic Salmon with Brioche Toast, with capers shallots and creme fraiche.  And as always, it did not disappoint.  Simply superb.  My daughter isn't a big fan of salmon but this changed her mind!  She actually ate half the plate!  My only criticism is there's simply not enough toast.  Four very small pieces is just not right.  I'd like to see them up the toast count... but we made do with the bread basket so it was just fine.  For our mains, I had the Braised Beef Sort Rib Benedict and Crab Red Pepper Hollandaise, served over a four cheese potato cake, with 2 perfectly poached eggs, roasted carrots and green beans.  It was simply heaven on a plate... wonderful flavors, perfectly balanced.  The beef was "melt in your mouth" - so moist and tender it was just amazing.  Jenny and I shared both our entre choices and she loved the Benedict as much as I did.  Her choice was the Lobster Bisque and a Twice Baked Potato.  I've never seen bisque served the way they do here - a nicely seasoned 1/4-cup pile of crab is in the bottom of the bowl when served, and the bisque is gently poured around it.  It was a tad sweet for my taste, but otherwise - like everything else - pretty amazing.  And the twice baked potato was HUGE!!  There was no way we could finish all of this wonderful food and boxes were't an option - pity, because I'd otherwise never leave leftovers of this quality behind.  The service was impeccable.  It's as if they all have a "third eye" and know when to attend and when to stay back.  We were never once interrupted in conversation, yet never left without refills or empty plates needing to be picked up.  Sure it's a tad spendy by some standards - but for less than $90 including 20% gratuity, my daughter had a lunch she won't soon forget.  We finished our visit by watching the crazy people jump off the tower (1,140 feet) and the other rides on the roof.  There's a reason they have a whole wall full of Zagat and other awards for culinary excellence.  Great job Top of the World.  I will be back.

KmQNNPG_Fnz6nCjQXDYagA.text: Yes the food is expensive but well worth it! The view is spectacular and you're spinning the whole time getting different views of the surrounding area. The filet mignon is something I recommend with scallops as an appetizer. If you want great food with a nice view I would eat here!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a24USR1NG5BEuEXXmveeKg.text: What an unforgettable experience w/ a beautiful 360 view of the city & incredible food at the "top of the world." (Pun-intended)  Wait - def recommend getting reservations esp for dinner b/c for those who don't will have to wait abt 2.5 hrs. With reservations,  my bf&I were seated right away&taken into a slowly revolving tower overlooking the flashing lights of Vegas. Service - great friendly service & very attentive! Food - high quality&amazing! For starter,we got the crab cake which had delicious chunky pieces of crab & a refreshing cabbage slaw&remoulade sauce to compliment it. For the main meal, I ordered the large gulf prawns,scallops&lobster w/ a side of gnocchi. Wow,the prawns,scallops&lobsters were perfectly cooked&seasoned,& the gnocchi had the perfect soft texture.   Overall, I was absolutely impressed w/ the food&had an enjoyable experience. Def recommend trying!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnocchi with Caper, Lemon &amp; Brown Butter
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large Gulf Prawns, Maine Scallops &amp; Lobster &#34;A La Plancha&#34;
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Jumbo Lump Crab Cake

dCrJqgKo5VNFkOGglnpfFQ.text: I wanted to surprise my girlfriend for our 3 year anniversary and take her out to eat at a really nice restaurant. I spent days trying to figure out when I finally decided on here. Man oh man did I choose correctly.   I made reservations through open table, which was really efficient.   We get here at like 9:30 so the sun is completely down. We get to the lobby, they do bag checks for the ladies and make you go through a metal detector before you can get on the elevator to go up to the restaurant.   The restaurant is on floor 107 and you can feel how fast the elevator is flying to get there.   We get seated in no time and all I can say is WOW for the view. It was so awesome.    It's a perfect date restaurant, dim lighting, awesome view. Although, the music threw me off as it was upbeat. You would think it would be more romantic type music. For how romantic the restaurant is.   The restaurant takes an 1 hr and 30 min to spin all the way around to get a full 360 view of the strip.  You may get a little dizzy looking out the window but if your date is going well you shouldn't be looking out the window that much!! Lol  The service was great, they quickly took our drinks and food orders.   I ordered the "Wagyu Skirt Steak" 12oz Girlfriend ordered " Filet Mignon" 9oz And we got a side of mashed potatoes we knew the steaks alone wouldn't fill us up  My Wagyu steak was just amazing. Cooked perfectly medium rare. Left me wanting more!   My girlfriend never had filet Mignon before so she was just blown away at the texture and flavor.   The mashed potatoes, for just being mashed potatoes. Tasted amazing too!   The bill came out to 126$ but to celebrate our three years this was the perfect place to go.  Taking her here definitely earned me some brownie points! Lol so fellas if you got a big date coming up , anniversary , proposal, just a date. This is the perfect place!

9sl-fsXKRJHqqgMYwyATmQ.text: The view of the strip and having random people fly by the windows as they "skydive" add to the allure of this place.  We went for lunch---which was about the same price as paying for a ticket to get up to the observation deck, so why not get food with it.  The sandwiches were good, and the side salad was generous.  I know at dinner its super expensive, but for lunch its a steal.  Service was very attentive---which was what I expected for an expensive restaurant (see my review of Mix for the night before so my expectations were low).  They used flair in the presentation of the soup we ordered, offered to use our camera to take photos of us, chatted without being overly chatty, and made me feel like they were glad we were there and that they could share the experience.    Go for lunch, spend time on the observation deck afterwards...and don't be surprised when people go flying by the windows (thank goodness they had signs telling you what was going on!)

O7uGEw-601MDe5MpBGkRjw.text: We had a wonderful time at Top of the World! It's True that the wait staff is in no hurry to serve you, but that seems to be so you can stay longer and enjoy the entire view as the restaurant rotates. We were just trying to spend a little money to avoid the $18/person fee to go up to the observation desks. I wound up having Lobster Bisque and a chocolate martini and my husband had the Chocolate Lovers Dream. The view from the restaurant was better than the view from either observation level. Totally worth it!

ttHcfRzAIn3naA3OKjpK_w.text: My boyfriend made reservations here for my birthday dinner. The view was amazing (at night)  and the food was delicious. We both ordered the surf and turf my lobster was so good and my steak so tender and moist . My boyfriend who usually doesn't like his steaks medium rare ended up finishing my plate!  he said and I quote " best steak hes ever had" we came at night and the vibe was romantic.

OpODL0q_ajthlFUHESrIbQ.text: I enjoyed this restaurant very much and it was an awesome experience to be there dining!!!!!!   Once you get to the hotel area, You go up in a small elevator and it does feel weird to go up so high, but once you walk into the restaurant and out of the elevator, you feel kind of normal again.  The BEST part is where your table is, we were close to the window, had a great view, great table, and got to enjoy the whole rotation of seeing Las Vegas city lights at night.  It was really cool for me :)   The rotation moves very very slow, and you can enjoy the window view high up in the sky while having dinner.   I felt the restaurant was romantic atmosphere too!   We had a good server and the food was delicious but expensive!!  We ordered seafood and steak with mashed potatoes.   The bread was great and the butter comes in this cute shape form of a " mini Stratosphere".   I think it takes about 1 hour for the whole restaurant to spin 360,  and you will pass by dessert tables...  so you can get an idea of what you want to order for dessert later ;)   Overall, great experience especially as a tourist and I would like to go back again!  Definitely make reservations and take the time to sit, eat, relax, enjoy dinner with a view!

DyAUkoFKImQxuCwfrgL7mw.text: had a great time, my sister and I went there for lunch, we had so much fun, the food was  not bad I got the short ribs burger, it actually was good but don't get the fries instead ask for salad I didn't like that fries at all, but the view was gorgeous we took lots of pictures, staff very pleasant :)

p9s8-INFJmHgqOAECDLO1w.text: The view was spectacular and the whole experience was amazing. I only give it 3 stars because I didn't think the food measured up to the price. however, I think what you're paying for is the experience. I'm glad I went once, but I probably wouldn't go back.

gvuQ32YOIpO6Upf6IDAHBw.text: This was the second time we have eaten here.  Both times I thought were very good.    I had the lamb chops and thought they had great flavor.  My wife had the pork something and she liked hers.    Of course, the best thing about this place is the view, and it did not dissapoint.  And also, the wife had a coupon good for about $50 which helped out.  ( We still had to pay $90 even with the coupon, and all we had were our entrees and 1 soda) !

NF3fvGY0o1hFtNA5eRXBPQ.text: So, I came with my boyfriend for his birthday and well, walking through Stratosphere was kind of meh. The hotel is average so we weren't sure how great the restaurant was and were kinda doubting how good the food was gonna be. Well boy were we mistaken.. although the hotel was average, the restaurant was definitely outstanding.   My boyfriend ordered the 16oz Prime Rib-Eye with Seared Foie Gras. The steak was cooked perfectly at medium rare and the foie gras was absolutely delectable. I ordered the five course set meal and I must say... there wasn't a dish that I did not like. The drink pairings that came with it was just perfect and enhanced the taste of the food.  Not only is the food excellent, but the service is amazing. Our waiter came around just enough to inquire how everything was and made sure we were comfortable. The view was also very amazing, it was nice to see the beautiful night lights of Vegas.  It was one of the best meals of my life and I can't wait to come back for more!

WBdU-wj3gTC_e2-BRYymLQ.text: The hotel and building really need to be remodeled. Nothing was noticeable from the dining table, but the carpet and walls were clearly aged all along the route one must take from valet to tower entrance. There is a brief security check before ascending the tower. They also say - and have a sign saying - business casual strictly enforced however while there were folks dressed up beyond business casual there were also people in jeans and athletic wear. The servers were all friendly and all the food we were served was good, if only a bit salty. There is a photographer who comes by and takes your picture several ways. She really did a brilliant job and I actually bought one of the $45 displays featuring one of our solo portraits and our pic together. 2 wallets with holder sold for something in the 20s. This restaurant does revolve and we got around about 1.5 times - and saw one sky jumper fly by our window during dinner. I actually do recommend this place. I know a lot of places that are iconic (e.g., have height or revolve) get lazy in making good food but this wasn't one of those places. From the looks of the area though and my brief experience in town this is not a section of the strip worth hanging out much in. Drive down here for dinner but then go back south on Las Vegas Blvd for more fun on the strip.
