Pg6H1p_sDGAO8EbhCcju2w.text: The Top of the World Restaurant .. dot dot dot...  Came with a huge party to celebrate a birthday on a Saturday night.  The restaurant was not very busy which makes sense for the current economy and the prices of this restaurant.  Besides their amazing view and outstanding service, this place was maybe on top of the world but certainly not on top of their food.  I can describe this experience as cafeteria food in the elegant setting.  The sixty something dollars I spent here would've been better spent going to the terrace upstairs and riding the rides.    I ordered the Kurobuta Pork Chop which was, again, something I could probably get at  a hospital's cafeteria for less than $7 but instead I paid 6 times more that amount.  Which by the way, they charge minimum $50 per person since they include the "ride" to see the view.  The only thing that was good was the sweet mashed potatoes.  I actually enjoyed the pork chop's sauce with the sweet mashed potatoes more than with the dry flavorless pork chop.  The sauce had a sweet and spicy kick that didn't overwhelm the dish.  The service however, outstanding!  Top notch.  Our server has to be one of the best servers I've had.  I forgot his name but he had interesting eyebrows.  He knew the entire menu and did not leave our side the entire time.  Here's my recommendation if you're reading this.  Eat at the Stratosphere's food court (or somewhere else besides this restaurant) and take your date upstairs to enjoy the amazing view.  You will not regret this as much, TRUST ME.  Actually, there's a very cool bar on the second floor where you can enjoy the view too.  Do not eat here though.  I tried other plates from the rest of my party and nothing really had a great taste considering their prices.  1 Star for the food, 5 stars for the location and the service.

qO45cKi-1GecGo2pFTzRyQ.text: (Disclaimer: this is mostly a vegan review, although there may be some bits of meaty wisdom sprinkled throughout.)   Vegans, save your money and just go have a drink in the lounge.  There is really nothing vegan on the menu here, except for a (no butter, no toppings) baked potato and salad (oil and vinegar).  But who really goes here for the food anyway??  I came along with a meat-loving foodie who was picking up the tab on an expense account (thank god! it is PRICEY!).  He was not crazy about any of his food (which I believe was a cheese plate and steak?), but the wine was great and the view is of course spectacular!!  The service was very good as well.  I had a good time, but the food isn't good enough to bring me back. Especially when you can just go up to the lounge and have a $10 cocktail and enjoy essentially the same view.  That is definitely worth the 100-story elevator ride!  Food, 2 stars.  View, 4.

bL45Pdcls4-f7pg6_bNddg.text: Where do I begin. Well, the view is nice, but you can grab a cocktail in the lounge for that. The food is overpriced and tasted terrible.We reservations and check in at 8p for a 8:30 reservation and had to wait an additional 10 minutes for the table to be set. Then after we sat it took over 10 minutes to get bread at the table (no it was not there when the table was set).  Caesar salad had romaine cores, potatoes with steak had an off flavor, the steak was cooked alright, but it was salty and the demi glace was thick and tasted like it was mixed from a McCormick packet. The pork tenderloin was totally out of season and should not have been on the menu . Sea bass was so-so. The servers were pretty rude and slow.  So many other great places to eat...don't waste your time here.

OoiySjmib65_fSHUIzLP-A.text: Top The World was a beautiful experience! The city view of Las Vegas is a dream and it's so cool while you are dining the restaurant rotates 360 degrees so you get to see the city from different angles. Our waiter Dan D. was super nice and very attentive. The reason I am giving this place a four stars is because the food isn't that great. I ordered the Mexican prawns and scallops and they were kind of blend and salty, not to mention very pricey! but I guess you get charged for the experience and not so much for the food.

UhqhlvhCH_gleLHqJEMKog.text: This is a very nice restaurant albeit obscenely expensive.  But that's not my biggest beef with the place. They make a point of telling you (on 'hold' messages, on their website and when you make a reservation) that it is 'business casual' dress (in other words, nice clothes - no shorts, t-shirts, flip flops, etc.)  So we brought nice clothes and went to the restaurant.  You have to go through at least 4 'checkpoints' (including a metal detector a la airports) to get to the restaurant itself - plenty of opportunity to let the unwashed, clueless cretins who stroll in with a wifebeater and swim trunks wanting to eat in a clearly fine dining restaurant.  But NOOOOOOOOO....apparently they let anybody who can fog up a mirror and afford the prices come in dressed like they're going to the pool. I asked one of the waiters about it and he gave me this pained look of agreement. He said it is pretty common that people come in dressed contrary to the dress code, and to complain to management is futile. He said to go on Yelp and leave candid feedback and hopefully that would get the management's attention.  Well, here it is. Enforce your dress code or don't have one!  By the way, the view is pretty awesome.  But bring the equivalent of your mortgage or rent payment to cover your bill.  :-)

ANGyeCjM60C6ZzGxsPEGBQ.text: We showed about 30 minutes earlier for our dinner reservations but they took us and seated us right away which was great. We took the ride up to the top of the world restaurant and the view was awesome. The restaurant rotates continuously and the view is breathtaking. Our server was very polite and courteous. I ordered the curry chicken soup and my wife had a salad to begin with along with some great hot bread. Soup was great. I decided to go with the Ribeye steak medium and my wife went with the short rib lobster stuffed pasta. Food came out pretty late, about 30 minutes later. My steak was looking fabulous and tasted great until I finished the outer portion. When I bit into the juicier part it was apparent that the steak was extremely rare. It tasted so bloody and the fat portion was even rubbery from lack of being cooked. I totally lost my appetite and could not eat anymore. I asked the bus boy to take it away, I was so disappointed. Meanwhile, my wife was so loving her short rib lobster stuffed pasta. I tried it as well and it was very good. The waiter finally came over and apologized for the steak. I told him it wasn't his fault but I was disappointed and totally lost my appetite. After wife finished her food, I asked for the check. I was not in the mood for dessert even though we were celebrating our 20th year anniversary. They didn't even give us a free dessert like most places do for special occasions. When the waiter came back, he gave us our check and told me he removed the steak from the bill. I thanked, paid and left. We did go up to the observatory to check out the view. Too bad, it was a good night till the steak and lack of customer service ruined it. Won't be back again

lqHsVLnB4wAie96TyGqQpg.text: Continuing on the steak houses of Las Vegas, Top of the World is another excellent choice if you get to Las Vegas. Recommended by another friend, I'm glad we ditched our reservations at a trendy new place at Bellagio for this "old school" classic. The restaurant spins around so you get amazing 360' views of Las Vegas at night, and every once in a while someone bungee jumps off in front of you! Or waitress was trained by Disney before moving to Vegas, and she knew her stuff! Attentive, but not hovering, and knowledgeable about the menu. Quiet atmosphere and very good food. I had the tice baked potato side dish and shared it, because as described it is huge. Desserts were luxurious, and I had a delicious spiked coffee to finish. Then we went on the observation deck to enjoy the views, and watch the folks in the "thrill rides". Make it a must do on your list.

AiE2cQnRVZWLLl93FhOFFQ.text: I came here with my family and I think their service is great. The sight is absolutely beautiful, especially because we were here at night. It was my brother's girlfriend's birthday and she loved her "cake" or dessert that they gave her. However, to me, their food was really nothing special. But I would say the point of coming here is for the atmosphere and view instead of food quality.

HFCaZfJfcw7N1ukNm3e-gw.text: Great Vegas restaurant. The views were FANTASTIC!  Four of us went, everyone enjoyed their plate they ordered. My bf kept talking about his steak! I loved the shrimp and scallops that I had, moroccan style.  I would go again!

Voj7uFc_a7yBV7xTT7FdqQ.text: Giving this place 5 stars for the awesome view and kick ass happy hour. I've never had dinner there but based on the appetizers it will not disappoint!

3a-6Ni1H4fQWPGljxTomKg.text: A must during your LV visit.  Great view, great food, great service.  As the place rotates, you will sometimes see someone bunjee jumping and passing the window!

iZveAhwGdNCdj1n2CsOPVg.text: Paid over $300 per person for NYE party on 108 floor.  No tables left for most of the ticket holders!  Even worse, no knives to eat your food!!  Although it was very tasty, we had to bite it off the fork.  We asked for knives but no one knew where they were.   Ridiculous!! Don't bother with this event.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YuFP5j7GNaRIXDCnT9Ao-w.text: Overall this is about the view right not the food, cause where else can you get a nice view while eating a nice meal on top of the world in vegas.  Getting to the stratosphere we took the monorail and it is about a 10 minute walk to get from the last stop that is by the SLS hotel. once you enter the hotel it takes about another 5-10 minute depending how fast you walk to make it to the reservation table. Then go thru security. take the elevator up that goes 21mph where your ears start to pop. check in to get seated. Pay attention to where you are seated in what section so you do not get lost. The whole tower rotates around so it is easy to get lost. They say it takes about 1 hour and 20 minutes to go all the way around. We did the groupon deal where we get the 4 course meal. Honestly it is worth it and enough. My girl and I both chose the opposite of what we wanted. So we get to try everything. Lobster bisque was good but the seasoning was a little to much. second course the pasta was good nothing crazy. I had the filet it looked more like a regular steak than filet, but it was a big portion a little salty over seasoned but good, the mashed potatoes was really good. The salmon is honestly fresh and really good if you had to choose. The dessert was the best part. I liked the chocolate ice cream, just amazing and good to top it off. We left feeling full, and satisfied. We ended up purchasing the wallet size picture that was taken was about $28 why not. We did not have time to go check out the other levels, but i am sure it is amazing. It is a cool experience to check out if you have time.

l3XvNAya6RL9euDbAwg26w.text: Wonderful birthday dinner!  A group of 4 of us went for a birthday celebration, and made a same day reservation.  We enjoyed the 107 lounge while we waited for our rim side table.    We ordered the bone in rib eye with been side and wagyu rib eye; along with potato puree and asparagus.   We were also brought a generous serving of tasty bread to begin our meals.   It was tasty, the steak fat wasn't quite rendered down enough on the bone in rib eye but still enjoyable.   Yes the meal is a bit more expensive but you are paying for the view and experience.  The motion is noticeable if you are particularly sensitive, but you should be able to manage (as I did).

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View around 7:45 pm in October
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View in October around 8:00pm
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in rib eye with potato purée and asparagus

cdioRQC55bZP77jbpEWT1w.text: We went to the Top of the World at the Strat Tower on August 25, 2019, to celebrate a major wedding anniversary. We were treated like royalty and seated next to the windows on the revolving floor. In the course of 80 minutes to make a full revolution, we were treated to magnificent views of Las Vegas and the surrounding mountains. The service was efficient and friendly but not solicitous or hurried. My wife and I split the large caprese salad. She then had spaghetti squash, and I had Scottish salmon with grilled asparagus. For dessert we shared spumoni in a dark chocolate shell. Everything was outstanding. There is a wide variety of steaks as well as other dishes (on the expensive side, though). Photographers are also there to take photos for special occasions and offer them for sale tableside at a reasonable price. This is the ideal place for romantic getaways, anniversaries, and marriage proposals. You just can't go wrong here.

dHsQx42W9Ohvh7KoLXYRcg.text: I love this restaurant! First, you can't beat the view and getting to watch people bungee off is quite fun.   The staff is spot on and they treat my kids very well. 6, 3 and 6 months usually get the nose snub but they ask them what they want and have a special menu just for kids.   We had a huge group of my parents, hubby, 3 kids and my brother and his girlfriend. We came on Thanksgiving and the meal was amazing and oh so good. I have my dessert to my hubby so I could get the Chocolate Lover Tear Drop. O.M.G. it was soooo good!!   A must go to while in Vegas!

5NCdKyTSjctGAzZAG-qd5Q.text: Best service so far in Vegas! Really fabulous food! The strake was so flavorful and green beans and potatoes was wonderful not under cooked just right ! I got to say it was definitely worth every penny! The waitress was polite ( Micah ) and just amazing ! Love love love this place !

GZs5fJlzbwbc40cHbjc1pw.text: Came to Vegas for work, but on my time off I wanted to enjoy what this great city has to offer. I'm not a gambler but I do love eating, especially in unique and cool places, and the Stratosphere Restaurant was a great place to start. I ordered the Lobster Macaroni dish which I must say was very delicious and a perfect portion.  It looked small at first glance but it actually satisfied me. The rotating restaurant and views of the city and distant mountains were amazing, even on an overcast day. The wait staff was very attentive and friendly. I highly recommend it.

xWayXIA2u0oE0ZayQ3gMhg.text: My favorite part about the whole experience was playing "spot the waiter". In other words, this establishment has awful service.  Each of the entrees were delivered by a different waiter, which says to me that they don't care about their customers.  But wait, what entrees? Everything was delivered at a oslow pace. The restaurant wasn't busy when I arrived but got worse as the night went on. It's okay to be busy, but it's not okay to lack employees for it.   The view? Yeah...that's nice. But you can get a city view eating at the Eiffel Tower and receive significantly better service. Just go up to the top of Stratosphere if you're really itching for a view of Vegas.  Good food though. Will probably be back.

3cU8reo2W3ADYX2gaXNhrw.text: They advertise "One of the world's best steakhouses".  So why can't they properly staff the elevator up? We made a reservation, but the elevator staff was so rude and incompetent.  We just left.  I vote with my money, and I vote "nay" on this cheesey setup.  Owner should take a field trip to the CN Tower to see how it's done.

Qhuf7OfqpdAjDfBM_m_F2Q.text: It is worth to came here just for the view, or for the special occasion. The food is just so-so, but costly.  The menu includes two categories: taste of chef's - which includes four courses, and other dishes  Me and my friend would like to share the taste of chef's which contains four plates, but the server told us that my friend has to order at least one plate because they don't want us to share. (I think he told us if we want to share, it will be $15 charge)  Thanks to our waiter for his recommendation for everything we asked, but during the meal, we don't really feel like we are being take care.   Also, when we need to pay our check, he and other three waiters are chatting. We wave at him but one of them just ignore us.  There will be photographer walking around taking photos for your groups, but her attitude? Hah... you better be prepared. Maybe she went through some bad things, she looks really unhappy talking to us. After she took the photo, she brought us the printed photos, two photos with the cover cost $45. Still, with inpatient attitude. We don't like the photos so we didn't take that. She took the photos and turn back to us with unfriendly and impatient voice: "enjoy your evening." Well, I don't really feel she wish us to enjoy.   My major is hospitality and I think I do know what is the right way to treat your customers. Overall, shat we are happy about this dinner is that the view is gorgeous, but the food taste and the attitude?  3 out of 5.

n6AKhqRiObKxvUgZWyJ2kg.text: What an amazing experience, 360 degrees view of Las Vegas, very friendly and polite staff from the elevator person to the servers, we have new York sour and humble bee for cocktails , we selected the 4 course prefix dinner , amazing menu , me and spouse enjoyed it, the service is 5 stars, attentive waiter, amazing experience and on our next visit to Vegas will book a table again

v0aA9lf_g3CcmIE22AEMDw.text: Top of the World was great! The view is amazing. we enjoyed our meal. I'm a bit finicky when it comes to the temperature of my food. My husband and I both ordered crab cakes. His came out piping hot, mine was room temperature, so we switched. Other than that the food was delicious. I couldn't eat everything but we enjoyed every moment of our dinner.

-gGQfni0uX2morRJRyaEvA.text: This is a long over due review that I've been meaning to get around to.   I've been to this restaurant several times and have never had a bad experience.    The restaurant is located in the top of the Stratosphere on a very slow moving rotating foundation making it possible to sit at your table, enjoy your food and get a view of the WHOLE city at the same time.   This latest trip included a seafood appetizer and the surf n turf for dinner.  Accompanied by some amazing service and a couple great cocktails.  Our server was on point with everything.  Even the smallest detail of my drink barely needing to be refreshed would be replaced immediately.    There are a handful of great restaurants with a view of Vegas but none compare to this at the top of Stratosphere.

zZbgPdcuf725J8a941Ioig.text: Dee, our server, the view, lunch, all fantastic.  First timers must check out the Stratosphere restaurant & bar.  It brings great joy to me to show friends & family the beauty of our city.  Both views in the day & at night are a must so I will have to bring them to dinner one day too!  The restaurant rotates slowly as you eat so you can take it all in leisurely.  I always go when I'm not rushed for time & can spend a good hour and a half or so.    The Caprese is mmm, a must!  It's seasonal w/ sweet slices of watermelon layered between burrata & yellow heirloom tomatoes, topped w/ edible flowers, my fav!  Drizzle of balsamic, pesto & pine nuts.  Beautiful presentation!    Dee recommended her fav, the Seafood Linguine that I added some red pepper flakes to since I love everything to be spicy & it was even more tasty!  They do not skimp on the shrimp or crab, both cooked perfectly & paired so well w/ a surprisingly lite cream sauce.    Love the bread as well w/ the orange butter & pesto butter.  After all that, we had no room for dessert, but I took pix of how nice of a job the pastry chefs do.

I liked the tuna tartare. I ordered myself spaghetti squash cause I'm not really a meat nor seafood person. the plate came out hot and fresh. I would order this again. my hubby got the Maryland crab stuffed chicken...I tried his and didn't really like it, maybe it's cause I'm not a fan of crab with chicken together. overall, it was a great experience.

mgwRQ7i18pBhBEMQg9ybwQ.text: I will say the view is amazing but not the customer service!!! Overpriced and food was underwhelming!!! I am a foodie and went off other reviews.....definitely not a fave!!!  I did have a Groupon in which I called the restaurant prior to purchasing in order to ensure no hidden charges....then at the restaurant they hit me with a sharing charge....even the Manager was not willing to remove when I explained I called ahead!!!! Just not good PR!!!! I will not let this ruin my first night ever in Vegas but buyer beware!!!

q1FGJcCJBsOgE7yRlNbYHg.text: My wife and I went here for dinner last night for our anniversary. First off, the atmosphere is great. Being 106 stories up and slowly spinning around to give you complete 360 views of the area was great.  Our waiter was awesome. Explained the menu very well to us and made sure we had everything we need every step of the way. My wife ordered the filet mignon and I had the wagyu skirt steak with the lobster tail. My steak was very tender and the lobster was fantastic  my wife's filet was so tender and juicy it almost melted in your mouth. One of the better steaks I have had. I had a few beers with dinner and my wife had a few glasses of wine. The dinner was very good and we both enjoyed the views while eating. We did decide to order the cheese cake for desert. It was also very good! Thanks to Top of the World for giving this to us free for our anniversary!  We did check out the observation tower on the 109th floor after dinner!  Would definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting to celebrate a special occasion.

Zsho8O7UGeBR5nLo9AHjZg.text: A definite must! Highly recommend. The Dinner is well worth it and the View is Priceless. This definitely made our bday celebration that much more special. From the Elevator up, to Mario at the bar and Shiela giving you 5 star service. Reservations are a must and don't be afraid to pick later times as you're likely to get the tables on the edge. 22oz Bone in RibEye worth every penny!

OC_c5tn0XqvpAccqv4Rnbg.text: Best experience in our whole trip was to this restaurant!!! We went for a late lunch, which was perfect. It wasn't crowded and we got an amazing seat! We both decided to get the 3 course lunch special. The filet mignon and lobster tail were so delicious. We wanted to stay and eat all day! The view was just as amazing as the food! Would definitely recommend this place to everyone!!! Hint: if the cost isn't in your budget, go to lunch, much more affordable options!

0Fpiu1_UCU9O0W3FPjcCxg.text: It's a really good feeling to be treated like a rock star! Especially when it's on the "Top of the World". Well, the restaurant that is.  Friday night, no reservations. No casual business attire. No worries.   The service. The view. The live music. The view. Had to throw that in again as you're dining up a hundred floors up while the restaurant is rotating so you have a view of the entire valley. One complete revolution in 120 minutes.   Anyway, called the restaurant as it was mentioned that admittance to the tower is waived if you're dining up there. No openings except for a 9:45 slot so that's the end of the call. A few minutes later, decide to call back to ask about reservations for Saturday night but then was invited to come down "now" to be taken care probably because of the little white lie about being a "Vegas first-timer".   Casino parking - valet or self park. Make your way to the host/hostess who directs you to security where you pass thru a metal detector. That's also where you see multiple signs about the dress code. I was dressed down to the point where if I saw myself on the street, I might give myself some spare change or maybe even a few bucks. But, no one says anything. Not the hostess; security guard; elevator attendant; three more hostesses, the server, the bus person and the manager. I'm not worried about it too much as I have the attitude that if they don't want my money, I'll spend it elsewhere.  Anyway - the food. Ordered the Mosaic of Chilled Seafood. That's a meal in itself. Lobster, Poke, Oysters, Shrimp and an Oyster shooter. The Poke was incredible. The rest was good. Not great. Good.   For my meal, I had the Surf and Turf. Steak and shrimp. Steak was ordered medium and it was served medium. Juicy, tender; full of flavor. Mashed potatoes were on the creamy side - I tend to like it a little chunky. The shrimps were huge and cooked just right. Really good overall.   Service was most excellent. She was always there when she was needed but she wasn't annoyingly present. Bus person always showed up to clear plates to refill the drinks. The manager even stopped by to check up on us. Being doted on is not a bad thing. And either the staff thought I have celeb status or the staff is just really good. And though I like to think it's all about me, I have to admit, the staff was just pros and looked like they enjoyed their job.   The views were spectacular. You'll have to trust me on that one or see it for yourself. Try to be there for sunset.

JrbyNrWfUJCYnDOaw6Zu4A.text: the view, oh the view. as the magic hour of sunset approaches and the valley glows from the setting sun, there is no better place to enjoy a tasty beverage and slurp oysters off the half shell than on the 106th floor of the stratosphere tower.  --server Deborah won't lead you astray. attentive, warm and professional service. spot on! --maitre'D Santino welcomes you and makes you feel like an old friend come home to your club's dining room --live music and the bustle from the lounge above float down to keep the right atmosphere going  --head for the up elevator early so you can wander and shop through the mall on your way to the tower --hang on tight, 'cause that elevator swooshes! #107 lounge service is sporadic and scripted, don't bother. --tiered dessert cart slowly passes you as you spin by, tempting you with delight. the sign says, "for display only" darn it!  --oysters on the half with all the trimmings; atomic, lemon, cocktail sauce, tart red wine and beet string salad --turf and quack. a trio of favorites. prime filet, perfectly grilled, pepper cress and luscious reduction seared fois gras atop delectable sweet potato mash, and duck breast, sliced and with its own sweet sauce presentation was a bit off, seemingly rushed --creme brulee with berries.  tower restaurants on the spin can easily leave you feeling alone and abandoned with just inches between you and the glass, but not so with this team. server Deborah and manager Santino were on it! Thanks for a wonderful evening!

IoQkS4qhPXpI37DlFv9wAg.text: For my appetizer I chose a crab cake. That crab cake was so delicious it left me wanting for more. It a long time for many entre to arrive. When it did it smelled and looked like heaven. I ordered the surf and turf. Three lobster was cooked to perfection as well as the steak.

_pVw-KygI9JABSXdFnzhuA.text: Ok short review.. Food was just ok, service was good, drinks were strong, and the view is AMAZING.

Wmw7sRMZMzGrN2eQ2ejYlw.text: This restaurant certainly has a nice view.  It's wonderful to see the whole city from such a vantage point.  The food was pretty good but not exceptional enough to warrant the insane prices. However the biggest problem was the service.  For example, I ordered my steak seared (almost raw) how could that possibly take almost an hour??   But by far the most insulting part was our waiter, named "Bon" what a total a-hole.  He was totally inattentive, never checked on us, we had to almost throw shit at him to get him to refill our drinks while we waited endlessly for even a bread basket.  Meanwhile he chatted up the table text to us while leaning over to stick his fat butt in my face.  This is one of the worst waiters I've ever had, especially in such and expensive place.  He even had an assistant waiter, Andy, who was super nice, but he kept undermining him when he tried to take care of us. I would not recommend this place to anyone.  Or go to the lounge on floor 107 to enjoy the view.  This place made me furious and put a major damper on my night.  Hopefully I'll drink so much at the next club I'll forget all about it.

D7ZVbYF3w_GsGGLclz8W8A.text: The food is fantastic, but the service was incredibly slow. We waited an hour before our meal was delivered. Cool views but be ware that the platform is rotating so if you have a tendency to get seasick, you might be careful.

SehWYuPsmDP3QZYXMaXhkQ.text: Our steaks were superb, sides were not hot but good. View was AWESOME! Came to celebrate my daughter turning 25. Liz is great, ordered a birthday cake through her and it was delicious.

GL1x8m7OUrMcv6xnJ_g07A.text: What a view!!!! If anything, the view is worth it. I ordered the 10oz filet with wild mushroom sauce, medium rare. When I got the steak, it was delicious except for the fact it was cooked medium. I'm a medium rare to rare girl and trust me this thing was over cooked. The portions aren't big either so don't expect to share unless it's the dessert.

L8R2xZCTc5RdXuBMcXx3Cg.text: The view - A The ambiance - B The service, food and price - C  Let's just say the steak tasted like butane because they forgot to turn on the flame after trying to char it and the sub-par pasta my wife ordered was $55.  Won't be spending a pretty penny at this place again unless its for a few cocktails.

xCRLI1-c3YB6mwN68bH4Aw.text: Very nice place to eat! If you don't like heights this may not be your place. The floor is rotating the entire time you are dining it's very slow you hardly notice but if you are paying attention to it you may feel uneasy. All the food was good at our table. Steak, lobster, Salmon and soups all great and service was great. The only reason I wouldn't go again would be that I found it hard to enjoy the meal while being that high up but I'm not someone who enjoys heights.

5V0tRgdUPvTMYJ3kFCNnjg.text: There is no view worth the price of the drinks, the rudeness of the service, and the purgatory-like experience of trying to get in/out of the place on the overwhelmed elevator system.  Pick a tall hotel, take an elevator up as far as you can, look out a hallway window. Done.

3KnJurHMaLNxcnsvYYvl1g.text: $$ makes the world and this restaurant go round.  During an impromptu Vegas trip, I made resos for this popular place. Being from Chicago, I love all things tall and a chance to get breath-taking view is always at the top of my list. We had been drinking a little before, as everyone does in Vegas. We were running a little late for our reso but when I called to notify, they seemed cool. We walk through the airport-type security and my buzzed self thinks i'm going to meet a celebrity with all these precautionary measures. Who's up there, Jay-Z?  We get to the pretty empty restaurant and it's very cool and unique, as everyone's mentioned, it spins! We are immediately greeted and given the specials by our waiter which is the sole reason I'm giving this place 2 stars. Granted, it was cool seeing people bun-jee off the building and the sunset was taking place around the time of our meal, but spinning in circles made me a little whoozy when I realized it. Looking around at other patrons, I notice two extremes, there's groups of retirees and high school prom dates. Was I in the twilight zone? Or did I just make a bad reso? I try to carry on without thinking much of it.  We ordered a bottle of cab sav. Sure, it wasn't the most expensive, but it was freaking horrendous. Fiancee at the time ordered a filet and I had the seared branzino. They brought us a bread basket which was nice. My fish was gross. I was trying to make the most of it because we were on a tight schedule so I swallowed it and kept it going.  He enjoyed his meal but mentioed his belly was aching a bit. We took pics of the scenery, paid the bill and skiddatled out of there.   After our show, I started feeling ill, like really ill, as did he. We went back to our hotel and pretty much everything we ate came up and we were stuck in bed for the remainder of the night. Thankfully it was a short-term stomach issue because the next day we were able to continue with our trip, but limited with what our tummies could tolerate. Idk if my fish wasn't cooked right or if there was a germ issue, but every time I think of this place, I primarily recall heaving, sleeping and missing out on a night on the town.  Grrr, Top Of the World. You're on the top of my ish list.

mWgvofEY7vJctVzoVZrrRg.text: The Stratosphere is located at the very end of the strip and right before the iffy area of Vegas. I personally like the Stratosphere and have stayed here a few times on business trips. After a very long, hard day at a convention, my colleague and I decided to treat ourselves to a nice dinner at the Top of the World Restaurant.   As we rode up the elevator, with our ears popping on the way up, I became a bit anxious as I'm actually afraid of heights. I gingerly stepped out of the elevator with caution as I did not know what to expect. We found a large restaurant that SPINS!!!! Slowly, of course, but the restaurant is rotating as you eat so you get a full view of Las Vegas, Henderson and other nearby towns. We were there at night, so we got to really see all of Vegas lit up and let me tell you that was an absolute treat for the eye. Vegas is truly beautiful. You don't see the drunks stumbling the streets or the depressed people who just lost their entire life savings from up here. All you see is the beauty that makes up this awesome city. You can truly appreciate the architecture and design of LV from Top of the World Restaurant.   If I remember correctly, we both chose the Four Course Tasting Menu which included a soup or salad, a small appetizer, a steak and dessert. Now, it's been a while since I was here, so I'm guessing it's changed a little but I did peek at their current menu and they still offer this option for $90 per person. Now, let me take this opportunity to tell you that the food was very good, but it is overpriced. You are paying for the atmosphere and the view, for sure! The service was slightly above average but not to the level I would have expected for the amount of money you spend when dining here.  The meal was well paced and allowed you to view the complete 360-degrees of scenery and more if you took your time during dessert.   I would say it's worth a visit...if someone else is paying!

tu2vnjOGzLzhplWcqsJ75w.text: Beautiful beautiful beautiful. One word that describes this place. I have been coming to eat here every time I am in Vegas. Food and service are always amazing. I would give this place a million starts if I could. Did a lunch special for $49.  The view is amazing, with the most beautiful and perfect view in Vegas. Service was pleasurable.  Plan on coming here one time after another only because of the service, food, view. I don't have words to describe how happy I get every time I am here. may be its safe to say I am definitely in love with this place

UJeoYrU3f2qs5VNJW4o-QQ.text: Delicious food, great service, and can't beat the view. Pricey, but worth it for the experience.

GzKHc58n_8UqCfPvgXPqsg.text: So I am finally able to do a review on this place !!! Ate here with the hubby a few months ago while visiting family, it was amazing. The entrance walking into this place is really cool, once you take the elevator up and walk into the restaurant, it kind of looks like a spaceship. The restarunt spins so you get to go around and see the entiere city. The food was great and the ambiance was nice and relaxing  (we picked a Wednesday night). The view was amazing,overall it was a really cool experience.

dBw-yZ-d9lvNYubzITX6Nw.text: Okay, I really love this venue! We sat 855 feet up in the air with a 360 degree view of Las Vegas. The whole restaurant revolves slowly so one can take it all in. I had the lamb. Exquisitely prepared. The restaurant smells so good, and the staff are excellent. Because of the view, this is a 10!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegas lights

j7bkN2qWpZ3Pi6j33WoKqQ.text: We were seated on time for our reservation in one of the booths. It was very comfortable and the views were stunning. I had the mixed greens salad to start and the surf and turf with Canadian lobster for my main. I also had a mango madness and a sangria for drinks. Hubby had the portobello and cheese app and a filet for his main with the twice baked potato. Everything was very tasty and the service was good but the main attraction was definitely that view. Overall, it was a very nice experience and we will probably go back.

lxXYrlqF21Ht6uxI2engSQ.text: Poor service, poor quality, horrible signature dessert. Save your time and money and skip this one.

jMPt-HtXP3VIH6J1RSU2Wg.text: Where do I begin? I made reservations through Open Table, however, because this was a very special evening for both my husband and I celebrating birthdays I elected to make contact with Arianna also. This evening could not have been any more perfect without her assistance. She made certain we were going to be taken care of with kit gloves. Unfortunately Arianna was not working the evening we were there, but Anthony was a True professional in further handling all for us. From the minute we sat down we knew this would be an evening to remember thanks to both Arianna and Anthony.  Our waiter Abraham was delightful and very attentive. I ordered the Chef's Tasting Menu which consisted of Lobster Bisque, Kurobuta Pork Belly, and Filet Mignon with Shrimp. This was an absolute meal to die for. My Lobster Bisque arrived rather cool so I asked it be returned. There was absolutely no hisitation upon them removing it and replacing with another in a matter of minutes. The Filet was one of the best I have had ever!!! My husband ordered the Caesar Salad, Smoked Salmon and Ribeye Steak. His meal was fantastic. I could go on and one about the view, the fantastic food, the wonderful service and how romantic our evening was. My pictures should give you an idea of the beautiful night we had.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. WOW!! Absolutely beautiful.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Celebrating...
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Filet and Shrimp I have ever had!!!

q8CrpmIAXWh6qppfaGz2UQ.text: I have eaten here with my wife and her family a few times when we have travelled to Vegas together, and it is definitely a place I see myself going back to during future trips to Vegas. FOOD: the food here is really nice, albeit very pricy (in fact so much so that it's really this alone that keeps my review at 4 stars instead of 5; if you're gonna charge $60 for a steak, fine, but it better be the best damn steak I've ever had, which this isn't.  It's very good, but it doesn't earn the price that they charge for it.).  I usually get a Filet Mignon or some sort of steak, along with a side of either mashed potatoes or asparagus or something like that, but I have tasted several things off the menu off of other people's plate.  The beef carpaccio is one of the best I have ever had, and if I remember correctly, there is a particularly nice Caesar Salad on the menu.  SERVICE: the service here is always top notch.  Again, I've been there maybe three or four times, and I've always had great waiters and waitresses here.  They are always very knowledgeable about the menu and happy to answer any questions I might have.  My water glass is never empty, and I've never had to wait an unreasonable amount of time for a food or drink order here.  In addition, I one time ordered a dish (I don't remember what it was), that had onions in it, which I did not know when I ordered it (I hate onions; not an allergy, just a strong aversion).  I mentioned this to our waiter, who immediately offered to bring me an entirely new dish off the menu.  VIEW: it goes without saying that the view at Top of the World Restaurant is one of the best views I have had in my entire life. You are 100+ stories up in the air, and on top of that, the restaurant is continuously rotating, so by the end of the meal, you have literally seen a view of all of Las Vegas. An absolutely breathtaking view, perfect for any occasion, romatic or otherwise.  I definitely reccomend this place, just keep in mind you will be spending quite a bit to eat here.

XuWWlE17tVRgGbXNZPtERQ.text: Great food and great view.   I am only giving 5 stars to the restaurant. The enclosed observation deck above it is very weird.

d7Q1g0aUc7-BCrfQiFwYug.text: to be honest, i knew foods will be super expensive here which is exactly right.. lets just say, we pay for the spectacular view itself but the food is not even that great, it looks so presentable tho but the taste is not really for the price you pay., the servers were cool, the 360 deg of las vegas is super fabulous.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pkDvkNU8uWOlSMd0oc6jbA.text: Boyfriend and I decided to splurge on a fancy dinner. Timing was perfect, beginning of the dinner we saw the whole strip in daylight. By the end of our meal, the vegas lights were out in full.  Pros: Food was amazing Don't have to wait in that awful line to get to the top Great view Romantic atmosphere Seated very quickly (Had reservations so not sure how seating really is) Photographer took really nice pictures  Cons: Bratty kids were running around Jumpers from the top may scare the crap out of you The restaurant turns so finding the bathroom can be difficult because the direction will change  This was a great experience and I loved the food. I felt the dress code should be stricter and more enforced. The table next to use looked like they were celebrating a wedding anniversary and didn't look too happy about the children in street clothes running around. The table behind us with the kids all nicely dressed and well behaved, that was another story.

fCqYDk4XJFes325vCJtUsQ.text: The absolute best views in Vegas. I suggest going in the evening to enjoy all the lights of the city. The customer service was excellent. I would offer more stars if it was not for the price and menu selection. I realize this is a very fancy restaurant and you are paying for the views. But I spent almost $50 on just a steak and two baby carrots....no salad, no other vegetables or side. Just meat. And while the steak was good, I have had much better for much less. I will admit the chocolate wine I had was divine and paired well with my steak. Just wish I had more to eat then just meat. If I ever return it would be simply for the ambiance and dessert. Don't think I would spend that much money on dinner again when there are so many other wonderful restaurants in Vegas to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Cod4fGIzoQQFaCuujFGRHw.text: Nothing like fine dining in Las Vegas and what better than to have dinner in the highest structure on the strip. The elevator ride to the top of the tower is free if you have a meal at Top of the World. You are free to roam the observation deck once you are done with your meal.  The food here was excellent. Along with the view and the dimly lit setting, this place is very romantic and quite the place to visit if you are trying to impress someone.  The menu when I visited was different that it was now. When I dined here, the menu had a three course tasting featuring chateubriand for two. We started the meal with lobster bisque. The soup was tasty and full of lobster flavor. The chateubriand was carved tableside and was cooked to perfection. We finished the meal with a chocolate tower resembling the Stratosphere tower.  Service was spot on with our food coming out as soon as the previous dish was completed.

mSHPLihXr8C_j1_e5F03Uw.text: Overall it was a great experience - overlooking the strip, the view is really nice. The cool thing is that you can see people jump off the stratosphere.. it almost got me do it too :)  Being vegetarian, there was not much choice for me - I got the Grilled Vegetable Napoleon & Portobello, which was nice.  Allow for a good hour and half at least for dinner, they want you to take a whole round therefore the service is slow......

I_-EkChPqLbebHW5SRS64w.text: The view alone is worth the cost of your meal (and you won't be getting out of here for less than a hundred dollars). Come at sunset and watch the night sky creep across the horizon as the whole restaurant rotates around a thousand foot spire. The staff is wonderful, friendly, and funny. The food is good, not exceptional, but again you're paying for the view which words just won't do justice to.

SvneY_PyXKUu5meiwkRpcQ.text: My friends treated me for a b'day dinner here. The restaurant itself is beautiful and the views are spectacular.  The staff we're very friendly and accomodating. We saw people bungee jumping from the windows which was a bit scary to see while you're eating.  We were able to go to the outside observation deck for free. The views were gorgeous n u were able to see some of the stratosphere adventure rides from the deck. Overall, this was a cool spot to see one time because the prices are a bit steep. I've actually been to a similar restaurant in Riverwalk, San antonio Texas called charthouse.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l7xebtcxi18Ze9PUBgz-HQ.text: BON the server was frigging amazing!  Trust me when I say he is knowledgeable and amazing at his job, I was set off by the price at first but said efffff it mayne I'm n vegas and enjoy it...so I did...and it all was great. The seafood Alfredo was the absolute bomb yo! I had the crabcake appetizer and it was just okay. I wasnt blown away by the taste or the sauce. The ceasar salad was incredible, and the lobster bisque was NOT a pleasant taste to me...HOWEVER, the Seafood alfredo was incredible, lobster, shrimp, and scallops all combined in a homemade pasta sauce that was to die for! Go at sunset.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f-cbhePnQDTEYBYsry9yyw.text: I went to top of the world for my first anniversary day   Food was good View was stunning Service was awful  1. They served main dish after 70mins we got there 2. A Japanese waitress never said sorry for inconveniences 3. A staff went through emergency door, so the elevators didn't work forever (of course never apologize)  I definitely won't come back there again

-6WMQLNKfjGz2WU1YACMkw.text: Wow, oh wow.  The views are to die for! I didn't expect this restaurant to be this lavish especially the 'low-end' part of the strip.  They had security check point/metal detectors BEFORE you entered into the restaurant. We really didn't order a whole lot, we ordered the cheesecake for dessert($6) and I had a salad which was $13.  It looked like something from the food network it was tasty and beautiful.  We weren't dressed like we were "supposed" to be,  but overall it was great.

FDMLKdWIv0MzMQO-Iaz99g.text: Ambience and guest experience was top notch. Waitress was attentive and constantly checking in with us. Food was excellent as well. Only reason for four stars is because of the bar area. Waitresses up there didn't seem like they enjoyed being there and it was a nuisance asking them for anything. Other than that it was a positive experience.

NLVz8DNxh4iEOqgNsj6MWg.text: very nice view. need reservation. just long time waiting maybe because all is made fresh. one meal time can turn one and half round view of Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-OV9NF5rVOp4nQdIQPCu3A.text: Came here on the off chance for drinks and a dessert after a 'tour' of the top floor. After a lot of shuffling around because we hadn't booked in a half empty restaurant, the four of us were eventually seated. The service was awful, but I think that was because they are short staffed. We were left for long periods of time looking around for anyone, anyone who could take an order. We were there for much longer than we should have been. View was amazing but i was there for so long I actually started to feel travel sick. No thank you.

XSl7CYpgG0U5ifO6Mx92Qw.text: I've been here twice now, and both times was spectacular.  Before ever getting into the food the view has to be mentioned.  The restaurant crew time your meal to take at least 90 minutes.  This is how long it takes for the restaurant to rotate the full 360 so you can take in all of the sights before you leave.  As for the food this is truly a fine dining experience.  The lobster bisque is outstanding.  Beautifully rich and flavorful without being heavy.  Both times I have tried their steaks, and on both occasions the steak was cooked perfectly with a great seer, phenomenal flavoring and was extremely tender.  I have tried several sides, as well, sharing with my dining companions and everything has been very tasty.  I haven't personally tried any of their desserts, but anyone I have dined with who did said they were made incredibly well also.  If you are interested in a more upscale evening I recommend driving just slightly farther down the strip to experience what this restaurant has to offer.  Don't forget to visit the room as well when you are done so you can take in the view, and maybe even a nice photo op.

aFqwTZPo0pLlkXE3aItqxw.text: Top of the world!!!! That's what it felt like because of the view.  A beautiful view of Las Vegas.   The awesome part was that we were able to see every perspective of Vegas without leaving our table because the restaurant rotates as you eat.  The food was good.  My 10 oz steak was cooked to perfection.  The steak was tender and melted in my mouth.  Also tried the gnocchi with lobster and braised beef short ribs.   That was ok.  For dessert,  banana foster in a caramel and almond box.  Delicious!!! What a great way to end the meal.  Overall great experience! The service was good.  Awesome view. Good food!  Definitely must check out.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A view from inside the restuarant.  This pic doesn&#39;t do the experience justice.  The view was awesome.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnocchi woth lobster and braised short rib
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly!!!

1J5D6rwAjRcTTyQwcdgtew.text: I really enjoyed my dining experience here there is no better way to have dinner at sunset in Las Vegas with a rotating dining floor and seeing the spectacular views on a 360* scale! Service was on point, food cooked and served to perfection and delicious! Fun romantic ambience! Will most definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Had a blast!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful views of Las Vegas!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas Foster was to die for!

nY-8UHefM9N0MCgmmgw67w.text: I finally had a chance to eat there. It was nice to eat on top of the world. The views, of course, were spectacular, so no regrets although it was pricey, but it was New Year's day. I had the prix fixe for lunch, which was steak, lobster tail and mash potatoes with dessert. The food was good. However, I wasn't pleased that it was warm and probably was sitting on the counter for a while. My friend, who had the hamburger, said hers was warm, too, and very plain. The dessert, which was the creme brule and pot de creme, were not so great. The brule was overly sweet and I've had and can make much better. The pot de creme was too stiff, and I didn't care for it since it was dark chocolate. I prefer milk chocolate. I gave it to my fiend. My other gripe is that our waitress wasn't very attentive and hardly came around. She actually seemed grumpy. It's too bad we had to experience that since we were really looking forward to our first time there.

FUm352C31BOL_WAe8KNK1A.text: Views are beautiful but food and services horrible. Called and made a reservation since we were with the big group of 8 people. Got a table in 10 min even though we called 3 hours in advance. Steaks were overcooked lobster bisque too salty. Told the waitress we had a show after dinner and that we need to make sure our food comes out fast. Didn't happen. Took over 2 hours to get our food when asked for manager we were ignored twice. Disgusting food. We didn't finish our dinner paid 1000$ and were late to our show. Never ever im going tp eat there again

GctE_xF_j7QelwVHT4Pjtg.text: Any Vegas trip must have a stop here at least once. The food was excellent. We got there planned around the sunset and that worked perfectly. Service was awesome, and we were not rushed to finish dining. Home run. DO IT!.. if you are inclined to do rides before hand those are available also (separate).

xnkgwlZzcSYFoZMq2U-Ruw.text: The Space: I came here for my cousin's bachelorette party; none of us have ever been there so we didn't know what to expect. First off, it is way down the Strip so if you're on the opposite end (near Aria) be prepared to pay a hefty taxi fee. Anyway, the place is really nice. The restaurant rotates while you dine so you can see all of Las Vegas. When you've just got off a plane, got only a few hours of sleep and go straight to Top of the World like we did, you might get semi-dizzy as we did. What's neat is that while you're dining, you can see the people sky jumping and doing all sorts of stuff I just can't do. As far as the restaurant itself, it's very clean and they didn't go over the top with the decor because who would want to take away from the incredible views.   The Food: The food was pretty good. They start you off with a bread basket and three types of butter: plain, pesto (we all LOVED this stuff) and orange (it was good and sweet but I'm just used eating my bread with something more savory). Being a fan of childhood favorites, I got the Lobster Grilled Cheese and Tomato Bisque. I do wish there was more cheese than lobster in the sandwich but other than that, the food was seasoned well and had lots of flavor.   The Staff: From the lady checking you in and leading you to the elevator, to the hostess bringing you to your table and of course the waitress we had, everyone was so professional, welcoming and helpful. Our waitress was as sweet as can be and was pretty entertaining. This is just a side note but there are people walking around taking pictures of your party to sell. I wouldn't mind this IF the pictures came out nice. However, when we saw the final product, it looked as if they clicked the "contrast" button ten times; so much to the point, everyone looked greasy. Also, with the rose border they added (they said we didn't have the option to take the border out) it looked like a memorial picture. I don't know and you but I don't want a picture like that when I want to remember our a Las Vegas trip.

TmZg2g4cVXFxL9XIMU5QMw.text: We had one of the greatest romantic dinners at Top of the World. The food was delicious, the view was spectacular, and our waiter Lou was AMAZING! He made our Vegas trip complete!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Night view from our window seat! Made reservation through Yelp and requested a window seat as a surprise to my husband.

2FlNEc40B9IC6ujqkAZgnQ.text: Okay, you go there for the view and you are not disappointed it is amazing and the restaurant turns! My son got a little motion sick nothing major we just had him change seats so he was not facing backwards from the direction of the rotation and things were better. I wish I could give a half a star rating because 3 stars is not quite enough but 4 is just a little too many. The food was good to almost very good. It was just missing that little extra something that you would expect at the menu prices. We all had steaks they all came out at the right temps but the presentation was lacking. The desserts were very good I would recommend the bananas foster. What really needed work was the wait staff. No communication and a bit standoffish. They offered no recommendations and they all seemed to be hurried. Overall go for the views! Enjoy the food but realize you might not be talking about your meal the next day. It felt like a place it was once really good bit is slipping kind of like the hotel that it is in.

Z4HNKjf3oz94MRahtrX-SQ.text: $40 for a 3 course brunch was such a bargain considering we were dining at a restaurant 108 stories up in the sky, rotating 360 degrees to capture every possible view of the strip.  They had me hooked from the 1st course-Kobe Carpaccio. I was so hungry that I devoured it in less than 5 minutes despite the fact that we each got a complimentary shrimp cocktail just prior because I happen to find a coupon from a booklet they handed me back at the hotel. Don't be too quick to throw those coupon booklets away! You might lose out on a tasty shrimp cocktail. Speaking of "free" food, the brunch also came with complimentary champagne which worked out perfectly since we were in Vegas, alcohol is our best friend.  My friends swapped the 3rd course-Berry Delight for creme brulee.  Luckily I decided to stick with mine because their creme brulee came out too thick AND at room temperature. Ick!  The downfall of the meal was the photographer lady who went around to each table taking pictures to pressure us to buy after the meal.  Our pictures came out alright, well, except for the smudge on my friend's face.  The photographer told me that one of the waiters thought I was hot.  I wasn't sure if that was really the case or if it was just a ploy to get me to buy the pictures.  Well, truth or not, it worked!! I was the only one who ended up purchasing a picture. Damn, I hate being female, I'm such a sucker for compliments.  Bottom line: Eat brunch here, but watch out for False compliments ladies!!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White chocolate macadamia nut creme brulee
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry Delight: Mixed seasonal berries marinated with Gran Marnier, layered with vanilla sauce and garnished with vanilla bean ic

DwS2FC17MzI8Uq84R60BGg.text: Very pricey but very romantic.  We got a table by the window.  The view was absolutely breathtaking--It reminded me of being on top of the Eiffel Tower at night when I was studying abroad in France.  However, I get motion sickness very easily so the turning platform actually got me lightheaded whenever I looked down.  I tried to ignore looking down or the fact that I was moving BUT it's really hard once I realized that I was!  hah  It wasn't too bad though and after 20 mins or so my queasy feeling went away for the most part.  I recommend sitting on the upper level if you're incredibly sensitive to motion like me.  (Plus, you actually get to sit next to your date and cuddle vs. sitting across from them.)  The food was good, not worth the $$$$ but the view made it worth it.    One bad after taste I have though about this place was the lady who took our picture (Caucasian in her 50's), which you get the option of buying after dinner.  We purchased 1 photo for $22, gave the lady $30, which she then asks, "Do you want change?"  Umm...my bf and I aren't cheap tippers but like ~27% for just snapping 3 pictures and after JUST paying for a really pricey meal??  Come on?!  But that wasn't what bothered me, what bothered me was what she said afterward: "Oh well, it's a good thing I asked.  I tend not to ask sometimes."  Are you serious?  Bleh. Overall though I would recommend this restaurant for a romantic dinner date.

-QhfJSFDlwS52oVu5oLdxw.text: First timy I went with my husband alone and everything was perfect.  Food was amazing.  Service was great.  Dessert was memorable.  Second time we went with friends, food was still excellent, service was horrendous (which is why they aren't getting a higher rating), and they removed the dessert options we loved rom before.  It will be a long time before we consider going back.  It's a higher end on the prices to have such bad service.  Enjoy the view and the live music as well.

6KsPrp4wLrDoa4D541icpA.text: I grew up in Vegas, moved away and came back in 1996. Last night was the first time I dined at Top of the World restaurant at the Stratosphere--I was absolutely impressed and regret not going sooner!  The food was delicious (although I did not care too much for their lobster bisque) and the service was top notch. The view of the valley was just amazing since it was at night.  The only recommendation I have for the restaurant is to enforce a dress code--too many patrons in yoga pants, jeans and tees--since it is at the pricier end.

GnJ6O7zJzvMfy4fS2I7jRQ.text: I am torn on how to review this restaurant.  We had dinner here on Saturday night.  This restaurant should NOT even be considered if you have any sort of dizziness, anxiety or have ever been car sick.   Metal detector first. We rode up the elevator.  Hated it.  It seemed unsafe.  We were packed in.  The elevator attendant looked up the shaft many times to see if we were going to run into the elevator above us.  Weird and very unsettling to say the least. We get to the top and the service was top notch.  A very beautiful restaurant until you are seated. Ug... immediately we all tried to enjoy, but it was inevitable.  All four of us felt like we were on a small boat out in the ocean.  The space ship ride, bungy jumpers.... just not our scene.  The rotation of the restaurant made eating miserable.  The view was amazing. The food:  I would rate 4 stars.  It was delicious.  the Caesar with white anchovies is a must.  The flank steak melted in our mouth.  The fatty pork app could eat all day and the seafood pasta dish was so worth the trip.  We all love to indulge in wine and cocktails, however, felt too weak stomached to order any drinks.

nrmUMY3A-1aqJtXX03J4XQ.text: What an amazing place to go! I feel so bad that I missed this place the first two times we went to Vegas.   The waiter was very attentive, the view was literally jaw dropping and the food was to die for. Just a word of warning though, don't go here if you are looking for a cheap night out. Dinner for three cost us 350.00, and we didn't even order any drinks.  I will be going back here again on our next trip though, it is my new favorite place to go in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy surf and turf. This cost 79.00 but worth every penny!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow, what a view!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m-3JUj_f8xyeOelEx_-gow.text: I don't think that I can say enough good things about this restaurant. Well, let's start at the beginning. Our reservations were at 8 o'clock, and due to traffic, we did not arrive until about 815pm, and we were worried that our table would not be available. When we arrived and explained our situation, the staff could not have been more understanding. Our server was very friendly, and was exactly what I was expecting. She was very attentive to our needs, and my water glass never got below half. The food was outstanding - also exactly what I was expecting. The views are breathtaking, and the restaurant does not revolve too fast so you don't get nauseous. The Top of the World Restaurant is truly a fine dining experience, and if I ever make my way back to Vegas, I will definitely come here again. It is worth the money!

e2Pjr8fB34719117xAv4ng.text: My mother and I came here for Christmas Eve and we were SO PLEASED with the ensemble-style waitstaff. I had the surf and turf and she had the dual lobster tails. Perfectly prepared seafood, very light and buttery--but filling! Amazing ambiance, great food presentation. We came for the view, fell in love with the food. Had no room for dessert! We thought the photographer was a little aggressive, but she took some great photos.

fvM0FrFjQNaaEsB57FXOkw.text: Awesome experience, just as expected. We came here with intent to: -enjoy the scenic view of LV from above by night -have a slow romantic dinner for two -receive great service from a place that preferred more-than-casual dresscode -have good enough food to prove that this wasn't just a tourist trap. All those expectations were met to a greater extent than I could have asked for.. the service was absolutely spot-on and friendly enough to make you feel comfortable. It was on the slower side, but that's how it always is at higher end restaurants. If you think you're waiting too long, you've never been to Italy where the average dinner is 3-4 hours long. Chat, relax, and enjoy the view! The food selection was better than I expected, my prime rib was perfect and I barely finished it but couldn't say no to the dessert bites after eyeing a trayful being delivered to the table next to ours. Overall, I absolutely loved it here, it made for a great experience. Nothing's better than going upstairs afterwards and watching those brave souls on the X-Scream: youtube.com/watch?v=JSOK...

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. dining to this view

AOvGXlm4Kd3afqsNYJ1jhQ.text: Spectacular views with this revolving restaurant! I am so delighted that several fellow Yelpers recommended this place for a special birthday celebration.  The rib eye and twice baked potato was so delicious.  I do NOT recommend the lamb chops though. It was just okay and the sides with it were underwhelming.  I will for sure return here any time I am in LV.

CeGw4jrZ7Bd3dHll-LycnA.text: Amazing views, and fantastic food. The highest view in Vegas did not disappoint whatsoever.  I asked for no horseradish and they left some on, but the steak was amazing nevertheless. The lobster bisque was rich and thoroughly enjoyable. At the end, the photographer was a little pushy in selling her somewhat dingy photos. That threw me off a little.

JPClkfPgHZCw35wrQtonpA.text: The food just okay alittle overpriced. I keep going back though.   I have been there many times and have had exuberant experiences.  Great place for cocktails and views.

V4tzRN2uaict15OYchzWRg.text: Top of the world? Can I give it 10 stars? Best dining experience in Las Vegas hands down. The food is just great the service is the best and the view cannot be beat. I'd go there every night if I could afford it. The only drawback is that it is pricy and that's why I don't go every day. It's a wonderful location for celebrating any occasion or bringing guests from out of town.

9r0yFzr3COWcZ9mN9VOMeg.text: Solid. High end. Professional staff. Delicious. Great classic entrees, great sides, great views... And great cocktails! A special occasion dress up night out.

4-CRqsH9bMit96JHG5DEHg.text: Ok I admit, the view is breathtaking. The fact that it was a 360deg view was just amazing. Being surrounded by the night time view so Las Vegas... I was in awe. But the food is a different story.   We came in a large party so I got to try a few things. The general consensus is that the food is good quality, BUT poorly poorly executed. I ordered the seafood dish and my scallops, shrimp, and lobster were all overlooked. It was tasty enough so I still enjoyed it, but for the hefty price tag I expected it to be cooked perfectly. Almost everyone else in my party ordered steaks.  I tried the filet and it was very tender, but unevenly cooked. Everyone commented that their steak was either overlooked or undercooked. We didn't figure it out until the end that they must have switched up all our orders - a detrimental mistake. My poor little cousin got my boyfriend's rare+ steak. At the end he said it sucked cause his cow was still bleeding! We were pretty upset at this point, but there wasn't much we could do. My sister ordered a steak with foie gras on the side and it was horrible. Nothing like foie gras I've had before. The sides were good.  Like most restaurants with an amazing view, the food was just ok. I'm glad I came here once to see the view, but I wouldn't come again. There is also a lounge above the restaurant. So if you want to see the view without splurging $50-80 per entree for dinner, ride the elevator straight to the lounge! You can also go outside where there are telescopes and rides.   They had a photographer come around and take pictures for us, which I thought was cool! I thought they would post it somewhere, but silly me! Of course they are for sale. Guess how much a picture costs?? $60!!!

shBImsuxe4Z1KRgalSvZTA.text: The view was super cool and we had fun. Really Good service but mediocre food. And extremely overpriced! I wouldn't come for the food it's a good time seeing people jump off and for the view!

q_t8sTKnDM8gOIZrTTT_LQ.text: Views the best in town. For being a tourist spot you will be surprised to find good quality dishes. I had the Lobster Thermidor. Cooked a little different but good. Skip the lobster bisque soup.

CvZyKHWxZX0Ui1zdCPPz9Q.text: Wow, what a great place for a 20th anniversary dinner on New Years Day. We arrived a bit early so we got to hang out in the lounge and have a few drinks and half price appetizers while we waited for a text to let us know that our table was ready. The restaurant was very prompt in honoring our reservation, as well as our request to be seated at a table next to the window for our anniversary (make special requests via email or via open table reservation system). Our server was excellent. My husband enjoyed the bread basket, and I loved the portabello/mozarella appetizer. My dinner was fabulous...I got the filet and roasted carrots/parsnips. They were truly delicious and I was totally happy. My husband loved his Caesar salad and his entree (but I'm blanking on what he ordered right now...I know we loved everything).   The motion of the restaurant floor can be a bit disconcerting at first. I admit I felt a bit queasy for a while. But pretty soon I got used to it and felt fine. Another disconcerting thing...periodically people jump off the building and go flying down into the night right next to you. Don't be alarmed. All part of the fun!  This was a great way to celebrate our anniversary and end our little Vegas escape.

1DZC1ycA-xown1ppbd_0_g.text: It's an okay place for dinner. Always crowded I believe. The  view is amazing but the food is just average. Friendly staff and good ambiance. On the other hand getting there from the casino floor in itself is a trip! We had to ask where to go and how to get there a few different times. Its a bit confusing.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackened Scottish salmon

fk2jgXNoavDmmAN5T13U2Q.text: This is the place that you take a ton of pictures because it's at night and say you've been too...but cringe when the check comes because you HATED YOUR FOOD.   This the worst chicken I have ever had in my life for 50$. My boyfriend order 50$ salmon and got such a tiny plate.   Here's my tip, Call and make a rsvp the night before or afternoon before, for at night near the window. Then go and order a glass of wine and appetizers. Drink slow. Eat slow. Enjoy. Click Click. and Ask for the check and LEAVE!!!! Not worth paying 150$ for two people.  Also, I wore leggings, vans and a tunic. My boyfriend wore jeans, a button up old navy shirt and jeans...we got in. Their dress code in August is not strict. Enjoy the night view (very similar to what you'd see from an airplane)

c6xwv10fAIByo5Tk9QRhGA.text: I decided to give this restaurant a second try, as the first time I tried it, about five years ago, left me unimpressed. I came tonight with a couple of friends. They ordered the soup of the day which was a cauliflower cream soup and I ordered the tomato and burratta salad. Both were good. I ordered the Seabass which the chef told me was phenomenal and I have no idea why he would tell me that because it tasted fishy and it was just unappetizing and disappointing. My friends got the filet mignon and said it wasn't bad at all. For dessert, the vanilla creme brulee was delicious and that saved a good part of how bad the Seabass was. I did order a Bordeaux for wine in the glass and it was OK, but I have had way better. The bread that initially came to us was hard and a little stale so I was very unimpressed. This restaurant still leaves me underwhelmed and the only thing I can say is that the reason it gets such acclaims must be because of its view and the observation deck three floors above it. We did go up to the observation deck after having dinner and it is beautiful. The view from the restaurant itself is very impressive. This is a very nice place to bring anyone that has never been to Las Vegas, who would like to see the city from a different and broader vantage point, but do not expect excellence in food because it does not compare even close to the excellence that Las Vegas offers with top chefs. This restaurant may be called Top of the world, yet it in no way signifies the quality of food, which is anything but at the top. Really too bad, as was hoping for better. There are other restaurants that offer views and currently, even though I love how high up it is and the views that you get from the restaurant, I just don't see the point of coming here when the food is as average or below average as what is available in Las Vegas. Also, the prices are exorbitant. For three people, with only one glass of wine each, it came out to $100 a person and with tip, the bill was $360. I would've hoped for way better quality of food. I will not likely be coming back. I gave it three stars because our waiter was very nice and because I love the view from the restaurant and the observation deck. I can do without the food.

tb9yvqPY-vct9gD1ICbvmA.text: So it's been some years since I've visited this amazing restaurant, I've gone twice and the first most memorable time was with my Dad and Stepmom for my 21st birthday.  It was let's just say about 8 years ago, and leave it at that! ha ha  We had an amazing dinner, it was at night and as it slowly moved we got an AMAZING view of the Las Vegas lights.   We ordered a wonderful bottle of wine, it was sweet and fruity in a great way, It was so good I still talk about it to this day. I finished it off by myself and it was suggested to us, he also mentioned that it's not sold in many places in the U.S so I haven't even tried looking for it on my own.   But most importantly for a great special occasion, a birthday, and anniversary or just a nice night out to end a vacation visit..   You should at least try it out once. A little pricy but SOOOOOOO worth it. It's all about the memories right???

RNzYAczsxKiXJx5ccQY_Bw.text: The only thing you're paying for here is the spectacular view!!! The restaurant is located in the 106th floor in the Stratosphere hotel (the hotel is super old and not pretty). We were a party of 8 and got a table not close to the window where you could see the view. The menu is totally and completely over priced. The food is average for an upscale restaurant but totally overpriced. You are paying for the view!!! My skirt steak was very flavorful, cooked how I wanted. The mashed potatoes were a big portion ($12). My husband ordered a lobster bisque which he loved (14), but I hated it. The lobster taste was so strong, it felt more like a thick broth than a soup. The service was below average. We were only able to split the check two ways, and it was confusing. Definitely excited about the experience which was looking at Vegas from a very high floor, even though every hotel offers you a similar view. Would not come back or recommend.

YrnTuUGcxPJaDaWs_94ftQ.text: Dinner with a view.  My girlfriend and I had to pleasure of eating dinner at the Top of the World.  Our server was Klodian, who was an amazing server.  He knew all the small details about everything on the menu and even had many personal recommendations of his own.  His service was perfect, always keeping us in the loop on when our main course was going to be delivered to the table.  The manager Anthony, stopped by our table to see how our experience was going.  He wanted to make sure our experience was meaningful, he also was a pleasure to talk with.  You know what he was saying was meaningful and not something he would say to every table.  We were extremely happy with our overall experience, highly recommend this restaurant!

1jy6OQ_vNtMhl9h02PwqHQ.text: The view is breathtaking! The food was great. The staff here are friendly but they definitely need more workers here.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Yq03E7QJxmMtHLkSAYnQwg.text: What a cool spot. We had dinner before a show at top of the world. A great experience. Staff greeting us was friendly. Our waitress Dana was spot on. Welcoming, friendly, attentive, and knowledgable. Always making a point to explain sites as the go by. Service was great. Nothing was rushed. Portions were large. We ordered an appetizer to split, each got a salad, and shared seafood Alfredo. We were stuffed! My fiance tried a signature cocktail as well. Chocolate something. I would recommend this place for sure.

VlGX2DH6Qjlzia4puLlSmg.text: my friend and I went here for lunch and it was superb! The Food was HIGHLY fresh, and I cant say enough about the dessert. JUST WOW! I loved how the platform slowly turned so you can see the whole city while you ate.   You must try this place if you go!

W_Fb34fs1iWSag0d83VSmw.text: Why is there a metal detector to get in?     The happy hour is unnecessarily complicated, two for ones, but each person has to order, or there's a cover.  Lame, lame, lame.  We just left.

AUOX2rnErSCWn5gD2PDoDQ.text: this place is amazingggg. came here MARCH 10TH 2017 for my bday. n I loved everything about it. I got to sit close to the window which was even better. so I got to see everything. I'm from nyc so when I visit las vegas for my bday, I knew I wanted to go there... n did n was the best decision. the food was omg the bestttt(taste so good make u wanna slap ya mama). I will definitely go there again.
