HUo9B8kCU6QZDV_rJ-5wxQ.text: this place was amazing the view the food everything was great and wonderful service! by far the best steak it was so juicy and tender and the gravy was amazing

ZLS2RaDh3tUmmDipZoRkpA.text: You are definitely paying for the view when you eat here.  I went with a party of 12, and amongst both meat and fish orderers alike, we felt that while the food was good, it wasn't worth the price in terms of taste/quality. I had the Branzino, and had much better branzino for half the price recently. The Foie Gras was strangly mushy and falls apart to touch. The asparagus side was good.   You pass through a security scanner before taking the elevator up. The restaurant takes about 60-90 minutes to make a full turn, which in combination with the crazy slow service allows you to enjoy the entire view during your meal.  The dining experience is not for the easily  motion sick, like myself. While the rotation is very slow and mostly smooth, the movement of the view made me a bit queasy. Moreover the lights don't move with the restaurant, so your lighting is constantly changing, at times dim, at other times blinding.  It is definitely a unique Vegas experience though.

SGWS--yzW7RhDo34vpuwdQ.text: First off, I am so sad to be leaving this review.  ****Tried reaching out the them VIA FACEBOOK, and they deleted my comment (multiple times) .They also blocked me on the page so I couldn't "like" or comment on anything they posted.   My husband and I were here two years ago, for a "just cause", and that was our reason last night (saturday, aug 24, 2013). A member of the staff walks around, and goes from table to table, and asks "what are you celebrating?"  Uh. Nothing, we just came to have dinner.... Does it have to be a "special occasion" to eat here? Jeez.  Lou A. Is the nicest server ! She was attentive, and between her and her busser "team" we only were low on water/essentials once. I started a drink order of a   "summer mint margarita" $(14)- Hornitos Reposado Tequila, cointreau, sweet&sour, Fresh mint & lime... My husband had a stella (bottled) and a shot of gold tequila. My margarita was pretty strong, and I took my time to finish it.. because I was getting...... loopy.  For appetizers, my husband ordered the  Iceberg Wedge with Nueske's Bacon & oven roasted tomato ($13)- White whine Dijon vinaigrette, Maytag Blue cheese and chopped chives. I had the beef carpaccio (forgive my spelling), with white truffle oil and crispy capers.  Both of our appetizers were so delicious, we couldn't wait for more. Me, feeling my margarita, reached for more bread, and that's when we ran into a problem. As shown in the picture, there was this long, straight black hair, BAKED INTO THE ROLL. Thank God I was tearing it, and eating it in pieces, or else I would have vomited.  I was trying to not make a scene, and flagged down someone who told me he would get the manager.... Waiting... Waiting... The manager goes to the wrong table and then gets to us. I tell him, and show him the hair...  He then inspects it, and asks if I would like more bread (uh, heck no) or if he could clear the bread...YES PLEASE.  I ordered the Colorado rack of lamb with Morcoccan Flavors  Seasonal chutney, tomato puree, quinoa tabbouleh, demi glace and minted greek yogurt. I ordered a side of Au Gratin potatoes (extra $10)  Husband ordered the surf and turf, with rib-eye and crab legs...    I'll post pictures of our receipt.   We both loved our meals. LOVED THEM. LOVED LOVED LOVED. My lamb was a little salty, and I didn't quite like the chutney, and the yogurt didn't go with the lamb... but it was the best lamb I had ever had, and the quinoa was, delicious, how quinoa should be.   The au gratin, though, looked bad on the plate. Like someone had just slapped it on there. It was suppose to be "4 cheese", but all I tasted was one flavor. There wasn't that crunchy top to the potatoes either.  For dessert, I ordered a chocolate duo, with came with pudding and fruit, and my husband ordered a scoop of raspberry sorbet. Yummy, but the sorbet was especially sugary.  Now, the part I've been waiting to see. Don't get me wrong... I don't look for comps normally, I don't complain for bad service, and rarely complain about food / drink. But a hair, is so disgusting.   Not a single discount.... not our drinks, not our $8 dollar dessert... Nothing. Almost like it was my fault for finding the "oops" roll. It was a great dinner, and we had fantastic service... But this was a True disappointment. I even feel bad for saying that I thought we should have some compensation... but it is something that I feel strongly about. I wasn't just complaining because I had nothing better to do.  Spend two hundred dollars on dinner, and have some hairy rolls.....

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hair baked into my bread. Seriously........... Bread loving ruined.

M6_qOUtbJp7vFfGXqmJNCA.text: Pretty spectacular setting - view. Very good, attentive service. The "special" of a fixed price 4 course meal was the best deal. Lobster bisque was great. Entrees good, dessert great. High priced but worth it for a special occasion

UQ7DH6rR92nKIbceDs_l4w.text: Went to Vegas to get married, researched many restaurants to find one that would stand out as our after wedding dinner.  Was not disappointed in our choice of Top Of the World.  We had a wonderful seat, was like a booth but facing windows, raised over the tables in front of us so we had a spectacular view!!!!!!!!  Wait staff was friendly, informative and accommodating.  We each had a lemon in coconut cocktail.  Was very good.  We each had salads Very large and perfectly put together.   Bread basket was full of variety and the choice of 3 different butters on the plate was an unexpected touch.  Groom had surf and turf. Lobster was cooked perfectly (we New Englanders know such things)  Filet Mignon was done perfectly as well.  Bride had the Ribeye. Horseradish crust.  We shared the pureed potatoes.  Ribeye was done perfectly, was a large steak and took half back to room with us.  Potatoes we shared and were sooooo good.  I had looked at reviews and noticed a lot of people complaining about the slow service.  If you are dining in a spinning restaurant that gives you a 360 degree view of Vegas that takes over an hour to go all the way around, did it ever occur to you that the slower service is there for your benefit, to get the whole 360 degree view?     I appreciated the whole experience and enjoyed sitting there taking in the view and lights, the food.    So I would suggest that if you go there and are in a hurry to leave....just let the wait staff know, I'm sure they can speed things up if needed.  Thank You to the wait staff at the Top of The World...for such a wonderful and memorable Wedding Dinner!

fMYzZS9bMKQxvkdHeu4_IQ.text: Visited on our anniversary, both ordered chef's Choice. Mixed green salad was fresh and right amount of dressing. Both of us selected kurobuta (black pig) didn't ask where came from and serving was tad bit small, taste was no different than regular pork belly you find in grocery store.  Filet Mignon was cooked to order , Shrimp was not Scampi style just cooked with butter no taste Best part was view of 360" last Vegas town.  We even say two guys did bungee jump while we were dining. Jump went down quick didn't have time say good luck assuming they landed okay.

1yxxkqVKtvFhb3kBf_VX7g.text: Normally this place is packed, we were lucky to call in and get our reservation an hour and a half before. This place has a fantastic view, you have a panoramic view of the city. The restaurant itself slowly spins around so you can see the view from every angle!  Everything from the view, service, food, and the atmosphere was fantastic. I was very surprised with the music that was playing, it was really good. It IS a little on the expensive side, however it is worth every penny. I was beyond happy with my experience here and cannot wait to come back next time I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best chocolate dessert ever!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and lobster combo. Great!

qshph16XqH-HMWxZptEBAw.text: Spectacular view, nice staff, sub par and overpriced food.    Our Christmas Eve tradition since we moved to Las Vegas has been to try a different fine restaurant. While the view was spectacular and the staff was nice, the food was sub par and over priced.  We could have gotten the same meal at Montana Meat Company for a third of the price.   We don't mind paying a lot for a good meal but this experience made me feel that I had been taken.  Also when we got to the bottom of the elevator after dinner we had to walk through a creepy deserted  mall to get back to valet. Here is a tip, skip the restaurant and go to the cocktail lounge one level above.  You get the same great view.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O1hoEUL_t3xB0HYEQUr7xQ.text: Decided to take my husband here for brunch and to try their steak.  The dress code is business casual, but they let us dine in anyways with casual clothes which was nice.  We had the three course meal and it was worth every penny.  We started off with a complimentary basket of delicious bread.  For the three course meal we had the lobster bisque, filet mignon, lobster tail with potatoes.  For the dessert we had the chocolate mousse and cream brulee.  We also ordered the ribeye steak with the poach egg.  I was skeptical of the blue cheese sauce because I usually don't like blue cheese but, how the sauce was prepared was incredibly good.  Overall we were both very happy with the dining experience, everything was perfect and tasted just right and the staff was friendly, professional and provided excellent customer service.  The coolest thing we encountered was seeing the skydivers jump from the restaurant view while the restaurant was slowly spinning.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious dessert for brunch chocolate mousse and creme brûlée
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great place for brunch in Vegas!!!

bGTjE861gRCJTom6JnHb9w.text: Went here the second day we came into town for our vacation.  It was a nice restaurant with a great view.  I started with a drink, a chocolate martini.  That was the best chocolate martini I've had in a long time.  The food was good and quality, we had good bread with 3 choices of butters (I liked the sweeter one).  We both ordered the seafood pasta, the pasta seemed fresh and cooked al dente and the quality of the seafood was good.  The shrimp were large and the lobster was in chunks and was the good pieces, not the claw meat that some places serve.  I did add some salt, a little of the sweet butter, and some parmesan cheese to spruce up the pasta from being somewhat bland.    I was too full to have dessert or I would have gotten something.  With our dinner purchase, we were also permitted to go to the top with our meal receipt and look out.  This was nice once it got later in the evening.  A very expensive meal but overall a great experience.

CaQHhzP6e1Lr6bOTodK2yQ.text: We celebrated the last night of our honey at the Top of the World. Service was superb, food was exceptional! We each had the four course meal. It was all amazing! Quite possibly the best steak I've ever had! Would highly recommend this restaurant! View was breathtaking!
