This restaurant is at the top of the Stratosphere Hotel Tower and it rotates slowly. It takes 1 & 1/2 hours to make a complete rotation. What a view!!!   We have never been here because my wife hates heights and would never go up to the top. Well we had guests in town and it was the husbands birthday so she begrudgingly agreed to go up and she ended up having a good time.

iWMygsEWEdCDUddaYNakfg.text: Great view of course.  The food was below average for a regular priced restaurant and well below average for a high end restaurant.  We got the 4-course meal and the bisque was not good, the crab cake was average, the steak was well below average, the shrimp was good and the deserts were excellent.  The beer selection is terrible.  Every other place in Vegas has at least some craft beers, why not here?  Every employee we encountered wished us a happy anniversary...except the waiter.  He was gruff all night and at the end, ended up charging us full price when we gave him a groupon beforehand.  In my book, that is a really big mistake.  The pay the bill process took over 20 minutes which was a bad way to end the night.  Maybe he was having a bad night?  I would not go here again and would definitely not recommend.  The view is great, but there are a lot of great views in Vegas that are a lot less expensive than this one.

zJ33-Dd4X8vcRTkBTVSB1Q.text: This is a resturant where you know you are in Las Vegas, and feel like you are in old school Vegas. It's an incredible experience with great service and outstanding food.

xeYWk60oaouOnKl4H7QSyA.text: Made our reservations, very excited to have dinner here and their view is breathtaking. Food and service was top notch. They also have a photographer visiting each table to capture the moment which we purchased.

6iWKcILazdqeB8K7U10caw.text: I had the best time here with my boyfriend. The staff went above and beyond! We had a lovely server (young caucasian woman with glasses). First, we were a little late to our lunch reservation but since they were having a slow day, they totally didn't give us any problems and seated us right next to the window. The view was BREATHTAKING!!! So worth it. I ordered the surf and turf but I always ask for well done steak. The server told me that every restaurant is different but if I like it not dry but still cooked all the way through, I should try medium. She was so right. The steak was cooked to perfection (in my eyes). She also suggested I try the strawberry lemonade & that was amazing too! We couldn't stop gushing about the food and the view. Don't forget to check out the observation deck just two floors above the restaurant! They'll let you up for free if you ask nicely!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PwSTfiR1O1duwjbjgImrng.text: Unbelievable place to eat.  The view of Las Vegas is spectacular.  The food is excellent as well as the service.  A bit pricy but certainly a value for a special occasion.  From the first course to the desert... a great experience!

h9loyQS_z0-rsynl4pXpdQ.text: Ordered the $69 ribeye medium.  It's was extremely salty.  The salmon looked and tasted like salmon I can get from a buffet.  I told my waitress the steak was dry and extremely salty.  Her response, let me tell my manager???  How about you don't charge for something that terrible.  I would be embarrassed to even serve this.  How can this place be considered a high end restaurant?  Rest of the food, lobster bisque (ok), Cesar's salad (ok), Brussels sprouts (not ok), truffle fries (ok).  Meal total $185 before tip.  Not worth it as the food is terrible.

6fECJh06DhzggRboiDO7cQ.text: Last summer I travel from NYC to Las Vegas to celebrate my birthday. I called around 2 months in advance and made my reservations for 2 and the person who assisted me was amazing. She answered all of my questions and even told me what would be a great time to make the reservation so I can get the best view possible. I explained to her it was my birthday dinner celebration and I wanted a table right next to the window and she made sure I got it! They named this restaurant "Top Of The World" for a reason. The view of Las Vegas is absolutely breathtaking and the food was amazing. The restaurant does a full 360 spin and moves slowly as you're eating the whole time. It was a great experience and I plan on returning ever time in back in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2yyhzJec3MQVd_-jTaCuXA.text: I arrived 20 minutes late for my 5:00 reservation but I was still seated within a few minutes. I asked the host for a window seat and was able to get one without any problem as the place was pretty empty. I'm not a huge bread eater and don't typically eat bread that is brought before a meal, but the butter spread it was served with was amazing. I had to force myself to stop eating it. I ordered a Ribeye with blue cheese butter topping and creamed spinach while my partner had the seafood pasta. Both were delicious although they took about 20-25 minutes to arrive. My steak was cooked perfectly and the blue cheese butter complimented it very well. The service was excellent and we enjoyed the beautiful (but overpriced) photo that the photographer captured of us. It was interesting seeing the sky jumpers flying by the window. Visiting the restaurant also entitles you to visit the observation deck for free.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HEcd_nEZkC8-29AcjJnh1g.text: We had such a wonderful experience here! We started n the lounge for happy hour before our dinner reservation at 7:30. It was half off appetizer and 2/1 cocktails. The shrimp cocktail was delicious! The view breathtaking! Our server was attentive and pleasant! We then went down one floor for dinner we both decided on the chefs tasting menu! Lobster bisque, a seared scallop,   filet and shrimp scampi, finish with a tasting of chocolate mouse and creme brulee. It was all delicious and cooked to perfection. All while the restaurant is spinning around to get the whole view of Vegas! We had a beautiful evening with wonderful food and service!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JVjIjv9bDJC8MzMzOr0A2A.text: This was the best meal that we had in Vegas. We went for brunch when it opened at 11am on a Saturday. I loved that the restaurant revolves and you get to see so much of Las Vegas including beautiful views of the mountains. A fun perk was seeing a couple of people bungee jump past our table. Yikes! We all ordered the fix prixe meal which was delicious - I chose lobster bisque, shrimp scampi with beef tenderloin and creme brulee and chocolate mousse for dessert. They also served warm bread with an onion butter. It was the last thing we did in Vegas before going to the airport and it was a great way to end the trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy dessert!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s a good thing they warned us, or I would have been slightly shocked. :)
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panoramic views!

YqKPHJV9FzbDDDJtJdjuoQ.text: Two stars for the amazing views...but the praise stops here. "Denny's" level service (I can live with that) but the food--ugh--ordered the Short Rib Hash--not Hash at all, but a slimy piece of inedible grizzle, on a bed of over cooked potatoes, topped with an egg. My husband took pity and switched plates with me.  Celebrating daughters 21st BDay brunch and not a mention--thanks for the love, Stratosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dear Chef, Please see Wikipedia for a definition of the word &#34;Hash&#34; cause that&#39;s not at all what you served me

zDfbNrFS0z9A_JPgSNTnqg.text: I'm only rating in the view and the service. The view is always amazing our waiter was perfect! Menu selection is horrible and over priced expected it's Vegas you basically pay for the view. Food was not worth it. You would be better off going to the lounge and ordering drinks and appetizers you can still enjoy the view from the lounge. To give you an idea of the price I ordered spaghetti squash and zucchini dish which was basically zoodles and pasta sauce and my husband had a salad with salmon salad was average at best. Two mixed drinks, 2 beers and a dessert. Bill came to $196.00 That's a bit much I think. Also for a classy place people wore whatever the heck they wanted. I think you can get the same experience cheaper by utilizing there lounge!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

duW21a3c5ay73FCeypa9Hw.text: 2 stars: for the experience and wait staff. We had dinner reservations, so we got to the hotel an extra 15mins. Went through a metal detector before heading up to the restaurant. It was so disorganized, we waited for the elevator for 10mins. Then got pulled to the "VIP" elevator because "that one was faster" waited for another 10mins. Got pulled back to the our original area we waited for the 1st elevator. Like what the hell?? Was that even neccessary?  No one could give us a straight answer.  For how pricey the restaurant is, you would think all operations moved smoothly. Nothing really stood out besides the view, food was ok, drinks ok... not something I would repeat.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aJYL3ZrIGx89llR9WFGW4w.text: Amaaaaazing!!! Definitely one of my favorite steakhouse restaurants in town with a nice overview of Las Vegas, it rotates 360 degrees and you get to see everything throughout your dining time. I must say you get large portion of meals, so don't be scared of the numbers on the menu lol. My favorite steak was NY steak and we got the Mac and cheese with double baked potato. Everything came out pretty fast and delicious. We will definitely go back!!

TUMm8zcX1sxpU-XnRgUPAw.text: This is such a beautiful restaurant. I'm sure it's much more amazing at night, but I came for lunch and had a great time. The food was delicious, the staff was so Pleasant and welcoming. I couldn't even start my dessert because I was so full! I would definitely come back again!

9UrLBSme2Mzct_qc3_LBNw.text: We live here but decided to have a little date night and neither of us have been to this spot.  We enjoyed and beautifully prepared dirty martini to start and incredible seafood tower.  We came early so we got to see the incredible view by day and night.  The service staff was wonderful and helped us pick some wine and even dessert wine later.  The entrees were ok but we really enjoyed each other and the service and the view!  The server was friendly and professional and so was the rest of the staff from the moment of check in downstairs to the elevator ride.  I highly recommend coming here for a special night.  We will be back to try the bar some night.  Great job to everyone at this restaurant!!

o0gAsRfZUScKDLfyb37xWg.text: Beautiful revolving restaurant. Amazing views of Las Vegas. The food had no favor. Ordered chopped salad, crab cakes (very little seasoning) and the yam fries where cold and tasteless. For the prices, I definitely expected more. But the experience was nice. Watching the people bungee jump was wacking!!!!

U2vnCVx7V0q7DM2-3ZvYRw.text: I definitely suggest going at night!! To see the city light up from this view is simply amazing!! I got the filet which was cooked to perfection along with the mashed potatoes and creamed corn. The combination of the amazing view/experience and food you can't go wrong!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HaM7svjeUeqfRnDuGSn4LA.text: We expected so much of this restaurant. Tbh the food was okay, nothing special. The service was actually so bad and they treated us like we were joke. We've waited 15 min to get a menu and all the waiters walked by or took care of other guests.   Very disappointing at all. The lounge is probably better for just one drink.

bCNU6wrFW7MALoqe1YvxGg.text: I was able to go out and experience a wonderful dinner here at the TOTW resturaunt while we were out for SEMA.    This place certainly takes the cake for a truly enjoyable dining experience for everyone to take in.     Everything from the service, the decor, the lighting, the ambience was fantastic.     While not really paying attention to what was going on as we were enjoying some beverages, something had caught all of our eyes, something outside the window had zipped past our vision.   Upon further review, we soon notices that there were cables for people that were free jumping off of the top of the roof of the place.   That was awesome to see!    The steak that I ordered rivaled some of the better steaks I've had in my lifetime.   Everything that I had ordered was very enjoyable, cooked perfectly, and just really hit the spot.     The dessert menu?   Oh boy... That was the thing that put it all over the top.   The Chocolate mousse cake was amazing.. and everyone else I was with couldn't stop raving about the creme brulee that they had ordered.     One thing to watch out for.... if you're sitting non the rotating part of the restaurant, make sure that you don't have any motion sickness.   I felt a little off after our meal, and I didn't think about it but I was spinning backwards the whole time we were there.   As soon as I had gotten to stable ground... I felt a little disoriented (it couldn't have been the wine either)... but it was still a great time.

nNbktk1TZENXqmWE1zJ3MA.text: Went for my birthday&anniversary on 4/15 and it was absolutely amazing. Everything from the customer service to the food was on point. I am so happy I picked this place to bring my boyfriend, the view was breathtaking and it was the perfect way to end our trip. I cannot wait to come back. Thank you to your team.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our amazing view

ZU7mUUctbV57Das60QJ4tA.text: This restaurant exceeded my expectations! Service and food was absolutely outstanding! Would recommend to anyone!

efE11oGqhmaBASd48ELdDA.text: It's been a while since we've been back to, "Top of the World"... not since the wife and I were dating back in the days.   The view was awesome, the food  was good (not spectacular), but the service was lacking a bit... esp at the hostess position.   I try not to let stuff like that bother me, but I'm guessing the B team works the lunch shifts while the A team works the dinner.  We had the Power lunch which was a 3 course meal.  We had the lobster bisque and French onion soup to start with.  The surf and turf as our main course, and finished off for dessert with a salted caramel creme brulee.  Overall, would recommend this dining experience, but probably for dinner only.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uPX1TIrKv3LN8JDVpJsEnQ.text: HAZARDOUS. DON'T COME HERE. MEMBER OF PARTY LOST TOOTH. UNSANITARY.   This restaurant started out by serving a member of our dinner party undercooked, cold scallops. It was disgusting. We sent them back and were apologized to over the undercooked seafood. As a way of trying to apologize, they offered two free desserts. We selected the baked Alaska and chocolate cake. A member of the party took a bite of the baked Alaska dessert and as he was chewing, we heard a loud crack. His tooth painfully cracked out of his mouth by something hard in the dessert. We believe that there was plastic in the dessert - or something hard in it that should not have been. Upon telling the manager about the situation, HOLDING UP THE CRACKED TOOTH, the manager was completely rude, unapologetic, and downright hostile. We came to dine at this restaurant, were fed raw seafood, given a cracked tooth and we're treated like trash?????? Better yet -- now they are refusing to pay the dental bills!!! A VERY expensive night for an incredibly low quality (and hazardous....and painful) dinner.   Did I mention it was my 21st birthday?????

GQJGfpIALw_yeYfr0WWiBw.text: This place is incredible!! The floor rotated so you see all 360 of Las Vegas. The service and the food were very good, but it's pricey. Be prepared to pay a lot, but it's so so so worth it.

NcEV8M2sAP_kY9k6YpF5Kw.text: Awesome experience! Our server, Joey was absolutely the best. The food was great. The views were great, such a nice experience. Joey is a True asset to the Top of the World dining experience.

3q3FkcWlWMUaMGFb5zl8ig.text: The view is spectacular and the food is pretty great.  We took the elevator up to the 106th floor and were immediately greeted by a friendly staff. They helped us to our seat, the restaurant was entirely empty when we got there (we arrived for lunch at about 12:00pm so maybe we were there a little early) The waitress brought a delicious basket of warm bread with some onion spread. We ordered their surf and turf special, which consisted of a petit filet mignon, lobster tail and mashed potatoes with a red wine and mushroom reduction. We're not fans of seafood so the lobster was replaced with chicken. The filet mignon and mashed potatoes were delicious. The meat was cooked perfectly and the reduction was very savory and It complemented  the dish perfectly. The chicken, however, was flavorless and dry. I did not enjoy It at all!  The meal special came with a salad and a desert. The desert was small but It was very yummy. It includes a small serving of creme brulee and Dark chocolate mousse with some sort of berry jelly.   Very happy with our experience

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qn-sfcjQN5ltRYwh2BDCFA.text: You're in Las Vegas on vacation. Literally Sin City. Treat yourself to at least one splurge meal while you're there. Top of the World was me and my friends' splurge meal. I'm talking $8 for flat tap water splurge.  The food is delicious, though not the largest portions. They go for quality rather than quantity here. To be honest, I filled up on the assortment of bread and butter before my meal even came to me.   I was told when making a reservation everyone had to order an entree but that wasn't True. I enjoyed the lobster bisque soup (under starters) and lobster mac n cheese (under side dish) and that was perfectly fine. My boyfriend ordered the lamb chops with baked potato. One of my friends ordered the tomato caprese. Another friend ordered the chicken but said it was a bit bland under seasoned.  Go for the great views of the city lit up, and the quality time with friends. Also, if you're brave enough test out the roller coaster or bungee jump off the Stratosphere. My heart couldn't take it.  Pro tip: Check out the menu ahead of time so you don't have sticker shock. I sent the menu link to my friends hours before we went so they had time to adjust accordingly and figure out what they wanted.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked potato
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork chops
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BF and I

epJGxPTj0etJED-XfBpGiw.text: Worth the experience such a romantic atmosphere. Had the 4 course dinner and it was totally worth it best filet mignon I've had. Amazing service treated us great and for our anniversary dinner they surprised us with a Happy Anniversary on the dessert such a nice touch. Also if you use groupon the server mentioned purchasing drinks is required didn't see that on the groupon but we we're planning on purchasing drinks either way so just an FYI.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c_ofa1KeK-o2Ujb4ZGuWBA.text: Clumsy.  Best description I can use for this visit.  This is our second visit in a year to the restaurant.  Previous visit was definitely a 4 star.  Steaks are spot on, great variety of options, sides are decent, and desserts fantastic.  French Onion Soup - This is not your traditional FOS.  If you are expecting Cap Grille crock with a nice piece of gruyere melted across the top - well have news for ya, skip this dish.  My first one came out cold and had to send back.  The second one was loaded with onions and broth which was hot, good news, but then it was an assembly of croutons with a cheese sauce - only way I can describe it.  Was not tasty at all.  Wine - Ordered a $100+ bottle and I don't know if it was the sommelier, but they did open, pour and give me a taste.  We had 5 glasses and they poured way too much into the glasses and dumped the bottom sediment pour into the last glass.  Prompt to hit me up for a new bottle to which I said, lets see how this goes.  I did order a second bottle and while I was in the restroom, they opened the bottle, never let me taste it, and apparently just poured it on top of the others without asking if we wanted new glasses.  I guess I can chalk this up to the service for the evening.  Food wise - tried lamb instead of steak since I wasn't that hungry.  The lamb was cooked perfectly medium rare and there are 3 side accompaniments which nobody bothered to explain what they were.  I had to ask to learn about the horseradish, jelly (which I of course knew), and side sauce.   Still, for what I'm spending, come satisfy my curiosity.  The view of course is great and the overall experience is still nice, especially being able to go up to the observation deck.  Still an experience you need to have.

6U4x4WAm2IQ5cZKhweeQtg.text: If you hadn't been to The top of the world for the last 6 months, you must go back for their new menu items! The quality of the ingredients is superb! The dishes are delicious! The views are magnificent! The service is great! Parking is Free! I really didn't want to write a review, some of my Yelp friends have done a really good job on that before!  With all the interest on the photos though,  I feel obligated to give some more info on my experience.  The white chocolate bread in the bread basket was irresistible!  The crab cakes were the best I ever had!  The spinach salad white gorgonzola was scrumptious! The salmon was like butter and didn't smell like fish! The filet mignon was tender and delicious! The sweet potatoes with white meringue and apple nut was exceptional!  The bananas foster were delicious! The cream brulee was creamy and delicious! The 21 layer chocolate cake was delightful, enough for 4 people! The ingredients are  high quality and fresh, done in a healthy way! I haven't reviewed for a very long time... this place was worth reviewing again!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An other delicious lunch!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 21 Layer Chocolate Cake! 5*****
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas Foster! 5*****

60DZiA2imjGX2xzDPEIfdA.text: What a view!   Definately the best view in town!   Very friendly staff, food was good, and the portions were big.  I could only eat the 60% of what they have served!  But... I don't care about all that.  The view was just fantastic!

dwm4Kv1H752ucV9d3OD_zw.text: OKAY I should have trusted the rest of the reviews on Yelp about this place, all I can say is DON'T bother eating here.  Just go to the lounge for a drink and then leave.  The server was so rude, when we ordered an expensive bottle of wine, the server refilled our glasses and said "just like you remembered it" insinuating that we had never had ordered an expensive bottle of wine before, are you kidding ME.  No sequence of service or care what so ever about us.  I had the pork, boring and dry again nothing special.  This was our wedding night (we are 50 somethings, not 20 somethings) and really wanted something to remember, well unfortunately it will be remembered for poor food and what's even worse poor service.  Our server did not have a name tag nor bothered to introduce himself so I can't mention him by name unfortunately.  Again, believe the poor reviews and eat somewhere else, the view is simply not worth the lack of caring by every person that we met.

0QnMeebAjOmKDgqmVMt3YQ.text: My wife and I ate here for lunch.  I think this is a great deal since it costs 16 bucks just to go upto the observatory deck!  Lunch was great!  I had the angus burger with bleu cheese and onion strings.  My wife had the club sandwich.  Food was good.  But the real treat is the view!  The restaurant spins and we were told it takes one hour and twenty mintes to go completely around.  I think our bill came to around $45 with 2 soft drinks.  Afterwards they let you go up to the observatory deck.  I would definately eat there again!

mVaEW6-JWrRT-z-BIr53ew.text: This place is a deinite must go. The view is worth the price of the food, which has always been well prepared each time I visit, about once a year. If you want to escape from the smoke and noise of the casino hotels there is no better place. Focus on the restaurant, not the hotel its adjacent to. You'll be pleasantly suprised. Go just before sunset and you'll view the city as the lights come on. Better to spend your money here then lose it at the gaming tables.

RfFYmeC5PyQrZKaC0mIalw.text: Nice revovling scene for the not bad food. The food prepared good, in a traditional way, no surprise. The service was good too. I usually don't have the patient to sit and wait, but since the view was changing, I didn't feel very boring between the food. Only tip for anyone read this is before going there, go to one of the ticket 4 tonight booth and pay $3 to get 25% off. I only know that afterwards. My total bill was $180 for two people, if I would knew, it will save me good $45, which was not a small number. I felt, restaurant should post it instead of letting ticket 4 tonight to make their money. I felt I was one of the thousand stupid guests to be ripped off?

pMcpLOzOGS5xB51sNV21ug.text: I'm a local and we just had our valentine's dinner @ this resto and I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT to everyone! :) you'll go thru security before going to the elevator kinda like an airport entrance but I like it since it's for everyone's safety :) resto is located @ 106th flr of the Strat hotel tower the elevator was prolly running 20 miles per hr we got to the 107th floor in less about 30 secs but you won't get dizzy it was so quick and a very smooth ride :)  from the 107th floor you'll check in then they'll give you a number that  you'll have to take to 106th flr @ the resto, all tables by the window were all taken so we got the booth which is actually perfect since we took lots of pics. The tower will rotate 360 within 1 hr, the view and the resto's ambience is soooo perfect for a dinner date (I don't recommend bringing kids @ this place)  Our waiter was very nice, and he didn't complain about taking pic with us every time he brings our food LOL! below are what we ordered: -DRINKS *iced tea $5 *Miller lite $7.50 (we don't drink wine but they have a bunch of wine in the menu)  -APPETIZER PLATTER  *$50 ($25 per person) kobe beef, shrimp scampi & lobster ravioli -MAIN COURSE  * Chilean Sea bass $42 * Filet Mignon $48 * Potato Au Gratin $10 * Asparagus $10  -DESSERT * chocolate stratosphere $13 all of the food that we ordered are perfect and soooo yummy, only thing i would suggest though is don't order the asparagus unless ur a big veggie eater I prolly had 2 sticks from the plate full of asparagus for $10  after dinner we went to the romantic lounge, cocktails are buy 1 get 1 free with the receipt from our dinner, they had a live jazz band and the lounge had the same view as the resto   OVERALL EXPERIENCE: 5 STARS++++ I got nothing neg to say about this resto, the food we had were great and the service was perfect they have a photog inside though that will try to sell you a package of pics for $160 BRING UR OWN CAMERA and take pics yourself or have the waiter do it for you, although we bought wallet pics from their photog for $16 otherwise our dinner experience here was perfect :)

PbaVVjgZwuekwHZtuPyL-w.text: The food was good, but it is on the expensive side.  You will get your Money's worth though.  My friends and I tried 5 of the entrees, and enjoyed them all.  Pork chops, ribeye, and the lobster ravioli were the best ones there in my opinion.  View was wonderful.  We were up there during the night, and the sight was very nice.  The only drawback was our busboy acted more like our waiter than our waiter did.  I would do it again for sure.

nWH_gFCndg9_AHKNuT8ccA.text: My sister treated us for a Sunday brunch here and I was blown away.  The view was fantastic, (once you get over the fear of heights and the strange uneasiness of a rotating restaurant).  The food, was equally amazing.  The beef carpaccio was possibly the best dish I've ever had at any restaurant (rivaled only by the sweetbreads at Bouchon).  The salad was amazing too, with just the right balance of everything.  I don't remember everything since this was two years ago, but I think it was arugula, pecans, an amazing bleu cheese crumbled on top, with mandarin oranges, and a balsamic reduction to give it the right blend of sweet and acidic.  I don't remember what my main entree was or what the dessert was, but I remember thinking that it was pretty awesome.  I know one of us (could've been me or my girlfriend) had a lobster dish that was really spectacular.  Anyway, even though I don't remember all the details, I remember enough to recommend it to anyone in Las Vegas for the weekend.

IvPQyVBqwqtaabVm6qovZQ.text: As a Casino/Resort, Stratosphere comes off a bit cheap.  That, and the fantastic view from the top were my main memories from a few prior visits.  But having heard decent things about the restraunt, and given that it provided a free ride up (otherwise $15/adult), a lunch time stop when recently in Las Vegas was planned.  As I recalled, there is a bit of a cheap almost junky atmosphere to much of the walk through the Casino and shops, and when finally up in the restraunt (which is nicer, though not on par with some of the other establishments in Las Vegas), found the view was maybe even better than I recalled.  With that much as expected, I was pleasantly suprised to find the food very good!  Excellent even.  Service was also good... in fact everything was right on.

8oxHoSz6se1axgdyQ3HW0Q.text: If you don't mind driving through the ghetto, you'll enjoy the best view of Vegas (unless you want to shell out the big dough for a helicopter).  Forget the overpriced dinner, grab a Kobe burger from their lunch menu, and stay for an amaizing sunset...head for the lounge & sit-n-spin baby!

yQ3d0UUXSSMjQZoBxSv2BQ.text: The view alone was worth the price, but the food was excellent as well.  Especially after trying out some of the more trendy restaurants in Vegas that weekend, it was nice to get some big portions for the coin that I was shelling out.  We had the lobster bisque, the shrimp scampi, caesar salad,  and steaks.  Too stuffed for dessert, but everything was fantastic.  Bill came out to about $160.  Great for the quality and quantity of food that we received!

WV5ENDJweIUjOy52EezscQ.text: Prime Beef is the best! Expensive but it's good food. The view itself is spectacular! While your eating you can't feel that the whole area is rotating, it's pretty awesome! You can see the entire city from here and it's amazing. And if your pretty brave there's a roller coaster on top of this hotel. I haven't try it yet and I don't think I will hehe

88T5_H62jC4rszBTF-wzGg.text: I only enjoyed the 360 view of Las Vegas.  We asked for medium-rare ribeye and we got medium.  I didn't enjoy the salmon wrapped with prosciutto and sage because the salmon wasn't fresh; but what was I thinking it's in the middle of the desert!!!  Lobster omelet was decent.  Raspberry and dark chocolate tart wasn't very good.

ves0KKVaLnwOrWPpfXmmXw.text: Looking for the perfect, first stop on your first night in Vegas? Look up.  Look way, way up at the top of the Stratosphere and its Top of the World Restaurant. The view is nothing but spectacular--and nothing you can get anywhere else in Vegas. And that's pretty much what you want when it comes to Vegas--something fabulous that stands out above all the rest, right?  Well worth the price, Top of the World scores high ratings for its unique, rotating, ever-changing view of the entire Vegas area.  Professional staff who is polished, poised, and focused on providing a memorable experience also ups the rating for Top of the World.  As for food, everything we ordered was stellar. I enjoyed the sea scallop and shrimp entree nestled on a bed of mediterranean couscous.  Other favorites at our table were the lamb entree and the potato gnocchi and cheese.  If you want to create a moment in time that will fairly sparkle in your memory, look no further than Top of the World.

sGEeKYYjWyHlxoupy16cbg.text: My girlfriend booked reservations here a month in advance.  As you can see in other reviews we too had to wait 45 minutes still to get a table after our reservation time.  That didn't bother us really but the food did.  Terrible.  Anyone who thinks they have good food probably ranks Burger King as their favorite burger.  I had the lobster ravioli-the portion was ok- but after one bite I was creeped out by its taste.  It comes with a baby lobster tail, that I literally had trouble cutting w/ a steak knife because it was so tuff and stringy.   We also had Alaskan King Crab legs-  You could get fresher crab legs at shithole here in Chicago in Chinatown.  They're fishy and just plain low quality.  My girlfriend loves shrimp and ordered the shrimp scampi-she at about two shrimp before the toughness and grainyness creeped her out too much to eat.   She also had mashed potatoes-somehow they managed to come up with a unique taste to make mashed potatoes bad.  The view is great-thats it.  Go here if you are just want to sit in the lounge and drink.  The seafood is so bad that even if you love seafood you will not want to eat it for awhile after eating this garbage.  The inside is somewhat rundown as well.  Our waiter barely could speak english and was actually helped by other waiters at somepoints because they could see (or have seen before) that we could only  make out half of what he said.  If this place weren't on top of the stratosphere every review would say "I wanted to puke after one bite of my meal."  The prices are expected for the atmosphere, but to have such a great atmosphere and a terribly run place is ridiculous, but I guess expected since no one would ever need to go there twice with it being in Vegas.  They know they can bend you over and they certainly do.

SSWDxzIi4r4p_ANmBM1lxw.text: Great view, nice people, take grandma if she has never been out of Roundup, MT or Raymond, WA. Restaurants like this have their place and I wouldn't knock them as simple done well is better than complicated done poorly. If you like interesting dining however, take a pass and go get a nice bowl of pho or hit the Indian buffet. Either would surpass this place but getting granny in the door of the Indian buffet might be a harder sell.

NVHE47cqa4LrgL4bs5foVQ.text: I Have eaten here on two separate occasions. Romantic spot to grab some lunch or dinner. Quite pricey, I could tell you that one. Both times I ordered the surf and turf which did not disappoint. The view is like none other in Vegas, as you can see all of Vegas in full rotation. If you make the trip out to Vegas, might as well take a trip over here ;)

QyQ3hRUFJWMRhGDczNuQuQ.text: Having been to the Space Needle in Seattle and having dinner, and the CN tower in Toronto and having dinner, my next natural stop while in Vegas was the Stratosphere for dinner. Dinner atop a tower is not a thing for those with vertigo or motion sickness. This was the bad part for my group as shortly after being seated a couple started feeling it. Yes this restaurant REVOLVES so you get a full view of Vegas. I love this but it may not be good for others. Order a drink and wait to order before deciding you do actually want to eat here and can eat a good portion of your meal.  Service was great although our waiter said his name was something other than was on his name tag which was odd - he was attentive and kept our water glasses filled so we ignored that. The a-la cart options as others mention are kinda pricey but yo are paying for the view moreso than the dinner - I've come to realize this after the first two towers.  I settled on a Caesar salad and steak along with their recommended wine pairing (each main dish has one). The ceasar salad was great and very crisp and fresh and dressing was creamy and tasty. The steak came with a pepper Burgundy reduction that was a bit too strong for my tastes and i immediately ended up scrapping it off and just dunking in for a little extra kick every third bite or so. It was a good sized steak and cooked perfectly for me though.  Stick around for a full rotation to get the full strip and the Fremont Street. Unfortunately with the Fontainebleau still being under construction and blacked out it really distracts from an otherwise amazing view. Occasionally you get a view of people flying by doing the skydiving experience from the tower or the edge ride. And once in a while helicopters will fly by which is pretty cool as well. All in all you really are getting an amazing show with pretty decent dinner and save the price of ticket to the top of the stratosphere.

26h243tXHGUHfUeBOwstRw.text: Well I've only been here twice but it seems like that was enough times. We've only gone for lunch since it seems like you get the same food at half the price with the same view(which is kind of what you're paying for.) The service is good but the food itself leaves you expecting to have had more. The pastas are good, however, I like the pasta at the Italian restaurant downstairs more. I've tried the burgers which were actually really good, however last time I had a philly cheesesteak sandwich and it was a little on the small side. Sure $15 isn't outrageous for a sandwich, you just expect it to be a slightly bigger size. Also, last time we went, there was a woman who kept walking behind us so that she could take pictures outside the window. This isn't that bad, but when she kept doing it over and over for 10 minutes straight, eventually, we'd like to be able to enjoy the view rather than stare at her ass in our faces the whole time. I thought the staff could have really said something to her after she just wouldn't sit down. Also, the fire alarm was set off downstairs while we were eating and it was going off for what was literally 10-15 minutes. This is a long time to have a very loud BLARING alarm going off while you are paying for what I consider a classy restaraunt experience. The manager did come around to every table and apologize after about 5, minutes, and then came around again to every table to let us know that they were working on turning it off. That's nice, but after 15 minutes of not being able to hear each other speak and having this blaring alarm in our ears, I really thought we could expect some kind of discount. 10% or at least a free drink. I understand you can't go around looking for free stuff all the time, but when you're paying for a classy experience and as your food arrives you have to sit there and listen to a fire alarm going off right next your ears(it wasn't in the room over or somewhere far away, it was LOUD, and in the dining area), you'd expect something, right? Well we didn't get anything comped which was surprising for how bad our experience was, and then we had to wait 10 minutes for the elevators to start working again since they shut off automatically when the fire alarm goes off. We thought about going upstairs to walk around but when we saw the crowd of people on the observation deck waiting for an elevator, we walked back down to wait in their lounge area. I'm not saying this place is bad, I just think for the price you could definitely get better, and you don't wan't to know what it's like to pay $25-$30 a person to get front row tickets to the fire alarm concert.

W1HFfLmHAyHpl88y8R18hw.text: I have eaten here twice now. The first was before 9/11 and since then security has tightened so make sure you get in the line for the resturant and not the tours! Another tip is to get a table at the windows and not set back on the second level, especially if you are susceptible to motion sickness! You definitely know you are moving and the second levels of seats look straight out so you aren't part of the ride like by the windows which is disconcerting. Now the food...it seems stuck in the 90s. The steaks, which were tender and cooked perfectly, were sitting in a heavy wine sauce which distracted from the great steak. The potato graitin could have been delicious if not over salted. My boyfriend had the surf and turf and the lobster was so over cooked it was mushy and inedible. What was great..the bread, the house salad with a bowl made of shaved cucumbers and the banana bread pudding. Also the fact that you get to bypass lines for the top rides and observation decks as well as the ticket price for the observation deck!

XIJx7vHaVa0eyCzRjKQgzw.text: The view is amazing and basically that is what you are paying for.  I passed on the steaks because the average 8oz was $64.  And it's la carte.  I had the marinated pork chops which were perfect.  The caesar salad was just ok but the portion was very small and served in a large dish.  The garlic mashed were good. The drinks were very strong.  I drink Malibu Bay Breeze and it was the strongest one I've had in ages.   I passed on dessert.  Service was perfect.  It's definitely a place to go to at least once.  (We were there for a friends birthday.) The food overall is good but the prices justify the view not the food.

xWGlwwLkFBhcfaYoykGCdw.text: 5 stars all the way around!  Beyond the outstanding food, the view takes the dining experience to a new level!  The dining area is on a slowly rotating floor at the very top of the Stratosphere (Seattle Needle shaped building).  If you get a table next to a window, the rotating floor will give you a 360 view of Vegas.  Unlike any other dining experience.

P4m9Oe-7Yii7s5vyrAyI0A.text: I came here w/ my husband as part of our honeymoon (Hawaii and then Vegas to end it), and we thought this would be a great place to celebrate.  I'm more of a hole in the wall type of person, but it's a nice change for a special occasion.  I had the tasting menu and my husband had a steak - everything was great. Like other reviewers say - great food, great service, and wonderful ambiance.

HpMS0PcuvOqVBcgW5dP7WA.text: I've lived in Vegas for 10 years and this is my favorite place to impress visiting guests!  You can't beat the deal for lunch since it also includes tower admission and the service is incredible. The staff doesn't rush you and gives you plenty of time to enjoy the full restaurant rotation, which I believe takes 80 minutes for a complete circle.  We saw several people doing the sky jump last week and everyone loved their meals.  For ambiance, service, and price no one else beats the Top of the World Restaurant.

4WvdhZZtu-eUGU7u3Et_Cw.text: it lives up to it's name. 360 degree breathtaking view and best of all you get to watch people fall pass the window while dinning. food is decent.

4UPF3FSKKq9Yy-x6KpHDgA.text: I do not understand the positive reviews on here for such a horrible restaurant!  The food was over prices and tasteless.  My husband had the filet $54.  it was drowning in a horrible brandy sauce.  It was possibly the fattiest steak i have ever seen, especially for a filet.  Over half was left over due to the fat that was cut away.  The Creamed spinach was OK.  But $10 for a vat of it.  it would be nice if they had single servings.  I had the tasting menu, $85.  The lobster bisque was ok but too rich.  The Crab cake was over powered but a papaya slaw (the papaya clearly out of season as it was bitter and rancid tasting).  The Fish... OMG, the fish... it was completely tasteless. Then my filet... yuck!  it came with a side of Potato Au Gratin with tasted like paste.  again my steak was drowning in a sauce with onions that we inedible.  Finally time for dessert... it was a trio of desserts (banana pudding, some chocolate tradgedy and raspberry whipped cream).  My husband took a bite of the banana pudding and described it as "flour mixed with snot".  Our Bill was over $200 and that did not include wine.  The view was nice, but then again, there are many other places you can eat with a nice view.  MIX and Mandalay Bay has a wondeful view and dynamite food.

_Ul7w-uTD0oGYIdCWUt7Ig.text: I came here at 10pm and it was still pretty busy. The reason why I am giving it 3 stars is because it takes forever to get here with traffic from the main part of the strip, and if you take a taxi, be prepared to pay $20 for the cab ride. Anyway, they have metal detectors there before you go up the SMALL ASS elevator. The view is AMAZING though which is a plus. As far as the food...i've definately had better. It was just alright. I had the Colorrado lamb or something like that. There was too much fat on that, yuck! I thought the actual top part of the stratosphere spun, but it is actually the floor that spins. Yes it's pretty slow, but you can definately feel it. I'm one to get motion sickness and that's what I had. I immediately got a headache after 5 minutes of sitting down. So just be prepared to get queezy if you are sensitive to motion. It is VERY PRICY here so be prepared to spend about $150 for 2 people here for food that is just mediocre. You are paying for the VIEW. As far as the elevators. down, that is another story. I knocked off one star for that because it takes FOREVER. There is a viewing deck above the restaurant and everytime the elevator comes to the floor of the restaurant, it's always full because it stops all the way at the top first. We had to wait 20 minutes for a ride down. It sucked. I hated those damn elevators.

4mKEEsYYb_FQ0CxrN4TbGg.text: YUMMMMMMMMM!!!!! My boyfriend and I decided we deserved a "nice" dinner while in Vegas. We took a late reservation since that's what you do in Vegas, do everything late. Our waiter was very gracious and not pushy at all. He actually suggested that we were ordering too much food since the portions were so large. I started my meal out with a caesar salad and while it was nothing spectacular, it was pretty good. But then again, if a restaurant can mess up a simple salad, be very worried. We both ordered steak - the strip and filet. This was hands down the BEST steak I have ever had in my entire life!!!!! I wanted to cry knowing that I would never be able to finish it and since we had no fridge in the room, it would go in the garbage. :-( I also had the au gratin potatoes. The potatoes were cooked in heaven I think. They were not too hard, not too soft and had a blend of cheesy gooeyness.  Needless to say, we did not have room left for dessert, but they looked delicious. Oh yeah, the view was spectacular!!!

dx3VKFx6ykYPmx9u3sXJSQ.text: Nice place! nice food! nice view!  The only drawback is that waiting for the elevator needs to wait for more than half an hour.

E2SZrG6O9OlnPNPc3CzPMg.text: I feel bad giving it 3 stars, because I've been here before and I loved it... but my most recent experience there was not all that great. My boyfriend and I were celebrating our anniversary. Our server was very nice, and we were sat by a window. However, we waiting over an hour just for our food... we were given bread to snack on, but the wait time was ridiculous. We had plans to see a show after, so I specifically made my reservation 2 hours before the show. Our dinner was rushed because we had to be at the show, so we couldn't enjoy it as much as we should have. I'm disappointed.

-p9R3LTfjxMXYO2RiZgiAg.text: Top of the world customer service that Is Jean, master conversationalist. Rising to Eleven thousand feet allowing for landscape mode observation of the great flat desert. The Strat utilizes slow mechanical parts to complete revolutions thus creating complete pictures upon every angle on the australian wagyu steak, optional to view the city. But the True star of the show is Jean for her stories, generosity, and professionalism. Often budgets are saved for the vegas experience, but exceptions can be made and refinancing was necessary to reward top of the world service.

lwLTZW_fHemYXHRhQTRHuw.text: This is our second time here. We were here in 2017 for our wedding dinner. We recommended Top of the World to my Mom and her husband and joined them for a wonderful evening of good food and amazing views. The menu is typical for a steak restaurant. Our appetizers, dinner and dessert came out nicely timed so that we didn't feel rushed and could enjoy each course.  Remember to have a reservation and be sure to get your picture taken with the photographer that roams the restaurant. You can get a nice nighttime shot of you with the Vegas lights in the background.

yQ6NLqO-L9wm10NiMtM99w.text: GROPON DEAL BEWARE!  Purchased the Groupon deal for myself so I can try out the food at this restaurant for the first time. Took my buddy with me and she ordered her own stuff. Made the reservation and let them know I got 1 Groupon deal. I also let the server know as well and he gave me the special menu.   We sat in the booth so there's 2 layers of people blocking the view. Whatever, the lobster bisque was salty af. Crab cake was good and the mustard sauce was a great pair. The filet mignon was nicely grilled. The salted caramel creme brulee was runny, I can drink it with a straw. We also ordered the lamb chops, 4 cocktails, beef tartar. Service was good.   We were pretty intoxicated by the end. I was trying to be careful when I was looking at the receipt, saw that he marked some Groupon items as 0.00 (stupid me, should've read all of it, he charged me the Groupon deal  on one item which adds up to $82 total). Yadda yadda, went back to the hotel room and sobered up. Looked at the receipt again and noticed I was charged for the Groupon deal. The restaurant was already closed so I called and was bounced around until I got to a voicemail. Left a message. I have to head back to LA the next morning so I didn't have time to go back to get a refund. I attempted to call again the next day (10 times, no less), bounced to the same voicemail, I don't know why it's so hard for these people to transfer me to the right person. Never raised my voice or rude. I was calm.   I already paid Groupon for the 4 items, why am I paying for it again at the restaurant? Makes no sense. For Groupon, if you click "View Voucher", you can't get a refund on it afterwards. Pretty upset at this point. Sent emails and left voicemails. Time to file a chargeback. One tip for my fellow foodies, you don't have to sign the receipt, the restaurant can still run the charge on the card. The signature is to protect them, not us. If you don't sign it, you have a very high chance of winning a chargeback if they overcharge you. When sh*t hit the fan, good luck trying to reach the restaurant. They'll hear it from the bank though. Thank god for credit cards!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charged for Groupon deal even though I already paid Groupon. Beware when checking receipt, 4 drinks can really cloud your mind.

VbSki62i9rKC48hGMfnQyA.text: The reception could do a little better when their guests make a reservation. My boyfriend and I made a reservation at 9 we got there at 8:50 checked in and we had to wait for a table to be cleared. We got seated around 9:15, and our waiter was kind enough to apologize for the wait. We ordered the sea food platter and a steak. We didn't get our food until 10:15. Honestly for the amount we spent on this date we expected way more. The sea food platter had more ice than it did food, the steak wasn't filling, and the time it took for it to be ready was extremely long. The view of the strip lasted about 10 minutes, and for the whole restaurant to circle around took about an hour. Our bill came up to about $340 that's not including gratuity. I wouldn't return, it was nice for the experience.  P.s. If you want good sea food, go to M resort, all you can eat sea food buffet. Less expensive too. And their steak is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8 small oyster clams, 8 huge shrimps, 8 small crab legs. My boyfriend and I finished the whole thing.

3HQ4h7E4MKhaohFTfKtTbg.text: We liked this for the experience of overlooking Vegas at night. Beautiful 360 degree view of glittering Vegas in this rotating restaurant. We saw a bungee jumper take a plunge from the level above us.    My skirt steak was tender and juicy. The blue cheese crust was disappointing- too oily. My daughter's scallops were also amazing.  Both asparagus and Brussel sprouts were fresh and cooked to perfection. Retained their crispness without being raw.  Actually regret ordering though, because too much food.   We were disappointed in the establishment's claim of being upscale. They have a dress code they don't enforce and they had a photographer come around the dining room offering to take photos. Felt cruise ship- like. Definitely detracts from the ambience.

3cplRUlnMieIdQh3Du5Psw.text: My boyfriend and I went here for our 5 year anniversary and it was amazing! Joey was our server and he was very nice and attentive and made our experience one to remember. As for the food, it was delicious! We had the 4 course meal. Started off with the lobster Bisque for our first course, then we had the crab cake for the 2nd course , for the 3rd course we had filet mignon with mash potatoes, asparagus and shrimp and for the last course we had the Spumoni and crepe brulee which was the perfect way to top off the night. Everything was so delicious and perfect. Definitely my favorite steak place so far. Will be coming here again very soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MyIIUDWFKjTsiVhL9uY84g.text: The food was good, nothing out of this world..... now the being up 900ft and in a spinning Stratosphere Tower was an experience in itself!   Everyone always raved about the chefs dishes, but no one ever warned me about the room spinning around so you can get a different view every second that goes by. The view is SPECTACULAR!!!!! If only I didn't get dizzy! ( which I did, very rare for me )  I order the portobello mushrooms for appetizer. Very healthy, and light. Followed by my main course the roasted organic chicken! I played it very safe considering the dizzy side effects. This was more for the experience!   Service was great as well, my server made sure to take the worried look off my face and keep me smiling ! Even took a pic for me! What a guy! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4HRtZGUCOt2f1xTsO01wPw.text: I'm so excited to have given the opportunity to experience "Top of The World" for lunch earlier today! Even better I was able to call at 1:30, for a 2pm reservation for 5- when they close for lunch at 3:30, that's whaaasssupp!   Walking up to the restaurant was super cool. You check in and walk through a security check area then basically ride a private elevator up to the 106th floor! So VIPish. Checked in with the front desk receptionist-then we were seated right away...  The immediate view from 106 stories up is a site to see within itself. Of course the view is much more spectacular at night, but the view during the day is just as special. You get a 360 degrees view of Las Vegas and surrounding cities. The restaurant is a constant revolving restaurant, so sit back enjoy the view and some delicious food!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duo of Carpaccio &amp; Tartare
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh bread

9W7v8srW2YHgozpSD09wqQ.text: The food and view were excellent.  We were delighted to be seated right by the window.  This was a magical meal.    Where Top of the World really excelled was at helping me find my lost rental car key.  I either dropped it or left it on the table.  Of course I did not discover this until after the long walk through the Casino to the Parking Garage.    I walked back and was fearful of a a penalty fee from the rental car company and a long wait to get this sorted out.  We were both tired.    When I reached the hostess stand one was very attentive and let me return to my table to look.  I realized that the key may have fallen on the outside non moving part of the restaurant so I looked over there too.  No key.   I returned to the hostess stand and the hostess that had previously helped me told me that the key had been turned into security. So I went security and got my key.    These hostesses probably catch hell all day long because they can't always seat people by the window.  In spite if this, the lady helping me was extremely compassionate.  I  ate there on January 25th and I had a 6:30 pm reservation.  I sat in section 5.  This information is provided to help management locate this employee and commend her.

LUdiwD20i3xZlfbdS4GENw.text: Gorgeous views and amazing food with fabulous service.  Simple yet delicious menu, mostly steak and seafood choices.  The bread basket (variety) was a nice starter: yummy and fresh.  Caprese salad was one of my favorites with colorful chunks of fresh tomato and fresh mozzarella. Served with micro greens a balsamic drizzle and a basil puree. Another very nice starter, not to heavy.  The shrimp cocktail was delicious, extremely fresh and generously sized shrimp.  The strip steak was the best I've ever had, tender and flavorful! It was a nice portion size as well. I was able to take half home. Along side I ordered the grilled asparagus with Parmesan crouton topping. Again very fresh veggies! The crunch of the Parmesan and croutons was a very nice addition to the tender grilled asparagus.  I tried my husbands fillet as well and it was one of the best fillets I have ever had. Simply seasoned and tender, it nearly melts in your mouth. Delicious!  I tried my husbands loaded twice baked potato as well, it was a very big portion and was fluffy and simply delicious.  All the food was rich and delicious but did not leave us feeling too full or yucky by the end of the meal.  The view was AMAZING! As a local it was fun to identify locations around town near and far off into the distance. It was also a lot of fun to watch people enjoying the crazy rides on the floor about the restaurant. We got to see a number of people bungee jump and found that really cool.  It takes the restaurant an hour and 20 minutes to make a whole revolution and in the time we spent enjoying the restaurant I would say we got to go around a time and a half.  The service was great, prompt and extremely friendly. I wish I could remember our waiters name he was very personable and helpful with suggestions on the menu. I very much enjoyed my experience and felt that although the service was prompt we were still able to spend a nice chunk of time enjoying the beautiful restaurant and view.  I hope to enjoy this restaurant again soon. It was a very nice treat!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strip view
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunset over the mountains to the north west.

bjUeY4sdXDm00oSeyKSDwg.text: If it wasn't for the view, I would be giving this spot 0 stars. To start, you have to walk through a medal detector, and then wait for an elevator. Once you're off the elevator, you have to wait again just to be seated. Once we were seated, we had to wait...and wait for the waiter to come by. The waiter that we had did not bother to ask what we wanted to drink, did not bother to ask how the food was, and didn't ask if we wanted dessert/coffee. The cocktails (which we had to tell the waiter we wanted) were very good. There is not an extensive menu so I hope you like overpriced steak or seafood. The salmon I had was small, greasy, and definitely not worth the price. However, the bread was delicious.   If you want to see the view, I recommend going to 107 Sky Lounge because the restaurant is nothing to write home about.

zVmy_x3tiT-j04unlQ-dEw.text: We will come back. And we will also bring family and friends here. We received great service and also follow up. Amazing view, especially during sunset. We ordeded each a ribeye steak amd they were juicy and perfectly cooked the we way we like them. We also had caprese salad, mashed potatoes and a bottle of wine. All were good choices.

IH9ze8O80pyE8-CRy-w_EQ.text: Don't go to this resturesta. We had a resovresol fot 9:45 tonight, we had still wait 40 minutes until we get tge table, then we ask for the manager that not really a manager he just listinis to the problem and not doing anything really he says "yes yes yes" and ignoring tge situation.. we ask few times to get the fish no souce still got it with. I recommend this restaurant to change the manager he is not doing any good to tgis restaurant big fat guy i don't know his name!

NhxIfo_HrD4ZgTIBjydfUA.text: The view was honestly to die for! The service was excellent and prompt and the food was exquisite in every single way. I think it was over priced and honestly it probably is because of the location, however it was well worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16oz Bone-In Prime Ribeye* with Brussels Sprouts

OKpSj25hzou_A49tA6AWyA.text: Beautiful dining spot with an amazing 360 view of Las Vegas. Food is a bit high but its worth every penny.  By far the best customer service in town.

VoI_Htlf-k5j9_TxfncdFg.text: I first went to Top of the World in the late 1990s when it was pretty new. I recently went back and found it still amazing! The views are wonderful. The elevator to the restaurant takes 32 seconds by the way! Tremendous ambiance and elegance to it. This is a rotating restaurant. Rotation take 80 minutes to complete and is very smooth! The views of the Las Vegas Valley are second to none. I highly recommend going at night to see all the lights! 5 STARS

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looking at downtown Las Vegas.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spectacular view
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looking south toward all the large hotels on The Strip.

MKrrfF-O-POsqefTbpZV4g.text: I really did not expect this restaurant to be as good as it was.  We honestly went there mainly for the beautiful view.  We requested a window table for my husband's birthday and got it.  However, they are correct by saying there are gorgeous views from any table or booth at the restaurant.    We started with the lump crab, filet mignon tartare, and avocado salad.  OMG, the best lump crab and steak tartare ever!!  The avocado salad was also light and refreshing.  I only had a few bites because I wanted to save my appetite.  For our entrees, I ordered the Australian Wagyu Skirt Steak and my husband had the bone-in ribeye.  The skirt steak was incredible.  I brought the leftovers back to our hotel and had a refrigerator delivered to my room for just that purpose.  (I had to fib and say I needed to refrigerate my medication...oops.)  Unfortunately, we had too many other amazing meals that weekend, so the leftovers never got eaten.  That is a darn shame because it was the best meal of the weekend!  Kudos to TOTW which could have gotten by on their looks alone but stepped up to the plate with some f****ing amazing food!

59N3t9PtcexoKufzzxFSkw.text: Wonderful experience, the view, the ambiance on the night I took my partner was AMAZING. I ordered the crab Stuffed chicken with the lobster Mac. The lobster Mac was ehhh, but the chicken was really good. Do yourself the favor of ordering the lobster bisque. The presentation of the lobster bisque was something I wish I couldve gotten on camera. Great experience and we got to go to the observatory deck after our meal for free.

X8BXZIhEnvUd7ia2R-H1Ew.text: Absolutely worth it. The views are amazing. It takes 75 minutes to completely rotate. You get to head up to the 106 floor via a private elevator. We were seated right away, even though we were early for our reservation. Our server, Micah, was prompt and very professional. We both ordered power lunches- with the Groupon special. I ordered a Caesar salad (pretty standard but good), the filet and lobster tail (very good, lobster tail is small but overall the dish was well cooked) and the creme brulee (very good) and my partner ordered the beet/burrata (amazing flavors) the salmon (slightly salty but cooked perfectly) and the baked Alaska (upcharge but worth it). Overall, I would recommended it. I wouldn't say I HAVE to go everytime I'm in LV but it's a good experience. And they give you free access to the observation floors after!

9ENZ5LrXdMdJ8nnrww4ngg.text: The service here was excellent.  Make sure to book a reservation and your wait time should be short.  Good portion sizes and the food was nicely seasoned and cooked as requested. I recommend the aspen ribeye  if you're a steak lover. The twice baked potato was a hearty side dish, enough for 2.  Drinks and wine options plentiful.  This Restaurant is a very enjoyable location for dinner because of the views rotating slowly as you enjoy your meal.  Watch out though, every few minutes a poor soul will be flying off the side of the Stratosphere... truly insane! We surely enjoyed our dinner at the "top of the world."

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twice Baked Potato , Bacon , Cheddar , Green Onion
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The aspen ribeye 16 oz.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Salmon

Fyl-8vBg9n_QWWwBfU2lew.text: An oldie, but a goodie, can't beat the view and ambiance,  my favorite steakhouse in the city for that reason

W_EmS2-6M3PxRZbUyfIcgQ.text: We walked past the Stratosphere on our way back to our hotel and decided to head up to have some lunch. First off, you are required to pay the fee to go to the top deck in order to get to the restaurant despite being told from others on Yelp that this wasn't the case. However, it was worth it. We enjoyed the views.   It wasn't busy so we were able to have a seat along the edge. The view is spectacular!!! We almost made it all the way around but we were able to see from all angles. I believe our server told us it takes an hour and 15 minutes to get all the way around but don't quote me on that.   Our server was great and very attentive. She brought us water and a break basket right away. We ordered drinks cause, why not? They came quickly and tasted delicious. I ordered the sangria.   My husband and think alike too much but we both ordered the steak sandwich. It was so good! Very flavorful, with a TON of meat but for some reason I didn't take a picture which is not like me.   We did not get a chance to have desert because we were so full from the sandwich and to be honest my fear of heights was taking its toll on me so I was anxious to get my feet back on the ground. They have a desert cart that you pass on your trip around the tower.   While having lunch we watched the crazy people on the ride they have on the observation deck. We also watched two crazy people do the "bungee jump."    Overall it was a great experience. Service was good, food was good and the view was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread basket
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desert cart

XleVEMbNmMvod2Vb5nxI6w.text: People!!! This place was a great find and to find a Groupon to use on top of that!! The views are amazing, the food is delicious, and the service was great! If you like seafood, the lobster bisque is a MUST!!! So creamy and delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cavatelli Pasta (also a 2nd course option).
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Neapolitan ice cream.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon &amp; Shrimp Scampi (3rd course).

Lfn7wWCvo51fX9PW8oxE1w.text: We went here for an early dinner.  Food: They give good quantity and the food tastes good. The mushroom with black garlic side tasted really delicious. The food is a little more on the expensive side though.  Service: Really good service.  Ambience: Beautiful views, romantic. The seating rotates completely in about 80 mins. So you good amazing strip views. We went during sunset time and it was gorgeous.

spbERvZixksgfTuHvPh-wA.text: Waited 20 min to order  Lack of employee only 3 people were working price is normal for high class restaurants don't care about price but 20 mins wait just for order not deserve price like that  Also not super friendly staff old lady were not bother to smile eve

81bXJk5yrj9ZSpsEWJ7cFg.text: The food was excellent!  Filet cooked perfectly and very tender.  Shrimp delicious!  The view is really fun but the decor is very dated and doesn't fit the quality of the dining experience.  The food was slow but good service overall.  The entrance to the building is low end too so again I was surprised at the quality of the food!  Really great wine list too.  If I could I'd give this 3.5 stars.

kjQBLU9E4c8PD3XvwzgnRA.text: With such a stunning view I was really hoping that the food was going to be great as well. And it was. I ordered the California salad with heirloom tomatoes, burrata, and basil with a balsamic sauce. It was delicious. The lamb chops were cooked perfectly, medium rare, and served with 3 sauces. They were so tender they just melted in my mouth. Probably the best lamb I've ever had. The sauteed mushrooms were excellent. Quite the medley of mushrooms. Unfortunately I had no room for desert but the desert menu offered a lot of great choices. The service was fantastic as well. Thanks Alexander. Definitely coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. For my lamb chops-horseradish, mint gel and au jus.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb chops with mushrooms
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California salad with heirloom tomatoes

evPOQ8euydZKcYCf969fxg.text: This restaurant is incredible. The views are breathtaking and are worth the visit alone! The food is great. The service was even better! This is a for sure go-to every time I'm in Vegas. This place is very pricey, but between the meal & the experience, it is worth the money. I would absolutely recommend this restaurant to anyone who happens to be in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Even better at night!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View during the day
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime ribeye steak sandwich

2n87HwgmWBu23OPaflO7Ng.text: 5 stars for view, and their happy hour isn't bad.  Buy one, get one on certain drinks in the 107 Lounge. It is a bit chilly, bring a sweater.   4 stars for service. Courteous staff, but lacking.   2 stars for food. Highly disappointed about everything. You don't pay $78.00 for the wagyu ribeye, and get a piece that has 3 inches of fat and a huge line of grisle. I should not have to chew like I have a piece of jerky in my mouth.   The filet was way under cooked, rare moo rare. They then took it back and re-fired the same piece. Never do that, it came back super tough. Like we should not have to keep chewing the same piece like a cow chewing grass.  The duck confit was so overcooked as well. Hardly any pink left in the meat. The leg was fine, but the breast was ruined. It was dry, and the Yukon potato scalloped circle was inedible. It tasted old, and re cooked.   The sea bass was not hot, and salty. More than likely it was salted as well as having the miso sauce. The miso sauce is already salty as it is.   The twice baked potato was recommended, but I would not recommend it.  The haricorts had a balsamic reduction or sauce that wasn't mentioned. Underseasoned.   The salads were alright. Caesar was more outer leaves instead of hearts. It was definitely overdressed, but for some who like the extra dressing it was perfect. The butter/ bibb salad was alright with roasted beets.   The bread was alright, no sourdough like the waiter mentioned. Three types of butter: orange, pesto, and regular. Some were hot, and some not.  There were also some flat chip like bread. They were salty in places, spicy in others, and okay.  Creme brulee was good, a little burnt on the sugar top. The teardrop chocolate cake was dense and the outer chocolate was really hard.   Overall I would say come for drinks and appetizers. DO NOT COME FOR STEAK! The couple next to us got the ribeye with the horseradish crust. They only ate half- chewy and undercooked.   Manager stepped in, and comped one dish. They decided that since the leg of the duck was moist, but the breast was dry, they comped half of that.  Still a disappointment.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. creme brulee and teardrop chocolate cake
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The filet, after the second time cooked.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yukon gold potatoes with the duck confit inedible, and old.

kC448bCuQkj-oC8rNX2AOA.text: Had a great meal at Top of the World. Everything was tasty. The rotating views of Las Vegas makes dinner entertaining. See the pictures I've took.

4F_DvxfCQQ7v8g7PfXJpbA.text: atmosphere: What a beautiful place to have dinner with a loved one. The atmosphere is dimly lit and is not too loud. Most people here are celebrating something special" anniversaries, birthday, special ocassions, etc. the waiters are also very friendly, smiling at all time, and easy to wave down for information regarding the menu. The view is also spectacular, and it rotates slowly enough that you can probably get two rotations before end of your dinner.  food: hands down wagyu beef is the best thing on the menu. It melts in your mouth and is extremely flavorful. I added grilled mushrooms to the entree and it only made it better.   I would highly recommend

JEc6D9czXpdX0TlQLD5hjA.text: An absolutely incredible dining experience! My family and I ate here pretty late after a show in the Stratosphere. The restaurant itself was fairly full and as far as I know had a long waiting list. If you eat here, I would highly recommend making a reservation a day in advance as well as making a reservation for the evening after the sun has set as the nighttime views of The Strip are fantastic. Food service was a bit slow, but the quality of our food was well worth it. Definitely one of the best meals I have ever had in a revolving restaurant and in general. Our server was phenomenal. Even though a lounge is located right above, the restaurant was also surprisingly quiet. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who is visiting Las Vegas!

FrwMeSoNZcMRI7NA7p_DZg.text: Breathtaking views and a great fine dining experience!  I've been here twice...   The first time my husband and I had the five course meal. Each time a little something something came to our table to eat, it was paired with a glass of wine! I was in drink heaven. The food was excellent, from the salad to the filet mignon to the desert. I might be biased, but the desert was my favorite part.... my now husband had an engagement ring waiting for me in one of the desert cakes and he proposed! It was magical! Turns out he pre-planned the occasion with the engagement special, and the wait staff was 'in on it'. A photographer took pictures (it was apart of the engagement special) and now I have the memories forever.   The second time I went was with a girlfriend for happy hour. Buy one get one drinks! Yes! The drink was really refreshing (can't remember the name... cucumber something or other). I'm glad we caught Happy hour because drink prices on regular menu seemed steep (19$-22$). Even though it was really crowded, we still found a place to sit and had excellent service.   Check this place out! The views alone are worth the cost of a drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8BeqhG5r1durrPRyehZTPA.text: So....you want a steak? And you're thinking to yourself," I'm in Vegas and I need to get myself a fine dining experience, with a killer view of the city and enjoy a beautiful moment in the madness of Vegas night life." Well fellow readers, this is your spot.  Now, let me be clear, there are some pretty amazing steak houses in Vegas. You got Cut, Maesto's and other spots. They are all pricey and bring a certain charm to your world. So be prepared for a dinner for two costing (without good wine) $350. That's a pretty good sum for a great experience.  The Resteraunt is located in top of the Stratosphere. This casino is all honesty is a dump. It's the borderland between the strip and downtown. Broken dreams powered by pawn shops, short order wedding chapels and ya tattoo parlors lifter the surroundings. But you will avoid al that when you drive direct to the Tower itself. The hotel is a dump now because of low maintenance and the parking lot being filthy. Parking is free though which is nice given how other casinos now barge $12 for 24 hour parking.  So, go through the casino and catch the elevator going up to the Resteraunt. The elevators take forever. Be patient, that's how it is. You will encounter drunks and other orcs going in and out with their bottomless margaritas. It's ok...keep going.  Now, the resteraunt entry is easy. And when you get in, you will be seated on this amazing, tall ceiling space. The entire floor is like a lazy Susan and turns a full 360 while you sit and eat. Menu is pretty straightforward.  We ordered surf and turf filet mignon. Around $65 bucks a pop. Not bad. Steak can be prepared blue in the center for all you savage carnivores out there.  The desert iand the wine list is pretty good. Oh and the waiters are very personable and super chill. You won't be disappointed. Get the souffle, it is one of the best. Avoid the ice cream, it's just ok.  Anyhow, great steak and very beautiful view. Truly a joy for a night in Vegas. Oh and when you are done, go watch the sky divers jumping off the building....it's insane.

SL19VGKhiT_LC6duvpDooQ.text: Let's face it, dining in Las Vegas is expensive. The Strat is no exception, but prices on par with other fine dining on the strip and you're not just paying for the view: the food was excellent.
