I had the crab stuffed chicken, Brussels sprouts and twice baked potatoes. The wine list was well curated with reasonable options.  You really do get a lovely and intimate experience: dimly lit, quiet, with ample space so you don't feel as if you're dining with the strangers seated at the next table over :)

yU0R6v7OlMRjKpCyeM1poA.text: The restaurant was simply amazing, and an experience we won't forget. The food was wonderful, drinks were amazing and the service was superb. The view from the top of the Stratosphere is gorgeous, and the bungie jumpers were an added attraction. We enjoyed every moment of our experience.

zBsBftlDF2q-k5o34q_uTg.text: Sure, it might be the cliche thing to do while in Vegas, but I thought it was well worth it. The restaurant sits at about the top of the Stratosphere Tower, and it's a neat and beautiful view of Vegas and the Strip. The eating area slowly oscillates around the tower, providing for the all around view. We waited a very minimal additional time after our reservation to get an outer edge seat - worth it as well.  The food was great, prices are reasonable, and our service was great as well. I think the only major thing missing was the ambiance of the actual interior. It just seemed lackluster, dull, and a bit outdated. Nonetheless, I'd give it 4.5 stars, so I'll throw the extra half in there.  Also, we went to the Sky Lounge for happy hour first and were able to bring down much cheaper drinks for dinner. Definitely the suggested route...

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View during dinner at Top of the World
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View during dinner at Top of the World

GMDdKXWO_y_AlGE8rDwz7w.text: DO THE TASTING MENU.   We made a reservation and got seated with a great view. I don't think there's a bad seat though. We opted for the tasting menu and opted to upgrade the shrimp to lobster for an extra 10 bucks. well worth it.   We started with the lobster bisque (a little too much Brandy for my taste) and my cousin got the Caesar. I then got the scallop and she got the pork belly. We shared them. I liked the scallop (it's just one) much better. The filet and lobster were next and they were amazing. Lastly was the dessert, which I was too full to enjoy!   Get there early. The lines for the elevators are long and you have to go through a metal detector. But it's an amazing experience to do in the beginning of your trip to get the full view!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert on the tasting menu.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet and lobster!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallop!

xdSjSlw0niUI3imj6pvYZA.text: We went here around New Years. I really wasn't expecting much to be honest. I thought we'd be paying exorbitant prices just for the views and get poor food in return.   I was pleasantly surprised to find the food and the service were superb and the view was not surprisingly superb.  The lobster thermidor was enormous and delicious.   The worst part of the evening was getting to and leaving the restaurant. The stratosphere is a truly miserable place and it feels like a very long walk to and from dinner.

bOYeZkTcdgZQ3k9X2cZpug.text: This was a nice experience. Great restaurant. Make sure you get a seat on the outside so you can see the view while you eat and spin. You don't feel like your spinning out of control but you get the fest of it. The food was ok. Nothing to write home about. But definitely a good experience for you and the special someone.

gHRzaB_YABMEDDvK4rnMPw.text: For 4 stars, 75% goes to the food and 25% is for the view.  First, the experience was unique in that you dine at the top of the tallest building in Las Vegas.  The long ride in the elevator built up the anticipation.  We did need to wait for perhaps 10 minutes though we had our reservation.  Every table has a view of Las Vegas as the restaurant rotates 360 degrees.  The night view was romantic and spectacular.  We tried the prawn shrimp and crab cake appetizers.  They were excellent.  The lobster bisque tops the best I had and is a must try.  However, my New York steak was just average and a bit chewy.  The restaurant seemed to rotate faster than I thought.  You could feel the movement.  I guess it's ok as long as you don't feel dizzy.  The waiter told us that you don't feel as much movement facing the direction of the clockwise rotation.  My waiter's service was excellent and cordial.   You can see people doing bungee jump from the roof. Overall, I'd recommend it as it is a once in lifetime experience.  Price was reasonable, we spent about $65 per person considering the venue and the price you pay for food on the Strip.  BTW, I was told to be dressy but most people in the restaurants showed up with just casual clothing and even jeans and tennis shoes.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vsdm9pBHAZHYBkgztQ5Ewg.text: Exceptional is the best way to describe my experience here. Came here for dinner after seeing great reviews and also since I was staying at the stratosphere hotel. First recommendation I have is to get reservations, on the Friday that i went the wait averaged about 2.5-3 hours, so be prepared for that if you don't have a reservation.  We were promptly seated after arriving a couple minutes after our reservation time. The service was great, very friendly and attentive hostess, waiter and manager who came around and asked about our stay and experience so far which is always a plus.  The obvious thing that makes this place so great is the views, it was a clear night and you could see for miles, the strip was gorgeous, it was breathtaking to say the least. Whoever thought of the revolving floor concept is a genius because it is the perfect speed to allow you to see all sides of vegas without giving you any motion-sickness.  We decided to start with the crab cake for our appetizer, it was great, very meaty and the consistency was better than most I have had. The slaw it came with also complimented it nicely.  For my entree I got the 10oz center cut steak with a side of mashed potatoes. Perfect steak, marble fat which just melted in your mouth and the steak was made to a perfect medium, literally would dissolve in your mouth and leave you with such good flavor. I was very impressed with the quality of the food and the experience as a whole. The price is so worth it, you won't forget this dining experience, it's a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 10oz center cut steak

rxpzSahpX3sTty37a7xduQ.text: Probably the worst steakhouse in Vegas. For the environment it tries to exude the food quality as well as the service are barely subpar. I attended lunch at this restaurant with two other people. My steak was okay, I had the filet. Not cooked to my specifications but it wasn't a big deal. My mother had the prime rib sandwich and the cut was so bad she didn't take one bite for the fact she couldn't cut or bite the steak whatsoever. But the most frustrating part was our server. Not once did "Armida M.", according to the receipt, ask us if we needed anything or how anything tasted. Not the kind of service or lack thereof you should get when you are spending that kind of money. I also think good servers should acknowledge that a dish was untouched and question if the guest would like another dish or remove it from the bill. Although the views are incredible. This restaurant is not the best you will find in Vegas especially when it comes to quality control and the customer service.

1LfGsUFQ2FsWnGEvKmcuhg.text: Best view in Las Vegas, Nevada. Always fun. Bartenders terrific. Such a great view of the entire valley. Really great place to bring people.

opQpVy6Ib6Kw2l5IxoHdsw.text: If you are ever in Las Vegas, please have lunch or dinner at this amazing restaurant, Top of the World @ The Stratosphere Hotel. The drinks are delicious, the food is absolutely amazing, and so fresh. Get ready to be in awe of the beautiful views you see while dining. The staff were are all so pleasant, and helpful with selecting menu choices. This had to be one of THE best visits I've had in Las Vegas. I hope to visit again next year, and this restaurant will definitely be on my list of things to do, again .

Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t5jSnD7XA6nNp9lAN6ZqrA.text: My grilled cheese was not okay. $25 for a grilled cheese and it better be good. It wasn't. The cheese wasn't even fully melted. It was at the rubbery, about to melt stage, but didn't quite make it. All the staff was great except for our waitress. I think she got kind of miffed that we asked for a kids menu for my 15 year old niece who didn't see anything she liked on the lunch menu. We didn't get the kids menu any way because she told us in a rather bitchy tone that it's policy that you must be 12 and under. Fine. So I ask for a dessert menu for my niece. Waitress acted shocked. For lunch!? Jesus lady just give me the damn menu. I've been here before and I am not coming back anymore.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meh

2Jx8ZbuKXIhcD4_H76nJRw.text: This restaurant is known for its stunning views of Las Vegas, but it's much more.  The food is delicious and the service is excellent. Even in the busy bar we were served quickly and with great customer service.

2d_R1_CgUgew12nA--EQIw.text: Very good food, but the hot soup was not hot. The filet was extremely rare and also cold. Waitress was nice. MNG. was accommodating. It was my daughter's birthday. They gave her a complimentary desert that was incredibly good as well. Bloody Mary was not good. But we'll be back for the appetizers, happy hour, and deserts.

e07v-E_W4F787Oh8O6D1oQ.text: KEVIN is the worse servant I've ever had in my life.   We were there, a party of 5, for my friend birthday.   Our waiter Kevin, was so rude and so slow.   He rushed us to order and talk fast.  He has never smiled to us and didn't say anything nice! It took us about 45 minutes to get our food and everything was cold! Chicken, steak, salmon... It was all so cold! And on top of this, I asked for a Medium steak and got a well done!!  Only after complaining to the manager, we got new food and Kevin has changed attitude.    The view is amazing and everything there is as expensive as we thought it was gonna be.    This place can be nice but they need better ppl to work there..

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aZA73HIGG7-zbyTChIUvgw.text: We decided to have dinner here mostly for the view. The view is absolutely amazing at night!  The food was decent, but forgettable. I ordered the seared sea bream.   Maybe next time I'd just take the elevator to the "observatory" or whatever it's called to see the view.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea bream

u3tbut9Y03hYtNCMi1zN_g.text: A bit late on the review but this place was exceptional. The view alone is worth going. We were there at night and the spinning top with the circular view of the Vegas night lights is amazing. Gorgeous place for a date or romantic dinner. The service was great and the food was very good. Steak and appetizers were good and went well with the red wine. We honestly didn't want to leave and hubby had a coffee and I got another wine after dinner just to stay there as we were chatting cause it was so pleasant and gorgeous there and the waitress was great. Definitely the best part of the stratosphere all together hands down. Even if you're not staying at the hotel, i would strongly recommend visiting the top of the world for dinner.

4KTRx-tjvQ6zX7BG_C88MQ.text: Decided to celebrate our anniversary here as we had heard great things. If we had to describe our experience in one word, it would be "overrated". Our server, Tom, did his best and the view obviously speaks for itself, but the food was so bland and lacking in flavor, it is hard to justify the $400 we spent. Disappointing.

hWi61TbyXh_p9NwZvIqgrw.text: The view is absolutely amazing! And so is the fact that you can see bungee jumpers during your meal. The only issue with this place is your meal! The food is not great! And it's pretty pricey. The average meal is $50 to $60 without sides.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view

9AD0Fu9-wO6u6sc6tHMtkA.text: I thought this place was a beauty and made me realize how beautiful Vegas is. You obviously pay for the view too food was good the Cesar salad was very good and huge. I got the prime New York steak  with peppercorn sauce it was like any other steak but let me tell you the mashed potatoes and baked potatoes was my favorite part haha they were delicious! The service was a great by Anthony.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread and butter

x0l0ikA5Clno7NGFlTFMOQ.text: Just had a wonderful time and fabulous dinner celebrating my niece's birthday. Joshua was our waiter and was marvelous. Thank you

wYpQxw6BeCwTaUvGQHY32g.text: What a view!  Not only is the food great, but honestly the view is worth its weight in gold!  We had 4:00pm reservations for our first night in Las Vegas and while it wasn't busy, its better to be safe than sorry.  Yes, it is a little early for dinner but this was a great time as we were able to enjoy the beautiful sunset and watch the city go from day to night.  Be sure to ask for a window seat!    The waitress, Dalia, was very nice and attentive.  We were served a bountiful bread basket with 3 different infused butter options - highly recommend the honey ginger one!  We both ordered filets (no soups or salads - saving room for our anticipated meal!)  We were told that the sides are bigger but not really "shareable" so we ordered our own - I got the butternut risotto and my husband ordered the baked potato.  FYI - these are definitely shareable!  Everything was delicious and prepared well -although the presentation was a little lacking (steak on the plate with 2 cooked carrots).   They have a photographer who goes around and will take photos of you - of course they charge for the photos but this a great chance to get some really nice mementos of a great date night!  After dinner, be sure to go to the observation deck and take a look around!  Again, what a view!

reFmZwHUbHmMThO5bz7xNw.text: We had the best waiter he was so awesome his name was Joey very very polite and knew about everything on the menu explained all the steaks to us just couldn't ask for better service very happy would definitely come again

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Such an amazing place to eat very romantic my husband just treated me like a queen

1_wVSaUxJit_ufGXOYyR8Q.text: Called ahead to make reservations several days prior, as I wanted to surprise my girlfriend by bringing her here for or anniversary. I specifically requested a table on the outer rim, and was told that she could put the request into the reservation, but she couldn't guarantee that we wouldn't have to wait once we got there- which was no problem, just so long as they set us up when we got there.   Called again 30 minutes prior to the reservation time just to make sure my request had been put it in, and was assured that it had been.   Once we got there of course they tried to seat us and when I asked about the outer rim table that I had specifically requested, she said she didn't see anything and it would be a 20 minute wait. Again, not sure why I was assured twice that it was taken care of when it wasn't, but okay.  The service after that continued the trend of being subpar- (it was a slow Wednesday night and the restaurant was not very busy). After ordering our soup and salad, we were told our bread was on the way, which showed up 15 minutes later (after we had finished our first course). We then proceeded to wait a full hour for our main course, at which point our server didn't check in on us ONCE. No drink refills, no asking if we needed anything or wanted more bread, no update on when our food was coming out, nothing.   We finally received our meals (the food was decent, but nothing to rave about) and we waited another 30 minutes after we finished to be asked about dessert or a check. I understand that individual results may vary depending on who you get as a server, but for being a top rated restaurant in Las Vegas, I was extremely disappointed at the customer service and overall attention to customers. It was like they didn't even care we were eating there, so long as we paid our bill at the end of the night.

WTYGd_mQXXantN7drlQRQQ.text: Always have been a little hesitant about this place because I thought it was more of a novelty location and I should have stuck with my instincts. The bar is a great location as is the view but after that there isn't much to talk about. The oyster on half shell had in the bathroom 20minutes later. The steak was poor quality actually shredded like roast beef. Plus the view is only good actually for the 10 minutes it rotates by the strip after that you have to realize the rest of the valley is pretty dim and not much to look at. Simply said you pay for a ten minute view and not the food or service.

4-2giycVZ9m2T_QlQfIT0g.text: Food was delicious, service was amazing, and the view could not be beat! I would go back to Vegas just to have another dining experience here!

jd-AxYI0BkJEYdc_BZ8wSA.text: For a long time, I've held a negative image of the Stratosphere. I've never stayed there, but many years ago I visited the casino and wrote it off. However, my image has changed after dining in the Top of the World Restaurant last September.  Arrive early, as it's a long walk through the hotel and to the elevators that take you to the top. You also must go through a security check point that took about ten minutes.   The views are breathtaking. Really, one of the best views on the strip.   The service is top notch. Everyone on staff was warm, welcoming and more than competent. Along with the view, they are the superstars of the restaurant.  Do not order the tasting menu, unless you are on the competitive eating circuit. The portions are mammoth. If you do decide to try it, as it is a great deal, make sure to eat about 1/3 of each course, so that you will have enough room to taste them all. The food is excellent and I nearly cried when I felt ill during my steak from too much food. I couldn't even take the smallest bite of dessert because I was so stuffed. Our server told us that the tasting menu has grown in size over the years and people rarely are able to eat it all. You've been warned!  It's a little cheesy, but also exciting to occasionally see people bungee jumping off the side of the building. It's so unexpected, that they have warning signs on the walls. They will also send around a photographer, which again is cheesy, but we got such a great photograph out of it, that we bought it.  I'm glad to have had this dining experience. It's well worth the money.

laZcgufi2pTMncqFzaXyBw.text: My boyfriend and I came here last week, of course we would want such an experience! The service was very good but the food was worth less than a quarter of the cost. I am from Maine and ordered the seafood Alfredo, I wouldn't have paid $5 for that meal, the lobster was like rubber and VERY fishy, and even worse the next day (Alfredo always tends to be the best the day after). My boyfriend had a decent meal but we shared a side of "roasted vegetables" which tasted and looked like someone just took them out of a freezer bag and nuked them. We both also got VERY motion sick. The motion of the spinning is very apparent and the outside walls stay in place and can be very disorienting. We asked for our food to go because we just couldn't take it anymore. They don't even have to try with the food and can charge a ridiculous amount of money for a mediocre meal because of their location. If you're in Vegas eat somewhere else, and go have a drink at the observatory. Worst $200 I've ever spent.

AznRIwphMyM-CDrwGZ_U1A.text: Best part about this restaurant is the view. Great service but the food was average for the price. They are trying hard to be really fancy but falling just below.

BExH-0-Op4v3NZZMi14k9Q.text: I went to Top of the World Restaurant over the weekend.  First, the restaurant is on the 106th floor of the Stratosphere, so if you are afraid of heights...navigate to a new restaurant.  The view is undeniably gorgeous.  I had a romantic dinner overlooking all of Las Vegas.  We were sat near the outer edge so that we can see everything.  They even have jumpers off of the building.  Sadly, that didn't happen because there was lightning.  Understood.  There is not too much to choose from on the menu and is rather pricey.  All the entrees are just that.  The entree.  I got the 14oz. New York steak with Brandy peppercorn sauce.  Pretty large steak!  If you want sides, you have to pony up about $10.  The wait staff was impeccable.  They always made sure our drinks were filled (could only afford free water at this point) and that everything tasted good--which the food did.  You do have to spend a minimum of $50 per person, so if you order the chicken which is $46, you will have to order additional items (extra sauce is $2, so get two sauces!).  Overall a good experience.  Breathtaking view!

2Y5B_WlAE08n3M-3BVIVIQ.text: What a great location for dinner! The views were amazing and good was even better. I always stay in Vegas and must say some of the best service I've had in years! So happy and full. Will return soon!

2c0V4hmxdQtH5EjY8U6nAg.text: Poor service, average ambiance, decent food and good view. I think this restaurant needs overhaul.

RYAcX90tKIfC26-osvmOGg.text: Delicious food at a great price from an awesome server and with a lovely view!

jO2qk_YsknnEsGNEanW4pA.text: All atmosphere and little else...To begin, our waiter took far too long to come back to the table and take our order after our menus were closed and on the table.  I ordered the filet mignon, medium rare and the mushroom side.  My filet came out between medium and medium well.  My date's sea bass was good, but certainly nothing exceptional.  When the waiter finally came back to check on our food...WAY too long after serving...I informed that my filet was overcooked and would like another.  He took the plate away, but did not offer to take my date's away or the mushrooms and bring out together.  My date had eaten about 95% of her sea bass when my steak arrived.  I had eaten the mushrooms while waiting, (lukewarm)...and then proceeded to cut my filet to find that it still wasn't a PERFECT medium rare.  I ate it anyway, (lukewarm sauce)...and tried to make the best of an evening.  We also ordered 2 glasses of wine and while I am guessing that a 6 ounce pour is the goal...my Cab was probably closer to 5 ounces.  There was no recognition from the staff or management that I was paying $250 for a meal where we each ate while the other watched.  No offer to buy a dessert...(we ordered the cheesecake...rather dry)...and called it a day.  Awful, awful, awful and worst of all is that no member of management or ownership even offered an apology.  I understand that this place caters to tourists and losing me will not ruin their business, but my date was a local and assuredly will spread the negative word.  Go for the view and order a 5 ounce glass of wine, then leave...not a restaurant that is worth spending $250.  There is better food and service at virtually any other reputable restaurant in Las Vegas.

jz1ax6Ju7O9y08YQjeO_2A.text: So I took my wife for our anniversary and I was pleasantly surprised. The service was among the best I have ever had and the overall experience was a great one.    The food is definitely overpriced and is decent but not great. The view of the Vegas city from above kind of makes up for that. This is a really romantic place especially if you go later in the evening during sunset time. I would recommend this place mainly because of the atmosphere, great service, and the view but not because of the food.

dz-eHvwhQgZuTOuhbXH-Zg.text: The steak is great, the view is beautiful. Very nice experience. Unfortunately we didn't get a window seat as we requested but it does state on their website that you may not get the seat you requested. It did take a long time for our server to come to us. Also you get to go up to the top and see the view from the outdoor deck area. Don't forget to visit the air bar on your way up. They have great drink specials before 9 pm. The bartender is wonderful.

0v-wvqPyf9KyRqZsSLPGqQ.text: The Stratosphere is in a not-so-nice area of Vegas so getting there is sort of a downer. Once you arrive and take the elevator up, the restaurant decor is dated - but that was sort of the fun of it - everything in Vegas is tacky so we just went with it. The waiter was awesome - very attentive and accommodating to our large party. The food was super rich and a bit pricey but again, this is what you expect in Vegas so I was fine with it.The views are amazing and we were there long enough to go around a little more than one time and could see it in the light and after sunset so we have a lot of neat pictures. One warning that I didn't come across before going - if anyone in your group has motion sickness, make sure they take something or choose a different restaurant. There were two people in our group of 15 who had issues with the movement.

KqCjfh63-zIWZmN_Tg1bLw.text: The view here is amazing. It is probably one of the nicest views I have ever seen in Las Vegas. The restaurant itself rotates once every hour and has amazing views of every part of Las Vegas from downtown to the strip. The food on the other hand is nothing special. Overpriced for the quality and portion size. But the atmosphere makes up for it. Definitely worth the price of admission. Which in this case is under quality food at high quality prices. So I base my rating on my overall experience which was great because the view and atmosphere.

tnzifapfUM2y9VfwlHP7Xw.text: Despite its location (away from the main strip and in a scary looking casino), this is one of our favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. Twelve years ago my husband and I had our dinner reception here on our wedding day, and a year later my best friend and her husband did the same. Since then, Vegas has changed a lot, but the view and food at Top of the World remains as good as the first time.   The menu has a good variety, the wine list is extensive (they also have a very long list of scotch). The food is great, the service is attentive, and the view is among the best you can get in Vegas.  Over the years we have bought many friends here, and I would still go back in a heart beat!  Come here for dinner instead of lunch. Make an early dinner reservation so you get to see Vegas at sunset and at night. There is no better place to spend three hours for a relaxing, enjoyable and delightful dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter comes in the shape of their tower.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster!
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and Quack -- a combo of beef, duck, and fois gras.

3VvT0IJyHjLRB6x5wPi3Vw.text: This is a lousy restaurant in a horrible, dirty hole in the wall hotel!  The view was nice but that was all.  The food was overpriced and wasn't even tasty.  The waiter was nice. I didn't realize the hotel/restaurant was down on skid row of Vegas.  Would NEVER go back and wouldn't recommend this to anyone!!!

_QszE9lYUIEnfPBoNritaw.text: My review is for my visit on 02/22/2014. We had reservations for a party of 12 on Saturday at 8pm. When we got there, the view was spectacular but that's the only positive thing I can say about my visit. The food was terrible! I got the "Surf and Turf Gnochi with Lobster and Braised Beef Short Rib" and was promptly disappointed with my meal. The pasta flavor was extra "fishy" and was really not a good combination to have the beef short rib added. Whoever thought this was a good way to combine the meal, needs to rethink their taste buds...Seriously.   What was even more disappointing was my husband's meal. He wanted to stay away from seafood and stick to pasta and chicken, so the waiter said that he could do the "Fettuccine Seafood Alfredo with Lobster, Prawns & Scallops" from the menu, no seafood, and replace with chicken. Both my sister-in-law and my husband ordered the waiter's suggestion. When my husband and sister-in-law got his meal, however, it was as if the chef removed the scallops and slapped some chicken on top of it. The meal was fishy, exactly what we were trying to avoid. When we spoke with the waiter about the matter, he said that there was no way the meal had any seafood. What?! The waiter made both my sister-in-law and husband look like liars; very embarrassing in front of our large group of friends. And to top it all off, the waiter did not even bother calling his manager for assistance or replacing the meal with something else. So practically, we were stuck paying for a meal that we did not eat. And you call this fine dining? I don't think so!  And finally, the entire group and I were pretty upset when we noticed that directly across from us was a table with a group as big as ours receiving totally different service than we were just because there was some type of minor league baseball player in their group. The manager was showing them their different champagnes, catering to their every need. How is that fair? Shouldn't all the customers receive the same service?   In conclusion, I would only recommend this place for their view, but definitely not for a nice dining experience!

ElLXNABo5CJEdZY4HBPZ2A.text: Best romantic dinner view.No question. Food fancy pricey and good! An experience to say the least rotating floor takes 80 minutes to go around best time to go at sunset.

myVkuKUDrudf4MAyNemNNw.text: The family and I had the worst experience ever. I was there on 3/26/2014. The rooms are not as clean, and customer service is rude. The valet parking sucks they have you waiting for 1/2 an hour. The food was horrible. NEVER EVER GOING BACK! The only reason I reserved this hotel was for my kids to go on the rides. Also, because my friend told me it was good for the price! Yah rite!

yH4kQI1nUfSLCy-7b_BkoQ.text: Spent thanksgiving here, couldn't have chosen a better restaurant!  Stunning view, boys 8/11 yrs old loved it.  My son said it was best filet mignon he'd ever had.  My wedge salad was excellent.  The waiter was even so kind as to offer an inexpensive option to my 8 year old who isn't a steak lover.  He offered plain noodles!  My son was thrilled!!!!

bVmnrjMr1SPVwCS7wxgD3w.text: Back in '03 or '04, I had took the opportunity to eat at the tallest structure in Las Vegas and I didn't regret it. The food was fantastic. I still remember it till this very day.   We had gone at night and it was just very beautiful evening to be sitting 1000 feet or so in the air, eating dinner, and having the entire restaurant rotate around Las Vegas. The view was just spectacular.   You know dinner was a little expensive, but it was worth every dime. If you have never been there before, not only is the restaurant located around 1000 feet in the air, but there is an entire amusement park of sorts above the restaurant. Yes, that shocked me to when I found out.  As a matter of fact, while I was eating I kept hearing this faint noise from time to time and eventually asked the server what sound was and that is how I found out.   I don't know how much things have changed since then, but I had a great a experience back then and it is worth going back if I go back to Vegas again.

Jzu6QqmpC0DfZy9ybdhxbg.text: Yeah, like most people have already said, don't eat here. The food was just dreadful. When I handed over my credit card to pay for the meal, I had to keep muttering to myself "it's for the gorgeous view... it really is for the gorgeous view". Anyway, come here for the view (and drinks, perhaps)!

g574OiqdYFXTC19uDYe4vw.text: The food at most restaurants with views rarely live up to the expectations of the oohs and aahs of the sights.  Often the food is treated as a passing thought,  but not here.  This place really delivered and it was more enjoyable because it rotates and bungee jumpers leap right in front of you.  It may sound cheesy but some how they pull it off with some sophistication.

n7IDQrot4L_jCWphZJvIqQ.text: Worst experience ever! Decided to take my family here for our Thanksgiving dinner. Had a reservation for 9 people, which was made months in advance. Got there on time for our 7:30 reservation and was given a pager and asked to wait in the upper lounge, not once in the 40 minutes we waited did a waitress ever come by to offer us drinks. After 45 minutes the pager we were given went off and we went back down to be seated. I was greeted by 4 hostesses who took the pager and then asked my family to move out of the way as they were not ready for us. After making sure they understood we had been waiting over 45 minutes for a reservation we were finally seated. The manager at that time decided to finally acknowledge the absurdity of the situation and offered us a free bottle of wine. We then ordered, which most of us got the Thanksgiving special which should have been a very quick turn around for them. It was not, and 2 hours after our reservation we still had not been served our entrees. In that time our waiter avoided our table, and did not refill our water glasses at any point. Needless to say we decided at that point to leave. I figured they would at least comp the one bottle of wine ordered as my family's entire evening had been ruined, but no they handed me the check for it. So we ended our evening going to a crummy dinner and having burgers for our Thanksgiving meal. The whole experience was beyond disappointing as my family and I came from all over the globe to meet and have a nice dinner and instead ended up just trying to find a place that we could sit at a table together. The view might be nice, but everything else was a nightmare experience and I would not recommend this place to anyone. For a restaurant that runs $100 per person, you would never expect to have this type of experience.

CDfIfS1CzRZMf_Ji4qn2gQ.text: So glad we chose to dine here! The view was, of course, amazing and food was delicious. The tenderloin was so tender and perfectly cooked. The sides come in huge portions are are definitely big enough to share. We had two different potato dishes and neither of us finished half of either. I will say the walk to/from the monorail stop to the Stratosphere was interesting. The walk itself isn't too bad (maybe 10 minutes) but it doesn't seem to be the best area. Its nothing I would have wanted to walk alone!

dO0otmfOr8TnbwonF8-CLw.text: Spectacular view of the strip while you eat! Food is just ok....but the ambiance is what you really pay for.

o8g9ITAnmMyoWt2MOb9h6w.text: A wonderful experience. The food was delicious and we had a window table; the view was incredible. We even saw people bungee jumping off the building! This restaurant is very pricey for dinner but restaurant dot com offers coupons that help. For a special occasion, the price is definitely worth it. The view is breathtaking and you get a complete view of Las Vegas because the restaurant slowly turns on a full rotation.

lUCZ1Aq7zCu5MyPj5kfSDQ.text: A bit pricey but we did not mind paying for the view, the experience, and the gourmet lunch. This place is a necessary stop for Vegas visitors. Dress decent for lunch, and business casual for dinner. Great place!

R0dWLHj9RdnGtNtLy70nmg.text: Server not up to par, as he couldn't answer questions on items in the menu. The steak I ordered was good, but soup was luke warm, and my wife's fish plate was too salty.  I expect better for their price point.  The view of LV is great though.  Will I go back for the food?  Probably not.  But I may go back to the lounge on another floor for a drink and the view.

_U5dhFmAx2npk79Iuyedsw.text: My wife and I celebrated our wedding anniversary with a romantic dinner at this restaurant. I was skeptical because the Stratosphere is one of the older hotels on the strip and I didn't believe that they had a restaurant as nice as this. I was blown away by the ambience, the magnificent views and the awesome service. The lobster bisque is the best that I have ever had and the crab cakes and filet mignon were just as delicious. If you are as skeptical ad I was then I hope this review changes your mind. I am looking forward to dining there when I return to Vegas.

zNQEXyly0m0uWhgg6nSZ1A.text: Was out there with some friends and they wanted to try this restaurant.  It is pretty good.  The service was a little above average.  It took forever to get there though as it seemed you had to go through a maze before you got there.  Side dishes are ordered to share.  We had ordered potatoes and I guess I was expecting something else but ended up not eating it.  I was a little surprised that the waiter saw we didn't eat the food and didn't even ask what was wrong with it.  Just took the dish away.  The steak was pretty good although not the best I have ever had.  Our server was nice and attentive, although for a 'high end' restaurant, some things could be a bit more polished.  It was cool to see the city from up there.  If you want quiet, this is not the place.  You did see the people jumping off the building as you went around though.  Although it wasn't spectacular, I would try this place at least once.  Not sure I would go back though when in Vegas.

KHbsMq_sPFeutErbis1WBA.text: This used to be my favorite restaurant in Vegas. I just went back after nearly two years and it was horrible. They changed the menu and the food isn't what it used to be. The old saying goes...if it isn't broke, don't fix it! They were trying to change with the times is what the waiter told me...Trust me....I wont be going back...not even for the top of las vegas experience. For $300 for two people....no way.

o-idt93LWlp2PKk1Dw5r5A.text: The experience is well worth the expense.  The food is excellent, and the view of Las Vegas is spectacular.  This was our second visit and would have rated it a 5, except we believe the restaurant can do better with more amiable servers and a little remodeling in order to exploit the amazing views and to keep up to par with all the fancy restaurants that are surfacing in Vegas.

lSot9LQkWhrMVJ-dFQuOTg.text: While living in Vegas for 6 years, I always recommend this place to visitors.  Yes-it's not at the best hotel (the hole in the wall Stratosphere)  and furthest away from the strip (North end), but for the price and atmosphere, it's great for any occasion or celebration.  I have taken my family, friends and planned a bachelorette dinner here.  Brunch prices are $9-$22 and dinner prices are $30-$50, drinks are $15.  The prices are reasonable and the quality food is excellent.  The restaurant revolves 360 degrees, if you get motion sickness, request to dine away from the window.  Great place to enjoy the city views, take pictures, and enjoy good food without breaking your bank.  Reservations are recommended.  We get a lot of wind/dust in Vegas, so make sure you go when it's not windy, the dust will just ruin the views.  Also with your reservations, you can go to the observatory deck and go outside (where the rides are) and take pictures.   If you don't want to pay the high dinner prices, go to brunch.   It will be under $30 per person.  I actually enjoy dinng here during the day as you can see more of the strip and the whole city of Las Vegas.  You can even see the people walking below you on the strip (they look like ants, hehe!)

JKhmLgHUStQdmXFjCHjyLA.text: This place looks like it used to be a great restaurant, but it's showing it's age.  The view was pretty cool and I'd have to say the spinning was novel, but it doesn't make up for the horrible food.  Oh and don't bother dressing up, I saw nothing but jeans and T-shirts.  I got the roast chicken and it was swimming in some funky sauce.  I didn't even bother to eat the salad because it smelled like feet.  Dessert was decent but it was the meal's only saving grace.        I was sitting at a four person table with two people and the wait staff knocked into me a couple of times.  You'd think they would have mastered walking in between the spinning part and non-spinning part of the place.  I was told one of the windows was shot out and they could not replace it.  (How ghetto is that?)  How did they get the windows in in the first place?  Can't put in another one, now the wind whips and rattles a black board stuffed up in there.  Kind of distracting when your trying to have a nice meal.        There are some people walking around taking pictures, don't do it.  It's a total rip-off.  Our pictures were blurry and made us look really shinny.  Some even had red eye.  One had a waiter in the back ground and I was told I could go home and just cut up the pictures.  Seventy eight bucks for two photos and two wallets is insane, especially when they suck.  If it wasn't my anniversary and my husband wanting them I probably would have told them to forget it.      Not coming back here.  The view is not worth it.  I'd go back to the Voodoo Lounge because they have a view too, and food you'd actually want to eat.

tRVeblCmtZTLb8CQ4OtweA.text: This is a great place. Unfortunately the food doesn't quite live up to the view. Still, I would recommend trying at least once to see for yourself.

gGhlMXZpqS9Qqrv8oRoWKg.text: Second time to restaurant.  First was very enjoyable with the best views Vegas has to offer.  This time, the views still incredible. Food, not so much. Ordered the rib eye, medium.  The steak was bland with no flavor.  Truly ate maybe three bites. Oddly, waiter never asked if any of us at our table enjoyed the meal or not.  Wasn't looking for anything other than a great meal. Would of thought some steak sauce or something to add to the steak would of been nice to suggest. Others at table agreed, bland food overall.  Still, views are enjoyable.  Just need help in kicking it up a little and adding a touch of care from the customer service point of view.  With that being said, I'll check it off of my list, noting the incredible views, and move on to the many other restaurants as I don't believe I'd return.

bZNtv0TW6n1O0j4BSec6CA.text: This restaurant is the go to for special occasions. Beautiful setting, amazing views, attentive service. Good food, spend hours there and don't feel rushed. I will always keep this place in my back pocket for a fool proof special celebration.

FhoMYNrRZMo0x_-bUovi6g.text: We made reservations wanting to see the view from up at the top of the stratosphere. We didn't expect great food-thought it would be more of a tourist trap kind of place.  Wow, were we surprised! First, the table we got was right on the window.  A spectacular place to get a 360 degree view of Vegas. Our waiter was extremely friendly, chatty and professional. He gave us a "tip" that our having dinner there gets us access up onto the obese action deck after dinner. We looked forward to that.  We both ordered the filet, my husband also got the shrimp scampi.  We subbed bearnaise sauce for the wine mushroom sauce, and that bearnaise sauce was to die for! Fantastic. While we ate, e room rotated so that by sunset we were facing the Vegas strip, and the lights were just starting to come on. Again, what a view! We got to see a couple of bungy jumpers leap off the platform too, which was startling. The dessert offerings were varied, and I settled on the "white chocolate lemon cheesecake". The portion size was way too big, and while I'm a big fan of lemon, there wasn't enough lemon flavor in it for my taste. It was just ok.  The rest of the meal was great, and the service very professional.

Q6sGl9e8VXHA2pBs_-ukcA.text: I loove this place...beautiful view the staff is friendly and the food is delicious...i usually have the petit felit with lobster tail which is part of the premier tasting menu...this is a filling 3 course meal...dessert is three mini desserts on a long plate...raspberry mousse chocolate cake and banana pudding bread...i would highly recommend this place for dinner for the awesome night view...This place is becoming my new Vegas tradition :)

WlctmFbM2w_qiqJqmD3MqA.text: The food is great and the place has an amazing view but the customer service is horrible! I went for my birthday and not once the server say anything, even though front desk knew about this. really disappointing

MUb3quz-722CI4jRt31_Mw.text: We came here for dinner but left before sunset so we missed out on the Vegas "city lights" view.  It was still incredible being up on the 106th floor and seeing all of Vegas while enjoying our fabulous dinner.  The Pan Seared Chilean Sea Bass, the Lamb Chops, the steaks (of course), the Grilled Asparagus, and the Lobster Macaroni were all top notch!  The decadent 21-Layer Chocolate Cake and the mango sorbet were incredible.  We were very happy with the service as well!  Glad we picked Top of the World at the Stratosphere to celebrate a special occasion.

OgTsSa8YhA2ahHZFYUl5Qg.text: My boyfriend had a fillet minon and it was AMAZING. I stole a bite because it smelled so good. I had lobster bisque which was equally as good. They server was attentive to us and patient at the same time. I loved that there was a photographer there as well! You get to take pictures in front of the windows where the view of all Vegas is. It was wonderful, and deserts aren't too high priced! The only thing I didn't necessarily like is that it was hard to locate. We walked up and down the stratosphere looking for this restaurant but once someone pointed us in the right direction all was fine. Thanks for an amazing experience!

jtaEwAdvSThfp4dxvl5oIA.text: Wonderful food and dining experience! The restaurant slowly rotates and you get a great view of every angle of the city all while enjoying your meal. Friendly waitstaff. Be sure to make reservations, and when doing so make sure to request a table close to the window for a great view! When my fiance and I were there, they offered for all people dining, a free pass to go to the top deck for a view. I was wonderful! It was a perfect dining experience on our last night in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 different types of butter

rf18zzNkavpQCU0KhigEkA.text: The food here was simply amazing, the flavors were on point and the view was worth skydiving for ;). My friends I came here with some friends. I started my journey off with the lobster bisque soup which was amazing, then I ordered some foie Gras which was also very delicious the flavors on both these items were simply amazing. For the entree I got the lamb chops which was simply a AHHHHMAZING. The flavors and worked harmoniously with the lamb meat, it was simply amazing with every bite. If the meat is done so well with flavors then you over look the price as then it was totally worth it. I will definitely recommend this restaurant as it was an amazing experience. Oh and the creme burlee was also very good.

r4ecfnT8l5_Iw2xw2rg59g.text: The food was good, however there are definitely better options on the strip.  Our server Dennis  - Didn't take our order, so another server did - After that he didn't even come over to apologize or anything  - Didn't bother asking us if we needed more water until AFTER we were done  - Didn't make any sort of small talk    Overall it seemed like he hated his job, and the lady that bussed our table just threw our plates in a basket in front of us.  For such a elevated restaurant the service was absolute garbage.  STAY AWAY, I could have had a WAY better experience for my birthday.

ws0sa3K_9DHweU16bA452Q.text: There's really no point of a reservation with this place. We had a reservation for 6:45 and showed up half an hour early at 6:15. We were instructed to wait at the bar for half an hour until our reservation. I approached the front desk at 6:45 again and they told me at least 15 more minutes, so we waited and waited, yet we did not get seated until 7:15. The hostess at the stand was also rude when I checked in with her at 6:45 and refused to talk to us when bringing us to our seats. It's usually not a big deal for us to wait but we didn't eat dinner comfortably because we had a 9:00 Vegas show and felt rushed since we were seated so late. We also spoke to some other folks while waiting: one man had a reservation at 6:30 and was told to wait an extra 45 minutes. Overall, this place has a terrible reservation system and does not accommodate their guest's schedules as long as you spend your money there. However, while spending time waiting at the bar, we could see many tables open..  The food was good, we just didn't enjoy it as much as we did because of the time constraint. For a four course meal that had to be scarfed down since we were seated so late, we just didn't find the value in paying so much for it. However, our server was phenomenal and so was the photographer.  My recommendation is that if you want to take advantage of the full dining experience at this place, just make sure you don't have any other set plans at night.  Two stars for the food, service, and view.

1Cp5S3ozmdvnJL4txGqrWw.text: I ate here once as a tourist and it was on my to do list for a number of years.  I was seated promptly and my server, Mirella, came by to ask for drink order and questions about the menu.  I ordered the chef's tasting menu with the following choices:  lobster bisque, Kurobuta pork belly, filet mignon and shrimp scampi, and a chocolate duo for dessert.  I was soon brought a small bread basket--two rolls and a piece of lavash along with three butter florets, one sweet, one pesto flavored, and the third was ginger peach.  The best was the pesto but it's best to let the butter come closer to room temperature to get the most of the flavors.  I'm glad they downsized the bread basket for one person.  It's smarter than bringing a regular basket and a lot of it goes back.  The lobster bisque was a win.  There was a fair amount of lobster and the broth was good.  The pork belly was a let down.  The menu says that it has root vegetables, farro, quinoa, chimichurri, Chinese five spice.  All these ingredients tended to overpower the pork belly, not enhance it.  The filet was cooked blue as I ordered.  It and two shrimp scampi were served on a  bed of mashed potatoes along with some green beans.  The steak had a red wine reduction and I'd say this was the best part of the meal.  There is no choice for dessert--it's a chocolate duo consisting of two chocolate dishes.  One is a dark chocolate pot de creme--very rich and very good.  The other was a white chocolate shaped cup holding some fresh berries and vanilla mousseline.  Service was excellent during the meal.  Mirella brought me a fresh glass of iced tea before I asked for a refill and she was there to refill my coffee with dessert.  The view is great.  I found myself less concentrated on looking at Las Vegas Boulevard and the Strip hotels and more of the neighborhoods.  The tourists were all taking photos of the Strip.  The meal was A-OK but you're paying Strip prices plus an extra for the view.  The bonus is you have access to the rooftop observation deck after dinner.  If you subtract the $12 cost of just going up the tower for the view, the price is a bit better.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sign on wall near the area where the jumpers fly by.  One went by while the restaurant was in this area.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eventually the kitchen pick up area comes into view as the restaurant rotates.
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White chocolate cup with fresh berries on the left and dark chocolate pot de crème on the right.

kKG-TI8VKxdCU211aSuzSw.text: Only only gets 3 stars for its view!   Also FYI, this is a moving restaurant, it's subtle but the platform still moves.  Let's start with the process on getting up to top of the world. First you have to go through a metal detector, something they started since 9/11. Then you get to the host stand, no place to stand to wait for your table. If there are tons of people waiting for their table or the elevators which there were, you feel like a sardine.   Service was only par. For being a $$$$ restaurant you would expect immaculate service.   I would say the same for food. My husband and I always share meals so we started with a wedge salad which is is favorite not mine. Presentation of the salad (picture added) was pretty but the dressing was not good and there was barely any toppings. I think they counted out the pieces of bacon they put on their salad, there was 5.   Portobello mushrooms app was not good either. It seemed as though the mushrooms and tomatoes should have been warm but they were in between temperatures so it was strange. Didn't know if it should be cold or hot app.  The filet comes with a red wine reduction on top and we opted to have that removed. Probably a bad item because the meat was dry and a bit tough. Something a filet medium rare should not be.  Yukon potatoes were creamy and I will say our dessert (picture added) was delicious. Mixing creme brulee and cheesecake together was yummy.   I would recommend tourist or first timers here for the experience and view. Try something else besides steaks.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portobello mushroom app
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedge salad
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée creesecake

7rg7btQb5nRaZDGuUY3aBA.text: Top of the World is a MUST when you're in Vegas.  Hands-down the best date night experience I've ever had from start to finish.  I booked my reservation through Open Table about two months and made sure I requested for a table next to the windows.  The day of our reservation, I changed our reservation time twice..so I was a bit worried that I was going to lose out on the table I requested for but thank goodness I didn't! Upon arrival to the restaurant, we were seated immediately by the hostess, and the view is absolutely breathtaking!!  The view is so stunning I couldn't even focus ordering from the menu lol, but finally decided on:   appetizer - Seafood Platter main entree - surf n turf (filet mignon, medium rare, just how I like it)  main entree - ribeye  glass of pinot grigio hennessy on the rocks   There is also a photographer that goes around taking pictures which you have the option to buy towards the end of dinner ...which I would suggest since it makes a great souvenir!    Also,  be aware that you may see a few bungee jumpers during your dining experience as well and the restaurant revolves at a full 360 degrees every 80 minutes...which I barely even felt.  Only downfall that I would have to say is that I wish the Stratosphere was closer to the center of the strip.  Other than that, I had an amazing time =)

MJnJvM9E-GMgxq8BCFbwaw.text: Even after requesting a table by the window, we were accommodated on the outside rim. The whole reason of going to this place was to see the view. Food was good however. Bit disappointed by the customer service

sO-k3UueUGk7M2Di3KyPIQ.text: Amazing dinner experience in Vegas. It was very romantic and we arrived there around 6pm and it was still light out for us to see the beautiful view of the strip. Also, at night, it's beautiful. While you are eating, the floor rotates. So you are eating and rotating around the tower. While you're eating, you will see sky jumpers falling off the 108th floor! Such a unique experience and I definitely recommend this restaurant while you're staying in Vegas. The food was amazing. I recommend the strip steak and the asparagus/mushroom dish.

qi9dLfC8lb1wEfEf6m0RbQ.text: Really fun and surprisingly good food. The steaks we're cooked properly and were high quality cuts. The server Patrick was fun and helpful. We enjoyed the experience and would recommend it to anyone looking for entertainment views and a great food.

HraW_T-xKz9pyrxglD3qDw.text: Went out Friday night for a celebration! The Stratosphere did not disappoint. Our food was wonderful, our waiter was awesome and of course the view was everything we expected. We expected the dollars spent due to checking the menu before going. We had the Seafood Tower as an appetizer, it was terrific for a land lock state. Our meals were very good as well.

-FWBtTH1hZrsCDpjSi34rA.text: You seriously are just paying for the beautiful view. The food was severely overpriced, very small plates (everything a la carte), and I've had way better. I ordered the lamb (about $60 for two small chops), my boyfriend ordered the salmon and ended up with food poisoning because they serve it "medium." The view was amazing but it would be cheaper to just pay for the viewing. I should have listened to the locals who told me to save my money

Vw1JaWb69BaQuoG22W7OTw.text: The service and views of the city were great. The meal was a bit pricey but we expected that much. We also had pictures taken that ran us another $45. Overall it was a nice romantic evening that we can say we experienced for our 1st time in LV. But we'll probably not revisit.

N0QULeXzX3iPnLH9p5x-JQ.text: We began coming here a few years ago for our bday lunch celebration. Always good but, this time the lobster was a little tough. Maybe overcooked. The filet was super though. So tender. A few dollars added on as well. Overall not as good as previous years but still a beautiful experience. Service was wonderful.

f_QF-SO9kVEf3VVP94prvA.text: Set up an anniversary dinner during sunset. They seated us along the outer rim by the windows. The view was spectacular.  Dinner takes about an hour which allows you to have one full 365 degree rotation.   The staff was friendly and attended to your needs in a timely manor while giving you enough privacy to enjoy your company.  The food was good and the portion size was good for the price.

9d8Zj1ut5RHiX7KgFbcDJQ.text: We went for my dad's birthday, and I was a bit worried because it was raining and I knew we wouldn't see the sunset as I was hoping for. Even without the sunset, the views were gorgeous!  The food was delicious! The waitstaff was knowledgeable and friendly.   I definitely should have looked at the menu, though, because it was incredibly expensive! I'm glad that we went because we got some great food and wonderful pictures.

cpRWBLGMvZfODfQFJ8iplA.text: Was there to celebrate a birthday 2 nights ago, and wondering why I waited so long to give it a shot.  Positives:  1) Wait staff was friendly and gave great dining recommendations 2) Presentation and flavor of lobster bisque was awesome 3) Views are obviously spectacular  Negatives: 1) Not an inexpensive evening  As I knew what to expect from a cost perspective, I was thrilled to find that all other aspects of the dining experience to be on point, from the greeting when we arrived by the folks at the host/hostess station to the words from the same folks as we departed at the end of the evening.  I've been to many of the "awesome" restaurants in Vegas, and I'd put my experience here right at or near the top of the list.  A great night out - Thanks!

269FcHeE1iGaNd9smQjz5w.text: We came for the lunch menu, aka breakfast on Vegas time.   Streak and egg come with tasty sauce. The skirt steak is very tender. The lobster omelet had great seasoning. I like my food a little more modern American, the eggs themselves and hash had that old school oily texture.   The service was fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster omlet
Photo of Top of the World - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Streak and egg come with tasty sauce. The skirt steak is very tender.

qeOlR3PIOTNAMq60UjOWWA.text: I'll give it 5 stars for the view alone. You can't beat it. We had dinner here during sunset. I would recommend coming after it's dark because depending on which side of the table you're sitting you, you can get blinded by the sun. The view from the restaurant at night is beautiful. It spins slowly enough so that you can enjoy the sights and not get horrible vertigo.  The service is amazing. The food is great, but comparable to the other fine dining restaurants on the strip. You would come here to have a relaxing drawn out dinner, enjoy the company you're with, and get some good food at the same time.

v7HZWYwkMHLWYcIQ8ZJ6Qg.text: Best food I have ever had. Omg this was awesome. Our server was great and very informative and helped us out with everything. Never had to ask for a refill or new silverware. The view was just amazing. We were able to watch tge sunset and had a romantic evening. It was mine and my girlfriend's one year anniversary. We are so thankful to top of the world for the amazing time.

hp22ye0BHCeuo_A-7VT3QQ.text: This is probably one of the best times that I've had in a long time. Went to top of the world for birthday dinner. We both enjoyed the tasters menu which was absolutely superb can't wait to have another night like this soon!!!

0ofDqG1ygEQPSZiebzlmrg.text: You definitely pay for the view, but it is an amazing view.  The food was delicious, the portions were just right.  I had the filet mignon with mash potatoes and a mushroom sauce.  The mash potatoes were creamy and just a great pair with the steak, my steak was juicy and tender no complaints there.  My favorite was the pork belly appetizer and the scallop appetizer it was just had such great flavor.  Next time we come to Vegas we will come back.

atll0x808NuqWueKwIxypQ.text: Wanted to treat my husband for his 30th birthday. We had the kids with us (ages 4, 3, and 1) so I made reservations for a late lunch on a weekday, thinking that would be the most child-friendly time. Confirmed with the hostess on the phone that this was acceptable, but got blatantly-annoyed eyerolls from the waitress when we walked in.  We write about family travel for a living, so our boys are extremely well-behaved and used to being in settings like this. The one time the baby fussed, I took him to the restroom for a break. Seems our group had already been judged, though, as the waitress was inattentive throughout our meal and walked away when were mid-sentence no less then 4 times. On one occasion she asked if we had questions about a dish and then immediately walked away to help a table of 50-something-year-olds right behind us as I desperately trailed a question in her direction. That's something I'd expect from a restaurant that hires 17-year-olds on roller skates, not an $80-dollar-per-plate establishment that serves filet mignon rare.  The food was decent. The view was stunning. Getting access to the observatory was a nice bonus. I just wish we hadn't been treated like second-class citizens. After being ignored for at least two-thirds of our 80-minute rotation and helped primarily by the gentleman who filled our drinks (thanks Maurice!) we skipped dessert. In spite of our children's excitement and desire for the colorful sorbet on the table next to us and the mouth-watering creme brulee that rotated by on display, we decided to forego dessert to save us another 30 minutes of "taking up someone's time."

UozMIRQPuh3zsXf8W2hujg.text: It was most magnificent place for dinner specially during sunset. Food was delicious and service was awesome. Highly recommended.

r6SKS4sL7J4p1fMyQcwTeg.text: Last weekend my husband and I went to Vegas for the weekend with our three kids. We decided to take our kids to the Top of the world restaurant. THEY LOVED IT! Let me tell you yelp readers there is a waiter by the name of Joseph A. he is an EXCELLENT server OMG!!! As a business owner my husband and I have had many meeting at different restaurant locations and experience good customer service but nothing like this waiter. He needs to be in some kind of management to train other servers. Our kids where amazed by the way this waiter spoke, he had amazing manners from pardon my reach when he was serving our food to being very informational when it came to Las Vegas and their food. I give this server 5 STARS!!!!!! WOW excellent excellent excellent Joseph keep up the wonderful work.

2lK8_UrToPav41kKRozuWQ.text: My husband and I came here for our anniversary lunch! We had the lunch menu the prix fixe which was $50 per person. I felt like it was really worthwhile for the view alone. We enjoyed our three courses while the restaurant spun around and gave us beautiful views of las vegas. This is a wonderful special occasion restaurant. Included with eating here you can go up to the observation deck and hang out. It made the whole day very special. We would come back here for sure!!

uGdpd5eyVWB8x89ntTebOA.text: As expected, this a popular and busy spot given its unique view of Vegas and a rotating dining area. We enjoyed the food we ordered but the wait time to be seated was a bit longer than expected after making reservations. My steak was good but wife's seafood Alfredo was cold, which was a bit disappointing.

kqCCMMaPMZmCrJNuUvJsFw.text: I was uneasy about going here as the stratosphere is lame and I assumed it wouldn't have nice restaurants. I've been here for 4 years and I was so wrong. The service was FANTASTIC! The view is alright, we arrived just before the sunset so by the time we were eating our first course, we were looking at east vegas. Yikes. The food was outstanding and the wine pairing was divine! We were seated promptly even though we were ten minutes late on the Saturday evening before Valentine's Day. Our table was very small but it's an observation tower so *shrug*. We were greeted by Rebecca and she is the best server I've ever had in fine dining. Very informative and attentive she made our whole evening! She recommended the prefixe menu with the wine pairing. My boyfriend and I both had the lobster bisque, scallops, portobello mushroom, filet mignon with the gulf shrimp, and for dessert, a white chocolate bowl with fruit and cream. We finished our night with Pinot Grigio and a Fat Tire.   Lobster bisque- presentation was beautiful, lobster tasted kind of chalky, it was good not great.  Scallops- good, slightly on the chewy side. The Fish Hopper in Carmel has the best scallops so my standard is already pretty high. There was only one scallop, but it's a prefixe I get it. Portobello mushroom- I hate mushrooms but my boyfriend loves them and it wasn't that bad. The plate had three slices of mushroom served with roasted tomato, mozzarella and balsamic vinegar.  Filet mignon with gulf shrimp- medium rare, this dish took the longest but with the wine parings we had, time seemed slow anyway! This steak is huge. I'm so sad I couldn't finish it! It had a delicious mushroom sauce that went well with the buttery mashed potatoes and a. The gulf shrimp was not peeled so that was agitating because it's fine dining. Would you want to eat feces if you had a choice? Exactly. I took out the nasty stuff and continued eating. Super juicy and succulent every bite was heaven. White chocolate bowl with fruit and cream- just that. Nothing gourmet or decedent. It also came with a small bowl that had a dark chocolate ganache that tasted like powered Swiss Miss and two small white chocolate decorations on top. Nothing to write home about, it was way too much sugar for me. I prefer a balance.  The wine- Rebecca served us just as the meals came out and gave a detailed description of the glasses. I could have went with the Cabernet but it's steak so I couldn't fight. The first wine she gave us was a Pinot Grigio from France? It was so ideal, my taste buds fell exactly in line and it was the perfect set up for the rest of the food that followed. I had the best Valentine's dinner with my sweetheart thanks to Rebecca. We definitely felt on top of the world

jP1bZ-6nVRJAm7JtQcz7Jw.text: The crispy bread with garlic cheese was great! All foods were stylish and delicious !

avAfdFGQhtWedSPKCAiGTA.text: I had a strange experience coming here. Something I wouldn't expect from a high class restaurant.   I was a walk in on a weekday during February. When I checked in upstairs, another guest came out of the restaurant wanting a different seat, I was told I was set and to take a seat by the elevators. People came in and out of the restaurant (I figured guests with reservations) and I waited about 20 mins until the host looked at me and said, "Do you need help? Oh, no wait, you ate already". I answered,  "No, I checked in a while ago, you told me to sit here". The host apologized and searched my name in the system not knowing what happened. I made the excuse for them, "That guest that wanted different seats must have distracted the check in process, it happens". So, they made a big deal to get me a "good seat" (by the window - at the hotel I was staying at... With a view I've seen several times on this trip...that I mentioned when I checked in).  The view was gorgeous none-the-less but as soon as I sat down, a waiter dropped a plate of food, picking up only the big pieces.   I ordered a glass of wine, the Lobster Bisque and Steak and Lobster.  The Lobster Bisque was devine though some parts of the meat were cold while other parts were warm. And the steak and lobster was perfect as well.   While I was eating, my water was never filled and a different waitress broke a wine glass (again, only picking up the big pieces). While enjoying the food and view all the waiters (3 in our area) are speaking on the different restaurant levels in Spanish rather loudly.   When I was done, the waitress that broke the glass asked if I was done and when I said yes, she took my plate away which I thought was strange. I had quite a bit of food left and I felt like for a place like this, wasting food wouldn't be an option. (I would have loved to finish left overs!)  While waiting for check, my waiter was bringing food to another table where he dropped the food cover.   I thought this restaurant staff was VERY careless and I left uneasy about my experience.

yUOYT0qnFR515g87aBR6Ww.text: first walking through the old casino was a turn off. second, I ordered the pasta Alfredo seafood and it was really bad. the pasta was too much and it was dry. The nice thing was that they took it off the bill. the steak that we ordered was okay and the view is obv nice but I think it's safe to say that I will not be returning

_QPd-wC5XbqyEjKrdtqMSw.text: The view is amazing, and the wait staff is great. We got the wagyu skirt steak and it was way tooooo salty. The potatoes were good but the asparagus was over cooked. A little too pricey for Average food.

9I1pakBkP7jHXTW4vNOMwQ.text: The dish was excellent! Nice place to be and share  good moment with your loves #famillydiner. I will definitely go back on Top of the World
